analyzed: hattha pāse ṭhitassa pana bhikkhussa atthāya pīḷiyamānā ucchutaḥ paggharantam rasaṃ  gaṇhitum vaṭṭati doṇikāya sayam paggharantam ucchurasam majjhe āvaritvā āvaritvā
translated: But it is allowable for a bhikkhu to take the juice of the sugar-cane that is flowing and dripping for the purpose of a bhikkhu standing within hand-reach.🔽It is allowable to take the juice of the sugar-cane that is flowing and dripping in a trough, letting it run into the mouth after turning it this way and that.

original: vissajjitampi gaṇhituṃ vaṭṭati. Katthaci aṭṭhakathāsu.
analyzed: vissajjitam pi gaṇhitum vaṭṭati katthaci aṭṭhakathāsu
translated: In some commentaries,🔽“Not to be carried off” means not to be carried off by a strong man.

original: Asaṃhārimeti thāmamajjhimena purisena asaṃhāriye. “Tintiṇikādipaṇṇesū”ti vacanato🔽sākhāsu paṭiggahaṇaṃ ruhatīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Puñchitvā paṭiggahetvāti ettha “puñchite
analyzed: asaṃhārimā iti thāma majjhimena purisena asaṃhāriye tintiṇika ādi paṇṇesu iti vacanataḥ  sākhāsu paṭiggahaṇam ruhati iti daṭṭhabbam puñchitvā paṭiggahetvā iti ettha puñchite
translated: Since it is said “in leaves of tinduka, etc.,”🔽it should be taken that the taking is in the branches.

original: paṭiggahaṇakiccaṃ natthi, tasmā puñchitvā gahetvāti evamattho gahetabbo”ti vadanti.
analyzed: paṭiggahaṇa kiccam na atthi tasmā puñchitvā gahetvā ati evamatthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti vadanti
translated: As to “having picked it up and taken it,” they say that “there is no act of taking in what is picked up; therefore the meaning should be taken thus: ‘having picked it up and taken it.’

original: Puñchitvā paṭiggahetvā vāti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Patte patitarajanacuṇṇañhi
analyzed: puñchitvā paṭiggahetvā vāti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo patte patita rajana cuṇṇam hi
translated: ” The meaning should be taken thus: “having picked it up and taken it.” For what is ground rice in a leaf,

original: abbhantaraparibhogatthāya aparihaṭabhāvato paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjituṃ vaṭṭati. Pubbābhogassa🔽anurūpena “anupasampannassa datvā…pe… vaṭṭatī”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmā pana taṃ “aññassa
analyzed: abbhantara paribhoga tthāya a parihaṭa bhāvataḥ paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjitum vaṭṭati pubba ābhogassa  anurūpena anupasampannassa vaṭṭati iti vuttam yasmā pana tam aññassa
translated: It is allowable to receive and use it for one’s own consumption if it has not been set aside.🔽“It is allowable to give to one who is not fully admitted to the Order” is said in accordance with the original use.

original: dassāmī”ti cittuppādamattena parasantakaṃ nāma na hoti, tasmā tassa adatvāpi paṭiggahetvā🔽paribhuñjituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: dassāmi iti citta uppāda mattena para santakam nāma na hoti tasmā tassa a datvā api paṭiggahetvā  paribhuñjitum vaṭṭati
translated: But since it is not the property of another merely by the thought “I will give it to someone else,” therefore it is allowable to receive and use it without giving it to anyone else.

original: Bhikkhussa detīti aññassa bhikkhussa deti. Kañjikanti khīrarasādiṃ yaṃkiñci dravaṃ🔽sandhāya vuttaṃ. Hatthato mocetvā puna gaṇhāti, uggahitakaṃ hotīti āha “hatthato🔽amocentenevā”ti. Ālulentānanti ālolentānaṃ, ayameva vā pāṭho. Āharitvā bhūmiyaṃ ṭhapitattā
analyzed: bhikkhussa deti iti aññassa bhikkhussa deti kañjikam ti khīra rasa ādim yaṃ kiñci dravam  sandhāya vuttam hatthataḥ mocetvā puna gaṇhāti uggahitakam hoti iti āha hatthataḥ  ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ āharitvā ayam iyam
translated: “He gives to a bhikkhu” means he gives to another bhikkhu. “Acid fruit juice” is said with reference to any liquid such as whey.🔽“If he takes it after letting go of it in his hand, it is what has been received” is said because “he should not let go of it in his hand.”

original: abhihāro natthīti āha “patto paṭiggahetabbo”ti. Paṭhamataraṃ uḷuṅkato thevā patte
analyzed: abhihāro natthi iti āha patto paṭiggahetabbo ti paṭhamataram uḷuṅkataḥ thevā patte
translated: “If they are shaking it” is the reading. “He should receive it in the bowl” is said because it is not a case of pouring into the bowl since it is brought and placed on the ground.

original: patantīti ettha “yathā paṭhamataraṃ patitatheve doso natthi, tathā ākiritvā apanentānaṃ
analyzed: patanti iti ettha yathā paṭhamataram doso natthi tathā ākiritvā apanentānam
translated: “Falling”: they say that there is no offence if it is taken up and removed in the same way as it fell,

original: pacchā patitathevepi abhihaṭattā nevatthi doso”ti vadanti. Carukenāti khuddakabhājanena.
analyzed: pacchā abhihaṭa ttā na iva atthi doso ti vadanti carukena ati khuddaka bhājanena
translated: and that there is no offence if it is taken up afterwards because it has been disturbed. “In a small vessel”: in a small bowl.

original: Mukhavaṭṭiyāpi gahetuṃ vaṭṭatīti mukhavaṭṭiṃ ukkhipitvā hatthe phusāpite gaṇhituṃ
analyzed: mukhavaṭṭiyā api gahetum vaṭṭati iti mukhavaṭṭim ukkhipitvā hatthe phusāpite gaṇhitum
translated: “It is allowable to take it up even with the rim of the mouth”: it is allowable to take it up by touching it with the hand after raising the rim of the mouth.

original: vaṭṭati. Kecīti abhayagirivāsino. Esa nayoti kāyapaṭibaddhapaṭibaddhampi kāyapaṭibaddhamevāti
analyzed: vaṭṭati keci iti abhayagiri vāsinaḥ esa nayoti kāya paṭibaddha paṭibaddham pi kāya paṭibaddham eva ati
translated: “Some”: the residents of Abhayagiri. “This is the principle”: the principle is that what is bound to the body and what is bound to that are the same as what is bound to the body.

original: ayaṃ nayo. Tathā ca tattha kāyapaṭibaddhe taṃpaṭibaddhe ca thullaccayameva vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ayam nayo tathā ca tattha kāya paṭibaddhe taṃ paṭibaddhe ca thullaccayam eva vuttam
translated: And in that case, only a thullaccaya is stated for what is bound to the body and what is bound to that.

original: Tenāti yassa bhikkhuno santikaṃ gataṃ, tena. Tasmāti yasmā mūlaṭṭhasseva paribhogo
analyzed: tena ati yassa bhikkhuno santikam gatam tena tasmā iti yasmā mūlaṭṭhassa iva paribhogaḥ
translated: “By him”: by the bhikkhu to whose presence it has gone. “Because”: because the use of what is stored is allowed only for one who has a store.

original: anuññāto, tasmā. Taṃ divasaṃ hatthena gahetvā dutiyadivase paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa
analyzed: anuññātaḥ tasmā tam divasam hatthena gahetvā dutiya divase paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa
translated: Therefore “without having announced it” means that it becomes received and accepted by him if he takes it with his hand on that day and receives it on the following day and uses it.

original: uggahitakapaṭiggahitaṃ hotīti āha “anāmasitvā”ti. Appaṭiggahitattā “sannidhipaccayā
analyzed: uggahitaka paṭiggahitam hoti iti āha an āmasitvā iti a paṭiggahita ttā sannidhi paccayā
translated: Because it has not been received, it is said that “it is not allowable to use it without having received it.”

original: anāpattī”ti vuttaṃ. Appaṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa adinnamukhadvārāpatti hotīti
analyzed: anāpatti iti vuttam a paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa adinna mukha dvāra āpatti hoti iti
translated: If he uses it without having accepted it, there is an offence of wrong-doing through the mouth.🔽“But having accepted it, he may use it,” he said.

original: āha “paṭiggahetvā pana paribhuñjitabba”nti. “Taṃ divasaṃ…pe… na tato para”nti vacanato
analyzed: āha paṭiggahetvā pana paribhuñjitabbanti tam divasaṃpe na tatas paranti vacanato
translated: Because of the words, “On that day … and not after that,”

original: taṃ divasaṃ hatthena gahetvā vā aggahetvā vā ṭhapitaṃ dutiyadivase appaṭiggahetvā
analyzed: tam divasam hatthena gahetvā vā aggahetvā vā ṭhapitam dutiya divase a paṭiggahetvā
translated: if he uses it on the second day without having accepted it, whether he has held it in his hand or not,

original: paribhuñjantassa adinnamukhadvārāpatti hoti, hatthena gahetvā ṭhapitaṃ dutiyadivase🔽paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa pana uggahitakapaṭiggahitaṃ hoti. Appaṭiggahitameva
analyzed: paribhuñjantassa adinna mukha dvāra āpatti hoti hatthena gahetvā ṭhapitam dutiya divase  paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa pana uggahitaka paṭiggahitam hoti a paṭiggahitam eva
translated: there is an offence of wrong-doing through the mouth. But if he uses it on the second day after having accepted it,🔽it is accepted by being held in the hand.🔽For it is only what is not accepted that is held in the hand.

original: hi hatthena gahetvā ṭhapitaṃ. “Sāmaṃ gahetvā paribhuñjitu”nti hi vacanato appaṭiggahitasseva
analyzed: hi hatthena gahetvā ṭhapitam sāmam gahetvā paribhuñjitun ti hi vacanataḥ a paṭiggahitassa iva
translated: Because of the words, “He may use it after having taken it himself,” the use on that day of what is not accepted

original: tasmiṃ divase paribhogo anuññāto. Tasmā yaṃ vuttaṃ gaṇṭhipade “taṃ diyyamānaṃ patatīti
analyzed: tasmin divase paribhogaḥ anuññātaḥ tasmai yam vuttam gaṇṭhi pade tam diyyamānam patati iti
translated: is allowed. Therefore it was said in the Thread-passage, “If it falls while being given to him,”

original: ettha yathā gaṇabhojanādīsu gilānādīnaṃ kukkuccāyantānaṃ gaṇabhojanaṃ anuññātaṃ,
analyzed: ettha yathā gaṇa bhojana ādīsu gilāna ādīnam kukkuccāyantānam gaṇa bhojanam anuññātam
translated: just as in the case of the group meal, etc., the group meal is allowed for those who are scrupulous about the sick person, etc.,

original: evamidhāpi bhagavatā paṭiggahitameva kukkuccavinodanatthaṃ anuññāta”nti, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: evam idha api bhagavatā paṭiggahitam eva kukkucca vinodana attham anuññātam ti tat na gahetabbam
translated: So too here the Blessed One has allowed it to be received only for the purpose of dispelling scruples.

original: “Taṃ diyyamānaṃ patatī”ti avisesena vuttattā catūsupi kālikesu ayaṃ nayo veditabbo.
analyzed: tat diyyamānam patati iti avisesena vutta ttā catūsu pi kālikesu ayam nayaḥ veditabbo
translated: “If it falls while being given” should be understood in the case of all four kinds of requisites because of the word “it” without distinction.

original: Satthakenāti paṭiggahitasatthakena. Kasmā panettha uggahitapaccayā sannidhipaccayā🔽vā doso na siyāti āha “na hi taṃ paribhogatthāya pariharantī”ti. Imināva bāhiraparibhogatthaṃ
analyzed: satthakena ati paṭiggahita satthakena kasmā pana ittha uggahita paccayā sannidhi paccayā  vā dosaḥ na siyāti āha na hi tam paribhoga tthāya pariharanti iti bāhira paribhoga ttham
translated: “With a knife” means with a knife that has been received. But why should there be no offence here through the condition of receiving or the condition of keeping?🔽“For they do not keep it for the purpose of using it” . This shows that it is allowable to receive it oneself for the purpose of using it externally,

original: sāmaṃ gahetvā anupasampannena dinnaṃ vā gahetvā pariharituṃ vaṭṭatīti dīpeti. Tasmā
analyzed: sāmam gahetvā an upasampannena dinnam vā gahetvā pariharitum vaṭṭati iti dīpeti tasmai
translated: or to keep it after receiving it from one who is not fully admitted to the Order.

original: pattasammakkhanādiatthaṃ sāmaṃ gahetvā parihaṭatelādiṃ sace paribhuñjitukāmo hoti,🔽paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa anāpatti. Abbhantaraparibhogatthaṃ pana sāmaṃ gahitaṃ
analyzed: patta sammakkhana ādi attham sāmam gahetvā parihaṭa tela ādim sace paribhuñjitu kāmaḥ hoti  paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa anāpatti abbhantara paribhoga attham pana sāmam gahitam
translated: Therefore, if he wants to use oil, etc., that he has received himself for the purpose of anointing the bowl, etc.,🔽and he uses it after receiving it again, there is no offence. But if he uses it after receiving it for the purpose of using it internally,

original: paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa uggahitakapaṭiggahitaṃ hoti, appaṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa
analyzed: paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa uggahitaka paṭiggahitam hoti a paṭiggahetvā paribhuñjantassa
translated: it is received and received again. If he uses it without receiving it,

original: adinnamukhadvārāpatti hoti, abbhantaraparibhogatthameva anupasampannena dinnaṃ gahetvā🔽pariharantassa siṅgīloṇakappo viya sannidhipaccayā āpatti hoti. Keci pana “thāmamajjhimassa
analyzed: a dinna mukha dvāra āpatti hoti abbhantara paribhoga ttham eva an upasampannena dinnam gahetvā  pariharantassa siṅgīloṇa kappo viya sannidhi paccayā āpatti hoti keci pana thāma majjhimassa
translated: There is an offence for receiving what is not given if he receives and keeps what has been given by one who is not fully admitted to the Order, even for the purpose of using it himself.

original: purisassa uccāraṇamattaṃ hotītiādinā vuttapañcaṅgasampattiyā paṭiggahaṇassa ruhanato
analyzed: purisassa uccāraṇa mattam hoti itiādinā vutta pañcaṅga sampattiyā paṭiggahaṇassa
translated: There is an offence for storing it, as in the case of the salt-merchant. But some say that since the receiving is valid because of the fulfilment of the five factors stated thus, “It is as much as a medium-sized man can carry,” etc.,

original: bāhiraparibhogatthampi sace anupasampannena dinnaṃ gaṇhāti, paṭiggahitamevā”ti vadanti.🔽Evaṃ sati idha bāhiraparibhogatthaṃ anupasampannena dinnaṃ gahetvā pariharantassa🔽sannidhipaccayā āpatti vattabbā siyā, “na hi taṃ paribhogatthāya pariharantī”ti ca
analyzed: bāhira paribhoga attham pi sace an upasampannena dinnam gaṇhāti paṭiggahitam eva ati vadanti  evam sati bāhira paribhoga attham anupasampannena dinnam gahetvā pariharantassa  sannidhi paccayā āpatti vattabbā siyā na hi tam paribhoga tthāya pariharanti iti ca
translated: if he receives what has been given by one who is not fully admitted to the Order even for the purpose of using it externally, it is still received.🔽If that is so, then it should be said that there is an offence for storing it if he receives and keeps what has been given by one who is not fully admitted to the Order for the purpose of using it externally.🔽And it should not be said, “Because he does not keep it for the purpose of using it.”

original: na vattabbaṃ, tasmā bāhiraparibhogatthaṃ gahitaṃ paṭiggahitaṃ nāma na hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: na vattabbam tasmā bāhira paribhoga attham gahitam paṭiggahitam nāma na hoti iti veditabbam
translated: Therefore it should be understood that what has been received for the purpose of using it externally is not called “received.”

original: Yadi evaṃ pañcasu paṭiggahaṇaṅgesu “paribhogatthāyā”ti visesanaṃ vattabbanti? Na
analyzed: yadi evam pañcasu paṭiggahaṇa aṅgesu paribhoga atthāya ati visesanam vattabbanti na
translated: If that is so, then the qualification “for the purpose of using it” should be stated in the five factors of receiving.

original: vattabbaṃ. Paṭiggahaṇañhi paribhogatthameva hotīti “paribhogatthāyā”ti visuṃ avatvā
analyzed: vattabbam paṭiggahaṇam hi paribhoga attham eva hoti iti paribhoga atthāya ati visum a vatvā
translated: For the acceptance is only for the purpose of using it. Therefore, without specifying it,

original: “tañce bhikkhu kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhātī”ti ettakameva vuttaṃ. Apare🔽pana “satipi paṭiggahaṇe ‘na hi taṃ paribhogatthāya pariharantī’ti idha aparibhogatthāya
analyzed: tat ce bhikkhu kāyena vā kāya paṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhāti iti ettakam eva vuttam apare  pana sati pi paṭiggahaṇe na hi tam paribhoga tthāya pariharanti iti idha a paribhoga tthāya
translated: it is said: “If a bhikkhu accepts it with the body or with what belongs to the body.”🔽But others say that although there is acceptance, “it is not for the purpose of using it, for they are not keeping it for use.”

original: pariharaṇe anāpatti vuttā”ti vadanti. Udukkhalamusalāni khiyyantīti ettha udukkhalamusalānaṃ
analyzed: pariharaṇe anāpatti vuttā ati vadanti udukkhala musalāni khiyyanti iti ettha udukkhala musalānam
translated: Here, it is said that there is no offense in keeping it for the purpose of using it.🔽As for the mortar and pestle are worn out: if the color of the ground herbs is seen in the mortar and pestle

original: khayena pisitakoṭṭitabhesajjesu sace āgantukavaṇṇo paññāyati, na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: khayena pisita koṭṭita bhesajjesu sace āgantuka vaṇṇo paññāyati na vaṭṭati
translated: because of the wearing out, it is not allowable.

original: Suddhaṃ udakaṃ hotīti rukkhasākhādīhi gaḷitvā patanaudakaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Patto
analyzed: suddham udakam hoti iti rukkha sākhā ādīhi gaḷitvā patana odakam sandhāya vuttam patto
translated: It is pure water: this refers to water that has fallen from a tree branch and so on.

original: vāssa paṭiggahetabboti etthāpi pattagataṃ chupitvā dentassa hatthalaggena āmisena
analyzed: paṭiggahetabbo ti ettha api patta gatam chupitvā dentassa hattha laggena āmisena
translated: The bowl should be accepted: here too, if it is given after sucking up with the hand, there is no offense because of the food on the hand.

original: dosābhāvatthaṃ pattapaṭiggahaṇanti abbhantaraparibhogatthameva paṭiggahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: dosa abhāva ttham patta paṭiggahaṇam ti abbhantara paribhoga ttham eva paṭiggahaṇam veditabbam
translated: The acceptance should be understood as the acceptance only for the purpose of using it internally.

original: Yaṃ sāmaṇerassa patte patati…pe… paṭiggahaṇaṃ na vijahatīti ettha punappunaṃ gaṇhantassa🔽attano patte pakkhittameva “attano santaka”nti sanniṭṭhānakaraṇato hatthagataṃ paṭiggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: yam sāmaṇerassa patte patatipe paṭiggahaṇam na vijahati iti ettha punappunam gaṇhantassa  attano patte pakkhittam eva attano santakam ti sanniṭṭhāna karaṇataḥ hattha gatam paṭiggahaṇam
translated: The acceptance does not leave his hand if he takes it again and again,🔽because he decides that it is his by putting it into his own bowl.🔽But if he takes what is given after it has been pointed out, then the acceptance leaves his hand as soon as he has taken it,

original: na vijahati, paricchinditvā dinnaṃ pana gaṇhantassa gahaṇasamayeyeva “attano santaka”nti
analyzed: na vijahati paricchinditvā dinnam pana gaṇhantassa gahaṇa samayeya iva attano santakam ti
translated: because he has decided that it is his.

original: sanniṭṭhānassa katattā hatthagataṃ paṭiggahaṇaṃ vijahati. Kesañci atthāya odanaṃ
analyzed: sanniṭṭhānassa kata ttā hattha gatam paṭiggahaṇam vijahati kesañci atthāya odanaṃ
translated: If he puts rice into someone’s bowl for the sake of another,

original: pakkhipatīti ettha anupasampannassa atthāya pakkhipantepi “āgantvā gaṇhissatī”ti🔽sayameva pakkhipitvā ṭhapanato paṭiggahaṇaṃ na vijahati, anupasampannassa hatthe
analyzed: pakkhipati iti ettha anupasampannassa atthāya pakkhipante api āgantvā gaṇhissati iti  sayam eva pakkhipitvā ṭhapanataḥ paṭiggahaṇam na vijahati an upasampannassa hatthe
translated: if he puts it in himself, thinking, “He will come and take it,”🔽then the acceptance does not leave his hand, because he has put it there himself.

original: pakkhittaṃ pana anupasampanneneva ṭhapitaṃ nāma hotīti paṭiggahaṇaṃ vijahati pariccattabhāvato.
analyzed: pakkhittam pana an upasampannena iva ṭhapitam nāma hoti iti paṭiggahaṇam vijahati pariccatta bhāvato
translated: But if it is put into the hand of one who is not fully admitted to the Order, it is as if it were put there by one who is not fully admitted to the Order,🔽and so the acceptance leaves his hand because it has been relinquished.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “sāmaṇera…pe… pariccattattā”ti.
analyzed: tena vuttam sāmaṇerape
translated: Hence it was said above: “If he puts rice into the novice’s bowl … because it has been relinquished.”

original: Paṭiggahaṇūpagaṃ bhāraṃ nāma thāmamajjhimassa purisassa ukkhepārahaṃ. Kiñcāpi avissajjetvāva🔽aññena hatthena pidahantassa doso natthi, tathāpi na pidahitabbanti aṭṭhakathāpamāṇeneva
analyzed: paṭiggahaṇa upagam bhāram nāma thāma majjhimassa purisassa ukkhepa araham kiñca api a vissajjetvā ava  aññena hatthena pidahantassa doso natthi tathā api na pidahitabbanti aṭṭhakathā pamāṇena iva
translated: A load that is to be received is one that a man of average strength can lift. Even though there is no offence if he supports it with one hand without letting it go,

original: gahetabbaṃ. Macchikavāraṇatthanti ettha “sacepi sākhāya laggarajaṃ patte patati,
analyzed: gahetabbam ettha sace pi sa ākhāya lagga rajam patte patati
translated: nevertheless it should be taken as stated in the Commentary that it should not be supported. ‘For the purpose of the Macchiras’ meal’: here it is said that ‘if a fruit falls from a tree on to a branch,

original: uttānameva. Pariyuṭṭhitarāgajāyampatikānaṃ sannihitatā, sayanigharatā, dutiyassa
analyzed: uttānam eva pariyuṭṭhita rāga jāyampatikānam sannihita tā dutiyassa
translated: clear.

original: bhikkhuno abhāvo, anupakhajja nisīdananti imāni panettha cattāri aṅgāni.
analyzed: bhikkhuno abhāvaḥ anupakhajja nisīdanan ti imāni pana ittha cattāri aṅgāni
translated: The absence of a monk, sitting down without first making an announcement: these are the four factors here.

original: Sabhojanasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sa bhojana sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on meals in groups is finished.

original: 284-289. Catutthapañcamesu natthi kiñci vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: catuttha pañcamesu na atthi kiñci vattabbam
translated: In the fourth and fifth, there is nothing to be said.

original: 6. Cārittasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: cāritta sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on behavior

original: 298. Chaṭṭhe pakativacanenāti ettha yaṃ dvādasahatthabbhantare ṭhitena sotuṃ sakkā🔽bhaveyya, taṃ pakativacanaṃ nāma. Āpucchitabboti “ahaṃ itthannāmassa gharaṃ gacchāmī”ti
analyzed: chaṭṭhe pakativacanena ati ettha yam dvādasa hattha abbhantare ṭhitena sotum sakkā  bhaveyya tam pakativacanam nāma āpucchitabbaḥ uti aham itthannāmassa gharam gacchāmi iti
translated: “In the hearing”: if it can be heard by someone standing within twelve and a half arm spans,🔽that is called “in the hearing”. “He should inform”: he should inform by saying,

original: vā “cārittaṃ āpajjāmī”ti vā īdisena vacanena āpucchitabbo. Sesamettha uttānameva.🔽Pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññatarena nimantanasādiyanaṃ, santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchanā,🔽bhattiyagharato aññagharappavesanaṃ, majjhanhikānatikkamo, samayassa vā āpadānaṃ
analyzed: vā cārittam āpajjāmi iti vā īdisena vacanena āpucchitabbaḥ sesam ettha uttānam eva  pañcannam bhojanānam aññatarena nimantana sādiyanam santam bhikkhum an āpucchanā  bhattiya gharataḥ añña ghara ppavesanam majjhanhika anatikkamaḥ samayassa vā āpadānam
translated: “I’m going to so-and-so’s house” or “I’m undertaking the practice of going on continuous alms round”. The rest is obvious.🔽The five factors here are: accepting an invitation to one of the five kinds of cooked food; not informing an available monk;

original: vā abhāvoti imāni panettha pañca aṅgāni.
analyzed: vā abhāvaḥ ti imāni pana ittha pañca aṅgāni
translated: entering a house other than the one where one has been invited, after one has entered a house for alms; going beyond the time; and there being no emergency.

original: Cārittasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: cāritta sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on behavior is finished.

original: 7. Mahānāmasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on Mahānāma

original: 303. Sattame mahānāmo nāmāti anuruddhattherassa bhātā bhagavato cūḷapitu putto. Suddhodano
analyzed: sattame mahānāmaḥ nāma ati anuruddha ttherassa bhātā bhagavataḥ cūḷa pitu putto suddhodano
translated: In the seventh, the elder named Mahānāma: the elder named Mahānāma was the brother of the elder Anuruddha, the son of the Blessed One’s paternal uncle, Suddhodana.

original: sakkodano sukkodano dhotodano amitodanoti ime hi pañca janā bhātaro. Amitā nāma devī
analyzed: sakkodanaḥ sukkodanaḥ dhotodanaḥ amitodanaḥ iti ime hi pañca janāḥ bhātaraḥ amitā nāma devī
translated: For there were five brothers, namely, Suddhodana, Sakkodana, Sukkodana, Dhotodana, and Amitodana.

original: tesaṃ bhaginī, tissatthero tassā putto. Tathāgato ca nandatthero ca suddhodanassa
analyzed: tesam bhaginī tissa thero tassā putto tathāgato ca nanda thero ca suddhodanassa
translated: The queen named Amitā was their sister. The elder Tissa was her son. The Tathāgata and the elder Nanda were the sons of Suddhodana.

original: puttā, mahānāmo ca anuruddhatthero ca sukkodanassa, ānandatthero amitodanassa. So🔽bhagavato kaniṭṭho, mahānāmo mahallakataro sakadāgāmī ariyasāvako. Tena vuttaṃ “mahānāmo
analyzed: puttā mahānāmo ca anuruddhatthero ca sukkodanassa ānandatthero amitodanassa so  bhagavato kaniṭṭhaḥ mahānāmaḥ mahallakataro sakadāgāmī ariyasāvako tena vuttam mahānāmo
translated: The elder Mahānāma and the elder Anuruddha were the sons of Sukkodana. The elder Ānanda was the son of Amitodana.

original: nāma…pe… ariyasāvako”ti.
analyzed: nāmape ariya sāvakā iti
translated: He was the Blessed One’s younger brother. The elder Mahānāma was a clansman who had attained the fruit of the first path. Therefore it is said: “The elder named Mahānāma … a clansman who had attained the fruit of the first path” .

original: 305-306. Pāḷiyaṃ ajjaṇhoti ajja ekadivasanti attho, “ajjano”ti vā attho gahetabbo,
analyzed: pāḷiyam ajjaṇho ti ajje ajjanaḥ iti vā atthaḥ gahetabbo
translated: In the text, ajjaṇho means “today” or “on this one day.” The meaning “today” should be taken.

original: no amhākaṃ. Kālaṃ āharissathāti sve harissatha. Tato ce uttari sādiyeyyāti sace tattha
analyzed: no amhākam kālam āharissatha ati sve harissatha tatas ce uttari sādiyeyya ati sace tattha
translated: No amhākaṃ means “not ours.” Kālaṃ āharissathāti means “you will take it tomorrow.” Tato ce uttari sādiyeyyā ti means “if he should consent to more than that.”

original: rattīhi vā bhesajjehi vā paricchedo kato hoti “ettakāyeva vā rattiyo ettakāni vā
analyzed: rattīhi vā bhesajjehi vā paricchedaḥ kataḥ hoti ettakāya iva vā rattiyaḥ ettakāni vā
translated: If a limit has been set on the number of nights or on the medicines, “only so many nights or only so many medicines,”

original: bhesajjāni viññāpetabbānī”ti, tato rattipariyantato vā bhesajjapariyantato vā uttari🔽viññāpento sādiyeyya. “Imehi tayā bhesajjehi pavāritamha, amhākañca imināva bhesajjena
analyzed: bhesajjāni viññāpetabbāni iti tatas ratti pariyantataḥ vā bhesajja pariyantataḥ vā uttari  viññāpentaḥ sādiyeyya imehi tayā bhesajjehi amhākañca iminā ava bhesajjena
translated: “Medicines should be asked for,” then, after the end of the night or the end of the medicines,

original: attho”ti ācikkhitvā viññāpetumpi gilānova labhati.
analyzed: attho ti ācikkhitvā viññāpetum pi gilānaḥ uva labhati
translated: if he asks for more, he commits an offense. If the sick person says, “We have been invited with these medicines, but we need these other medicines,” and then asks for them, he is also permitted to do so.

original: 310. Yasmā saṅghapavāraṇāyamevāyaṃ vidhi, tasmā “ye attano puggalikāya pavāraṇāya🔽pavāritā”ti vuttaṃ. Sesaṃ uttānameva. Saṅghapavāraṇatā, bhesajjaviññatti, agilānatā,
analyzed: yasmai tasmai ye puggalikāya pavāraṇāya  pavāritā iti vuttam sesam uttānam eva saṅgha pavāraṇa tā bhesajja viññatti a gilāna tā
translated: Since this is the procedure only for the invitation of the Sangha, it is said, “those who have been invited with their own individual invitations,”🔽and the rest is self-explanatory. The four members are: the invitation of the Sangha, asking for medicines, not being sick,

original: pariyantātikkamoti imāni panettha cattāri aṅgāni.🔽Mahānāmasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pariyanta atikkamaḥ ti imāni pana ittha cattāri aṅgāni  mahānāma sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: and exceeding the limit.🔽The explanation of the training rule on the invitation ceremony is finished.

original: 8. Uyyuttasenāsikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uyyuttasenā sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on the army

original: 311. Aṭṭhamaṃ uttānatthameva. Uyyuttasenā, dassanatthāya gamanaṃ, anuññātokāsato aññatra dassanaṃ, tathārūpapaccayassa āpadāya vā abhāvoti imāni panettha cattāri aṅgāni.
analyzed: aṭṭhamam uttāna ttham eva uyyutta senā dassana tthāya gamanam anuññāta ukāsataḥ aññatra dassanam tathārūpa paccayassa āpadāya vā abhāvaḥ ti imāni pana ittha cattāri aṅgāni
translated: The eighth is self-explanatory. The four members are: an army, going to see it, except if there is an invitation or an opportunity to see it, and the absence of an appropriate reason or an emergency.

original: Uyyuttasenāsikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uyyuttasenā sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on the army is finished.

original: 9. Senāvāsasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: senāvāsa sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on staying with the army

original: 317. Navamasikkhāpadampi uttānameva. Tirattātikkamo, senāya sūriyassa atthaṅgamo, gilānatādīnaṃ abhāvoti imāni panettha tīṇi aṅgāni.
analyzed: navama sikkhāpadam pi uttānam eva tirattā atikkamaḥ senāya sūriyassa atthaṅgamaḥ gilāna tā ādīnam abhāvaḥ ti imāni pana ittha tīṇi aṅgāni
translated: The ninth training rule is straightforward. There are three parts here: crossing a river, the sun setting while one is with the army, and there being no reason such as illness.

original: Senāvāsasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽10. Uyyodhikasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā🔽322. Dasame kati te lakkhāni laddhānīti tava sarappahārassa lakkhaṇabhūtā kittakā
analyzed: senāvāsa sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  uyyodhika sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā  dasame kati te lakkhāni laddhāni iti tava sara ppahārassa lakkhaṇa bhūtā kittakā
translated: The training rule on staying with the army is finished.🔽The training rule on fighting

original: janā tayā laddhāti attho, kittakā tayā viddhāti vuttaṃ hoti. Sesamettha uttānameva.🔽Uyyodhikādidassanatthāya gamanaṃ, anuññātokāsato aññatra dassanaṃ, tathārūpapaccayassa
analyzed: janā tayā laddhā ati attho kittakā tayā viddhā iti vuttam hoti sesam ettha uttānam eva  uyyodhika ādi dassana tthāya gamanam anuññāta ukāsataḥ aññatra dassanam tathārūpa paccayassa
translated: In the tenth training rule, “How many did you get?” means “How many people did you hit?” “How many did you wound?” is what is meant. The rest is straightforward.

original: āpadāya vā abhāvoti imāni panettha tīṇi aṅgāni.
analyzed: āpadāya vā imāni pana itthā tīṇi aṅgāni
translated: There are three parts here: going to see fighting, etc.; seeing it except on an approved occasion; and there being no reason such as an emergency.

original: Uyyodhikasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uyyodhika sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on fighting is finished.

original: Niṭṭhito acelakavaggo pañcamo.🔽6. Surāpānavaggo
analyzed: niṭṭhitaḥ acelaka vaggaḥ pañcamaḥ  surā pāna vaggo
translated: The fifth sub-chapter on naked ascetics is finished.🔽The sub-chapter on drinking alcohol

original: 1. Surāpānasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: surā pāna sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on drinking alcohol

original: 326-328. Surāpānavaggassa paṭhamasikkhāpade vatiyāti gāmaparikkhepavatiyā. Pāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: surā pāna vaggassa paṭhama sikkhāpade vatiyā ati gāma parikkhepavatiyā pāḷiyam
translated: In the first training rule of the section on drinking alcohol, “within the village area” means within the area of a village.

original: piṭṭhasurādīsu piṭṭhaṃ bhājane pakkhipitvā tajjaṃ udakaṃ datvā madditvā katā piṭṭhasurā.🔽Evaṃ pūve odane ca bhājane pakkhipitvā tajjaṃ udakaṃ datvā madditvā katā pūvasurā
analyzed: piṭṭha surā ādīsu piṭṭham bhājane pakkhipitvā tajjam udakam datvā madditvā katā piṭṭha surā  evam pūve odane ca bhājane pakkhipitvā tajjam udakam datvā madditvā katā pūva surā
translated: In the text, “flour alcohol” is alcohol made by putting flour in a container, adding water, kneading it, and then fermenting it.🔽“Cake alcohol” is made in the same way, using cakes instead of flour. It is also called “rice alcohol.” “Fermented” is its seed.

original: odanasurāti ca vuccati. “Kiṇṇā”ti pana tassā surāya bījaṃ vuccati. Ye surāmodakātipi
analyzed: odanasurā ti ca vuccati kiṇṇā ati pana tassā surāya bījam vuccati ye
translated: “Fermented rice” is what is called “rice water.”

original: vuccanti, te pakkhipitvā katā kiṇṇapakkhittā. Harītakīsāsapādinānāsambhārehi saṃyojitā sambhārasaṃyuttā.🔽Madhukatālanāḷikerādipuppharaso ciraparivāsito pupphāsavo. Panasādiphalaraso phalāsavo.
analyzed: vuccanti te pakkhipitvā katā kiṇṇa pakkhittā harītakī sāsapa ādi nānā sambhārehi saṃyojitā sambhāra saṃyuttā  madhuka tāla nāḷikera ādi puppha rasaḥ cira parivāsito puppha āsavaḥ panasa ādi phala rasaḥ phala āsavaḥ
translated: “Mixed with a drug” is mixed with harītakī, asafoetida, etc.🔽“Flower-essence” is the juice of madhuka, tāla, coconut, etc., that has been kept a long time. “Fruit-essence” is the juice of jack-fruit, etc.

original: Muddikāraso madhvāsavo. Ucchuraso guḷāsavo. Harītakāmalakakaṭukabhaṇḍādinānāsambhārānaṃ
analyzed: muddikā rasaḥ madhvāsavaḥ ucchu rasaḥ guḷāsavaḥ
translated: “Honey-essence” is the juice of honey-vine. “Sugar-essence” is the juice of sugar-cane. “Mixed with a drug” is mixed with harītakī, emblic myrobalan, and various other ingredients.

original: raso ciraparivāsito sambhārasaṃyutto. Bījato paṭṭhāyāti sambhāre paṭiyādetvā cāṭiyaṃ
analyzed: rasaḥ cira parivāsitaḥ sambhāra saṃyuttaḥ bījataḥ paṭṭhāya ati sambhāre paṭiyādetvā cāṭiyam
translated: The juice is what has been kept for a long time and mixed with the ingredients.

original: pakkhittakālato, tālanāḷikerādīnaṃ puppharasassa gahitaabhinavakālatoyeva ca paṭṭhāya.
analyzed: pakkhitta kālataḥ tāla nāḷikera ādīnam puppha rasassa gahita abhinava kālatas yā iva ca paṭṭhāya
translated: From the seed: from the time of preparing the ingredients and putting them in the fermenting vessel, and from the time of taking the fresh flower-juice of the palmyra, coconut, and so on.

original: 329. Loṇasovīrakaṃ suttañca anekehi bhesajjehi abhisaṅkhato amajjabhūto āsavaviseso.🔽Vāsaggāhāpanatthanti sugandhibhāvaggāhāpanatthaṃ. Acittakaṃ lokavajjanti ettha yaṃ
analyzed: loṇa sovīrakam suttam ca anekehi bhesajjehi abhisaṅkhataḥ amajja bhūtaḥ āsava viseso  vāsa ggāhāpana attham ti sugandhi bhāva ggāhāpana attham acittakam ettha yam
translated: The salt and the vinegar are a particular kind of fermentation, not yet become spirit, mixed with many medicinal ingredients.🔽For the purpose of taking on the smell: for the purpose of taking on the smell of fragrance.

original: vattabbaṃ, taṃ paṭhamapārājikavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayena veditabbaṃ. Sesamettha uttānameva.
analyzed: vattabbam tat paṭhama pārājika vaṇṇanāyam vutta nayena veditabbam sesam ettha uttānam eva
translated: Without mind, blameworthy in the world: what should be said about this has been said in the commentary on the first offense entailing expulsion. The rest here is clear.

original: Majjabhāvo, tassa pānañcāti imāni panettha dve aṅgāni.
analyzed: majja bhāvaḥ tassa pānam ca ati imāni pana ittha dve aṅgāni
translated: Here the two factors are the state of being spirit and drinking it.

original: Surāpānasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: surā pāna sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on drinking alcohol is finished.

original: 2. Aṅgulipatodakasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṅguli patodaka sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on tickling

analyzed: dutiye bhikkhunī pi an upasampanna ṭhāne ṭhitā ti ettha bhikkhu pi bhikkhuniyā an upasampanna ṭhāne

analyzed: ṭhitaḥ ti veditabbo sesam ettha uttānam eva hasa adhippāya tā upasampannassa kāyena kāya āmasanam ti

original: imāni panettha dve aṅgāni.
analyzed: imāni pana itthā dve aṅgāni
translated: These are the two factors here.

original: Aṅgulipatodakasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṅguli patodaka sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on tickling is finished.

original: 3. Hasadhammasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on laughing

analyzed: tatiyam uttāna attham eva upari gopphaka tā hasa adhippāyena kīḷananti imāni pana ittha dve aṅgāni
translated: The third is clear. The two factors here are: being in a secluded place, and playing aiming at laughter.

original: Hasadhammasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ha sa dhamma sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on laughing is finished.

original: 4. Anādariyasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: anādariya sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on disrespect

original: 344. Catutthe gārayho ācariyuggaho na gahetabboti yasmā ucchuraso sattāhakāliko,
analyzed: catutthe gārayhaḥ ācariyuggahaḥ na gahetabbo ti yasmai ucchurasaḥ satta aha kāliko
translated: In the fourth, “a teacher’s instruction that is to be criticized should not be followed”: since the juice of sugarcane is allowable for seven days,

analyzed: tassa kasaṭaḥ yāvajīvikaḥ tasmā vikāle  khāditum vaṭṭati guḷa harītakam viyāti evamādikaḥ gārayha ācariya vādaḥ na gahetabbaḥ lokavajje
translated: and the dregs are allowable for life, and the two together are sugarcane stumps,

analyzed: āpattiyā koṭi chinnā nāma hoti  anupasampannassa sukka vissaṭṭhi ca kāya saṃsaggo ca ati ayam duṭṭhulla ajjhācāro  nāma ati idam duṭṭhulla ārocana sikkhāpada ṭṭhakathāya na sameti vuttam hi tattha anupasampannassa  duṭṭhullam vā a duṭṭhullam vā ajjhācāranti ettha āditas pañca sikkhāpadāni duṭṭhullo
translated: the corner of the offence is cut off.🔽“Indecent exposure and physical contact with a person who is not fully admitted to the Order: this is called a grave offence.” This does not agree with the commentary on the training rule on telling grave offences. For it is said there: “With a person who is not fully admitted to the Order, whether it is a grave offence or not, it is called an offence of wrong conduct. Here, the first five training rules are called grave offences,

original: nāma ajjhācāro, sesāni aduṭṭhullo, sukkavissaṭṭhikāyasaṃsaggaduṭṭhullaattakāmā panassa
analyzed: nāma ajjhācāraḥ sesāni aduṭṭhullaḥ sukka vissaṭṭhi kāyasaṃsagga duṭṭhulla atta kāmā panassa
translated: the rest are not grave offences. Indecent exposure and physical contact are grave offences, but sexual intercourse is not.

original: ajjhācāro nāmā”ti. “Ārocane anupasampannassa duṭṭhullaṃ aññathā adhippetaṃ, paṭicchādane
analyzed: ajjhācāraḥ nāma ati ārocane anupasampannassa duṭṭhullam aññathā adhippetam paṭicchādane
translated: “In telling, with a person who is not fully admitted to the Order, a grave offence is intended in another way. In concealing,

original: aññathā”ti etthāpi visesakāraṇaṃ na dissati, tasmā aṭṭhakathāya pubbenāparaṃ na sameti.🔽Avirodhaṃ icchantena pana vīmaṃsitabbamettha kāraṇaṃ. Sesamettha uttānameva. Upasampannassa
analyzed: aññathā ti ettha api visesa kāraṇam na dissati tasmai aṭṭhakathāya pubbena aparam na sameti  avirodham icchantena pana vīmaṃsitabbam ettha kāraṇam sesam ettha uttānam eva upasampannassa
translated: But in the case of the words “otherwise” there is no reason given, so the later statement does not agree with the earlier one in the commentary.🔽But if one wishes to avoid contradiction, one should investigate the reason here. The rest is clear.

original: duṭṭhullāpattijānanaṃ, paṭicchādetukāmatāya nārocessāmīti dhuranikkhepoti imāni panettha dve aṅgāni.
analyzed: duṭṭhulla āpatti jānanam paṭicchādetu kāma tāya na ārocessāmi iti dhura nikkhepaḥ ti imāni pana ittha dve aṅgāni
translated: The two factors here are: knowing that an offence of a serious nature has been committed by one who is fully admitted to the Order, and the laying hold of the resolution “I will not tell” because of the wish to conceal.

original: Duṭṭhullasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Ūnavīsativassasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: duṭṭhulla sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  ūnavīsati vassa sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the training rule on a serious offence is finished.🔽The training rule on less than twenty years

original: 402. Pañcame rūpasuttanti heraññikānaṃ suttaṃ. Duruttānanti akkosavasena duruttānaṃ,
analyzed: pañcame rūpa suttam ti heraññikānam suttam duruttānam ti akkosa vasena duruttānam
translated: In the fifth, the Thread about a woman’s figure is the Thread about the gold-finder . Harsh words: words that are harsh because of abuse;

original: duruttattāyeva durāgatānaṃ. Vacanapathānanti ettha vacanameva tadatthaṃ ñātukāmānaṃ
analyzed: duruttattāya iva durāgatānam ettha vacanam eva tad attham ñātu kāmānam
translated: because of being harsh, they are ill-spoken. Courses of speech: here speech itself is the course for those who want to know the meaning of that,

original: ñāpetukāmānañca pathoti vacanapatho. Dukkhamānanti dukkhena khamitabbānaṃ.🔽404. Gabbhe sayitakālena saddhiṃ vīsatimaṃ vassaṃ assāti gabbhavīso. Hāyanavaḍḍhananti
analyzed: ñā apetu kāmānam ca pathaḥ ti vacana pathaḥ dukkha mānan ti dukkhena khamitabbānam 🔽gabbhe sayita kālena saddhim vīsatimam vassam assa ati gabbha vīsaḥ hāyana vaḍḍhananti
translated: and for those who want to make known. Words that are hard to endure: words that are hard to forgive because of pain.

original: gabbhamāsesu adhikesu uttarihāyanaṃ, ūnesu vaḍḍhananti veditabbaṃ. Ekūnavīsativassanti
analyzed: gabbha māsesu adhikesu uttari hāyanam ūnesu vaḍḍhananti veditabbam ekūnavīsati vassanti
translated: If the conception is later than the normal time, the higher limit is extended; if earlier, it is reduced.🔽Nineteen years:

original: dvādasamāse mātukucchismiṃ vasitvā mahāpavāraṇāya jātakālato paṭṭhāya ekūnavīsativassaṃ.
analyzed: dvādasa māse mātukucchismim vasitvā mahāpavāraṇāya jāta kālataḥ paṭṭhāya ekūnavīsati vassam
translated: from the time of his birth on the full-moon day of Āsāḷhi, after spending twelve months in his mother’s womb.🔽On the day of the Invitation: on the last day of the three-month period of the rains.

original: Pāṭipadadivaseti pacchimikāya vassūpagamanadivase. “Tiṃsarattidivo māso”ti vacanato
analyzed: pāṭipada divasa iti pacchimikāya vassūpagamana divase māso ti vacanato
translated: Since it is said that “a month is thirty days and nights,”🔽it is said that “four months are lost.”

original: “cattāro māsā parihāyantī”ti vuttaṃ. Vassaṃ ukkaḍḍhantīti vassaṃ uddhaṃ kaḍḍhanti,
analyzed: cattāraḥ māsā parihāyanti iti vuttam vassam ukkaḍḍhanti iti vassam uddham kaḍḍhanti
translated: They extend the rains: they extend the rains upwards,

original: tatiye saṃvacchare ekamāsaṃ adhikamāsavasena pariccajantā vassaṃ uddhaṃ kaḍḍhantīti
analyzed: tatiye saṃvacchare eka māsam adhika māsa vasena pariccajantāḥ vassam uddham kaḍḍhanti iti
translated: the meaning is that they spend the third year with an extra month, making it thirteen months.

original: attho, tasmā tatiyo saṃvaccharo terasamāsiko hoti, saṃvaccharassa pana dvādasamāsikattā
analyzed: attho tasmā tatiyaḥ saṃvaccharaḥ terasa māsikaḥ hoti saṃvaccharassa pana dvādasa māsika ttā
translated: But since the year consists of twelve months,

original: aṭṭhārasasu vassesu adhikamāse visuṃ gahetvā “cha māsā vaḍḍhantī”ti vuttaṃ. Tatoti
analyzed: aṭṭhārasasu vassesu adhika māse visum gahetvā cha māsāḥ vaḍḍhanti iti vuttam tatas ti
translated: it is said that “six months are added” by taking the extra months separately in the eighteen years.🔽After that:🔽after the six months.

original: chamāsato. Nikkaṅkhā hutvāti adhikamāsehi saddhiṃ paripuṇṇavīsativassattā nibbematikā
analyzed: cha māsataḥ nikkaṅkhā hutvā ati adhika māsehi saddhim paripuṇṇa vīsati vassa ttā nibbematikā
translated: Being certain: being free from doubt because of the full twenty years together with the extra months.

original: hutvā. Yaṃ pana vuttaṃ tīsu gaṇṭhipadesu “aṭṭhārasannaṃyeva vassānaṃ adhikamāse gahetvā🔽gaṇitattā sesavassadvayassapi adhikāni divasāni honteva, tāni adhikadivasāni sandhāya
analyzed: hutvā yam pana vuttam tīsu gaṇṭhi padesu aṭṭhārasannam yeva vassānam adhika māse gahetvā  adhikāni divasāni hontā iva tāni adhika divasāni sandhāya
translated: But what was said, namely, “because eighteen years and the extra months were taken,🔽the extra days of the remaining two years were also taken, and it was said ‘without doubt’

original: ‘nikkaṅkhā hutvā’ti vutta”nti, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ. Na hi dvīsu vassesu adhikadivasāni
analyzed: nikkaṅkhā hutvā iti vuttanti tat na gahetabbam na hi dvīsu vassesu adhika divasāni
translated: with reference to those extra days,” should not be accepted. For extra days in two years

original: nāma visuṃ upalabbhanti tatiye vasse vassukkaḍḍhanavasena adhikamāse pariccatteyeva
analyzed: nāma visum upalabbhanti tatiye vasse vassukkaḍḍhana vasena adhika māse
translated: are not found separately. They are included in the extra months given in the third year

original: atirekamāsasambhavato. Tasmā dvīsu vassesu atirekadivasāni nāma visuṃ na sambhavanti.
analyzed: atireka māsa sambhavataḥ tasmā dvīsu vassesu atireka divasāni nāma visum na sambhavanti
translated: by the addition of a month. Therefore extra days in two years are not found separately.

original: Nanu ca “te dve māse gahetvā vīsativassāni paripuṇṇāni hontī”ti kasmā vuttaṃ, ekūnavīsativassamhi
analyzed: nanu ca te dve māse gahetvā vīsati vassāni paripuṇṇāni honti iti kasmā vuttam ekūnavīsati vassamhi
translated: But why was it said, “taking those two months, the twenty years are completed”?

original: puna aparasmiṃ vasse pakkhitte vīsativassāni paripuṇṇāni hontīti āha “ettha pana…pe…
analyzed: puna aparasmin vasse pakkhitte vīsati vassāni paripuṇṇāni honti iti āha ettha panape
translated: Because when another year is added to nineteen years, the twenty years are completed.🔽“Herein, however, the word ‘but’ is stated in order to show that the extra days in the two years are not included in the twenty years.

original: vutta”nti. Anekatthattā nipātānaṃ pana-saddo hi-saddatthe, ettha hīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vuttam ti aneka attha ttā nipātānam pana saddaḥ hi sadda atthe ettha hi iti vuttam hoti
translated: For the word ‘but’ has various meanings. Here it has the meaning of ‘since.’

original: Idañhi vuttassevatthassa samatthanavasena vuttaṃ. Iminā ca imaṃ dīpeti “yaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: idam hi vuttassa iva atthassa samatthana vasena vuttam iminā ca imam dīpeti yam vuttam
translated: “It was said above

original: ‘ekūnavīsativassaṃ sāmaṇeraṃ nikkhamanīyapuṇṇamāsiṃ atikkamma pāṭipadadivase upasampādentī’ti,🔽tattha gabbhamāsepi aggahetvā dvīhi māsehi aparipuṇṇavīsativassaṃ sandhāya ‘ekūnavīsativassa’nti
analyzed: ekūnavīsati vassam sāmaṇeram nikkhamanīya puṇṇamāsim atikkamma pāṭipada divase upasampādenti iti  tattha gabbha māse api aggahetvā dvīhi māsehi aparipuṇṇa vīsati vassam sandhāya ekūnavīsati vassanti
translated: ‘if she gives the full admission to a novice who is less than twenty years old on the day after the Invitation ceremony in the last month of the rainy season,’🔽and there the words ‘less than twenty years old’ refer to one who is less than twenty years old by two months without counting the months in the womb.

original: vuttaṃ, tasmā adhikamāsesu dvīsu gahitesu vīsativassāni paripuṇṇāni nāma hontī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam tasmai adhika māsesu dvīsu gahitesu vīsati vassāni paripuṇṇāni nāma honti iti
translated: Therefore, when two months are added to the two extra months, the twenty years are complete.”

original: Tasmāti yasmā gabbhamāsāpi gaṇanūpagā honti, tasmā. Ekavīsativasso hotīti jātadivasato
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmai gabbha māsā api gaṇanūpagāḥ honti tasmai ekavīsati vassaḥ hoti iti jāta divasataḥ
translated: Therefore, since the months in the womb are counted,

original: paṭṭhāya vīsativasso samāno gabbhamāsehi saddhiṃ ekavīsativasso hoti.
analyzed: paṭṭhāya vīsati vassaḥ samānaḥ gabbha māsehi saddhim ekavīsati vassaḥ hoti
translated: he is twenty years old, and with the months in the womb he is twenty-one years old.

original: 406. Aññaṃ upasampādetīti upajjhāyo kammavācācariyo vā hutvā upasampādeti. Sesamettha uttānameva. Ūnavīsativassatā, ūnakasaññitā, upasampādananti imāni panettha tīṇi aṅgāni.
analyzed: aññam upasampādeti iti upajjhāyaḥ kamma vācā cariyaḥ vā hutvā upasampādeti sesam ettha uttānam eva ūnavīsati vassa tā ūnaka saññi tā upasampādanan ti imāni pana ittha tīṇi aṅgāni
translated: Gives the full admission to another: either as preceptor or as ceremonial assistant. The rest is clear. Herein, these are the three items: less than twenty years old, the perception of less, and giving the full admission.

original: Ūnavīsativassasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽6. Theyyasatthasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ūnavīsati vassa sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  theyyasattha sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the training rule on less than twenty years is finished.🔽The training rule on a thief

original: 407. Chaṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ uttānatthameva. Theyyasatthakabhāvo, jānanaṃ, saṃvidhānaṃ, avisaṅketena gamananti imāni panettha cattāri aṅgāni.
analyzed: chaṭṭha sikkhāpadam uttānattham eva theyyasatthaka bhāvaḥ jānanam saṃvidhānam a visaṅketena gamanan ti imāni pana ittha cattāri aṅgāni
translated: The sixth training rule is straightforward in meaning. But there are four relevant points here: being a thief, knowing it, making an appointment, and going without a companion.

original: Theyyasatthasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: theyyasattha sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the training rule on a thief is finished.

original: 412. Sattame natthi kiñci vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: sattame natthi kiñci vattabbam
translated: There is nothing to be said about the seventh.

original: 8. Ariṭṭhasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā🔽417. Aṭṭhame bādhayiṃsūti haniṃsu. Taṃtaṃsampattiyā vibandhanavasena sattasantānassa
analyzed: ariṭṭha sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā  aṭṭhame bādhayiṃsu iti haniṃsu tad tad sampattiyāḥ vibandhana vasena satta santānassa
translated: The training rule on Ariṭṭha

original: antare vemajjhe eti āgacchatīti antarāyo, diṭṭhadhammikādianattho. Anatikkamanaṭṭhena
analyzed: antare vemajjhe eti āgacchati iti antarāyaḥ diṭṭhadhammika ādi anatthaḥ an atikkamana aṭṭhena
translated: In the eighth rule, “they harmed” means they killed. Because they obstructed the attainment of the goal, they are an “obstacle” (antarāya), which is something that is disadvantageous in this life and the next. Because they cannot be transgressed,

original: tasmiṃ antarāye niyuttā, antarāyaṃ vā phalaṃ arahanti, antarāyassa vā karaṇasīlāti
analyzed: tasmin antarāye niyuttāḥ antarāyam vā phalam arahanti antarāyassa vā karaṇa sīlā ati
translated: they are “bound to an obstacle” (antarāyika), or they are “worthy of an obstacle” (antarāyika), or they are “of the nature of creating an obstacle” (antarāyika).

original: antarāyikā. Tenāha “antarāyaṃ karontīti antarāyikā”ti. Ānantariyadhammāti ānantarikasabhāvā
analyzed: antarāyikā tena āha antarāyam karonti iti antarāyikā ati ānantariya dhammā ati ānantarika sabhāvā
translated: That is why it is said, “They create an obstacle, thus they are antarāyika.” “Immediate offenses” (ānantariyadhamma) means “of the nature of being immediate offenses” (ānantarikasabhāva).

original: cetanādhammā. Tatrāyaṃ vacanattho – cutianantaraphalaṃ anantaraṃ nāma, tasmiṃ anantare
analyzed: cetanā dhammā tatra ayam vacana attho cuti anantara phalam anantaram nāma tasmin anantare
translated: and the mental-data element. Herein, the meaning of the words is as follows. The fruit that is next to the death is called “next” .

original: niyuttā, taṃnibbattanena anantarakaraṇasīlā, anantarappayojanāti vā ānantarikā, te
analyzed: niyuttā tad nibbattanena anantara karaṇa sīlā anantara ppayojanā ati vā ānantarikā te
translated: They are “bound to that” , they are of the nature to make that next , or they are next to that as the purpose next to it, thus they are “next-to-next” .

original: eva ānantariyāti vuttā. Kammāni eva antarāyikāti kammantarāyikā. Mokkhasseva antarāyaṃ🔽karoti, na saggassāti micchācāralakkhaṇābhāvato vuttaṃ. Na hi bhikkhuniyā dhammarakkhitabhāvo
analyzed: eva ānantariyā ti vuttā kammāni eva antarāyikā ati kamma antarāyikā mokkhassa iva antarāyam  karoti na saggassa iti micchācāra lakkhaṇa abhāvataḥ vuttam na hi bhikkhuniyā dhamma rakkhita bhāvaḥ
translated: They are called “next-to-next” because they are next to that next . They are “hindrances to kamma” because they are hindrances to kamma.🔽It is said that it is only a hindrance to deliverance, not to heaven, because there is no characteristic of misconduct in it.🔽For there is no protection of the Dhamma by a bhikkhunī.

original: atthi. Pākatikabhikkhunīvasena cetaṃ vuttaṃ. Ariyāya pana pavattaṃ apāyasaṃvattanikameva,
analyzed: atthi pākatika bhikkhunī vasena ca itam vuttam ariyāya pana pavattam apāya saṃvattanikam eva
translated: This is said of a bhikkhunī who is an ordinary person. But if it occurs to one who is a noble person, it leads only to an unhappy destiny.

original: nandamāṇavako cettha nidassanaṃ. Ubhinnaṃ samānacchandatāvasena vā na saggantarāyikatā,
analyzed: ca ittha nidassanam samāna chanda tā vasena vā na saggantarāyika tā
translated: The youth Nanda is the example here. Or alternatively, it is not a hindrance to heaven because of the equality of desire in both.

original: mokkhantarāyikatā pana mokkhatthāya paṭipattiyā vidūsanato. Abhibhavitvā pana pavattiyaṃ
analyzed: mokkha antarāyika tā pana mokkha atthāya paṭipattiyā vidūsanataḥ abhibhavitvā pana pavattiyam
translated: But it is a hindrance to deliverance because it defiles the practice that has deliverance as its object.

original: saggantarāyikatāpi na sakkā nivāretunti.
analyzed: saggantarāyika tā api na sakkā nivāretun ti
translated: But when it occurs by overcoming , it is not possible to deny that it is a hindrance to heaven.

original: Ahetukadiṭṭhiakiriyadiṭṭhinatthikadiṭṭhiyova niyatabhāvaṃ pattā niyatamicchādiṭṭhidhammā.
analyzed: ahetuka diṭṭhi akiriya diṭṭhi natthika diṭṭhiyo uva niyata bhāvam pattāḥ niyatam icchā diṭṭhi dhammā
translated: The views that there is no cause, that there is no action, and that there is no fruit are fixed wrong views.

original: Paṭisandhidhammāti paṭisandhicittuppādamāha. Paṇḍakādiggahaṇañcettha nidassanamattaṃ
analyzed: paṭisandhi dhammā ti paṭisandhi cittuppādam āha paṇḍaka ādi gahaṇam ca ittha nidassana mattam
translated: The states of rebirth: he refers to the arising of rebirth-linking consciousness. The inclusion of the paṇḍakas, etc., is by way of illustration only.

original: sabbāyapi ahetukapaṭisandhiyā vipākantarāyikabhāvato. Yāhi ariye upavadati, tā cetanā
analyzed: ahetuka paṭisandhiyā vipāka antarāyika bhāvataḥ cetanā
translated: For all rebirth-linking consciousness without root-cause is an obstruction to the other kinds of kamma-resultant consciousness.🔽The volition that occurs in the course of reviling noble ones is the reviling of noble ones.

original: ariyūpavādā jātā. Tato paranti khamāpanato upari. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ dibbacakkhukathāyaṃ
analyzed: ariyūpavādā jātā tato paranti khamāpanato upari yat pana ittha vattabbam tat dibba cakkhu kathāyam
translated: After that: after the asking for forgiveness. What is to be said here has already been said in the discussion on the divine eye.

original: vuttameva. Sañcicca āpannā āpattiyoti sañcicca vītikkantā satta āpattikkhandhā. Sañcicca
analyzed: vuttam eva sañcit ca āpannāḥ āpattiyaḥ iti sañcit ca vītikkantāḥ satta āpatti kkhandhāḥ sañcit ca
translated: The seven classes of offenses that one has intentionally committed are the seven classes of offenses that one has intentionally transgressed.

original: vītikkantañhi antamaso dukkaṭadubbhāsitampi saggamaggaphalānaṃ antarāyaṃ karoti.🔽Yāva bhikkhubhāvaṃ paṭijānāti pārājikaṃ āpanno, na vuṭṭhāti sesagarukāpattiṃ āpanno,
analyzed: vītikkantam hi antamasaḥ dukkaṭa dubbhāsitam pi sagga magga phalānam antarāyam karoti  yāva bhikkhu bhāvam paṭijānāti pārājikam āpannaḥ na vuṭṭhāti sesa garuka āpattim āpannaḥ
translated: For even a mere offense of wrong conduct or wrong speech that one has intentionally transgressed is an obstruction to the supramundane paths and fruits.

original: na deseti lahukāpattiṃ āpanno.
analyzed: na deseti lahuka āpattim āpannaḥ
translated: As long as one acknowledges oneself as a bhikkhu, one has not fallen away from the offense entailing expulsion; one has not been rehabilitated from the offense entailing suspension; one has not confessed the offense entailing acknowledgment; one has not been forgiven for the offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ayaṃ bhikkhūti ariṭṭho bhikkhu. Rasena rasaṃ saṃsanditvāti anavajjena paccayaparibhuñjanarasena🔽sāvajjakāmaguṇaparibhogarasaṃ samānetvā. Yoniso paccavekkhaṇena natthi ettha chandarāgoti🔽nicchandarāgo, paccayaparibhogo. Upanento viyāti bandhanaṃ upanento viya. “Ghaṭento
analyzed: ayam bhikkhu iti ariṭṭhaḥ bhikkhu rasena rasam saṃsanditvā ati anavajjena paccaya paribhuñjana rasena  sāvajja kāma guṇa paribhoga rasam samānetvā yoniso paccavekkhaṇena natthi ettha chanda rāgo ti  nicchanda rāgo paccaya paribhogo upanentaḥ viya ati bandhanam upanentaḥ viya ghaṭentaḥ
translated: ‘This monk’: the monk Arittha. ‘Having mixed the taste with the taste’: having mixed the taste of using requisites without transgression

original: viyā”tipi pāṭho. Upasaṃharanto viyāti sadisataṃ upasaṃharanto viya ekantasāvajje🔽anavajjabhāvapakkhepanato. Pāpakanti lāmakaṭṭhena duggatisampāpanaṭṭhena ca pāpakaṃ.🔽Mahāsamuddaṃ bandhantena viyāti setukaraṇavasena mahāsāgaraṃ bandhantena viya. Sabbaññutaññāṇena
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ upasaṃharantaḥ viyāti upasaṃharantaḥ ekanta sāvajje  anavajja bhāva pakkhepanato pāpakanti lāmaka ṭṭhena duggati sampāpana ṭṭhena ca pāpakam  mahā samuddam bandhantena viya ati setu karaṇa vasena mahā sāgaram bandhantena viya sabbaññuta ññāṇena
translated: with the taste of using sense pleasures with transgression. ‘Having reflected wisely’: there is no lust here, therefore there is no lust. The use of requisites. ‘As if binding’: as if binding a fetter. ‘As if making a bond’ is another reading. ‘As if bringing together’: as if bringing together a hundred. Because of the removal of the state of being without transgression

original: saddhiṃ paṭivirujjhantoti sabbaññutaññāṇena “sāvajja”nti diṭṭhaṃ “anavajja”nti gahaṇena
analyzed: saddhim paṭivirujjhanto ti sabbaññu ta ññāṇena sa āvajjanti diṭṭham an avajjanti gahaṇena
translated: in the entirely blameworthy, ‘evil’: evil in the sense of being rotten and in the sense of bringing about an unhappy destination. ‘As if binding the great ocean’: as if binding the great ocean by making a bridge. ‘In conflict with’: in conflict with the knowledge of omniscience. ‘Having seen’: having seen ‘blameworthy’ with the knowledge of omniscience, ‘blameless’

original: tena saha paṭivirujjhanto. Āṇācakketi paṭhamapārājikasikkhāpadasaṅkhāte, “abrahmacariyaṃ
analyzed: tena saha paṭivirujjhantaḥ āṇācakka iti paṭhama pārājika sikkhāpada saṅkhāte a brahmacariyam
translated: He is in conflict with it.

original: pahāyā”tiādidesanāsaṅkhāte ca āṇācakke.
analyzed: pahāya ati ādi desanā saṅkhāte ca āṇācakke
translated: He is in conflict with the instruction in the first offense entailing expulsion, called “abandoning unchastity,” and with the instruction called “the instruction in the rod.”

original: Aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ nāma uraṭṭhi vā piṭṭhikaṇṭakaṃ vā sīsaṭṭhi vā. Tañhi nimmaṃsattā “kaṅkala”nti🔽vuccati. Vigatamaṃsāya hi aṭṭhisaṅkhalikāya ekaṭṭhimhi vā kaṅkala-saddo niruḷho.
analyzed: aṭṭhikaṅkalam nāma uraṭṭhi vā piṭṭhikaṇṭakam vā sīsaṭṭhi vā tat hi nimmaṃsattā kaṅkalanti  vuccati vigata maṃsāya hi aṭṭhi saṅkhalikāya ekaṭṭhimhi vā kaṅkala saddo niruḷhaḥ
translated: A skeleton: a rib bone, a spine bone, or a skull bone. For these are called “skeleton” because they are without flesh. For the term “skeleton” is used for a chain of bones without flesh.

original: Anudahanaṭṭhenāti anupāyapaṭipattiyā sampati āyatiñca anudahanaṭṭhena. Mahābhitāpanaṭṭhena
analyzed: anudahana ṭhena ati an upāya paṭipattiyā sampati āyatim ca anudahana ṭhena mahā abhitāpana ṭṭhena
translated: In the sense of burning: in the sense of burning now and in the future through the practice of the wrong way. In the sense of great burning:

original: anavaṭṭhitasabhāvatāya, ittarapaccupaṭṭhānaṭṭhena muhuttakaraṇīyatāya, tāvakālikaṭṭhena
analyzed: anavaṭṭhita sabhāva tāya ittara paccupaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena muhutta karaṇīya tāya tāvakālika ṭṭhena
translated: because of the non-continuous nature of the aggregates, in the sense of momentary activity, in the sense of being for a while,

original: parehi abhibhavanatāya, sabbaṅgapaccaṅgapalibhañjanaṭṭhena bhedanādiadhikaraṇabhāvena,
analyzed: parehi abhibhavana tāya sabbaṅga paccaṅga palibhañjana ṭṭhena bhedana ādi adhikaraṇa bhāvena
translated: because of being overcome by others, in the sense of breaking all the limbs and joints, in the sense of the legal issues of schism, etc.,

original: ugghāṭasadisatāya adhikuṭṭanaṭṭhena, avaṇe vaṇaṃ uppādetvā anto anupavisanabhāvatāya
analyzed: ugghāṭa sadisa tāya adhikuṭṭana ṭṭhena avaṇe vaṇam uppādetvā antar an upavisana bhāva tāya
translated: in the sense of striking down, because of being like the uncovering, in the sense of not entering inside after producing a wound in the skin,

original: vinivijjhanaṭṭhena, diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaanatthanimittatāya sāsaṅkasappaṭibhayaṭṭhena.
analyzed: vinivijjhana ṭṭhena diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika anattha nimitta tāya sa āsaṅka sa paṭibhaya ṭṭhena
translated: In the sense of penetrating, in the sense of being fearful and risky because of being a cause of harm in this life and the life to come.

original: Pāḷiyaṃ “thāmasā parāmāsā”tiādīsu evamattho veditabbo. Thāmasāti diṭṭhithāmena, tassā🔽diṭṭhiyā thāmagatabhāvenāti attho. Parāmāsāti diṭṭhiparāmāsena, diṭṭhisaṅkhātaparāmāsenāti🔽attho. Diṭṭhiyeva hi dhammasabhāvaṃ atikkamitvā parato āmasanena parāmāso. Abhinivissāti
analyzed: pāḷiyam thāmasā parāmāsā atiādīsu evam atthaḥ veditabbaḥ thāmasā ti diṭṭhi thāmena tassā  diṭṭhiyā thāma gata bhāvena ati diṭṭhi parāmāsena diṭṭhi saṅkhāta parāmāsena ati  atthaḥ diṭṭhiyā iva hi dhamma sabhāvam atikkamitvā paratas āmasanena parāmāsaḥ abhinivissāti
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way in the passage in the text beginning, “By obstinacy and by grasping” . By obstinacy : by the obstinacy of view,🔽by the obstinacy of that view, is the meaning. By grasping : by the grasping of view, by the grasping called view, is the meaning. For grasping is so called because it grasps beyond the real nature of things.

original: taṇhābhinivesapubbaṅgamena diṭṭhābhinivesena “idamettha sacca”nti abhinivisitvā.
analyzed: taṇhā abhinivesa pubbaṅgamena diṭṭha abhinivesena idam ettha saccanti abhinivisitvā
translated: By adhering : by the adherence of view, preceded by the adherence of craving, by adhering to the view “This alone is the truth” .

original: Voharatīti katheti. Yato ca kho te bhikkhūti yadā te bhikkhū. Evaṃbyākho ahaṃ, bhante,🔽bhagavatāti idaṃ esa attano laddhiṃ nigūhitukāmatāya natthīti vattukāmopi bhagavato
analyzed: voharati iti kathā iti yatas ca kho te bhikkhū iti yadā te bhikkhū evaṃbyākhaḥ aham bhante  bhagavatā ati idam esa attanaḥ laddhim nigūhitu kāma tāya natthi iti vattu kāmaḥ api bhagavataḥ
translated: By arguing : by saying. And when the bhikkhus : when those bhikkhus. Thus, venerable sir,🔽I have answered the Blessed One’s question as I understood it.

original: ānubhāvena sampaṭicchati. Buddhānaṃ kira sammukhā dve kathā kathetuṃ samattho nāma
analyzed: ānubhāvena sampaṭicchati buddhānam kira sammukhā dve kathāḥ kathetum samatthaḥ nāma
translated: Although he wanted to say “No,” he assented through the Blessed One’s psychic power, for it seems that no one is able to carry on a discussion with Buddhas face to face.

original: natthi. Kassa nu kho nāma tvaṃ moghapurisāti tvaṃ moghapurisa kassa khattiyassa vā🔽brāhmaṇassa vā vessassa vā suddassa vā gahaṭṭhassa vā pabbajitassa vā devassa vā
analyzed: natthi kassa nu kho nāma tvam mogha purisa ati tvam mogha purisa kassa khattiyassa vā  brāhmaṇassa vā vessassa vā suddassa vā gahaṭṭhassa vā pabbajitassa vā devassa vā
translated: “No, friend.” “Then, foolish man, who do you think I am? I am a Khattiya,🔽a Brahmin, a merchant, a worker, a scavenger, a householder, a monastic, a god,🔽

original: manussassa vā mayā evaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāsi. Sesamettha uttānameva. Dhammakammatā,🔽samanubhāsanā, appaṭinissajjananti imāni panettha tīṇi aṅgāni.
analyzed: manussassa vā mayā evam dhammam desitam ājānāsi sesam ettha uttānam eva dhamma kamma tā  imāni pana ittha tīṇi aṅgāni
translated: There is not. “By whom, foolish man, have you been so taught?” “Foolish man,” he should be told, “by whom, a contemplative or a brahmin, a householder or one gone forth, a god or a human, have you been so taught that you think thus?” The rest is as above. The three instances here are the offense entailing suspension, the accusation, and the refusal to stop.

original: Ariṭṭhasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ariṭṭha sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the training rule on Ariṭṭha is finished.

original: 9. Ukkhittasambhogasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā🔽424. Navame payogagaṇanāyāti dānaggahaṇappayogagaṇanāya. Saṃvāse kammapariyosānavasena,
analyzed: ukkhittasambhoga sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā  navame payoga gaṇanāya ati dāna ggahaṇa ppayoga gaṇanāya saṃvāse kamma pariyosāna vasena
translated: The training rule on the offense entailing suspension🔽In the ninth, by the number of attempts: by the number of attempts to receive the gift. The offense should be understood by way of the end of the transaction in the case of living together,

original: sahaseyyāya ekasmiṃ nipanne itarassa nipajjanapayogavasena āpattiparicchedo veditabbo.
analyzed: sahaseyyāya ekasmin nipanne itarassa nipajjana payoga vasena āpatti paricchedaḥ veditabbo
translated: and by way of the attempt to lie down when the other is lying down in the case of lying down together.

original: Ettha ca padabhājane “ekacchanne”ti avisesena vuttattā nānūpacārepi ekacchanne nipajjantassa
analyzed: ettha ca pada bhājane eka channa iti avisesena vutta ttā na anu upacāre pi eka channe nipajjantassa
translated: And in the analysis of the rule, “in the same shelter” is said without distinction. Therefore, if one lies down in the same shelter as someone who is not on the same level,

original: āpatti. Teneva mātikāṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ “saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyyāti nānūpacārepi
analyzed: āpatti tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttam saha vā seyyam kappeyya iti na anūpacāre pi
translated: there is an offense. And so it is said in the commentary on the mātikā: “If he should lie down in the same bed: he should not lie down in the same bed-cover, even if the bed-covers are separate.”

original: ekacchanne nipajjeyyā”ti. Paṇṇattiṃ ajānantena arahatāpi kiriyābyākatacittena āpajjitabbattā🔽“ticitta”nti vuttaṃ. Yaṃ pana kenaci vuttaṃ “ticittanti ettha vipākābyākatacittena
analyzed: eka channe nipajjeyya iti paṇṇattim a jānantena arahatā api kiriyā a byākata cittena āpajjitabba ttā  ti cittam ti vuttam yam pana kenacid vuttam ti cittam ti ettha vipāka abyākata cittena
translated: Because it is possible for one who is not yet fully enlightened to commit an offense with a mind that is undetermined in the sense of being a natural outcome of the previous wholesome state,

original: saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyyāti evamattho daṭṭhabbo, aññathā sacittakattā sikkhāpadassa
analyzed: saha vā seyyam kappeyya ati evamatthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ aññathā sa cittaka ttā sikkhāpadassa
translated: it is said that there are three kinds of minds. But what someone else has said—that the meaning of “three kinds of minds” should be understood as “if he should lie down in the same bed with a mind that is undetermined in the sense of being a natural outcome of the previous wholesome state,” and that otherwise, since the training rule requires a mind,

original: kiriyābyākataṃ sandhāya na yujjatī”ti, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ. Na hi sacittakasikkhāpadavītikkamo
analyzed: kiriyā byākatam sandhāya na yujjati iti tat na gahetabbam na hi sa cittaka sikkhāpada vītikkamaḥ
translated: it is not appropriate to refer to a mind that is undetermined in the sense of being a natural outcome of the previous wholesome state—that should not be accepted. For it is not the case that a breach of a training rule that requires a mind

original: arahato na sambhavati. Teneva pathavīkhaṇanādīsu sacittakasikkhāpadesu ticittameva🔽vuttaṃ. Sesamettha uttānameva. Akatānudhammatā, jānanā, sambhogādikaraṇanti imāni
analyzed: arahataḥ na sambhavati tena iva pathavī khaṇana ādīsu sa cittaka sikkhāpadesu ti cittam eva  vuttam sesam ettha uttānam eva akata anudhamma tā jānanā sambhoga ādi karaṇan ti imāni
translated: is impossible for a perfected one. That is why, in the case of the training rules that require a mind—the digging of the earth, etc.—only three kinds of minds are mentioned.

original: panettha tīṇi aṅgāni.
analyzed: pana itthā tīṇi aṅgāni
translated: The rest is self-explanatory. The three factors in this training rule are:🔽the state of being undetermined, knowing, and using.

original: Ukkhittasambhogasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ukkhittasambhoga sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The training rule on resuming use is finished.

original: 10. Kaṇṭakasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kaṇṭaka sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on thorns

original: 428. Dasame pireti nipātapadaṃ. Sambodhane vattamānaṃ para-saddena samānatthaṃ vadantīti
analyzed: dasame pi rā iti nipāta padam sambodhane vattamānam para saddena samāna attham vadanti iti
translated: In the tenth, the word “pire” is a particle. They say that it has the same meaning as the word “para” in the sense of “addressing,”

original: āha “para amāmakā”ti, amhākaṃ anajjhattikabhūtāti attho. Pireti vā “parato”ti iminā🔽samānatthaṃ nipātapadaṃ, tasmā cara pireti parato gaccha, mā idha tiṭṭhāti evampettha
analyzed: āha amāmakā ati amhākam anajjhattika bhūtā ati attho pirā iti vā paratas iti iminā  samāna attham nipāta padam tasmai cara pirā iti paratas gaccha mā idha tiṭṭha evam pā ittha
translated: so he says, “para amāmakā” . The meaning is: “not belonging to us.” Or else the word “pire” is a particle having the same meaning as “parato” .

original: attho veditabbo. Sesamettha purimasikkhāpadadvaye vuttanayameva.
analyzed: atthaḥ veditabbo sesam ettha purima sikkhāpada dvaye vutta nayam eva
translated: Therefore the meaning here should be understood thus: “Go away from here, pire, go away from us, do not stand here.” The rest is as in the previous two training rules.

original: Kaṇṭakasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kaṇṭaka sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the training rule on thorns is finished.

original: Niṭṭhito sappāṇakavaggo sattamo.🔽8. Sahadhammikavaggo
analyzed: niṭṭhitaḥ sappāṇaka vaggaḥ sattamaḥ  sahadhammika vaggaḥ
translated: The seventh sub-chapter on living beings is finished.🔽The sub-chapter on legitimate

original: 1. Sahadhammikasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā🔽434. Sahadhammikavaggassa paṭhamasikkhāpade vācāya vācāya āpattīti anādariyabhayā🔽lesena evaṃ vadantassa āpatti. Sesamettha uttānameva. Upasampannassa paññattena vacanaṃ,
analyzed: sahadhammika sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā  sahadhammika vaggassa paṭhama sikkhāpade vācāya vācāya āpatti iti anādariya bhayā  lesena evam vadantassa āpatti sesam ettha uttānam eva upasampannassa paññattena vacanaṃ
translated: The commentary on the training rule on legitimate is finished.🔽In the first training rule in the sub-chapter on legitimate, “for every statement” means that there is an offense for one who speaks in this way out of disrespect. The rest is obvious. The two members here are: a statement that is legitimate and has been laid down by the Buddha,

original: asikkhitukāmatāya evaṃ vacananti imāni panettha dve aṅgāni.
analyzed: a sikkhitu kāma tāya evam imāni pana ittha dve aṅgāni
translated: and speaking in this way because of not wanting to train.

original: Sahadhammikasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sahadhammika sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the training rule on what is in accordance with the Teaching is finished.

original: 2. Vilekhanasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vilekhana sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The training rule on writing

original: 438. Dutiye vinayassa pariyāpuṇanaṃ vinayapariyattīti āha “vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇantāna”ntiādi.
analyzed: dutiye vinayassa pariyāpuṇanam vinaya pariyatti iti āha vinayam
translated: In the second, memorizing the Monastic Law is called “knowing the Monastic Law”. He says, “Those who memorize the Monastic Law” and so on.

original: Suguttoti yathā karaṇḍake pakkhittamaṇikkhandho viya na nassati vipattiṃ na pāpuṇāti,🔽evaṃ suṭṭhu gopito. Surakkhitoti tasseva pariyāyavacanaṃ. Yathā hi kilesacorehi avilumpanīyo
analyzed: su guttaḥ ti yathā karaṇḍake pakkhitta maṇi kkhandhaḥ viya na nassati vipattim na pāpuṇāti  evam suṭṭhu gopitaḥ su rakkhitaḥ ti tassa iva pariyāya vacanam yathā hi kilesa corehi a vilumpanīyaḥ
translated: Well-guarded: not lost, not fallen into misfortune, like a chest of jewels placed in a safe.🔽Well-protected: this is a synonym for the previous term. For just as one is not robbed by the thieves of defilements,

original: hoti, evaṃ sabbadā sūpaṭṭhitassatitāya suṭṭhu rakkhito. Kukkuccapakatānanti kappiyākappiyaṃ
analyzed: hoti evam sabbadā su upaṭṭhitaḥ satitāya suṭṭhu rakkhitaḥ kappiya akappiyam
translated: so one is well-protected by being constantly well-established in mindfulness. Overcome by scruples: overcome by the scruples that arise in regard to what is allowable and what is not.🔽Fear of delusion: fear of delusion.

original: nissāya uppannakukkuccena abhibhūtānaṃ. Sārajjanaṃ sārado, byāmohabhayaṃ. Vigato
analyzed: nissāya uppanna kukkuccena abhibhūtānam sārajjanam sāradaḥ byāmoha bhayam vigataḥ
translated: Free from fear: one who is free from fear.

original: sārado etassāti visārado. Sahadhammenāti sakāraṇena vacanena. Suniggahitaṃ niggaṇhātīti
analyzed: sāradaḥ etassa ati visāradaḥ sahadhammena ati sa kāraṇena vacanena su niggahitam niggaṇhāti iti
translated: With reasons: with reasons for speaking.

original: yathā na puna sīsaṃ ukkhipanti, atha kho appaṭibhānā maṅkubhūtāyeva honti, evaṃ suṭṭhu niggaṇhāti.
analyzed: yathā na puna sīsam ukkhipanti atha kho appaṭibhānāḥ maṅku bhūtāya iva honti evam suṭṭhu niggaṇhāti
translated: Well-restrained: just as one does not raise one’s head again, but is instead speechless and embarrassed, so one is well-restrained.

original: Alajjitāti ya-kāralopena niddeso, alajjitāyāti vuttaṃ hoti. Aññāṇatātiādīsupi eseva nayo. Mando momūhoti aññāṇabhāvena mando, avisayato momūho, mahāmūḷhoti attho.
analyzed: alajjitā ati yakāra lopena niddesaḥ alajjitāya iti vuttam hoti aññāṇatā ati ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ mandaḥ momūho ti aññāṇa bhāvena mandaḥ avisayataḥ momūhaḥ mahā mūḷhaḥ ti attho
translated: ‘Without shame’ is a locative in the sense of ‘without shame’ by the omission of the locative case ending. The same method of explanation applies in the case of ‘without knowledge’ and so on. ‘Slow-witted, dullards’ : slow-witted because of ignorance, dullards because of lack of scope; the meaning is, great fools.

original: Attapaccatthikāti attano paccatthikā. Vajjiputtakā dasavatthudīpakā. Parūpahāraaññāṇakaṅkhāparavitāraṇādivādāti
analyzed: atta paccatthikā ti attanaḥ paccatthikā vajji puttakā dasa vatthu dīpakā para upahāra aññāṇa kaṅkhā para vitāraṇa ādi vādā ti

analyzed: na hi apaharitu kāma tāya pahāre dinne purima sikkhāpadena pahāra paccayā pācittiyena  dukkaṭena vā bhavitum tiracchāna ādīnam disvā kujjhitvā api

original: uggirantassa mokkhādhippāyo evā”ti vadanti. Sesamettha uttānameva. Kupitatā, na mokkhādhippāyatā,🔽upasampannassa talasattiuggiraṇanti imāni panettha tīṇi aṅgāni.

translated: They say that even if one becomes angry on seeing an animal, etc. defecating, etc., and then emits semen, one is still not aiming at emission.

original: 459. Chaṭṭhaṃ uttānatthameva. Upasampannatā, saṅghādisesassa amūlakatā, anuddhaṃsanā, taṅkhaṇavijānanāti imāni panettha cattāri aṅgāni.

translated: And here the words “both sides” and “the first pair of ancestors” show that he is free from the defect of his source, since he is praised as one whose line of ancestors is pure;🔽the words “unblamed” show that he is free from the defect of his action, since it is by the defect of his action that beings come to be despised;
