original: paṭiccā”ti vuttattā. “Pāṇātipātādi viya nivāsanadoso lokagarahito na hotīti paṇṇattivajja”nti
analyzed: paṭicca ati vutta ttā pāṇa atipāta ādi viya nivāsana doso lokaga rahitaḥ na hoti iti paṇṇatti vajjanti
translated: “Because of disrespect” is said. “The fault of wearing the sarong is not censured in the world as is the case with killing breathing things, and so on. Therefore it is a mere offence of wrong-doing,”

original: phussadevatthero āha. Upatissatthero pana “yasmā anādariyavaseneva āpajjitabbattā
analyzed: phussadeva ttheraḥ āha upatissa ttheraḥ pana yasmai anādariya vasena iva āpajjitabba ttā
translated: said the Elder Phussadeva. But the Elder Upatissa said: “Because it must be committed only through disrespect,

original: kevalaṃ akusalameva, tañca pakatiyā vajjaṃ, sañcicca vītikkamanañca domanassitasseva
analyzed: kevalam akusalam eva tat ca pakatiyā vajjam sañcid ca vītikkamanañca domanassitassa iva
translated: it is unwholesome only, and that is a fault by nature. And the transgression of the rule is only for one who is displeased.🔽Therefore it is a mere offence of wrong-doing, and the mind is unwholesome, and the feeling is painful.”

original: hoti, tasmā lokavajjaṃ akusalacittaṃ dukkhavedana”nti āha. Anādariyaṃ, anāpattikāraṇābhāvo,
analyzed: hoti tasmā lokavajjam akusala cittam dukkha vedanam ti āha anādariyam anāpatti kāraṇa abhāvaḥ
translated: “Disrespect,” “absence of a reason for non-offence,”

original: aparimaṇḍalanivāsananti imāni panettha tīṇi aṅgāni. Yathā cettha, evaṃ sabbattha
analyzed: aparimaṇḍala nivāsananti imāni pana ittha tīṇi aṅgāni yathā ca ittha evam sabbattha
translated: “wearing the sarong without tucking it in properly”: these are the three factors here. And as here, so in all the following rules.

original: purimāni dve tattha tattha vuttapaṭipakkhakaraṇañcāti tīṇiyeva honti.
analyzed: purimāni dve tattha tattha vutta paṭipakkha karaṇam ca ati honti
translated: The first two and the doing of the opposite of what is stated there are the three.

original: 577. Dutiyādīsu anekappakāraṃ gihipārutanti setapaṭapārutaṃ paribbājakapārutaṃ ekasāṭakapārutantiādi
analyzed: dutiya ādīsu aneka ppakāram gihi pārutanti seta paṭa pārutam paribbājaka pārutam eka sāṭaka pāruta nti ādi
translated: In the second and the rest, “covered with many kinds of lay-people’s clothes” means covered with white cloth, covered with the robes of wanderers of other religions, covered with a single piece of cloth, and so on.

original: anekappabhedaṃ gihipārutaṃ. Tassattho khandhakeyeva āvi bhavissati. Vihārepīti buddhupaṭṭhānādikālaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: aneka ppabhedam gihi pārutam tassa atthaḥ khandhake iva āvi bhavissati vihāre pi iti buddha upaṭṭhāna ādi kālam sandhāya vuttam
translated: The meaning of this will become clear in the Khandhaka. “In a monastery” is said with reference to the time of attending on the Buddha, and so on.

original: 578. “Suppaṭicchanno”ti vuttattā “sasīsaṃ pāruto sabbathā suppaṭicchannattā suppaṭicchanno nāma hotī”ti yassa siyā, taṃ sandhāyāha “na sasīsaṃ pārutenā”tiādi.
analyzed: suppaṭicchannaḥ ti vutta ttā sa sīsam pāruto sabbathā suppaṭicchanna ttā suppaṭicchannaḥ nāma hoti iti yassa siyā tam sandhāya āha na sa sīsam pārutena atiādi
translated: Since it is said “well covered,” if anyone should think “one who is covered from head to foot is called well covered because of being completely covered,” he is referring to that when he says “not with what covers the head,” and so on.

original: 582. Ekasmiṃ pana ṭhāne ṭhatvāti ettha “gacchantopi parissayābhāvaṃ oloketuṃ labhatiyeva, tathā gāme pūja”nti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ekasmim pana ṭhāne ṭhatvā ati ettha gacchantaḥ api parissaya abhāvam oloketum labhatiyā iva tathā gāme pūjanti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: “Standing in one place” here is said in the three key terms: “one who is going may look for the absence of danger in the same way, and so in the village.”

original: Parimaṇḍalavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Ujjagghikavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: parimaṇḍala vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  ujjagghika vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Parimaṇḍala vagga is finished.🔽The commentary on the Ujjagghika vagga

original: 586. Dutiyavagge hasanīyasmiṃ vatthusminti hāsajanake kāraṇe.
analyzed: dutiya vagge hasanīyasmin vatthusmin ti hāsa janake kāraṇe
translated: In the second vagga, “in a laughable matter” means in a reason for laughter.

original: Ujjagghikavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Khambhakatavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ujjagghika vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  khambhakata vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Ujjagghikavagga is finished.🔽The Khambhakatavagga

original: 603. Tatiyavagge patte saññā pattasaññā, sā assa atthīti pattasaññī, attano bhājane
analyzed: tatiya vagge patte saññā patta saññā sā assa atthi iti patta saññī attanaḥ bhājane
translated: In the third vagga, in the first two terms, “bowl” is a bowl for eating; “perception of a bowl” is the perception of that as one’s own.🔽The meaning is that he is one who is attached to his own bowl.

original: upanibandhasaññī hutvāti attho. Byañjanaṃ pana anādiyitvā atthamattameva dassetuṃ
analyzed: upanibandha saññī hutvā iti atthaḥ byañjanam pana an ādiyitvā attha mattam eva dassetuṃ
translated: But in order to show the meaning without regard for the letter,

original: “patte saññaṃ katvā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: patte saññam katvā iti vuttam
translated: it is said, “having made perception of a bowl.”🔽Without salt: a kind of condiment.🔽Some say, “Any pure condiment such as kañjikataṇḍula, etc.”

original: 604. Oloṇīti ekā byañjanavikati. “Yo koci suddho kañjikatakkādirasao”ti keci. Sākasūpeyya-ggahaṇena🔽yā kāci sūpeyyasākehi katā byañjanavikati vuttā. Maṃsarasādīnīti ādi-saddena avasesā
analyzed: ekā  yā kāci vuttā maṃsa rasa ādīni iti ādi saddena avasesā
translated: By the phrase “with vegetables and sauces”🔽any kind of condiment made with vegetables and sauces is meant.🔽By the word “etc.,” in “meat-juice, etc.,” it should be understood that all the rest are included.

original: sabbāpi byañjanavikati saṅgahitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Teneva mātikāṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ “ṭhapetvā
analyzed: sabbā api saṅgahitā iti daṭṭhabbam tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam ṭhapetvā
translated: That is why it is said in the commentary on the mātikā:

original: pana sūpaṃ avasesā sabbāpi sūpeyyā byañjanavikati rasaraso nāma hotī”ti.
analyzed: pana sūpam avasesā sabbā api sūpeyyā byañjana vikati rasarasaḥ nāma hoti iti
translated: “But apart from soup, any other kind of vegetable and sauce is called meat-juice.”

original: 605. Samapuṇṇanti adhiṭṭhānupagassa pattassa antomukhavaṭṭilekhaṃ anatikkāmetvā racitaṃ.
analyzed: sama puṇṇam ti adhiṭṭhāna upagassa pattassa antar mukha vaṭṭi lekham an atikkāmetvā racitam
translated: Filled level: heaped up without exceeding the rim of the bowl.

original: Samabharitanti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Phalāphalādīti ādi-saddena odanādimpi saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: sama bharitanti tassa iva vevacanam phala a phala ādi iti ādi saddena odana ādim pi saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The words ‘heaped up’ are a synonym for that. ‘With fruit, etc.’: the word ‘etc.’ includes boiled rice, etc.

original: Heṭṭhā orohatīti samantā okāsasabbhāvato cāliyamānaṃ heṭṭhā bhassati. Matthake thūpīkataṃ
analyzed: heṭṭhā orohati iti samantā okāsa sabbhāvataḥ cāliyamānam heṭṭhā bhassati matthake thūpīkatam
translated: ‘It trickles down below’: it trickles down below all round because of the lack of a suitable place. ‘It is heaped up in the bowl’

original: pūvameva vaṭaṃsakasadisattā “pūvavaṭaṃsaka”nti vuttaṃ. Pupphavaṭaṃsakādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: pūvam eva vaṭaṃsaka sadisa ttā pūva vaṭaṃsakanti vuttam puppha vaṭaṃsaka ādīsu pi esā iva nayo
translated: means that it is heaped up in the bowl. ‘Cake’ is called ‘pūva’ because it is like a vaṭa fruit. The same method applies in the case of ‘flower-cake,’ etc.

original: Yasmā “samatittiko piṇḍapāto paṭiggahetabbo”ti vacanaṃ piṇḍapāto sampuṇṇo paṭiggahetabboti
analyzed: yasmai sama tittikaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ paṭiggahetabbo ti vacanam piṇḍapātaḥ sampuṇṇaḥ paṭiggahetabbo ti
translated: Since the statement ‘alms food should be received in the right measure’ shows that alms food should be received when it is full,

original: dīpeti, tasmā attano hatthagate patte piṇḍapāto diyyamāno thūpīkatopi ce hoti, vaṭṭatīti🔽dīpeti. “Thūpīkataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti hi vacanaṃ paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: dīpeti tasmai attanaḥ hattha gate patte piṇḍapātaḥ diyyamānaḥ thūpīkataḥ api ce hoti vaṭṭati iti  dīpeti thūpīkatam piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa ati hi vacanam paṭhamam
translated: it shows that when alms food is being given into the bowl in one’s hand, it is allowable even if it is heaped up.

original: thūpīkataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ pacchā paṭiggaṇhato āpattīti dīpeti. “Patte paṭiggaṇhato ca
analyzed: thūpīkatam piṇḍapātam pacchā paṭiggaṇhato āpatti iti dīpeti patte paṭiggaṇhato ca
translated: For the statement ‘There is an offence of wrong-doing if he receives alms food heaped up’ shows that there is an offence for one who first receives alms food that is not heaped up and then receives more when it is heaped up.

original: thūpīkataṃ hoti, vaṭṭati athūpīkatassa paṭiggahitattā, payogo pana natthi aññatra
analyzed: thūpīkatam hoti vaṭṭati a thūpīkatassa paṭiggahita ttā payogaḥ pana natthi aññatra
translated: And if it is heaped up when he receives it into the bowl, it is allowable because what is not heaped up has been received. But there is no use in🔽receiving it if it is not going to be eaten.

original: pubbadesā”ti kenaci vuttaṃ, taṃ na sārato paccetabbaṃ. “Na thūpīkataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ🔽paṭiggaṇhātī”ti vacanaṃ paṭhamaṃ thūpīkatasseva pacchā paṭiggaṇhanaṃ dīpeti. Na hi🔽hatthagatepi patte diyyamānaṃ thūpīkataṃ gaṇhanto thūpīkataṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paṭiggaṇhanto
analyzed: pubba desā ti kenacid vuttam tam na sārataḥ paccetabbam na thūpīkatam piṇḍapātam  paṭiggaṇhāti iti vacanam paṭhamam thūpīkatassa iva pacchā paṭiggaṇhanam dīpeti na hi  hattha gate api patte diyyamānam thūpīkatam gaṇhantaḥ thūpīkatam piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhantaḥ
translated: and he should not accept it as authoritative. The words, “He does not accept almsfood that has been assigned to a particular monk” show that he should accept it only after it has been assigned to him. For if he were to accept it before it has been assigned to him, then, even if it were to be given to him after it has been assigned, he would be accepting almsfood that has been assigned to a particular monk.

original: nāma na hoti, na ca tena samatittiko piṇḍapāto paṭiggahitoti sakkā viññātuṃ. “Thūpīkata”nti
analyzed: nāma na hoti na ca tena sama tittikaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ paṭiggahito ti sakkā viññātum thūpīkatam ti
translated: “The eastern countries” is not to be taken literally. The words “He does not accept almsfood that has been assigned to a particular bhikkhu” indicate that he accepts only what is given after it has been assigned. For if he were to accept what has been assigned while it is still in the bowl, he would not be “one who does not accept almsfood that has been assigned.” Nor could it be known that he has accepted almsfood sufficient for his needs.

original: ca bhāvanapuṃsakaniddese gayhamāne ayamattho suṭṭhutaraṃ pākaṭoyevāti.
analyzed: ca bhāva napuṃsaka niddese gayhamāne ayam attho suṭṭhutaram
translated: And when the word thūpīkata is taken as a neuter noun in the sense of “having made a shrine,” the meaning is even clearer.

original: Khambhakatavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khambhakata vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Khambhakatavagga is finished.

original: 4. Sakkaccavaggavaṇṇanā
translated: The Sakkaccavagga

original: 608. Catutthavagge sapadānanti ettha dānaṃ vuccati avakhaṇḍanaṃ, apetaṃ dānato apadānaṃ,
analyzed: catuttha vagge sa padānam ti ettha dānam vuccati avakhaṇḍanam apetam dānataḥ apadānam
translated: In the fourth vagga, the word sapadāna is derived as follows: dāna means “not to cut off”; the opposite of that is apadāna,

original: anavakhaṇḍananti attho. Saha apadānena sapadānaṃ, avakhaṇḍanavirahitaṃ, anupaṭipāṭiyāti
analyzed: an avakhaṇḍanam ti saha apadānena sa padānam avakhaṇḍana virahitam anupaṭipāṭiyā ti
translated: the meaning is “not cutting off.” With apadāna is sapadāna, which is without not cutting off, without interruption.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Tenāha “tattha tattha odhiṃ akatvā anupaṭipāṭiyā”ti.
analyzed: vuttam hoti tena āha tattha tattha odhim a katvā anupaṭipāṭiyā iti
translated: is what is meant. Hence it was said above: “without regard to the order of sequence here and there.”

original: 611. Yasmiṃ samaye “pāṇo na hantabbo”ti rājāno bheriṃ carāpenti, ayaṃ māghātasamayo
analyzed: yasmin samaye pāṇaḥ na hantabbaḥ uti rājānaḥ bherim ayam māghāta samayaḥ
translated: The time of non-offence is when kings have a proclamation made with the beating of drums: “No living beings are to be killed.”

original: nāma. Idha anāpattiyaṃ gilāno na āgato, tasmā gilānassapi āpatti. Sūpodanaviññattisikkhāpade🔽asañcicca assatiyāti ettha “mukhe pakkhipitvā puna vippaṭisārī hutvā chaḍḍentassa🔽aruciyā pavisante ‘asañciccā’ti vuccati, viññattimpi aviññattimpi etasmiṃ ṭhāne ṭhitaṃ
analyzed: nāma idha anāpattiyam gilānaḥ na āgataḥ tasmā gilānassa api āpatti sūpodana viññatti sikkhāpade  a sañcicca assatiyā ti ettha mukhe pakkhipitvā puna vippaṭisārī hutvā chaḍḍentassa  aruciyā pavisante vuccati viññattim pi a viññattim pi etasmim ṭhāne ṭhitam
translated: Here the sick man is not included in the non-offence, so there is an offence for the sick man too. In the training rule on asking for curry and rice,🔽“without minding” and “unaware”: it is said in the three Commentaries on the three passages, “If he puts it in his mouth and then, being remorseful, throws it away,

original: sahasā gahetvā bhuñjante ‘assatiyā’ti vuccatī”ti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sahasā gahetvā bhuñjante assatiyā ati vuccati iti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: it is called ‘without minding.’ If he asks for it or does not ask for it, and then, being heedless, he takes it and eats it, it is called ‘unaware.’ ”

original: 614-615. Ujjhāne saññā ujjhānasaññā, sā assa atthīti ujjhānasaññī. “Mayūraṇḍaṃ atimahanta”nti
analyzed: ujjhāne saññā ujjhāna saññā sā assa atthi iti ujjhāna saññī mayūraṇḍam
translated: . “Disparaging” is disparaging perception; he has that, thus he is one who disparages;

original: vacanato mayūraṇḍappamāṇo kabaḷo na vaṭṭati. Keci pana “mayūraṇḍato mahanto na vaṭṭatī”ti
analyzed: vacanataḥ mayūraṇḍa ppamāṇaḥ kabaḷaḥ na vaṭṭati keci pana mayūraṇḍataḥ mahantaḥ na vaṭṭati iti
translated: because of the words “a peacock’s egg is too big,” a morsel the size of a peacock’s egg is not allowable. But some say that what is bigger than a peacock’s egg is not allowable.

original: vadanti, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ, “nātimahanta”nti ca atimahantasseva paṭikkhittattā khuddake
analyzed: vadanti tam na gahetabbam na ati mahantam ti ca ati mahantassa iva paṭikkhitta ttā khuddake
translated: If they say, “It is not too big,” it should not be accepted. And because “too big” is prohibited, there is no offense for a small one.

original: āpatti na dissati. “Mayūraṇḍaṃ atimahantaṃ, kukkuṭaṇḍaṃ atikhuddakaṃ, tesaṃ vemajjhappamāṇo”ti
analyzed: āpatti na dissati mayūra aṇḍam ati mahantam kukkuṭaṇḍam ati khuddakam tesam vemajjha ppamāṇaḥ ti
translated: “A peacock’s egg is too big, a hen’s egg is too small. The right size is in between.”

original: iminā pana sāruppavasena khuddakampi paṭikkhipitvā paricchedo na dassitoti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: iminā pana sāruppa vasena khuddakam pi paṭikkhipitvā paricchedaḥ na dassito ti veditabbam
translated: But it should be understood that the right size is not shown by prohibiting a small one, since this is done by way of what is suitable.

original: Sakkaccavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sakkacca vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the fifth sub-chapter is finished.

original: 5. Kabaḷavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kabaḷa vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The sub-chapter on mouthfuls

original: 618. Pañcamavagge sabbaṃ hatthanti ettha hattha-saddo tadekadesesu aṅgulīsu daṭṭhabbo🔽“hatthamuddā”tiādīsu viya, samudāye pavattavohārassa avayavepi vattanato ekaṅgulimpi
analyzed: pañcama vagge sabbam hattham ti ettha hattha saddo tad ekadesesu aṅgulīsu daṭṭhabbo  hattha muddā ati ādīsu viya samudāye pavatta vohārassa avayave pi vattanataḥ eka aṅgulim pi
translated: In the passage beginning “All in the hand,” the word “hand” should be taken to refer to the fingers, which are part of the hand,🔽just as in such passages as “hand-clapping.”

original: mukhe pakkhipituṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: mukhe pakkhipitum na vaṭṭati
translated: For a convention that applies to a whole applies also to its parts. So it is not allowable to put even a single finger in the mouth.

original: Kabaḷavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kabaḷa vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the sub-chapter on mouthfuls is finished.

original: 6. Surusuruvaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: suru suru vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The sub-chapter on slurping

original: 627. Chaṭṭhavagge sītīkatoti sītaṭṭo, sītapīḷitoti vuttaṃ hoti. Silakabuddhoti parihāsavacanametaṃ. Silakañhi kañci disvā “buddho aya”nti voharanti.
analyzed: chaṭṭha vagge sītīkato ti sītaṭṭaḥ sīta pīḷito ti vuttam hoti silaka buddhaḥ iti parihāsa vacanam etam silakam hi kañci disvā buddhaḥ ayanti voharanti
translated: In the sixth section, “With a cold seat” : the seat is cold, that is, it is cold-natured, it is cold-to-the-touch. “With a straw Buddha” : this is a term of contempt. For when they see a straw man they say, “This is a Buddha.”

original: 634. Vilīvacchattanti veṇuvilīvehi kataṃ chattaṃ. Tatthajātakadaṇḍakena katanti tālapaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: vilīva chattanti veṇu vilīvehi katam chattam tattha jātaka daṇḍakena katanti tāla paṇṇam
translated: “With a bamboo-leaf sunshade” : a sunshade made of bamboo leaves. “With a sunshade made of a palm-leaf” : a sunshade made of a palm leaf.

original: saha daṇḍakena chinditvā tameva chattadaṇḍaṃ karonti gopālakādayo viya, taṃ sandhāyetaṃ
analyzed: saha daṇḍakena chinditvā tam eva chatta daṇḍam karonti gopālaka ādayaḥ tam sandhāya itam
translated: They cut the palm leaf together with the stalk and make it into a sunshade, as cowherds, etc., do. That is what is meant.

original: vuttaṃ. Chattapādukāya vā ṭhitaṃ hotīti ettha chattapādukā vuccati chattādhāro. Yasmiṃ
analyzed: vuttam chatta pādukāya vā ṭhitam hoti iti ettha chatta pādukā vuccati chatta ādhāraḥ yasmin
translated: Or it may be standing on a sunshade stand. Herein, a sunshade stand is what is called a sunshade stand.

original: chattaṃ apatamānaṃ katvā ṭhapenti, tādisikāya chattapādukāya ṭhitaṃ chattaṃ “chatta”nti
analyzed: chattam a patamānam katvā ṭhapenti tādisikāya chatta pādukāya ṭhitam chattam chattanti
translated: In it they place a sunshade so that it does not fall down. The sunshade should be taken as “sunshade”

original: ajjhāharitabbaṃ. “Chattaṃ chattapādukāya ṭhita”ntipi paṭhanti, tatthāpi ayamevattho.
analyzed: ajjhāharitabbam chattam chatta pādukāya paṭhanti tattha api ayam eva atthaḥ
translated: or “sunshade standing on a sunshade stand.” They also read “chattapādukāya ṭhitaṃ hotī” . Here too the meaning is the same.

original: 637. Cāpoti majjhe vaṅkā kācadaṇḍasadisā dhanuvikati. Kodaṇḍoti vaṭṭaladaṇḍā dhanuvikati. Paṭimukkanti pavesitaṃ laggitaṃ.
analyzed: cāpā iti majjhe vaṅkā kāca daṇḍa sadisā dhanu vikati kodaṇḍo ti vaṭṭala daṇḍā dhanu vikati paṭimukkam ti pavesitam laggitam
translated: Cāpo: the middle of the bow, like a bamboo stick, a bow-length. Kodaṇḍa: the handle of the bow, a bow-length. Paṭimukka: inserted, stuck.

original: Surusuruvaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.

analyzed: sākhāya sākham ambam olokentaḥ vicari tassa tathā karontassa iva ratti vibhāyi so

analyzed: cintesi sace idāni otaritvā gamissāmi disvā mam cora iti gahessanti ratti bhāge gamissāmi iti  atha ekam viṭapam abhiruhitvā nilīnaḥ acchi tam sandhāya itam vuttam saḥ rukkhataḥ otarantaḥ
translated: He thought, “If I come down and go now, they will see me and arrest me, thinking I am a thief. I will go at night.”🔽So he climbed up into a tree and remained hidden. That is why it is said. As he was coming down from the tree,

original: ekaṃ olambinisākhaṃ gahetvā tesaṃ ubhinnampi antare patiṭṭhāsi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ
analyzed: ekam olambi nisākham gahetvā tesam ubhinnam pi antare patiṭṭhāsi tam sandhāya vuttam
translated: he grabbed a branch that was hanging down and remained there between the two. That is why it is said.

original: “tesaṃ dvinnampi antarā rukkhato patito”ti. Pāḷiyā atthaṃ na jānantīti attano gahaṇassa atthaṃ na jānanti.
analyzed: tesam dvinnam pi antarā rukkhato patitoti pāḷiyāḥ attham na jānanti iti attanaḥ gahaṇassa attham na jānanti
translated: They do not know the meaning of the text: they do not know the meaning of their own interpretation.

original: Jātakapāḷiyaṃ pana ayaṃ gāthā –
analyzed: jātakapāḷiyam pana ayam gāthā
translated: But the verse in the Jataka Commentary is as follows:🔽All this is done in vain:

analyzed: sabbam idam carimam katam ubho dhammam na passare

translated: He who recites the mantras and

analyzed: yaḥ ca mantam adhīyati iti  evam āgatā tassa ayam atthaḥ sabbam idam carimam katanti yam amhehi tīhi janehi katam
translated: He who studies the mantras.🔽This is how it is found. Its meaning is this: All this is done in vain,

original: mantesu agāravaṃ garahitvā puna itare dveyeva garahanto “ubho dhammaṃ na passare”tiādimāha.
analyzed: mantesu agāravam garahitvā punar itare garahantaḥ ubho dhammam na passara iti ādim āha

analyzed: tattha ubho ti ime dve api janāḥ garukāra araham porāṇaka dhammam na passanti tatas va dhamma pakatito
translated: Herein, both: these two people do not see the ancient Dhamma worthy of reverence. Therefore they have fallen

original: cutā. Dhammo hi paṭhamuppattivasena pakati nāma. Vuttampi cetaṃ –
analyzed: cutā dhammo hi paṭhama uppatti vasena pakati nāma
translated: from the Dhamma. For the Dhamma is called “nature” in the sense of original occurrence. And this is said:

original: “Dhammo have pāturahosi pubbe,
analyzed: dhammaḥ have pāturahosi pubbe
translated: “The Dhamma appeared in the world first,

original: Pacchā adhammo udapādi loke”ti. ;
analyzed: pacchā adhammaḥ udapādi loke iti
translated: And afterwards the world appeared in the Dhamma.”

original: Yo cāyanti yo ca ayaṃ nīce nisīditvā mante ajjhāpeti, yo ca ucce nisīditvā adhīyatīti.
analyzed: yaḥ ca āyanti yaḥ ca ayam nīce nisīditvā mante ajjhāpeti yaḥ ca ucce nisīditvā adhīyati iti
translated: The one who recites the mantras while sitting lower and the one who listens to them while sitting higher.

original: Sālīnanti ayaṃ gāthāpi –
analyzed: ayam gāthā api
translated: “Rice” : this verse is found in the Jataka:

original: “Sālīnaṃ odanaṃ bhuñje, suciṃ maṃsūpasecanaṃ;
analyzed: sālīnam odanam bhuñje sucim maṃsūpasecanam
translated: “I eat rice boiled in milk, Pure, with meat as relish;

original: Tasmā etaṃ na sevāmi, dhammaṃ isīhi sevita”nti. –
analyzed: tasmai etam na sevāmi dhammam isīhi
translated: Therefore I do not serve it, The Dhamma served by the seers.”

original: Evaṃ jātake āgatā. Tattha sucinti paṇḍaraṃ parisuddhaṃ. Maṃsūpasecananti nānappakārāya maṃsavikatiyā sittaṃ bhuñje, bhuñjāmīti attho. Sesaṃ pākaṭameva.🔽Dhiratthūti dhi atthu, nindā bhavatūti attho, garahāma taṃ mayanti vuttaṃ hoti. Laddhalābhoti
analyzed: evam jātake āgatā tattha sucinti paṇḍaram parisuddham maṃsūpasecanam ti nānappakārāya maṃsa vikatiyā sittam bhuñje bhuñjāmi iti attho sesam pākaṭam eva  dhiḥ atthu iti dhi atthu nindā bhavatu iti atthaḥ garahāma tam mayan ti vuttam hoti laddha lābhaḥ iti
translated: Here “pure” means white and clean. “With meat as relish” means I eat it mixed with various kinds of meat. The rest is clear.🔽“Fie on it” : “Fie” means blame. “Fie on it” means “We blame it.” “Gain” :

original: dhanalābhaṃ yasalābhañca sandhāya vadati. Vinipātanahetunāti vinipātanassa hetubhāvena.
analyzed: dhana lābham yasa lābham ca sandhāya vadati vinipātana hetunā ati vinipātanassa hetu bhāvena
translated: he speaks with reference to the gain of wealth and the gain of fame. “Cause of downfall” : as the cause of downfall.

original: Vutti nāma hotīti yathāvutto duvidhopi lābho apāyasaṃvattanikatāya samparāye vinipātanahetubhāvena
analyzed: nāma hoti iti yathā vuttaḥ duvidhaḥ api lābhaḥ samparāye vinipātana hetu bhāvena
translated: “A living” means that both kinds of gain mentioned are a living in that they lead to an unhappy destination in the next world by being a cause for rebirth there,

original: pavattanato sampati adhammacaraṇena pavattanato ca vutti nāma hotīti attho. Evarūpā
analyzed: pavattanato sampati adhamma caraṇena pavattanato ca vutti nāma hoti iti attho evarūpā
translated: and in the present existence they are a living in that they occur through the practice of the wrong way.

original: yā vuttīti evarūpā dhanalābhayasalābhasaṅkhātā yā vutti. Adhammacaraṇena vāti vā-saddo
analyzed: yā vutti iti evarūpā dhana lābha yasa lābha saṅkhātā yā vutti adhamma caraṇena vā ati vā saddaḥ
translated: “Such a living” means such a living consisting in gain of wealth and gain of fame.🔽“Through the practice of the wrong way” : the word vā is in the sense of “inclusive” .

original: sampiṇḍanattho. Tvanti upayogatthe paccattavacanaṃ, taṃ icceva vā pāṭho. Asmāti pāsāṇādhivacanametaṃ.
analyzed: sampiṇḍana tthaḥ upayoga tthe paccatta vacanam tam iti ca iva vā pāṭhaḥ pāsāṇa adhivacanam etam
translated: “That” is a pronoun in the sense of an object of use; or the reading may be taṃ icceva .🔽“This” is a word for a stone.

original: Pādukavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pāduka vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sandals sub-chapter is finished.

original: Sesaṃ uttānameva.
analyzed: sesam uttānam eva
translated: The rest is clear.

original: Sekhiyakaṇḍaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: sekhiya kaṇḍam niṭṭhitam
translated: The chapter on training is finished.

original: Adhikaraṇasamathesu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ āgataṭṭhāneyeva dassayissāma.
analyzed: adhikaraṇa samathesu yat vattabbam tat aṭṭhakathāyam āgata ṭṭhāne iva dassayissāma
translated: As for the settling of legal issues, we shall show what should be said about them in the commentary on the relevant passages.

original: Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ
analyzed: iti samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: Thus in the commentary on the Discipline called Paramatthadipani,

analyzed: bhikkhu vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Analysis of offenses for monks is finished.

original: Mahāvibhaṅgo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: mahāvibhaṅgaḥ niṭṭhito

analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One

translated: The Chapter on the Nuns’ Pārājika Offenses

analyzed: paṭhama pārājika sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā
translated: The first Pārājika training rule

original: 656. Bhikkhunīvibhaṅge yoti yo bhikkhunīnaṃ vibhaṅgo. Migāranattāti majjhapadalopenetaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhunī vibhaṅge yaḥ ti yaḥ bhikkhunīnam vibhaṅgaḥ migāranattā ati majjha pada lopena itam
translated: In the Bhikkhunis’ Analysis: the analysis of the nuns. The daughter of Migara: this is said with omission of the middle term.

original: vuttanti āha “migāramātuyā pana nattā hotī”ti. Migāramātāti visākhāyetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam ti āha migāra mātuyā pana nattā hoti iti migāra mātā ati adhivacanam
translated: He said: “But she was the daughter of Migara’s mother.” The mother of Migara is a designation for Visakha.

original: Navakammādhiṭṭhāyikanti navakammasaṃvidhāyikaṃ. Byañjanānaṃ paṭivijjhitabbo ākāro
analyzed: nava kamma adhiṭṭhāyikam ti nava kamma saṃvidhāyikam byañjanānam paṭivijjhitabbaḥ ākāraḥ
translated: The supervisor of the building work: the one who arranged the building work. The form of the text should be penetrated by the letters.

original: nātigambhīro, yathāsutaṃ dhāraṇameva tattha karaṇīyanti satiyā byāpāro adhiko, paññā
analyzed: na ati gambhīraḥ yathāsutam dhāraṇam eva tattha karaṇīyanti satiyā byāpāraḥ adhikaḥ paññā
translated: It is not too deep. The function there is just to remember what has been heard. The function of mindfulness is predominant there.

original: tattha guṇībhūtāti vuttaṃ “satipubbaṅgamāya paññāyā”ti. Sati pubbaṅgamā etissāti
analyzed: tattha guṇībhūtā iti vuttam sati pubbaṅgamāya paññāya ati sati pubbaṅgamā etissa ati
translated: Understanding is subordinate there. Therefore it is said: “With understanding preceded by mindfulness.”

original: satipubbaṅgamā. Pubbaṅgamatā cettha padhānabhāvo “manopubbaṅgamā”tiādīsu viya. Atthaggahaṇe
analyzed: sati pubbaṅgamā pubbaṅgama tā ca ittha padhāna bhāvaḥ manaḥ pubbaṅgamā ati ādīsu viya attha ggahaṇe
translated: Preceded by mindfulness: preceded by mindfulness. Here the state of being preceded is the state of being predominant, as in such passages as “Mind precedes thoughts” . In the apprehension of the meaning

original: pana paññāya byāpāro adhiko paṭivijjhitabbassa atthassa atigambhīrattāti āha “paññāpubbaṅgamāya
analyzed: pana paññāya byāpāraḥ adhikaḥ paṭivijjhitabbassa atthassa ati gambhīra ttā ti āha paññā pubbaṅgamāya
translated: That is why he said “with understanding foremost” .🔽Free from idleness : free from laziness.

original: satiyā”ti. Ālasiyavirahitāti kosajjarahitā. Yathā aññā kusītā nisinnaṭṭhāne nisinnāva
analyzed: satiyā ati ālasiya virahitā ati kosajja rahitā yathā aññā kusītā nisinna ṭṭhāne nisinnā ava
translated: Just as others, being lazy, sit down where they should stand,

original: honti, ṭhitaṭṭhāne ṭhitāva, evaṃ ahutvā vipphārikena cittena sabbakiccaṃ nipphādeti.
analyzed: honti ṭhita ṭṭhāne evam a hutvā vipphārikena cittena sabba kiccam nipphādeti
translated: and stand where they should sit, she does not do so, but accomplishes all her duties with a mind that is expansive.

original: Sabbā bhikkhuniyo satthuladdhūpasampadā saṅghato laddhūpasampadāti duvidhā. Garudhammapaaggahaṇena
analyzed: sabbāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ satthu laddhu upasampadā saṅghataḥ laddhu upasampadā ti duvidhāḥ garu dhamma pa aggahaṇena
translated: All the bhikkhunis are of two kinds: those who have received the full admission from the Teacher and those who have received the full admission from the Sangha.

original: hi laddhūpasampadā mahāpajāpatigotamī satthusantikāva laddhūpasampadattā satthuladdhūpasampadā
analyzed: hi laddhu upasampadā mahāpajāpati gotamī satthu santikā ava laddhu upasampadattā satthu laddhu upasampadā
translated: For Mahapajapati Gotami, who received the full admission by the acceptance of the eight important rules, received the full admission from the Teacher himself.🔽Therefore she is called one who has received the full admission from the Teacher.🔽All the others have received the full admission from the Sangha.

original: nāma. Sesā sabbāpi saṅghato laddhūpasampadā. Tāpi ekatoupasampannā ubhatoupasampannāti
analyzed: nāma sesā sabbā api saṅghataḥ laddha upasampadā tā api ekatas upasampannā ubhatas upasampannā ati
translated: They too are of two kinds: those who have received the full admission once-only and those who have received it twice.

original: duvidhā. Tattha yā tā mahāpajāpatigotamiyā saddhiṃ nikkhantā pañcasatā sākiyāniyo,
analyzed: duvidhā tattha yā tā mahāpajāpati gotamiyā saddhim nikkhantā pañca satā
translated: Herein, those who went forth with Mahapajapati Gotami were the five hundred Sakyan women.

original: tā ekatoupasampannā bhikkhusaṅghato eva laddhūpasampadattā, itarā ubhatoupasampannā
analyzed: tāḥ ekatoupasampannāḥ bhikkhu saṅghataḥ eva laddha upasampadattāḥ itarāḥ ubhatoupasampannā
translated: They are called “one-sangha-entrant” because they have received their full admission from the bhikkhu sangha alone. The other is called “both-sangha-entrant”

original: ubhatosaṅghe upasampannattā. Ehibhikkhunībhāvena upasampannā pana bhikkhuniyo na
analyzed: ubhatosaṅghe upasampanna ttā ehibhikkhunī bhāvena upasampannāḥ pana bhikkhuniyaḥ na
translated: because she has received her full admission from both sanghas. But there are no bhikkhunis who have received their full admission by the “Come, bhikkhuni!” ordination,

original: santi tāsaṃ tathā upasampadāya abhāvato. Yadi evaṃ “ehi bhikkhunī”ti idha kasmā vuttanti?
analyzed: santi tāsam tathā upasampadāya abhāvataḥ yadi evam ehi bhikkhuni iti idha kasmā vuttan ti
translated: because there is no such ordination for them. If that is so, why is it said here, “Come, bhikkhuni!”?

original: Desanāya sotapatitabhāvato. Ayañhi sotapatitatā nāma katthaci labbhamānassapi aggahaṇena🔽hoti, yathā abhidhamme manodhātuniddese labbhamānampi jhānaṅgaṃ pañcaviññāṇasote
analyzed: desanāya sotapatita bhāvataḥ ayam hi sotapatita tā nāma katthaci labbhamānassa api aggahaṇena  hoti yathā abhidhamme manaḥ dhātu niddese labbhamānam pi jhāna aṅgam pañca viññāṇa sote
translated: Because the teaching has entered their ears. For this “entry into the ears” is found in some cases by the non-mention of what is possible,🔽as in the case of the jhana factors, which are not mentioned in the description of the mind element in the Abhidhamma though they are possible in the five doors of consciousness,

original: patitāya na uddhaṭaṃ katthaci desanāya asambhavato, yathā tattheva vatthuniddese
analyzed: patitāya na uddhaṭam katthaci desanāya asambhavataḥ yathā tattha iva vatthu niddese
translated: and in some cases by the mention of what is impossible, as in the case of the heart-basis in the description of the physical basis,

original: hadayavatthu. Katthaci alabbhamānassapi gahaṇavasena yathāṭhitakappīniddese. Yathāha –
analyzed: hadaya vatthu katthaci alabbhamānassa api gahaṇa vasena yathā ṭhitakappīniddese yathā āha
translated: and in some cases by the mention of what is possible, as in the case of the “one who is steadied in what is possible” in the description of the “one who is steadied in what is possible” . For it is said:

original: “Katamo ca puggalo ṭhitakappī? Ayañca puggalo sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo ṭhita kappī ayam ca puggalo sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipanno
translated: “What kind of person is one who is steadied in what is possible? This person is one who is practising for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: assa, kappassa ca uḍḍayhanavelā assa, neva tāva kappo uḍḍayheyya, yāvāyaṃ puggalo
analyzed: assa kappassa ca uḍḍayhana velā assa na iva tāva kappo uḍḍayheyya yāvā ayam puggalo
translated: and the aeon was about to break up, the aeon would not break up until🔽

original: na sotāpattiphalaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
analyzed: na sa utāpatti phalam sacchikareyyāti
translated: and the aeon were about to end, still the aeon would not end before this person had realized the fruit of stream-entry.”

original: Evamidhāpi alabbhamānagahaṇavasena veditabbaṃ. Parikappavacanañhetaṃ “sace bhagavā bhikkhunībhāvayogyaṃ kañci mātugāmaṃ ‘ehi bhikkhunī’ti vadeyya, evaṃ bhikkhunībhāvo siyā”ti.
analyzed: evam idha api alabbhamāna gahaṇa vasena veditabbam parikappa vacanam ha etam sace bhagavā bhikkhunī bhāva yogyam kañci mātugāmam ehi bhikkhuni iti vadeyya evam bhikkhunī bhāvaḥ siyā ti
translated: So too here, it should be understood, the meaning is that it is not possible to take it. It is a hypothetical statement: “If the Blessed One were to say ‘Come, bhikkhunī’ to any woman of the kind fit for the bhikkhunī state, the bhikkhunī state would come into being.”🔽But why did the Blessed One not do so? Because there were none who had performed the duties requisite for that.

original: Kasmā pana bhagavā evaṃ na kathesīti? Tathā katādhikārānaṃ abhāvato. Ye pana “anāsannāsannihitabhāvato”ti
analyzed: kasmai pana bhagavā evam na kathesi iti tathā abhāvataḥ ye pana anāsanna asannihita bhāvataḥ ti
translated: But those who give the reason as “because they were not near at hand”

original: kāraṇaṃ vatvā “bhikkhū eva hi satthu āsannacārino sadā sannihitā ca honti, tasmā
analyzed: kāraṇam vatvā bhikkhū eva hi satthu āsanna cārinaḥ sadā sannihitā ca honti tasmā
translated: and say that “only the bhikkhus were near to the Master and always at hand,🔽so they were worthy to be told ‘Come, bhikkhus,’ but not the bhikkhunīs”

original: te eva ‘ehibhikkhū’ti vattabbataṃ arahanti, na bhikkhuniyo”ti vadanti, taṃ tesaṃ
analyzed: te eva ehi bhikkhu iti vattabbatam arahanti na bhikkhuniyaḥ ti vadanti tam tesam

translated: In the tenth, ‘a legitimate ending of the robe season’ is when a lay follower who wants to give non-staple robe-cloth to all the bhikkhunīs gives them either more or the same as the value of the robe-cloth he has received.

original: samaggena bhikkhunisaṅghena yaṃ kathinaṃ ñattidutiyena kammena antarā uddharīyati,
analyzed: samaggena bhikkhuni saṅghena yam kathinam ñatti dutiyena kammena antarā uddharīyati
translated: When the robe-making ceremony is ended by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, with the consent of the Sangha of monks,

original: tassa so uddhāro dhammikoti vuccati, evarūpaṃ kathinuddhāranti attho. Sesaṃ uttānatthameva.
analyzed: tassa so uddhāraḥ dhammiko ti vuccati evarūpam attho sesam uttānattham eva

original: Naggavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nagga vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā

original: 932. Tuvaṭṭavagge sabbaṃ uttānameva.
analyzed: tu va ṭṭa vagge sabbam uttānam eva
translated: In the section on the six kinds of origin, all the terms are clear in meaning.

original: 5. Cittāgāravaggavaṇṇanā🔽978. Cittāgāravaggassa paṭhame kīḷanaupavananti antonagare ṭhitaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ,
analyzed: cittāgāra vagga vaṇṇanā  cittāgāra vaggassa paṭhame kīḷanaupavanam ti antar nagare ṭhitam sandhāya vuttam
translated: The explanation of the Cittāgāra group🔽In the first of the Cittāgāra group, the “pleasure park” is within the town.🔽The “pleasure grove” is outside the town. “An offense entailing confession for each turning of the head”:

original: kīḷanuyyānanti bahinagare ṭhitaṃ sandhāya. Pāṭekkā āpattiyoti gīvāya parivaṭṭanappayogagaṇanāya
analyzed: kīḷan uyyāna nti bahi nagare ṭhitam sandhāya pāṭekkā āpattiyā iti gīvāya parivaṭṭana ppayoga gaṇanāya
translated: The offense is counted according to the number of times one turns one’s neck, not according to the number of times one looks.

original: āpattiyo, na ummīlanagaṇanāya. “Ajjhārāme rājāgārādīni karonti, tāni passantiyā anāpattī”ti
analyzed: āpattiyaḥ na ummīlana gaṇanāya ajjhārāme rāja āgāra ādīni karonti tāni passantiyāḥ anāpatti iti

original: vacanato “antoārāme tattha tattha gantvā naccādīni passituṃ labhatī”tipi siddhaṃ.
analyzed: vacanataḥ antoārāme tattha tattha gantvā nacca ādīni passitum siddham
translated: From this it’s also allowed to go here and there within the monastery and see the dancing and so on.

original: 982. Dutiyādīni uttānatthāneva.
analyzed: dutiya ādīni uttāna tthāna eva
translated: The second and following cases are clear in meaning.

original: 1015. Navame hatthiādīsu sippa-saddo paccekaṃ yojetabbo, tathā āthabbaṇādīsu manta-saddo.🔽Tattha āthabbaṇamanto nāma āthabbaṇavedavihito parūpaghātakaro manto, khīlanamanto🔽nāma dārusārakhīlaṃ mantetvā pathaviyaṃ pavesetvā māraṇamanto, agadappayogo visayojanaṃ.🔽Nāgamaṇḍalanti sappānaṃ pavesanivāraṇatthaṃ maṇḍalabaddhamanto.🔽1018. Dasamaṃ uttānatthameva.
analyzed: navame hatthi ādīsu sippa saddo paccekam yojetabbo tathā āthabbaṇa ādīsu manta saddo  tattha āthabbaṇa mantaḥ nāma āthabbaṇa veda vihito para upaghāta karaḥ mantaḥ khīlana manto  nāma dārusārakhīlam mantetvā pathaviyam pavesetvā māraṇa mantaḥ agada ppayogaḥ visa yojanam  nāga maṇḍalanti sappānam pavesa nivāraṇa attham maṇḍala baddham antar  dasamam uttānattham eva
translated: In the ninth, the word “craft” should be construed separately with each of the terms beginning with “elephant craft”; and likewise the word “spell” with each of the terms beginning with “spell for summoning.”

original: Cittāgāravaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽1021. Ārāmavagge sabbaṃ uttānatthameva.🔽1067. Gabbhinivaggepi sabbaṃ suviññeyyameva.🔽8. Kumāribhūtavaggavaṇṇanā🔽1119. Kumāribhūtavaggassa paṭhame sabbapaṭhamā dve mahāsikkhamānāti gabbhinivagge🔽sabbapaṭhamaṃ vuttā dve sikkhamānā. Sikkhamānā icceva vattabbāti sammutikammādīsu
analyzed: cittāgāra vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽ārāma vagge sabbam uttāna attham eva 🔽gabbhini vagge pi sabbam su viññeyyam eva 🔽kumāri bhūta vagga vaṇṇanā 🔽kumāri bhūta vaggassa paṭhame sabba paṭhamā dve mahāsikkhamānā ati gabbhini vagge 🔽sabba paṭhamam vuttā dve sikkhamānā sikkhamānā icca eva vattabbā ati sammuti kamma ādīsu
translated: Herein, a spell for summoning is a spell recited according to the rules of the science of summoning spirits that is used for harming others. A spell for killing is a spell for killing by burying an image of the victim under a cross-road or in his house after making an effigy of him with clay from a ant-hill, and so on. A spell for administering poison is a spell for administering poison to someone by reciting the spell over the poison. A spell for making someone fall in love is a spell for making someone fall in love by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over water and giving it to him to drink. A spell for making someone invisible is a spell for making someone invisible by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and giving it to him to wear. A spell for making someone lose his wits is a spell for making someone lose his wits by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and giving it to him to wear. A spell for making someone impotent is a spell for making someone impotent by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and giving it to him to wear. A spell for making someone’s mouth gape open is a spell for making someone’s mouth gape open by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and touching his mouth with it. A spell for making someone’s tongue stick out is a spell for making someone’s tongue stick out by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and touching his tongue with it. A spell for making someone’s head fall off is a spell for making someone’s head fall off by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and touching his head with it. A spell for making someone’s eyes fall out is a spell for making someone’s eyes fall out by reciting a spell over a charm of twisted darbha grass or over a charm of twisted thread and touching his eyes with it. A spell for making someone’s limbs wither is a spell for making someone’s limbs wither by reciting

original: evaṃ vattabbā. Gihigatāti vā kumāribhūtāti vā na vattabbāti sace vadanti, kammaṃ
analyzed: evam vattabbā gihi gatā ati vā kumāri bhūtā ati vā na vattabbā ati sace vadanti kammam
translated: If they say, “She is not to be spoken to as a female householder or a female trainee,” then the legal issue is resolved.

original: kuppatīti adhippāyo. Ito paraṃ navamapariyosānaṃ uttānatthameva.
analyzed: kuppati iti adhippāyaḥ itas param navama pariyosānam uttāna attham eva

original: 1163. Dasame apubbasamuṭṭhānasīsanti paṭhamapārājikasamuṭṭhānādīsu terasasu samuṭṭhānesu🔽ananuññātasamuṭṭhānaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tañhi ito pubbe tādisassa samuṭṭhānasīsassa
analyzed: dasame paṭhama pārājika samuṭṭhāna ādīsu terasasu samuṭṭhānesu  ananuññāta samuṭṭhānam sandhāya vuttam tat hi itas pubbe tādisassa samuṭṭhāna sīsassa
translated: In the tenth, “the head of a legal issue that has not arisen before”: among the thirteen heads of legal issues, beginning with the first offense entailing expulsion,🔽it is the head of a legal issue that has not been sanctioned that is referred to. Because that has not arisen before,

original: anāgatattā “apubbasamuṭṭhānasīsa”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: anāgata ttā apubba samuṭṭhāna sīsam ti vuttam
translated: it is called “the head of a legal issue that has not arisen before.”

original: 1166. Ekādasamādīni uttānatthāneva.
analyzed: ekādasama ādīni
translated: The meaning of the eleventh and the following is clear.

original: Kumāribhūtavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kumāri bhūta vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the sub-chapter on unmarried girls is finished.

original: 9. Chattupāhanavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: chattupāhana vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals

analyzed: chattupāhana vaggassa ekādasame upacāram sandhāya ati samantā dvādasa hattha upacāram sandhāya sesam sabbattha uttānam eva
translated: In the eleventh, “the vicinity”: the vicinity of twelve hand spans all around. The rest is clear in all cases.

original: Chattupāhanavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: chattupāhana vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals is finished.

original: Giraggasamajjādīni acittakāni lokavajjānīti vuttattā naccanti vā vaṇṇakanti vā ajānitvāva
analyzed: giragga samajja ādīni acittakāni loka vajjāni iti vutta ttā naccanti vā vaṇṇakanti vā a jānitvā ava
translated: Since it is said that “the drinking of alcohol is a natural offense that is committed without awareness,”

original: passantiyā vā nahāyantiyā vā āpattisambhavato vatthuajānanacittena acittakāni, naccanti
analyzed: passantiyāḥ vā nahāyantiyāḥ vā āpatti sambhavataḥ vatthu a jānana cittena acittakāni naccanti
translated: Since there is an offence for one who sees or bathes, the offences are “unintentional” because of the ignorance of the subject-matter.

original: vā vaṇṇakanti vā jānitvā passantiyā vā nahāyantiyā vā akusaleneva āpajjanato lokavajjānīti
analyzed: vā vaṇṇakanti vā jānitvā passantiyā vā nahāyantiyā vā akusalena iva āpajjanataḥ lokavajjāni iti
translated: Since there is an offence only through the unwholesome, the offences are “indecent” because of the seeing or bathing after knowing the beauty or the lust.

original: veditabbāni. Corīvuṭṭhāpanādīni corītiādinā vatthuṃ jānitvā karaṇe eva āpattisambhavato
analyzed: veditabbāni corī vuṭṭhāpana ādīni corī iti ādinā vatthum jānitvā karaṇe eva āpatti sambhavato

original: sacittakāni, upasampadādīnaṃ ekantaakusalacitteneva akattabbattā paṇṇattivajjāni.
analyzed: sa cittakāni upasampad ādīnam ekanta akusala cittena iva a kattabba ttā paṇṇatti vajjāni
translated: and they are “offences of wrongdoing” because of the fact that they are not to be done only through a wholly unwholesome consciousness.

original: “Idha sacittakācittakatā paṇṇattijānanājānanatāya aggahetvā vatthujānanājānanatāya
analyzed: idha sa cittakā acittaka tā paṇṇatti jānanā jānana tāya aggahetvā vatthu jānanā jānana tāya
translated: “Here, the intentional and unintentional should be taken not by way of knowing or not knowing the rule,

original: gahetabbā”ti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Sesamettha uttānatthameva.
analyzed: gahetabbā ti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam sesam ettha uttānattham eva
translated: but by way of knowing or not knowing the subject-matter” is said in the three passages in the Thread. The rest of the meaning here is evident.

original: Bhikkhunīvibhaṅge khuddakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhikkhunī vibhaṅge khuddaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Minor (Class) in the Bhikkhunī Vibhaṅga is finished.

analyzed: pāṭidesanīya sikkhāpada vaṇṇanā

original: 1228. Pāṭidesanīyā nāma ye aṭṭha dhammā saṅkhepeneva saṅgahaṃ āruḷhāti sambandho. Pāḷivinimuttakesūti pāḷiyaṃ anāgatesu sappiādīsu.

original: Pāṭidesanīyasikkhāpadavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.

analyzed: pāṭidesanīya kaṇḍam niṭṭhitam
translated: The chapter on offenses entailing confession is finished.

original: Ye pana pañcasattati sekhiyā dhammā uddiṭṭhā, ye ca tesaṃ anantarā sattādhikaraṇavhayā
analyzed: ye pana pañcasattati sekhiyāḥ dhammāḥ uddiṭṭhāḥ ye ca tesam anantarā satta adhikaraṇa vhayā

analyzed: dhammāḥ uddiṭṭhā ati sambandhaḥ tattha tesanti tesam satta adhikaraṇa vhayā ti

analyzed: sattā adhikaraṇa samatha saṅkhātā tam attha vinicchayam tādisaṃyā iva yasmai vidū vadanti iti
translated: are called “the seven principles for settling legal issues”. The meaning is that the wise explain the discernment of the meaning of that in the same way.

analyzed: yathā niṭṭhitā iti sambandho sabba āsava paham magganti sabba āsava vighātakam arahatta maggam

analyzed: patvā sa santāne uppādetvā passantu nibbutin ti magga ñāṇa locanena nibbānam sacchikarontu

original: pappontūti vā pāṭho. Tattha nibbutinti khandhaparinibbānaṃ gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: pappontu iti vā pāṭhaḥ tattha nibbutim ti khandha parinibbānam gahetabbam
translated: or the reading is pappontū. Herein, “extinguished” should be taken as the extinction of the aggregates.

original: Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ.
analyzed: iti samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: So much for the commentary on the Vinaya text, which is a commentary on the Sāratthapakāsinī,

analyzed: bhikkhunī vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā

original: Pācittiyavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pācittiya vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā

original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa

original: Mahāvagga-ṭīkā

original: 1. Mahākhandhakaṃ
analyzed: mahākhandhakam
translated: The Great Chapter

original: Bodhikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: bodhi kathā vaṇṇanā

analyzed: pātimokkhānam ti ubhinnam pātimokkha vibhaṅgānam pātimokkha ggahaṇena ha ittha tesam

analyzed: vibhaṅgaḥ abhedena gahitaḥ yam khandhakam saṅgāyiṃsu iti sambandhaḥ khandhānam samūhaḥ
translated: is included here without distinction. The connection is: “the chapter that they compiled.” The collection🔽of chapters

analyzed: khandhakaḥ khandhānam vā pakāsanataḥ dīpanataḥ khandhakaḥ khandhā ati ca ittha pabbajja upasampad ādi vinaya kamma saṅkhātā
translated: The chapter is so called because it is the revealing, the illuminating, of the aggregates. Herein, the aggregates are intended as the determinations called the legal questions of ordination, full admission, etc.,

analyzed: cāritta vāritta sikkhāpada saṅkhātā ca paññattiyaḥ adhippetā pabbajja ādīni hi bhagavatā  paññatta ttā pañattiyo ti vuccanti paññattiyam ca khandha saddo dissati dāru kkhandho
translated: and the training precepts called the rules and the prohibitions. For the determinations called ordination, etc., are called “determinations” because they are determined by the Blessed One.🔽And the word “aggregate” is found used for a determination, as in the passages, “a log-aggregate” , “a fire-aggregate” ,

original: aggikkhandho”tiādīsu viya. Apica bhāgarāsaṭṭhatāpettha yujjatiyeva tāsaṃ paññattīnaṃ🔽bhāgato rāsito ca vibhattattā. Khandhakovidāti paññattibhāgarāsaṭṭhavasena khandhaṭṭhe kovidā.
analyzed: aggi kkhandha uti ādīsu api ca tāsam paññattīnam  bhāgataḥ ca vibhatta ttā khandha kovidā ti paññatti bhāga rāsaṭṭha vasena khandha aṭṭhe kovidā
translated: and so on. Besides, the meaning of a portion, a heap, is appropriate here too, since those determinations are distributed by portions and by heaps.🔽Skilled in the aggregates: skilled in the meaning of the aggregates by way of the determinations, the portions, and the heaps.

original: Padabhājanīye yesaṃ padānaṃ atthā yehi aṭṭhakathānayehi pakāsitāti yojetabbaṃ. Te

translated: The meaning of the words of which has been explained below, if I were to explain it again,

analyzed: nipātaḥ tasmai abhisambodhitaḥ pacchā ati evamattho gahetabbaḥ kho ti pada pūraṇe nipātaḥ  satta ahāni sattāham upayoga vacanam yasmai bhagavā tam sattāham

This is a statement of instrumentality in the sense of extreme intimacy.🔽Since the Blessed One lived for seven days without interruption in the bliss of fruition attainment,

original: nirantaratāya accantameva phalasamāpattisukhena vihāsi, tasmā “sattāha”nti accantasaṃyogavasena
analyzed: nirantara tāya accantam eva phala samāpatti sukhena vihāsi
translated: it is said “for seven days” in the sense of extreme intimacy.

original: upayogavacanaṃ vuttaṃ. Ekapallaṅkenāti visākhapuṇṇamāya anatthaṅgateyeva sūriye aparājitapallaṅkavasena

translated: The words “with one sitting” are said. “With one sitting” means that, on the full-moon day of the month of Visakha, before the sun has set, he sits down cross-legged on the unconquered seat.

original: vajirāsane nisinnakālato paṭṭhāya sakimpi anuṭṭhahitvā yathābhujitena ekeneva pallaṅkena.🔽Vimuttisukhapaṭisaṃvedīti ettha tadaṅgavikkhambhanasamucchedapaṭippassaddhinissaraṇavimuttīsu🔽pañcasu paṭippassaddhivimuttisaṅkhātā bhagavato phalavimutti adhippetāti āha “vimuttisukhaṃ
analyzed: vajirāsane nisinna kālataḥ paṭṭhāya sa kimpi anuṭṭhahitvā yathā bhujitena ekena iva pallaṅkena  vimutti sukha paṭisaṃvedi iti ettha tad aṅga vikkhambhana samuccheda paṭippassaddhi nissaraṇa vimuttīsu  pañcasu paṭippassaddhi vimutti saṅkhātā bhagavataḥ phala vimutti adhippetā iti āha vimutti sukham
translated: The word “enjoying” is said in the sense of using. “On a single couch”: from the time of sitting down on the invincible seat in the manner of the invincible seat on the full-moon night of the month of Visakha, before the sun has set, without rising from that very couch, with the same legs crossed, the same hands in the same position, the same bodily posture, and the same mindfulness.🔽“Experiencing the bliss of liberation”: here, among the five kinds of liberation, namely, the liberation consisting in the abandoning of the hindrances, the liberation consisting in the surmounting of form, etc., the liberation consisting in the destruction of the taints, the liberation consisting in the crossing over of doubt, and the liberation consisting in the crossing over of all suffering,

original: phalasamāpattisukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedayamāno”ti. Vimuttīti ca upakkilesehi paṭippassaddhivasena🔽cittassa vimuttabhāvo, cittameva vā tathā vimuttaṃ veditabbaṃ. Tāya vimuttiyā jātaṃ,
analyzed: phala samāpatti sukham paṭisaṃvedayamānaḥ iti vimutti iti ca upakkilesehi paṭippassaddhi vasena  cittassa vimutta bhāvo cittam eva vā tathā vimuttam veditabbam tāya vimuttiyā jātam
translated: the Blessed One’s liberation, which is called the liberation consisting in the crossing over of all suffering, is intended. Therefore it is said: “experiencing the bliss of liberation, the bliss of the attainment of fruition.”

original: sampayuttaṃ vā sukhaṃ vimuttisukhaṃ. “Yāyaṃ, bhante, upekkhā sante sukhe vuttā bhagavatā”ti
analyzed: sampayuttam vā sukham vimutti sukham yā ayam bhante upekkhā sante sukhe vuttā bhagavatā ati
translated: And “liberation” is the liberated state of the mind by way of the crossing over of defilements, or the mind itself should be understood as liberated in that way. The bliss that arises from that liberation, or that is associated with it, is the bliss of liberation. “That equanimity, venerable sir, which the Blessed One described as peaceful and sublime” .

original: vacanato upekkhāpi cettha sukhamicceva veditabbā. Tathā hi vuttaṃ sammohavinodaniyaṃ
analyzed: vacanato upekkhā api ca ittha sukham icca eva veditabbā tathā hi vuttam sammoha vinodaniyam
translated: “But equanimity is called pleasure because it is peace” .

analyzed: upekkhā pana santattā sukham icca iva bhāsitā ati bhagavā hi catuttha jhānikam arahatta phala samāpattim
translated: For the Exalted One enters upon the attainment of the fruition of arahantship based on the fourth jhāna, not on any other jhāna.

original: samāpajjati, na itaraṃ. Atha vā “tesaṃ vūpasamo sukho”tiādīsu yathā saṅkhāradukkhavūpasamo🔽“sukho”ti vuccati, evaṃ sakalakilesadukkhūpasamabhāvato aggaphale labbhamānā paṭippassaddhivimutti
analyzed: samāpajjati na itaram atha vā tesam vūpasamaḥ sukhaḥ ti ādīsu yathā saṅkhāra dukkha vūpasamaḥ  sukhaḥ ti vuccati evam sakala kilesa dukkha upasama bhāvataḥ agga phale labbhamānā paṭippassaddhi vimutti
translated: Or alternatively, just as the stilling of the pain of formations is called “pleasure” in such passages as “The stilling of the formations is bliss” ,

original: eva idha “sukha”nti veditabbā.🔽Athāti adhikāratthe nipāto, khoti padapūraṇe. Tesu adhikāratthena “athā”ti iminā
analyzed: eva idha sukhanti veditabbā  atha ati adhikāra atthe nipātaḥ kha iti pada pūraṇe tesu adhikāra atthena atha ati iminā
translated: so the supreme fruit, which is the deliverance consisting in the complete subsiding of all the suffering of defilements, should be understood as “pleasure” here.🔽Now: the particle now is in the sense of a topic; the word kho is a pleonastic particle. Of these, by the word now he shows a topic other than the experiencing of the bliss of deliverance.

original: vimuttisukhapaṭisaṃvedanato aññaṃ adhikāraṃ dasseti. Ko panesoti? Paṭiccasamauppādamanasikāro.

original: Rattiyāti avayavasambandhe sāmivacanaṃ. Paṭhamanti accantasaṃyogatthe upayogavacanaṃ.

analyzed: bhagavā hi tassā rattiyā sakalam pi paṭhamam yāmam tena iva manasikārena yuttaḥ ahosi iti
translated: For the Blessed One was occupied with that same thought for the whole of the first watch of the night.🔽“Conditioned by” : by the states that are conditions, such as ignorance, etc.

original: Paccayākāranti avijjādipaccayadhammaṃ. Paṭiccāti paṭimukhaṃ gantvā, kāraṇasāmaggiṃ🔽apaṭikkhipitvāti attho. Paṭimukhagamanañca paccayassa kāraṇasāmaggiyā aṅgabhāvena
analyzed: paccaya ākāram ti avijjā ādi paccaya dhammam paṭicca ati paṭimukham gantvā kāraṇa sāmaggim  a paṭikkhipitvā ti attho paṭimukha gamanam ca paccayassa kāraṇa sāmaggiyā aṅga bhāvena
translated: “Having gone to” : having gone to the front, without rejecting the concurrence of the causes.

original: phalassa uppādanameva. Apaṭikkhipitvāti pana vinā tāya kāraṇasāmaggiyā aṅgabhāvaṃ🔽agantvā sayameva na uppādetīti attho. Etena kāraṇabahutā dassitā. Avijjādiekekahetusīsena
analyzed: phalassa uppādanam eva a paṭikkhipitvā ati pana vinā tāya kāraṇa sāmaggiyā aṅga bhāvam  a gantvā sayam eva na uppādeti iti atthaḥ etena kāraṇa bahu tā dassitā avijjā ādi eka eka hetu sīsena
translated: The meaning is: without rejecting. And the going to the front is the production of the effect by the condition as a factor in the concurrence of the causes.🔽“Without rejecting” means: without going as a factor in the concurrence of the causes, it does not produce by itself. original: hi hetusamūho niddiṭṭho. Sahiteti samudite, avinibbhutteti attho. Avijjādiko hi paccayadhammo
analyzed: hi hetu samūhaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ sahita iti samudite a vinibbhutta iti atthaḥ avijjā ādikaḥ hi paccaya dhammaḥ
translated: “Combined” : collected, the meaning is: without being separated. For a condition such as ignorance, etc.,

original: sahiteyeva aññamaññaṃ avinibbhogavuttidhamme uppādeti. Iminā paccayuppannadhammabahutā
analyzed: sahitā iya iva aññam aññam a vinibbhoga vutti dhamme uppādeti iminā paccaya uppanna dhamma bahu tā
translated: produces the states that arise combined, without being separated from each other. This shows the plurality of the states that arise as conditions.

original: dassitā. Ubhayenapi “ekaṃ na ekato”tiādinayo dīpito hoti. Ekato hi kāraṇato na idha
analyzed: dassitāḥ ubhayena api ekam na ekatas iti ādi nayaḥ dīpitaḥ hoti ekatas hi kāraṇataḥ na idha
translated: By both of these the method beginning with “not one from one” is shown. For not from one cause here

original: kiñci ekaṃ phalamatthi, na anekaṃ, nāpi anekehi kāraṇehi ekaṃ, anekehi pana kāraṇehi🔽anekameva hoti. Tathā hi anekehi utupathavībījasalilasaṅkhātehi kāraṇehi anekameva
analyzed: kiñci ekam phalam atthi na anekam na api anekehi kāraṇehi ekam anekehi pana kāraṇehi  anekam eva tathā hi anekehi utu pathavī bīja salila saṅkhātehi kāraṇehi anekam eva
translated: There is no single effect produced by a single cause, nor is there a single cause producing several effects.🔽But many effects are produced by many causes.

original: rūpagandharasādiaṅkurasaṅkhātaṃ phalamuppajjamānaṃ dissati. Yaṃ panetaṃ “avijjāpaccayā
analyzed: rūpa gandha rasa ādi aṅkura saṅkhātam phalam uppajjamānam dissati yam pana etam avijjā paccayā

original: saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇa”nti ekekahetuphaladīpanaṃ kataṃ, tattha payojanaṃ na vijjati.
