analyzed: ratta ṭṭhānehi lohita rasmiyaḥ nikkhamiṃsu yāsam vasena cīna piṭṭha cuṇṇa rañjitā
translated: and the directions were suffused with their glow as if they were sprinkled with red lac dye,

original: viya supakkalākhārasanisiñcamānā viya rattakambalaparikkhittā viya jayasumanapāribaddhakabandhujīvakakusumasamparikiṇṇā
analyzed: viya su pakkala ākhā rasa nisiñcamānā viya ratta kambala parikkhittā viya jaya sumana pāribaddhaka bandhujīvaka kusuma samparikiṇṇā
translated: as if covered with a red blanket, as if strewn with red bandhujīvaka and kusuma flowers bound with jasmine flowers,

original: viya ca virociṃsu. Aṭṭhīhi ceva dantehi ca akkhīnañca setaṭṭhānehi odātarasmiyo nikkhamiṃsu,
analyzed: viya ca virociṃsu aṭṭhīhi ca iva dantehi ca akkhīnam ca seta ṭṭhānehi odāta rasmiyaḥ nikkhamiṃsu
translated: and they shone. From the bones and teeth and from the white parts of the eyes white rays issued forth,🔽and the directions were suffused with their glow as if sprinkled with streams of milk flowing from silver pitchers,

original: yāsaṃ vasena disābhāgā rajatakuṭehi āsiñcamānakhīradhārāsamparikiṇṇā viya pasāritarajatapaṭavitānā
analyzed: yāsam vasena disā bhāgā rajata kuṭehi āsiñcamāna khīra dhārā samparikiṇṇā viya pasārita rajata paṭa vitānā
translated: as if covered with a spread of silver cloth,

original: viya vītipatantarajatatālavaṇṭā viya kundakumudasindhuvārasumanamallikādikusumasañchannā
analyzed: viya kunda kumuda sindhuvāra sumana mallikā ādi kusuma sañchannā
translated: as if surrounded by silver palm trees, as if strewn with flowers such as jasmine, blue lotuses, white lotuses, and water lilies,

original: viya ca virociṃsu. Mañjiṭṭhapabhassarā pana tamhā tamhā sarīrappadesā nikkhamiṃsu.
analyzed: ca virociṃsu mañjiṭṭha pabhassarā pana tamhā tamhā sarīra ppadesā nikkhamiṃsu
translated: and they shone. The rays of the sun’s light issued forth from all parts of the body.

original: Iti tā chabbaṇṇarasmiyo nikkhamitvā ghanamahāpathaviṃ gaṇhiṃsu.
analyzed: iti tāḥ chabbaṇṇa rasmiyaḥ nikkhamitvā ghana mahā pathavim gaṇhiṃsu
translated: So the six-coloured rays came out and seized the solid earth.

original: “Catunahutādhikadviyojanasatasahassabahalā mahāpathavī niddhantasuvaṇṇapiṇḍi viya
analyzed: mahā pathavī viya
translated: The great earth, which is two hundred and forty thousand leagues thick, became like a lump of molten gold.

original: ahosi. Pathaviṃ bhinditvā heṭṭhā udakaṃ gaṇhiṃsu. Pathavīsandhārakaṃ aṭṭhanahutādhikacatuyojanasatasahassabahalaṃ
analyzed: ahosi pathavim bhinditvā heṭṭhā udakam gaṇhiṃsu pathavī sandhārakam aṭṭhana huta adhika catu yojana sata sahassa bahalam
translated: Having pierced through the earth, they seized the water beneath. The water, which is four hundred and eighty thousand leagues thick and supports the earth,

original: udakaṃ suvaṇṇakalasehi āsiñcamānavilīnasuvaṇṇaṃ viya ahosi. Udakaṃ vinivijjhitvā
analyzed: udakam suvaṇṇa kalasehi āsiñcamāna vilīna suvaṇṇam viya ahosi udakam vinivijjhitvā
translated: became like molten gold being poured into a golden basin. Having pierced through the water,

original: vātaṃ aggahesuṃ. Channavutādhikanavayojanasatasahassabahalo vāto samussitasuvaṇṇakkhandho
analyzed: vātam aggahesum channavuta adhika nava yojana sata sahassa bahalaḥ vātaḥ samussita suvaṇṇa kkhandhaḥ
translated: they seized the wind. The wind, which is nine hundred and sixty thousand leagues thick, became like a mass of piled-up gold.

original: viya ahosi. Vātaṃ vinivijjhitvā heṭṭhā ajaṭākāsaṃ pakkhandiṃsu. Uparibhāgena uggantvāpi🔽catumahārājike gaṇhiṃsu. Te vinivijjhitvā tāvatiṃse, tato yāme, tato tusite, tato
analyzed: viya ahosi vātam vinivijjhitvā heṭṭhā ajaṭā kāsam pakkhandiṃsu upari bhāgena uggantvā api  catu mahārājike gaṇhiṃsu te vinivijjhitvā tāvatiṃse tatas yāme tatas tusite tatas
translated: Having pierced through the wind, they went down into the space below. Having risen up above,

original: nimmānaratī, tato paranimmitavasavattī, tato nava brahmaloke, tato vehapphale, tato
analyzed: nimmāna ratī tatas para nimmita vasavattī tatas nava brahma loke tatas vehapphale tatas
translated: they seized the realm of the Four Kings. Having pierced through that, they seized the Thirty-three, then the Yāma gods, then the Tusita gods, then the gods who delight in creating, then the gods who wield power over others’ creations, then the nine Brahma-worlds, then the gods of the sphere of the infinity of space, then the gods of the sphere of the infinity of consciousness, then the gods of the sphere of nothingness, then the gods of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: pañca suddhāvāse vinivijjhitvā cattāro āruppe gaṇhiṃsu. Cattāro ca āruppe vinivijjhitvā
analyzed: pañca suddhāvāse vinivijjhitvā cattāraḥ āruppe gaṇhiṃsu cattāraḥ ca āruppe vinivijjhitvā
translated: and after piercing the five Pure Abodes they took the four Formless (Realms). And after piercing the four Formless (Realms)

original: ajaṭākāsaṃ pakkhandiṃsu.
analyzed: a jaṭā kāsam pakkhandiṃsu
translated: they went to the Ākaṃsa (Realm).

original: “Tiriyabhāgehi anantā lokadhātuyo pakkhandiṃsu, ettake ṭhāne candamhi candappabhā
analyzed: tiriya bhāgehi anantāḥ lokadhātuyaḥ pakkhandiṃsu ettake ṭhāne candamhi canda ppabhā
translated: “They went to infinite world systems beyond the Tiriya (Realm), and in that place there was no moon,

original: natthi, sūriye sūriyappabhā natthi, tārakarūpesu tārakarūpappabhā natthi, devatānaṃ
analyzed: natthi sūriye sūriya ppabhā natthi tāraka rūpesu tāraka rūpa ppabhā natthi devatānam
translated: no sun, no stars, no gods,

original: uyyānavimānakapparukkhesu sarīre ābharaṇesūti sabbattha pabhā natthi. Tisahassimahāsahassilokadhātuyā
analyzed: uyyāna vimāna kappa rukkhesu sarīre ābharaṇesu uti sabbattha pabhā natthi ti sahassi mahā sahassi lokadhātuyā
translated: no parks, no palaces, no wish-fulfilling trees, no ornaments, no light anywhere. In the Three-Thousand (Great Thousand) World System

original: ālokapharaṇasamattho mahābrahmāpi sūriyuggamane khajjopanako viya ahosi, candasūriyatārakarūpadevatuyyānavimānakapparukkhānaṃ
analyzed: āloka pharaṇa samatthaḥ mahābrahmā api sūri yuggamane khajjopanakaḥ viya ahosi canda sūriya tāraka rūpa deva tuyyāna vimāna kappa rukkhānam
translated: the Great Brahmā, who is able to pervade with light, was like a firefly at sunrise, and the moon, sun, stars, gods,

original: paricchedamattakameva paññāyittha. Ettakaṃ ṭhānaṃ buddharasmīhiyeva ajjhotthaṭaṃ
analyzed: pariccheda mattakam eva paññāyittha ettakam ṭhānam buddha rasmīhiyā iva ajjhotthaṭam
translated: parks, palaces, wish-fulfilling trees, and so on, were only known by their boundaries. That place was pervaded by the Buddha’s light

original: ahosi. Ayañca neva buddhānaṃ adhiṭṭhāniddhi, na bhāvanāmayiddhi. Saṇhasukhumadhammaṃ
analyzed: ahosi ayam ca na iva buddhānam na saṇha sukhuma dhammaṃ
translated: and it was not the psychic power of the Buddhas’ resolve, nor was it the psychic power of development. The subtle and fine Dhamma

original: pana sammasato lokanāthassa lohitaṃ pasīdi, vatthurūpaṃ pasīdi, chavivaṇṇo pasīdi.
analyzed: pana sammasataḥ lokanāthassa lohitam pasīdi vatthu rūpam pasīdi chavi vaṇṇo pasīdi
translated: but the blood of the Protector of the World became clear, the colour of the skin became clear, and the six sense-media became clear.

original: Cittasamuṭṭhānā vaṇṇadhātu samantā asītihatthamatte padese niccalā aṭṭhāsī”ti.🔽Evaṃ nisinneti tamhā samādhimhā vuṭṭhahitvā nisinne. Eko brāhmaṇoti nāmagottavasena
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānā vaṇṇa dhātu samantā asīti hattha matte padese niccalā aṭṭhāsi iti  evam nisinnā iti tamhā samādhimhā vuṭṭhahitvā nisinne ekaḥ nāma gotta vasena
translated: The colour element that arose from the mind stood still in the area of eighty cubits all around.”

original: anabhiññāto apākaṭo eko brāhmaṇo. “Huṃ hu”nti karonto vicaratīti sabbaṃ acokkhajātikaṃ
analyzed: an abhiññātaḥ apākaṭaḥ ekaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ hum hunti karontaḥ vicarati iti sabbam a cokkha jātikam
translated: Sitting thus: having arisen from that concentration, sitting. A certain brahmin: unknown, not famous, a certain brahmin. “Huṃ hu” making: seeing all that is not to be looked at,

original: passitvā jigucchanto “huṃ hu”nti karonto vicarati. Etadavocāti etaṃ idāni vattabbaṃ🔽“kittāvatā nu kho”tiādivacanaṃ avoca. Tattha kittāvatāti kittakena pamāṇena. Nu-ti
analyzed: passitvā jigucchantaḥ hum hunti karontaḥ vicarati etat avoca ati etam idāni vattabbam  kittāvatā nu kha iti ādi vacanam avoca tattha kittāvatā ati kittakena pamāṇena nu ti
translated: disgusted, he wanders about making “huṃ hu.” He said this: he said this speech that should be said now,

original: saṃsayatthe nipāto, kho-ti padapūraṇe. Bho-ti brāhmaṇānaṃ jātisamudāgataṃ ālapanaṃ.
analyzed: saṃsaya atthe nipātaḥ pada pūraṇe bhoti brāhmaṇānam jāti samudāgatam ālapanam
translated: “In what way?” etc. Herein, in what way: by what measure. Nu is a particle in the sense of doubt, kho is a particle for filling out the line. Bho is an address to brahmins that is born with them.

original: Tathā hi vuttaṃ “bhovādi nāma so hoti, sace hoti sakiñcano”ti. Gotamāti bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi vuttam bho vādi nāma saḥ hoti sace hoti gotama ati bhagavantam
translated: For this is said: “He is called bho, if he has something of his own.” Gotama: the Blessed One.

original: gottena ālapati. Kathaṃ panāyaṃ brāhmaṇo sampati samāgato bhagavato gottaṃ jānātīti?
analyzed: gottena ālapati katham pana ayam brāhmaṇaḥ sampati samāgataḥ bhagavataḥ gottam jānāti iti
translated: He addresses the Blessed One by his clan name. But how does this brahmin know the Blessed One’s clan name?

original: Nāyaṃ sampati samāgato, chabbassāni padhānakaraṇakāle upaṭṭhahantehi pañcavaggiyehi
analyzed: na ayam sampati samāgataḥ cha bassāni padhāna karaṇa kāle upaṭṭhahantehi pañcavaggiyehi
translated: He did not come on purpose. He was one of the group of five ascetics who attended on the Blessed One during his austerities for six years.

original: saddhiṃ caramāno aparabhāge taṃ vataṃ chaḍḍetvā uruvelāyaṃ senanigame eko adutiyo🔽hutvā piṇḍāya caramānopi tena brāhmaṇena diṭṭhapubbo ceva sallapitapubbo ca, tena
analyzed: saddhim caramānaḥ aparabhāge tam chaḍḍetvā uruvelāyam sena nigame ekaḥ adutiyaḥ  hutvā piṇḍāya caramānaḥ api tena brāhmaṇena diṭṭha pubbaḥ ca iva sallapita pubbaḥ ca tena
translated: Later, after the Blessed One had abandoned his austerities, he had gone forth in the town of Uruvelā, and he was living alone,🔽wandering and walking for alms in the town of Senānigama. He had seen the Blessed One before and had spoken to him.

original: so pubbe pañcavaggiyehi gayhamānaṃ bhagavato gottaṃ anussaranto “bho gotamā”ti bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: saḥ pubbe pañcavaggiyehi gayhamānam bhagavataḥ gottam anussarantaḥ bho gotama ati bhagavantam
translated: Therefore, remembering the Blessed One’s clan name, which he had heard from the group of five ascetics, he addressed the Blessed One with the words “Master Gotama.”

original: gottena ālapati. Yato paṭṭhāya vā bhagavā mahābhinikkhamanaṃ nikkhanto anomānadītīre
analyzed: gottena ālapati yatas paṭṭhāya vā bhagavā mahābhinikkhamanam nikkhantaḥ anomānadī tīre
translated: From the time the Blessed One went forth into homelessness on the banks of the river Nerañjarā,

original: pabbaji, tato pabhuti “samaṇo gotamo”ti cando viya sūriyo viya pākaṭo paññāto hoti,
analyzed: pabbaji tatas pabhuti samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ti candaḥ viya sūriyaḥ viya pākaṭaḥ paññātaḥ hoti
translated: he was well known and famous as the ascetic Gotama, as clear and radiant as the sun and moon,

original: na ca tassa gottajānane kāraṇaṃ gavesitabbaṃ. Brāhmaṇakaraṇāti brāhmaṇaṃ karontīti
analyzed: na ca tassa gotta jānane kāraṇam gavesitabbam brāhmaṇa karaṇā ati brāhmaṇam karonti iti
translated: and there is no need to look for a reason why he was known by his clan name. “They make a brahmin”: they make a brahmin.

original: brāhmaṇakaraṇā, brāhmaṇabhāvakarāti attho. Ettha ca “kittāvatā”ti etena yehi dhammehi
analyzed: brāhmaṇa karaṇā brāhmaṇa bhāva karā ati attho ettha ca kittāvatā ati etena yehi dhammehi
translated: the making of a brahmin, the causing of the state of a brahmin, is the meaning. And here, by “to what extent” he shows the extent of the state of a brahmin.

original: brāhmaṇo hoti, tesaṃ dhammānaṃ parimāṇaṃ pucchati. “Katame”ti pana iminā tesaṃ sarūpaṃ pucchati.🔽Udānaṃ udānesīti “yo brāhmaṇo”tiādikaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, na pana tassa brāhmaṇassa
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ hoti tesam dhammānam parimāṇam pucchati katamā iti pana iminā tesam sarūpam pucchati  udānam udānesi iti yaḥ brāhmaṇa uti ādikam udānam udānesi na pana tassa brāhmaṇassa
translated: The meaning is: the making of a brahmin, the becoming of a brahmin. And here, by “in what way” he asks about the measure of those things by which one becomes a brahmin. But by “what” he asks about their nature.🔽He uttered a solemn utterance: he uttered the solemn utterance beginning with “The brahmin who” , but he did not teach the Dhamma to that brahmin.

original: dhammaṃ desesi. Kasmā? Dhammadesanāya abhājanabhāvato. Tathā hi tassa brāhmaṇassa
analyzed: dhammam desesi kasmā dhamma desanāya abhājana bhāvato tathā hi tassa brāhmaṇassa
translated: Why not? Because he was not a fit vessel for the Dhamma teaching. For when that brahmin

original: imaṃ gāthaṃ sutvā na saccābhisamayo ahosi. Yathā ca imassa, evaṃ upakassa ājīvakassa
analyzed: imam gātham sutvā na sacca abhisamayaḥ ahosi yathā ca imassa evam upakassa ājīvakassa
translated: heard this stanza, he did not penetrate the truth. And just as in his case, so also in the case of Upaka the Ājīvaka

original: buddhaguṇappakāsanaṃ sutvā. Dhammacakkappavattanato hi pubbabhāge bhagavatā bhāsitaṃ
analyzed: buddha guṇa ppakāsanam sutvā dhammacakka ppavattanataḥ hi pubba bhāge bhagavatā bhāsitam
translated: when he heard the exposition of the Buddha’s special qualities. For before the setting in motion of the Wheel of the Dhamma, whatever was spoken by the Exalted One

original: paresaṃ suṇantānampi tapussabhallikānaṃ saraṇadānaṃ viya vāsanābhāgiyameva jātaṃ,
analyzed: paresam suṇantānam pi tapussa bhallikānam saraṇa dānam viya vāsanābhāgiyam eva jātam
translated: was only a preparation for the future, like the gift of refuge to Tapassu and Bhalluka by the other,🔽and not a preparation for the state of a non-learner or for penetration. This is the nature of things.

original: na asekkhabhāgiyaṃ vā nibbedhabhāgiyaṃ vā. Esā hi dhammatāti. Vedehi vā antanti ettha
analyzed: na asekkha bhāgiyam vā nibbedha bhāgiyam vā esā hi dhamma tā ati vedehi vā ettha
translated: In the passage “or to the end of the Vedas” ,

original: antaṃ nāma sabbasaṅkhārapariyosānaṃ nibbānaṃ. Ime ussadā natthīti sabbaso ime pahīnattā na santi.
analyzed: antam nāma sabba saṅkhāra pariyosānam nibbānam ime ussadāḥ natthi iti sabbaso ime pahīna ttāḥ na santi
translated: “End” is Nibbāna, the end of all formations. “These are not” means that they do not exist at all because they have been abandoned.

original: Ajapālakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ajapāla kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the story of Ajapāla is finished.

original: Mucalindakathāvaṇṇanā🔽5. Mucalindamūleti ettha mucalindo vuccati nīparukkho, yo “niculo”tipi vuccati, tassa
analyzed: mucalinda kathā vaṇṇanā  mucalinda mūle ti ettha mucalindaḥ vuccati nīpa rukkhaḥ yaḥ niculaḥ tipi vuccati tassa
translated: The explanation of the story of Mucalinda🔽“Mucalindamūla” means “at the foot of Mucalinda.” Here Mucalinda is a kind of tree called nicula.

original: samīpeti attho. Keci pana “mucaloti tassa rukkhassa nāmaṃ, vanajeṭṭhakatāya pana🔽mucalindoti vutta”nti vadanti. Udapādīti sakalacakkavāḷagabbhaṃ pūrento mahāmegho🔽udapādi. Evarūpo kira megho dvīsuyeva kālesu vassati cakkavattimhi vā uppanne buddhe
analyzed: samīpa iti attho keci pana mucalo ti tassa rukkhassa nāmam vana jeṭṭhaka tāya pana  mucalindaḥ iti vuttanti vadanti udapādi iti sakala cakkavāḷa gabbham pūrentaḥ mahā meghaḥ  udapādi evarūpaḥ kira meghaḥ dvīsu yeva kālesu vassati cakkavattimhi vā uppanne buddhe
translated: The meaning is “near that.” But some say that “mucala” is the name of that tree, and that it is called Mucalinda because it is the chief of the forest trees.🔽“A great cloud arose” means that a great cloud arose filling the whole womb of the world-sphere. Such a cloud, it seems, rains only on two occasions: when a Wheel-turning Monarch arises and when a Buddha arises. Here it arose on the occasion of the Buddha’s arising.

original: vā, idha buddhuppādakāle udapādi. Pokkharaṇiyā nibbattoti pokkharaṇiyā heṭṭhā nāgabhavanaṃ
analyzed: vā idha buddhuppāda kāle udapādi pokkharaṇiyā nibbatto ti pokkharaṇiyā heṭṭhā nāgabhavanam
translated: “Born in the lake” means that there is a nāga’s abode beneath the lake. He was born there.

original: atthi, tattha nibbatto. Sakabhavanāti attano nāgabhavanato. Evaṃ bhogehi parikkhipitvāti
analyzed: atthi tattha nibbattaḥ saka bhavanā ati attanaḥ nāga bhavanataḥ evam bhogehi parikkhipitvā ati
translated: “From his own abode” means from his own nāga abode. “So he surrounded him with his coils” means that he surrounded him with his coils and spread out his large hood above his head.

original: satta vāre attano sarīrabhogehi bhagavato kāyaṃ parivāretvā. Uparimuddhani mahantaṃ
analyzed: satta vāre attano sarīra bhogehi bhagavato kāyam parivāretvā upari muddhani mahantam
translated: and he surrounded the Blessed One’s body with his own body seven times.

original: phaṇaṃ vihaccāti bhagavato muddhappadesassa upari attano mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ pasāretvā.
analyzed: phaṇam vihacca ati bhagavataḥ muddhappadesassa upari attanaḥ mahantam phaṇam pasāretvā
translated: He spread out a great hood above his head: he extended a great hood above the Blessed One’s head.

original: “Phaṇaṃ karitvā”tipi pāṭho, soyevattho.
analyzed: phaṇam karitvā atipi pāṭhaḥ
translated: There is also the reading “having made a hood,” which has the same meaning.

original: Tassa kira nāgarājassa etadahosi “bhagavā ca mayhaṃ bhavanasamīpe rukkhamūle nisinno,
analyzed: tassa kira nāga rājassa etat ahosi bhagavā ca mayham bhavana samīpe rukkha mūle nisinno
translated: It seems that the thought occurred to the king of nāgas: “The Blessed One is sitting at the foot of a tree near my abode,

original: ayañca sattāhavaddalikā vattati, vāsāgāramassa laddhuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti. So sattaratanamayaṃ🔽pāsādaṃ nimminituṃ sakkontopi “evaṃ kate kāyasāro gahito na bhavissati, dasabalassa
analyzed: ayam ca vattati vāsāgāram assa laddhum vaṭṭati iti so satta ratana mayam  pāsādam nimminitum sakkontaḥ api evam kate kāya sāraḥ gahitaḥ na bhavissati dasabalassa
translated: and it is raining for seven days. It is proper to give him a dwelling.” Although he was able to create a palace of the seven precious substances,

original: kāyaveyyāvaccaṃ karissāmī”ti mahantaṃ attabhāvaṃ katvā satthāraṃ sattakkhattuṃ bhogehi
analyzed: kāyaveyyāvaccam karissāmi iti mahantam atta bhāvam katvā satthāram sattakkhattum bhogehi
translated: thinking “If I do so, the Blessed One’s body will be enclosed and will not be visible,” he assumed a great form,

original: parikkhipitvā upari phaṇaṃ dhāresi. “Tassa parikkhepabbhantaraṃ lohapāsāde bhaṇḍāgāragabbhappamāṇaṃ
analyzed: parikkhipitvā upari phaṇam dhāresi tassa parikkhepa abbhantaram loha pāsāde bhaṇḍāgāra gabbha ppamāṇam
translated: surrounded the Teacher with his coils seven times, and spread out a hood above him. The space enclosed by his coils was the size of the storehouse of the Lohapāsāda .

original: ahosī”ti idha vuttaṃ. Majjhimaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana –
analyzed: ahosi iti idha vuttam majjhima ṭṭhakathāyam pana
translated: But in the Majjhima commentary it is said:

original: “Parikkhepassa anto okāso heṭṭhā lohapāsādappamāṇo ahosi, ‘icchiticchitena iriyāpathena
analyzed: parikkhepassa antaḥ okāsaḥ heṭṭhā loha pāsāda ppamāṇaḥ ahosi icchiticchitena iriyāpathena
