translated: Of the five hundred students, two hundred and fifty turned back, while two hundred and fifty went with them.

original: saddhiṃ agamaṃsu. Tena vuttaṃ “atha kho sāriputtamoggallānā tāni aḍḍhateyyāni paribbājakasatāni
analyzed: saddhim agamaṃsu tena vuttam atha kho sāriputta moggallānā tāni aḍḍhateyyāni paribbājaka satāni
translated: This is why it was said that “Sāriputta and Moggallāna took those two hundred and fifty wanderers

original: ādāya yena veḷuvanaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsū”ti.
analyzed: ādāya yena veḷuvanam tena upasaṅkamiṃsu iti
translated: and brought them to the Bamboo Grove.”

original: Vimutteti yathāvuttalakkhaṇe nibbāne tadārammaṇāya phalavimuttiyā adhimutte ne sāriputtamoggallāne byākāsīti sambandho.
analyzed: vimuttā iti yathāvutta lakkhaṇe nibbāne tad ārammaṇāya phala vimuttiyā adhimutte ne sāriputta moggallāne byākāsi iti sambandho
translated: “Vimuttacitta” means “having their minds liberated” in the Nibbana which has the characteristics already mentioned, or “having their minds liberated” in the fruit of liberation which has that Nibbana as its object. The rest is as already explained.

original: Evaṃ byākaritvā ca satthā catuparisamajjhe dhammaṃ desento nesaṃ parisāya cariyavasena
analyzed: evam byākaritvā ca satthā catu parisamajjhe dhammaṃ desentaḥ na īsam parisāya cariya vasena
translated: After explaining the matter in this way, the Teacher, while teaching the Dhamma to the four assemblies,🔽increased the number of his disciples by preaching the Dhamma in accordance with their dispositions.

original: dhammadesanaṃ vaḍḍhesi, ṭhapetvā dve aggasāvake sabbepi aḍḍhateyyasatā paribbājakā
analyzed: dhamma desanam vaḍḍhesi ṭhapetvā dve aggasāvake sabbe api aḍḍhateyya satā paribbājakā
translated: With the exception of the two chief disciples, all the two hundred and fifty wanderers

original: arahattaṃ pāpuṇiṃsu. Satthā “etha bhikkhavo”ti hatthaṃ pasāresi, sabbesaṃ kesamassu🔽antaradhāyi, iddhimayapattacīvaraṃ kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ ahosi. Aggasāvakānampi iddhimayapattacīvaraṃ
analyzed: arahattam pāpuṇiṃsu satthāḥ etha bhikkhavaḥ ti hattham pasāresi sabbesam kesa massu  antaradhāyi iddhi maya patta cīvaram kāya paṭibaddham ahosi aggasāvakānam pi iddhi maya patta cīvaram
translated: attained arahatship. The Teacher extended his hand and said, “Come, bhikkhus!” The hair of all of them disappeared and they were clothed in the yellow robes.

original: āgataṃ, uparimaggattayakiccaṃ pana na niṭṭhāti. Kasmā? Sāvakapāramīñāṇassa mahantatāya.
analyzed: āgatam upari magga ttaya kiccam pana na niṭṭhāti kasmā sāvaka pāramī ñāṇassa mahanta tāya
translated: The yellow robes of the two chief disciples also came to them, but the work of the three higher paths was not finished. Why was this? Because the knowledge of the disciples was great.

original: Athāyasmā mahāmoggallāno pabbajitadivasato sattame divase magadharaṭṭhe kallavāḷagāmakaṃ
analyzed: atha āyasmai mahāmoggallānaḥ pabbajita divasataḥ sattame divase magadha raṭṭhe kallavāḷa gāmakam
translated: Then the venerable Maha Moggallana, on the seventh day after his ordination, went to the village of Kallavāḷa in the Magadha country,

original: upanissāya samaṇadhammaṃ karonto thinamiddhaṃ okkamanto satthārā saṃvejito thinamiddhaṃ
analyzed: upanissāya samaṇa dhammam karontaḥ thinam iddham okkamantaḥ satthārā saṃvejito thinam iddham
translated: and while he was practicing the ascetic practices in dependence on that place, he was roused by the Teacher from the sloth and torpor into which he had fallen.

original: vinodetvā tathāgatena dinnaṃ dhātukammaṭṭhānaṃ suṇantova uparimaggattayakiccaṃ niṭṭhāpetvā
analyzed: vinodetvā tathāgatena dinnam dhātu kammaṭṭhānam suṇantaḥ iva upari magga ttaya kiccam niṭṭhāpetvā
translated: He then removed his sloth and torpor, listened to the meditation subject consisting of the elements given by the Exalted One, and completed the task of the three higher paths and fruits.🔽He reached the summit of knowledge of the perfection of discipleship.

original: sāvakapāramīñāṇassa matthakaṃ patto. Sāriputtattheropi pabbajitadivasato addhamāsaṃ
analyzed: sāvaka pāramī ñāṇassa matthakam patto sāriputta theraḥ api pabbajita divasataḥ addha māsam
translated: The Elder Sāriputta, too, after he had gone forth,

original: atikkamitvā satthārā saddhiṃ tameva rājagahaṃ upanissāya sūkarakhataleṇe viharanto
analyzed: atikkamitvā satthārā saddhim tam eva rājagaham upanissāya sūkarakhataleṇe viharantaḥ
translated: while he was living in the Sūkara-khanda Cave near Rājagaha with the Teacher,

original: attano bhāgineyyassa dīghanakhaparibbājakassa vedanāpariggahasuttante desiyamāne
analyzed: attanaḥ bhāgineyyassa dīghanakha paribbājakassa vedanā pariggaha suttante desiyamāne
translated: heard the Elder Moggallāna expounding the Discourse on the Analysis of Feeling to his nephew, the wanderer Dīghanakha.

original: suttānusārena ñāṇaṃ pesetvā parassa vaḍḍhitabhattaṃ bhuñjanto viya sāvakapāramīñāṇassa
analyzed: sutta anusārena ñāṇam pesetvā parassa vaḍḍhita bhattam bhuñjantaḥ viya sāvaka pāramī ñāṇassa
translated: He directed his knowledge to the discourse as one who eats another’s food that has been made to grow by another, and he reached the summit of knowledge of the perfection of discipleship.

original: matthakaṃ patto. Tenevāha “mahāmoggallānatthero sattahi divasehi arahatte patiṭṭhito,
analyzed: matthakam tena iva āha mahāmoggallāna thero sattahi divasehi arahatte patiṭṭhito
translated: Hence it is said: “The Elder Mahā-Moggallāna was established in Arahantship in seven days,

original: sāriputtatthero addhamāsenā”ti.
analyzed: sāriputta theraḥ addha māsena ati
translated: and the Elder Sāriputta in a fortnight.”

original: Yadipi mahāmoggallānatthero na cirasseva arahattaṃ patto, dhammasenāpati tato cirena,🔽evaṃ santepi sāriputtattherova mahāpaññataro. Mahāmoggallānatthero hi sāvakānaṃ sammasanacāraṃ
analyzed: yadi pi mahāmoggallāna ttheraḥ na cirassa iva arahattam pattaḥ dhamma senāpati tatas cirena  evam sante pi sāriputta theraḥ iva mahā paññataraḥ mahāmoggallāna ttheraḥ hi sāvakānam sammasana cāram
translated: Although the Elder Mahā Moggallāna reached Arahantship in no long time, and the General of the Dhamma did so after a longer time,🔽still the Elder Sāriputta was the greater in wisdom. For the Elder Mahā Moggallāna, after striving for seven days, reached Arahantship

original: yaṭṭhikoṭiyā uppīḷento viya ekadesameva sammasanto satta divase vāyamitvā arahattaṃ
analyzed: yaṭṭhi koṭiyā uppīḷentaḥ viya eka desam eva sammasantaḥ satta divase vāyamitvā arahattam
translated: by discerning only one part of the field of the discernment of disciples’ development, as if he were pressing with the tip of a stick.

original: patto. Sāriputtatthero ṭhapetvā buddhānaṃ paccekabuddhānañca sammasanacāraṃ sāvakānaṃ🔽sammasanacāraṃ nippadesaṃ sammasi, evaṃ sammasanto addhamāsaṃ vāyami. Ukkaṃsagatassa
analyzed: patto sāriputta theraḥ ṭhapetvā buddhānam paccekabuddhānam ca sammasana cāram sāvakānam  sammasana cāram nippadesam sammasi evam sammasantaḥ addha māsam vā āyami ukkaṃsa gatassa
translated: But the Elder Sāriputta discerned the whole field of the discernment of disciples’ development, leaving out only the field of the discernment of Buddhas and Paccekabuddhas.

original: sāvakānaṃ sammasanacārassa nippadesena pavattiyamānattā sāvakapāramīñāṇassa ca tathā
analyzed: sāvakānam sammasana cārassa nippadesena sāvaka pāramī ñāṇassa ca tathā
translated: He strove for a fortnight, discerning in this way, because the whole field of the discernment of disciples’ development was being discerned by him without omission and because his knowledge as a disciple had to be developed in this way.

original: paripācetabbattā. Yathā hi puriso “veṇuyaṭṭhiṃ gaṇhissāmī”ti mahājaṭaṃ veṇuṃ disvā
analyzed: paripācetabba ttā yathā hi purisaḥ veṇu yaṭṭhim gaṇhissāmi iti mahā jaṭam veṇum disvā
translated: For just as a man who wants to take a bamboo walking stick sees a big bamboo,

original: “jaṭaṃ chindantassa papañco bhavissatī”ti antarena hatthaṃ pavesetvā sampattameva
analyzed: jaṭam chindantassa papañcaḥ bhavissati iti antarena hattham pavesetvā sampattam eva
translated: and thinking “There will be trouble in cutting the bamboo,” he puts his hand inside and takes out only the bamboo that is already fallen,

original: yaṭṭhiṃ mūle ca agge ca chinditvā ādāya pakkameyya, so kiñcāpi paṭhamataraṃ gacchati,🔽yaṭṭhiṃ pana sāraṃ vā ujuṃ vā na labhati. Aparo tathārūpameva veṇuṃ disvā sace sampattayaṭṭhiṃ
analyzed: yaṭṭhim mūle ca agge ca chinditvā ādāya pakkameyya saḥ kiñca api paṭhamataram gacchati  yaṭṭhim pana sāram vā ujum vā na labhati aparaḥ tathārūpam eva veṇum disvā sace sampatta yaṭṭhim
translated: and he cut the bamboo at the root and at the top and took it away, then although he went first,

original: gaṇhissāmi, sāraṃ vā ujuṃ vā na labhissāmīti kacchaṃ bandhitvā mahantena satthena
analyzed: gaṇhissāmi sāram vā ujum vā na labhissāmi iti kaccham bandhitvā mahantena satthena
translated: he did not get a bamboo with heartwood or straight. Another, seeing such a bamboo, thought, ‘If I take it as it is, I shall not get one with heartwood or straight,’ so he bound it with a rope, cut the bamboo clump with a big knife,

original: veṇujaṭaṃ chinditvā sārā ceva ujū ca yaṭṭhiyo uccinitvā ādāya pakkameyya, ayaṃ kiñcāpi🔽pacchā gacchati, yaṭṭhiyo pana sārā ceva ujū ca labhati, evaṃsampadamidaṃ imesaṃ
analyzed: veṇu jaṭam chinditvā sārā ca iva ujū ca uccinitvā ādāya pakkameyya ayam kiñca api  pacchā gacchati sārā ca iva ujū ca labhati evaṃsampadam idam imesam
translated: took out the bamboos with heartwood and straight, and took them away. Although he went last,

original: dvinnaṃ therānaṃ padhānaṃ.
analyzed: dvinnam padhānam
translated: he got bamboos with heartwood and straight. So it is with these two elders’ striving.

original: Sammasanacāro ca nāmettha vipassanābhūmi veditabbā sammasanaṃ carati etthāti sammasanacāroti
analyzed: sammasanacāro ca nāma ittha vipassanā bhūmi veditabbā sammasanam carati ettha ati sammasanacāro ti
translated: And the “course of impulsion” here should be understood as the plane of insight. For the meaning of “course of impulsion” is this: it is a course that impulsion goes along , thus it is a course of impulsion.

original: katvā. Tattha buddhānaṃ sammasanacāro dasasahassalokadhātuyaṃ sattasantānagatā anindriyabaddhā
analyzed: katvā tattha buddhānam sammasana cāraḥ dasa sahassa lokadhātuyam satta santāna gatāḥ an indriya baddhāḥ
translated: Herein, the Buddhas’ course of impulsion is in the ten-thousand world-element. It is in the continuity of being of creatures, not in the inanimate world. For the Buddha’s knowledge is not obstructed as to creatures’ continuity of being, which is the field of his knowledge, as it is in the case of disciples’ knowledge.

original: ca saṅkhārāti vadanti. Koṭisatasahassacakkavāḷesūti apare. Tathā hi attaniyavasena
analyzed: ca saṅkhārā iti vadanti koṭi sata sahassa cakkavāḷesu iti apare tathā hi attaniya vasena
translated: and formations, they say. Others say: in a hundred thousand koṭis of world-spheres. For thus:🔽

original: paṭiccasamuppādanayaṃ otaritvā chattiṃsakoṭisatasahassamukhena buddhānaṃ mahāvajirañāṇaṃ🔽pavattaṃ. Paccekabuddhānaṃ sasantānagatehi saddhiṃ majjhimadesavāsīsattasantānagatā
analyzed: paṭiccasamuppāda nayam otaritvā chattiṃsa koṭi sata sahassa mukhena buddhānam mahā vajira ñāṇam  pavattam paccekabuddhānam sa santāna gatehi saddhim majjhima desavāsī satta santāna gatā
translated: and formations. Others say in a hundred thousand koṭis of world-systems. For in this way the great vajra knowledge of the Buddhas, which has a hundred thousand koṭis of aspects, occurs in them when they have descended into the method of dependent origination by way of their own individual essence.🔽Paccekabuddhas, they say, review formations that are not bound up with faculties, which occur in their own and others’ continuities, and which are not included in the central countries.

original: anindriyabaddhā ca saṅkhārā sammasanacāroti vadanti. Jambudīpavāsīsantānagatāti keci.🔽Sasantānagate sabbadhamme parasantānagate ca santānavibhāgaṃ akatvā bahiddhābhāvasāmaññato🔽sammasanaṃ, ayaṃ sāvakānaṃ sammasanacāro. Moggallānatthero pana bahiddhā dhammepi
analyzed: an indriya baddhā ca saṅkhārā sammasana cārā iti vadanti jambudīpa vāsī santāna gatā ati keci  sa santāna gate sabba dhamme para santāna gate ca santāna vibhāgam a katvā bahiddhā bhāva sāmaññato  sammasanam ayam sāvakānam sammasana cāraḥ moggallāna ttheraḥ pana bahiddhā dhamme pi
translated: Some say that they review formations occurring in the continuity of beings living in Jambudīpa.

original: sasantānavibhāgena keci keci uddharitvā sammasi, tañca kho ñāṇena phuṭṭhamattaṃ katvā.
analyzed: sa santāna vibhāgena keci keci uddharitvā sammasi tat ca kho ñāṇena phuṭṭha mattam katvā
translated: Without making a division of the continuity into one’s own and another’s, they review by the similarity of external existence. This is the reviewing practice of disciples. But the Elder Moggallāna, they say, reviewed external dhammas by extracting some from their continuity and reviewing them, and that only after he had made them accessible by knowledge.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “yaṭṭhikoṭiyā uppīḷento viya ekadesameva sammasanto”ti. Tattha ñāṇena
analyzed: tena vuttam yaṭṭhi koṭiyā uppīḷentaḥ viya eka desam eva sammasantaḥ ti tattha ñāṇena
translated: Hence it was said above: “reviewing as if pressing out the water from a lump of cotton wool by taking hold of one part of it.” Herein, by knowledge

original: nāma yāvatā neyyaṃ vattitabbaṃ, tāvatā avattanato “yaṭṭhikoṭiyā uppīḷento viyā”ti
analyzed: nāma yāvatā na iyyam vattitabbam tāvatā avattanataḥ yaṭṭhi koṭiyā uppīḷentaḥ viyāti
translated: “He is like one who presses a reed at the tip” means that he does not go beyond the extent to which the disciple can be led.

original: vuttaṃ, anupadadhammavipassanāya abhāvato “ekadesameva sammasanto”ti vuttaṃ. Dhammasenāpatinopi
analyzed: vuttam anupada dhamma vipassanāya abhāvataḥ eka desam eva sammasantaḥ ti vuttam dhammasenāpatinā api
translated: “He comprehends only a part” means that he does not have insight into the dhammas that are not yet arisen.

original: yathāvuttasāvakānaṃ vipassanāya bhūmiyeva sammasanacāro. Tattha pana thero sātisayaṃ
analyzed: yathā vutta sāvakānam vipassanāya bhūmiyā iva sammasana cāro tattha pana thero sa atisayam
translated: The Elder comprehends the Elder’s mode of comprehending, which is the same as the mode of comprehending of the disciples mentioned above.🔽But the Elder comprehends it in a more excellent way, without remainder, and in a way that is free from clinging.

original: niravasesaṃ anupadañca sammā vipassi. Tena vuttaṃ “sāvakānaṃ sammasanacāraṃ nippadesaṃ sammasī”ti.
analyzed: niravasesam anupadam ca sammā vipassi tena vuttam sāvakānam sammasana cāram nippadesam sammasī iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “He comprehends the Elder’s mode of comprehending, which is free from clinging.”

original: Ettha ca sukkhavipassakā lokiyābhiññappattā pakatisāvakā mahāsāvakā aggasāvakā paccekabuddhā🔽sammāsambuddhāti chasu janesu sukkhavipassakānaṃ jhānābhiññāhi anadhigatapaññānepuññattā
analyzed: ettha ca sukkha vipassakāḥ lokiya abhiñña ppattā pakati sāvakāḥ mahāsāvakāḥ aggasāvakāḥ paccekabuddhāḥ  sammāsambuddhā ati chasu janesu sukkha vipassakānam jhāna abhiññāhi anadhigata paññā nepuñña ttā
translated: Herein, the dry-insight meditator, the worldling who has attained the mundane direct knowledges, the ordinary disciple, the great disciple, the chief disciple, the paccekabuddha,🔽and the perfectly enlightened Buddha—these are the six kinds of dry-insight meditators.🔽Since the dry-insight meditators among them have not attained the wisdom that comes through the jhānas and direct knowledges,

original: andhānaṃ viya icchitapadesokkamanaṃ vipassanākāle icchiticchitadhammabhāvanā natthi,
analyzed: andhānam viya icchita padesa ukkamanam vipassanā kāle icchiticchita dhamma bhāvanā natthi
translated: they are like the blind in that they cannot develop any dhamma they choose at will at the time of insight.

original: te yathāpariggahitadhammamatteyeva vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhenti. Lokiyābhiññappattā pana
analyzed: te yathā pariggahita dhamma matteya iva vipassanam vaḍḍhenti lokiya abhiñña ppattā pana
translated: They extend insight only in the field of ideas as they have discerned them. But those who have reached mundane direct- knowledge

original: pakatisāvakā yena mukhena vipassanaṃ ārabhanti, tato aññenapi vipassanaṃ vitthārikaṃ🔽kātuṃ sakkonti vipulañāṇattā. Mahāsāvakā abhinīhārasampannattā tato sātisayaṃ vipassanaṃ🔽vitthārikaṃ kātuṃ sakkonti. Aggasāvakesu dutiyo abhinīhārasampattiyā samādhānassa🔽sātisayattā vipassanaṃ tatopi vitthārikaṃ karoti. Paṭhamo pana tatopi mahāpaññatāya🔽sāvakehi asādhāraṇaṃ katvā vipassanaṃ vitthārikaṃ karoti. Paccekabuddhā tehipi mahābhinīhāratāya
analyzed: pakati sāvakāḥ yena mukhena vipassanam ārabhanti tatas aññena api vipassanam vitthārikam  kātum sakkonti vipula ñāṇa ttāḥ mahāsāvakāḥ abhinīhāra sampanna ttā tatas sa atisayam vipassanam  vitthārikam kātum sakkonti aggasāvakesu dutiyaḥ abhinīhāra sampattiyā samādhānassa  sa ati saya ttā vipassanam tatas pi vitthārikam karoti paṭhamaḥ pana tatas pi mahā pañña tāya  sāvakehi asādhāraṇam katvā vipassanam vitthārikam karoti paccekabuddhā tehi pi mahā abhinīhāra tāya
translated: can extend insight by a method other than the one they began with. And because their knowledge is extensive, they can extend insight

original: attano abhinīhārānurūpaṃ tatopi vitthārikaṃ vipassanaṃ karonti. Buddhānaṃ sammadeva
analyzed: attanaḥ abhinīhāra anurūpam tatas api vitthārikam vipassanam karonti buddhānam sammat eva
translated: more than that. The great disciples can extend insight more than that because they are successful in their aspiration. As for the chief disciples, the second extends insight more than the first because his concentration is superior owing to his success in aspiration. But the first extends insight more than the other two because he has great understanding not shared by disciples. The Paccekabuddhas extend insight more than the chief disciples because of their great aspiration. The Buddhas extend insight more than the Paccekabuddhas because of their right penetration of the whole field of knowledge.

original: paripūritapaññāpāramīpabhāvitā sabbaññutaññāṇādhigamassa anurūpā yathā nāma katavālavedhaparicayena
analyzed: paripūrita paññāpāramīpa bhāvitā sabbaññuta ññāṇa adhigamassa anurūpā yathā nāma kata vālavedha paricayena
translated: and it is in conformity with the attainment of omniscient knowledge, which is developed by the fulfilment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sarabhaṅgasadisena dhanuggahena khitto saro antarā rukkhalatādīsu asajjamāno lakkheyeva
analyzed: sarabhaṅga sadisena dhanuggahena khittaḥ saraḥ antarā rukkha latā ādīsu a sajjamānaḥ lakkheya iva
translated: Just as an arrow shot by a skillful archer with a drawn bow does not touch the trees, creepers, etc., in between,

original: patati, na sajjati na virajjati, evaṃ antarā asajjamānā avirajjamānā vipassanā sammasanīyadhammesu
analyzed: patati na sajjati na virajjati evam antarā a sajjamānā a virajjamānā vipassanā sammasanīya dhammesu
translated: but hits the target, so too insight, without touching the things to be penetrated in between,

original: yāthāvato nānānayehi pavattati, yaṃ “mahāvajirañāṇa”nti vuccati.
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ nānā nayehi pavattati yam mahā vajirañāṇan ti vuccati
translated: penetrates them as they really are by means of the various methods, and it is called the “great diamond-like knowledge.”

original: Etesu ca sukkhavipassakānaṃ vipassanācāro khajjotappabhāsadiso, abhiññappattapakatisāvakānaṃ
analyzed: etesu ca sukkha vipassakānam vipassanā ācāraḥ khajjota ppabhā sadisaḥ abhiñña ppatta pakati sāvakānam
translated: And among these, the practice of insight of dry-insight meditators is like the light of a glowworm,

original: dīpappabhāsadiso, mahāsāvakānaṃ ukkāppabhāsadiso, aggasāvakānaṃ osadhitārakappabhāsadiso,
analyzed: dīpa ppabhā sadisaḥ mahāsāvakānam ukkā ppabhā sadisaḥ agga sāvakānam osadhi tāraka ppabhā sadisaḥ
translated: that of the great disciples who have attained direct knowledge is like the light of a lamp, that of the chief disciples is like the light of a torch,

original: paccekabuddhānaṃ candappabhāsadiso, sammāsambuddhānaṃ rasmisahassapaṭimaṇḍitasaradasūriyamaṇḍalasadiso
analyzed: paccekabuddhānam canda ppabhā sadisaḥ sammāsambuddhānam rasmi sahassa paṭimaṇḍita sarada sūriya maṇḍala sadisaḥ
translated: that of the paccekabuddhas is like the light of the moon, and that of the fully enlightened Buddhas is like the light of the autumn sun, which is adorned with a thousand rays.

original: hutvā upaṭṭhāti. Tathā sukkhavipassakānaṃ vipassanācāro andhānaṃ yaṭṭhikoṭiyā gamanasadiso,
analyzed: hutvā upaṭṭhāti tathā sukkha vipassakānam vipassanā ācāraḥ andhānam yaṭṭhi koṭiyā gamana sadisaḥ
translated: and it is the same with the dry insight worker’s practice of insight.🔽It is like a blind man’s going by the direction of a stick,

original: lokiyābhiññappattapakatisāvakānaṃ daṇḍakasetugamanasadiso, mahāsāvakānaṃ jaṅghasetugamanasadiso,
analyzed: lokiya abhiñña ppatta pakati sāvakānam daṇḍaka setu gamana sadisaḥ mahāsāvakānam jaṅgha setu gamana sadisaḥ
translated: like a novice’s going by the direction of a rope,🔽like a great man’s going by the direction of a chariot,

original: aggasāvakānaṃ sakaṭasetugamanasadiso, paccekabuddhānaṃ mahājaṅghamaggagamanasadiso,🔽sammāsambuddhānaṃ mahāsakaṭamaggagamanasadiso. Tathā buddhānaṃ paccekabuddhānañca🔽vipassanā cintāmayañāṇasaṃvaḍḍhitattā sayambhūñāṇabhūtā, itaresaṃ sutamayañāṇasaṃvaḍḍhitattā
analyzed: aggasāvakānam sakaṭa setu gamana sadisaḥ paccekabuddhānam mahā jaṅgha magga gamana sadisaḥ  sammāsambuddhānam mahā sakaṭa magga gamana sadisaḥ tathā buddhānam paccekabuddhānam ca  vipassanā cintā maya ñāṇa saṃvaḍḍhi tattā sayambhū ñāṇa bhūtā itaresam suta maya ñāṇa saṃvaḍḍhi tattā
translated: like a paccekabuddha’s going by the direction of a great elephant,🔽and like a perfect Buddha’s going by the direction of a great chariot.🔽And the insight of Buddhas and Paccekabuddhas is self-become knowledge because it is increased by knowledge consisting in what is thought out;

original: paropadesasambhūtāti veditabbā.
analyzed: para upadesa sambhūtā iti veditabbā
translated: that of the rest is knowledge consisting in what is learnt because it is increased by knowledge consisting in what is learnt and because it is originated by the advice of others.

original: Idāni ubhinnampi therānaṃ pubbayogaṃ dassetuṃ “atīte kirā”tiādimāha. Taṃ sabbaṃ uttānatthameva.
analyzed: idāni ubhinnam pi therānam pubba yogam dassetum atīte kirāti ādim āha tat sabbam uttāna ttham eva
translated: Now, in order to point out the previous practice of both elders, he said, “In the past, it seems” . All that is clear in meaning.

original: 63. Giribbajanagaranti samantā pabbataparikkhittaṃ vajasadisaṃ hutvā tiṭṭhatīti giribbajanti
analyzed: giribbajanagaranti samantā pabbata parikkhittam vaja sadisam hutvā tiṭṭhati iti giribbajanti
translated: Giribbajanagara : it is girinagaram because it stands girt by mountains like a vajira .

original: evaṃladdhanāmaṃ rājagahanagaraṃ. Usūyanakiriyāya kammabhāvaṃ sandhāya “upayogatthe vā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: evaṃladdha nāmam rājagaha nagaram usūyana kiriyāya kamma bhāvam sandhāya upayoga atthe vā ati vuttam
translated: The name of the town was given in this way. The word “or” in the phrase “in the sense of use or” refers to the fact that the name was given because of the action of the king’s nurse.

original: Sāriputtamoggallānapabbajjākathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sāriputta moggallāna pabbajjā kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the story of the going forth of Sāriputta and Moggallāna is ended.

original: Upajjhāyavattakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: upajjhāya vatta kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the story of the preceptor

original: 64. Vajjāvajjaṃ upanijjhāyatīti upajjhāyo, natthi upajjhāyo etesanti anupajjhāyakā.
analyzed: vajjāvajjam upanijjhāyati iti upajjhāyaḥ na atthi upajjhāyaḥ etesanti anupajjhāyakā
translated: The preceptor is one who considers what is blameworthy and what is not blameworthy . Those who do not have a preceptor are called “without a preceptor.”

original: Tenāha “vajjāvajjaṃ upanijjhāyakena garunā virahitā”ti. Tattha vajjāvajjanti khuddakaṃ
analyzed: tena āha vajjāvajjam upanijjhāyakena garunā virahitā ati tattha vajjāvajjanti khuddakam
translated: Therefore it is said: “They were without a senior who considered what was blameworthy and what was not blameworthy.” Herein, what is blameworthy and what is not blameworthy is a minor and a major offense.🔽The letter a has the sense of increase, as in the words “fruit” and “fault.”

original: mahantañca vajjaṃ. Vuddhiattho hi ayamakāro “phalāphala”ntiādīsu viya. Uttiṭṭhapattanti🔽ettha ucchiṭṭha-saddasamānattho uttiṭṭha-saddo. Tenevāha “tasmiñhi manussā ucchiṭṭhasaññino,
analyzed: mahantam ca vajjam vuddhi atthaḥ hi ayam akāraḥ phalāphalanti ādīsu viya uttiṭṭha pattanti  ettha ucchiṭṭha sadda samāna tthaḥ uttiṭṭha saddaḥ tena iva āha tasmin hi manussāḥ ucchiṭṭha saññinaḥ
translated: The word “rise” has the same meaning as the word “remnant.”🔽Therefore it is said: “For people regard it as a remnant,

original: tasmā uttiṭṭhapattanti vutta”nti. Piṇḍāya caraṇakapattanti iminā pana pattassa sarūpadassanamukhena
analyzed: tasmai uttiṭṭha pattanti vuttanti piṇḍāya caraṇaka pattanti iminā pana pattassa sarūpa dassana mukhena
translated: therefore it is called ‘rise.’“ By the words “the bowl for going on alms round” the bowl is shown by the method of pointing out its form.

original: ucchiṭṭhakappanāya kāraṇaṃ vibhāvitaṃ. Tasminti tasmiṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakapatte.
analyzed: ucchiṭṭha kappanāya kāraṇam vibhāvitam tasmin ti tasmin piṇḍāya caraṇaka patte
translated: The reason for the wearing of a rag-robe is explained. In that: in that place where he is wandering for alms.

original: 65. Sagāravā sappatissāti ettha garubhāvo gāravaṃ, pāsāṇacchattaṃ viya garukaraṇīyatā.
analyzed: sa gāravā ettha garu bhāvaḥ gāravam pāsāṇa chattam viya garu karaṇīya tā
translated: With respect and deference: here, the state of being heavy is respect, the state of being worthy of being treated as heavy, like a stone umbrella.

original: Saha gāravenāti sagāravā. Garunā kismiñci vutte gāravavasena patissavanaṃ patisso,
analyzed: saha gāravena ati sa gāravā garunā kismiñci vutte gārava vasena patissavanam
translated: Together with respect: with respect. When something is said with respect, the state of listening to it is deference.

original: patissavabhūtaṃ taṃsabhāgañca yaṃkiñci gāravanti attho. Saha patissenāti sappatissā,
analyzed: patissava bhūtam taṃsa bhāgañca yaṃkiñci gāravanti saha patissena ati sappatissā
translated: The meaning is: together with deference, with any state of respect that is of the same kind as that.

original: ovādaṃ sampaṭicchantāti attho. Patissīyatīti vā patisso, garukātabbo. Tena saha patissenāti
analyzed: ovādam sampaṭicchantā ti attho patissīyati iti vā patissaḥ garukātabbo tena saha patissena ati
translated: Together with deference: with deference. The meaning is: accepting the advice. Or alternatively, patisso is that which should be treated with respect. Together with that:

original: sappatissā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana byañjanavicāraṃ akatvā atthamattameva dassetuṃ “garukabhāvañceva🔽jeṭṭhakabhāvañca upaṭṭhapetvā”ti vuttaṃ. Sāhūti sādhu. Lahūti agaru, mama tuyhaṃ
analyzed: sappatissā aṭṭhakathāyam pana byañjana vicāram a katvā attham attam eva dassetum garuka bhāvam ca iva  jeṭṭhaka bhāvañca upaṭṭhapetvā iti vuttam sāhu iti sādhu lahu iti agaru mama tuyham
translated: with deference. But in the commentary, in order to show the mere meaning without examining the grammar, it is said: “having shown the state of being heavy and

original: upajjhāyabhāve bhāriyaṃ nāma natthīti attho. Opāyikanti upāyapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ te upajjhāyaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: upajjhāya bhāve bhāriyam nāma natthi iti attho opāyikam ti upāya paṭisaṃyuttam te upajjhāya ggahaṇam
translated: the state of being senior.” Sāhūti is good. Lahūti is light, the meaning is: there is nothing heavy in my being your preceptor. Opāyikanti is connected with the means. Your taking me as preceptor is🔽a means.

original: iminā upāyena tvaṃ me ito paṭṭhāya bhāro jātosīti vuttaṃ hoti. Patirūpanti anurūpaṃ
analyzed: iminā upāyena tvam me itas paṭṭhāya bhāraḥ jātaḥ asi iti vuttam hoti patirūpam ti anurūpam
translated: Suitable: appropriate.🔽Your acceptance of a preceptor: the meaning is, your taking a preceptor.

original: tava upajjhāyaggahaṇanti attho. Pāsādikenāti pasādāvahena kāyavacīpayogena. Sampādehīti
analyzed: tava upajjhāya ggahaṇanti pāsādikena ati pasāda āvahena kāya vacī payogena sampādehi iti
translated: By pleasing: by the bodily and verbal effort that produces confidence.🔽Accomplish: the meaning is, complete the three trainings.

original: tividhasikkhaṃ nipphādehīti attho. Kāyena vāti hatthamuddādiṃ dassento kāyena vā🔽viññāpeti. Gahito tayā…pe… viññāpetīti “sāhū”tiādīsu ekaṃ vadantoyeva imamatthaṃ
analyzed: tividha sikkham nipphādehi iti attho kāyena vā ti hattha mudda ādim dassento kāyena vā  viññāpeti gahito tayā āpe viññāpeti iti sāhūti ādīsu ekam vadantaḥ yeva imam attham
translated: By body: by showing the hand, the forehead, and so on.🔽By speech: by saying “Yes” and so on.🔽By mind: by showing the relevant aspect of the physical or verbal act.🔽By means of this: by means of this act of acceptance.

original: viññāpetīti vuccati. Tenevāha “idameva hī”tiādi. Sādhūti sampaṭicchanaṃ sandhāyāti🔽upajjhāyena “sāhū”ti vutte saddhivihārikassa “sādhū”ti sampaṭicchanavacanaṃ sandhāya.
analyzed: viññāpeti iti vuccati tena iva āha idam eva hi itiādi sādhu iti sampaṭicchanam sandhāya ati  upajjhāyena sāhu iti vutte saddhivihārikassa sādhu iti sampaṭicchana vacanam sandhāya
translated: The meaning is: by means of this act of acceptance, which is the cause for the preceptor’s and the pupil’s duties towards each other.🔽The pupil should not be too demanding: the meaning is, he should not be difficult to live with.

original: Kasmā nappamāṇanti āha “āyācanadānamattena hī”tiādi, saddhivihārikassa “upajjhāyo🔽me, bhante, hohī”ti āyācanamattena, upajjhāyassa ca “sāhū”tiādinā dānavacanamattenāti
analyzed: kasmā na pamāṇam ti āha āyācana dāna mattena hi itiādi saddhivihārikassa upajjhāyaḥ 🔽me bhante hohi iti āyācana mattena upajjhāyassa ca sāhūti ādinā dāna vacana mattena ati
translated: The preceptor should not be too demanding: the meaning is, he should not be difficult to live with.

original: attho. Na ettha sampaṭicchanaṃ aṅganti saddhivihārikassa sampaṭicchanavacanaṃ ettha
analyzed: atthaḥ na ettha sampaṭicchanam saddhivihārikassa sampaṭicchana vacanam ettha
translated: The meaning is: the consent is not a factor here. The statement of the pupil’s consent is a factor in the preceptor’s acceptance.

original: upajjhāyaggahaṇe aṅgaṃ na hoti.
analyzed: upajjhāya ggahaṇe aṅgam na hoti
translated: It is not a factor in the preceptor’s taking up of the pupil.

original: 66. Sammāvattanāti sammāpavatti. Assāti saddhivihārikassa. Tādisameva mukhadhovanodakaṃ🔽dātabbanti utumhi sarīrasabhāve ca ekākāre tādisameva dātabbaṃ. Dve cīvarānīti pārupanaṃ
analyzed: sammāvattanā ati sammāpavatti assa ati saddhivihārikassa tādisam eva mukha dhovana udakam  dātabbanti utumhi sarīra sabhāve ca eka ākāre tādisam eva dātabbam dve cīvarāni iti pārupanam
translated: “Conduct” is behaviour. “Such” : the water for washing the face should be given in the same way as the water for washing the feet.

original: saṅghāṭiñca sandhāya vadati. Yadi evaṃ “saṅghāṭiyo”ti kasmā vuttanti āha “sabbañhi
analyzed: saṅghāṭiñca sandhāya vadati yadi evam saṅghāṭiyaḥ iti kasmā vuttan ti āha sabbam hi
translated: “Two robes” : he speaks with reference to the upper garment and the outer cloak. If that is so, why is it said “saṅghāṭīyo” ? He says, “All

original: cīvaraṃ saṅghaṭitattā saṅghāṭīti vuccatī”ti. Padavītihārehīti ettha padaṃ vītiharati🔽etthāti padavītihāro, padavītiharaṇaṭṭhānaṃ dūtavilambitaṃ akatvā samagamane dvinnaṃ
analyzed: cīvaram saṅghaṭita ttā saṅghāṭī iti vuccati iti ettha padam vītiharati  ettha ati padavītihāro padavītiharaṇa ṭṭhānam dūta vilambitam a katvā sama gamane dvinnam
translated: robes are called saṅghāṭī because they are made by sewing together .”

original: padānaṃ antare muṭṭhiratanamattaṃ. Padānaṃ vā vītiharaṇaṃ abhimukhaṃ haritvā nikkhepo
analyzed: padānam antare muṭṭhi ratana mattam padānam vā vītiharaṇam abhimukham haritvā nikkhepaḥ
translated: “Within the range of two footsteps” : here, he steps over the footsteps, therefore it is padavītihāra . It is the place for stepping over the footsteps. Without making the messenger wait, he should go to meet him within the range of two footsteps.🔽The placing of the robes after carrying them face to face is the stepping over of the footsteps.

original: padavītihāroti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Ito paṭṭhāyāti “na upajjhāyassa bhaṇamānassā”ti
analyzed: padavī tihāraḥ ti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo itas paṭṭhāya ati na upajjhāyassa bhaṇamānassa ati
translated: From here on: from the “na” in “He should not correct his preceptor when he is speaking” .

original: ettha vutta na-kārato paṭṭhāya. Sabbattha dukkaṭāpatti veditabbāti “īdisesu gilānopi🔽na muccatī”ti dassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Aññampi hi yathāvuttaṃ upajjhāyavattaṃ anādariyena🔽akarontassa agilānassa vattabhede sabbattha dukkaṭameva. Teneva vakkhati “agilānena
analyzed: ettha vutta nakārataḥ paṭṭhāya sabbattha dukkaṭa āpatti veditabbā ati īdisesu gilānaḥ api  na muccati iti dassana attham vuttam aññam pi hi yathā vuttam upajjhāya vattam anādariyena  a karontassa a gilānassa vatta bhede sabbattha dukkaṭam eva tena iva vakkhati a gilānena
translated: The offence of wrong-doing should be understood in all cases: this is said in order to show that “Even if sick he is not released from this.”🔽For even if he is sick, if he does not do what he has been told to do by his preceptor through disrespect, then in all cases there is an offence of wrong-doing in the breach of the rule.

original: hi saddhivihārikena saṭṭhivassenapi sabbaṃ upajjhāyavattaṃ kātabbaṃ, anādarena akarontassa🔽vattabhede dukkaṭaṃ. Na-kārapaṭisaṃyuttesu pana padesu gilānassapi paṭikkhittakiriyaṃ
analyzed: hi saddhivihārikena saṭṭhivassena api sabbam upajjhāya vattam kātabbam anādarena a karontassa  vatta bhede dukkaṭam nakāra paṭisaṃyuttesu pana padesu gilānassa api paṭikkhitta kiriyam
translated: Therefore it is said: “For one who is not sick, even if he is sixty years old, all the duties to a preceptor should be done.🔽For one who does not do them through disrespect, there is an offence of wrong-doing in the breach of the rule.

original: karontassa dukkaṭamevā”ti. Āpattiyā āsannavācanti āpattijanakameva vacanaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: karontassa dukkaṭam eva ati āpattiyāḥ āsanna vācam ti āpatti janakam eva vacanam sandhāya
translated: But in the passages dealing with the ‘na’ word, if one who is sick does what is prohibited, there is an offence of wrong-doing.”🔽The speech that is near to the offence: he speaks referring to the speech that gives rise to the offence.

original: vadati. Yāya hi vācāya āpattiṃ āpajjati, sā vācā tassā āpattiyā āsannāti vuccati.
analyzed: vadati yāya hi vācāya āpattim āpajjati sā vācā tassā āpattiyā āsannā ati vuccati
translated: For the speech by which one falls into an offence is called “near” to that offence.

original: Cīvarena pattaṃ veṭhetvāti ettha “uttarāsaṅgassa ekena kaṇṇena veṭhetvā”ti gaṇṭhipadesu
analyzed: cīvarena pattam veṭhetvā ati ettha uttarāsaṅgassa ekena kaṇṇena veṭhetvā ati gaṇṭhi padesu
translated: He should wrap the bowl in the robe: in the place where the tying is done, he should wrap it in the upper robe by one corner .

original: vuttaṃ. Gāmeti gāmapariyāpanne tādise kismiñci padese. Antaraghareti antogehe. Paṭikkamaneti🔽āsanasālāyaṃ. Tikkhattuṃ pānīyena pucchitabboti sambandho, ādimhi majjhe anteti evaṃ
analyzed: vuttam gāme iti gāma pariyāpanne tādise kismiñci padese antaraghare iti antogehe paṭikkamanā iti  āsana sālā ayam tikkhattum pānīyena pucchitabbaḥ iti sambandho ādimhi majjhe anta iti evam
translated: In a village: in a place of that kind included in a village. In an inhabited area: in a house.🔽When he has gone out: in the assembly hall. He should ask for water three times: this is the construction. The meaning is that he should ask three times, at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: tikkhattuṃ pucchitabboti attho. Upakaṭṭhoti āsanno. Dhotavālikāyāti nirajāya parisuddhavālikāya.
analyzed: tikkhattum pucchitabbaḥ ti attho upakaṭṭhaḥ ti āsannaḥ dhota vālikāya ati nirajāya parisuddha vālikāya
translated: When it is near: when it is close by. Washed sand: clean, pure sand.

original: Sace pahotīti vuttamevatthaṃ vibhāveti “na kenaci gelaññena abhibhūto hotī”ti. Pariveṇaṃ
analyzed: sace pahoti iti vuttam eva attham vibhāveti na kenacid gelaññena abhibhūtaḥ hoti iti pariveṇam
translated: If there is: he explains the meaning of what was said thus: “He is not overcome by any affliction.”

original: gantvāti upajjhāyassa pariveṇaṃ gantvā.🔽Upajjhāyavattakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽67. Saddhivihārikavattakathā uttānatthāyeva.
analyzed: gantvā iti upajjhāyassa pariveṇam gantvā  upajjhāya vatta kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  saddhivihārika vatta kathā uttāna tthāya eva
translated: Having gone round: having gone round to the preceptor’s cell.🔽The explanation of the duties to the preceptor is ended.🔽The duties to the pupil are obvious in meaning.

original: Nasammāvattanādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: na sammāvattana ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the duties in the case of misconduct, etc.

original: 68. Nasammāvattanādikathāyaṃ gehassitapemanti “pitā me aya”nti evaṃ uppannapemaṃ.
analyzed: na sammāvattana ādi kathā ayam geha ssita pemanti pitā me evam uppanna peman
translated: In the discussion of the duties in the case of misconduct, etc., affection based on living together: affection arisen thus: “This is my father.”

original: Upajjhāyamhi pitucittupaṭṭhānameva hi idha gehassitapemaṃ nāma. Na hi idaṃ akusalapakkhiyaṃ
analyzed: upajjhāyamhi pitu citta upaṭṭhānam eva hi idha gehassitapemam nāma na hi idam akusala pakkhiyam
translated: For the affection called “affection for a house” is only the attitude of a son towards his father in regard to the preceptor.

original: gehassitapemaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ paṭividdhasaccānaṃ pahīnānugedhānaṃ tadasambhavato,
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam paṭividdha saccānam pahīna anugedhānam tad asambhavato
translated: This is not said with reference to affection for a house in the sense of the unprofitable,🔽because it is impossible for one who has penetrated the truths and abandoned attachment.

original: na ca bhagavā bhikkhū saṃkilese niyojeti, gehassitapemasadisattā pana pemamukhena
analyzed: na ca bhagavā bhikkhū saṃkilese niyojeti geha ssita pema sadisa ttā pana pema mukhena
translated: And the Blessed One does not urge bhikkhus to defilement, but affection like affection for a house is said here by way of affection,🔽which is the affection of loving kindness, and it should be understood thus.

original: mettāsineho idha vuttoti veditabbaṃ. “Tesu eko vattasampanno bhikkhu…pe… tesaṃ anāpattī”ti🔽vacanato sace eko vattasampanno bhikkhu “bhante, tumhe appossukkā hotha, ahaṃ tumhākaṃ
analyzed: mettāsinehaḥ idha vuttaḥ ti veditabbam tesu ekaḥ vatta sampannaḥ bhikkhupe tesam anāpatti iti  vacanataḥ sace ekaḥ vatta sampannaḥ bhikkhu bhante tumhe appossukkāḥ hotha aham tumhākam
translated: “If one of them is accomplished in the duties … there is no offence for them” .

original: saddhivihārikaṃ antevāsikaṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhahissāmi, ovaditabbaṃ ovadissāmi, iti
analyzed: saddhivihārikam antevāsikam vā gilānam upaṭṭhahissāmi ovaditabbam ovadissāmi iti
translated: If one bhikkhu who is accomplished in the duties says, “Venerable sirs, you be easy; I shall tend the sick one, I shall advise and instruct him, I shall take on myself the trouble of doing what has to be done,”

original: karaṇīyesu ussukkaṃ āpajjissāmī”ti vadati, te eva vā saddhivihārikādayo “bhante,
analyzed: karaṇīyesu ussukkam āpajjissāmi iti vadati te eva vā saddhivihārika ādayaḥ bhante
translated: or if the pupils and so on say, “Venerable sirs, you be easy,”

original: Ettha samosaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ. “Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, vimuttāyatanānī”ti ettha kāraṇaṃ,
analyzed: ettha samosaraṇa ṭṭhānam pañcimāni bhikkhave vimutta āyatanāni iti ettha kāraṇam
translated: as in the passage: “Bhikkhus, there are these five places of resort” .

original: taṃ idha sabbampi labbhati. Sabbepi hi diṭṭhigatikā sañjāyamānā imāsuyeva dvāsaṭṭhiyā
analyzed: tat idha sabbam api labbhati sabbe api hi diṭṭhigatikā sañjāyamānāḥ imāsuyā iva dvāsaṭṭhiyā
translated: All these are applicable here. For all those who hold views are born in these sixty-two views,

original: diṭṭhīsu sañjāyanti, samosaramānāpi etāsuyeva samosaranti sannipatanti, diṭṭhigatikabhāve
analyzed: diṭṭhīsu sañjāyanti samosaramānā api etāsu yeva samosaranti sannipatanti diṭṭhigatika bhāve
translated: and they meet in them, they assemble in them, in the state of being those who hold views.

original: ca nesaṃ imāyeva dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyo kāraṇaṃ, tasmā yathāvuttaṃ titthameva sañjātiādinā
analyzed: ca imāyā iva dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyo kāraṇam tasmā yathā vuttam tittham eva sañjāti ādinā
translated: and the reason for their sixty-two views is just this. Therefore, in the sense of the meaning stated thus, “The view is born in this way,”

original: atthena āyatananti titthāyatanaṃ, tenevatthena titthīnaṃ āyatanantipi titthāyatanaṃ.🔽Āyasmato nissāya vacchāmīti ettha āyasmatoti upayogatthe sāmivacanaṃ, āyasmantaṃ
analyzed: atthena āyatananti titthāyatanam tena iva atthena titthīnam āyatanam tipi titthāyatanam  āyasmataḥ nissāya vacchāmi iti ettha upayoga tthe sāmi vacanam āyasmantam
translated: the place of the view is a “view-place” . In the same sense it is also a “view-place” for the view-holders.

original: nissāya vasissāmīti attho. Byatto…pe… vuttalakkhaṇoyevāti parisupaṭṭhāpakabahussutaṃ
analyzed: nissāya vasissāmi iti atthaḥ byatta upe vutta lakkhaṇaḥ yā iva ati parisupaṭṭhāpaka bahussutam
translated: “I will live depending on the venerable one” : here the word “venerable one” is in the instrumental case in the sense of means, the meaning being “I will live depending on the venerable one.” “Is able” … “has the characteristics already stated” : he says this referring to one who is a good helper and is learned.

original: sandhāya vadati. Pañcahupāli aṅgehītiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ parato āvi bhavissati.
analyzed: sandhāya vadati pañcahupāli aṅgehi itiādīsu yam vattabbam tam paratas bhavissati
translated: As to the words “If, Upāli, there are five qualities” and so on, what is to be said has been said above .

original: Ācariyavattakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ācariyavatta kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “Discourse on the Teacher’s Preceptor” is ended.

original: Paṇāmanākhamāpanākathāvaṇṇanā🔽80. Yaṃ pubbe lakkhaṇaṃ vuttanti sambandho, “teneva lakkhaṇena nissayantevāsikassa
analyzed: paṇāmanā khamāpanā kathā vaṇṇanā  yat pubbe lakkhaṇam vuttanti sambandhaḥ tena iva lakkhaṇena nissaya antevāsikassa
translated: The explanation of the “Discourse on Sending Away and Sending Back”

original: āpatti veditabbā”ti potthakesu pāṭho dissati, “na teneva lakkhaṇena nissayantevāsikassa
analyzed: āpatti veditabbā ti potthakesu pāṭhaḥ dissati na tena iva lakkhaṇena nissaya antevāsikassa
translated: The connection is this: “The characteristic stated previously” . The reading found in the books is “The offense of the pupil living with the teacher should be understood according to that same characteristic.” “The offense of the pupil living with the teacher should not be understood according to that same characteristic.”

original: āpatti veditabbā”ti evaṃ panettha pāṭho veditabbo. Saddhivihārikassa vuttalakkhaṇena
analyzed: āpatti veditabbā ti evam pana ittha pāṭhaḥ veditabbaḥ saddhivihārikassa vutta lakkhaṇena
translated: And the offence should be understood thus: this is how the text should be understood here.

original: nissayantevāsikassa āpatti na veditabbāti evaṃ panettha atthopi veditabbo. Aññathā
analyzed: nissaya antevāsikassa āpatti na veditabbā ti evam pana ittha atthaḥ api veditabbaḥ aññathā
translated: The offence of the pupil who is a non-stayer-at-home should not be understood thus: this is how the meaning should be understood here. Otherwise,

original: “nissayantevāsikena hi yāva ācariyaṃ nissāya vasati, tāva sabbaṃ ācariyavattaṃ kātabba”nti
analyzed: nissaya antevāsikena hi yāva ācariyam nissāya vasati tāva sabbam ācariya vattam kātabbanti
translated: “For as long as the pupil who is a non-stayer-at-home stays in dependence on the teacher, for that long he should do all the duties to the teacher,”

original: idaṃ virujjheyya. Idañhi vacanaṃ nissayantevāsikassa amuttanissayasseva vattaṃ akarontassa
analyzed: idam virujjheyya idam hi vacanam nissaya antevāsikassa a mutta nissayassa iva vattam a karontassa
translated: this would be contradicted. For this statement shows that there is an offence for one who does not do the duties to the pupil who is a non-stayer-at-home, who is still in dependence.

original: āpattīti dīpeti. Tasmā saddhivihārikassa yathāvuttavattaṃ akarontassa nissayamuttakassa
analyzed: āpatti iti dīpeti tasmai saddhivihārikassa yathā vutta vattam a karontassa nissaya muttakassa
translated: Therefore it should be taken that there is an offence for the pupil who is a stay-at-home, who is still in dependence, and who does not do the duties as stated, and also for the pupil who is a stay-at-home, who is no longer in dependence,

original: amuttakassapi āpatti, nissayantevāsikassa pana amuttanissayasseva āpattīti gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: amuttakassa api āpatti nissaya antevāsikassa pana amutta nissayassa iva āpatti iti gahetabbam
translated: but there is an offence only for the pupil who is a non-stayer-at-home, who is still in dependence.

original: Teneva visuddhimaggepi ñātipalibodhakathāyaṃ –
analyzed: tena iva visuddhi magge pi ñāti pali bodha kathā ayam
translated: And so in the Path of Purity too, in the section on “hindrances to relatives,”

original: “Ñātīti vihāre ācariyupajjhāyasaddhivihārikaantevāsikasamānupajjhāyakasamānācariyakā,
analyzed: ñātī iti vihāre ācariya upajjhāya saddhivihārika antevāsika samān upajjhāyaka samāna ācariyakā
translated: “Relatives: in the monastery, teachers, preceptors, pupils, those who are subject to the same teacher, those who are subject to the same preceptor,

original: ghare mātā pitā bhaginī bhātāti evamādikā. Te gilānā imassa palibodhā honti, tasmā
analyzed: ghare mātā pitā bhaginī bhātā ati evamādikā te gilānāḥ imassa palibodhāḥ honti tasmā
translated: Mother, father, sister, brother, and so on. They are a hindrance to him when he is sick. Therefore

original: so palibodho upaṭṭhahitvā tesaṃ pākatikakaraṇena upacchinditabbo. Tattha upajjhāyo
analyzed: so palibodhaḥ upaṭṭhahitvā tesam pākatika karaṇena upacchinditabbaḥ tattha upajjhāyo
translated: the hindrance should be cut off by nursing them and making them well again. Herein, the preceptor

original: tāva gilāno sace lahuṃ na vuṭṭhāti, yāvajīvaṃ paṭijaggitabbo. Tathā pabbajjācariyo
analyzed: tāva gilānaḥ sace lahum na vuṭṭhāti yāvajīvam paṭijaggitabbo tathā pabbajja ācariyaḥ
translated: is to be nursed as long as he lives if he does not recover quickly. So too the teacher who gave him the Going Forth,

original: upasampadācariyo saddhivihāriko upasampāditapabbājitaantevāsikasamānupajjhāyakā ca.
analyzed: upasampad ācariyaḥ saddhivihārikaḥ upasampādita pabbājita antevāsika samāna upajjhāyakā ca
translated: the teacher who gave him the full admission, the pupil, the pupil who is a student, and the pupil who is a teacher.

original: Nissayācariya uddesācariya nissayantevāsika uddesantevāsikasamānācariyakā pana yāva
analyzed: nissaya ācariya uddesa ācariya nissaya antevāsika uddesa antevāsika samāna ācariyakā pana yāva
translated: The teacher who gave him dependence, the teacher who gave him instruction, the pupil who is a dependent, the pupil who is a student, and the pupil who is a teacher, are to be nursed

original: nissayauddesā anupacchinnā, tāva paṭijaggitabbā”ti –🔽Vibhāgena vuttaṃ. Ayañca vibhāgo “teneva lakkhaṇena nissayantevāsikassa āpatti veditabbā”ti
analyzed: nissaya oddesā anupacchinnā tāva paṭijaggitabbā ati  vibhāgena vuttam ayam ca vibhāgaḥ tena iva lakkhaṇena nissaya antevāsikassa āpatti veditabbā ati
translated: as long as the dependence or the instruction is not cut off.”

original: evaṃ pāṭhe sati na yujjeyya. Ayañhi pāṭho saddhivihārikassa viya nissayantevāsikassapi
analyzed: evam pāṭhe sati na yujjeyya ayam hi pāṭhaḥ saddhivihārikassa viya nissaya antevāsikassa api
translated: This is said by analysis. And this analysis would not be proper if the reading were “The offence of the pupil who is a dependent should be understood in the same way.” For this reading, like that for the pupil who is a student,

original: yathāvuttavattaṃ akarontassa nissayamuttakassa amuttakassapi āpattīti imamatthaṃ
analyzed: yathā vutta vattam a karontassa nissaya muttakassa a muttakassa api āpatti iti imam attham
translated: The meaning is that there is an offence for one who does not do as is said, whether he has taken the formal support or not.

original: dīpeti, tasmā vuttanayenevettha pāṭho gahetabbo.
analyzed: dīpeti tasmā vutta nayena iva ittha pāṭhaḥ gahetabbaḥ
translated: Therefore the reading should be taken in the way stated.

original: Pabbajjaupasampadadhammantevāsikehi pana…pe… tāva vattaṃ kātabbanti pabbajjācariyaupasampadācariyadhammācariyānaṃ
analyzed: pabbajja aupasampada dhamma antevāsikehi panape tāva vattam kātabbanti pabbajja ācariya aupasampada ācariya dhamma ācariyānam
translated: But with the one who has gone forth, with the one who has been ordained, with the pupil in the Dhamma … and so on.

original: Etehi yathāvuttavattaṃ kātabbaṃ. Tattha yena sikkhāpadāni dinnāni, ayaṃ pabbajjācariyo.
analyzed: etehi yathā vutta vattam kātabbam tattha yena sikkhāpadāni dinnāni ayam pabbajja ācariyo
translated: The duties are to be done by these as stated. Herein, the one who has given the training rules is the one who has gone forth.

original: Yena upasampadakammavācā vuttā, ayaṃ upasampadācariyo. Yo uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ vā
analyzed: yena upasampada kamma vācā vuttā ayam upasampada ācariyaḥ yaḥ uddesam paripuccham vā
translated: The one who has recited the ordination formula is the one who has been ordained. The one who gives the recitation or the interrogation

original: deti, ayaṃ dhammācariyoti veditabbaṃ. Sesamettha uttānameva.
analyzed: deti ayam dhamma ācariyaḥ ti veditabbam sesam ettha uttānam eva
translated: should be understood as the one who is the teacher of the Dhamma. The rest here is self-evident.

original: Paṇāmanākhamāpanākathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṇāmanā khamāpanā kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the section on sending away and on being sent away is ended.

original: Nissayapaṭippassaddhikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nissaya paṭippassaddhi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the ending of formal support

original: 83. Nissayapaṭippassaddhikathāyaṃ disaṃ gatoti puna āgantukāmo anāgantukāmo vā hutvā
analyzed: nissaya paṭippassaddhi kathā ayam disam gataḥ ti punar āgantu kāmaḥ anāgantu kāmaḥ vā hutvā
translated: In the section on the ending of formal support, “gone to a far place” means that he has gone to a far place with the intention of returning or without the intention of returning.

original: vāsatthāya kañci disaṃ gato. Bhikkhuno sabhāgatanti pesalabhāvaṃ. Oloketvāti upaparikkhitvā.🔽Vibbhante…pe… tattha gantabbanti ettha sace kenaci karaṇīyena tadaheva gantuṃ asakkonto
analyzed: vāsa atthāya kañci disam gataḥ bhikkhuno sabhā gatanti pesala bhāvam oloketvā ati upaparikkhitvā  tattha gantabbanti ettha sace kenacid karaṇīyena tadahā iva gantum a sakkonto
translated: he has gone in some direction for the sake of the rains. The monk’s equal status: his being a good person. Having looked: having investigated.

original: katipāhena gamissāmīti gamane saussāho hoti, rakkhatīti vadanti. Mā idha paṭikkamīti
analyzed: kati pāhena gamissāmi iti gamane saussāhaḥ hoti rakkhati iti vadanti mā idha paṭikkamīti
translated: If he thinks, “I’ll go in a few days,” and he makes an effort to go, they say he is protected. He should not return there:

original: mā idha pavisi. Tatreva vasitabbanti tattheva nissayaṃ gahetvā vasitabbaṃ. Taṃyeva
analyzed: mā idha pavisi tatra iva vasitabbanti tattha iva nissayam gahetvā vasitabbam
translated: he should not enter there. He should stay right there: he should stay right there, having taken a formal support.

original: vihāraṃ…pe… vasituṃ vaṭṭatīti ettha upajjhāyena pariccattattā upajjhāyasamodhānaparihāro
analyzed: vihāraṃpe vasitum vaṭṭati iti ettha upajjhāyena pariccatta ttā upajjhāya samodhāna parihāro
translated: If he thinks, “I’ll go back to that monastery,” and he makes an effort to go, they say he is protected.🔽In the case of “the formal support that he has taken from his teacher is not relinquished,” since it has been given by the preceptor, there is no relinquishment of the formal support through reunion with the preceptor.

original: natthi, tasmā upajjhāyena samodhānagatassapi ācariyassa santike gahitanissayo na paṭippassambhati.
analyzed: natthi tasmai upajjhāyena samodhāna gatassa api ācariyassa santike gahita nissayaḥ na paṭippassambhati
translated: Therefore, even if the preceptor has gone away, the formal support that he has taken in the presence of the teacher is not relinquished.

original: Ācariyamhā nissayapaṭippassaddhīsu ācariyo pakkanto vā hotīti ettha “pakkantoti disaṃ
analyzed: ācariyamhā nissaya paṭippassaddhīsu ācariyo pakkantaḥ vā hoti iti ettha pakkantaḥ ti disam
translated: In the case of “the teacher has gone away or died or left the monastery or become established as a woman,” “gone away” means that he has gone in a direction.

original: gato”tiādinā upajjhāyassa pakkamane yo vinicchayo vutto, so tattha vuttanayeneva
analyzed: gataḥ ti ādinā upajjhāyassa pakkamane yaḥ vinicchayaḥ vutto saḥ tattha vutta nayena iva
translated: The decision given in the case of the preceptor’s departure, beginning, “If he has gone … ” should be understood here in the same way as there.

original: idhāpi sakkā viññātunti taṃ avatvā “koci ācariyo āpucchitvā pakkamatī”tiādinā aññoyeva
analyzed: idha api sakkā viññātunti tam avatvā koci ācariyaḥ āpucchitvā pakkamati iti ādinā
translated: But instead of that, another method is begun here with the words, “If a teacher departs without taking leave” and so on.

original: nayo āraddho, ayañca nayo upajjhāyapakkamanepi veditabboyeva. Īdisesu hi ṭhānesu
analyzed: nayaḥ āraddhaḥ ayam ca nayaḥ upajjhāya pakkamane pi veditabbaḥ yā iva īdisesu hi ṭhānesu
translated: And this method should be understood also in the case of the preceptor’s departure. For in such cases🔽the characteristics given in one place should be understood to apply elsewhere too.

original: ekattha vuttalakkhaṇaṃ aññatthāpi daṭṭhabbaṃ. Sace dve leḍḍupāte atikkamitvā nivattati,🔽paṭippassaddho hotīti ettha ettāvatā disāpakkanto nāma hotīti antevāsike anikkhittadhurepi🔽nissayo paṭippassambhati. Ācariyupajjhāyā dve leḍḍupāte atikkamma aññasmiṃ vihāre🔽vasantīti bahiupacārasīmāyaṃ antevāsikasaddhivihārikānaṃ vasanaṭṭhānato dve leḍḍupāte
analyzed: ekattha vutta lakkhaṇam aññattha api daṭṭhabbam sace dve leḍḍupāte atikkamitvā nivattati  paṭippassaddhaḥ hoti iti ettha ettāvatā disāpakkantaḥ nāma hoti iti antevāsike a nikkhitta dhure pi  nissayaḥ paṭippassambhati ācariya upajjhāyā dve leḍḍupāte atikkamma aññasmin vihāre  vasanti iti antevāsika saddhivihārikānam vasana ṭṭhānataḥ dve leḍḍupāte
translated: If he turns back after going beyond two throwing-sticks’ lengths,🔽the support is broken if he goes beyond two throwing-sticks’ lengths.🔽The teacher and the preceptor are “staying in another dwelling” if they are staying in a dwelling outside the range of two throwing-sticks

original: atikkamma aññasmiṃ senāsane vasanti, antoupacārasīmāyaṃ pana dve leḍḍupāte atikkamitvāpi
analyzed: atikkamma aññasmim senāsane vasanti antoupacāra sīmāyam pana dve leḍḍupāte atikkamitvā api
translated: from the place where the pupil or student is living. But if they are staying within the range of two throwing-sticks from the boundary of the monastery,

original: vasato nissayo na paṭippassambhati. “Sacepi ācariyo muñcitukāmova hutvā nissayapaṇāmanāya
analyzed: vasataḥ nissayaḥ na paṭippassambhati sace pi ācariyaḥ muñcitu kāmaḥ iva hutvā nissaya paṇāmanāya
translated: If the preceptor wants to give up the pupil, he should give him back his bowl and robes.

original: paṇāmetī”tiādi sabbaṃ upajjhāyassa āṇattiyampi veditabbaṃ. Sesamettha uttānameva.
analyzed: paṇāmeti itiādi sabbam upajjhāyassa āṇattiyam pi veditabbam sesam ettha uttānam eva
translated: If the preceptor’s is not, then the pupil’s is not. “If the preceptor, wishing to be rid of him, dismisses him by means of a preceptor’s acts of relinquishment” , etc., should be understood in the same way in the case of the preceptor’s command. The rest here is clear.

original: Nissayapaṭippassaddhikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nissaya paṭippassaddhi kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the ending of the pupil-status is finished.

original: Upasampādetabbapañcakakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: upasampādetabba pañcaka kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the five who should be given Acceptance

original: 84. Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatenātiādīsu na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabboti upajjhāyena hutvā sāmaṇero na gahetabbo. Ayamattho aṅguttaranikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttoyeva.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatena atiādīsu na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo ti upajjhāyena hutvā sāmaṇeraḥ na gahetabbaḥ ayam atthaḥ aṅguttara nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam vuttaḥ yā eva
translated: is finished. As regards the passages beginning, “Monks, when a pupil is endowed with five qualities” , a novice should not be taken on as a pupil: a novice should not be taken on as a pupil by one who is a preceptor. The meaning of this has already been given in the Commentary on the Anguttara Nikāya.🔽“First of all one should establish oneself,

original: “Attānameva paṭhamaṃ, patirūpe nivesaye;
analyzed: attānam eva paṭhamam pati rūpe nivesaye
translated: And then one should instruct another;🔽The wise one does not get defiled

original: Athaññamanusāseyya, na kilisseyya paṇḍito”ti. –
analyzed: athaññam anusāseyya na kilisseyya paṇḍito ti
translated: By one who is not trained in oneself.”

original: Imassa anurūpavasena paṭhamaṃ tāva attasampattiyaṃ niyojetuṃ “na asekkhena sīlakkhandhenā”tiādi
analyzed: imassa anurūpa vasena paṭhamam tāva atta sampattiyam niyojetum na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena atiādi
translated: In accordance with this, the following is said in order to induce him to devote himself to the perfection of his own character first: “He should not be without the aggregate of virtue of one in training” ,

original: vuttaṃ, na āpattiaṅgavasena. Tattha asekkhena sīlakkhandhenāti asekkhassa sīlakkhandho
analyzed: vuttam na āpatti aṅga vasena tattha asekkhena sīla kkhandhena ati asekkhassa sīla kkhandho
translated: and not in the sense of the conditions for an offence. Herein, the aggregate of virtue of one in training is the aggregate of virtue of a person in training.

original: asekkho sīlakkhandho nāma. Asekkhassa ayanti hi asekkho, sīlakkhandho. Evaṃ sabbattha.
analyzed: asekkhaḥ sīlakkhandho nāma asekkhassa ayanti hi asekkhaḥ sīlakkhandho evam sabbattha
translated: The virtue aggregate of the adept is called the adept’s virtue. The adept’s virtue is so called because it belongs to the adept. So with all the rest.

original: Evañca katvā vimuttiñāṇadassanasaṅkhātassa paccavekkhaṇañāṇassapi asekkhatā upapannā.
analyzed: evam ca katvā vimutti ñāṇa dassana saṅkhātassa paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇassa api asekkha tā upapannā
translated: And this being so, the adeptness of the reviewing knowledge called “knowledge and vision of freedom” is established.

original: Asekkhasīlanti ca na maggaphalameva adhippetaṃ, atha kho yaṃkiñci asekkhasantāne
analyzed: asekkha sīlam ti ca na magga phalam eva adhippetam atha kho yaṃ kiñci asekkha santāne
translated: And the adept’s virtue is not only the path and fruition; it is also any virtue that occurs in the adept’s continuity,

original: pavattasīlaṃ lokiyalokuttaramissakassa sīlassa idhādhippetattā. Samādhikkhandhādīsupi
analyzed: pavatta sīlam lokiya lokuttara missakassa sīlassa idha adhippetattā samādhi kkhandha ādīsu pi
translated: because mixed virtue consisting of mundane and supramundane is intended here. The same method applies in the case of the concentration aggregate, etc.,

analyzed: vimutti kkhandha pariyosānesu ayam eva nayaḥ tasmai yathā sīla samādhi pañña kkhandhāḥ missakā  adhippetāḥ evam vimutti khandhaḥ api iti tad aṅga vimutti ādayaḥ api veditabbāḥ na paṭippassaddhi vimutti

original: eva. Vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ pana lokiyameva. Teneva saṃyuttanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ🔽“purimehi catūhi padehi lokiyalokuttarasīlasamādhipaññāvimuttiyo kathitā, vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ
analyzed: eva vimutti ñāṇa dassanam pana lokiyam eva tena iva saṃyutta nikāya ṭṭhakathāyam vuttam 🔽purimehi catūhi padehi lokiya lokuttara sīla samādhi paññā vimuttiyaḥ kathitāḥ vimutti ñāṇa dassanam
translated: But the knowledge and vision of freedom is mundane only. That is why it is said in the commentary to the Saṃyutta Nikāya:

original: Assaddhotiādīsu tīsu vatthūsu saddhā etassa natthīti assaddho. Sukkapakkhe saddahatīti

translated: He is not afraid, thus he is “unafraid” .🔽This is a term for one who is not afraid of misconduct.

analyzed: akusala samāpattiyā na bhāyati iti vuttam hoti tad biparītaḥ ottappī kucchitam sīdati iti

original: Abhivisiṭṭho uttamo samācāroti abhisamācāro, abhisamācārova sikkhitabbato sikkhāti🔽ābhisamācārikā sikkhā, abhisamācāraṃ vā ārabbha paññattā sikkhā ābhisamācārikā. Maggabrahmacariyassa
analyzed: abhivisiṭṭhaḥ uttamaḥ samācāro ti abhisamācāraḥ abhisamācāro uva sikkhitabbataḥ sikkhāti  ābhisamācārikā sikkhā abhisamācāram vā ārabbha paññattā sikkhā ābhisamācārikā magga brahmacariyassa
translated: The training in the higher conduct is the training in the higher conduct that is distinguished, that is, the best.🔽The training in the higher conduct is the training that should be trained in because it is the higher conduct.🔽Or the training in the higher conduct is the training announced in regard to the higher conduct.

analyzed: visuddhi magge vuttam tasmā sekkha paṇṇattiyan ti ettha sikkhitabbataḥ sabbā api ubhatas vibhaṅga pariyāpannā  paṇṇattī iti gahetabbā tena iva gaṇṭhi pade pi vuttam sekkha paṇṇattiyam ti pārājikam ādim  katvā sikkhitabba sikkhāpada paññattiyanti sesam ettha uttānattham eva

analyzed: tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam tat ce nakha piṭṭhi ppamāṇam pi vaḍḍhanaka pakkhe ṭhitam  hoti na pabbājetabbaḥ iti iminā sāmaññataḥ lakkhaṇam dassitam tasmā yattha katthaci

translated: But that is not intended in general terms; so showing it by specifying a place, he said, “But if it is hidden by the natural covering of skin.”

analyzed: pana iti ādim āha sace hi avisesena nakha piṭṭhi ppamāṇam avaḍḍhanaka pakkhe ṭhitam vaṭṭeyya  nivāsana pārupanehi ṭhāne iti padesa niyamam na kareyya tasmai nivāsana pārupanehi

original: na vaṭṭatīti siddhaṃ, nakhapiṭṭhippamāṇato khuddakataraṃ pana avaḍḍhanakapakkhe vaḍḍhanakapakkhe🔽vā ṭhitaṃ hotu, vaṭṭati nakhapiṭṭhippamāṇato khuddakatarassa vaḍḍhanakapakkhe avaḍḍhanakapakkhe
analyzed: na vaṭṭati iti siddham nakha piṭṭhi ppamāṇataḥ khuddakataram pana a vaḍḍhanaka pakkhe vaḍḍhanaka pakkhe  vā ṭhitam hotu vaṭṭati nakha piṭṭhi ppamāṇataḥ khuddakatarassa vaḍḍhanaka pakkhe a vaḍḍhanaka pakkhe
translated: It is established that it is not allowable. But if it is smaller than the size of the back of a fingernail, whether it is in the stage of non-increase or in the stage of increase, it is allowable.

translated: For what is smaller than the size of the back of a fingernail, whether it is in the stage of increase or in the stage of non-increase, is prohibited only in the mouth, etc.

original: Gaṇḍepi imināva nayena vinicchayo veditabbo. Tattha pana mukhādīsu kolaṭṭhimattato🔽khuddakataropi gaṇḍo na vaṭṭatīti visuṃ na dassito. “Mukhādike appaṭicchannaṭṭhāne
analyzed: gaṇḍe pi iminā ava nayena vinicchayaḥ veditabbo tattha pana mukha ādīsu kolaṭṭhi mattato  khuddakataraḥ api gaṇḍaḥ na vaṭṭati iti visum na dassitaḥ mukha ādike appaṭicchanna ṭhāne
translated: The explanation of boils should be understood in the same way. But here, even a boil smaller than the size of a jujube fruit is not allowable in the mouth, etc.

original: avaḍḍhanakapakkhe ṭhitopi na vaṭṭatī”ti ettakameva hi tattha vuttaṃ, tathāpi kuṭṭhe
analyzed: avaḍḍhanaka pakkhe ṭhitaḥ api na vaṭṭati iti ettakam eva hi tattha vuttam tathā api kuṭṭhe

original: vuttanayena mukhādīsu kolaṭṭhippamāṇato khuddakataropi gaṇḍo na vaṭṭatīti viññāyati,
analyzed: vutta nayena mukha ādīsu kola ṭṭhi ppamāṇato khuddakataraḥ api gaṇḍo na vaṭṭati iti viññāyati
translated: But it can be understood that even a boil smaller than the size of a jujube fruit in the mouth, etc., is not allowable, in the same way as in the case of the abscess on the shoulder-blade.

analyzed: khuddakataraḥ api na vaṭṭati iti ayam atthaḥ dassitaḥ yā iva ati ayam amhākam khanti pakati vaṇṇe
