analyzed: madditvā katā pūva surā evam sesa surā api kiṇṇā ati pana tassā surāya bījam vuccati  ye surāmodakā ati vuccanti te pakkhipitvā katā kiṇṇa pakkhittā harītakī sāsapa ādi nānā sambhārehi
translated: “The resort to liquor, wine, and intoxicants which are the basis for negligence”: here, “liquor” is fivefold: flour liquor, rice liquor, oil-cake liquor, fermented liquor, and liquor made from honey. “Wine” is fivefold: wine made from flowers, wine made from fruits, wine made from honey, wine made from sugar, and wine made from molasses. “The basis for negligence” is the fivefold fermented liquor. Herein, “flour liquor” is made by putting flour in a vessel, adding water, and fermenting it. So too with the rest of the liquors. “Fermented liquor” is the seed of that liquor,

original: saṃyojitā sambhārasaṃyuttā. Madhukatālanāḷikerādipuppharaso ciraparivāsito pupphāsavo.
analyzed: saṃyojitā sambhāra saṃyuttā madhuka tāla nāḷikera ādi puppha rasaḥ cira parivāsito puppha āsavaḥ
translated: which is called “liquor-seed” . “Liquor made from honey” is made by putting that in a vessel and fermenting it. The juice of flowers such as the madhūka, tāla, and nāḷikeraka, kept for a long time, is “wine made from flowers.”

original: Panasādiphalaraso phalāsavo. Muddikāraso madhvāsavo. Ucchuraso guḷāsavo. Harītakaāmalakakaṭukabhaṇḍādinānāsambhārānaṃ
analyzed: panasa ādi phala rasaḥ phala āsavaḥ muddikā rasaḥ madhva āsavaḥ ucchu rasaḥ guḷa āsavaḥ
translated: The juice of fruits such as the pāna, and so on, is “wine made from fruits.” The juice of molasses is “wine made from molasses.” The juice of emblic myrobalan, emblic myrobalan mixed with bitter plants, and so on, is “wine made from molasses.”

original: raso ciraparivāsito sambhārasaṃyutto. Taṃ sabbampi madakaraṇavasena majjaṃ pivantaṃ🔽madayatīti katvā. Pamādaṭṭhānanti pamādakāraṇaṃ. Yāya cetanāya taṃ majjaṃ pivanti,
analyzed: rasaḥ cira parivāsito sambhāra saṃyutto tam sabbam pi mada karaṇa vasena majjam pivantam  madayati iti katvā pamāda ṭṭhānan ti pamāda kāraṇam yāya cetanāya tam majjam pivanti
translated: and the juice, which is the result of a long process of fermentation, is mixed with the dregs. All this is called “strong drink” in the sense that it makes one drunk.🔽It is a state of bewilderment: it is a cause of bewilderment. It is a term for the volition by means of which one drinks the strong drink.

original: tassā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Surāmerayamajje pamādaṭṭhānaṃ surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: tassāḥ etam adhivacanam surā meraya majje pamāda ṭṭhānam surā meraya majja ppamāda ṭṭhānam
translated: Strong drink is a state of bewilderment: strong drink is a state of bewilderment.

original: tasmā surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā.🔽Vikālabhojanāti aruṇuggamanato paṭṭhāya yāva majjhanhikā. Ayaṃ buddhādīnaṃ ariyānaṃ🔽āciṇṇasamāciṇṇo bhojanassa kālo nāma, tadañño vikālo. Bhuñjitabbaṭṭhena bhojanaṃ,🔽yāgubhattādi sabbaṃ yāvakālikavatthu. Yathā ca “rattūparato”ti ettha rattiyā bhojanaṃ
analyzed: tasmā surā meraya majja ppamāda ṭṭhānā  vikāla bhojanā ti aruṇuggamanataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva majjhanhikā ayam buddha ādīnam ariyānam  āciṇṇa samāciṇṇaḥ bhojanassa kālaḥ nāma tad aññaḥ vikālaḥ bhuñjitabba ṭṭhena bhojanam  yāgu bhatta ādi sabbam yāvakālika vatthu yathā ca ettha rattiyā bhojanam
translated: Therefore: because of strong drink as a state of bewilderment.🔽Eating at the wrong time: from the time of dawn until midday is the time for eating, which is called “the noble ones’ proper time” because it is the time proper for eating, which is the custom of the ariyan disciples of the Buddha. Any other time than that is “the wrong time.” Eating is so called because it is what is to be eaten.

original: rattīti uttarapadalopena vuccati, evamettha bhojanajjhoharaṇaṃ bhojananti. Vikāle
analyzed: uttara pada lopena vuccati evam ettha vikāle
translated: All kinds of food, such as gruel and rice, are what is to be eaten at the proper time. And just as in the expression “one who has finished his meal and laid aside his bowl” the word “meal” is used for the eating of the meal , so here “eating” is used for the eating of what is to be eaten at the proper time. At the wrong time:

original: bhojanaṃ vikālabhojanaṃ, tato vikālabhojanā, vikāle yāvakālikavatthussa ajjhoharaṇāti
analyzed: bhojanam vikāla bhojanam tatas vikāla bhojanā vikāle yāvakālika vatthussa ajjhoharaṇā ti
translated: Food is what is to be eaten. The eating of it is the eating of food. The time for it is the time for eating food. The eating of food at a time other than that is eating at the wrong time.

original: attho. Atha vā na ettha kammasādhano bhuñjitabbatthavācako bhojanasaddo, atha kho🔽bhāvasādhano ajjhoharaṇatthavācako gahetabbo, tasmā vikāle bhojanaṃ ajjhoharaṇaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ atha vā na ettha kamma sādhanaḥ bhuñjitabbattha vācakaḥ bhojana saddaḥ atha kho  bhāva sādhanaḥ ajjhoharaṇa attha vācakaḥ gahetabbaḥ tasmā vikāle bhojanam ajjhoharaṇam
translated: Or alternatively, the word “food” here does not express what is to be eaten as a means to the performance of the action of eating, but rather🔽it should be taken as expressing the eating as a means to the performance of the action of existing. Thus the eating of food at a time other than the time for it is eating at the wrong time.

original: vikālabhojanaṃ. Kassa pana ajjhoharaṇanti? Yāmakālikādīnaṃ anuññātattā vikālabhojana-saddassa🔽vā yāvakālikajjhoharaṇe niruḷhattā yāvakālikassāti viññāyati, atthato pana kāyadvārappavattā
analyzed: vikāla bhojanam kassa pana ajjhoharaṇan ti yāma kālikā ādīnam anuññāta ttā vikāla bhojana saddassa  vā yāvakālika ajjhoharaṇe niruḷha ttā yāvakālikassa ati viññāyati atthataḥ pana kāya dvāra ppavattā
translated: But whose eating? Since what is allowed is the eating of what is allowable for a day and so on, it is understood that it is the eating of what is allowable for a day,

original: vikāle yāvakālikajjhoharaṇacetanā “vikālabhojana”nti veditabbā.🔽Naccagītavāditavisūkadassanāti ettha sāsanassa ananulomattā visūkaṃ paṭāṇībhūtaṃ
analyzed: vikāle vikāla bhojanam ti veditabbā  nacca gīta vādita visūka dassanā ti ettha sāsanassa an anuloma ttā visūkam paṭāṇībhūtam
translated: because the word “eating at the wrong time” is established in the sense of the eating of what is allowable for a day. But in the sense of what is meant, it should be understood as “eating at the wrong time” being the volition occurring at the door of the body in the wrong time of what is allowable for a day.🔽In the case of the words “dancing, singing, music, and watching dancing and so on”: because of its being contrary to the Dispensation, watching dancing and so on is called “watching shows” .

original: dassananti visūkadassanaṃ. Naccādīnañhi dassanaṃ sachandarāgappavattito saṅkhepato
analyzed: dassananti visūka dassanam nacca ādīnam hi dassanam sa chanda rāga ppavattitaḥ saṅkhepato
translated: For the watching of dancing and so on is a contraction of the occurrence of lust accompanied by appreciation.

original: “sabbapāpassa akaraṇa”ntiādinayappavattaṃ bhagavato sāsanaṃ na anulometi. Naccañca
analyzed: sabba pāpassa akaraṇa nti ādi naya ppavattam bhagavataḥ sāsanam na anulomā iti
translated: “He does not conform to the Dispensation of the Blessed One, which is expressed in such passages as ‘Abandoning of all evil unwholesome states’ .

original: gītañca vāditañca visūkadassanañca naccagītavāditavisūkadassanaṃ. Attanā payojiyamānaṃ
analyzed: gītañca vāditañca visūka dassanañca nacca gīta vādita visūka dassanam attanā payojiyamānam
translated: Dancing, singing, instrumental music, and watching shows are dancing, singing, instrumental music, and watching shows.

original: parehi payojāpiyamānañcettha naccaṃ naccabhāvasāmaññato pāḷiyaṃ ekeneva nacca-saddena🔽gahitaṃ, tathā gītavādita-saddehi gāyanagāyāpanavādanavādāpanāni, tasmā attanā naccananaccāpanādivasena🔽naccā ca gītā ca vāditā ca antamaso mayūranaccādivasenapi pavattānaṃ naccādīnaṃ visūkabhūtā
analyzed: parehi ekena iva nacca saddena  tathā gīta vādita saddehi gāyana gāyāpana vādana vādāpanāni tasmai naccana naccāpana ādi vasena  naccā ca gītā ca vāditā ca antamasaḥ mayūra naccā divasena api naccā ādīnam visūka bhūtā
translated: Herein, dancing is what is done by oneself or got done by others,🔽and it is included in the text by the single word “dancing” because it has the nature of dancing in common. Likewise, singing and instrumental music are what is done by oneself or got done by others, and they are included in the text by the single words “singing” and “instrumental music” because they have the nature of singing and instrumental music in common.

original: dassanā ca veramaṇīti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Naccādīni attanā payojetuṃ vā parehi
analyzed: dassanā ca veramaṇī iti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ nacca ādīni attanā payojetum vā parehi
translated: Therefore the meaning here should be regarded as follows: “Abstinence from dancing, singing, and instrumental music, and abstinence from watching shows, which are the worst kind of shows,

original: payojāpetuṃ vā payuttāni passituṃ vā neva bhikkhūnaṃ na bhikkhunīnaṃ vaṭṭati. Dassanena
analyzed: vā payuttāni passitum vā na iva bhikkhūnam na bhikkhunīnam vaṭṭati dassanena
translated: are abstinence from wrong livelihood.” It is not allowable for bhikkhus or bhikkhunīs either to engage in dancing, singing, or instrumental music themselves or to get others to do so or to watch shows.

original: cettha savanampi saṅgahitaṃ virūpekasesanayena. Yathā sakaṃ visayaālocanasabhāvatāya
analyzed: savanam pi saṅgahitam virūpa eka sesa nayena yathā sakam visaya ālocana sabhāva tāya
translated: and hearing is included here by the method of “excluding the dissimilar and taking the remainder.”

original: vā pañcannaṃ viññāṇānaṃ savanakiriyāyapi dassanasaṅkhepasambhavato “dassanā” icceva
analyzed: vā pañcannam viññāṇānam dassana saṅkhepa sambhavataḥ dassanāḥ icca eva
translated: Or alternatively, because of the state of seeing, which is the individual objective field of the five consciousnesses,🔽it is said “seeing” because of the possibility of the inclusion of hearing, and so on.

original: vuttaṃ. Teneva vuttaṃ “pañcahi viññāṇehi na kañci dhammaṃ paṭivijānāti aññatra abhinipātamattā”ti.🔽Dassanakamyatāya upasaṅkamitvā passato eva cettha vītikkamo hoti, ṭhitanisinnasayanokāse
analyzed: vuttam tena iva vuttam pañcahi viññāṇehi na kañci dhammam paṭivijānāti aññatra abhinipāta mattā ati  dassana kamyatāya upasaṅkamitvā passataḥ eva ca ittha vītikkamaḥ hoti ṭhita nisinna sayana ukāse
translated: That is why it is said, “He does not cognize any idea by means of the five consciousnesses except for the mere fact of its impact” .

original: pana āgataṃ gacchantassa vā āpāthagataṃ passato siyā saṃkileso, na vītikkamo.
analyzed: pana āgatam gacchantassa vā āpātha gatam passataḥ siyā saṃkilesaḥ na vītikkamaḥ
translated: Here the transgression is only for one who, being desirous of seeing, goes up to the place and sees. But if one who is standing, sitting, or lying down sees one who has come into his range of sight or who is going, there may be defilement but there is no transgression.

original: Mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānāti ettha mālāti yaṃ kiñci pupphaṃ.
analyzed: mālā gandha vilepana dhāraṇa maṇḍana vibhūsana ṭṭhānā ti ettha mālā ati yam kiñci puppham
translated: Wearing garlands, scents, and unguents, and using adornment and ornamentation: here, a garland is any kind of flower.

original: Kiñcāpi hi mālā-saddo loke baddhamālavācako, sāsane pana ruḷhiyā pupphesupi vutto,
analyzed: kiñcā api hi mālā saddaḥ loke baddha māla vācakaḥ sāsane pana ruḷhiyā pupphesu pi vutto
translated: For although in the world the word “garland” is a term for a bound garland, in the Dispensation it is used for flowers by derivation,

original: tasmā yaṃ kiñci pupphaṃ baddhamabaddhaṃ vā, taṃ sabbaṃ “mālā”ti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Gandhanti
analyzed: tasmai yam kiñci puppham baddham a baddham vā tam sabbam mālāti daṭṭhabbam gandhanti
translated: therefore any kind of flower, whether bound or unbound, should be regarded as a “garland.” Scents are of three kinds: root scents, etc.,

original: vāsacuṇṇadhūmādikaṃ vilepanato aññaṃ yaṃ kiñci gandhajātaṃ. Vilepananti vilepanatthaṃ
analyzed: vāsa cuṇṇa dhūma ādikam vilepanataḥ aññam yam kiñci gandha jātam vilepananti vilepana attham
translated: Unguent is any kind of cosmetic prepared by pounding for the purpose of anointing.

original: pisitvā paṭiyattaṃ yaṃ kiñci chavirāgakaraṇaṃ. Piḷandhanaṃ dhāraṇaṃ, ūnaṭṭhānapūraṇaṃ
analyzed: pisitvā paṭiyattam yam kiñci chavi rāga karaṇam piḷandhanam dhāraṇam ūna ṭṭhāna pūraṇam
translated: To wear is to carry. To adorn is to fill in the gaps.

original: maṇḍanaṃ, gandhavasena chavirāgavasena ca sādiyanaṃ vibhūsanaṃ. Teneva dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: maṇḍanam gandha vasena chavi rāga vasena ca vibhūsanam tena iva
translated: To ornament is to consent to the wearing of garlands, etc., for the purpose of scent and for the purpose of concealing a bad colour.🔽Hence it is said in the Commentary on the Digha Nikāya,

original: majjhimanikāyaṭṭhakathāyañca “piḷandhanto dhāreti nāma, ūnaṭṭhānaṃ pūrento maṇḍeti
analyzed: majjhima nikāya ṭṭhakathāyañca piḷandhantaḥ dhārā iti nāma ūna ṭṭhānam pūrentaḥ maṇḍā iti
translated: and in the Commentary on the Majjhima Nikāya, “To wear is to carry. To adorn is to fill in the gaps.

original: nāma, gandhavasena chavirāgavasena ca sādiyanto vibhūseti nāmā”ti vuttaṃ. Paramatthajotikāyaṃ
analyzed: nāma gandha vasena chavi rāga vasena ca vibhūseti nāma ati vuttam
translated: To ornament is to consent to the wearing of garlands, etc., for the purpose of scent and for the purpose of concealing a bad colour.”

original: pana khuddakaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “mālādīsu dhāraṇādīni yathāsaṅkhyaṃ yojetabbānī”ti ettakameva🔽vuttaṃ. Ṭhānaṃ vuccati kāraṇaṃ, tasmā yāya dussīlyacetanāya tāni mālādhāraṇādīni
analyzed: pana mālā ādīsu dhāraṇā ādīni yathāsaṅkhyam yojetabbāni iti ettakam eva  vuttam ṭhānam vuccati kāraṇam tasmai yāya dussīlya cetanāya tāni mālādhāraṇa ādīni
translated: But in the Paramatthajotikā, the Commentary on the Minor Books, it is said: “The wearing, etc., should be construed respectively with the garlands, etc.”

original: mahājano karoti, sā dhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: karoti sā dhāraṇa maṇḍana vibhūsana ṭṭhānam
translated: The word “place” means a cause. Therefore the wearing of garlands, etc., is the place for wearing, adorning, and ornamenting in the sense of the volition of unvirtuousness by which the multitude does them.

original: Uccāsayanamahāsayanāti ettha uccāti ucca-saddena samānatthaṃ ekaṃ saddantaraṃ. Seti🔽etthāti sayanaṃ, uccāsayanañca mahāsayanañca uccāsayanamahāsayanaṃ. Uccāsayanaṃ vuccati
analyzed: ettha uccā ati ucca saddena samāna attham ekam  ettha ati sayanam uccāsayanam ca mahāsayanam ca uccāsayana mahāsayanam uccāsayanam vuccati
translated: High and luxurious couches: here the word uccā is a synonym for ucca, and the word sayana is a synonym for sayana.

original: pamāṇātikkantaṃ mañcādi. Mahāsayanaṃ akappiyattharaṇehi atthataṃ āsandādi. Āsanañcettha🔽sayaneneva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yasmā pana ādhāre paṭikkhitte tadādhārā kiriyā🔽paṭikkhittāva hoti, tasmā “uccāsayanamahāsayanā” icceva vuttaṃ, atthato pana tadupabhogabhūtanisajjānipajjanehi
analyzed: pamāṇa atikkantam mañca ādi mahā sayanam a kappiya ttharaṇehi atthatam āsanda ādi āsanam ca ittha  sayanena iva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam yasmā pana ādhāre paṭikkhitte tad ādhārā kiriyā  paṭikkhittā ava hoti tasmai uccāsayana mahāsayanā icca iva vuttam atthataḥ pana tad upabhoga bhūta nisajjā nipajjanehi
translated: The word uccāsayana means high and luxurious couches. A couch that exceeds the right size is called a high couch. A couch such as a divan that is made up with improper spreads is called a luxurious couch. Here the word āsanā should be regarded as included in the word sayanā.

original: virati dassitāti daṭṭhabbā. Atha vā uccāsayanamahāsayanasayanāti etasmiṃ atthe ekasesanayena
analyzed: virati dassitā ati daṭṭhabbā atha vā uccāsayana mahāsayana sayanā ati etasmin atthe ekasesa nayena
translated: But since the action is prohibited when the support is prohibited, therefore it is said “high and luxurious couches and seats.” But in the sense of the avoidance of the reclining and sitting on them, which are the use of them, it should be regarded as shown. Or else, in the sense of high and luxurious couches and seats and reclining on them, this description is made by the method of a single inclusion,

original: ayaṃ niddeso kato yathā “nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatana”nti, āsanakiriyāpubbakattā sayanakiriyāya
analyzed: ayam niddeso kataḥ yathā nāma rūpa paccayā saṅgāyatanam ti āsana kiriyā pubbaka ttā sayana kiriyāya
translated: like the description “With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base” . Since the action of sitting is preceded by the action of reclining,

original: sayanaggahaṇeneva āsanampi gahitanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: sayana ggahaṇena iva āsanam pi gahitan ti veditabbam
translated: it should be understood that the action of sitting is included by the word sayana .

original: Jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇāti ettha jātarūpanti suvaṇṇaṃ. Rajatanti kahāpaṇo lohamāsako
analyzed: jātarūpa rajata paṭiggahaṇā ti ettha jātarūpanti suvaṇṇam rajatanti kahāpaṇaḥ loha māsakaḥ
translated: “Accepting gold and silver”: here gold is pure gold. Silver is coins, iron coins,

original: jatumāsako dārumāsakoti ye vohāraṃ gacchanti, tassa ubhayassapi paṭiggahaṇaṃ jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇaṃ.🔽Tividhañcettha paṭiggahaṇaṃ kāyena vācāya manasāti. Tattha kāyena paṭiggahaṇaṃ uggaṇhanaṃ,
analyzed: jatu māsakaḥ dāru māsakaḥ uti ye vohāram gacchanti tassa ubhayassa api paṭiggahaṇam jātarūpa rajata paṭiggahaṇam  tividham ca ittha paṭiggahaṇam kāyena vācāya manasā ati tattha kāyena paṭiggahaṇam uggaṇhanam
translated: copper coins, wooden coins, and whatever else is used as money. Accepting either of these is “accepting gold and silver.”🔽Herein, there are three kinds of accepting: by body, by speech, and by mind. Herein, accepting by body is taking possession of;

original: vācāya paṭiggahaṇaṃ uggahāpanaṃ, manasā paṭiggahaṇaṃ sādiyanaṃ. Tividhampi paṭiggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: vācāya paṭiggahaṇam uggahāpanam manasā paṭiggahaṇam sādiyanam tividham pi paṭiggahaṇam
translated: accepting by speech is having it taken possession of; accepting by mind is consenting to it.🔽All three kinds of accepting are included under the general term “accepting,”

original: sāmaññaniddesena ekasesanayena vā gahetvā “paṭiggahaṇā”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā neva uggahetuṃ
analyzed: sāmañña niddesena eka sesa nayena vā gahetvā paṭiggahaṇā iti vuttam tasmā na iva uggahetum
translated: so it is not allowable to take possession of it oneself,🔽or to have it taken possession of, or to consent to it being deposited.

original: na uggahāpetuṃ na upanikkhittaṃ vā sādituṃ vaṭṭati. Imāni pana dasa sikkhāpadāni
analyzed: na uggahāpetum na upanikkhittam vā sāditum vaṭṭati imāni pana dasa sikkhāpadāni
translated: But these ten training precepts🔽are common to both the householder and the homeless life. For this is said in the Path of Purification:

original: gahaṭṭhānampi sādhāraṇāni. Vuttañhetaṃ visuddhimagge “upāsakaupāsikānaṃ niccasīlavasena
analyzed: gaha ṭṭhānam pi sādhāraṇāni vuttam ha etam visuddhi magge upāsaka aupāsikānam nicca sīla vasena
translated: “For the male and female lay followers, as ordinary virtue,

original: pañca sikkhāpadāni, sati vā ussāhe dasa, uposathaṅgavasena aṭṭhāti idaṃ gahaṭṭhasīla”nti.
analyzed: pañca sikkhāpadāni sati vā ussāhe dasa uposathaṅga vasena idam gahaṭṭha sīlanti
translated: Five training precepts, or ten if one is keen, or eight as the factors of the observance day: this is virtue for the laity.

original: Ettha hi dasāti sāmaṇerehi rakkhitabbasīlamāha ghaṭikārādīnaṃ viya. Paramatthajotikāyaṃ
analyzed: ettha hi dasa ati sāmaṇerehi rakkhitabba sīlam āha ghaṭi kārā ādīnam viya
translated: Herein, as to “ten”: this refers to the virtue to be observed by novices, like Ghaṭīkāra the potter, and so on.

original: pana khuddakaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “ādito dve catutthapañcamāni upāsakānaṃ sāmaṇerānañca sādhāraṇāni
analyzed: pana āditas dve catuttha pañcamāni upāsakānam sāmaṇerānam ca sādhāraṇāni
translated: But in the Paramatthajotikā, in the commentary to the Khuddaka Nikāya, it is said: “The first two and the fourth and fifth are common to laymen and novices.

original: niccasīlavasena, uposathasīlavasena pana upāsakānaṃ sattamaṭṭhamaṃ cekaṃ aṅgaṃ katvā
analyzed: nicca sīla vasena uposatha sīla vasena pana upāsakānam sattama aṭṭhamam ca ikam aṅgam katvā
translated: They are the normal virtue. But as the observance-day virtue, the seventh and eighth are one factor for laymen,

original: sabbapacchimavajjāni sabbānipi sāmaṇerehi sādhāraṇāni, pacchimaṃ pana sāmaṇerānameva
analyzed: sabba pacchima vajjāni sabbāni pi sāmaṇerehi sādhāraṇāni pacchimam pana
translated: and all the last three are common to novices. But the last is special to novices only.”

original: visesabhūta”nti vuttaṃ, taṃ “sati vā ussāhe dasā”ti iminā na sameti. Nāsanavatthūti
analyzed: visesa bhūtanti vuttam tam sati vā ussāhe dasāti iminā na sameti na āsana vatthu ti
translated: This does not agree with the words “Five training precepts, or ten if one is keen.”

original: liṅganāsanāya vatthu, adhiṭṭhānaṃ kāraṇanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: liṅgana āsanāya vatthu adhiṭṭhānam kāraṇanti vuttam hoti
translated: The grounds for expulsion: the grounds for expulsion for failure in a rule of training.

original: 107. Kintīti kena nu kho upāyena. “Attano pariveṇanti idaṃ puggalikaṃ sandhāya vutta”nti
analyzed: kinti iti kena nu kho upāyena idam puggalikam sandhāya vuttanti
translated: “What means”: by what means.

original: gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Ayamettha gaṇṭhipadakārānaṃ adhippāyo – “vassaggena pattasenāsana”nti🔽iminā tassa vassaggena pattaṃ saṅghikasenāsanaṃ vuttaṃ, “attano pariveṇa”nti imināpi🔽tasseva puggalikasenāsanaṃ vuttanti. Ayaṃ panettha amhākaṃ khanti – “yattha vā vasatī”ti🔽iminā saṅghikaṃ vā hotu puggalikaṃ vā, tassa nibaddhavasanakasenāsanaṃ vuttaṃ. “Yattha
analyzed: gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam ayam ettha gaṇṭhi pada kārānam adhippāyaḥ vassaggena patta senāsanan ti  iminā tassa vassaggena pattam saṅghika senāsanam vuttam iminā api  tassa iva puggalika senāsanam vuttanti ayam pana ittha amhākam khanti yattha vā vasati iti  iminā saṅghikam vā hotu puggalikam vā tassa nibaddha vasanaka senāsanam vuttam yattha
translated: But our opinion is this: by the words “where he lives”🔽the dwelling-place that is his regular abode is stated, whether it belongs to the Community or to a person.

original: vā paṭikkamatī”ti iminā pana yaṃ ācariyassa upajjhāyassa vā vasanaṭṭhānaṃ upaṭṭhānādinimittaṃ🔽nibaddhaṃ pavisati, taṃ ācariyupajjhāyānaṃ vasanaṭṭhānaṃ vuttaṃ. Tasmā tadubhayaṃ🔽dassetuṃ “ubhayenapi attano pariveṇañca vassaggena pattasenāsanañca vutta”nti āha.
analyzed: vā paṭikkamati iti iminā pana yam ācariyassa upajjhāyassa vā vasana ṭhānam upaṭṭhāna ādi nimittam  nibaddham pavisati tam ācariya upajjhāyānam vasana ṭṭhānam vuttam tasmā tat ubhayam  dassetum ubhayena api attano pariveṇañca vassaggena patta senāsanañca vuttanti āha
translated: But by the words “where he goes back to” the place where he regularly enters for the sake of attending on his teacher or preceptor is stated.🔽So he said “By both he shows his own cell and the dwelling-place that is his regular abode by the Community’s permission”.

original: Tattha attano pariveṇanti iminā ācariyupajjhāyānaṃ vasanaṭṭhānaṃ dassitaṃ, vassaggena
analyzed: tattha iminā ācariya upajjhāyānam vasana ṭhānam dassitam vassaggena
translated: Herein, by the words “his own cell” he shows the place where his teacher or preceptor lives. By the words “the dwelling-place that is his regular abode by the Community’s permission” he shows the place where he lives.

original: pattasenāsananti iminā pana tassa vasanaṭṭhānaṃ. Tadubhayampi saṅghikaṃ vā hotu puggalikaṃ
analyzed: patta senāsanam ti iminā pana tassa vasana ṭṭhānam tat ubhayam pi saṅghikam vā hotu puggalikam
translated: By “with a bowl and a resting place”: his dwelling place. Both of these may be either a community property or a private property.🔽The covering should be done in either case.

original: vā, āvaraṇaṃ kātabbamevāti. Mukhadvārikanti mukhadvārena bhuñjitabbaṃ. Daṇḍakammaṃ🔽katvāti daṇḍakammaṃ yojetvā. Daṇḍenti vinenti etenāti daṇḍo, soyeva kātabbattā kammanti
analyzed: vā āvaraṇam kātabbam eva ati mukhadvārikam ti mukhadvārena bhuñjitabbam daṇḍa kammam  katvā iti daṇḍa kammam yojetvā daṇḍenti vinenti etena ati daṇḍaḥ kātabba ttā kammanti
translated: By “with a mouth-door”: it should be eaten by the mouth-door.🔽By “having imposed a penalty”: having imposed a penalty.

original: daṇḍakammaṃ, āvaraṇādi.
analyzed: daṇḍa kammam āvaraṇa ādi
translated: A penalty is that by which one is punished, and it is an action because it is to be done, thus it is a penalty-action, such as covering, etc.

original: Sikkhāpadadaṇḍakammavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sikkhāpada daṇḍa kamma vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on the offence for imposing a penalty is finished.

original: Anāpucchāvaraṇavatthuādikathāvaṇṇanā🔽108. Daṇḍakammamassa karothāti assa daṇḍakammaṃ yojetha āṇāpetha. Daṇḍakammanti vā🔽niggahakammaṃ, tasmā niggahamassa karothāti vuttaṃ hoti. Esa nayo sabbattha īdisesu
analyzed: anāpuccha āvaraṇa vatthu ādi kathā vaṇṇanā  daṇḍa kammam assa karotha ati assa daṇḍa kammam yojetha āṇāpetha daṇḍa kammanti vā  niggaha kammam tasmai niggaham assa karotha ati vuttam hoti esa nayaḥ sabbattha īdisesu
translated: The commentary on the section on the offence for covering without asking permission, etc.🔽“You should impose a penalty on him”: you should impose a penalty on him, you should order it. Or else a penalty is a censure, thus it is said that you should censure him. This is the method in all such cases.

original: ṭhānesu. Senāsanaggāho ca paṭippassambhatīti iminā ca chinnavasso ca hotīti dīpeti.
analyzed: ṭhānesu senāsana ggāho ca paṭippassambhati iti iminā ca chinna vassaḥ ca hoti iti dīpeti
translated: And the selection of resting places is cancelled: this shows that the residence is broken.

original: Sace ākiṇṇadosova hoti, āyatiṃ saṃvare na tiṭṭhati, nikkaḍḍhitabboti ettha sace yāvatatiyaṃ
analyzed: sace ākiṇṇa dosaḥ uva hoti āyatim saṃvare na tiṭṭhati nikkaḍḍhitabbaḥ iti ettha sace yāvatatiyam
translated: If he is full of offenses and does not observe restraint for the future, he should be expelled.

original: vuccamāno na oramati, saṅghaṃ apaloketvā nāsetabbo. Puna pabbajjaṃ yācamānopi apaloketvā🔽pabbājetabboti vadanti. Pacchimikāya vassāvāsikaṃ lacchatīti pacchimikāya puna vassaṃ
analyzed: vuccamānaḥ na oramati saṅgham apaloketvā na āsetabbaḥ puna pabbajjam yācamānaḥ api apaloketvā  pabbājetabbaḥ iti vadanti pacchimikāya vassāvāsikam lacchati iti pacchimikāya puna vassam
translated: If, when spoken to up to the third time, he does not stop, he should be dismissed after the Sangha has been informed.🔽They say that he should be given the going forth again after the Sangha has been informed.🔽He is allowed to do the invitation ceremony at the end of the rainy season.

original: upagatattā lacchati. Apaloketvā lābho dātabboti chinnavassatāya vuttaṃ. Itarāni pañca
analyzed: upagata ttā lacchati apaloketvā lābhaḥ dātabbaḥ ti chinna vassa tāya vuttam itarāni pañca
translated: Because he has entered the rainy-season residence again, he is allowed to do the invitation ceremony.🔽The allowance should be given after informing the Sangha.🔽The five training rules

original: sikkhāpadānīti vikālabhojanādīni pañca. Accayaṃ desāpetabboti “accayo maṃ, bhante,
analyzed: sikkhāpadāni iti vikāla bhojana ādīni pañca accayam desāpetabbo ti accayaḥ mama bhante
translated: The five training rules beginning with eating at the wrong time.

original: accagamā”tiādinā nayena desāpetabbo.
analyzed: accagamā ti ādinā nayena desāpetabbaḥ
translated: He should be made to recognize the offense.

original: Anāpucchāvaraṇavatthuādikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anāpuccha āvaraṇa vatthu ādi kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the section on “without asking permission” is finished.

original: Paṇḍakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṇḍaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on paṇḍakas

original: 109. Paṇḍakavatthumhi “yo kāḷapakkhe itthī hoti, juṇhapakkhe puriso, ayaṃ pakkhapaṇḍako”ti
analyzed: paṇḍaka vatthumhi yaḥ kāḷa pakkhe itthī hoti juṇha pakkhe purisaḥ ayam pakkhapaṇḍakaḥ ti
translated: In the case of a paṇḍaka, if a person is a woman in the dark fortnight and a man in the bright fortnight, this is a paṇḍaka by nature.

original: keci vadanti, aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “kāḷapakkhe paṇḍako hoti, juṇhapakkhe panassa pariḷāho
analyzed: keci vadanti aṭṭhakathāyam pana kāḷa pakkhe paṇḍakaḥ hoti juṇha pakkhe pana assa pariḷāhaḥ
translated: Some say that in the commentary it is said that he is a paṇḍaka in the dark fortnight, but in the bright fortnight his fever subsides.

original: vūpasammatī”ti apaṇḍakapakkhe pariḷāhavūpasamasseva vuttattā paṇḍakapakkhe ussannapariḷāhatā
analyzed: vūpasammati iti apaṇḍaka pakkhe pariḷāha vūpasamassa iva vutta ttā paṇḍaka pakkhe ussanna pariḷāha tā
translated: But since it is said that his fever subsides in the fortnight when he is not a paṇḍaka, it is clear that in the fortnight when he is a paṇḍaka, his fever is increased and he becomes a paṇḍaka.

original: paṇḍakabhāvāpattīti viññāyati, tasmā idamevettha sārato paccetabbaṃ. Itthibhāvo pumbhāvo
analyzed: paṇḍaka bhāva āpatti iti viññāyati tasmai idam eva ittha sārataḥ paccetabbam itthi bhāvaḥ pumbhāvaḥ
translated: So this is the sense to be accepted here.🔽The absence of the state of a woman or a man is the non-existence of that state.

original: vā natthi etassāti abhāvako. Tasmiṃ yevassa pakkhe pabbajjā vāritāti ettha “apaṇḍakapakkhe🔽pabbājetvā paṇḍakapakkhe nāsetabbo”ti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Keci pana “apaṇḍakapakkhe
analyzed: vā na atthi etassa ati abhāvakaḥ tasmin yeva assa pakkhe pabbajjā vāritā ti ettha apaṇḍaka pakkhe  pabbājetvā paṇḍaka pakkhe na āsetabbaḥ ti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam keci pana apaṇḍaka pakkhe
translated: He is refused the going forth in that very fortnight.🔽Here it is said in the three passages in the Thread that he should be expelled after giving him the going forth in the fortnight when he is not a paṇḍaka.

original: pabbajito sace kilesakkhayaṃ pāpuṇāti, na nāsetabbo”ti vadanti, taṃ tesaṃ matimattaṃ
analyzed: pabbajitaḥ sace kilesa khayam pāpuṇāti na na āsetabbaḥ iti vadanti tam tesam matimattam
translated: But some say that if he who has gone forth in the fortnight when he is not a paṇḍaka reaches the destruction of taints, he should not be expelled. That is their opinion.

original: paṇḍakassa kilesakkhayāsambhavato khīṇakilesassa ca paṇḍakabhāvānupapattito. Ahetukapaṭisandhikathāyañhi
analyzed: paṇḍakassa kilesa khaya asambhavataḥ khīṇa kilesassa ca paṇḍaka bhāva anupapattitaḥ ahetuka paṭisandhi kathāyan hi
translated: But it is impossible for a paṇḍaka to reach the destruction of taints, and it is impossible for one whose taints are destroyed to be a paṇḍaka. For in the discussion of rebirth-linking without cause,

original: avisesena paṇḍakassa ahetukapaṭisandhitā vuttā. Āsittausūyapakkhapaṇḍakānañca paṭisandhito
analyzed: avisesena paṇḍakassa ahetuka paṭisandhi tā vuttā āsitta ausūya pakkhapaṇḍakānam ca paṭisandhito
translated: But without distinction it is said that the sexless one has rebirth-linking without root-cause.🔽And they say that the sexless one’s sexless state is due to rebirth-linking in the case of those who are sexless through envy of wives and through partiality of sex organs,

original: paṭṭhāyeva paṇḍakasabhāvo, na pavattiyaṃyevāti vadanti. Teneva ahetukapaṭisandhiniddese
analyzed: paṭṭhāya iva paṇḍaka sabhāvaḥ na pavattiyaṃyeva ati vadanti tena iva ahetuka paṭisandhi niddese
translated: and not due to conduct. That is why in the description of rebirth-linking without root-cause

original: jaccandhabadhirādayo viya paṇḍako jātisaddena visesetvā na niddiṭṭho. Idhāpi catutthapārājikasaṃvaṇṇanāyaṃ🔽“abhabbapuggale dassentena paṇḍakatiracchānagataubhatobyañjanakā tayo vatthuvipannā
analyzed: jad candha badhira ādayaḥ viya paṇḍakaḥ jāti saddena visesetvā na niddiṭṭhaḥ idha api catuttha pārājika saṃvaṇṇanā ayam  abhabba puggale dassentena paṇḍaka tiracchānagatā aubhatobyañjanakā tayaḥ vatthu vipannā
translated: the sexless one is not distinguished by the word “born” as are the blind, the deaf, etc. And here in the commentary on the fourth offence entailing expulsion

original: ahetukapaṭisandhikā, tesaṃ saggo avārito, maggo pana vārito”ti avisesena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ahetuka paṭisandhikā tesam saggaḥ a vāritaḥ maggaḥ pana vāritaḥ ti avisesena vuttam
translated: it is said without distinction: “The three kinds of persons who are failures in the case of the sexless, the animal, and the hermaphrodite, who have rebirth-linking without root-cause, have heaven closed to them, but the path is not closed to them.”

original: Paṇḍakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṇḍaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section in the Paṭisambhidā on the sexless is ended.

original: Theyyasaṃvāsakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: theyya saṃvāsaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: In the case of the section on the one living unrighteously,

original: 110. Theyyasaṃvāsakavatthumhi kolaññāti mātuvaṃse pituvaṃse ca jātā mātāpituppabhutisabbañātayo.
analyzed: theyya saṃvāsaka vatthumhi kolaññāti mātu vaṃse pitu vaṃse ca jātāḥ mātā pitu pabhuti sabba ñātayaḥ
translated: “Kola” is a term for all the relatives on the mother’s and father’s sides who are related to the mother and father.

original: Theyyāya saṃvāso etassāti theyyasaṃvāsako. So ca na saṃvāsamattasseva thenako idhādhippeto,
analyzed: theyyāya saṃvāsaḥ etassa ati theyyasaṃvāsako so ca na saṃvāsa mattassa iva thenakaḥ idha adhippeto
translated: One who has cohabitation by theft is a cohabitant by theft. And here the term “cohabitant” does not refer only to one who cohabits,

original: atha kho liṅgassa tadubhayassa ca thenakopīti āha “tayo theyyasaṃvāsakā”tiādi. Na🔽yathāvuḍḍhaṃ vandanaṃ sādiyatīti yathāvuḍḍhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vā sāmaṇerānaṃ vā vandanaṃ
analyzed: atha kho liṅgassa tad ubhayassa ca thena kopī iti āha na  yathāvuḍḍham vandanam sādiyati iti yathāvuḍḍham bhikkhūnam vā sāmaṇerānam vā vandanam
translated: but also to one who has the characteristics of a monk and both of these.🔽He does not consent to the paying of respects according to seniority: he does not consent to the paying of respects to the bhikkhus or novices according to seniority.

original: na sādiyati. Yathāvuḍḍhaṃ vandanaṃ sādiyatīti attanā musāvādaṃ katvā dassitavassānurūpaṃ
analyzed: na sādiyati yathāvuḍḍham vandanam sādiyati iti attanā musāvādam katvā dassita vassa anurūpam
translated: He consents to the paying of respects according to seniority: having made a false claim to seniority, he consents to the paying of respects according to seniority.

original: yathāvuḍḍhaṃ vandanaṃ sādiyati. Bhikkhuvassagaṇanādikoti iminā na ekakammādikova
analyzed: yathāvuḍḍham vandanam sādiyati bhikkhu vassa gaṇanā ādikaḥ ti iminā na eka kamma ādikaḥ uva
translated: The counting of years as a bhikkhu, etc., is not the only thing here called “cohabitation.”

original: idha saṃvāso nāmāti dasseti.
analyzed: idha saṃvāsaḥ nāma ati dassa iti
translated: This is shown by the words “cohabitation according to seniority.”

original: Rāja…pe… bhayenāti ettha bhaya-saddo paccekaṃ yojetabbo “rājabhayena dubbhikkhabhayenā”tiādinā.
analyzed: rājape bhayena ati ettha bhaya saddo paccekam yojetabbaḥ rāja bhayena dubbhikkha bhayena ati ādinā
translated: Fear of the king, etc.: the word “fear” should be construed with each of the terms, “fear of the king,” “fear of famine,” etc.

original: Saṃvāsaṃ nādhivāseti, yāva so suddhamānasoti rājabhayādīhi gahitaliṅgatāya so suddhamānaso
analyzed: saṃvāsam saḥ suddha mānasaḥ iti rāja bhaya ādīhi saḥ suddha mānasaḥ
translated: He does not consent to cohabitation as long as he is pure in mind: because he has the characteristics of a monk due to fear of the king, etc., he is pure in mind.

original: yāva saṃvāsaṃ nādhivāsetīti attho. Yo hi rājabhayādiṃ vinā kevalaṃ bhikkhū vañcetvā🔽tehi saddhiṃ saṃvasitukāmatāya liṅgaṃ gaṇhāti, so asuddhacittatāya liṅgaggahaṇeneva
analyzed: yāva saṃvāsam na adhivāseti iti atthaḥ yaḥ hi rāja bhaya ādim vinā kevalam bhikkhū vañcetvā  tehi saddhim saṃvasitu kāma tāya liṅgam gaṇhāti saḥ a suddha citta tāya liṅga ggahaṇena iva
translated: The meaning is: as long as he does not consent to living together with them. For one who, without fear of kings, etc., deceives the bhikkhus

original: theyyasaṃvāsako nāma hoti. Ayaṃ pana tādisena asuddhacittena bhikkhū vañcetukāmatāya🔽abhāvato yāva saṃvāsaṃ nādhivāseti, tāva theyyasaṃvāsako nāma na hoti. Teneva “rājabhayādīhi🔽gahitaliṅgānaṃ ‘gihī maṃ samaṇoti jānantū’ti vañcanācitte satipi bhikkhūnaṃ vañcetukāmatāya
analyzed: theyyasaṃvāsakaḥ nāma hoti ayam pana tādisena a suddha cittena bhikkhū vañcetu kāma tāya  abhāvataḥ saṃvāsam na adhivāseti tāva theyyasaṃvāsakaḥ nāma na tena iva rāja bhaya ādīhi  gahita liṅgānam gihī mama samaṇa iti jānantu iti vañcanā citte sati api bhikkhūnam vañcetu kāma tāya
translated: and takes on the guise in order to live with them, becomes a “living-by-stealth” bhikkhu by virtue of his taking on the guise with an impure motive. But this bhikkhu, because he has no such impure motive of deceiving the bhikkhus,

original: abhāvā doso na jāto”ti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Keci pana “vūpasantabhayatā idha
analyzed: abhāvā doso na jātaḥ ti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam keci pana vūpasanta bhaya tāḥ idha
translated: is not a “living-by-stealth” bhikkhu as long as he does not consent to living together with them. Therefore it is said in the three Commentaries: “There is no offense for those who have taken on the guise because of fear of kings, etc., even though they have the intention to deceive, thinking ‘Let them take me for an ascetic.’ For they do not have the intention to deceive bhikkhus.”

original: suddhacittatā”ti vadanti, evañca sati so vūpasantabhayo yāva saṃvāsaṃ nādhivāseti,
analyzed: vadanti evañca sati saḥ saṃvāsam saṃvāsam
translated: But some say that the purity here is the absence of fear. And if that were so, then he would not be a “living-by-stealth” bhikkhu as long as he did not consent to living together with them because of the absence of fear.

original: tāva theyyasaṃvāsako na hotīti ayamattho viññāyati. Imasmiñca atthe viññāyamāne avūpasantabhayassa🔽saṃvāsasādiyanepi theyyasaṃvāsakatā na hotīti āpajjeyya, na ca aṭṭhakathāyaṃ avūpasantabhayassa
analyzed: tāva theyya saṃvāsakaḥ na hoti iti ayam atthaḥ viññāyati imasmin ca atthe viññāyamāne a vūpasanta bhayassa  theyya saṃvāsaka tā na hoti iti āpajjeyya na ca aṭṭhakathāyam a vūpasanta bhayassa
translated: and it is understood that he is not a co-resident by theft. And when this meaning is understood, then it would follow that one who is not afraid of being reproved🔽is not a co-resident by theft even if he accepts co-residence, etc., with the schismatic. But in the commentary it is said that he is a co-resident by theft.🔽

original: saṃvāsasādiyanepi atheyyasaṃvāsakatā dassitā. Sabbapāsaṇḍiyabhattāni bhuñjantoti
analyzed: atheyya saṃvāsaka tā dassitā sabba pāsaṇḍiya bhattāni bhuñjanto ti
translated: and it is clear that he is not a co-resident by theft. And when this meaning is clear, then it would follow that even if he does not accept co-residence out of fear of excommunication he is not a co-resident by theft. But in the commentary it is not shown that he is not a co-resident by theft even if he does not accept co-residence out of fear of excommunication. And by the words “he should eat the food of all sectarians”

original: ca iminā avūpasantatayenapi saṃvāsaṃ asādiyanteneva vasitabbanti dīpeti. Teneva tīsupi🔽gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ “yasmā vihāraṃ āgantvā saṅghikaṃ gaṇhantassa saṃvāsaṃ pariharituṃ🔽dukkaraṃ, tasmā sabbapāsaṇḍiyabhattāni bhuñjantoti idaṃ vutta”nti, tasmā rājabhayādīhi
analyzed: ca saṃvāsam saṃvāsam dīpe iti tena iva tīsupi  gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam yasmai vihāram āgantvā saṅghikam gaṇhantassa saṃvāsam pariharitum  dukkaram tasmā sabba pāsaṇḍiya bhattāni bhuñjanto ti idam vuttan ti tasmā rāja bhaya ādīhi
translated: it is shown that he should live without accepting co-residence even by the non-excommunication method. Therefore in the three

original: gahitaliṅgatāyevettha suddhacittatāti gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: gahita liṅga tāya iva itthā suddha citta tā ati gahetabbam
translated: commentarial passages it is said, “Since it is difficult for one who, having come to the monastery, takes the Community’s food to avoid co-residence, therefore it is said ‘he should eat the food of all sectarians.’ ” So it should be understood that here the mere state of being taken is due to fear of the king, etc., and that the mind is pure.

original: Sabbapāsaṇḍiyabhattānīti sabbasāmayikānaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ katvā vīthicatukkādīsu ṭhapetvā
analyzed: sabba pāsaṇḍiya bhattāni iti sabba sāmayikānam sādhāraṇam katvā vīthi catukka ādīsu ṭhapetvā
translated: “The food of all sectarians”: having made it common to all, he should place it in the four-cornered place, etc.,

original: dātabbabhattāni. Kāyaparihāriyānīti kāyena pariharitabbāni. Abbhuggacchantīti abhimukhaṃ
analyzed: dātabba bhattāni kāya parihāriyāni iti kāyena pariharitabbāni abbhut gacchanti iti abhimukham
translated: the food that is to be given. To be carried on the body: to be carried on the body. Will come: will come

original: gacchanti. Kammantānuṭṭhānenāti kasigorakkhādikammakaraṇena. Tadeva pattacīvaraṃ🔽ādāya vihāraṃ gacchatīti cīvarāni nivāsanapārupanavasena ādāya pattañca aṃsakūṭe🔽laggetvā vihāraṃ gacchati. Nāpi sayaṃ jānātīti “yo evaṃ pabbajati, so theyyasaṃvāsako
analyzed: gacchanti kammanta anuṭṭhānena ati kasi gorakkha ādi kamma karaṇena tat eva patta cīvaram  ādāya vihāram gacchati iti cīvarāni nivāsana pārupana vasena ādāya pattam ca aṃsakūṭe  laggetvā vihāram gacchati na api sayam jānāti iti yaḥ evam pabbajati so theyya saṃvāsako
translated: The food that is given to him. To be carried on the body: to be carried on the body. They will come to him: they will come to him. By his work and activity: by his work and activity of plowing, trading, etc. Taking that same bowl and robe,

original: nāma hotī”ti vā “evaṃ kātuṃ na labhatī”ti vā “evaṃ pabbajito samaṇo na hotī”ti vā
analyzed: nāma hoti iti vai evam kātum na labhati iti vai evam pabbajitaḥ samaṇaḥ na hoti iti vā
translated: he goes to the monastery: taking the robes by way of wearing the upper robe and the sarong, and hanging the bowl on his shoulder, he goes to the monastery. Nor does he know by himself: he does not know that “one who goes forth in this way is called a secret entrant,” or that “one is not allowed to do it this way,” or that “one who goes forth in this way is not a monastic.”

original: na jānāti. Yo evaṃ pabbajati, so theyyasaṃvāsako nāma hotīti idaṃ pana nidassanamattaṃ.
analyzed: na jānāti yaḥ evam pabbajati so theyyasaṃvāsakaḥ nāma hoti iti idam pana nidassana mattam
translated: One who goes forth in this way is called a secret entrant: this is just an illustration.

original: Anupasampannakāleyevāti iminā upasampannakāle sutvā sacepi nāroceti, theyyasaṃvāsako na hotīti dīpeti.
analyzed: iminā upasampanna kāleya iva ati iminā upasampanna kāle sutvā sace pi na āroca iti theyya saṃvāsakaḥ na hoti iti dīpa iti
translated: Not even at the time of the full ordination: this shows that even if he tells after the full ordination, he is not a secret entrant.

original: Sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya…pe… theyyasaṃvāsako na hotīti idaṃ bhikkhūhi dinnaliṅgassa
analyzed: sikkham theyya saṃvāsakaḥ na hoti iti idam bhikkhūhi dinna liṅgassa
translated: Without having renounced the training… he is not a secret entrant: this shows that one who has been given the going forth and the full ordination by the monks

original: apariccattattā na liṅgathenako hoti, liṅgānurūpassa saṃvāsassa sāditattā nāpi saṃvāsathenako
analyzed: a pariccatta ttā na liṅga thenakaḥ hoti liṅga anurūpassa saṃvāsassa sādita ttā na api saṃvāsa thenakaḥ
translated: Because he is not separated from the bhikkhu state, he is not one who has gone over to a sect; and because he has undertaken the association with the bhikkhus that is proper to his sex, he is not one who has gone forth by a schism.

original: hotīti vuttaṃ. Eko bhikkhu kāsāye saussāhova odātaṃ nivāsetvāti etthāpi idameva kāraṇaṃ🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ. Parato sāmaṇero saliṅge ṭhitotiādinā sāmaṇerassa vuttavidhānesupi atheyyasaṃvāsakapakkhe
analyzed: hoti iti vuttam ekaḥ bhikkhu kāsāye odātam nivāsetvā ti ettha api idam eva kāraṇam  daṭṭhabbam paratas sāmaṇeraḥ sa liṅge ṭhitaḥ ti ādinā sāmaṇerassa vutta vidhānesu pi atheyya saṃvāsaka pakkhe
translated: The same explanation should be given in the case of the bhikkhu who puts on the yellow robe with the hope of getting alms.🔽The same method applies in the cases stated for the novice monk, beginning with “a novice monk who has gone over to the other sect.”

original: ayameva nayo. Bhikkhuniyāpi eseva nayoti vuttamevatthaṃ “sāpi hi gihibhāvaṃ patthayamānā”tiādinā
analyzed: ayam eva nayaḥ bhikkhuniyā api esā iva nayo ti vuttam eva attham sā api hi gihi bhāvam patthayamānā iti ādinā
translated: The same method applies in the case of the bhikkhunī. The meaning stated is repeated in the Vibhaṅga: “For she too, desiring the state of a lay follower” .

original: vibhāveti. Yo koci vuḍḍhapabbajitoti sāmaṇeraṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Mahāpeḷādīsūti etena🔽gihisantakaṃ dassitaṃ. Sayaṃ sāmaṇerova…pe… theyyasaṃvāsako na hotīti ettha kiñcāpi
analyzed: vibhāveti yaḥ koci vuḍḍha pabbajito ti sāmaṇeram sandhāya vuttam mahāpeḷa ādīsu iti etena  gihi santakam dassitam sayam sāmaṇera uvape theyya saṃvāsakaḥ na hoti iti ettha kiñcā api
translated: “Any who have gone forth when old” : this is said with reference to the novice monk. “The Great Lay Follower, etc.” : this shows that he was a layman.

original: theyyasaṃvāsako na hoti, pārājikaṃ pana āpajjatiyeva. Sesamettha uttānameva.
analyzed: theyyasaṃvāsakaḥ na hoti pārājikam pana āpajjatiyā iva sesam ettha uttānam eva
translated: “The novice monk himself … is not one who has gone forth by a schism” : although he is not one who has gone forth by a schism, he still commits an offense entailing expulsion. The rest is clear.

original: Theyyasaṃvāsakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: theyya saṃvāsaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the case of one who has gone forth by theft is finished.

original: Titthiyapakkantakakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: titthiya pakkantaka kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the one who has gone over to another religion

original: Titthiyapakkantakakathāyaṃ tesaṃ liṅge ādinnamatte titthiyapakkantako hotīti “titthiyo
analyzed: titthiya pakkantakakathā ayam tesam liṅge ādinna matte titthiya pakkantakaḥ hoti iti titthiyaḥ
translated: In the case of the “one who has gone over to the sectarians” the moment the sign of his sex is produced in him he becomes a sectarian.

original: bhavissāmī”ti gatassa liṅgaggahaṇeneva tesaṃ laddhipi gahitāyeva hotīti katvā vuttaṃ.🔽Kenaci pana “tesaṃ liṅge ādinnamatte laddhiyā gahitāyapi aggahitāyapi titthiyapakkantako
analyzed: bhavissāmi iti gatassa liṅga ggahaṇena iva tesam laddhi pi gahitāya iva hoti iti katvā vuttam  kenacid pana tesam liṅge ādinna matte laddhiyā gahitāya api aggahitāya api titthiya pakkantako
translated: In the Thread-bare Rag-robe Discussion, it is said that they become deserters of the schism as soon as they take up the schismatic’s mode of deportment. But this is said with reference to the fact that the schismatic’s persuasion is already taken up by one who has gone over to him with the thought “I will become a schismatic” as soon as he takes up the schismatic’s mode of deportment.

original: hotī”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ. Na hi “titthiyo bhavissāmī”ti gatassa liṅgasampaṭicchanato🔽aññaṃ laddhiggahaṇaṃ nāma atthi. Liṅgasampaṭicchaneneva hi so gahitaladdhiko hoti.
analyzed: hoti iti vuttam tat na gahetabbam na hi titthiyaḥ bhavissāmi iti gatassa liṅga sampaṭicchanato  aññam laddhi ggahaṇam nāma atthi liṅga sampaṭicchanena iva hi so gahita laddhikaḥ hoti
translated: But it is said by someone that “they become deserters of the schism as soon as they take up the schismatic’s mode of deportment, whether or not they take up his persuasion”. That should not be accepted. For one who has gone over to him with the thought “I will become a schismatic” has already taken up his persuasion as soon as he takes up his mode of deportment.

original: Teneva “vīmaṃsanatthaṃ kusacīrādīni…pe… yāva na sampaṭicchati, tāva taṃ laddhi rakkhati.
analyzed: tena iva vīmaṃsana attham kusa cīra ādi nipe yāva na sampaṭicchati tāva tam laddhi rakkhati
translated: That is why it is said in the Thread-bare Rag-robe Discussion: “For the purpose of testing … he keeps to the persuasion as long as he does not consent to it.

original: Sampaṭicchitamatte titthiyapakkantako hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Naggova ājīvakānaṃ upassayaṃ
analyzed: sampaṭicchita matte titthiya pakkantakaḥ hoti iti vuttam naggo va ājīvakānam upassayam
translated: As soon as he consents he becomes a deserter of the schism” . He goes naked to the Ājīvaka’s meeting-hall

original: gacchati, padavāre padavāre dukkaṭanti “ājīvako bhavissa”nti asuddhacittena gamanapaccayā
analyzed: gacchati padavāre padavāre ājīvakaḥ bhavissanti asuddha cittena gamana paccayā
translated: If he goes, then for every step there is an offence of wrong-doing. “If he should become a means of livelihood” is said because of the going with an impure mind.

original: dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ. Naggena hutvā gamanapaccayāpi dukkaṭā na muccatiyeva. Kūṭavassaṃ
analyzed: dukkaṭam vuttam naggena hutvā gamana paccayā api dukkaṭā na muccatiyā iva kūṭa vassam
translated: And he is not released from the offence of wrong-doing because of going as a dog.

original: gaṇentoti kūṭavassaṃ gaṇetvā saṃvāsaṃ sādiyantoti adhippāyo.🔽Titthiyapakkantakakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gaṇento ti kūṭavassam gaṇetvā saṃvāsam sādiyanto ti adhippāyaḥ  titthiya pakkantaka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Counting a schism: the intention is that he is consenting to communion after counting a schism.🔽The explanation of the section on one who has gone over to another religion is finished.

original: 111. Tiracchānagatavatthu uttānameva.
analyzed: tiracchāna gata vatthu uttānam eva
translated: The case of an animal is plain.

original: Mātughātakādivatthukathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the mother’s brother, etc.

original: 112. Mātughātakādivatthūsu apavāhananti apagamanaṃ, patikaraṇanti attho. Yathā samānajātikassa
analyzed: mātughātaka ādi vatthūsu apavāhanam ti apagamanam pati karaṇam ti atthaḥ yathā samāna jātikassa
translated: In the case of the mother’s brother, etc., “expulsion” is departure, the meaning is “atonement”.

original: vikopane kammaṃ garutaraṃ, na tathā vijātikassāti āha “manussitthibhūtā”ti. Puttasambandhena
analyzed: vikopane kammam garutaram na tathā vijātikassa ati āha manussitthi bhūtā ti putta sambandhena
translated: Just as the action is heavier when there is corruption of one of the same class, not so when of a different class, thus he said “a human female”.

original: mātupitusamaññā, dattakittimādivasenapi puttavohāro loke dissati, so ca kho pariyāyatoti
analyzed: mātu pitu samaññā putta vohāro loke dissati so ca kho pariyāyato ti
translated: The mother and father are called by the name of the son because of the connection with the son. The designation “son” is seen in the world because of giving, because of fame, and so on. And that is by way of a simile.

original: nippariyāyasiddhataṃ dassetuṃ “janikā mātā”ti vuttaṃ. Yathā manussattabhāve ṭhitasseva
analyzed: nippariyāya siddha tam dassetum janikā mātā iti vuttam yathā manus satta bhāve ṭhitassa iva
translated: The words “mother who gives birth” are said in order to show that the mother is not merely the one who carries the child in her womb.🔽Just as the three Bodhisattvas, while still remaining in the human state,

original: kusaladhammānaṃ tikkhavisadasūrabhāvāpatti yathā taṃ tiṇṇampi bodhisattānaṃ bodhittayanibbattiyaṃ,
analyzed: kusala dhammānam tikkha visada sūra bhāva āpatti yathā tam tiṇṇam pi bodhisattānam bodhi ttaya nibbattiyam
translated: attained the sharpness, clarity, and brilliance of wholesome states, as they did at the time of the conception of the three kinds of enlightenment,

original: evaṃ manussattabhāve ṭhitasseva akusaladhammānampi tikkhavisadasūrabhāvāpattīti āha🔽“sayampi manussajātikenevā”ti. Cutianantaraṃ phalaṃ anantaraṃ nāma, tasmiṃ anantare
analyzed: evam manussatta bhāve ṭhitassa iva akusala dhammānam pi tikkha visada sūra bhāva āpatti iti āha  sayam pi manussa jātikena iva ati cuti anantaram phalam anantaram nāma tasmin anantare
translated: so too, while still remaining in the human state, they attained the sharpness, clarity, and brilliance of unwholesome states.🔽“The immediate” is the fruit that follows immediately after the action.

original: niyuttaṃ, taṃnibbattanena anantarakaraṇasīlaṃ, anantarapayojanaṃ vā ānantariyaṃ,
analyzed: niyuttam tad nibbattanena anantara karaṇa sīlam anantara payojanam vā ānantariyam
translated: The action is “directed to the immediate” because it is engaged in that immediate fruit. It is of the nature of producing that immediate fruit, or it is the immediate cause of the immediate fruit.🔽By that immediate action of matricide.

original: tena ānantariyena mātughātakakammena. Pitughātakepi yena manussabhūto janako pitā
analyzed: tena ānantariyena mātu ghātaka kammena pitu ghātake pi yena manussa bhūtaḥ janakaḥ pitā
translated: In the case of patricide, too, the father is a human being.

original: sayampi manussajātikeneva satā sañcicca jīvitā voropito, ayaṃ ānantariyena pitughātakakammena
analyzed: sayam pi manussa jātikena iva satā sañcid ca jīvitā voropitaḥ ayam ānantariyena pitu ghātaka kammena
translated: He, too, is intentionally deprived of life by one who is a human being. This is the immediate action of patricide.

original: pitughātakotiādinā sabbaṃ veditabbanti āha “pitughātakepi eseva nayo”ti.
analyzed: pitu ghātaka uti ādinā sabbam veditabbanti āha pitu ghātake pi esā iva nayo ti
translated: The same method of explanation should be understood in the case of the other crimes of immediate retribution.

original: Parivattitaliṅgampi mātaraṃ pitaraṃ vā jīvitā voropentassa ānantariyakammaṃ hotiyeva.
analyzed: parivattita liṅgam pi mātaram pitaram vā jīvitā voropentassa ānantariya kammam
translated: And if he has changed sex, his action is still a root-action of immediate result if he deprives his mother or father of life.

original: Satipi hi liṅgaparivatte so eva ekakammanibbatto bhavaṅgappabandho jīvitindriyappabandho🔽ca, nāññoti. Yo pana sayaṃ manusso tiracchānabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ vā, sayaṃ🔽vā tiracchānabhūto manussabhūtaṃ, tiracchānabhūtoyeva vā tiracchānabhūtaṃ jīvitā
analyzed: sati api hi liṅga parivatte saḥ eva eka kamma nibbattaḥ bhavaṅga ppabandhaḥ jīvitindriya ppabandho  ca na aññaḥ ti yaḥ pana sayam manusso tiracchāna bhūtam mātaram vā pitaram vā sayam  vā tiracchāna bhūtaḥ manussa bhūtam vā tiracchāna bhūtam jīvitā
translated: For even though the continuity of the aggregates has changed sex, still the continuity of the life faculty is the same, which was produced by the same action.🔽But if a human being deprives his mother or father of life, or if a non-human being does so, or if a human being deprives a non-human being of life, or if a non-human being deprives a human being of life, or if a non-human being deprives a non-human being of life, then his action is not a root-action of immediate result, but it is grave.

original: voropeti, tassa kammaṃ ānantariyaṃ na hoti, bhāriyaṃ pana hoti, ānantariyaṃ āhacceva
analyzed: voropeti tassa kammam ānantariyam na hoti bhāriyam pana hoti ānantariyam āhacca iva
translated: And if he has the intention to kill a human being, and he kills a human being, then his action is a root-action of immediate result.

original: tiṭṭhati. Eḷakacatukkaṃ saṅgāmacatukkaṃ coracatukkañcettha kathetabbaṃ. “Eḷakaṃ māremī”ti🔽abhisandhināpi hi eḷakaṭṭhāne ṭhitaṃ manusso manussabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ vā
analyzed: tiṭṭhati eḷaka catukkam saṅgāma catukkam cora catukkam ca ittha kathetabbam eḷakam mā āremi iti  abhisandhinā api hi eḷaka ṭṭhāne ṭhitam manussaḥ manussa bhūtam mātaram vā pitaram vā
translated: The four cases of goats, the four cases of battle, and the four cases of thieves should be told here.🔽For if a man has the intention to kill a goat, and he kills his mother who is standing in the place of the goat, then he touches a root-action of immediate result, because he has the intention to kill a human being.

original: mārento ānantariyaṃ phusati maraṇādhippāyeneva ānantariyavatthuno vikopitattā. Eḷakābhisandhinā
analyzed: mārentaḥ ānantariyam phusati maraṇa adhippāyena iva ānantariya vatthunaḥ vikopita ttā eḷaka abhisandhinā
translated: But if he has the intention to kill a goat, and he kills a goat, then his action is grave, but not a root-action of immediate result.

original: pana mātāpitiaasandhinā vā eḷakaṃ mārento ānantariyaṃ na phusati ānantariyavatthuabhāvato.🔽Mātāpitiabhisandhinā mātāpitaro mārento phusateva. Esa nayo itarasmimpi catukkadvaye.
analyzed: pana mātā piti a sandhinā vā eḷakam mārentaḥ ānantariyam na phusati ānantariya vatthu abhāvato  mātā piti abhisandhinā mātā pitaraḥ mārentaḥ itarasmin pi catukka dvaye
translated: But if he kills a cow with the thought of killing his parents, he does not incur an immediate-resultant action, because the object is not the object of the immediate-resultant action.🔽But if he kills his parents with the thought of killing his parents, he does incur an immediate-resultant action. The same method applies to the other two tetrads.

original: Yathā ca mātāpitūsu, evaṃ arahantepi etāni catukkāni veditabbāni. Sabbattha hi purimaṃ
analyzed: yathā ca mātā pitūsu evam arahante pi etāni catukkāni veditabbāni sabbattha hi purimam
translated: And as in the case of mother and father, so also in the case of an arahat.

original: abhisandhicittaṃ appamāṇaṃ, vadhakacittaṃ pana tadārammaṇaṃ jīvitindriyañca ānantariyānānantarabhāve🔽pamāṇaṃ. Katānantariyakammo ca “tassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭibāhissāmī”ti sakalacakkavāḷaṃ🔽mahācetiyappamāṇehi kañcanathūpehi pūretvāpi sakalacakkavāḷaṃ pūretvā nisinnassa
analyzed: abhisandhi cittam appamāṇam vadhaka cittam pana tad ārammaṇam jīvita indriyam ca ānantariya anānantara bhāve  pamāṇam kata ānantariya kammo ca tassa kammassa vipākam paṭibāhissāmi iti sakala cakkavāḷam  mahā cetiya ppamāṇehi kañcana thūpehi pūretvā api sakala cakkavāḷam pūretvā nisinnassa
translated: For in all cases the thought of killing is the measure of the imminence or otherwise of the immediate result, and the life faculty that has that thought as its object is the measure of the imminence or otherwise of the immediate result.

original: bhikkhusaṅghassa mahādānaṃ datvāpi buddhassa bhagavato saṅghāṭikaṇṇaṃ amuñcanto vicaritvāpi
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghassa mahā dānam da tvā api buddhassa bhagavataḥ saṅghāṭi kaṇṇam a muñcantaḥ vicaritvā api
translated: And even if one who has committed an immediate-resultant action were to fill the whole of the earth’s surface with great cairns of precious stones the size of the Vaijayanta Palace, and were to give the whole of the earth’s surface, filled with monks sitting like cakes of dough, the gift of the four requisites, and were to spend his whole life doing honour to the Enlightened One, the Blessed One, with countless myriads of pavilions of precious stones, and were to die with his whole mind absorbed in such thoughts, still he would have to take rebirth in hell.

original: kāyassa bhedā nirayameva upapajjati, pabbajjañca na labhati.
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā nirayam eva upapajjati pabbajjañca na labhati
translated: And he would not even get the going forth.

original: 115. Icchamānanti odātavatthavasanaṃ icchamānaṃ. Tenevāha “gihibhāve sampaṭicchitamatteyevā”ti.
analyzed: icchamānam iti icchamānam tena iva āha gihi bhāve
translated: ‘If he should wish’: if he should wish for the white clothes. Hence it is said, ‘as soon as he has consented to the life of a layman.’🔽The detailed explanation of the schism in the Community will come later .

original: Saṅghabhedakakathāvitthāro parato āvi bhavissati. Catunnaṃ kammānanti apalokanādīnaṃ
analyzed: saṅgha bhedaka kathā vitthāro paratas bhavissati catunnam kammānaṃ ti apalokana ādīnam
translated: ‘Of the four legal procedures’: of the four legal procedures beginning with the covering over as if with grass .

original: catunnaṃ kammānaṃ. Duṭṭhacittenāti vuttamevatthaṃ vibhāveti “vadhakacittenā”ti. Vadhakacetanāya
analyzed: catunnam kammānam duṭṭha cittena ati vuttam evattham vibhāveti vadhaka cittena ati vadhaka cetanāya
translated: ‘With a mind of hatred’: he analyses what has already been said with the words ‘with a mind of hatred’ by ‘with a mind to kill.’

original: hi dūsitacittaṃ idha duṭṭhacittaṃ nāma. Lohitaṃ uppādetīti ettha tathāgatassa abhejjakāyatāya🔽parūpakkamena cammacchedaṃ katvā lohitapaggharaṇaṃ nāma natthi, sarīrassa pana antoyeva
analyzed: hi dūsita cittam idha duṭṭha cittam nāma lohitam uppādeti iti ettha tathāgatassa a bhejja kāya tāya  para upakkamena camma chedam katvā lohitapaggharaṇam nāma natthi sarīrassa pana
translated: For a mind corrupted by a mind to kill is called here a mind of hatred.

original: ekasmiṃ ṭhāne lohitaṃ samosarati, āghātena pakuppamānaṃ sañcitaṃ hoti. Devadattena
analyzed: ekasmin ṭhāne lohitam samosarati āghātena pakuppamānam sañcitam hoti devadattena
translated: ‘Should draw blood’: since the Tathāgata’s body is indivisible, there is no drawing of blood by striking him with a weapon. But blood can be made to flow by striking him in a certain place in the body.

original: paviddhasilato bhijjitvā gatasakkhalikāpi tathāgatassa pādantaṃ pahari, pharasunā
analyzed: paviddha silataḥ bhijjitvā gata sakkhalikā api tathāgatassa pādantam pahari pharasunā
translated: When Devadatta’s stone dagger split open and became a lump of clay, it struck the Tathāgata’s toe and drew blood.

original: pahaṭo viya pādo antolohitoyeva ahosi. Jīvako pana tathāgatassa ruciyā satthakena
analyzed: pahaṭaḥ viya pādaḥ antolohitaḥ yā iva ahosi jīvakaḥ pana tathāgatassa ruciyā satthakena
translated: and his foot became as if it were full of liquid blood. But Jīvaka, by the Tathāgata’s wish,

original: cammaṃ chinditvā tamhā ṭhānā duṭṭhalohitaṃ nīharitvā phāsumakāsi, tenassa puññakammameva
analyzed: cammam chinditvā tamhā ṭhānā duṭṭha lohitam nīharitvā phāsum akāsi tena assa puñña kammam eva
translated: cut the skin with a knife, removed the bad blood from the place, and made him comfortable. Therefore it was only a meritorious deed for him.

original: ahosi. Tenāha “jīvako viyā”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha jīvakaḥ viyāti ādi
translated: Therefore it is said, “Like Jīvaka,” and so on.

original: Atha ye parinibbute tathāgate cetiyaṃ bhindanti, bodhiṃ chindanti, dhātumhi upakkamanti,
analyzed: atha ye parinibbute tathāgate cetiyam bhindanti bodhim chindanti dhātumhi upakkamanti
translated: Then, what happens to those who break a shrine, cut down a Bodhi tree, or attack a relic?

original: tesaṃ kiṃ hotīti? Bhāriyaṃ kammaṃ hoti ānantariyasadisaṃ. Sadhātukaṃ pana thūpaṃ
analyzed: tesam kim hoti iti bhāriyam kammam hoti ānantariya sadisam sa dhātukam pana thūpam
translated: A grave deed is committed, similar to an immediate-resultant action. But a branch of the Bodhi tree that is obstructing a shrine

original: vā paṭimaṃ vā bādhamānaṃ bodhisākhaṃ chindituṃ vaṭṭati. Sacepi tattha nilīnā sakuṇā
analyzed: vā paṭimam vā bādhamānam bodhisākham chinditum vaṭṭati sace pi tattha nilīnā sakuṇā
translated: or an image containing the five-constituent-relic is allowed to be cut. Even if birds roosting there

original: cetiye vaccaṃ pātenti, chindituṃ vaṭṭatiyeva. Paribhogacetiyato hi sarīracetiyaṃ
analyzed: cetiye vaccam pātenti chinditum vaṭṭatiyā iva paribhoga cetiyataḥ hi sarīra cetiyam
translated: defecate on the shrine, it is still allowed to be cut. For a relic shrine is more important than a shrine for use.

original: garutaraṃ. Cetiyavatthuṃ bhinditvā gacchante bodhimūlepi chinditvā harituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: garutaram cetiya vatthum bhinditvā gacchante bodhi mūle api chinditvā haritum vaṭṭati
translated: If someone breaks the shrine site and goes away, it is allowed to cut and take away even the root of the Bodhi tree.

original: Yā pana bodhisākhā bodhigharaṃ bādhati, taṃ geharakkhaṇatthaṃ chindituṃ na labhati.
analyzed: yā pana bodhisākhā bodhigharam bādhati tam geha rakkhaṇa attham chinditum na labhati
translated: But if a branch of the Bodhi Tree is obstructing the shrine, it should not be cut down for the sake of the shrine.

original: Bodhiatthañhi gehaṃ, na gehatthāya bodhi. Āsanagharepi eseva nayo. Yasmiṃ pana āsanaghare
analyzed: bodhi attham hi geham na geha atthāya bodhi āsana ghare pi esa iva nayaḥ yasmim pana āsana ghare
translated: For the shrine is for the sake of the Bodhi Tree, not the Bodhi Tree for the sake of the shrine. The same applies in the case of a sitting-screen.

original: dhātu nihitā hoti, tassa rakkhaṇatthāya bodhisākhaṃ chindituṃ vaṭṭati. Bodhijagganatthaṃ
analyzed: dhātu nihitā hoti tassa rakkhaṇa atthāya bodhisākham chinditum vaṭṭati bodhi jaggana attham
translated: But if a relic is enshrined in the sitting-screen, then it is allowable to cut a branch of the Bodhi Tree for the sake of its protection.

original: ojoharaṇasākhaṃ vā pūtiṭṭhānaṃ vā chindituṃ vaṭṭatiyeva, satthu rūpakāyapaṭijaggane viya puññampi hoti.
analyzed: ojaḥ haraṇa sākham vā pūtiṭṭhānam vā chinditum vaṭṭatiyā iva satthu rūpa kāya paṭijaggane viya puññam pi hoti
translated: And if it is for the sake of the Bodhi Tree, it is allowable to cut a branch that sap-suckers are injuring or that is rotten. There is merit in doing this, just as there is in looking after the Master’s physical body.

original: Mātughātakādivatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mātughātaka ādi vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the case of the parricide is ended.

original: Ubhatobyañjanakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā🔽116. Ubhato byañjanamassa atthīti ubhatobyañjanakoti iminā asamānādhikaraṇavisayo
analyzed: ubhatobyañjanaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā  ubhatas byañjanam assa atthi iti ubhatobyañjanakaḥ ti iminā asamāna adhikaraṇa visayaḥ
translated: The explanation of the case of the hermaphrodite🔽. He has the characteristics of both sexes, thus he is a hermaphrodite . This is a compound with a different meaning as a determinative compound.

original: bāhiratthasamāsoyaṃ, purimapade ca vibhattialopoti dasseti. Byañjananti cettha itthinimittaṃ
analyzed: bāhirattha samāsaḥ yam purima pade ca vibhatti a lopaḥ iti dassa iti byañjananti ca ittha itthi nimittam
translated: And it shows that the case-ending is omitted in the first member. And here the word “sex”

original: purisanimittañca adhippetaṃ. Atha ubhatobyañjanakassa ekameva indriyaṃ, udāhu dveti?
analyzed: purisa nimittam ca adhippetam atha ubhatobyañjanakassa ekam eva indriyam udāhu dve iti
translated: and the male organ is intended. But is there one faculty in the case of a hermaphrodite, or two?

original: Ekameva “yassa itthindriyaṃ uppajjati, tassa purisindriyaṃ uppajjatīti? No. Yassa
analyzed: ekam eva yassa itthi indriyam uppajjati tassa purisa indriyam uppajjati iti no yassa
translated: “If the female faculty arises in him, does the male faculty arise in him too? No.🔽Or if the male faculty arises in him, does the female faculty arise in him too? No” .

original: vā pana purisindriyaṃ uppajjati, tassa itthindriyaṃ uppajjatīti? No”ti ekasmiṃ santāne🔽indriyadvayassa paṭisiddhattā, tañca kho itthiubhatobyañjanakassa itthindriyaṃ, purisaubhatobyañjanakassa
analyzed: vā pana purisa indriyam uppajjati tassa itthi indriyam uppajjati iti no ti ekasmin santāne  indriya dvayassa paṭisiddha ttā tat ca kho itthi ubhatobyañjanakassa itthi indriyam purisa obhatobyañjanakassa
translated: In one continuity🔽the two faculties are denied. And that is the female faculty in a female hermaphrodite,

original: purisindriyaṃ. Yadi evaṃ dutiyabyañjanakassa abhāvo āpajjati. Indriyañhi byañjanakāraṇaṃ
analyzed: purisa indriyam yadi evam dutiya byañjanakassa abhāvaḥ āpajjati indriyam hi byañjana kāraṇam
translated: and the male faculty in a male hermaphrodite. If that is so, then the absence of a second sex is implied. For a faculty is said to be the cause of the sex,🔽and that is not present in a hermaphrodite.

original: vuttaṃ, tañca tassa natthīti? Vuccate – na tassa indriyaṃ dutiyabyañjanakāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam tat ca tassa natthi iti vuccate na tassa indriyam dutiya byañjana kāraṇam
translated: It is said: “It is not the cause of the second sex in a hermaphrodite.

original: Kasmā? Sadā abhāvato. Itthiubhatobyañjanakassa hi yadā itthiyā rāgacittaṃ uppajjati,
analyzed: kasmā sadā abhāvataḥ itthi ubhatobyañjanakassa hi yadā itthiyā rāga cittam uppajjati
translated: Why not? Because it is always absent. For when a female hermaphrodite has a mind affected by lust for a woman,🔽then the male sex is evident and the female sex is hidden and concealed,

original: tadā purisabyañjanaṃ pākaṭaṃ hoti, itthibyañjanaṃ paṭicchannaṃ guḷhaṃ hoti, tathā
analyzed: tadā purisa byañjanam pākaṭam hoti itthi byañjanam paṭicchannam guḷham hoti tathā
translated: and when he has a mind affected by lust for a man,

original: itarassa itaraṃ. Yadi ca tesaṃ indriyaṃ dutiyabyañjanakāraṇaṃ bhaveyya, sadāpi byañjanadvayaṃ
analyzed: itarassa itaram yadi ca tesam indriyam dutiya byañjana kāraṇam sadā api byañjana dvayam
translated: and the other to the other. And if the sex organ were the cause of the second sex, then there would be two sexes🔽

original: tiṭṭheyya, na pana tiṭṭhati, tasmā veditabbametaṃ “na tassa taṃ byañjanakāraṇaṃ,
analyzed: tiṭṭheyya na pana tiṭṭhati tasmā veditabbam etam na tassa tam byañjana kāraṇam
translated: and the other’s the other’s. And if the sex faculty were the cause of the other sex, the two sexes would be present all the time. But they are not. So it must be understood that that is not the cause of the sex.

original: kammasahāyaṃ pana rāgacittamevettha kāraṇa”nti.🔽Yasmā cassa ekameva indriyaṃ hoti, tasmā itthiubhatobyañjanako sayampi gabbhaṃ gaṇhāti,
analyzed: kamma sahāyam pana rāga cittam eva itthā kāraṇan ti  yasmai ca assa ekam eva indriyam hoti tasmai itthi ubhatobyañjanakaḥ sayam pi gabbham gaṇhāti
translated: The cause is the lustful consciousness that is the companion of kamma.

original: parampi gaṇhāpeti. Purisaubhatobyañjanako paraṃ gaṇhāpeti, sayaṃ pana na gaṇhāti.🔽Yadi paṭisandhiyaṃ purisaliṅgaṃ, yadi paṭisandhiyaṃ itthiliṅganti ca paṭisandhiyaṃ
analyzed: param pi gaṇhāpa iti param gaṇhāpa iti sayam pana na gaṇhāti  yadi paṭisandhiyam purisa liṅgam yadi paṭisandhiyam itthi liṅganti ca paṭisandhiyam
translated: And because it has only one sex faculty, the hermaphrodite can get a conception himself and can cause another to get one. The male hermaphrodite can cause another to get a conception but cannot get one himself.

original: liṅgasabbhāvo kurundiyaṃvutto, so ca ayutto. Pavattiyaṃyeva hi itthiliṅgādīni samuṭṭhahanti,
analyzed: liṅga sabbhāvaḥ so ca ayuttaḥ pavattiyam yeva hi itthi liṅga ādīni samuṭṭhahanti
translated: If the sign of the male is present at rebirth-linking, if the sign of the female is present at rebirth-linking, it is said in the Kurundi that the sex is fixed at rebirth-linking. But that is incorrect. For the signs of the female, etc., arise only in the course of an existence,

original: na paṭisandhiyaṃ. Paṭisandhiyaṃ pana indriyameva samuṭṭhāti, na liṅgādīni. Na ca
analyzed: na paṭisandhiyam paṭisandhiyam pana indriyam eva samuṭṭhāti na liṅga ādīni na ca
translated: not at rebirth-linking. But only the faculty arises at rebirth-linking, not the signs. And it is not possible to say that the sex is fixed at rebirth-linking because the faculty is fixed there.

original: indriyameva liṅganti sakkā vattuṃ indriyaliṅgānaṃ bhinnasabhāvattā. Vuttañhetaṃ aṭṭhasāliniyaṃ –
analyzed: indriyam eva liṅganti sakkā vattum indriya liṅgānam bhinna sabhāva ttā vuttam ha etam aṭṭhasāliniyam
translated: The sex organ itself is the sign of femininity, since the sign of femininity and the sex organ are of the same nature. For this is said in the Aṭṭhasālinī:

original: “Itthattaṃ itthibhāvoti ubhayaṃ ekatthaṃ, itthisabhāvoti attho. Ayaṃ kammajo paṭisandhisamuṭṭhito.
analyzed: itthattam itthi bhāvaḥ ti ubhayam ekattham itthi sabhāvaḥ ti attho ayam kamma jo paṭisandhi samuṭṭhito
translated: “The two terms ‘sex’ and ‘sexuality’ are used in the same sense; the meaning is the same. This is born of kamma and is originated by rebirth-linking.

original: Itthiliṅgādi pana itthindriyaṃ paṭicca pavatte samuṭṭhitaṃ. Yathā bīje sati bījaṃ
analyzed: itthi liṅga ādi pana itthi indriyam paṭicca pavatte samuṭṭhitam yathā bīje sati bījam
translated: But the sign of femininity, etc., are originated by the process of generation subsequent to the sex faculty. For just as, when there is a seed,

original: paṭicca bījapaccayā rukkho vaḍḍhitvā sākhāviṭapasampanno hutvā ākāsaṃ pūretvā tiṭṭhati,
analyzed: paṭicca bīja paccayā rukkhaḥ vaḍḍhitvā sākhā viṭapa sampannaḥ hutvā ākāsam pūretvā tiṭṭhati
translated: the tree grows by means of the seed, with the seed as its support, with the seed as its cause, and then, having grown, it fills the sky with branches and foliage,

original: evameva itthibhāvasaṅkhāte itthindriye sati itthiliṅgādīni honti. Bījaṃ viya hi itthindriyaṃ,
analyzed: evam eva itthi bhāva saṅkhāte itthi indriye sati itthi liṅga ādīni honti bījam hi itthi indriyam
translated: so too, when there is the sex faculty called ‘sexuality,’ the sign of femininity, etc., come into existence. For the sex faculty is like the seed,

original: bījaṃ paṭicca vaḍḍhitvā ākāsaṃ pūretvā ṭhitarukkho viya itthindriyaṃ paṭicca itthiliṅgādīni🔽pavatte samuṭṭhahanti. Tattha itthindriyaṃ na cakkhuviññeyyaṃ, manoviññeyyameva.
analyzed: bījam paṭicca vaḍḍhitvā ākāsam pūretvā ṭhita rukkhaḥ viya itthi indriyam paṭicca itthi liṅga ādīni  pavatte samuṭṭhahanti tattha itthi indriyam na cakkhu viññeyyam manaḥ viññeyyam eva
translated: and the sign of femininity, etc., are like the tree that grows by means of the seed, with the seed as its support, with the seed as its cause, and then, having grown, fills the sky with branches and foliage.🔽Herein, the sex faculty is not cognizable by the eye, it is cognizable by the mind only.

original: Itthiliṅgādīni cakkhuviññeyyānipi manoviññeyyānipī”ti.
analyzed: itthi liṅga ādīni cakkhu viññeyyāni pi manaḥ viññeyyāni pi iti
translated: But the sign of femininity, etc., are cognizable by the eye and also cognizable by the mind” .

original: Tenevāha “tattha vicāraṇakkamo vitthārato aṭṭhasāliniyā dhammasaṅgahaṭṭhakathāya veditabbo”ti.
analyzed: tena iva āha tattha vicāraṇa kkamaḥ vitthārataḥ aṭṭha sāliniyā dhammasaṅgaha ṭṭhakathāya veditabbaḥ ti
translated: Hence it is said: “The method of investigation here should be understood in detail in the Dhamma Saṅgaṇī subcommentary on the Aṭṭhasāḷiṇī.”

original: Ubhatobyañjanakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ubhatobyañjanaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The section on the case of the hermaphrodite is finished.

original: Anupajjhāyakādivatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: anupajjhāyaka ādi vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The section on the case of those without a preceptor, etc.

original: 117. Sikkhāpadaṃ apaññattaṃ hotīti idheva paññattaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sikkhāpadam a paññattam hoti iti idha iva paññattam sikkhāpadam sandhāya vuttam
translated: The training rules have not been laid down: this refers to the training rules that have been laid down here.

original: Upajjhaṃ aggāhāpetvāti “upajjhāyo me, bhante, hohī”ti evaṃ upajjhaṃ aggāhāpetvā.🔽Kammavācāya pana upajjhāyakittanaṃ kataṃyevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Aññathā “puggalaṃ na parāmasatī”ti
analyzed: upajjham aggāhāpetvā ati upajjhāyaḥ me bhante hohi iti evam upajjham aggāhāpetvā  kamma vācāya pana upajjhāya kittanam katam yeva ati daṭṭhabbam aññathā puggalam na parāmasati iti
translated: Having asked for a preceptor: having asked for a preceptor, saying, “Venerable sir, be my preceptor.”🔽But it should be understood that the preceptor is praised in the proclamation. Otherwise, the procedure would be invalid, since it would be “not grasping the individual.”

original: vuttakammavipattisambhavato kammaṃ kuppeyya, teneva “upajjhāyaṃ akittetvā”ti avatvā🔽“upajjhaṃ aggāhāpetvā”icceva vuttaṃ. Yathā ca aparipuṇṇapattacīvarassa upasampādanakāle
analyzed: vutta kamma vipatti sambhavataḥ kammam kuppeyya tena iva upajjhāyam a kittetvā ati avatvā  upajjham vuttam yathā ca a paripuṇṇa patta cīvarassa upasampādana kāle
translated: Therefore, instead of saying, “without praising the preceptor,”🔽it is said, “having asked for a preceptor.” And at the time of the full ordination of one who is not complete in the requisite robe and bowl,

original: kammavācāya “paripuṇṇassa pattacīvara”nti asantavatthuṃ kittetvā kammavācāya katāyapi
analyzed: kamma vācāya paripuṇṇassa patta cīvaranti asanta vatthum kittetvā kamma vācāya
translated: the proclamation is made with the words, “complete in the requisite robe,” even though the requisite is not complete.

original: upasampadā ruhati, evaṃ “ayaṃ buddharakkhito āyasmato dhammarakkhitassa upasampadāpekkho”ti
analyzed: upasampadā ruhati evam ayam buddharakkhitaḥ āyasmataḥ dhammarakkhitassa upasampadā apekkho ti
translated: Ordination is valid. So too, if it is said, “This one, Buddha-rakkhita, is the ordination candidate of the venerable Dhamma-rakkhita,”

original: asantaṃ puggalaṃ kittetvā kevalaṃ santapadanīhārena kammavācāya katāya upasampadā
analyzed: asantam puggalam kittetvā kevalam santa pada nīhārena kamma vācāya katāya upasampadā
translated: and the person is not present, but the ordination is performed by the mere recitation of the formula of information, then the ordination is valid.

original: ruhatiyevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenevāha “kammaṃ pana na kuppatī”ti. “Na, bhikkhave, anupajjhāyako
analyzed: ruhatiyā iva āti daṭṭhabbam tena iva āha kammam pana na kuppati iti na bhikkhave an upajjhāyakaḥ
translated: This should be understood. Therefore it is said, “But the action is not invalidated.”

original: upasampādetabbo, yo upasampādeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti ettakameva vatvā “so ca puggalo
analyzed: upasampādetabbaḥ yaḥ upasampādeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa ati ettakam eva vatvā saḥ ca puggalo
translated: “Monks, one who has no preceptor should not be ordained. If anyone should ordain him, there is an offense of wrong doing.”

original: anupasampanno”ti avuttattā kammavipattilakkhaṇassa ca asambhavato “taṃ na gahetabba”nti
analyzed: anupasampannaḥ ti a vutta ttā kamma vipatti lakkhaṇassa ca asambhavataḥ tam na gahetabbanti
translated: Having said this much, “But that person is not ordained,” is not said. And because the characteristic of invalidity of action is not possible, it is said, “That should not be taken.”

original: vuttaṃ. “Pañcavaggakaraṇañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ paṇḍakapañcamo kammaṃ kareyya, akammaṃ
analyzed: vuttam pañcavagga karaṇam ce bhikkhave kammam paṇḍaka pañcamaḥ kammam kareyya a kammam
translated: “Monks, if a legal procedure requiring a quorum of five is done with a paṇḍaka as the fifth member, the procedure

original: na ca karaṇīya”ntiādivacanato paṇḍakādīnampi ubhatobyañjanakapariyantānaṃ gaṇapūrakabhāveyeva
