original: Gamikādinissayavatthukathāvaṇṇanā

analyzed: āgamissati iti tat ce āgameti vaṭṭati āgamentassa iva ce vassūpanāyika divasaḥ hoti  hotu gantabbam tattha yattha nissaya dāyakam labhati keci pana sace so gacchantaḥ

analyzed: jīvita antarāyam brahmacariya antarāyam vā passati tattha eva vasitabbanti vadanti

original: Gottena anussāvanānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: gottena anussāvana anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the allowance for the announcement by name

analyzed: itthannāmaḥ itthannāmassa āyasmataḥ iti nāmakittanassa anussāvanāya āgata ttā na aham  ussahāmi therassa nāmam gahetunti vuttam āyasmataḥ pippalissa upasampada apekkho ti
translated: Because the announcement by name, “So-and-so of so-and-so,” has come up, he says, “I am not able to take the elder’s name.”

original: evaṃ nāmaṃ gahetuṃ na ussahāmīti attho. “Gottenapi anussāvetu”nti vacanato yena vohārena
analyzed: evam nāmam gahetum na ussahāmi iti atthaḥ gottena api anussāvetum ti vacanataḥ yena vohārena

analyzed: voharati tena vaṭṭati iti siddham konāmaḥ te upajjhāyaḥ iti puṭṭhena api nāmam
translated: If he is asked, “What is your preceptor’s name?” he should answer with his preceptor’s clan name.

original: katvā vattabbanti siddhaṃ hoti, tasmā catubbidhesu nāmesu yena kenaci nāmena anussāvanā
analyzed: katvā vattabbanti siddham hoti tasmā catubbidhesu nāmesu yena kenaci nāmena anussāvanā
translated: So it is established that it can be done with any one of the four kinds of names.🔽Therefore they say that the invitation should be done with any one of the four kinds of names.

analyzed: pana ayam buddharakkhitaḥ āyasmataḥ dhammarakkhitassa ati paṭhamam likhitan ti tam uppaṭipāṭiyā
translated: in the text for the proclamation of the transaction it is written first: “This Buddha- rakkhita to the venerable Dhamma-rakkhita.”🔽But this should not be taken as the order in which the words are to be uttered.

original: vuttanti na paccetabbaṃ. Pāḷiyañhi “itthannāmo itthannāmassa āyasmato”ti atthamattaṃ🔽dassitaṃ, tasmā pāḷiyaṃ avuttopi “ayaṃ buddharakkhito āyasmato dhammarakkhitassā”ti
analyzed: vuttam ti na paccetabbam pāḷiyam hi itthannāmaḥ itthannāmassa āyasmataḥ ti attha mattam 🔽dassitam tasmā pāḷiyam a vuttaḥ api ayam buddharakkhitaḥ āyasmataḥ dhammarakkhitassa ati

analyzed: katthaci āyasmataḥ buddharakkhita therassa ati vatvā katthaci kevalam buddharakkhitassa ati

original: sāveti, sāvanaṃ hāpetīti na vuccati nāmassa ahāpitattāti eke. Sace katthaci “āyasmato
analyzed: sāveti sāvanam hāpeti iti na vuccati nāmassa a hāpita ttā ati eke sace katthaci āyasmataḥ
translated: Some say that the word “of” is not omitted because the word “of” is not omitted in the name.

original: buddharakkhitassā”ti vatvā katthaci “buddharaakhatassāyasmato”ti sāveti, pāṭhānurūpattā
analyzed: buddha rakkhitassa ati vatvā katthaci pāṭha anurūpa ttā
translated: If in some places it is said, “Of the venerable Buddhaghosa,” and in some places it is said, “Of Buddhaghosa, the venerable,” then because of the conformity to the reading,

original: khettameva otiṇṇantipi eke. Byañjanabhedappasaṅgato anussāvanānaṃ taṃ na vaṭṭatīti
analyzed: eke byañjana bheda ppasaṅgataḥ anussāvanānam tam na vaṭṭati iti
translated: some say that it is the field that is entered. They say that it is not allowable for the recitation to be confused with the difference in the wording.

original: vadanti. Sace pana sabbaṭṭhānepi eteneva pakārena vadati, vaṭṭati.
analyzed: vadanti sace pana sabba ṭṭhāne pi etena iva pakārena vadati vaṭṭati
translated: But if he speaks in this way in every place, it is allowable.

original: Dveupasampadāpekkhādivatthukathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on two candidates for the going forth, etc.

original: 123. Ekānussāvaneti ettha ekato anussāvanaṃ etesanti ekānussāvanāti asamānādhikaraṇavisayo
analyzed: eka anussāvanā iti ettha ekatas anussāvanam etesan ti eka anussāvanā ati asamāna adhikaraṇa visayaḥ
translated: “At one invitation ceremony” means “at one invitation ceremony for them” .

original: bāhiratthasamāsoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenevāha “dve ekatoanussāvane”ti. Tattha ekatoti ekakkhaṇeti
analyzed: bāhirattha samāsaḥ ti daṭṭhabbam tena iva āha dve ekatas anussāvane iti tattha ekatas ti eka kkhaṇe ti
translated: “In one proclamation” : they are called “of one proclamation” because the proclamation is one for them. The compound is a bahubbīhi with a different meaning from that of the terms. That is why he says, “two in one proclamation.” Herein, “one” means at one time.

original: attho, vibhattialopena cāyaṃ niddeso. Purimanayeneva ekatoanussāvane kātunti “ekena
analyzed: atthaḥ vibhatti a lopena ca ayam niddeso purima nayena iva ekatas anussāvane kātum ti ekena
translated: The locative is elided. “To make one do” means to make one do one proclamation.

original: ekassa, aññena itarassā”tiādinā pubbe vuttanayena dvīhi vā tīhi vā ācariyehi ekena🔽vā ekatoanussāvane kātuṃ.
analyzed: ekassa aññena itarassa ati ādinā pubbe vutta nayena dvīhi vā tīhi vā ācariyehi ekena  vai ekatas anussāvane kātum
translated: “By one” means by one preceptor. “By two” means by two preceptors. “By three” means by three preceptors.

original: Upasampadāvidhikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: upasampadā vidhi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the ordination procedure.

original: 126. Vajjāvajjaṃ upanijjhāyatīti upajjhāti iminā upajjhāyasaddasamānattho upajjhāsaddopīti dasseti.
analyzed: vajjāvajjam upanijjhāyati iti upajjhā iti iminā upajjhāya sadda samāna atthaḥ upajjhā saddaḥ api iti dasseti
translated: “He considers what is blameworthy and what is not blameworthy”: he shows that the word upajjhāya is synonymous with upajjhāya.

original: Cattāronissayādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: cattāro nissaya ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the four requisites, etc.

original: 130. Sambhogeti dhammasambhoge āmisasambhoge ca. Anāpatti sambhoge saṃvāseti ettha
analyzed: sambhoge iti dhamma sambhoge āmisa sambhoge ca anāpatti sambhoge saṃvāse iti ettha
translated: “In sharing”: in sharing the Dhamma and in sharing requisites. “In sharing and in living together”:

original: ca ayamadhippāyo – yasmā ayaṃ osāraṇakammassa katattā pakatattaṭṭhāne ṭhito, tasmā
analyzed: ca ayam adhippāyaḥ yasmai ayam osāraṇa kammassa kata ttā pakata tta ṭṭhāne ṭhitaḥ tasmai
translated: the intention here is this. Since he is restored by the performance of the act of readmission, he is restored to his former status.

original: na ukkhittakena saddhiṃ sambhogādipaccayā pācittiyaṃ, nāpi alajjinā saddhiṃ paribhogapaccayā
analyzed: na ukkhittakena saddhim sambhoga ādi paccayā pācittiyam na api alajjinā saddhim paribhoga paccayā
translated: There is no offence of wrong-doing for one who has been suspended in the conditions of sharing a sleeping place with him, etc.;🔽nor is there any offence of wrong-doing for one who is shameless in the conditions of using what belongs to him.

original: dukkaṭaṃ alajjīlakkhaṇānupapattito. Yo hi ucchurasakasaṭānaṃ sattāhakālikayāvajīvikattā🔽vaṭṭati vikāle ucchu khāditunti saññaṃ uppādetvā taṃ khāditvā tappaccayā pācittiyaṃ
analyzed: dukkaṭam alajjī lakkhaṇa anupapattitaḥ yaḥ hi ucchu rasaka saṭānam satta aha kālikayā āvajīvika ttā  vaṭṭati vikāle ucchu khāditunti saññam uppādetvā tam khāditvā tad paccayā pācittiyam
translated: For the characteristic of one who is shameless is not applicable to him.🔽If one who is allowed to eat ghee, fresh butter, oil, honey, and sugar, thinking that it is allowable to eat ghee out of season, eats it, and does not see an offence in doing so, because he thinks that it is allowable,

original: na passati “vaṭṭatī”ti tathāsaññitāya, yo vā pana āpattimāpannabhāvaṃ paṭijānitvā
analyzed: na passati vaṭṭati iti tathā saññitāya yaḥ vā pana āpattim āpanna bhāvam paṭijānitvā
translated: or if one who has fallen into an offence admits that he has fallen into it,

original: “na paṭikaromī”ti abhinivisati, ayaṃ –
analyzed: na paṭikaromi iti abhinivisati ayam
translated: but persists in thinking, “I will not make amends for it,”

original: “Sañcicca āpattiṃ āpajjati, āpattiṃ parigūhati;
analyzed: sañcit ca āpattim āpajjati āpattim parigūhati
translated: “One who deliberately commits an offence, who conceals an offence,

original: Agatigamanañca gacchati, ediso vuccati alajjīpuggalo”ti. –🔽Vuttalakkhaṇe apatanato alajjī nāma na hoti. Tasmā yathā pubbe yāva ukkhepanīyakammaṃ
analyzed: agati gamanam ca gacchati edisaḥ vuccati alajjī puggalo ti  vutta lakkhaṇe apatanataḥ alajjī nāma na hoti tasmā yathā pubbe yāva ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: Who goes by a wrong path, is called a shameless person.”🔽Because he does not fall into the characteristic that has been stated, he is not shameless.🔽Therefore, just as there was no offence in sharing a sleeping place with him or in associating with him as long as the procedure of ejecting him had not been carried out,

original: kataṃ, tāva tena saddhiṃ sambhoge saṃvāse ca anāpatti, evamidhāpīti sabbathā anāpattiṭṭhāneyeva
analyzed: katam tāva tena saddhim sambhoge saṃvāse ca anāpatti evam idha api iti sabbathā anāpatti ṭṭhānā iya eva
translated: so too there is no offence in any case.

original: anāpatti vuttāti veditabbaṃ. Na hi bhagavā alajjinā saddhiṃ sambhogapaccayā āpattisambhave🔽sati “anāpatti sambhoge saṃvāse”ti vadati. Tato yamettha kenaci “anāpatti sambhoge🔽saṃvāse”ti iminā pācittiyena anāpatti vuttā, “alajjīparibhogapaccayā dukkaṭaṃ pana
analyzed: anāpatti vuttā iti veditabbam na hi bhagavā alajjinā saddhim sambhoga paccayā āpatti sambhave  sati anāpatti sambhoge saṃvāsa iti vadati tatas yam ettha kenaci anāpatti sambhoge  saṃvāse ti iminā pācittiyena anāpatti vuttā alajjī paribhoga paccayā dukkaṭam pana
translated: It should be understood that there is no offence. For the Blessed One does not say that there is no offence in the case of one who associates with one who is shameless when there is a possibility of an offence arising through the condition of association.

original: āpajjatiyevā”ti vatvā bahudhā papañcitaṃ, na taṃ sārato paccetabbaṃ. Sesamettha uttānameva.
analyzed: āpajjatiyā iva iti vatvā bahudhā papañcitam na tat sārataḥ paccetabbam sesam ettha uttānam eva
translated: Therefore what has been much elaborated here by someone with “There is no offence in the case of one who associates with one who is shameless in the case of the offence of Expiation stated thus, ‘There is no offence in association, in living together,’ but he does fall into an offence of wrong-doing in the case of the use of what is unallowable” should not be accepted as authoritative. The rest here is clear.

original: Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ
analyzed: iti samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: So in the Commentary on the Discipline called Samantapāsādikā

original: Mahākhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahākhandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Description of the Great Section is finished.

original: 2. Uposathakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: uposatha khandhakam
translated: The Observance Chapter

original: Sannipātānujānanādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sannipāta anujānana ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Discussion of the Allowance of Assemblies, etc.

original: 132. Uposathakkhandhake taranti plavanti ettha bālāti titthaṃ. Itoti imasmiṃ sāsane laddhito. Taṃ kathentīti “imasmiṃ nāma divase muhutte vā idaṃ kattabba”ntiādinā kathenti.
analyzed: uposatha khandhake taranti plavanti ettha bālā ati tittham itas ti imasmim sāsane laddhitaḥ tam kathenti iti imasmim nāma divase muhutte vā idam kattabba nti ādinā kathenti
translated: “A ford is a place where fools cross and float” . “From here” : from this Dispensation. “They tell it” : they tell it thus, “On this day or at this time this should be done.”

original: 134. “Suṇātu me bhante”tiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ mātikāṭṭhakathāyaṃ vitthārato āgatamevāti na idha vitthārayissāma, atthikehi pana tatoyeva gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhantā iti ādīsu yam vattabbam tam mātikā aṭṭhakathā ayam vitthārataḥ āgatam eva ati na idha vitthārayissāma atthikehi pana tatas yā iva gahetabbam
translated: As to “Let the venerable ones listen to me” and so on, what should be said has already been given in detail in the commentary on the Schedule, so we shall not elaborate it here. But those who want detail can find it there.

original: 135. Āpajjitvā vā vuṭṭhitoti ettha ārocitāpi āpatti asantī nāma hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: āpajjitvā vā vuṭṭhitaḥ ti ettha ārocitā api āpatti asantī nāma hoti iti veditabbam
translated: Having fallen and then recovered: here it should be understood that an offence that has been confessed is as good as non-existent.

analyzed: tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam yassa pana evam anāpannā vā āpatti āpajjitvā ca
translated: That is why it is said in the commentary on the Schedule, “But if someone has no offence, or having fallen into an offence he has recovered from it,

analyzed: pana vuṭṭhitā vā desitā vā ārocitā vā tassa sā āpatti asantī nāma hoti iti musāvādo
translated: or has confessed it, or has announced it, then that offence is as good as non-existent” .🔽Lying is a condition for a schism: he said “not by the characteristic of lying” .

analyzed: nāma vacībheda paccayā hoti iti āha na musāvāda lakkhaṇena ati bhagavataḥ pana vacanena ati
translated: But by the Blessed One’s word:

analyzed: sampajāna musāvāde kim hoti dukkaṭam hoti iti iminā vacanena vacī dvāre akiriya samuṭṭhānā
translated: What is there in a deliberate lie? “There is wrong-doing” is said by this word.

analyzed: āpatti hoti iti yasmai yassa bhikkhuno adhammikāya paṭiññāya tuṇhībhūtassa nisinnassa

original: manodvāre āpatti nāma natthi, yasmā pana āvi kātabbaṃ na āvi akāsi, tenassa vacīdvāre
analyzed: manodvāre āpatti nāma natthi yasmā pana āvi kātabbam na āvi akāsi tenassa vacī dvāre
translated: There is no offence in the mind-door, but since he did not make it known when he should have made it known, he has an offence

original: akiriyasamuṭṭhānā āpatti hoti.
analyzed: a kiriya samuṭṭhānā āpatti hoti
translated: originating in bodily and verbal action.

original: Vācāti vācāya, ya-kāralopenāyaṃ niddeso. Kenaci manujena vācāya anālapantoti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vācā iti vācāya yakāra lopena ayam niddeso kenaci manujena vācāya an ālapanto ti yojetabbam
translated: Speech: by speech. This is the definition with the omission of the ya-prefix. One should construe: “not making known by speech to any person.”

original: Giraṃ no ca pare bhaṇeyyāti “ime sossantī”ti parapuggale sandhāya saddampi na nicchāreyya.
analyzed: giram no ca pare bhaṇeyya ati ime sossanti iti para puggale sandhāya saddam pi na
translated: Not speak: not even utter a sound, referring to other persons, thinking, “They will understand.”

original: Āpajjeyya vācasikanti vācato samuṭṭhitaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjeyya.
analyzed: āpajjeyya vācasikam ti vācatas samuṭṭhitam āpattim āpajjeyya
translated: He would incur an offence of speech: he would incur an offence originating in speech.

original: Antarāyakaroti vippaṭisāravatthutāya pāmojjādisambhavaṃ nivāretvā paṭhamajjhānādīnaṃ🔽adhigamāya antarāyakaro. Tassa bhikkhuno phāsu hotīti avippaṭisāramūlakānaṃ pāmojjādīnaṃ
analyzed: antarāya karoti vippaṭisāra vatthu tāya pāmojja ādi sambhavam nivāretvā paṭhama jhāna ādīnam  adhigamāya antarāya karo tassa bhikkhuno phāsu hoti iti a vippaṭisāra mūlakānam pāmojja ādīnam
translated: He would be an obstacle: by being a cause for regret, he would prevent the arising of joy, etc., and would be an obstacle to the attainment of the first jhāna, etc.

original: vasena tassa bhikkhuno sukhā paṭipadā sampajjatīti attho.🔽Sannipātānujānanādikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vasena tassa bhikkhuno sukhā paṭipadā sampajjati iti attho  sannipāta anujānana ādi kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: That monk would be comfortable: the meaning is that the monk would have a pleasant way of practice by means of joy, etc., which have non-remorse as their root.🔽The explanation of the section on the allowance of the meeting, etc., is finished.

original: Sīmānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sīmā anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the allowance of the monastery zone, etc.

original: 138. Itaropīti suddhapaṃsupabbatādiṃ sandhāya vadati. Hatthippamāṇo nāma pabbato
analyzed: itaraḥ api iti suddhapaṃsu pabbata ādim sandhāya vadati hatthippamāṇaḥ nāma pabbataḥ
translated: “Or another” refers to pure sand, rock, etc. A rock the size of an elephant:

original: heṭṭhimakoṭiyā aḍḍhaṭṭhamaratanubbedho. Tasmāti yasmā ekena na vaṭṭati, tasmā. Dvattiṃsapalaguḷapiṇḍappamāṇatā
analyzed: heṭṭhima koṭiyāḥ tasmā iti yasmai ekena na vaṭṭati tasmai dvattiṃsa palaguḷa piṇḍa ppamāṇa tā
translated: the lower part is eight cubits high. “Because of that”: because of the fact that it is not allowable for one, therefore. The size of thirty-two palmyra fruits:

original: thūlatāya gahetabbā, na tulagaṇanāya. Antosāramissakānanti antosārarukkhehi missakānaṃ.🔽Sūcidaṇḍakappamāṇoti sīhaḷadīpe lekhanadaṇḍappamāṇoti vadanti, so ca kaniṭṭhaṅguliparimāṇoti
analyzed: thūla tāya gahetabbā na tula gaṇanāya antosāra missakānam ti antosāra rukkhehi missakānam  sūci daṇḍaka ppamāṇaḥ ti sīhaḷadīpe lekhana daṇḍa ppamāṇaḥ iti vadanti saḥ ca kaniṭṭha aṅguli parimāṇaḥ ti
translated: the thickness should be taken as the size of thirty-two palmyra fruits, not the number of fruits. “Mixed with heartwood”: mixed with trees with heartwood.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Etanti navamūlasākhāniggamanaṃ. Parabhāge kittetuṃ vaṭṭatīti bahi nikkhamitvā
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam etat ti nava mūla sākhā niggamanam parabhāge kittetum vaṭṭati iti bahi nikkhamitvā
translated: The size of a needle-case: in the island of Sri Lanka they say it is the size of a writing pen. And that should be understood as the size of the little finger. “That”: the going out nine steps from the root and the branch. “It is allowable to mark it on the other side”: having gone out,

original: ṭhitesu aṭṭhasu maggesu ekissā disāya ekaṃ, aparāya ekanti evaṃ catūsu ṭhānesu kittetuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ṭhitesu aṭṭhasu maggesu ekissā disāya ekam aparāya ekam ti evam catūsu ṭhānesu kittetum vaṭṭati
translated: it is allowable to mark it in four places, one in each of the four directions, in the eight directions in which there are paths.

original: Yattha katthaci uttarantiyā bhikkhuniyā antaravāsako temiyatīti sikkhākaraṇīyaṃ āgatalakkhaṇena
analyzed: yattha katthaci uttarantiyā bhikkhuniyā antaravāsakaḥ temiyati iti sikkhākaraṇīyam āgata lakkhaṇena
translated: Wherever a bhikkhunī goes, her sarong sticks to her: the characteristic of the training to be undertaken is stated.

original: timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādetvā antaravāsakaṃ anukkhipitvā titthena vā atitthena vā uttarantiyā🔽bhikkhuniyā ekadvaṅgulamattampi antaravāsako temiyati. Bhikkhuniyā eva gahaṇañcettha
analyzed: ti maṇḍalam paṭicchādetvā antaravāsakam an ukkhipitvā titthena vā a titthena vā uttarantiyā  bhikkhuniyāḥ eka dvaṅgula mattam pi antaravāsakaḥ bhikkhuniyāḥ eva gahaṇam ca ittha
translated: if she crosses a river that has a single current, even if it is only as much as to submerge her hips, and she does not cover the three circles or put on her sarong,🔽then she commits an offense.🔽In the case of a river, the offense is only for the nun.

original: bhikkhunīvibhaṅge bhikkhuniyā vasena nadīlakkhaṇassa pāḷiyaṃ āgatattā teneva nayena
analyzed: bhikkhunī vibhaṅge bhikkhuniyā vasena nadī lakkhaṇassa pāḷiyam āgata ttā tena iva nayena
translated: Because the characteristic of a river is given in the Monastic Code in terms of a nun.🔽The purpose of this rule is to show the characteristic of a river.

original: dassanatthaṃ kataṃ. Sīmaṃ bandhantānaṃ nimittaṃ hotīti ayaṃ vuttalakkhaṇā nadī samuddaṃ
analyzed: dassana attham katam sīmam bandhantānam nimittam hoti iti ayam vutta lakkhaṇā nadī samuddam
translated: If people are making a boundary, the river is a sign from the source🔽down to where it enters the ocean or a lake.

original: vā pavisatu taḷākaṃ vā, pabhavato paṭṭhāya nimittaṃ hoti. Ajjhottharitvā āvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: vā pavisatu taḷākam vā pabhavataḥ paṭṭhāya nimittam hoti ajjhottharitvā āvaraṇam
translated: It flows on, covering over.🔽It flows on, covering over, is what is meant.

original: pavattatiyevāti āvaraṇaṃ ajjhottharitvā sandatiyeva. Appavattamānāti asandamānudakā.🔽Āvaraṇañhi patvā nadiyā yattake padese udakaṃ asandamānaṃ santiṭṭhati, tattha nadīnimittaṃ
analyzed: pavattatiyā iva ati āvaraṇam ajjhottharitvā sandatiyā iva a pavattamānā ati a sandamāna udakā  āvaraṇam hi patvā nadiyāḥ yattake padese udakam a sandamānam santiṭṭhati tattha nadī nimittam
translated: It does not flow on, is what is meant by not covering over.🔽The water of a river that does not flow on, but remains in a certain place because it is blocked by an obstruction, is not a sign of a river.

original: kātuṃ na vaṭṭati. Upari sandamānaṭṭhāneyeva vaṭṭati, asandamānaṭṭhāne pana udakanimittaṃ
analyzed: kātum na vaṭṭati upari vaṭṭati a sandamāna ṭṭhāne iya iva vaṭṭati a sandamāna ṭṭhāne pana udaka nimittam
translated: It is only a sign in the place where it flows on. But the water that does not flow on is a sign of the water.

original: kātuṃ vaṭṭati. Ṭhitameva hi udakanimitte vaṭṭati, na sandamānaṃ. Tenevāha “pavattanaṭṭhāne
analyzed: kātum vaṭṭati ṭhitam eva hi udaka nimitte vaṭṭati na sandamānam tena iva āha pavattana ṭṭhāne
translated: It is allowable to do so. For it is allowable only when the water is still, not when it is running. Hence it is said:🔽🔽

original: nadīnimittaṃ, appavattanaṭṭhāne udakanimittaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti. Nadiṃ bhinditvāti
analyzed: nadī nimittam appavattana ṭhāne udaka nimittam kātum vaṭṭati iti nadim bhinditvā iti
translated: It is allowable to make it in the place where the water is still, not in the place where it is flowing. Hence it is said: “It is allowable to make the sign of a river in the place where it flows, and the sign of water in the place where it is still.”🔽Having breached the river: having breached the bank of the river by the mouth of the channel.

original: mātikāmukhadvārena nadīkūlaṃ bhinditvā. Ukkhepimanti kūpato viya ukkhipitvā gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: mātikā mukha dvārena nadī kūlam bhinditvā ukkhepimanti kūpataḥ viya ukkhipitvā gahetabbam
translated: It should be lifted up: it should be lifted up and taken as if from a pit.

original: Siṅghāṭakasaṇṭhānāti tikoṇaracchāsaṇṭhānā. Mudiṅgasaṇṭhānāti mudiṅgabherī viya majjhe
analyzed: siṅghāṭaka saṇṭhānā ati tikoṇa racchā saṇṭhānā mudiṅga saṇṭhānā ati mudiṅga bherī majjhe
translated: The shape of a ploughshare: the shape of a three-cornered furrow. The shape of a drum: in the middle it is

original: vitthatā ubhosu koṭīsu saṅkoṭitā hoti. Upacāraṃ ṭhapetvāti pacchā sīmaṃ bandhantānaṃ🔽sīmāya okāsaṃ ṭhapetvā. Antonimittagatehi panāti ekassa gāmassa upaḍḍhaṃ anto kattukāmatāya
analyzed: vitthatā ubhosu koṭīsu saṅkoṭitā hoti upacāram ṭhapetvā ati pacchā sīmam bandhantānam  sīmāya okāsam ṭhapetvā antar nimitta gatehi panāti ekassa gāmassa upaḍḍham antar kattu kāma tāya
translated: spread out like a drum or a kettle-drum, and at both ends it is drawn in.🔽Having reserved a space: having reserved a space for the sīmā for those who will be making the sīmā later.

original: sati sabbesaṃ āgamane payojanaṃ natthīti katvā vuttaṃ. Āgantabbanti ca sāmīcivasena
analyzed: sati sabbesam āgamane payojanam natthi iti katvā vuttam āgantabban ti ca sāmīci vasena
translated: But if all the resident bhikkhus come: this is said because there is no point in all of them coming if one who wants to make half of a single village to be inside the sīmā🔽has made it.🔽But if they come: this is said in the sense of what is proper.

original: vuttaṃ, nāyaṃ niyamo “āgantabbamevā”ti. Tenevāha “āgamanampi anāgamanampi vaṭṭatī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam na ayam niyamaḥ āgantabbam eva ati tena iva āha āgamanam pi anāgamanam pi vaṭṭati iti
translated: This is not a rule that they must come. Hence it is said: “It is allowable for them to come or not to come.”

original: Abaddhāya hi sīmāya nānāgāmakhettānaṃ nānāsīmasabhāvattā tesaṃ anāgamanepi vaggakammaṃ
analyzed: abaddhāya hi sīmāya nānā gāma khettānam nānā sīma sabhāvattā tesam an āgamane pi vagga kammaṃ
translated: For if the boundary is not fixed, then, since the fields of the various monasteries have different boundaries, the transaction is not invalidated by the absence of monks from other monasteries.

original: na hoti, tasmā anāgamanampi vaṭṭati. Baddhāya pana sīmāya ekasīmabhāvato puna aññasmiṃ
analyzed: na hoti tasmai anāgamanam pi vaṭṭati baddhāya pana sīmāya eka sīma bhāvato puna aññasmin
translated: Therefore the absence of monks is allowable. But if the boundary is fixed, then, since all the monasteries are within a single boundary, the monks must come again when another transaction is being carried out.

original: kamme kariyamāne anto sīmagatehi āgantabbamevāti āha “avippavāsasīmā…pe… āgantabba”nti.
analyzed: kamme kariyamāne antar sīma gatehi āgantabbam eva ati āha a vippavāsa sīmāpe āgantabbanti
translated: This is why it is said, “In a boundary of non-residence … they must come” .

original: Nimittakittanakāle asodhitāyapi sīmāya nevatthi doso nimittakittanassa apalokanādīsu aññatarābhāvato.
analyzed: nimitta kittana kāle sīmāya na iva atthi dosaḥ nimitta kittanassa apalokana ādīsu aññatara abhāvato
translated: At the time of proclaiming the sign there is no harm in not having the boundary cleared first, because there is no proclamation of the sign, etc.,🔽The mention of “going forth” is in order to include the “act of asking permission” .

original: Bhaṇḍukammāpucchanaṃ sandhāya pabbajjā-gahaṇaṃ. Sukhakaraṇatthanti sabbesaṃ sannipātanaparissamaṃ🔽pahāya appatarehi sukhakaraṇatthaṃ. Ekavīsati bhikkhū gaṇhātīti vīsativaggakaraṇīyaparamattā
analyzed: bhaṇḍu kamma āpucchanam sandhāya pabbajjā gahaṇam sukha karaṇa attham ti sabbesam sannipātana parissamam  pahāya appatarehi sukha karaṇa attham ekavīsati bhikkhū gaṇhāti iti vīsati vagga karaṇīya paramattā
translated: “For the sake of comfort” means for the sake of comfort for all, avoiding the inconvenience of a large gathering.

original: saṅghakammassa kammārahena saddhiṃ ekavīsati bhikkhū gaṇhāti. Idañca nisinnānaṃ vasena
analyzed: saṅgha kammassa kamma arahena saddhim ekavīsati bhikkhū gaṇhāti idam ca nisinnānam vasena
translated: “He takes twenty-one monks” means that he takes twenty-one monks, the maximum number required for a transaction of a group of twenty.🔽This is on the basis of those who are seated.

original: vuttaṃ. Heṭṭhimantato hi yattha ekavīsati bhikkhū nisīdituṃ sakkonti, tattake padese
analyzed: vuttam heṭṭhimantataḥ hi yattha ekavīsati bhikkhū nisīditum sakkonti tattake padese
translated: This has been said. In the lowest (case), in a place where twenty-one monks can sit down,

original: sīmaṃ bandhituṃ vaṭṭati. Na sakkhissantīti avippavāsasīmāya baddhabhāvaṃ asallakkhetvā
analyzed: sīmam bandhitum vaṭṭati na sakkhissanti iti a vippavāsa sīmāya baddha bhāvam a saṃlakkhetvā
translated: This has been said. For it is allowable to lay a boundary in a place where twenty-one bhikkhus can sit down comfortably. They will not be able to do so if they do not take account of the fact that a boundary of non-co- residence has been laid down.

original: “samānasaṃvāsakameva samūhanissāmā”ti vāyamantā na sakkhissanti. Baddhāya hi avippavāsasīmāya
analyzed: samāna saṃvāsakam eva samūhanissāma ati vā āyamantāḥ na sakkhissanti baddhāya hi a vippavāsa sīmāya
translated: For they will not be able to do so if they try to abolish the co-residence by thinking, “We shall abolish it.”🔽For when a boundary of non-co-residence has been laid down,

original: taṃ asamūhanitvā “samānasaṃvāsakasīmaṃ samūhanissāmā”ti katāyapi kammavācāya asamūhatāva
analyzed: tam a samūhanitvā samāna saṃvāsaka sīmam samūhanissāma ati kamma vācāya
translated: the boundary is not abolished by the mere doing of the proclamation of the kammavācā, even though it be done with the thought, “We shall abolish the boundary of co-residence.”

original: hoti sīmā. Paṭhamañhi avippavāsaṃ samūhanitvā pacchā sīmā samūhanitabbā. Ekaratanappamāṇā
analyzed: hoti sīmā paṭhamam hi a vippavāsam samūhanitvā pacchā sīmā samūhanitabbā eka ratana ppamāṇā
translated: For the boundary of non-co-residence must first be abolished and then the boundary of co-residence.

original: suviññeyyatarā hotīti katvā vuttaṃ “ekaratanappamāṇā vaṭṭatī”ti. Ekaṅgulamattāpi
analyzed: su viññeyyatarā hoti iti katvā vuttam eka ratana ppamāṇā vaṭṭati iti eka ṅgula mattā api
translated: It is said that “one that is one-league in extent is allowable” because one that is the size of one standard league is more easily recognized.🔽A space of one finger’s breadth is also allowable.

original: sīmantarikā vaṭṭatiyeva. Tattakenapi hi sīmā asambhinnāva hoti.
analyzed: sīmantarikā hi sīmā a sambhinnā ava hoti
translated: For even with that much the boundary is not confused.

original: Avasesanimittānīti mahāsīmāya bāhirapasse nimittāni. Khaṇḍasīmato paṭṭhāya bandhanaṃ
analyzed: avasesa nimittāni iti mahā sīmāya bāhira passe nimittāni khaṇḍa sīmataḥ paṭṭhāya bandhanam
translated: The other signs: the signs outside the great boundary.

original: āciṇṇaṃ, āciṇṇakaraṇeneva ca sammoho na hotīti āha “khaṇḍasīmatova paṭṭhāya bandhitabbā”ti.
analyzed: āciṇṇam āciṇṇa karaṇena iva ca sammohaḥ na hoti iti āha khaṇḍa sīmataḥ uva paṭṭhāya bandhitabbā ti
translated: And since there is no confusion when the procedure is done as it is laid down, he says, “It should be done starting from the line of the broken wall.”

original: Kuṭigeheti kuṭighare, bhūmighareti attho. Udukkhalanti khuddakāvāṭaṃ. Nimittaṃ na
analyzed: kuṭi gehe iti kuṭi ghare bhūmi ghare ti attho udukkhalanti khudda kāvāṭam nimittam na
translated: In a hut: in a hut built on the ground. A mortar: a small pestle.

original: kātabbanti taṃ rājiṃ vā udukkhalaṃ vā nimittaṃ na kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: kātabbanti tam rājim vā udukkhalam vā nimittam na kātabbam
translated: No sign is to be made: no sign is to be made of that line or of the mortar.

original: Heṭṭhā na otaratīti bhittito oraṃ nimittāni ṭhapetvā kittitattā heṭṭhā ākāsappadesaṃ🔽na otarati. Heṭṭhāpi otaratīti sace heṭṭhā antobhittiyaṃ ekavīsatiyā bhikkhūnaṃ okāso🔽hoti, otarati. Otaramānā ca uparisīmappamāṇena na otarati, samantā bhittippamāṇena🔽otarati. Otaraṇānotaraṇaṃ vuttanayeneva veditabbanti sace heṭṭhā ekavīsatiyā bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: heṭṭhā naḥ otarati iti bhittitaḥ oram nimittāni ṭhapetvā heṭṭhā ākāsa ppadesam  na otarati heṭṭhā api otarati iti sace heṭṭhā antobhittiyam ekavīsatiyā bhikkhūnam okāsaḥ  hoti otarati otaramānā ca upari sīma ppamāṇena na otarati samantā bhitti ppamāṇena  otarati otaraṇa anotaraṇam vutta nayena iva veditabban ti sace heṭṭhā ekavīsatiyā bhikkhūnam
translated: It does not descend below: because the signs are placed above the wall, the space below the signs does not belong to the monastery zone.🔽It descends below: if there is room for twenty-one bhikkhus inside the wall below, it belongs to the monastery zone. And when it descends, it does not descend by the measure of the height of the upper story, but by the measure of the height of the wall all around.

original: okāso hoti, otarati. No ce, na otaratīti adhippāyo. Sabbo pāsādo sīmaṭṭho hotīti
analyzed: okāsaḥ hoti otarati no ce na otarati iti adhippāyo sabbaḥ pāsādaḥ sīmaṭṭhaḥ hoti iti
translated: The descending and not descending should be understood in the same way: if there is room for twenty-one bhikkhus below, it belongs to the monastery zone. If not, it does not belong to the monastery zone. This is the intention. The whole terrace belongs to the monastery zone.

original: uparimatalena saddhiṃ ekābaddhabhittiko vā hotu mā vā, sabbopi pāsādo sīmaṭṭhova hoti.🔽Tālamūlakapabbateti tālamūlasadise pabbate. So ca heṭṭhā mahanto hutvā anupubbena🔽tanuko hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Paṇavasaṇṭhāno majjhe tanuko hoti mūle agge ca vitthato.
analyzed: uparima talena saddhim eka ābaddha bhittikaḥ vā hotu mā vā sabbaḥ pi pāsādaḥ sīmaṭṭhaḥ uva hoti  tālamūlaka pabbata iti tāla mūla sadise pabbate saḥ ca heṭṭhā mahantaḥ hutvā anupubbena  tanukaḥ hoti iti daṭṭhabbam paṇava saṇṭhānaḥ majjhe tanukaḥ hoti mūle agge ca vitthataḥ
translated: Whether the upper story is connected to the wall or not, the whole stilt house is still in the monastery.🔽On a mountain like a palm stump: on a mountain like a palm stump. And that should be seen as being big at the bottom and gradually🔽getting thinner. The shape of a drum: it is thin in the middle and wide at the bottom and top.

original: Heṭṭhā vā majjhe vāti mudiṅgasaṇṭhānassa heṭṭhā paṇavasaṇṭhānassa majjhe. Ākāsapabbhāranti🔽bhittiyā aparikkhittapabbhāraṃ. Antoleṇaṃ hotīti pabbatassa anto leṇaṃ hoti. Sīmāmāḷaketi🔽khaṇḍasīmāmāḷake. Mahāsīmaṃ sodhetvā vā kammaṃ kātabbanti mahāsīmagatā bhikkhū hatthapāsaṃ🔽vā ānetabbā, sīmato vā bahi kātabbāti adhippāyo. Gaṇṭhipadesu pana “mahāsīmagatehi
analyzed: heṭṭhā vā majjhe vāti mudiṅga saṇṭhānassa heṭṭhā paṇava saṇṭhānassa majjhe ākāsa pabbhāranti  bhittiyāḥ a parikkhitta pabbhāram antoleṇam hoti iti pabbatassa antar leṇam hoti sīmāmāḷaka iti  khaṇḍa sīmā māḷake mahā sīmam sodhetvā vā kammam kātabbanti mahā sīma gatāḥ bhikkhū hattha pāsam  vā ānetabbā sīmataḥ vā bahi kātabbā iti adhippāyaḥ gaṇṭhi padesu pana mahā sīma gatehi
translated: At the bottom or in the middle: of a shape like a drum. The open air: a mountain with no wall around it. A cave: there is a cave inside the mountain. In a monastery:🔽in a monastery with a boundary. After clearing a large monastery: the intention is that either the monks in the large monastery should be brought within arm’s reach

original: bhikkhūhi taṃ sākhaṃ vā pārohaṃ vā anāmasitvā ṭhātabbanti adhippāyo”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: bhikkhūhi tam sākham vā pāroham vā an āmasitvā ṭhātabbanti adhippāyaḥ ti vuttam tam
translated: or the business should be done outside the monastery. But in the commentaries it is said that the intention is that the monks in the large monastery should stand without touching that branch or that wall.

original: na gahetabbaṃ. Purimanayepīti khaṇḍasīmāya uṭṭhahitvā mahāsīmāya oṇatarukkhepi. Ukkhipāpetvā
analyzed: na gahetabbam purima naye pi iti khaṇḍa sīmāya uṭṭhahitvā mahā sīmāya oṇatara ukkhe pi ukkhipāpetvā
translated: It should not be taken. Also in the former way: having risen in the boundary of a piece of wood, even if the trees are lower in the great boundary. Having had them removed

original: kātuṃ na vaṭṭatīti khaṇḍasīmāya anto ṭhitattā rukkhassa tattha ṭhito hatthapāsaṃyeva
analyzed: kātum na vaṭṭati iti khaṇḍa sīmāya antar ṭhita ttā rukkhassa tattha ṭhitaḥ hattha pāsaṃya iva
translated: it is not allowable to do so. Because they are standing inside the boundary of a piece of wood, the tree’s handspan standing there

original: ānetabboti ukkhipāpetvā kātuṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ānetabbaḥ iti ukkhipāpetvā kātum na vaṭṭati
translated: should be brought. Having had them removed, it is not allowable to do so.

original: 140. Pārayatīti ajjhottharati. Pārāti sīmāpekkho itthiliṅganiddeso. Assāti bhaveyya.
analyzed: pārayati iti ajjhottharati sīmā apekkhaḥ itthi liṅga niddesaḥ assa āti bhaveyya
translated: Pārayati = ajjhottharati. Pārā = sīmāpekkho. Itthiliṅganiddeso. Assa = bhaveyya.

original: Idhādhippetanāvāya pamāṇaṃ dassento āha “yā sabbantimena paricchedena…pe… tayo jane
analyzed: idha adhippeta nāvāya pamāṇam dassentaḥ āha yā tayaḥ jane
translated: Pointing out the measure of the boat intended here, he said: “That which can carry three people with this much space left over …

original: vahatī”ti. Iminā ca vuttappamāṇato khuddakā nāvā vijjamānāpi idha asantapakkhaṃ bhajatīti
analyzed: vahati iti iminā ca vutta ppamāṇataḥ khuddakā nāvā vijjamānā api idha asanta pakkham bhajati iti
translated: … carries three people.” And by this, it is shown that although a boat smaller than the measure stated exists, it belongs to the class of non-existence here.

original: dīpeti. Avassaṃ labbhaneyyā dhuvanāvāva hotīti sambandho. Rukkhaṃ chinditvā katoti
analyzed: dīpeti avassam labbhaneyyā hoti iti sambandho rukkham chinditvā kato ti
translated: The connection is: it is a boat that can be obtained by begging, and it is always a boat. The reading is: “having cut down a tree, made”

original: pāṭhaseso. Paratīre sammukhaṭṭhāneti orimatīre sabbapariyantanimittassa sammukhaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: pāṭha sesaḥ para tīre sammukha ṭṭhāne ti orima tīre sabba pariyanta nimittassa sammukha ṭṭhāne
translated: Standing opposite on the other bank: in the place opposite the sign of the whole extent on this bank.

original: Sabbanimittānaṃ anto ṭhite bhikkhū hatthapāsagate katvāti ettha sace ekaṃ gāmakhettaṃ
analyzed: sabba nimittānam antar ṭhite bhikkhū hattha pāsa gate katvā ati ettha sace ekam gāma khettam
translated: “Having made the bhikkhus standing within the range of the sign within arm’s reach” .🔽

original: hoti, ubhosu tīresu sabbanimittānaṃ anto ṭhite bhikkhū hatthapāsagate katvā sammannitabbā.
analyzed: hoti ubhosu tīresu sabba nimittānam antar ṭhite bhikkhū hattha pāsa gate katvā sammannitabbā
translated: “Bhikkhus standing within the boundaries of all the signs” means that if the monastery zone is one village area, then bhikkhus standing within the boundaries of all the signs on both sides should be made to agree to the resolution.🔽If the monastery zone is several village areas, it is allowable for them not to come at the time of the resolution to make a zone of common affiliation.

original: Nānāgāmakkhettaṃ ce, samānasaṃvāsakasīmābandhanakāle anāgantumpi vaṭṭati. Avippavāsasīmāsammutiyaṃ🔽pana āgantabbameva. Yasmā ubhosu tīresu nimittakittanamattena dīpako saṅgahito nāma🔽na hoti, tasmā dīpakepi nimittāni visuṃ kittetabbānevāti āha “dīpakassa orimante
analyzed: nānā gāma khettam ce samāna saṃvāsaka sīmābandhana kāle vaṭṭati a vippavāsa sīmā sammutiyam  pana āgantabbam eva yasmai ubhosu tīresu nimitta kittana mattena dīpakaḥ saṅgahitaḥ nāma  na hoti tasmā dīpake pi nimittāni visum āha dīpakassa orimante
translated: But they must come at the time of the resolution to make a zone of non-intercourse.🔽Since the island is not included by the mere description of the signs on both sides, therefore the signs should be described separately even on the island.

original: ca pārimante ca nimittaṃ kittetabba”nti. Dīpakasikharanti dīpakamatthakaṃ. Pabbatasaṇṭhānāti
analyzed: ca pārimante ca nimittam dīpaka sikharanti dīpaka matthakam pabbata saṇṭhānā ti
translated: That is why he said “The sign on the near side and the sign on the far side of the island should be described.”🔽The peak of the island: the top of the island.

original: dīpakassa ekato adhikatarattā vuttaṃ.🔽Sīmānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dīpakassa ekatas adhikatara ttā vuttam  sīmānujānana kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The shape of the mountain: this is said because one side of the island is higher than the other.🔽The explanation of the discussion of the allowance of a zone is ended.

original: Uposathāgārādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: uposatha āgāra ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the hall for the observance-day ceremony, etc.

original: 142. Vatthuvasena vuttanti “mayañcamhā asammatāya bhūmiyā nisinnā pātimokkhaṃ assumhā”ti🔽vatthumhi pātimokkhasavanassa āgatattā vuttaṃ. Uposathappamukhaṃ nāma uposathāgārassa
analyzed: vatthu vasena vuttanti mayam camhā asammatāya bhūmiyā nisinnāḥ pātimokkham assumha iti  vatthumhi pātimokkha savanassa āgata ttā vuttam uposatha pamukham nāma uposatha āgārassa
translated: “In terms of the site”: because the recitation of the Monastic Code is included in the site, as shown by the statement, “We were sitting on an unapproved site when we recited the Monastic Code.”🔽“In the vicinity of the observance-day hall”: the place that is in the vicinity of the observance-day hall.

original: sammukhaṭṭhānaṃ. Pāḷiyaṃ “paṭhamaṃ nimittā kittetabbā”ti ettakameva vatvā sīmāsammutiyaṃ🔽viya “pabbatanimittaṃ pāsāṇanimitta”ntiādinā visesetvā nimittānaṃ adassitattā “khuddakāni
analyzed: sammukha ṭṭhānam pāḷiyam paṭhamam nimittā kittetabbā ti ettakam eva vatvā sīmā sammutiyam  viya pabbata nimittam pāsāṇa nimittam ti ādinā visesetvā nimittānam a dassita ttā khuddakāni
translated: In the text, only this much is said: “First the signs should be announced.”🔽But because the signs are not specified in the way they are in the case of the resolution for a monastery zone, as “a mountain as a sign, a rock as a sign,” it is said, “any small signs, or whatever signs there are.”

original: vā…pe… yāni kānici nimittānī”ti vuttaṃ. Kittetuṃ vaṭṭatīti iminā sambandho.
analyzed: vāpe yāni kānici nimittāni iti vuttam kittetum vaṭṭati iti iminā sambandhaḥ
translated: This is connected with “should be announced”.

original: Avippavāsasīmānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: a vippavāsa sīmā anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the allowance for monastery zones without affiliation🔽“Their”: of the Sangha of nuns.

original: 144. Assāti bhikkhunisaṅghassa. Dvepi sīmāyoti paṭhamaṃ vuttā avippavāsasīmā samānasaṃvāsakasīmā
analyzed: assa ti bhikkhuni saṅghassa dve pi sīmāyaḥ ti paṭhamam vuttā a vippavāsa sīmā samāna saṃvāsaka sīmā
translated: “Two kinds of monastery zones”: the first is the monastery zone without affiliation, and the second is the monastery zone with affiliation.

original: ca. Na kammavācaṃ vaggaṃ karontīti kammavācaṃ na bhindanti, kammaṃ na kopentīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: ca na kamma vācam vaggam karonti iti kamma vācam na bhindanti kammam na kopenti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “They don’t break the proclamation of the legal procedure”: they don’t interrupt the legal procedure, is the meaning.

original: Etthāti “ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañcā”ti ettha. Gāmañca gāmūpacārañca na ottharatīti
analyzed: ettha ati ṭhapetvā gāman ca gāmūpacāram ca ati ettha gāman ca gāmūpacāram ca na ottharati iti
translated: ‘Here’: in the passage ‘except the village and the precincts of the village.’ ‘Does not enter the village or the precincts of the village’:

original: “ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañcā”ti vuttattā. Sīmāsaṅkhyameva gacchatīti avippavāsasīmāsaṅkhaṃ🔽gacchati. Ekampi kulaṃ paviṭṭhaṃ vāti abhinavakatagehesu sabbapaṭhamaṃ ekampi kulaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapetvā gāmam ca gāmūpacāram ca ati vutta ttā sīmā saṅkhyam eva gacchati iti a vippavāsa sīmā saṅkham  gacchati ekam pi kulam paviṭṭham vāti abhinava kata gehesu sabba paṭhamam ekam pi kulam
translated: because of the words ‘except the village and the precincts of the village.’ ‘It becomes a kind of territory’: it becomes a kind of non-communal territory.🔽‘A single family has entered’: in the case of new houses, a single family has entered for the first time.

original: paviṭṭhaṃ atthi. Agataṃ vāti porāṇakagāme aññesu gehāni chaḍḍetvā gatesu ekampi kulaṃ agataṃ atthi.
analyzed: paviṭṭham atthi agatam vā ati porāṇakagāme aññesu gehāni chaḍḍetvā gatesu ekam pi kulam agatam atthi
translated: ‘A single family has not entered’: in the case of an old village, a single family has not entered after abandoning the other houses.

original: Avippavāsasīmā na samūhantabbāti mahāsīmaṃ sandhāya vadati. Nirāsaṅkaṭṭhānesu ṭhatvāti
analyzed: a vippavāsa sīmā na samūhantabbā ati mahā sīmam sandhāya vadati nirāsaṅka ṭṭhānesu ṭhatvā ati
translated: ‘The non-communal territory should not be abolished’: he is referring to the major territory. ‘Standing in a place free from danger’:

original: cetiyaṅgaṇādīnaṃ khaṇḍasīmāya anokāsattā vuttaṃ. Khaṇḍasīmañhi bandhantā tādisaṃ
analyzed: cetiya ṅgaṇa ādīnam khaṇḍa sīmāya anokāsa ttā vuttam khaṇḍa sīman hi bandhantā tādisam
translated: this is said because there is no room for a flag-signal in the courtyard of a shrine, etc. For when people set up a flag-signal,

original: ṭhānaṃ pahāya aññasmiṃ vivitte okāse bandhanti. Appeva nāma samūhanituṃ sakkhissantīti
analyzed: ṭhānam pahāya aññasmin vivitte okāse bandhanti appa iva nāma samūhanitum sakkhissanti iti
translated: they do so in a secluded place other than that. ‘Perhaps they will be able to abolish it’:

original: avippavāsasīmaṃyeva samūhanituṃ sakkhissanti, na khaṇḍasīmaṃ. Paṭibandhituṃ pana
analyzed: a vippavāsa sīmaṃ yā iva samūhanitum sakkhissanti na khaṇḍa sīmam paṭibandhitum pana
translated: they will be able to abolish only the zone of non-co-residence, not the zone of the sub-unit. But they will not be able to abolish the zone of the sub-unit.

original: na sakkhissantevāti khaṇḍasīmāya aññātattā na sakkhissanti. Na samūhanitabbāti khaṇḍasīmaṃ
analyzed: na sakkhissanteva ati khaṇḍa sīmāya aññāta ttā na sakkhissanti na samūhanitabbā ati khaṇḍa sīmaṃ
translated: Because they do not know it: because they do not know the zone of the sub-unit.

original: ajānantehi na samūhanitabbā. Uposathassa visuṃ gahitattā avasesakammavasena samānasaṃvāsatā veditabbā.
analyzed: a jānantehi na samūhanitabbā uposathassa visum gahita ttā avasesa kamma vasena samāna saṃvāsa tā veditabbā
translated: It should not be abolished: it should not be abolished by those who do not know the zone of the sub-unit. It should be understood that the observance-day ceremony is included in the “other transactions” because it is mentioned separately.

original: Gāmasīmādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: gāma sīma ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the “boundary of a village,” etc.

original: 147. Aparicchinnāyāti baddhasīmāvasena akataparicchedāya. Yena kenaci khaṇitvā akatoti
analyzed: aparicchinnāya ati baddha sīmā vasena akata paricchedāya yena kenacid khaṇitvā
translated: Unmarked: not marked off by a boundary as defined. Not made by anyone by digging:

original: antamaso tiracchānenapi khaṇitvā akato. Tassa antohatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā ṭhito kammaṃ
analyzed: antamasaḥ tiracchānena api khaṇitvā a kataḥ tassa antar hattha pāsam vijahitvā ṭhito kammaṃ
translated: not made by digging even crosswise. Standing outside the reach of a stone thrown by one who stands within it:

original: kopetīti iminā bahiparicchedato yattha katthaci ṭhito kammaṃ na kopetīti dīpeti.
analyzed: kopeti iti iminā bahi paricchedataḥ yattha katthaci ṭhitaḥ kammam na kopeti iti dīpeti
translated: this shows that standing anywhere outside the boundary line he does not invalidate the transaction.

original: Yaṃ pana vuttaṃ mātikāṭṭhakathāyaṃ “paricchedabbhantare hatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā ṭhitopi
analyzed: yam pana vuttam mātikā aṭṭhakathā ayam pariccheda abbhantare hattha pāsam vijahitvā ṭhitaḥ api
translated: But it is said in the commentary to the mātikā: “Standing outside the reach of a stone thrown by one who stands within the boundary line,

original: paricchedato bahi aññaṃ tattakaṃyeva paricchedaṃ anatikkamitvā ṭhitopi kammaṃ kopeti,
analyzed: paricchedataḥ bahi aññam tattakam yeva paricchedam an atikkamitvā ṭhitaḥ api kammam kopeti
translated: If he is not beyond the other enclosure, that is, if he is not beyond the enclosure belonging to the same community, then the legal procedure is valid.🔽This is the conclusion in all the commentaries.”

original: idaṃ sabbaaṭṭhakathāsu sanniṭṭhāna”nti, tattha “aññaṃ tattakaṃyeva paricchedaṃ anatikkamitvā
analyzed: idam sabba aṭṭhakathāsu sanniṭṭhānan ti tattha aññam paricchedam an atikkamitvā
translated: Herein, the words “if he is not beyond the other enclosure belonging to the same community”

original: ṭhitopi kammaṃ kopetī”ti idaṃ neva pāḷiyaṃ, na aṭṭhakathāyaṃ upalabbhati. Yadi cetaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ api kammam kopeti iti idam na iva pāḷiyam na aṭṭhakathā ayam upalabbhati yadi ca itam
translated: are not found in the texts or in the commentaries.

original: dvinnaṃ saṅghānaṃ visuṃ uposathādikammakaraṇādhikāre vuttattā udakukkhepato bahi
analyzed: dvinnam saṅghānam visum uposatha ādi kamma karaṇa adhikāre vutta ttā udakukkhepataḥ bahi
translated: And if this is said on the grounds that the two communities are entitled to perform the Uposatha and other legal procedures separately,

original: aññaṃ udakukkhepaṃ anatikkamitvā uposathādikaraṇatthaṃ ṭhito saṅgho sīmāsambhedasambhavato
analyzed: aññam udakukkhepam an atikkamitvā uposatha ādi karaṇa ttham ṭhitaḥ saṅghaḥ sīmā sambheda sambhavataḥ
translated: then the legal procedure is valid if the community is not beyond the other enclosure belonging to the same community, that is, if it is within the same enclosure, for the purpose of performing the Uposatha and other legal procedures, because the legal procedure is not invalidated by the breaking of the boundary.🔽This is the intention.

original: kammaṃ kopetīti iminā adhippāyena vuttaṃ siyā, evaṃ sati yujjeyya. Teneva mātikāṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: kammam kopeti iti iminā adhippāyena vuttam siyā evam sati yujjeyya tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathāya
translated: Therefore it is said in the commentary on the mātikā:

original: līnatthappakāsaniyaṃ vuttaṃ “aññaṃ tattakaṃyeva paricchedanti dutiyaṃ udakukkhepaṃ
analyzed: līna attha ppakāsaniyam vuttam aññam tattakam yeva paricchedan ti dutiyam udakukkhepam
translated: “The other enclosure belonging to the same community: the second enclosure belonging to the same community.

original: anatikkantopi kopeti. Kasmā? Attano udakukkhepasīmāya paresaṃ udakukkhepasīmāya ajjhotthaṭattā
analyzed: an atikkantaḥ api kopeti kasmai attanaḥ udakukkhepa sīmāya paresam udakukkhepa sīmāya ajjhotthaṭattā
translated: and it is not crossed, it is still infringed. Why? Because the water-pouring of one is mixed with the water-pouring of the other.

original: sīmāsambhedo hoti, tasmā kopetī”ti. “Idaṃ sabbaaṭṭhakathāsu sanniṭṭhāna”nti ca iminā
analyzed: sīmā sambhedaḥ hoti tasmā kopeti iti idam sabba aṭṭhakathāsu sanniṭṭhānam ti ca iminā
translated: The boundary is mixed, and that is why it is infringed.” This is the conclusion in all the commentaries.🔽And it should be understood that this is said with this intention,

original: adhippāyena vuttanti gahetabbaṃ sabbāsupi aṭṭhakathāsu sīmāsambhedassa anicchitattā.
analyzed: adhippāyena vuttanti gahetabbam sabbāsu pi aṭṭhakathāsu sīmā sambhedassa an icchita ttā
translated: because the mixing of the boundaries is not admitted in all the commentaries.

original: Teneva hi “attano ca aññesañca udakukkhepaparicchedassa antarā añño udakukkhepo sīmantarikatthāya
analyzed: tena iva hi attanaḥ ca aññesam ca udakukkhepa paricchedassa antarā aññaḥ udakukkhepaḥ sīmantarika tthāya
translated: For this is said: “Between the water-pouring of one and the water-pouring of the other, another water-pouring should be set up for the purpose of the sign of the boundary.”

original: ṭhapetabbo”ti vuttaṃ. Aññe panettha aññathāpi papañcenti, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhapetabbaḥ iti vuttam aññe pana ittha aññathā api papañcenti tam na gahetabbam
translated: But others here make a further complication, which should not be accepted.

original: Sabbattha saṅgho nisīdatīti hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā nisīdati. Udakukkhepasīmākammaṃ
analyzed: sabbattha saṅghaḥ nisīdati iti hattha pāsam a vijahitvā nisīdati udakukkhepa sīmākammam
translated: “All the bhikkhus sit down” means that they sit down without leaving the contact of hand with hand.🔽There is no water-pouring procedure for a boundary

original: natthīti yasmā sabbopi nadīpadeso bhikkhūhi ajjhotthaṭo, tasmā samantato nadiyā abhāvā
analyzed: natthi iti yasmā sabbaḥ api nadī padesaḥ bhikkhūhi ajjhotthaṭaḥ tasmā samantataḥ nadiyāḥ abhāvā
translated: because the whole river-region is occupied by bhikkhus, and so there is no river all round.

original: udakukkhepe payojanaṃ natthi. Udakukkhepappamāṇā sīmantarikā suviññeyyatarā hoti,
analyzed: udakukkhepe payojanam natthi udakukkhepa ppamāṇā sīmantarikā suviññeyyatarā hoti
translated: The distance of a water-pouring is too short a measure for a boundary.

original: sīmāsambhedasaṅkā na ca siyāti sāmīcidassanatthaṃ “añño udakukkhepo sīmantarikatthāya
analyzed: sīmā sambheda saṅkā na ca siyāti sāmīci dassana ttham aññaḥ udakukkhepaḥ sīmantarika tthāya
translated: “There would be the danger of the boundary’s being confused” means that in order to see the boundary clearly, the water should be thrown outside the intended boundary.

original: ṭhapetabbo”ti vuttaṃ. Yattakena pana sīmāsambhedo na hoti, tattakaṃ ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭatiyeva.
analyzed: ṭhapetabbaḥ iti vuttam yattakena pana sīmā sambhedaḥ na hoti tattakam ṭhapetum vaṭṭatiyā iva
translated: But it is allowable to throw it to the extent that there is no confusion of the boundary.

original: Tenevāhu porāṇā “yattakena sīmāsaṅkaro na hoti, tattakampi ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti. Ūnakaṃ🔽pana na vaṭṭatīti idampi udakukkhepasīmāya parisavasena vaḍḍhanato sīmāsambhedasaṅkā
analyzed: tena iva āhu porāṇāḥ yattakena sīmā saṅkaraḥ na hoti tattakam pi ṭhapetum vaṭṭati iti ūnakam  pana na vaṭṭati iti idam pi udakukkhepa sīmāya parisa vasena vaḍḍhanato sīmā sambheda saṅkā
translated: Therefore the ancients said: “It is allowable to throw it to the extent that there is no confusion of the boundary.”🔽But less than that is not allowable.

original: siyāti taṃnivāraṇatthameva vuttaṃ.🔽Gacchantiyā pana nāvāya kātuṃ na vaṭṭatīti ettha udakukkhepamanatikkamitvā parivattamānāya🔽kātuṃ vaṭṭatīti veditabbaṃ. Sīmaṃ vā sodhetvāti ettha sīmasodhanaṃ nāma gāmasīmādīsu
analyzed: siyā iti tad nivāraṇa attham eva vuttam  gacchantiyā pana nāvāya kātum na vaṭṭati iti ettha uda kukkhepam an atikkamitvā parivattamānāya  kātum vaṭṭati iti veditabbam sīmam vā sodhetvā iti ettha sīma sodhanam nāma gāma sīmā ādīsu
translated: This is said in order to prevent the danger of the boundary’s being confused because of the extension of the water-boundary by the perimeter.🔽But it is not allowable to make it while going in a boat.🔽Here it should be understood that it is allowable to make it while turning round without going beyond the water-throwing.

original: ṭhitānaṃ hatthapāsānayanādi. “Nadiṃ vināsetvā taḷākaṃ karontī”ti vuttamevatthaṃ vibhāveti
analyzed: ṭhitānam hattha pāsā nayana ādi nadim vināsetvā taḷākam karonti iti vuttam evattham vibhāvā iti
translated: “Or having cleared the boundary”: here “clearing the boundary” is the removal of the hand-span of earth from the boundaries of the village, etc.,🔽and it is the same as what is said in the passage beginning, “Having destroyed the river, they make a lake.”

original: “heṭṭhā pāḷi baddhā”ti, heṭṭhānadiṃ āvaritvā pāḷi baddhāti attho. Chaḍḍitamodakanti
analyzed: heṭṭhā pāḷi baddhā ati heṭṭhānadim āvaritvā pāḷi baddhā ati chaḍḍita modakam ti
translated: “Bound by a line below”: the meaning is, “bound by a line after the river has been dammed below.” “A piece of discarded food”:

original: taḷākarakkhaṇatthaṃ ekamantena chaḍḍitamudakaṃ. Deve avassanteti dubbuṭṭhikāle vassānepi🔽deve avassante. Uppatitvāti uttaritvā. Gāmanigamasīmaṃ ottharitvā pavattatīti vuttappakāre
analyzed: taḷāka rakkhaṇa attham ekamantena chaḍḍitam udakam deve a vassante ti dubbuṭṭhi kāle vassāne pi  deve a vassante uppatitvā ati uttaritvā gāma nigama sīmam ottharitvā pavattati iti vutta ppakāre
translated: water that has been set aside by a single announcement for the purpose of protecting a pond. “When the rains do not enter”: even during the rainy season,

original: vassakāle cattāro māse abbocchinnā pavattati. Vihārasīmanti baddhasīmaṃ sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: vassa kāle cattāraḥ māse abbocchinnā pavattati vihāra sīmanti baddha sīmam sandhāya vadati
translated: when the clouds do not rain. “Having overflowed”: having risen up. “It flows over the boundary of the village or town”: it flows for four months during the rainy season without interruption. “The boundary of the monastery”: he says this referring to a defined boundary.

original: Agamanapatheti yattha tadaheva gantvā paccāgantuṃ na sakkā hoti, tādise padese araññasīmāsaṅkhameva🔽gacchatīti sattabbhantarasīmaṃ sandhāya vadati. Tesanti macchabandhānaṃ. Gamanapariyantassa
analyzed: a gamana pathā iti yattha tadahā iva gantvā paccāgantum na sakkā hoti tādise padese arañña sīmā saṅkham eva  gacchati iti satta bbhantara sīmam sandhāya vadati macchabandhānam gamana pariyantassa
translated: “The boundary of the forest”: it gets the name “boundary of the forest” in a place where it is not possible to go and return on the same day.

original: oratoti gamanapariyantassa orimabhāge dīpakaṃ pabbatañca sandhāya vuttaṃ, na samuddappadesaṃ.
analyzed: oratas ti gamana pariyantassa orima bhāge dīpakam pabbatam ca sandhāya vuttam na samudda ppadesam
translated: “Theirs”: of the fishermen. “On this side of the boundary”: this refers to the island and the mountain, not to the ocean.

original: 148. Saṃsaṭṭhaviṭapāti iminā aññamaññassa āsannataṃ dīpeti. Baddhā hotīti pacchimadisābhāge
analyzed: saṃsaṭṭha viṭapā ti iminā aññamaññassa āsanna tam dīpeti baddhā hoti iti pacchima disā bhāge
translated: By “joined to the trees” he shows that they are close to each other. “It is bounded” : this refers to the boundary in the western direction.

original: sīmaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tassā padesanti yattha ṭhatvā bhikkhūhi kammaṃ kātuṃ sakkā
analyzed: sīmam sandhāya vuttam yattha ṭhatvā bhikkhūhi kammam kātum sakkā
translated: “The place where they stand” : a place such as this is suitable for the bhikkhus to perform the kamma.

original: hoti, tādisaṃ padesaṃ. Yattha pana ṭhitehi kammaṃ kātuṃ na sakkā hoti, tādisaṃ padesaṃ🔽antokaritvā bandhantā sīmāya sīmaṃ sambhindanti nāma. Dvinnaṃ sīmānaṃ nimittaṃ hotīti🔽nimittassa sīmato bāhirattā sīmāsambhedo na hotīti vuttaṃ. Sīmāsaṅkaraṃ karotīti
analyzed: hoti tādisam padesam yattha pana ṭhitehi kammam kātum na sakkā hoti tādisam padesam  antokaritvā bandhantā sīmāya sīmam sambhindanti nāma dvinnam sīmānam nimittam hoti iti  nimittassa sīmataḥ bāhirattā sīmā sambhedaḥ na hoti iti vuttam sīmā saṅkaram karoti iti
translated: A place such as this is not suitable for them to perform the kamma.🔽When they are bounded by making the boundary within the boundary, they are said to “intersect the boundary.”🔽“It is the sign of two boundaries” : because the sign of the boundary is outside, it is said that there is no intersection of boundaries.

original: vaḍḍhitvā sīmappadesaṃ paviṭṭhe dvinnaṃ sīmānaṃ gataṭṭhānassa duviññeyyattā vuttaṃ,
analyzed: vaḍḍhitvā sīma ppadesam paviṭṭhe dvinnam sīmānam gata ṭṭhānassa du viññeyya ttā vuttam
translated: “He makes a confusion of the boundaries” : this is said because when the place of the boundary is extended, the place where the two boundaries go becomes difficult to discern.

original: na pana tattha kammaṃ kātuṃ na vaṭṭatīti dassanatthaṃ. Na hi sīmā tattakena asīmā
analyzed: na pana tattha kammam kātum na vaṭṭati iti dassana attham na hi sīmā tattakena asīmā
translated: But this is said not to show that it is not allowable to perform a kamma there.

original: hoti, dve pana sīmā pacchā vaḍḍhitena rukkhena ajjhotthaṭattā ekābaddhā honti, tasmā
analyzed: hoti dve pana sīmā pacchā vaḍḍhitena rukkhena ekābaddhāḥ honti tasmā
translated: For the boundary does not become non-boundary by being extended. But because the two boundaries are enclosed by the tree that is extended afterwards, they become one enclosure.

original: ekattha ṭhatvā kammaṃ karontehi itaraṃ sodhetvā kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: ekattha ṭhatvā kammam karontehi itaram sodhetvā kātabbam
translated: If they are doing the work while standing in one place, they should clear the other.

original: Gāmasīmādikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gāma sīma ādi kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the section on the “village zone” is finished.

original: Uposathabhedādikathāvaṇṇanā🔽149. Adhammena vaggaṃ uposathakammanti ettha yattha cattāro vasanti, tattha pātimokkhuddeso🔽anuññāto. Yattha dve vā tayo vā vasanti, tattha pārisuddhiuposatho. Idha pana tathā🔽akatvā catunnaṃ vasanaṭṭhāne pārisuddhiuposathassa katattā tiṇṇaṃ vasanaṭṭhāne ca🔽pātimokkhassa uddiṭṭhattā “adhammenā”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmā sabbeva na sannipatiṃsu, chandapārisuddhi
analyzed: uposatha bheda ādi kathā vaṇṇanā  adhammena vaggam uposatha kamman ti ettha yattha cattāraḥ vasanti tattha pātimokkha uddeso  anuññātaḥ yattha dve vā tayo vā vasanti tattha pārisuddhi uposathaḥ idha pana tathā  a katvā catunnam vasanaṭṭhāne pārisuddhi uposathassa katattā tiṇṇam vasanaṭṭhāne ca  pātimokkhassa uddiṭṭha ttā adhammena ati vuttam yasmā sabbā iva na sannipatiṃsu chanda pārisuddhi
translated: The explanation of the section on the schism in the Uposatha ceremony, etc.

original: ca saṅghamajjhaṃyeva āgacchati, na gaṇamajjhaṃ, tasmā “vagga”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ca saṅgha majjham yā iva āgacchati na gaṇa majjham tasmā vagganti vuttam
translated: “An illegitimate Uposatha ceremony with an incomplete assembly”: the recitation of the Pāṭimokkha is allowed in a place where there are four resident monks. The Pāṭimokkha purification is allowed in a place where there are two or three resident monks. But here, without doing it in that way, they did the Pāṭimokkha purification in a place where there were three resident monks, and they recited the Pāṭimokkha in a place where there were four resident monks. That’s why it’s said that it was “illegitimate”. Since they didn’t all gather together, the consent purification has to come to the midst of the Sangha, not to the midst of a group. That’s why it’s said that it was “with an incomplete assembly”.

original: Pātimokkhuddesakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pātimokkha uddesa kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the recitation of the Monastic Code

original: 150. Evametaṃ dhārayāmīti “sutā kho panāyasmantehī”ti ettha “evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti
analyzed: evam etam dhārayāmi iti sutā khalu pana ayasmant ehi iti ettha evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: “I remember it like this”: in the passage “Venerables, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha: ‘I remember it like this’

original: vatvā “uddiṭṭhaṃ kho āyasmanto nidānaṃ, sutā kho panāyasmantehi cattāro pārājikā🔽dhammā”ti vattabbaṃ. Teneva mātikāṭṭhakathāyaṃ “tatthāyasmante pucchāmi kaccittha
analyzed: vatvā uddiṭṭham kho āyasmantaḥ nidānam sutā kho pana āyasmantehi cattāro pārājikā  dhammā ti vattabbam tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathā ayam tattha ayasmante pucchāmi kacci ttha
translated: Having said that, he should say, “The introduction has been recited, Venerable Sirs. The four rules entailing expulsion have been listened to by the Venerable Sirs.🔽” There, he should ask, “Are you pure in this matter? I ask a second time, are you pure in this matter? I ask a third time, are you pure in this matter? Since there is silence,

original: parisuddhā, dutiyampi pucchāmi…pe… tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmīti vatvā ‘uddiṭṭhaṃ🔽kho āyasmanto nidāna’ntiādinā nayena avasese sutena sāvite uddiṭṭho hotī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: parisuddhā dutiyam pi tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti vatvā uddiṭṭham  kho āyasmantaḥ nidāna nti ādinā nayena avasese sutena sāvite uddiṭṭhaḥ hoti iti vuttam
translated: I will regard the gathering as pure in this matter.” Having said that, the rest should be listened to and recited in the way beginning, “The introduction has been recited, Venerable Sirs.”

original: Sutenāti sutapadena. Savarabhayanti vanacarakabhayaṃ. Tenāha “aṭavimanussabhaya”nti.🔽“Avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabba”nti vacanato nidānuddese aniṭṭhite sutena sāvetabbaṃ nāma
analyzed: sutena ati suta padena vana caraka bhayam tena āha aṭavi manussa bhayanti  avasesam sutena sāvetabbanti vacanataḥ nidāna uddese aniṭṭhite sutena sāvetabbam nāma
translated: “By listening to” means by the word “listened to.” “Danger from wild beasts” means danger from forest-wanderers. Hence he says “danger from wild men in the forest.”🔽Because of the words, “The rest should be listened to and recited,” there is nothing called “listened to and recited” when the introduction is not recited.

original: natthīti āha “dutiyādīsu uddesesū”ti. Uddiṭṭhauddesāpekkhañhi avasesaggahaṇaṃ, tasmā🔽nidāne uddiṭṭhe pārājikuddesādīsu yasmiṃ vippakate antarāyo uppajjati, tena saddhiṃ
analyzed: na atthi iti āha dutiya ādīsu uddesesu iti uddiṭṭha auddesa apekkham hi avasesa ggahaṇam tasmā  nidāne uddiṭṭhe pārājika uddesa ādīsu yasmin vippakate antarāyaḥ uppajjati tena saddhim
translated: Therefore he says, “In the recitations that follow.” For the phrase “the rest” refers to what is expected in the recitation that has been recited.

original: avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ.
analyzed: avasesam sutena sāvetabbam
translated: Therefore, when the introduction has been recited, if an obstruction arises while any one of the rules entailing expulsion, etc., is being recited, the rest should be listened to and recited together with that rule.

original: Tīhipi vidhīhīti osāraṇakathanasarabhaññehi. Ettha ca atthaṃ bhaṇitukāmatāya suttassa🔽osāraṇā osāraṇaṃ nāma. Tasseva atthappakāsanā kathanaṃ nāma. Suttassa tadatthassa🔽vā sarena bhaṇanaṃ sarabhaññaṃ nāma. Sajjhāyaṃ adhiṭṭhahitvāti “sajjhāyaṃ karomī”ti
analyzed: tīhi pi vidhīhi iti osāraṇa kathana sarabhaññehi ettha ca attham bhaṇitu kāma tāya suttassa  osāraṇā osāraṇam nāma tassa iva attha ppakāsanā kathanam nāma suttassa tad atthassa  vā sarena bhaṇanam sarabhaññam nāma sajjhāyam adhiṭṭhahitvā ati sajjhāyam karomi iti
translated: By the three means: by recitation, by explanation, and by rehearsal. Herein, when one wants to expound the meaning of a discourse,🔽the recitation is called “recitation”; the explanation of its meaning is called “explanation”; the recitation of the discourse or its meaning in a chant is called “rehearsal.”🔽Having resolved upon a rehearsal: having aroused the thought, “I shall rehearse.”

original: cittaṃ uppādetvā. Osāretvā pana kathentenāti paṭhamaṃ ussāretvā pacchā atthaṃ kathentena.
analyzed: cittam uppādetvā osāretvā pana kathentena ati paṭhamam ussāretvā pacchā attham kathentena
translated: But when he is explaining after reciting: when he is explaining after reciting at the beginning.

original: Manussānaṃ pana “bhaṇāhī”ti vattuṃ vaṭṭatīti ettha uccatare nisinnenapi manussānaṃ
analyzed: manussānam pana bhaṇāhi iti vattum vaṭṭati iti ettha uccatare nisinnena api manussānam
translated: But it is allowable for human beings to say, “Speak,”

original: bhaṇāhīti visesetvāyeva vattuṃ vaṭṭati, avisesetvā pana na vaṭṭati. Sajjhāyaṃ karontenāti
analyzed: bhaṇāhi iti visesetvāya iva vattum vaṭṭati a visesetvā pana na vaṭṭati sajjhāyam karontena ati
translated: for human beings sitting higher up. It is allowable to say, “Speak,” specifying them, but not without specifying them.🔽When he is rehearsing: when he is rehearsing a rehearsal anywhere at all.

original: yattha katthaci nisīditvā sajjhāyaṃ karontena. Theroti yo koci attanā vuḍḍhataro.
analyzed: yattha katthaci nisīditvā sajjhāyam karontena thero ti yaḥ koci attanā vuḍḍhataro
translated: Elder: anyone older than oneself.

original: Ekaṃ āpucchitvāti ekaṃ vuḍḍhataraṃ āpucchitvā. Aparo āgacchatīti aparo tatopi vuḍḍhataro āgacchati.
analyzed: ekam āpucchitvā ati ekam vuḍḍhataram āpucchitvā aparaḥ āgacchati iti aparaḥ tatas api vuḍḍhataraḥ āgacchati
translated: Having asked one: having asked one who is older. Another comes: another comes who is older still.

original: Pātimokkhuddesakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pātimokkha uddesa kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the discussion of the reciter of the Pāṭimokkha is finished.

original: Pātimokkhuddesakaajjhesanādikathāvaṇṇanā🔽155. Codanāvatthu nāma ekaṃ nagaraṃ. Saṅghauposathādibhedena navavidhanti saṅghe🔽uposatho gaṇe uposatho puggale uposathoti evaṃ kārakavasena tayo, suttuddeso pārisuddhiuposatho🔽adhiṭṭhānuposathoti evaṃ kattabbākāravasena tayo, cātuddasiko pannarasiko sāmaggīuposathoti🔽evaṃ divasavasena tayoti navavidhaṃ. Catubbidhaṃ uposathakammanti adhammena vaggaṃ
analyzed: codanāvatthu nāma ekam nagaram saṅgha auposatha ādi bhedena navavidhanti saṅghe  uposathaḥ gaṇe uposatho puggale uposatho ti evam kāraka vasena tayaḥ sutta uddeso pārisuddhi uposatho  adhiṭṭhāna uposatho ti evam kattabba ākāra vasena tayo cātuddasiko pannarasiko sāmaggī uposatho ti  evam divasa vasena tayo ti navavidham catubbidham uposatha kammanti adhammena vaggam
translated: The commentary on the discussion of the invitation of the reciter of the Pāṭimokkha, etc.

original: uposathakammaṃ, adhammena samaggaṃ uposathakammaṃ, dhammena vaggaṃ uposathakammaṃ,🔽dhammena samaggaṃ uposathakammanti evaṃ catubbidhampi uposathakammaṃ. Duvidhaṃ pātimokkhanti🔽bhikkhupātimokkhaṃ bhikkhunīpātimokkhanti duvidhaṃ pātimokkhaṃ. Navavidhaṃ pātimokkhuddesanti
analyzed: uposatha kammam adhammena samaggam uposatha kammam dhammena vaggam uposatha kammam 🔽dhammena samaggam uposatha kamman ti evam catubbidham pi uposatha kammam duvidham pātimokkham ti 🔽bhikkhu pātimokkham bhikkhunī pātimokkha nti duvidham pātimokkham navavidham pātimokkha uddesa nti
translated: The “site for accusation” is a town. The Pāṭimokkha is of nine kinds by way of the division of the Pāṭimokkha in the Sangha, etc. By way of the doer, there are three: the Pāṭimokkha in the Sangha, the Pāṭimokkha in a group, and the Pāṭimokkha in an individual. By way of the mode of performance, there are three: the Pāṭimokkha with the recitation of the Monastic Code, the Pāṭimokkha with the expression of purity, and the Pāṭimokkha by determination. By way of the day, there are three: the Pāṭimokkha on the fourteenth day, the Pāṭimokkha on the fifteenth day, and the Pāṭimokkha of the united Sangha. Thus it is of nine kinds. The Pāṭimokkha procedure is of four kinds: the Pāṭimokkha procedure that is illegitimate and has an incomplete assembly, the Pāṭimokkha procedure that is illegitimate but has a complete assembly, the Pāṭimokkha procedure that is legitimate but has an incomplete assembly, and the Pāṭimokkha procedure that is legitimate and has a complete assembly. Thus it is of four kinds. The Monastic Code is of two kinds: the Monastic Code for monks and the Monastic Code for nuns. Thus it is of two kinds. The recitation of the Monastic Code is of nine kinds:

original: bhikkhūnaṃ pañca uddesā, bhikkhunīnaṃ ṭhapetvā aniyatuddesaṃ avasesā cattāroti navavidhaṃ pātimokkhuddesaṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhūnam pañca uddesāḥ bhikkhunīnam ṭhapetvā aniyata uddesam avasesā cattāro ti navavidham pātimokkha uddesam
translated: The recitation of the Monastic Code for the monks is fivefold, and for the nuns it is fourfold, excluding the undetermined section. Thus the recitation of the Monastic Code is ninefold.

original: Pakkhagaṇanādiuggahaṇānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pakkha gaṇanā ādi uggahaṇa anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The allowance to count the half-months, etc., and to memorize

original: 158-161. Samannāharathāti sallakkhetha. Pariyesitabbānīti bhikkhācārena pariyesitabbāni.
analyzed: samannāharatha ati sallakkhetha pariyesitabbāni iti bhikkhācārena pariyesitabbāni
translated: “Pay attention” means “consider”. “Should be sought” means “should be sought by going on alms round”.

original: Disaṃgamikādivatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: disaṃgamikā ādi vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on those who are traveling in a particular direction, etc.

original: 163. Utuvasseyevāti hemantagimhesuyeva.
analyzed: utu vasseyā iva ati hemanta gimhesuyā iva
translated: “Only in the cold and rainy seasons” means only in the cold and rainy seasons.

original: Pārisuddhidānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pārisuddhi dāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the giving of purity

original: 164. Yena kenaci aṅgapaccaṅgena viññāpetīti manasā cintetvā hatthappayogādinā yena
analyzed: yena kenaci aṅga paccaṅgena viññāpeti iti manasā cintetvā hattha ppayoga ādinā yena
translated: “By any means, by any part or aspect”: having thought about it with the mind, one should make it known by any means, by any part or aspect, by the use of the hands, etc.

original: kenaci viññāpeti. Saṅgho nappahotīti dvinnaṃ dvinnaṃ antarā hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā
analyzed: kenacid viññāpeti saṅghaḥ nappahoti iti dvinnam dvinnam antarā hattha pāsam a vijahitvā
translated: “The Sangha is unable”: it is unable to stand in a line without breaking the continuity between those who are two or three arm spans apart.

original: paṭipāṭiyā ṭhātuṃ nappahoti. Itarā pana biḷālasaṅkhalikapārisuddhi nāmāti ettha keci
analyzed: paṭipāṭiyā ṭhātum nappahoti itarā pana biḷālasaṅkhalikapārisuddhi nāma ati ettha keci
translated: But the other, the purity through a chain of cats, is called: here some say,

original: vadanti “biḷālasaṅkhalikā baddhāva hoti antogehe eva sampayojanattā, yathā sā na
analyzed: vadanti biḷāla saṅkhalikā antar gehe eva yathā sā na
translated: “It is like a chain of cats, because it is connected only within the house. As it is not connected outside,

original: katthaci gacchati, tathā sāpi na gacchatīti adhippāyo. Itarathā visesanaṃ niratthakaṃ🔽hotī”ti. Apare pana “yathā bahūhi manussehi ekassa biḷālassa attano attano saṅkhalikā🔽gīvāya ābaddhā biḷāle gacchante gacchanti ābaddhattā, na aññasmiṃ biḷāle gacchante🔽gacchanti anābaddhattā, evamevassa bhikkhussa bahūhi saṅkhalikasadisā chandapārisuddhi
analyzed: katthaci gacchati tathā sā api na gacchati iti adhippāyaḥ itarathā visesanam niratthakam  hoti iti apare pana yathā bahūhi manussehi ekassa biḷālassa attanaḥ attanaḥ saṅkhalikā  gīvāya ābaddhāḥ biḷāle gacchante gacchanti ābaddha ttā na aññasmin biḷāle gacchante  gacchanti an ābaddha ttā evam evassa bhikkhussa bahūhi saṅkhalika sadisā chanda pārisuddhi
translated: and so it is with the purity given by him. The intention is that it does not go elsewhere. Otherwise the qualification would be pointless.🔽But others say that just as when many men tie a chain round the neck of a single cat, the chain goes when the cat goes because it is tied to it, and it does not go when another cat goes because it is not tied to it, so too, when many purities of desire are given to a bhikkhu like a chain, they go when he goes because they are tied to him like the chain,

original: dinnā, sā tasmiṃ bhikkhusmiṃ gacchante gacchati tasmiṃ saṅkhalikā viya ābaddhattā,
analyzed: dinnā sā tasmin bhikkhusmin gacchante gacchati tasmin saṅkhalikā viya
translated: and they do not go when another goes because they are not tied to him.

original: na aññasmiṃ anābaddhattā”ti vadanti. Sabbampetaṃ na sārato paccetabbaṃ. Ayaṃ panettha
analyzed: na aññasmin an ābaddha ttā ti vadanti sabbam petam na sārataḥ paccetabbam ayam pana ittha
translated: But all this should not be accepted as the essence of the matter. The essence of the matter is this.

original: sāro – yathā saṅkhalikāya paṭhamavalayaṃ dutiyaṃyeva valayaṃ pāpuṇāti, na tatiyaṃ,
analyzed: sāraḥ yathā saṅkhalikāya paṭhama valayam dutiyam iva valayam pāpuṇāti na tatiyam
translated: Just as the first link of a chain reaches only the second link and not the third,

original: evamayampi pārisuddhidāyakena yassa dinnā, tato aññattha na gacchatīti saṅkhalikasadisattā
analyzed: evam ayam pi pārisuddhi dāyakena yassa dinnā tatas aññattha na gacchati iti saṅkhalika sadisa ttā
translated: so too, when it has been given by one who gives a purity, it does not go elsewhere than where it is given, because it is like a chain.

original: “biḷālasaṅkhalikā”ti vuttā. Biḷālasaṅkhalikagahaṇañcettha yāsaṃ kāsañci saṅkhalikānaṃ
analyzed: biḷāla saṅkhalikā ati vuttā biḷāla saṅkhalika gahaṇam ca ittha yāsam kāsañci saṅkhalikānam
translated: “A cat’s chain” is what is meant. And here the mention of a cat’s chain is a mere indication of any kind of chain.

original: upalakkhaṇamattanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Chandadānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: upalakkhaṇa mattam ti daṭṭhabbam  chanda dāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the giving of consent.

original: 165. “Santi saṅghassa karaṇīyānī”ti vattabbe vacanavipallāsena “karaṇīya”nti vuttaṃ. Tassa sammutidānakiccaṃ natthi. “Hatthapāsaṃ ānetabboyevā”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: santi saṅghassa karaṇīyāni iti vattabbe vacana vipallāsena karaṇīyanti vuttam tassa sammuti dāna kiccam natthi hattha pāsam ānetabbaḥ yeva ati gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: “There are things to be done for the Sangha” should be said. But it is said with an inversion of the terms. There is no act of giving consent in this. “He should be brought within arm’s reach” is said in the summary lines.

original: Saṅghuposathādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgha uposatha ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the observance-day ceremony for the Sangha, etc.

original: 168. Saṅghasannipātato paṭhamaṃ kātabbaṃ pubbakaraṇanti vuttaṃ, pubbakaraṇato pacchā
analyzed: saṅgha sannipātataḥ paṭhamam kātabbam pubbakaraṇam ti vuttam pubbakaraṇato pacchā
translated: What is done first, before the gathering of the Sangha, is called “the preliminary task.” What is done after the preliminary task

original: kātabbampi uposathakammato paṭhamaṃ kātabbattā pubbakiccanti vuttaṃ. Ubhayampi cetaṃ
analyzed: kātabbam api uposatha kammato paṭhamam kātabba ttā pubba kiccan ti vuttam ubhayam pi ca itam
translated: but before the observance-day ceremony is called “the observance-day task.” Both are called🔽“the preliminary task” because they are done before the observance-day ceremony.

original: uposathakammato paṭhamaṃ kattabbattā katthaci pubbakiccamicceva voharīyati “kiṃ saṅghassa🔽pubbakicca”ntiādīsu viya.
analyzed: uposatha kammataḥ paṭhamam kattabbattā katthaci pubba kiccam icca iva voharīyati kim saṅghassa 🔽pubba kicca nti ādīsu viya
translated: “What is the preliminary task for the Sangha?”

original: Uposathoti tīsu uposathadivasesu aññataradivaso. Tasmiñhi sati idaṃ saṅghassa uposathakammaṃ
analyzed: uposathaḥ ti tīsu uposatha divasesu aññatara divasaḥ tasmin hi sati idam saṅghassa uposatha kammam
translated: Uposatha: any one of the three uposatha days. For on that day this is a fitting act for the Sangha to do,

original: pattakallaṃ nāma hoti, nāsati. Yathāha “na ca, bhikkhave, anuposathe uposatho kātabbo”ti.
analyzed: pattakallam nāma hoti na asati yathā āha na ca bhikkhave anuposathe uposathaḥ kātabbo ti
translated: but not on other days. As it is said: “Monks, the observance-day ceremony should not be done on a non-observance day.”

original: Yāvatikā ca bhikkhū kammappattāti yattakā bhikkhū tassa uposathakammassa pattā yuttā🔽anurūpā sabbantimena paricchedena cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā, te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ
analyzed: yāvatikā ca bhikkhū kamma ppattā ati yattakāḥ bhikkhū tassa uposatha kammassa pattā yuttā  anurūpā sabba antimena paricchedena cattāraḥ bhikkhū pakata ttā te ca kho hattha pāsam
translated: As many monks as can go: as many monks as are suitable, fit, and proper for that observance-day ceremony.

original: avijahitvā ekasīmāyaṃ ṭhitā. Sabhāgāpattiyo ca na vijjantīti ettha yaṃ sabbo saṅgho
analyzed: a vijahitvā eka sīmā ayam ṭhitā sabhāga āpattiyaḥ ca na vijjanti iti ettha yam sabbaḥ saṅgho
translated: All: with the restriction of four. And they are fully ordained. And they are not out of earshot of each other. And they are within the same monastery zone.

original: vikālabhojanādinā sabhāgavatthunā lahukāpattiṃ āpajjati, evarūpā “vatthusabhāgā”ti
analyzed: vikāla bhojana ādinā sabhāga vatthunā lahuka āpattim āpajjati evarūpā vatthu sabhāgā ti
translated: There are no shared offenses: here, “shared” means that the whole Sangha commits a light offense by eating at the wrong time, etc.

original: vuccanti. Etāsu hi avijjamānāsu visabhāgāsu vijjamānāsupi pattakallaṃ hotiyeva.
analyzed: vuccanti etāsu hi a vijjamānāsu visabhāgāsu vijjamānāsu pi patta kallam
translated: This is called “shared by way of the action”. Even if there are no shared offenses, it is still a fitting act if there are unshared offenses.

analyzed: ime vīsati ca ati ekavīsati puggalāḥ vajjanīyāḥ nāma te hattha pāsataḥ bahikaraṇa vasena  vajjetabbāḥ etesu hi tividhe ukkhittake sati uposatham karonto saṅgho pācittiyam
translated: These twenty-one people are called “to be avoided”. They should be avoided by moving them outside the range of one’s hand-to-hand contact.

translated: laid down “The observance-day ceremony is not to be performed by one who has an offence”?
