translated: At the end of the recitation: at the end of the recitation text.🔽Well-learned: well-learned, rightly learned.

original: ussāraṇāvasāne. Suggahitānīti sammā uggahitāni. Sumanasikatānīti suṭṭhu manasi katāni.
analyzed: ussāraṇā avasāne suggahitāni iti sammā uggahitāni su manasikatāni iti suṭṭhu manasi katāni
translated: Well-remembered: well-remembered, rightly remembered.

original: Ekacco uggahaṇakāle sammā uggahetvāpi pacchā sajjhāyādivasena manasikaraṇakāle byañjanāni
analyzed: ekacco uggahaṇa kāle sammā uggahetvā api pacchā sajjhāya ādi vasena manasikaraṇa kāle byañjanāni
translated: Some, though they learn correctly at the time of learning, later, at the time of reviewing, etc., misplace the syllables

original: vā micchā ropeti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ vā karoti, na evamayaṃ. Iminā pana sammadeva🔽yathuggahitaṃ manasi katāni. Tena vuttaṃ “sumanasikatānīti suṭṭhu manasi katānī”ti.
analyzed: vā micchā ropeti pada pacca ābhaṭṭham vā karoti na evam ayam iminā pana sammat eva  yathuggahitam manasi katāni tena vuttam su manasikatāni iti suṭṭhu manasi katāni iti
translated: or they misplace the order of the words, but he did not do so.🔽By this he shows that he remembered them correctly as he had learned them. Therefore it was said: “Well-remembered: well-remembered, rightly remembered.”

original: Sūpadhāritānīti atthatopi suṭṭhu upadhāritāni. Atthe hi suṭṭhu upadhārite sakkā pāḷi
analyzed: su upadhāritāni iti atthataḥ pi suṭṭhu upadhāritāni atthe hi suṭṭhu upadhārite sakkā
translated: Well-investigated: well-investigated, rightly investigated, in their meaning. For when the meaning is well-investigated, it is possible to understand the wording

original: sammā ussāretuṃ. Kalyāṇiyāpi vācāya samannāgatoti sithiladhanitādīnaṃ yathāvidhānaṃ
analyzed: sammā ussāretum sithila dhanitā ādīnam yathā vidhānam
translated: He should speak rightly. He is endowed with good speech: with speech that is rounded out with words and syllables that are clear,

original: vacanena parimaṇḍalapadabyañjanāya poriyā vācāya samannāgato. Vissaṭṭhāyāti vimuttāya.
analyzed: vacanena parimaṇḍala pada byañjanāya poriyā vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya ati vimuttāya
translated: with speech that is pure. He is endowed with speech that is pure: with speech that is free.

original: Etenassa vimuttavāditaṃ dasseti. Anelagalāyāti elaṃ vuccati doso, taṃ na paggharatīti
analyzed: etena assa vimutta vāditam dasseti anelagalāya ati elam vuccati doso tam na paggharati iti
translated: By this he shows that his speech is free. He is endowed with speech that is unhurried: ela is a synonym for hate; he does not emit that, thus he is unhurried.

original: anelagalā, tāya niddosāyāti attho. Atha vā anelagalāyāti anelāya ca agalāya ca, niddosāya🔽agalitapadabyañjanāya aparihīnapadabyañjanāyāti attho. Tathā hi naṃ bhagavā “etadaggaṃ,
analyzed: anela galā tāya niddosāya ati attho atha vā anela galāya ati anelāya ca agalāya ca niddosāya  a galita pada byañjanāya a parihīna pada byañjanāya ati tathā hi nam bhagavā etat aggam
translated: The meaning is that he is free from hate. Or alternatively, he is endowed with unhurried speech: with unhurried speech and with speech that is not hurried, with speech whose words and syllables are not slurred, with speech whose words and syllables are not defective.

original: bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kalyāṇavākkaraṇānaṃ yadidaṃ soṇo kuṭikaṇṇo”ti
analyzed: bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam kalyāṇa vāc karaṇānam yat idam soṇaḥ kuṭikaṇṇo ti
translated: For the Blessed One placed him in the foremost position among those who speak well, saying: “The most eloquent bhikkhu in speech that is rounded out with words and syllables that are clear, with speech that is pure, with unhurried speech, with speech that is polished, with speech that is distinct, with speech that is intelligible, with speech that conveys the meaning, is the bhikkhu Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa” .

original: etadagge ṭhapesi. Atthassa viññāpaniyāti yathādhippetaṃ atthaṃ ñāpetuṃ samatthāya.🔽Kativassoti so kira majjhimavayassa tatiye koṭṭhāse ṭhito ākappasampanno ca paresaṃ
analyzed: etat agge ṭhapesi atthassa viññāpaniyā ati yathā adhippetam attham ñāpetum samatthāya 🔽kati vassaḥ ti so kira majjhima vayassa tatiye koṭṭhāse ṭhitaḥ ākappa sampanno ca paresam
translated: He is endowed with speech that conveys the meaning: with speech that is able to make known the meaning intended.

original: ciratarapabbajito viya khāyati. Taṃ sandhāya bhagavā pucchīti keci, taṃ akāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: ciratara pabbajitaḥ viya khāyati tam sandhāya bhagavā pucchi iti keci tam akāraṇam
translated: He seems to have gone forth a long time ago. ” Some say that the Exalted One asked him with reference to this, but that is not the reason.

original: Evaṃ santaṃ samādhisukhaṃ anubhavituṃ yutto, ettakaṃ kālaṃ kasmā pamādaṃ āpannosīti
analyzed: evam santam samādhi sukham anubhavitum yuttaḥ ettakam kālam kasmā pamādam āpanno asi iti
translated: “If this is so, ” he thought, “he is fit to experience the bliss of concentration. Why did you fall into negligence for so long a time? ”🔽In order to question him about this, the Teacher asked him, “How old are you? ”

original: pana anuyuñjituṃ satthā “kativassosī”ti taṃ pucchi. Tenevāha “kissa pana tvaṃ bhikkhu🔽evaṃ ciraṃ akāsī”ti. Tattha kissāti kiṃkāraṇā. Evaṃ ciraṃ akāsīti evaṃ cirāyi, kena
analyzed: pana anuyuñjitum satthā kati vassā asi iti tam pucchi tena iva āha kissa pana tvam bhikkhu  evam ciram akāsi iti tattha kissa ati kiṃkāraṇā evam ciram akāsi iti evam cirāyi kena
translated: Therefore he said, “But why, bhikkhu,

original: kāraṇena evaṃ cirakālaṃ pabbajjaṃ anupagantvā agāramajjhe vasīti attho. Ciraṃ diṭṭho🔽meti cirena cirakālena mayā diṭṭho. Kāmesūti vatthukāmesu kilesakāmesu ca. Ādīnavoti
analyzed: kāraṇena evam cira kālam pabbajjam an upagantvā agāra majjhe vasi iti atthaḥ ciram diṭṭho  mā iti cirena cira kālena mayā diṭṭhaḥ kāmesu iti vatthu kāmesu kilesa kāmesu ca ādīnavaḥ ti
translated: did you do so for so long a time? ” Here “kissa” means “kiṃ kāraṇā” . “Evaṃ ciraṃ akāsī” means “evaṃ ciraṃ āyi” . “Kenaci kāraṇena evaṃ cirakālaṃ pabbajjaṃ anupagantvā agāramajjhe vasī” .

original: doso. Apicāti kāmesu ādīnave kenaci pakārena diṭṭhepi na tāvāhaṃ gharāvāsato nikkhamituṃ
analyzed: dosaḥ api ca ati kāmesu ādīnave kenaci pakārena diṭṭhe pi na tāva aham ghara āvāsataḥ nikkhamituṃ
translated: “Ciraṃ diṭṭho me” means “cirena cirakālena diṭṭho me” . “Kāmesu ādīnavo” means “doso” . “Apicā” means “kāmesu ādīnave kenaci pakārena diṭṭhepi na tāvāhaṃ gharāvāsato nikkhamituṃ asakkhi” .

original: asakkhiṃ. Kasmā? Sambādho gharāvāso, uccāvacehi kiccakaraṇīyehi samupabyūḷho agāriyabhāvo.
analyzed: kasmā sambādhaḥ ghara āvāsaḥ uccāvacehi kicca karaṇīyehi samupabyūḍhaḥ agāriya bhāvo
translated: Why? “Sambādho gharāvāso” , and “uccāvacehi kiccakaraṇīyehi samupabyūḷho agāriyabhāvo” .

original: Tenevāha “bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo”ti.
analyzed: tena iva āha
translated: That is why he said: “I have much to do and much to arrange.”

original: Etamatthaṃ viditvāti kāmesu yathābhūtaṃ ādīnavadassino cittaṃ cirāyitvāpi gharāvāse
analyzed: etam attham viditvā ati kāmesu yathābhūtam ādīnava dassinaḥ cittam cirāyitvā api ghara āvāse
translated: Having understood the matter thus: having understood in all ways that the mind of one who sees the danger in sensual pleasures as it really is does not enter upon the home life,

original: na pakkhandati, aññadatthu padumapalāse udakabindu viya vinivattatiyevāti etamatthaṃ
analyzed: na pakkhandati aññadatthu paduma palāse udaka bindu viya vinivattatiyā iva ati etam attham
translated: but turns back as though from a live coal, as a drop of water on a lotus leaf turns back from it,

original: sabbākārato viditvā. Imaṃ udānanti pavattiṃ nivattiñca sammadeva jānanto pavattiyaṃ🔽taṃnimitte ca na kadācipi ramatīti idamatthadīpakaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi.🔽Tattha disvā ādīnavaṃ loketi sabbasmimpi saṅkhāraloke “anicco dukkho vipariṇāmadhammo”tiādīnavaṃ🔽dosaṃ paññācakkhunā passitvā. Etena vipassanācāro kathito. Ñatvā dhammaṃ nirūpadhinti
analyzed: sabba ākārataḥ viditvā imam udānanti pavattim nivattiñca sammat eva jānantaḥ pavattiyam  tad nimitte ca na kadācipi ramati iti idam attha dīpakam imam udānam udānesi  tattha disvā ādīnavam loke iti sabbasmin pi saṅkhāra loke aniccaḥ dukkhaḥ vipariṇāma dhammo ti ādīnavam  dosam paññācakkhunā passitvā etena vipassanā ācāraḥ kathitaḥ ñatvā dhammam
translated: having understood this matter thus, he uttered this exalted utterance.🔽Having seen the danger in the world: having seen with the eye of wisdom the danger, the fault, in all the world of formations, which is impermanent, painful, and subject to change,

original: sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggattā nirupadhiṃ nibbānadhammaṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñatvā, nissaraṇavivekāsaṅkhatāmatasabhāvato
analyzed: sabba upadhi paṭinissagga ttā nirupadhim nibbāna dhammam yathābhūtam ñatvā nissaraṇa viveka asaṅkha tā mata sabhāvato
translated: and so on. This shows the practice of insight. Having known the Dhamma free from cleaving: having known as it really is the Dhamma free from cleaving, Nibbāna, by way of its being the escape and seclusion from all cleaving,

original: maggañāṇena paṭivijjhitvā. “Disvā ñatvā”ti imesaṃ padānaṃ “ghataṃ pivitvā balaṃ hoti,
analyzed: magga ñāṇena paṭivijjhitvā disvā ñatvā ati imesam padānam ghatam pivitvā balam hoti
translated: and he penetrates it with the knowledge of the path.🔽The words “having seen and known” should be regarded as having the meaning of a cause, like the following: “When one drinks water that has been strained, one is strong.

original: sīhaṃ disvā bhayaṃ hoti, paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā hontī”tiādīsu viya🔽hetuatthatā daṭṭhabbā. Ariyo na ramatī pāpeti kilesehi ārakattā ariyo sappuriso aṇumattepi
analyzed: sīham disvā bhayam hoti paññāya ca ssa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti itiādīsu viya  hetu attha tā daṭṭhabbā ariyaḥ na ramati pāpa iti kilesehi āraka ttā ariyaḥ sappurisaḥ aṇumatte pi
translated: When one sees a lion, one is afraid. When his taints are exhausted, a man is emancipated through wisdom.”🔽The noble one does not delight in evil: because of his aloofness from defilements, the noble one, the true man, does not delight in evil even in the slightest degree.

original: pāpe na ramati. Kasmā? Pāpe na ramatī sucīti suvisuddhakāyasamācārāditāya suci suddhapuggalo
analyzed: pāpe na ramati kasmai pāpe na ramati suci iti su visuddha kāya samācāra āditāya suci suddha puggalaḥ
translated: Why? Because he does not delight in evil, the pure one: the pure one, the clean one, the one of pure conduct in body, etc.,

original: rājahaṃso viya uccāraṭṭhāne pāpe saṃkiliṭṭhadhamme na ramati nābhinandati. “Pāpo
analyzed: rājahaṃsaḥ viya uccāra ṭṭhāne pāpe saṃkiliṭṭha dhamme na ramati na abhinandati pāpaḥ
translated: does not delight in, does not enjoy, evil, which is defiled, in the place of excrement, like a royal swan.

original: na ramatī suci”ntipi pāṭho, tassattho – pāpo puggalo suciṃ anavajjaṃ vodānadhammaṃ
analyzed: na ramati suciṃ tipi pāṭhaḥ tassa atthaḥ pāpaḥ puggalo sucim anavajjam vodāna dhammam
translated: The reading “pāpo na ramatī suci” is also found, which means: the evil one does not delight in the pure, the blameless, the purifying,

original: na ramati, aññadatthu gāmasūkarādayo viya uccāraṭṭhānaṃ asuciṃ saṃkilesadhammaṃyeva
analyzed: na ramati gāma sūkara ādayaḥ viya uccāra ṭṭhānam asucim saṃkilesa dhammaṃyā iva
translated: but rather delights in the impure, the defiled, like village pigs, etc., in the place of excrement.

original: ramatīti paṭipakkhato desanaṃ parivatteti.
analyzed: ramati iti paṭipakkhataḥ desanam parivattā iti
translated: The Master thus reverses the teaching by way of the opposite.

original: Soṇakuṭikaṇṇavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: soṇa kuṭikaṇṇa vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Soṇakuṭikaṇṇa story is concluded.

original: 259. Kāḷasīhoti kāḷamukhavānarajāti. Sesamettha pāḷito aṭṭhakathāto ca suviññeyyamevāti.
analyzed: kāḷasīhaḥ ti kāḷamukha vānara jāti sesam ettha pāḷitaḥ aṭṭhakathātaḥ ca su viññeyyam evā ti
translated: The black lion is a species of black-faced monkey. The rest here is quite clear in the text and in the commentary.

original: Cammakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: cammakkhandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Description of the Leathern Garment is finished.

original: 6. Bhesajjakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: bhesajja khandhakam
translated: The Drugs Section

original: Pañcabhesajjādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañca bhesajja ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Five Kinds of Drugs, etc.

original: 261. Bhesajjakkhandhake nacchādentīti ruciṃ na uppādenti.🔽262. Susukāti samudde bhavā ekā macchajāti. Kumbhīlātipi vadanti. Saṃsaṭṭhanti parissāvitaṃ. Telaparibhogenāti sattāhakālikaparibhogaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bhesajja kkhandhake na chādenti iti rucim na uppādenti  susukā ati samudde bhavā ekā maccha jāti kumbhīlā atipi vadanti saṃsaṭṭhanti parissāvitam tela paribhogena ati satta aha kālika paribhogam sandhāya vuttam
translated: They do not relish it: they do not take a liking to it.🔽The susuka is a kind of fish found in the ocean. It is also called the “kumbhīla.” Mixed: mixed with. Oil-treatment: this is said with reference to the use of what is allowable for seven days.

original: 263. Piṭṭhehīti pisitehi. Ubbhidaṃ nāma ūsarapaṃsumayaṃ.
analyzed: piṭṭhehi iti pisitehi ubbhidam nāma ūsara paṃsu mayam
translated: With powders: with ground-up powders. The ubbida is a kind of soil found in the desert.

original: 264. Chakaṇanti gomayaṃ. Pākatikacuṇṇaṃ nāma apakkakasāvacuṇṇaṃ. Tena ṭhapetvā gandhacuṇṇaṃ sabbaṃ vaṭṭatīti vadanti.
analyzed: chakaṇam ti gomayam pākatika cuṇṇam nāma apakka kasāva cuṇṇam tena ṭhapetvā gandha cuṇṇam sabbam vaṭṭati iti vadanti
translated: The chakkara is cow-dung. The ordinary powder is the powder of unbaked salt. With that, they say, all is allowable except fragrant powder.

original: 265. Suvaṇṇagerukoti suvaṇṇatutthādi. Añjanūpapisananti añjanatthāya upapisitabbaṃ yaṃ kiñci cuṇṇajātaṃ.
analyzed: suvaṇṇa gerukaḥ ti suvaṇṇa tuttha ādi añjana upapisanam ti añjana atthāya upapisitabbam yam kiñci cuṇṇa jātam
translated: The suvannagureka is gold-ore, etc. Eye-salve: any kind of powder that can be used as an eye-salve.

original: 268. Sāmaṃ gahetvāti ettha sappadaṭṭhassa atthāya aññena bhikkhunā gahitampi sāmaṃ gahitasaṅkhameva gacchatīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: sāmam gahetvā ti ettha sa ppadaṭṭhassa atthāya aññena bhikkhunā gahitam api sāmam gahita saṅkham eva gacchati iti veditabbam
translated: “Having taken himself” : it should be understood that what is taken by another bhikkhu for the purpose of the sick one is also called “taken by himself.”

original: 269. Gharadinnakābādho nāma vasīkaraṇatthāya gharaṇiyā dinnabhesajjasamuṭṭhito ābādho.🔽Tenāha “vasīkaraṇapāṇakasamuṭṭhitarogo”ti. Ghara-saddo cettha abhedena gharaṇiyā🔽vattamāno adhippeto. “Akaṭayūsenāti anabhisaṅkhatena muggayūsena. Kaṭākaṭenāti mugge
analyzed: gharadinnaka ābādhaḥ nāma vasīkaraṇa atthāya gharaṇiyā dinna bhesajja samuṭṭhitaḥ ābādhaḥ  tena āha vasīkaraṇa pāṇaka samuṭṭhita rogaḥ ti ghara saddo ca ittha abhedena gharaṇiyā  vattamānaḥ adhippetaḥ a kaṭa yūsena ati an abhisaṅkhatena mugga yūsena kaṭākaṭena ati mugge
translated: “A sickness given in a house” is a sickness arisen from medicine given in a house for the purpose of curing a disease.🔽Therefore it is said: “a disease arisen from a house-snake given for the purpose of curing a disease.” The word “house” here is intended to be used without distinction of a house-snake or a house-lizard.

original: pacitvā acāletvāva parissāvitena muggasūpenā”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.🔽Guḷādianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pacitvā a cāletvā ava parissāvitena mugga sūpena ati gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam  guḷa ādi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: “With a raw-meat skewer” means with a mung-bean curry that has not been cooked. “With a raw-meat broth” means with a mung-bean broth that has not been cooked after boiling the mung beans and then straining it.🔽The explanation of the section on the allowance of sugar, etc.

original: 272. Guḷakaraṇanti guḷakaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ, ucchusālanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: guḷa karaṇanti guḷa karaṇa ṭṭhānam ucchusālam ti vuttam hoti
translated: “Sugar-making place” is a place where sugar is made, that is, a place where sugar is boiled.

original: 274. Avissatthāti sāsaṅkā.
analyzed: avissatthā ati sa āsaṅkā
translated: “Not safe” means doubtful.

original: 276. Appamattakepi pavārentīti appamattakepi gahite pavārenti, “bahumhi gahite aññesaṃ
analyzed: appamattake pi pavārenti iti appamattake pi gahite pavārenti bahumhi gahite aññesam
translated: “When they have taken even a little” means when they have taken even a little, they should announce it. If they have taken a lot, they should announce it.

original: nappahotī”ti maññamānā appamattakaṃ gahetvā pavārentīti adhippāyo. Paṭisaṅkhāpi paṭikkhipantīti
analyzed: na pahoti iti maññamānāḥ appamattakam gahetvā pavārenti iti adhippāyaḥ paṭisaṅkhā api paṭikkhipanti iti
translated: They refuse even after reflecting:

original: “divā bhojanatthāya bhavissatī”ti sallakkhetvāpi paṭikkhipanti.
analyzed: divā bhojana tthāya bhavissati iti sallakkhetvā api paṭikkhipanti
translated: they reflect, ‘It will be for the purpose of a meal during the day,’ and they refuse.

original: 279. Sambādhe dahanakammaṃ paṭikkhepābhāvo vaṭṭati.
analyzed: sambādhe dahana kammam paṭikkhepa abhāvaḥ vaṭṭati
translated: The refusal of the act of burning in a confined space is allowable.

original: 280. Ubhatopasannāti ubhayato pasannā. Māghātoti “mā ghātetha pāṇino”ti evaṃ māghātaghositadivaso.
analyzed: ubhatas pasannā ati ubhayatas pasannā mā ghātaya iti mā pāṇinā iti evam mā āghāta ghosita divasaḥ
translated: Both are satisfied: both are satisfied with the invitation. The day of the proclamation: the day on which the proclamation is made thus: ‘Do not kill living beings.’

original: Yāgumadhugoḷakādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: yāgu madhu goḷaka ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of rice porridge, honey-balls, etc.

original: 282. Madhugoḷakanti sakkarādisaṃyuttapūvaṃ. Āyuṃ detīti āyudānaṃ deti. Vaṇṇanti sarīravaṇṇaṃ.
analyzed: sakkara ādi saṃyutta pūvam āyum deti iti āyu dānam deti vaṇṇanti sarīra vaṇṇam
translated: Honey-balls: cakes mixed with sugar, etc. Gives life: gives a life-support. Beauty: beauty of the body.

original: Sukhanti kāyikacetasikasukhaṃ. Balanti sarīrathāmaṃ. Paṭibhānanti yuttamuttapaṭibhānaṃ.
analyzed: sukham iti kāyika cetasika sukham balam iti sarīra thāmam paṭibhānam iti yutta mutta paṭibhānam
translated: Happiness: bodily and mental happiness. Strength: strength of the body. Eloquence: suitable and apt eloquence.

original: Vātaṃ anulometīti vātaṃ anulometvā harati. Vatthiṃ sodhetīti dhamaniyo suddhaṃ karoti.
analyzed: vātam anulometi iti vātam anulometvā harati vatthim sodheti iti dhamaniyaḥ suddham karoti
translated: It follows the wind: it carries the wind along with it. It cleans the bowels: it makes the veins pure.

original: Āmāvasesaṃ pācetīti sace āmāvasesakaṃ hoti, taṃ pāceti. Anuppavecchatīti deti. Vātañca
analyzed: āma avasesam pāceti iti sace āma avasesakam hoti tam pāceti anuppavecchati iti deti vātam ca
translated: It digests the remaining food: if there is any remaining food, it digests it. It gives relief: it gives. The wind

original: byapanetīti sambandhitabbaṃ.
analyzed: vyapaneti iti sambandhitabbam
translated: should be supplied.

original: 283. Nanu ca “paramparabhojanena kāretabbo”ti kasmā vuttaṃ. Paramparabhojanañhi pañcannaṃ🔽bhojanānaṃ aññatarena nimantitassa taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ
analyzed: nanu ca parampara bhojanena kāretabbaḥ iti kasmā vuttam parampara bhojanam hi pañcannam  bhojanānaṃ aññatarena nimantitassa tam ṭhapetvā aññam pañcannam bhojanānam aññataram
translated: But why is it said that he should be dealt with for eating by invitation?🔽For eating by invitation is when one who has been invited eats any one of the five cooked foods other than that one, setting aside the one he has been invited with.

original: bhuñjantassa hoti, ime ca bhikkhū bhojjayāguṃ paribhuñjiṃsu, pañcasu bhojanesu aññataranti
analyzed: bhuñjantassa hoti ime ca bhikkhū bhojja yāgum paribhuñjiṃsu pañcasu bhojanesu aññataranti
translated: But these bhikkhus ate rice gruel, which is one of the five cooked foods.🔽“For the invitation is in the rice gruel,” he says.

original: āha “bhojjayāguyā hi pavāraṇā hotī”ti. Yasmā pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ paṭikkhipantassa
analyzed: āha bhojja yāguyā hi pavāraṇā hoti iti yasmai pañcannam bhojanānam aññataram paṭikkhipantassa
translated: For the invitation that is stated when one refuses any one of the five cooked foods

original: vuttā pavāraṇā bhojjayāguṃ paṭikkhipantassapi hotiyeva, tasmā bhojjayāgupi odanagatikāyevāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vuttā pavāraṇā bhojja yāgum paṭikkhipantassa api hotiyā iva tasmā odana gatikāya iva ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: is also present when one refuses rice gruel. So the intention is that the rice gruel is included in the rice.

original: 284. Sukhumojaṃ pakkhipiṃsūti “bhagavā paribhuñjissatī”ti maññamānā pakkhipiṃsu.
analyzed: sukhumojam pakkhipiṃsu iti bhagavā paribhuñjissati iti maññamānā pakkhipiṃsu
translated: They put in the fine wheaten flour: they put it in, thinking, “The Blessed One will eat it.”

original: Pāṭaligāmavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section of the Mahāvagga dealing with Pāṭaliputta🔽Pāṭaliputta: a village of that name in the Magadha country.

original: 285. Pāṭaligāmoti evaṃnāmako magadharaṭṭhe eko gāmo. Tassa kira gāmassa māpanadivase
analyzed: pāṭaligāmo ti evaṃnāmakaḥ magadha raṭṭhe ekaḥ gāmo tassa kira gāmassa māpana divase
translated: On the day when the building of the village was begun,

original: gāmaṅgaṇaṭṭhāne dve tayo pāṭalaṅkurā pathavito ubbhijjitvā nikkhamiṃsu. Tena taṃ
analyzed: gāmaṅgaṇa ṭhāne dve tayo pāṭalaṅkurā pathavitaḥ ubbhijjitvā nikkhamiṃsu tena tam
translated: Two or three shoots of the pāṭalī tree rose up from the ground in the village-compound. Because of that

original: “pāṭaligāmo” tveva vohariṃsu. Tadavasarīti taṃ pāṭaligāmaṃ avasari anupāpuṇi. Pāṭaligāmikāti
analyzed: pāṭaligāmaḥ tu eva vohariṃsu tad avasarī iti tam pāṭaligāmam avasari anupāpuṇi pāṭaligāmikā ati
translated: they called it Pāṭali Village. Tadavasari: he reached, he arrived at, that Pāṭali Village. Pāṭaligāmike:

original: pāṭaligāmavāsino. Upāsakāti te kira bhagavato paṭhamadassanena keci saraṇesu ca sīlesu
analyzed: pāṭaligāma vāsinaḥ te kira bhagavato paṭhama dassanena keci saraṇesu ca sīlesu
translated: the inhabitants of Pāṭali Village. Upāsake: it seems that on the occasion of their first seeing the Fortunate One some were established in the Refuges and Precepts,

original: ca patiṭṭhitā. Tena vuttaṃ “upāsakā”ti. Yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsūti pāṭaligāme
analyzed: ca patiṭṭhitā tena vuttam upāsakā ati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṃsu iti pāṭaligāme
translated: therefore it was said: “lay followers”. Tenupasaṅkamiṃsu: it seems that in Pāṭali Village

original: kira ajātasattuno licchavirājūnañca manussā kālena kālaṃ gantvā gehasāmike gehato
analyzed: kira ajātasattunaḥ licchavi rājūnam ca manussā kālena kālam gantvā geha sāmike gehataḥ
translated: the people of Ajātasattu and the Licchavi kings went from time to time, and after taking the houses away from the owners,

original: nīharitvā māsampi aḍḍhamāsampi vasanti. Tena pāṭaligāmavāsino manussā niccupaddutā
analyzed: nīharitvā māsam pi aḍḍha māsam pi vasanti tena pāṭaligāma vāsinaḥ manussāḥ niccu paddutā
translated: they lived there for a month or a fortnight. Because of that the people living in Pāṭali Village were constantly oppressed,

original: “etesañceva āgatakāle vasanaṭṭhānaṃ bhavissatīti ekapasse issarānaṃ bhaṇḍapaṭisāmanaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: etesam ca iva āgata kāle vasana ṭhānam bhavissati iti eka passe issarānam bhaṇḍa paṭisāmana ṭhānam
translated: and thinking: ‘When they come we will have a place to live,’ on one side they made a place to store the goods of the rulers,

original: ekapasse vasanaṭṭhānaṃ, ekapasse āgantukānaṃ addhikamanussānaṃ, ekapasse daliddānaṃ
analyzed: eka passe vasana ṭṭhānam eka passe āgantukānam addhika manussānam eka passe daliddānam
translated: on one side a place to live, on one side a place for the extra people who had come, on one side for the poor,

original: kapaṇamanussānaṃ, ekapasse gilānānaṃ vasanaṭṭhānaṃ bhavissatī”ti sabbesaṃ aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: kapaṇa manussānam eka passe gilānānam vasana ṭṭhānam bhavissati iti sabbesam aññamaññam
translated: “It will be a place for the poor and the sick to stay in.”🔽They had a great hall built in the middle of the city, each one building a separate hall,

original: aghaṭṭetvā vasanappahonakaṃ nagaramajjhe mahatiṃ sālaṃ kāresuṃ, tassa nāmaṃ āvasathāgāranti.
analyzed: a ghaṭṭetvā vasanappahonakam nagara majjhe mahatim sālam kāresuṃ tassa nāmam āvasatha āgāram ti
translated: and they gave it the name “Guest House.”

original: Āgantvā vasanti ettha āgantukāti āvasatho, tadeva āgāraṃ āvasathāgāraṃ.🔽Taṃ divasañca taṃ niṭṭhānaṃ agamāsi. Te tattha gantvā iṭṭhakakammasudhākammacittakammādivasena
analyzed: āgantvā vasanti ettha āgantukāḥ ati āvasathaḥ tat eva āgāram āvasatha āgāram  tam divasam ca tam niṭṭhānam agamāsi te tattha gantvā iṭṭhaka kamma sudhā kamma citta kamma ādi vasena
translated: “Guests” are those who come and stay here; the house for them is a guest house.🔽And that very day it was completed. They went there and saw that it was well built, well finished, well constructed, well plastered, and well whitewashed, like a celestial palace,

original: supariniṭṭhitaṃ susajjitaṃ devavimānasadisaṃ dvārakoṭṭhakato paṭṭhāya oloketvā “idaṃ
analyzed: su pariniṭṭhitam su sajjitam deva vimāna sadisam dvāra koṭṭhakataḥ paṭṭhāya oloketvā idam
translated: from the gatehouse on. They thought, “This guest house is so beautiful and so delightful.

original: āvasathāgāraṃ ativiya manoramaṃ sassirikaṃ, kena nu kho paṭhamaṃ paribhuttaṃ amhākaṃ🔽dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya assā”ti cintesuṃ, tasmiṃyeva ca khaṇe “bhagavā taṃ gāmaṃ
analyzed: āvasatha āgāram ativiya manoramam sa sirikam kena nu kho paṭhamam paribhuttam amhākam  dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya cintesum tasmin yā iva ca khaṇe bhagavā tam gāmaṃ
translated: Who should be the first to use it for his own benefit and happiness for a long time?🔽” At that very moment they heard that the Buddha had arrived in the village.

original: anuppatto”ti assosuṃ, tena te uppannapītisomanassā “amhehi bhagavā gantvāpi ānetabbo
analyzed: an uppattaḥ ti assosum tena te uppanna pīti somanassāḥ amhehi bhagavā gantvā api ānetabbo
translated: They were filled with joy and happiness and thought, “We should invite the Buddha to stay in the guest house.

original: siyā, so sayameva amhākaṃ vasanaṭṭhānaṃ sampatto, ajja mayaṃ bhagavantaṃ idha vasāpetvā
analyzed: siyā saḥ sayam eva amhākam vasana ṭṭhānam sampattaḥ ajja mayam bhagavantam idha vasāpetvā
translated: “He may have come here of his own accord to stay in our dwelling. Today we will cause the Blessed One to dwell here

original: paṭhamaṃ paribhuñjāpessāma, tathā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ, bhikkhusaṅghe āgate tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: paṭhamam paribhuñjāpessāma tathā bhikkhu saṅgham bhikkhu saṅghe āgate tepiṭakam buddha vacanam
translated: and to use it first. After that we will cause the community of monks to use it. When the community of monks has come, the entire Buddha Word in three Piṭakas

original: āgatameva bhavissati, satthāraṃ maṅgalaṃ vadāpessāma, dhammaṃ kathāpessāma, iti tīhi🔽ratanehi paribhutte pacchā amhākaṃ paresañca paribhogo bhavissati, evaṃ no dīgharattaṃ
analyzed: āgatam eva bhavissati satthāram maṅgalam vadāpessāma dhammam kathāpessāma iti tīhi  ratanehi paribhutte pacchā amhākam paresam ca paribhogaḥ bhavissati evam naḥ dīgharattam
translated: will have come. We will cause the Teacher to speak a blessing, we will cause the Dhamma to be spoken. In this way,🔽after the three Jewels have used it, it will be used by us and others. In this way it will be for our benefit and happiness for a long time.”

original: hitāya sukhāya bhavissatī”ti sanniṭṭhānaṃ katvā etadatthameva bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamiṃsu.
analyzed: hitāya sukhāya bhavissati iti sanniṭṭhānam katvā etad attham eva bhagavantam upasaṅkamiṃsu
translated: Having made this decision, they approached the Blessed One for this very purpose.

original: Tasmā evamāhaṃsu “adhivāsetu no, bhante, bhagavā āvasathāgāra”nti. Tenupasaṅkamiṃsūti
analyzed: tasmai evam āhaṃsu adhivāsetu naḥ bhante bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṃsu iti
translated: Therefore they said, “Venerable Sir, may the Blessed One consent to the rest house.” They approached him.

original: kiñcāpi taṃ divasameva pariniṭṭhitattā devavimānaṃ viya susajjitaṃ supaṭijaggitaṃ,
analyzed: kiñca api tam divasam eva pariniṭṭhita ttā deva vimānam viya su sajjitam su paṭijaggitam
translated: Although it was well-prepared and well-looked after like a divine mansion because it was completed that very day,

original: buddhārahaṃ pana katvā na paññattaṃ. Buddhā hi nāma araññajjhāsayā araññārāmā, antogāme
analyzed: buddhāraham pana katvā na paññattam buddhāḥ hi nāma arañña ajjhāsayā arañña ārāmāḥ antogāme
translated: it was not arranged for the Buddha. For Buddhas are inclined to the wilderness, they delight in the wilderness, and they🔽dwell in the wilderness.

original: vaseyyuṃ vā no vā, tasmā bhagavato ruciṃ jānitvāva paññapessāmāti cintetvā te bhagavantaṃ🔽upasaṅkamiṃsu, idāni bhagavato ruciṃ jānitvā tathā paññāpetukāmā yenāvasathāgāraṃ🔽tenupasaṅkamiṃsu. Sabbasanthariṃ āvasathāgāraṃ santharitvāti ettha santharaṇaṃ santhari,
analyzed: vaseyyum vā no vā tasmai bhagavato rucim jānitvā ava paññapessāma ati cintetvā te bhagavantam  upasaṅkamiṃsu idāni bhagavataḥ rucim jānitvā tathā paññā petu kāmāḥ yena āvasatha āgāram  tena upasaṅkamiṃsu sabba santharim āvasatha āgāram santharitvā ati ettha santharaṇam santhari
translated: whether they should be laid out or not. So they thought: ‘We will find out what the Lord likes and then we will lay them out.’ And they approached the Lord,

original: sabbo sakalo santhari etthāti sabbasanthari. Atha vā santhatanti santhari, sabbaṃ
analyzed: sabbo sakalo santhari ettha ati sabbasanthari atha vā santhatanti santhari sabbam
translated: and said to him: ‘If it pleases the Lord, let the beds and benches be laid out in the rest-house. We will find out what the Lord likes and then we will lay them out.’

original: santhari sabbasanthari, taṃ sabbasanthariṃ. Bhāvanapuṃsakaniddesovāyaṃ, yathā sabbameva🔽santhataṃ hoti, evaṃ santharitvāti attho. Sabbapaṭhamaṃ tāva “gomayaṃ nāma sabbamaṅgalesu
analyzed: santhari sabbasanthari tam sabbasantharim bhāva napuṃsaka niddesa uvāyam yathā sabbam eva  santhatam hoti evam santharitvā iti attho sabba paṭhamam tāva gomayam nāma sabba maṅgalesu
translated: ‘Let the beds and benches be laid out in the rest-house, Ananda, and let water be brought in a pot.’🔽‘Yes, Lord’, said Ananda, and did as he was asked.

original: vaṭṭatī”ti sudhāparikammakatampi bhūmiṃ allagomayena opuñjāpetvā parisukkhabhāvaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti sudhā parikamma katam api bhūmim alla gomayena opuñjāpetvā parisukkha bhāvam
translated: Then the Lord took a key with him and went to the rest-house. He opened the door with his own hand, and then said to Ananda: ‘Lay out the beds and benches in the rest-house, Ananda, and bring water in a pot.🔽I am tired and want to sit down.’

original: ñatvā yathā akkantaṭṭhāne padaṃ paññāyati, evaṃ cātujjātiyagandhehi limpetvā upari
analyzed: ñatvā yathā akkanta ṭṭhāne padam paññāyati evam cātujjātiya gandhehi limpetvā upari
translated: ‘Yes, Lord’, said Ananda, and did as he was asked.

original: nānāvaṇṇakaṭasārake santharitvā tesaṃ upari mahāpiṭṭhikakojave ādiṃ katvā hatthattharaṇādīhi
analyzed: nānā vaṇṇa kaṭasārake santharitvā tesam upari mahāpiṭṭhika kojave ādim katvā hatthattharaṇa ādīhi
translated: and having spread them out, they had the whole floor covered with carpets of various colours, beginning with the great Piṭṭhika-kojava carpets,🔽and with carpets of various colours, beginning with the elephant-foot carpets.

original: nānāvaṇṇehi attharaṇehi santharitabbayuttakaṃ sabbokāsaṃ santharāpesuṃ. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: nānā vaṇṇehi attharaṇehi santharitabba yuttakam sabba ukāsam tena vuttam
translated: Therefore it was said:

original: “sabbasanthariṃ āvasathāgāraṃ santharitvā”ti.
analyzed: sabbasantharim āvasatha āgāram santharitvā ati
translated: “Having had the rest-house covered all over with carpets.”

original: Āsanānīti majjhaṭṭhāne tāva maṅgalatthambhaṃ nissāya mahārahaṃ buddhāsanaṃ paññapetvā🔽tattha yaṃ yaṃ mudukañca manoramañca paccattharaṇaṃ, taṃ taṃ attharitvā ubhatolohitakaṃ
analyzed: āsanāni iti majjha ṭṭhāne tāva maṅgala tthambham nissāya mahā raham buddha āsanam paññapetvā  tattha yam yam mudukam ca manoramam ca paccattharaṇam tam tam attharitvā ubhatolohitakam
translated: “Seats”: First of all, having prepared a very valuable Buddha-seat in the middle of the room, leaning against the auspicious central pillar,🔽and having spread out the soft and beautiful beddings,

original: manuññadassanaṃ upadhānaṃ upadahitvā upari suvaṇṇarajatatārakavicittavitānaṃ bandhitvā
analyzed: manuñña dassanam upadhānam upadahitvā upari suvaṇṇa rajata tāraka vicitta vitānam bandhitvā
translated: having hung up a canopy which was decorated with golden and silver stars,

original: gandhadāmapupphadāmapattādāmādīhi alaṅkaritvā samantā dvādasahatthe ṭhāne pupphajālaṃ
analyzed: gandha dāma puppha dāma pattā dāma ādīhi alaṅkaritvā samantā dvādasa hatthe ṭhāne puppha jālam
translated: having adorned it with garlands of scent, garlands of flowers, garlands of leaves, etc., having had a flower-net made all round the place twelve cubits in extent,

original: kāretvā tiṃsahatthamattaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭasāṇiyā parikkhipāpetvā pacchimabhittiṃ nissāya
analyzed: kāretvā tiṃsa hattha mattam ṭhānam paṭa sāṇiyā parikkhipāpetvā pacchima bhittim nissāya
translated: having had the place thirty cubits in extent surrounded with a curtain,

original: bhikkhusaṅghassa pallaṅkapīṭhaapassayapīṭhamuṇḍapīṭhādīni paññapāpetvā upari setapaccattharaṇehi
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghassa pallaṅka pīṭha apassaya pīṭha muṇḍa pīṭha ādīni paññapāpetvā upari seta paccattharaṇehi
translated: and had prepared for the Community of Bhikkhus couches and chairs, and foot-stools, and foot-rests, and had spread them with white coverings,

original: paccattharāpetvā sālāya pācīnapassaṃ attano nisajjāyoggaṃ kāresuṃ. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ
analyzed: paccattharāpetvā sālāya pācīna passam attanaḥ nisajjāyoggam kāresuṃ tam sandhāya vuttam
translated: and had prepared a sitting place for himself in the eastern part of the hall, and had said:

original: “āsanāni paññapetvā”ti.
analyzed: āsanāni paññapetvā ati
translated: “Let seats be prepared.”

original: Udakamaṇikanti mahākucchikaṃ samekhalaṃ udakacāṭiṃ. Evaṃ bhagavā bhikkhusaṅgho ca
analyzed: udakamaṇikam ti mahā kucchikam sa mekhalam udaka cāṭim evam bhagavā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ ca
translated: A water-vessel: a large pot, a water-jug, a water-pot. Thus the Blessed One and the Community of Bhikkhus

original: yathāruciyā hatthapāde dhovissanti, mukhaṃ vikkhālessantīti tesu tesu ṭhānesu maṇivaṇṇassa🔽udakassa pūretvā vāsatthāya nānāpupphāni ceva udakavāsacuṇṇāni ca pakkhipitvā kadalipaṇṇehi
analyzed: yathāruciyā hattha pāde dhovissanti mukham vikkhālessanti iti tesu tesu ṭhānesu maṇi vaṇṇassa  udakassa pūretvā vāsa atthāya nānā pupphāni ca iva udaka vāsa cuṇṇāni ca pakkhipitvā kadali paṇṇehi
translated: will wash their hands and feet as they like, and will rinse their mouths, and they placed it in various places, filling it with water the colour of a gem,

original: pidahitvā patiṭṭhapesuṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “udakamaṇikaṃ patiṭṭhāpetvā”ti.
analyzed: pidahitvā patiṭṭhapesum tena vuttam udakamaṇikam patiṭṭhāpetvā iti
translated: and putting in it various flowers and water-perfume, and covering it with a plantain leaf, for the purpose of bathing. Therefore it was said: “Having placed a water-vessel.”

original: Telapadīpaṃ āropetvāti rajatasuvaṇṇādimayadaṇḍāsu daṇḍadīpikāsu yonakarūpakādīnaṃ
analyzed: āropetvā ati rajata suvaṇṇa ādi maya daṇḍāsu daṇḍa dīpikāsu
translated: Having lit an oil-lamp: in the oil-lamps with handles made of silver, gold, etc., and having put in them wicks of cotton, etc.,

original: hatthe ṭhapitasuvaṇṇarajatādimayakapallikāsu ca telapadīpe jalayitvā. Yena bhagavā
analyzed: hatthe ṭhapita suvaṇṇa rajata ādi maya kapallikāsu ca telapadīpe jalayitvā yena bhagavā
translated: and approached the Lord.

original: tenupasaṅkamiṃsūti ettha pana te pāṭaligāmikaupāsakā na kevalaṃ āvasathāgārameva,
analyzed: tena upasaṅkamiṃsu iti ettha pana te pāṭaligāmika aupāsakāḥ na kevalam āvasatha āgāram eva
translated: But the lay-followers of Pataliputta not only prepared the rest-house,🔽but also had the streets of the whole town decorated,

original: atha kho sakalasmimpi gāme vīthiyo sajjāpetvā dhaje ussāpetvā gehadvāresu puṇṇaghaṭe
analyzed: atha kho sakalasmim pi gāme vīthiyaḥ sajjāpetvā dhaje ussāpetvā geha dvāresu puṇṇa ghaṭe
translated: had flags hoisted, had full water-jars

original: ca kadaliādayo ca ṭhapāpetvā sakalagāmaṃ dīpamālāhi vippakiṇṇatārakaṃ viya katvā
analyzed: ca kadali ādayo ca sakala gāmam dīpa mālāhi vippakiṇṇa tārakam viya katvā
translated: and plantain trees placed at the doors of the houses, and had the whole town lit up with garlands of lamps like the sky with stars,

original: “khīrapake dārake khīraṃ pāyetha, daharakumāre lahuṃ lahuṃ bhojetvā sayāpetha, uccāsaddaṃ🔽mā karittha, ajja ekarattiṃ satthā antogāme vasissati, buddhā nāma appasaddakāmā
analyzed: khīrapake dārake khīram pāyetha dahara kumāre lahum lahum bhojetvā sayāpetha uccāsaddam  mā karittha ajja eka rattim satthā antogāme vasissati buddhāḥ nāma appasadda kāmā
translated: had the children suckled on milk and gruel, had the young men and women fed and put to bed, had the people keep quiet,🔽and had it proclaimed with drums: “To-day the Lord will spend one night in the town. The Buddhas are fond of quiet.”

original: hontī”ti bheriṃ carāpetvā sayaṃ daṇḍadīpikā ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.🔽Atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena yena āvasathāgāraṃ
analyzed: honti iti bherim cara apetvā sayam daṇḍa dīpikāḥ ādāya yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṃsu 🔽atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena yena āvasatha āgāram
translated: And they themselves, taking torches, approached the Lord.

original: tenupasaṅkamīti “yassa dāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṃ maññatī”ti evaṃ kira tehi kāle
analyzed: tena upasaṅkami iti yassa dāni bhante bhagavā kālam maññati iti evam kira tehi kāle
translated: “If it is convenient for the Blessed One, it is time for the meal.”🔽The Blessed One, having understood that the time had been announced to him by them in this way, put on his lower robe and fastened his belt,🔽like one who is polishing a red lotus with a red cloth,

original: ārocite bhagavā lākhārasena tintarattakoviḷārapupphavaṇṇaṃ surattaṃ dupaṭṭaṃ kattariyā🔽padumaṃ kantento viya, saṃvidhāya timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādento nivāsetvā suvaṇṇapāmaṅgena
analyzed: ārocite bhagavā lākhā rasena tinta ratta koviḷāra puppha vaṇṇam su rattam du paṭṭam kattariyā  padumam kantentaḥ viya saṃvidhāya ti maṇḍalam paṭicchādentaḥ nivāsetvā suvaṇṇa pāmaṅgena
translated: covering the three circles,🔽and having fastened his waistband, which was radiant like a flash of lightning, like one who is surrounding a cluster of red lotuses with a golden garland,🔽and having put on his upper robe, which was red,

original: padumakalāpaṃ parikkhipanto viya, vijjulatāsassirikaṃ kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā rattakambalena🔽gajakumbhaṃ pariyonandhanto viya, ratanasatubbedhe suvaṇṇagghike pavāḷajālaṃ khipamāno🔽viya, mahati suvaṇṇacetiye rattakambalakañcukaṃ paṭimuñcanto viya, gacchantaṃ puṇṇacandaṃ
analyzed: paduma kalāpam parikkhipantaḥ viya vijju latā sassirikam kāyabandhanam bandhitvā ratta kambalena  gaja kumbham pariyonandhantaḥ viya suvaṇṇagghike pavāḷa jālam khipamānaḥ  viya mahati suvaṇṇa cetiye ratta kambala kañcukam paṭimuñcantaḥ viya gacchantam puṇṇa candam
translated: like one who is covering the tusk of an elephant with a red cloth,🔽and having taken his bowl and robe, like one who is throwing a coral net into a golden casket with a hundred sections,🔽and having gone out into the open air, like one who is placing a red cloth cover on a great golden shrine,🔽and having entered the city of Kusinārā, like one who is covering the full moon with a red cloud,

original: rattavalāhakena paṭicchādayamāno viya, kañcanagirimatthake supakkalākhārasaṃ parisiñcanto
analyzed: ratta valāhakena paṭicchādayamānaḥ viya kañcana giri matthake su pakkala ākhā rasam parisiñcantaḥ
translated: and having gone to the Mallas’ Sal Wood, like one who is sprinkling red lac on the top of a golden mountain,

original: viya, cittakūṭapabbatamatthakaṃ vijjulatājālena parikkhipanto viya ca sacakkavāḷasineruyugandharamahāpathaviṃ
analyzed: viya cittakūṭa pabbata matthakam vijju latā jālena parikkhipantaḥ viya ca sa cakkavāḷa sineru yugandhara mahā pathavim
translated: as if surrounding the peak of Cittakūṭa Mountain with a net of lightning flashes, and as if shaking the earth with its great oceans and mountains,

original: cāletvā gahitanigrodhapallavasamānavaṇṇaṃ rattavarapaṃsukūlaṃ pārupitvā vanagahanato
analyzed: cāletvā gahita nigrodha pallava samāna vaṇṇam ratta vara paṃsukūlam pārupitvā vana gahanataḥ
translated: he put on a red-dyed rag-robe, the colour of a young mango shoot, and came out of the forest thicket

original: kesarasīho viya, udayapabbatakūṭato puṇṇacando viya, bālasūriyo viya ca attanā nisinnatarusaṇḍato nikkhami.🔽Athassa kāyato meghamukhato vijjukalāpā viya rasmiyo nikkhamitvā suvaṇṇarasadhārāparisekapiñjarapattapupphaphalasākhāviṭape
analyzed: kesarasīhaḥ viya udayapabbata kūṭataḥ puṇṇa candaḥ viya bāla sūriyaḥ viya ca attanā nisinna taru saṇḍataḥ nikkhami  athassa kāyataḥ megha mukhataḥ vijju kalāpāḥ viya rasmiyaḥ nikkhamitvā suvaṇṇa rasa dhārā pariseka piñjara patta puppha phala sākhā viṭape
translated: like a lion from a mountain cave, like the full moon from the peak of the rising mountain, like the young sun from the eastern mountain.🔽Then from his body, like a flash of lightning from a cloud, rays issued forth, and they made the trees all around

original: viya samantato rukkhe kariṃsu. Tāvadeva attano attano pattacīvaramādāya mahābhikkhusaṅgho
analyzed: viya samantataḥ rukkhe kariṃsu tāvat eva attano attano patta cīvaram ādāya mahā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ
translated: look as if they were sprinkled with liquid gold, and as if their leaves, flowers, fruits, and branches were fresh. Then the great community of monks, taking their own bowls and robes,

original: bhagavantaṃ parivāresi. Te ca naṃ parivāretvā ṭhitabhikkhū evarūpā ahesuṃ appicchā
analyzed: bhagavantam parivāresi te ca nam parivāretvā ṭhita bhikkhū evarūpāḥ ahesuṃ appicchāḥ
translated: surrounded the Fortunate One. And those monks who stood surrounding him were such that they were few in their wishes,

original: santuṭṭhā pavivittā asaṃsaṭṭhā āraddhavīriyā vattāro vacanakkhamā codakā pāpagarahino
analyzed: santuṭṭhāḥ pavivittāḥ asaṃsaṭṭhāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ vattāraḥ vacana khamā codakā pāpa garahino
translated: content, secluded, aloof from society, strenuous, respectful, reproving, and censuring evil.

original: sīlasampannā samādhisampannā paññāsampannā vimuttisampannā vimuttiñāṇadassanasampannā.
analyzed: sīla sampannā samādhi sampannā paññā sampannā vimutti sampannā vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampannā
translated: endowed with virtue, concentration, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Tehi parivārito bhagavā rattakambalaparikkhitto viya suvaṇṇakkhandho, rattapadumasaṇḍamajjhagatā🔽viya suvaṇṇanāvā, pavāḷavedikāparikkhitto viya suvaṇṇapāsādo virocittha. Mahākassapappamukhā
analyzed: tehi parivāritaḥ bhagavā ratta kambala parikkhittaḥ viya suvaṇṇa kkhandhaḥ  viya suvaṇṇa nāvā pavāḷa vedikā parikkhittaḥ viya suvaṇṇa pāsādaḥ virocittha mahākassapa pamukhā
translated: The Fortunate One, surrounded by them, shone like a golden chest surrounded by a red blanket,🔽like a golden ship in the middle of a cluster of red lotuses, like a golden palace surrounded by a coral rampart. But the great elders headed by Mahākassapa,

original: pana mahātherā meghavaṇṇaṃ paṃsukūlacīvaraṃ pārupitvā maṇivammavammitā viya mahānāgā
analyzed: pana mahā therāḥ megha vaṇṇam paṃsukūla cīvaram pārupitvā maṇi vamma vammitāḥ viya mahā nāgāḥ
translated: having put on their dusty rag-robes the colour of rain clouds, surrounded him like great nāgas anointed with gem necklaces,

original: parivārayiṃsu vītarāgā bhinnakilesā vijaṭitajaṭā chinnabandhanā kule vā gaṇe vā alaggā.
analyzed: vīta rāgā bhinna kilesā vijaṭita jaṭā chinna bandhanā kule vā gaṇe vā a laggā
translated: free from passion, their defilements destroyed, their matted hair unraveled, their bonds cut, not clinging to families or groups.

original: Iti bhagavā sayaṃ vītarāgo vītarāgehi, vītadoso vītadosehi, vītamoho vītamohehi,
analyzed: iti bhagavā sayam vīta rāgaḥ vīta rāgehi vīta dosaḥ vīta dosehi vīta mohaḥ vīta mohehi
translated: Thus the Fortunate One, himself free from passion, was surrounded by those free from passion, himself free from hatred by those free from hatred, himself free from delusion by those free from delusion,

original: nittaṇho nittaṇhehi, nikkileso nikkilesehi, sayaṃ buddho anubuddhehi parivārito pattaparivāritaṃ
analyzed: nittaṇhaḥ nittaṇhehi nikkilesaḥ nikkilesehi sayam buddhaḥ anubuddhehi parivāritaḥ patta parivāritam
translated: himself without desire by those without desire, himself without defilements by those without defilements, himself enlightened by those enlightened, surrounded like a bowl surrounded by a rim,

original: viya kesaraṃ, kesaraparivāritā viya kaṇṇikā, aṭṭhanāgasahassaparivārito viya chaddanto
analyzed: viya kesaram kesara parivāritāḥ viya kaṇṇikāḥ aṭṭhanāga sahassa parivāritaḥ viya chaddanto
translated: like a lotus with a filament, like a pericarp surrounded by filaments, like Chaddanta the king of elephants surrounded by eight thousand elephants,

original: nāgarājā, navutihaṃsasahassaparivārito viya dhataraṭṭho haṃsarājā, senaṅgaparivārito
analyzed: nāga rājā navuti haṃsa sahassa parivāritaḥ viya dhataraṭṭhaḥ haṃsa rājā senaṅga parivārito
translated: like Dhataraṭṭha the king of geese surrounded by ninety thousand geese, like a universal monarch surrounded by the nine treasures,

original: viya cakkavattī, marugaṇaparivārito viya sakko devarājā, brahmagaṇaparivārito viya🔽hāritamahābrahmā, tārāgaṇaparivuto viya puṇṇacando asamena buddhavesena aparimāṇena
analyzed: viya cakkavattī maru gaṇa parivāritaḥ viya sakkaḥ devarājā brahma gaṇa parivāritaḥ viya  hārita mahā brahmā tārā gaṇa parivutaḥ viya puṇṇa candaḥ asamena buddha vesena aparimāṇena
translated: like Sakka the king of gods surrounded by the Maruts, like the great Brahmā Hārita surrounded by the company of Brahmas,

original: buddhavilāsena pāṭaligāmīnaṃ maggaṃ paṭipajji.
analyzed: buddha vilāsena pāṭali gāmīnam maggam paṭipajji
translated: like the full moon surrounded by the stars, he went along the road to Pāṭali Village with incomparable Buddha-beauty and immeasurable Buddha-glory.

original: Athassa puratthimakāyato suvaṇṇavaṇṇā ghanabuddharasmiyo uṭṭhahitvā asītihatthaṃ🔽ṭhānaṃ aggahesuṃ, pacchimakāyato dakkhiṇapassato vāmapassato suvaṇṇavaṇṇā ghanarasmiyo
analyzed: athassa puratthima kāyataḥ suvaṇṇa vaṇṇāḥ ghana buddha rasmiyaḥ uṭṭhahitvā asīti hattham  ṭhānam aggahesum pacchima kāyataḥ dakkhiṇa passataḥ vāma passataḥ suvaṇṇa vaṇṇāḥ ghana rasmiyaḥ
translated: Then from his front part golden-coloured, solid Buddha-rays arose and occupied a space of eighty cubits,

original: uṭṭhahitvā asītihatthaṃ ṭhānaṃ aggahesuṃ, uparikesantato paṭṭhāya sabbakesāvattehi
analyzed: uṭṭhahitvā asīti hattham ṭhānam aggahesum upari kesantataḥ paṭṭhāya sabba kesāvattehi
translated: from his back part, from his right side, from his left side, golden-coloured, solid rays arose and occupied a space of eighty cubits, from the top of his head right down to the soles of his feet,

original: moragīvavaṇṇā ghanabuddharasmiyo uṭṭhahitvā gaganatale asītihatthaṃ ṭhānaṃ aggahesuṃ,
analyzed: ghana buddha rasmiyaḥ uṭṭhahitvā gagana tale asīti hattham ṭhānam aggahesuṃ
translated: and from the nape of his neck, golden rays issued forth and filled a space eighty cubits in extent in the sky above.

original: heṭṭhāpādatalehi pavāḷavaṇṇā rasmiyo uṭṭhahitvā ghanapathaviyaṃ asītihatthaṃ ṭhānaṃ🔽aggahesuṃ, dantato akkhīnaṃ setaṭṭhānato, nakhānañca maṃsavinimuttaṭṭhānato odātā🔽ghanabuddharasmiyo uṭṭhahitvā asītihatthaṃ ṭhānaṃ aggahesuṃ, rattapītavaṇṇānaṃ sambhinnaṭṭhānato
analyzed: heṭṭhā pāda talehi pavāḷa vaṇṇāḥ rasmiyaḥ uṭṭhahitvā ghana pathaviyam asīti hattham ṭhānam  aggahesum dantataḥ akkhīnam seta ṭṭhānataḥ nakhānam ca maṃsa vinimutta ṭṭhānataḥ  ghana buddha rasmiyaḥ uṭṭhahitvā asīti hattham ṭhānam aggahesum ratta pīta vaṇṇānam sambhinna ṭhānato
translated: From the soles of his feet, ruby-coloured rays issued forth and filled a space eighty cubits in extent on the earth below.🔽From his teeth, from the white parts of his eyes, and from the parts of his nails that are free from flesh, pure white rays issued forth and filled a space eighty cubits in extent.

original: mañjiṭṭhavaṇṇā rasmiyo uṭṭhahitvā asītihatthaṃ ṭhānaṃ aggahesuṃ, sabbatthakameva
analyzed: mañjiṭṭha vaṇṇāḥ rasmiyaḥ uṭṭhahitvā asīti hattham ṭhānam aggahesum sabbatthakam eva
translated: From the parts of his body that are a mixture of red and yellow, rays of the colour of the coral tree issued forth and filled a space eighty cubits in extent.

original: pabhassarā rasmiyo uṭṭhahiṃsu. Evaṃ samantā asītihatthamattaṃ ṭhānaṃ chabbaṇṇā buddharasmiyo🔽vijjotamānā vipphandamānā vidhāvamānā kañcanadaṇḍadīpikāhi niccharitvā ākāsaṃ pakkhandamānā
analyzed: pabhassarāḥ rasmiyaḥ uṭṭhahiṃsu evam samantā asīti hattha mattam ṭhānam chabbaṇṇāḥ buddha rasmiyaḥ  vijjotamānā vipphandamānā vidhāvamānā kañcana daṇḍa dīpikāhi niccharitvā ākāsam pakkhandamānā
translated: From all parts of his body, rays of dazzling brilliance issued forth. Thus the rays of the Buddha, which are of six colours,🔽shone forth, filling a space eighty cubits in extent on all sides. They spread out, extended, and expanded, like a mass of great lamps issuing forth from a golden tube,

original: mahāpadīpajālā viya, cātuddīpikamahāmeghato nikkhantavijjulatā viya ca disodisaṃ
analyzed: mahā padīpa jālā viya cātuddīpika mahā meghataḥ nikkhanta vijju latā viya ca disodisam
translated: like lightning flashes issuing from a great cloud with four colours.

original: pakkhandiṃsu. Yāhi sabbadisābhāgā suvaṇṇacampakapupphehi vikiriyamānā viya, suvaṇṇaghaṭato🔽nikkhantasuvaṇṇarasadhārāhi āsiñciyamānā viya, pasāritasuvaṇṇapaṭṭaparikkhittā viya,
analyzed: pakkhandiṃsu sabba disā bhāgā suvaṇṇa campaka pupphehi vikiriyamānā viya suvaṇṇa ghaṭataḥ  nikkhanta suvaṇṇa rasa dhārāhi āsiñciyamānā viya pasārita suvaṇṇa paṭṭa parikkhittā viya
translated: and they shone as if they were scattered with golden campaka flowers, as if they were sprinkled with golden water flowing from golden jars, as if they were surrounded by golden banners,

original: verambhavātasamuddhatakiṃsukakaṇikārakikirātapupphacuṇṇasamokiṇṇā viya cīnapiṭṭhacuṇṇasamparirañjitā viya ca virociṃsu.
analyzed: verambha vāta samuddhata kiṃsuka kaṇikāraki kirāta puppha cuṇṇa samokiṇṇāḥ viya cīna piṭṭha cuṇṇa samparirañjitāḥ viya ca virociṃsu
translated: as if they were covered with the pollen of kīra flowers shaken off by the Verambha wind, as if they were anointed with Chinese vermilion.

original: Bhagavatopi asītianubyañjanabyāmappabhāparikkhepasamujjalaṃ dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ
analyzed: bhagavataḥ api asīti anubyañjana byāma pabhā parikkhepa samujjalam dvattiṃsa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa paṭimaṇḍitam
translated: The Blessed One’s body, too, shone forth, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, encircled with the eighty minor characteristics,

original: sarīraṃ abbhamahikādiupakkilesavimuttaṃ samujjalatārakapabhāsitaṃ viya gaganatalaṃ,
analyzed: sarīram abbha mahika ādi upakkilesa vimuttam samujjala tāraka pabhāsitam viya gagana talam
translated: free from the impurities of smoke, dust, and the like, like the sky with its stars shining forth,

original: vikasitaṃ viya padumavanaṃ, sabbapāliphullo viya yojanasatiko pāricchattako, paṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: vikasitam viya paduma vanam sabba pāli phullaḥ viya yojana satikaḥ pāricchattakaḥ paṭipāṭiyā
translated: like a grove of full-blown lotuses, like a full-blown yojana-wide pāricchattaka tree,

original: ṭhapitānaṃ dvattiṃsacandānaṃ dvattiṃsasūriyānaṃ dvattiṃsacakkavattīnaṃ dvattiṃsadevarājānaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapitānam dvattiṃsa candānam dvattiṃsa sūriyānam dvattiṃsa cakkavattīnam dvattiṃsa devarājānam
translated: as if it were surrounded by thirty-two moons, thirty-two suns, thirty-two wheel-turning monarchs, thirty-two gods of the Tāvatimsa realm,

analyzed: dvattiṃsa mahābrahmānam siriyā sirim abhibhavamānam viya virocittha yathā tam
translated: and shone forth as if outshining the glory of the thirty-two Great Brahmās,

original: pāramīhi dasahi upapāramīhi dasahi paramatthapāramīhīti sammadeva paripūritāhi samatiṃsāya🔽pāramīhi alaṅkataṃ kappasatasahassādhikāni cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni dinnena dānena rakkhitena
analyzed: pāramīhi dasahi upapāramīhi dasahi paramattha pāramīhi iti sammat eva samatiṃsāya  pāramīhi alaṅkatam kappa sata sahassa adhikāni cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni dinnena dānena rakkhitena
translated: adorned with the thirty pāramīs, which are fulfilled in the right way with the ten pāramīs, the ten upapāramīs, and the ten paramatthapāramīs,

original: sīlena katena kalyāṇakammena ekasmiṃ attabhāve samosaritvā vipākaṃ dātuṃ okāsaṃ alabhamānena🔽sambādhappattena viya nibbattitaṃ nāvāsahassassa bhaṇḍaṃ ekaṃ nāvaṃ āropanakālo viya,

translated: and with the merit of the four asaṅkheyyas and a hundred thousand eons of giving gifts, of guarding virtue, and of doing good deeds, which had been accumulated in a single existence, and which had no opportunity to give their fruit,🔽as if they were crowded together,🔽as if a thousand ships were being loaded with a thousand shiploads of goods,🔽as if a thousand carts were being loaded with a thousand cartloads of goods,

original: sakaṭasahassassa bhaṇḍaṃ ekaṃ sakaṭaṃ āropanakālo viya, pañcavīsatiyā gaṅgānaṃ sambhijja🔽mukhadvāre ekato rāsībhūtakālo viya ca ahosi.
analyzed: sakaṭa sahassassa bhaṇḍam ekam sakaṭam āropana kālaḥ viya pañcavīsatiyā gaṅgānam  mukha dvāre ekatas ca ahosi
translated: as if the twenty-five rivers were being brought together and poured into the mouth of the Ganges,🔽and as if they were being poured into the mouth of the Ganges.

original: Imāya buddharasmiyā obhāsamānassapi bhagavato purato anekāni daṇḍadīpikāsahassāni
analyzed: imāya buddha rasmiyā obhāsamānassa api bhagavato puratas anekāni daṇḍa dīpikā sahassāni
translated: Even though the Buddha-glory shone forth, a thousand torches

original: ukkhipiṃsu, tathā pacchato vāmapasse dakkhiṇapasse. Jātisumanacampakavanamālikārattuppalanīluppalabakulasinduvārādipupphāni
analyzed: tathā pacchatas vāma passe dakkhiṇa passe jāti sumana campaka vanamālikā rattuppala nīluppala bakula sinduvāra ādi pupphāni
translated: and they did so. And then, in the same way, on the left and on the right. And flowers of the jasmine, the champak, the gardenia, the ratta, the blue water lily, the white water lily, the spider lily, the tabernanthe, the coral tree, and so on,

original: ceva nīlapītādivaṇṇasugandhagandhacuṇṇāni ca cātuddīpikamahaāmeghavissaṭṭhā salilavuṭṭhiyo🔽viya vippakiriṃsu. Pañcaṅgikatūriyanigghosā ceva buddhadhammasaṅghaguṇapaṭisaṃyuttā
