analyzed: so api ajjhāsayena maṅku hotiyā iva vippaṭisārībhāvato
translated: but he is diffident in his heart because of remorse.

original: Sammūḷho kālaṃ karotīti dussīlassa hi maraṇamañce nipannassa dussīlyakammānaṃ samādāya
analyzed: sammūḷhaḥ kālam karoti iti dussīlassa hi maraṇa mañce nipannassa dussīlya kammānam samādāya
translated: He dies confused: for when the unvirtuous lie on their deathbed, the places where they habitually committed their evil deeds come into focus.

original: vattitaṭṭhānāni āpāthamāgacchanti. So ummīletvā attano puttadārādidassanavasena idhalokaṃ🔽passati, nimīletvā gatinimittupaṭṭhānavasena paralokaṃ passati, tassa cattāro apāyā
analyzed: vattita ṭṭhānāni āpātham āgacchanti saḥ ummīletvā attano putta dāra ādi dassana vasena idha lokam  passati nimīletvā gati nimitta upaṭṭhāna vasena para lokaṃ passati tassa cattāro apāyā
translated: He sees the world of sensual desires by opening his eyes and seeing his children, wife, etc.,🔽and he sees the world beyond by closing his eyes and seeing the signs of his destiny.🔽The four lower worlds appear to him in accordance with his evil deeds,

original: kammānurūpaṃ upaṭṭhahanti. Sattisatena pahariyamāno viya aggijālāya āliṅgiyamāno
analyzed: kamma anurūpam upaṭṭhahanti satti satena pahariyamānaḥ viya aggi jālāya āliṅgiyamānaḥ
translated: as if he were being struck by a hundred spears or embraced by a mass of flames.

original: viya ca hoti. So “vāretha vārethā”ti viravantova marati. Tena vuttaṃ “sammūḷho kālaṃ karotī”ti.
analyzed: viya ca hoti saḥ vāretha vāretha ati viravantaḥ uva marati tena vuttam sammūḷhaḥ kālam karoti iti
translated: He dies crying out, “Stop! Stop!” That is why it is said, “He dies confused.”🔽At the breakup of the body: at the relinquishing of the clung-to aggregates.

original: Kāyassa bhedāti upādinnakakkhandhapariccāgā. Paraṃ maraṇāti tadanantaraṃ abhinibbattakkhandhaggahaṇe.
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā ati upādinna ka khandha pariccāgā param maraṇā ti tad anantaram abhinibbatta kkhandha ggahaṇe
translated: After death: in the next rebirth-linking of aggregates.🔽Or alternatively, at the breakup of the body: at the cessation of the life faculty.

original: Atha vā kāyassa bhedāti jīvitindriyassa upacchedā. Paraṃ maraṇāti cutito uddhaṃ.
analyzed: atha vā kāyassa jīvitindriyassa upacchedā param maraṇā ati cutitaḥ
translated: After death: after the death.

original: Apāyantiādi sabbaṃ nirayavevacanaṃ. Nirayo hi saggamokkhahetubhūtā puññasaṅkhātā
analyzed: sabbam niraya vevacanam nirayaḥ hi saggamokkha hetu bhūtā puñña saṅkhātā
translated: The rest is a synonym for hell. For hell is an apāya because it is a non-going by way of merit, which is the cause for the going to heaven,

original: ayā apetattā, sukhānaṃ vā āyassa āgamanassa abhāvā apāyo. Dukkhassa gati paṭisaraṇanti🔽duggati, dosabahulatāya vā duṭṭhena kammunā nibbattā gatīti duggati. Vivasā nipatanti
analyzed: sukhānam vā āyassa āgamanassa abhāvā apāyaḥ dukkhassa gati paṭisaraṇanti  duggati dosa bahula tāya vā duṭṭhena kammunā nibbattā gatīti duggati vivasāḥ nipatanti
translated: or because of the absence of the coming of pleasure. It is a bad destination because it is the destination for suffering.🔽Or it is a bad destination because it is a destination produced by bad kamma that is abundant in hate.🔽It is a downfall because those who do evil go there and fall.

original: ettha dukkaṭakārinoti vinipāto, vinassantā vā ettha nipatanti saṃbhijjamānaṅgapaccaṅgāti
analyzed: ettha dukkaṭa kārino ti vinipātaḥ vinassantāḥ vai ettha nipatanti saṃbhijjamāna aṅga paccaṅgā ati
translated: Or it is a downfall because there one’s limbs and secondary limbs are broken.

original: vinipāto. Natthi ettha assādasaññito ayoti nirayo.
analyzed: vinipātaḥ na atthi ettha assāda saññitaḥ ayaḥ ti nirayo
translated: It is hell because there is no perception of pleasure there.

original: Atha vā apāyaggahaṇena tiracchānayoniṃ dīpeti. Tiracchānayoni hi apāyo sugatito apetattā,
analyzed: atha vā apāya ggahaṇena tiracchānayonim dīpeti tiracchānayoni hi apāyaḥ sugatitaḥ apeta tā
translated: Or alternatively, by the word “apāya” he shows the animal realm, for that is an apāya because it is a non-going to a good destination,

original: na duggati mahesakkhānaṃ nāgarājādīnaṃ sambhavato. Duggatiggahaṇena pettivisayaṃ
analyzed: na duggati mahesakkhānam nāga rāja ādīnam sambhavataḥ duggati ggahaṇena petti visayam
translated: but it is not a bad destination because of the existence there of powerful kings of the animals, etc. By the word “durgati” he shows the realm of ghosts,

original: dīpeti. So hi apāyo ceva duggati ca sugatito apetattā dukkhassa ca gatibhūtattā,
analyzed: dīpeti saḥ hi apāyaḥ ca iva duggati ca sugatitaḥ apeta ttā dukkhassa ca gati bhūta ttā
translated: for that is an apāya and a bad destination because it is a non-going to a good destination and because it is the destination for suffering,

original: na tu vinipāto asurasadisaṃ avinipatitattā. Petamahiddhikānaṃ vimānānipi nibbattanti.🔽Vinipātaggahaṇena asurakāyaṃ dīpeti. So hi yathāvuttenatthena apāyo ceva duggati
analyzed: na tu vinipātaḥ asura sadisam a vinipatita ttā peta mahiddhikānam vimānāni api nibbattanti  vinipāta ggahaṇena asura kāyam dīpeti saḥ hi yathā vuttena atthena apāyaḥ ca iva duggati
translated: but not the downfall, since it is not a downfall like that of the asuras. And the mansions of the petas of great spiritual power are also produced.

original: ca sabbasampattisamussayehi vinipātattā vinipātoti ca vuccati. Nirayaggahaṇena pana
analyzed: ca sabba sampatti samussayehi vinipāta ttā vinipāto ti ca vuccati niraya ggahaṇena pana
translated: The asura world is indicated by the word “downfall,” since it is a state of loss in the sense stated. It is a state of loss because it is a downfall, a falling away from all the kinds of excellence.🔽But the word “hell” indicates only the various kinds of hell, such as the Avīci Hell, etc.

original: avīciādikaṃ anekappakāraṃ nirayameva dīpeti. Upapajjatīti nibbattati.
analyzed: avīci ādikam aneka ppakāram nirayam eva dīpeti upapajjati iti nibbattati
translated: “Is reborn”: is produced.

original: Ānisaṃsakathā vuttavipariyāyena veditabbā. Ayaṃ pana viseso – sīlavāti samādānavasena
analyzed: ānisaṃsa kathā vutta vipariyāyena veditabbā ayam pana visesaḥ sīlavā ati samādāna vasena
translated: The explanation of the benefits should be understood in the opposite sense to the above. But there is this difference. “Virtuous” : virtuous by undertaking .

original: sīlavā. Sīlasampannoti parisuddhaṃ paripuṇṇañca katvā sīlassa sampādanena sīlasampanno.
analyzed: sīlavā sīla sampannaḥ ti parisuddham paripuṇṇam ca katvā sīlassa sampādanena sīla sampannaḥ
translated: “Endowed with virtue” : endowed with virtue by fulfilling virtue with purification and perfection.🔽“A great mass of good fortune” : a great heap of good fortune.

original: Bhogakkhandhanti bhogarāsiṃ. Sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokanti ettha sugatiggahaṇena manussagatipi
analyzed: bhogakkhandham ti bhogarāsim sugatim saggam lokanti ettha sugati ggahaṇena manussa gati pi
translated: “A happy destiny, a heavenly world” : here, the word “happy destiny” includes the human destiny,

original: saṅgayhati, saggaggahaṇena devagati eva. Tattha sundarā gatīti sugati, rūpādīhi visayehi
analyzed: sagga ggahaṇena deva gati eva tattha sundarā gati iti su gati rūpa ādīhi visayehi
translated: and the word “heavenly world” includes the divine destiny. Herein, a happy destiny is a destiny that is beautiful ;

original: suṭṭhu aggoti saggo, so sabbopi lujjanapalujjanaṭṭhena lokoti.
analyzed: suṭṭhu aggaḥ ti saggaḥ saḥ sabbaḥ api lujjana palujjana ṭṭhena loko ti
translated: “The word ‘heaven’ (sagga) is derived from the word ‘good’ (sugata); and all these are called ‘worlds’ (loka) in the sense of ‘that which is broken up’ (lujjati).🔽“The lay devotees of Pāṭaligāma” means the lay devotees of Pāṭali Village.🔽“For much of the night” means for a long time.

original: Pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahudeva rattiṃ dhammiyā kathāyāti aññāyapi pāḷimuttāya dhammakathāya
analyzed: pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahu deva rattim dhammiyā kathāya ati pāḷimuttāya dhamma kathāya
translated: “With talk on the Dhamma” means with talk on the Dhamma that is not included in the texts.🔽“With talk on the dwelling” means with talk on the dwelling place.

original: ceva āvasathānumodanakathāya ca. Tadā hi bhagavā yasmā ajātasattunā tattha pāṭaliputtanagaraṃ
analyzed: āvasatha anumodana kathāya ca tadā hi bhagavā yasmai ajātasattunā pāṭaliputta nagaram
translated: For at that time, when Ajātasattu was building the city of Pāṭaliputta,

original: māpentena aññāsu gāmanigamarājadhānīsu ye sīlācārasampannā kuṭumbikā, te ānetvā dhanadhaññāni
analyzed: māpentena aññāsu gāma nigama rājadhānīsu ye sīla ācāra sampannā kuṭumbikā te ānetvā dhana dhaññāni
translated: he brought from other villages, towns, and royal cities all the wealthy and virtuous householders🔽and made them live there, giving them wealth, grain,🔽houses, fields, and so on.

original: gharavatthukhettavatthādīni ceva parihārañca dāpetvā nivesiyanti, tasmā pāṭaligāmikā
analyzed: ghara vatthu khetta vattha ādīni ca iva parihāram ca dāpetvā tasmā pāṭaligāmikā
translated: Therefore the lay devotees of Pāṭali Village,

original: upāsakā ānisaṃsadassāvitāya visesato sīlagarukāti sabbaguṇānañca sīlassa adhiṭṭhānabhāvato
analyzed: upāsakāḥ visesato sīla garukāḥ ati sabba guṇānaṃ ca sīlassa adhiṭṭhāna bhāvato
translated: seeing the benefits, were especially respectful of virtue. And because virtue is the foundation of all good qualities,

original: tesaṃ paṭhamaṃ sīlānisaṃse pakāsetvā tato paraṃ ākāsagaṅgaṃ otārento viya pathavojaṃ
analyzed: tesam paṭhamam sīla nisaṃse pakāsetvā tato param ākāsagaṅgam otārentaḥ viya pathavojam
translated: the Blessed One first explained the benefits of virtue to them, and then, like one who plunges into the Ganges in the sky,🔽like one who drags along the earth,🔽like one who shakes a great mango tree by the top,

original: ākaḍḍhanto viya mahājambuṃ matthake gahetvā cālento viya yojanappamāṇaṃ mahāmadhuṃ
analyzed: ākaḍḍhantaḥ viya mahā jambum matthake gahetvā cālentaḥ viya yojana ppamāṇam mahā madhum
translated: like one who takes a great honey tree and shakes it,

original: cakkayantena pīḷetvā sumadhurarasaṃ pāyamāno viya ca pāṭaligāmikānaṃ upāsakānaṃ hitasukhāvahaṃ
analyzed: cakkayantena pīḍetvā sumadhura rasam pāyamānaḥ ca pāṭaligāmikānam upāsakānam hita sukha āvaham
translated: and as if he were feeding them with a sweet-tasting drink by means of a water-wheel, he brought welfare and happiness to the lay devotees of Pāṭali Village.

original: pakiṇṇakakathaṃ kathentopi “āvāsadānaṃ nāmetaṃ gahapatayo mahantaṃ puññaṃ, tumhākaṃ🔽āvāso mayā paribhutto, bhikkhusaṅghena paribhutto, mayā ca bhikkhusaṅghena ca paribhutte
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka katham kathentaḥ api āvāsa dānam nāma etam gahapatayaḥ mahantam puññam tumhākam  āvāsaḥ mayā paribhuttaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena paribhuttaḥ mayā ca bhikkhu saṅghena ca paribhutte
translated: “Householders, this gift of a dwelling is not a great merit.🔽When it is used by me and by the Community of Bhikkhus,

original: dhammaratanenapi paribhuttoyeva hoti, evaṃ tīhi ratanehi paribhutte aparimeyyova
analyzed: dhamma ratanena api hoti evam tīhi ratanehi paribhutte aparimeyyā uva
translated: then it is used by the Jewel of the Community. When it is used by me and by the Community of Bhikkhus and by the Jewel of the Community,

original: vipāko, apica āvāsadānasmiṃ dinne sabbadānaṃ dinnameva hoti, bhūmaṭṭhakapaṇṇasālāya
analyzed: vipākaḥ apica āvāsa dānasmim dinne sabba dānam dinnam eva hoti bhūmaṭṭhaka paṇṇasālāya
translated: then the result is immeasurable. Moreover, when a gift of a dwelling is given, all gifts are given.🔽When a leaf hut or a pavilion of branches is made for the Community,

original: vā sākhāmaṇḍapassa vā saṅghaṃ uddissa katassa ānisaṃso paricchindituṃ na sakkā. Āvāsadānānubhāvena
analyzed: vā sākhāmaṇḍapassa vā saṅgham uddissa katassa ānisaṃso paricchinditum na sakkā āvāsa dāna anubhāvena
translated: the benefit cannot be measured.🔽For when a gift of a dwelling is given,

original: hi bhave nibbattamānassapi sampīḷitagabbhavāso nāma na hoti, dvādasahattho ovarako
analyzed: hi bhave nibbattamānassa api sampīḍitagabbha vāsaḥ nāma na hoti dvādasa hatthaḥ ovarako
translated: if one is reborn in a becoming, one’s womb is not crowded, and one’s room is twelve cubits wide,

original: viyassa mātukucchi asambādhova hotī”ti evaṃ nānānayavicittaṃ bahuṃ dhammakathaṃ kathetvā –
analyzed: viyassa mātukucchi asambādhaḥ uva hoti iti evam nānā naya vicittam bahum dhamma katham kathetvā
translated: and the mother’s womb is not cramped.”

original: “Sītaṃ uṇhaṃ paṭihanti, tato vāḷamigāni ca;
analyzed: sītam uṇham paṭihanti tatas vāḍamigāni ca
translated: “Cold and heat are warded off, and wild beasts as well,

original: Sarīsape ca makase, sisire cāpi vuṭṭhiyo.
analyzed: sarīsape ca makase sisire ca api
translated: And snakes and crocodiles, and also dew.🔽“Then a terrible wind and sun

original: “Tato vātātapo ghoro, sañjāto paṭihaññati;
analyzed: tatas vāta ātapaḥ ghoro sañjātaḥ paṭihaññati
translated: are warded off,🔽For the sake of shelter and comfort,

original: Leṇatthañca sukhatthañca, jhāyituñca vipassituṃ.
analyzed: leṇattham ca sukhattham ca jhāyitum ca vipassitum
translated: for the sake of meditation and insight.🔽“The gift of a dwelling to the Sangha

original: “Vihāradānaṃ saṅghassa, aggaṃ buddhena vaṇṇitaṃ;
analyzed: vihāra dānam saṅghassa aggam buddhena vaṇṇitam
translated: is praised by the Buddha as the best.🔽Therefore a wise person,

original: Tasmā hi paṇḍito poso, sampassaṃ atthamattano.
analyzed: tasmā hi paṇḍitaḥ posaḥ sampassam attham attano
translated: seeing what is beneficial for himself,

original: “Vihāre kāraye ramme, vāsayettha bahussute;
analyzed: vihāre ramme vāsayettha bahu sute
translated: “Should have delightful dwellings built🔽and have learned ones dwell there.🔽He should give them food and drink,

original: Tesaṃ annañca pānañca, vatthasenāsanāni ca.
analyzed: tesam annam ca pānam ca vattha senāsanāni ca
translated: clothes, and bedding.🔽“He should give to the upright

original: “Dadeyya ujubhūtesu, vippasannena cetasā;
analyzed: dadeyya uju bhūtesu vippasannena cetasā
translated: with a serene mind.🔽They teach him the Dhamma

original: Te tassa dhammaṃ desenti, sabbadukkhāpanūdanaṃ;
analyzed: te tassa dhammam desenti sabba dukkha apanūdanam
translated: that dispels all suffering.🔽Having understood the Dhamma here,

original: Yaṃ so dhammaṃ idhaññāya, parinibbāti anāsavo”ti. –
analyzed: yam saḥ dhammam idhaññāya parinibbāti anāsavaḥ ti
translated: he attains nibbāna, free of defilements.”

original: Evaṃ ayampi āvāsadāne ānisaṃso ayampi āvāsadāne ānisaṃsoti bahudeva rattiṃ atirekadiyaḍḍhayāmaṃ
analyzed: evam ayam pi āvāsa dāne ayam pi āvāsa dāne ānisaṃsaḥ uti bahu deva rattim
translated: Thus the benefits of giving a dwelling are many.

original: āvāsadānānisaṃsaṃ kathesi. Tattha imā gāthāva saṅgahaṃ āruḷhā, pakiṇṇakadhammadesanā
analyzed: āvāsa dāna anisaṃsam kathesi tattha imāḥ gāthā ava saṅgaham āruḷhā pakiṇṇaka dhamma desanā
translated: and the benefits of giving dwellings. Herein, these verses are included:🔽

original: pana saṅgahaṃ na ārohati. Sandassetvātiādīni vuttatthāneva.🔽Abhikkantāti atikkantā dve yāmā gatā. Yassadāni tumhe kālaṃ maññathāti yassa gamanassa
analyzed: pana saṅgaham na ārohati sandassetvā ati ādīni vutta tthāni eva  abhikkantā ati atikkantāḥ dve yāmāḥ gatāḥ tumhe kālam maññatha ati yassa gamanassa
translated: and he spoke in praise of the giving of dwelling places. Herein, these verses are included in the Collection of Verses, but the miscellaneous teaching is not included in the Collection of Miscellaneous Verses.🔽Having exhorted them: the meaning of this has already been given.🔽The first two watches of the night have passed: the first two watches of the night have gone by.🔽Now is the time to do as you think fit: now is the time for you to go, the time for you to depart, is what is meant.

original: tumhe kālaṃ maññatha, gamanakālo tumhākaṃ, gacchathāti vuttaṃ hoti. Kasmā pana bhagavā
analyzed: tumhe kālam maññatha gamana kālo tumhākam gacchatha ati vuttam hoti kasmā pana bhagavā
translated: But why did the Blessed One send them away?

original: te uyyojesīti? Anukampāya. Tiyāmarattiñhi nisīditvā vītināmentānaṃ tesaṃ sarīre ābādho
analyzed: te uyyojesi iti anukampāya tiyāma rattim hi nisīditvā tesam sarīre ābādhaḥ
translated: Out of compassion: for if they had sat there passing the whole night, their bodies would have become tired,

original: uppajjeyya, bhikkhusaṅghopi ca mahā, tassa sayananisajjānaṃ okāsaṃ laddhuṃ vaṭṭati,
analyzed: uppajjeyya bhikkhu saṅghaḥ api ca mahā tassa sayana nisajjānam okāsam laddhum vaṭṭati
translated: and the Community of Bhikkhus is a large one, so it is proper that they should get a chance to lie down and sit.

original: iti ubhayānukampāya uyyojesi.🔽Suññāgāranti pāṭiyekkaṃ suññāgāraṃ nāma tattha natthi. Te kira gahapatayo tasseva
analyzed: iti ubhaya anukampāya uyyojesi  suññāgāranti pāṭiyekkam suññāgāram nāma tattha natthi te kira gahapatayo tassa iva
translated: So he sent them away out of compassion for both.🔽An empty place: there is no such thing as an empty place by itself. It seems that those householders had a curtain put up on one side of the dwelling place

original: āvasathāgārassa ekapasse paṭasāṇiṃ parikkhipāpetvā kappiyamañcaṃ paññapetvā tattha
analyzed: āvasatha āgārassa eka passe paṭa sāṇim parikkhipāpetvā kappiya mañcam paññapetvā tattha
translated: and a suitable bed laid out there,

original: kappiyapaccattharaṇāni attharitvā upari suvaṇṇarajatatārakagandhamālādidāmapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ
analyzed: kappiya paccattharaṇāni attharitvā upari suvaṇṇa rajata tāraka gandha mālā ādi dāma paṭimaṇḍitam
translated: and having spread out the allowable rugs, they hung up a canopy over the seat,

original: vitānaṃ bandhitvā gandhatelapadīpaṃ āropayiṃsu “appeva nāma satthā dhammāsanato vuṭṭhāya🔽thokaṃ vissametukāmo idha nipajjeyya, evaṃ no idaṃ āvasathāgāraṃ bhagavatā catūhi
analyzed: vitānam bandhitvā gandha tela padīpam āropayiṃsu appā iva nāma satthā dhammāsanataḥ vuṭṭhāya  thokam vissametu kāmaḥ idha nipajjeyya evam naḥ idam āvasatha āgāram bhagavatā catūhi
translated: adorned with gold and silver stars, perfumes, garlands, and so on, and they lit a perfumed oil lamp, thinking, “Perhaps the Teacher, having risen from his seat of preaching,🔽and wishing to rest a little, will lie down here,” and so that their dwelling-place might be for a long time for their welfare and happiness, since it would have been used by the Blessed One

original: iriyāpathehi paribhuttaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissatī”ti. Satthāpi tadeva🔽sandhāya tattha saṅghāṭiṃ paññapetvā sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “suññāgāraṃ
analyzed: iriyāpathehi paribhuttam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya bhavissati iti satthā api tat eva  sandhāya tattha saṅghāṭim paññapetvā sīha seyyam kappesi tam sandhāya vuttam suññāgāram
translated: in all the four postures. The Teacher, thinking of this,🔽spread out his outer robe and lay down in the lion’s posture. In reference to this it is said: “He entered the empty dwelling-place.”

original: pāvisī”ti. Tattha pādadhovanaṭṭhānato paṭṭhāya yāva dhammāsanā agamāsi, ettake ṭhāne🔽gamanaṃ nipphannaṃ. Dhammāsanaṃ patvā thokaṃ aṭṭhāsi, idaṃ tattha ṭhānaṃ. Dve yāme
analyzed: pāvisi iti tattha pāda dhovana ṭṭhānato paṭṭhāya yāva dhamma āsanā agamāsi ettake ṭhāne  gamanam nipphannam dhammāsanam patvā thokam aṭṭhāsi idam tattha ṭhānam dve yāme
translated: From the time he went from the place where he washed his feet up to the seat of preaching, the posture of walking was fulfilled.🔽When he reached the seat of preaching, he stood for a little while. This was the posture of standing. For two watches

original: dhammāsane nisīdi, ettake ṭhāne nisajjā nipphannā. Upāsake uyyojetvā dhammāsanato
analyzed: dhammāsane nisīdi ettake ṭhāne nisajjā nipphannā upāsake uyyojetvā dhammāsanato
translated: he sat on the seat of preaching. In this posture of sitting the posture of sitting was fulfilled. Having dismissed the lay disciples, he rose from the seat of preaching,

original: oruyha yathāvutte ṭhāne sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi. Etaṃ ṭhānaṃ bhagavatā catūhi iriyāpathehi🔽paribhuttaṃ ahosīti.
analyzed: oruyha yathāvutte ṭhāne sīha seyyam kappesi etam ṭhānam bhagavatā catūhi iriyāpathehi  paribhuttam ahosi iti
translated: and he descended and lay down to sleep in the manner of a lion. This place was used by the Blessed One in four postures.

original: Pāṭaligāmavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pāṭaligāma vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: This is the story of the place at Pāṭali Village.

original: Sunidhavassakāravatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sunidha vassakāra vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of Sunīdha and Vassakāra

original: 286. Sunidhavassakārāti sunidho ca vassakāro ca dve brāhmaṇā. Magadhamahāmattāti
analyzed: sunidha vassakārā ati sunidhaḥ ca vassakāraḥ ca dve brāhmaṇāḥ magadha mahāmattā ati
translated: Sunīdha and Vassakāra: two brahmans, Sunīdha and Vassakāra. Great ministers of Magadha:

original: magadharañño mahāamaccā, magadharaṭṭhe vā mahāmattā, mahatiyā issariyamattāya samannāgatāti
analyzed: magadharaññaḥ mahāamaccāḥ magadharaṭṭhe vā mahā mattāḥ mahatiyai issariya mattāya samannāgatā ati
translated: great ministers of the king of Magadha, or great ministers in the kingdom of Magadha, endowed with great authority,

original: magadhamahāmattā. Pāṭaligāme nagaraṃ māpentīti pāṭaligāmantasaṅkhāte bhūmippadese
analyzed: magadha mahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaram māpenti iti pāṭaligāmanta saṅkhāte bhūmi ppadese
translated: they are great ministers of Magadha. They are building a city at Pāṭali Village: they are building a city in the place called Pāṭali Village,

original: nagaraṃ māpenti, pubbe “pāṭaligāmo”ti laddhanāmaṃ ṭhānaṃ idāni nagaraṃ katvā māpentīti
analyzed: nagaram māpenti pubbe pāṭaligāmaḥ ti laddha nāmam ṭhānam idāni nagaram katvā māpenti iti
translated: a place that previously had the name “Pāṭali Village,” now they are building a city, making it a town.

original: attho. Vajjīnaṃ paṭibāhāyāti licchavirājūnaṃ āyamukhapacchindanatthaṃ. Vatthūnīti
analyzed: atthaḥ vajjīnam paṭibāhāyāti licchavi rājūnam āya mukha pacchindana attham vatthūni iti
translated: This is the meaning. To ward off the Vajjians: to cut off the source of income for the Licchavi kings. Sites:

original: gharavatthūni gharapatiṭṭhāpanaṭṭhānāni. Cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetunti rañño
analyzed: ghara vatthūni ghara patiṭṭhāpana ṭṭhānāni cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetunti rañño
translated: house sites, places for establishing houses. Their minds turn to building houses: the minds of the king’s

original: rājamahāmattānañca nivesanāni māpetuṃ vatthuvijjāpāṭhakānaṃ cittāni namanti. Te kira
analyzed: rāja mahāmattānam ca nivesanāni māpetum vatthu vijjā pāṭhakānam cittāni namanti te kira
translated: and to the royal ministers to build their residences. The men who read the signs of the earth were able to do this.

original: attano sippānubhāvena heṭṭhāpathaviyaṃ tiṃsahatthamatte ṭhāne “idha nāgānaṃ nivāsapariggaho,
analyzed: attano sippa anubhāvena heṭṭhāpathaviyam tiṃsa hattha matte ṭhāne idha nāgānam nivāsa pariggaho
translated: They knew by the power of their craft that at a depth of thirty cubits below the earth there was a place for the nāgas to live,

original: idha yakkhānaṃ, idha bhūtānaṃ nivāsapariggaho, idha pāsāṇo vā khāṇuko vā atthī”ti
analyzed: idha yakkhānam idha bhūtānam nivāsa pariggahaḥ idha pāsāṇaḥ vā khāṇukaḥ vā atthi iti
translated: a place for the yakkhas, a place for the bhūtas, and a place where there was a rock or a stump.

original: jānanti, te tadā sippaṃ jappitvā tādisaṃ sārambhaṭṭhānaṃ pariharitvā anārambhe ṭhāne
analyzed: jānanti te tadā sippam jappitvā tādisam sa ārambha ṭṭhānam pariharitvā anārambhe ṭhāne
translated: They recited their craft and, avoiding a place that was dangerous, they built the residences in a place that was safe.

original: tāhi vatthupariggāhikāhi devatāhi saddhiṃ mantayamānā viya taṃtaṃgehāni māpenti.
analyzed: tāhi vatthu pariggāhikāhi devatāhi saddhim mantayamānāḥ viya taṃtaṃgehāni māpenti
translated: They did this as if they were consulting with the deities who had taken possession of the land.

original: Atha vā nesaṃ sarīre devatā adhimuccitvā tattha tattha nivesanāni māpetuṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: atha vā na īsam sarīre devatāḥ adhimuccitvā tattha tattha nivesanāni mā āpetum cittam
translated: Or else the deities took possession of their bodies and directed their minds to build the residences.

original: nāmenti. Tā catūsu koṇesu khāṇuke koṭṭetvā vatthumhi gahitamatte paṭivigacchanti.
analyzed: tā catūsu koṇesu khāṇuke koṭṭetvā vatthumhi gahita matte paṭivigacchanti
translated: They drove in pegs at the four corners and, when the land had been taken possession of, they disappeared.

original: Saddhānaṃ kulānaṃ saddhā devatā tathā karonti, assaddhānaṃ kulānaṃ assaddhā devatā
analyzed: saddhānam kulānam saddhāḥ devatā tathā karonti assaddhānam kulānam assaddhāḥ devatā
translated: The deities of the faithful families did this, and the deities of the faithless families did this too.

original: ca. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Saddhānañhi evaṃ hoti “idha manussā nivesanaṃ māpentā paṭhamaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ🔽nisīdāpetvā maṅgalaṃ vadāpessanti, atha mayaṃ sīlavantānaṃ dassanaṃ dhammakathaṃ🔽pañhavissajjanaṃ anumodanañca sotuṃ labhissāma, manussādānaṃ datvā amhākaṃ pattiṃ🔽dassantī”ti. Assaddhā devatāpi “attano icchānurūpaṃ tesaṃ paṭipattiṃ passituṃ kathañca
analyzed: ca kim kāraṇā saddhānam hi evam hoti idha manussāḥ nivesanam māpentā paṭhamam bhikkhu saṅghaṃ  nisīdāpetvā maṅgalam vadāpessanti atha mayam sīlavantānam dassanam dhamma katham  pañha vissajjanam anumodanañca sotum labhissāma manussa ādānam da tvā amhākam pattim  dassanti iti assaddhā devatā api attanaḥ icchā anurūpam tesam paṭipattim passitum kathaṃ ca
translated: Why? Because the faithful think: “When people are building a house, they will first make the Community of Bhikkhus sit down and will have them utter a blessing. Then we shall be able to hear the virtuous ones’ Dhamma talk, their answering of questions, and their expression of appreciation. After giving the people their fee, they will give us our share.” Even the faithless deities think: “We shall see their practice according to their wish.

original: sotuṃ labhissāmā”ti tathā karonti.🔽Tāvatiṃsehīti yathā hi ekasmiṃ kule ekaṃ paṇḍitaṃ manussaṃ, ekasmiñca vihāre ekaṃ🔽bahussutaṃ bhikkhuṃ upādāya “asukakule manussā paṇḍitā, asukavihāre bhikkhū bahussutā”ti
analyzed: sotum labhissāma iti tathā karonti  tāvatiṃsehi iti yathā hi ekasmin kule ekam paṇḍitam manussam ekasmin ca vihāre ekam  bahussutam bhikkhum upādāya asuka kule manussāḥ paṇḍitāḥ asuka vihāre bhikkhū bahu ssutā ti
translated: Why? Because the faithful think thus: “Here people, when building a dwelling, will first seat the community of bhikkhus and will have them utter a blessing, and then we shall have the opportunity to see the virtuous ones and to hear the Dhamma talk and the answering of questions and the expression of appreciation. They will give to the people what they have received from us and will give us what they have received from others.” And the faithless deities also do so, thinking: “We shall have the opportunity to see their practice according to their wishes and to hear their talk.”

original: saddo abbhuggacchati, evamevaṃ sakkaṃ devarājānaṃ vissakammañca devaputtaṃ upādāya
analyzed: saddaḥ abbhuk gacchati evam evam sakkam devarājānam vissakammam ca devaputtam upādāya
translated: As to “among the Thirty-three”: just as in the case of a family in which one person is clever, the word gets about, “People in such-and-such a family are clever,” and in the case of a monastery in which one bhikkhu is learned, the word gets about, “Bhikkhus in such-and-such a monastery are learned,” so too, because of Sakka Ruler of Gods and the deity Vissakamma,

original: “tāvatiṃsā paṇḍitā”ti saddo abbhuggato. Tenāha “tāvatiṃsehī”ti. Seyyathāpītiādinā
analyzed: tāvatiṃsā paṇḍitā ati saddo abbhuggataḥ tena āha tāvatiṃsehi iti sā iyyathā api itiādinā
translated: “The Thirty-Three are wise” was the word that went round. Hence the words “the Thirty-Three.”

original: devehi tāvatiṃsehi saddhiṃ mantetvā viya sunidhavassakārā nagaraṃ māpentīti dasseti.
analyzed: devehi tāvatiṃsehi saddhim mantetvā viya sunidha vassakārāḥ nagaram māpenti iti dasseti
translated: With the words “Just as if” he shows that they built the city as if they had consulted with the Thirty-Three gods.🔽As far as the noble resort

original: Yāvatā ariyaṃ āyatananti yattakaṃ ariyamanussānaṃ osaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ nāma atthi. Yāvatā🔽vaṇippathoti yattakaṃ vāṇijānaṃ āhaṭabhaṇḍassa rāsivaseneva kayavikkayaṭṭhānaṃ nāma,
analyzed: yāvatā ariyam āyatanam ti yattakam ariya manussānam osaraṇa ṭhānam nāma atthi yāvatā  vaṇippatho ti yattakam vāṇijānam āhaṭa bhaṇḍassa rāsi vasena iva kaya vikkaya ṭṭhānam nāma
translated: As far as the noble resort, that is, as far as there is a place for the descent of noble people.🔽As far as the trade-route

original: vāṇijānaṃ vasanaṭṭhānaṃ vā atthi. Idaṃ agganagaranti tesaṃ ariyāyatanavaṇippathānaṃ
analyzed: vāṇijānam vasana ṭṭhānam vā atthi idam agga nagaram ti tesam ariya āyatana vaṇippathānam
translated: As far as there is a place for the buying and selling of goods brought by merchants, as if it were a city of the merchants themselves.🔽This city will be the best

original: idaṃ nagaraṃ aggaṃ bhavissati jeṭṭhakaṃ pāmokkhaṃ. Puṭabhedananti bhaṇḍapuṭabhedanaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: idam nagaram aggam bhavissati jeṭṭhakam pāmokkham puṭabhedanam ti bhaṇḍa puṭabhedana ṭhānaṃ
translated: This city will be the best, the foremost, the most excellent of all those noble resorts and trade-routes.🔽The place for opening bales

original: bhaṇḍaganthikānaṃ mocanaṭṭhānanti vuttaṃ hoti. Sakalajambudīpe aladdhabhaṇḍampi hi
analyzed: bhaṇḍa ganthikānam mocana ṭṭhānan ti vuttam hoti sakala jambudīpe a laddha bhaṇḍam pi hi
translated: The place for opening bales, that is, the place for unfastening the bundles of goods. For even goods not obtained in the whole of India

original: idheva labhissati, aññattha vikkayaṃ agacchantampi idha vikkayaṃ gacchissati, tasmā
analyzed: idha iva labhissati aññattha vikkayam a gacchantam pi idha vikkayam gacchissati tasmā
translated: will be obtained here, and goods coming here for sale from other places will be sold here. Therefore

original: idheva puṭaṃ bhindissatīti attho. Āyanti yāni catūsu dvāresu cattāri, sabhāyaṃ ekanti
analyzed: idha iva puṭam bhindissati iti atthaḥ āyanti yāni catūsu dvāresu cattāri sabhāyam ekanti
translated: The “approaches” are the four that come from the four gates and the one in the assembly hall.

original: evaṃ divase divase pañcasatasahassāni tattha uṭṭhahissanti, tānissa bhāvīni āyāni
analyzed: evam divase divase pañca sata sahassāni tattha uṭṭhahissanti tāni issa bhāvīni āyāni
translated: Thus five hundred thousand approaches will arise there every day. He shows that they will be his future “approaches.”

original: dasseti. Aggito vātiādīsu ca-kārattho vā-saddo, agginā ca udakena ca mithubhedena
analyzed: dassa iti aggitaḥ vā ati ādīsu cakāra atthaḥ vā saddaḥ agginā ca udakena ca mithu bhedena
translated: In the phrases “from fire” and so on, the word “and” is used in the sense of “or.” The meaning is, it will be destroyed by fire, water, and dissension.

original: ca nassissatīti attho. Tassa hi eko koṭṭhāso agginā nassissati, nibbāpetumpi naṃ🔽na sakkhissati, ekaṃ koṭṭhāsaṃ gaṅgā gahetvā gamissati, eko iminā akathitaṃ amussa,
analyzed: ca nassissati iti attho tassa hi ekaḥ koṭṭhāsaḥ agginā nassissati nibbāpetum pi naṃ  na sakkhissati ekam koṭṭhāsam gaṅgā gahetvā gamissati ekaḥ iminā a kathitam amussa
translated: For one part of it will be destroyed by fire, and it will not be possible to extinguish the fire;

original: amunā akathitaṃ imassa vadantānaṃ pisuṇavācānaṃ vasena bhinnānaṃ manussānaṃ aññamaññabhedena vinassissati.
analyzed: amunā a kathitam imassa vadantānam pisuṇa vācānam vasena bhinnānam manussānam aññamañña bhedena vinassissati
translated: one part will be carried off by the Ganges; and one part will be destroyed by the dissension of men who are divided by slanderers who say, “He did not tell this to that one,” “He did not tell that to this one.”

original: Evaṃ vatvā bhagavā paccūsakāle gaṅgātīraṃ gantvā katamukhadhovano bhikkhācārakālaṃ
analyzed: evam vatvā bhagavā paccūsa kāle gaṅgā tīram gantvā kata mukha dhovanaḥ bhikkhācāra kālam
translated: After saying this, the Blessed One went to the bank of the Ganges at dawn, washed his face, and sat down waiting for the time to go for alms.

original: āgamayamāno nisīdi. Sunidhavassakārāpi “amhākaṃ rājā samaṇassa gotamassa upaṭṭhāko,
analyzed: āgamayamānaḥ nisīdi amhākam rājā samaṇassa gotamassa upaṭṭhāko
translated: Sunīdha and Vassakāra thought, “Our king is a supporter of the ascetic Gotama,

original: so amhe upagate pucchissati ‘satthā kira pāṭaligāmaṃ agamāsi, kiṃ tassa santikaṃ🔽upasaṅkamittha, na upasaṅkamitthā’ti, ‘upasaṅkamimhā’ti ca vutte ‘nimantayittha,
analyzed: so amhe upagate pucchissati satthā kira pāṭaligāmam agamāsi kim tassa santikam  upasaṅkamittha na upasaṅkamittha ati upasaṅkamimha ati ca vutte nimantayittha
translated: “When we have approached him, he will ask us, ‘The Teacher has come to Pāṭali Village, it seems. Did you approach him🔽or not?’ If we say, ‘We approached him,’ he will ask, ‘Did you invite him

original: na nimantayitthā’ti pucchissati, ‘na nimantayimhā’ti ca vutte amhākaṃ dosaṃ āropetvā
analyzed: na nimantayittha ati pucchissati na nimantayimha ati ca vutte amhākam dosam āropetvā
translated: or not?’ If we say, ‘We did not invite him,’ he will accuse us of a fault

original: niggaṇhissati, idañcāpi mayaṃ akataṭṭhāne nagaraṃ māpema, samaṇassa kho pana gotamassa
analyzed: niggaṇhissati idam ca api mayam a kata ṭṭhāne nagaram māpema samaṇassa kho pana gotamassa
translated: and will punish us. Moreover, we are having the city built in a place where no one has built before. But wherever the recluse Gotama goes,

original: gatagataṭṭhāne kāḷakaṇṇisattā paṭikkamanti, taṃ mayaṃ nagaramaṅgalaṃ vācāpessāmā”ti
analyzed: gata gata ṭṭhāne kāḷakaṇṇi sattā paṭikkamanti tam mayam nagara maṅgalam vācāpessāma ati
translated: black cobras flee before him. We will therefore proclaim the city auspicious.”

original: cintetvā satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā nimantayiṃsu. Tena vuttaṃ “atha kho sunidhavassakārā”tiādi.🔽Pubbaṇhasamayanti pubbaṇhakāle. Nivāsetvāti gāmappavesananīhārena nivāsanaṃ nivāsetvā
analyzed: cintetvā satthāram upasaṅkamitvā nimantayiṃsu tena vuttam atha kho sunidha vassaka arāti ādi  pubbaṇha samayam ti pubbaṇha kāle nivāsetvā ati gāma ppavesana nīhārena nivāsanam nivāsetvā
translated: Having thus reflected, they approached the Teacher and invited him. Hence it is said, “Then Sunīdha and Vassakāra” and so forth.🔽In the morning time: in the morning. Having dressed: having put on his sarong in the manner suitable for going into a village.

original: kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā. Pattacīvaramādāyāti pattañca cīvarañca ādiyitvā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ
analyzed: kāya bandhanam bandhitvā patta cīvaram ādāya ati pattam ca cīvaram ca ādiyitvā kāya paṭibaddham
translated: Having taken up his waistband: having fastened his waistband. Having taken his bowl and robe: having taken his bowl and robe, having made them into a bundle and fastened it to his body,

original: katvā, cīvaraṃ pārupitvā pattaṃ hatthena gahetvāti attho.
analyzed: katvā cīvaram pārupitvā pattam hatthena gahetvā ati atthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: “having taken the bowl in his hand.”

original: Sīlavantetthāti sīlavante ettha attano vasanaṭṭhāne. Saññateti kāyavācācittehi saññate.
analyzed: sīlavantā itthā ati sīlavante ettha attanaḥ vasana ṭṭhāne saññata iti kāya vācā cittehi saññate
translated: “To those who are virtuous here” means: to those who are virtuous in this place where he lives. “To those who are restrained” means: to those who are restrained in body, speech, and mind.

original: Tāsaṃ dakkhiṇamādiseti saṅghassa dinne cattāro paccaye tāsaṃ gharadevatānaṃ ādiseyyapattiṃ
analyzed: tāsam dakkhiṇam ādiseti saṅghassa dinne cattāraḥ paccaye tāsam ghara devatānam ādiseyya pattim
translated: “To those who are generous” means: to those who are generous with the four requisites.

original: dadeyya. Pūjitā pūjayantīti “ime manussā amhākaṃ ñātakāpi na honti, tathāpi no pattiṃ
analyzed: dadeyya pūjitā pūjayantī iti ime manussāḥ amhākam ñātakā api na honti tathā api no pattim
translated: “Honoured, they honour” means: “These people are not even our relatives, yet they give us requisites.🔽Let them make a good guard.” They make a good guard.

original: dentīti ārakkhaṃ susaṃvihitaṃ karothā”ti suṭṭhu ārakkhaṃ karonti. Mānitā mānayantīti🔽kālānukālaṃ balikammakaraṇena mānitā “ete manussā amhākaṃ ñātakāpi na honti, tathāpi
analyzed: denti iti ārakkham su saṃvihitam karotha ati suṭṭhu ārakkham karonti mānitāḥ mānayanti iti  kāla anukālam bali kamma karaṇena mānitāḥ ete manussāḥ amhākam ñātakāḥ api na honti tathā api
translated: “Respected, they respect” means:

original: catumāsachamāsantare no balikammaṃ karontī”ti mānenti uppannaparissayaṃ haranti.
analyzed: catu māsa cha māsa antare no bali kammam karonti iti mānenti uppanna parissayam haranti
translated: “These people are not even our relatives, yet they make an offering to us every now and then.” They respect them, they remove any arising trouble.🔽“From there” means: from there, from that wise person.

original: Tato nanti tato naṃ paṇḍitajātikaṃ manussaṃ. Orasanti ure ṭhapetvā saṃvaḍḍhitaṃ,
analyzed: tatas nanti tatas nam paṇḍita jātikam manussam ure ṭhapetvā saṃvaḍḍhitam
translated: “They carry him on their shoulders” means: they carry him on their shoulders, having raised him up,

original: yathā mātā orasaṃ puttaṃ anukampati, uppannaparissayaharaṇatthamevassa vāyamati,
analyzed: yathā mātā orasam puttam anukampati uppanna parissaya haraṇa attham eva assa vā āyamati
translated: Just as a mother out of compassion for her child, who is dear to her, strives to remove any discomfort that has arisen,

original: evaṃ anukampantīti attho. Bhadrāni passatīti sundarāni passati.
analyzed: evam anukampanti iti atthaḥ bhadrāni passati iti sundarāni passati
translated: so too does she look on with compassion. The meaning is that she looks on with compassion. She sees what is good: she sees what is beautiful.

original: Anumoditvāti tehi tadā pasutapuññassa anumodanavasena tesaṃ dhammakathaṃ katvā. Sunidhavassakārāpi
analyzed: anumoditvā ti tehi tadā pasuta puññassa anumodana vasena tesam dhamma katham katvā
translated: Having rejoiced: having rejoiced in the merit they had then produced by listening to the Dhamma talk he gave them. Sunidha and Vassakara

original: “yā tattha devatā āsuṃ, tāsaṃ dakkhiṇamādise”ti bhagavato vacanaṃ sutvā devatānaṃ
analyzed: yāḥ tattha devatāḥ āsum tāsam dakkhiṇam ādisa iti bhagavataḥ vacanam sutvā devatānam
translated: also, having heard the Blessed One’s words, “The deities that are there, to them he should give the offering,” gave the offering to the deities.

original: pattiṃ adaṃsu. Taṃ gotamadvāraṃ nāma ahosīti tassa nagarassa yena dvārena bhagavā
analyzed: pattim tam gotamadvāram nāma ahosi iti tassa nagarassa yena dvārena bhagavā
translated: That gate was called the Gotama Gate. The gate of the city by which the Blessed One went out

original: nikkhami, taṃ gotamadvāraṃ nāma ahosi. Gaṅgāya pana uttaraṇatthaṃ anotiṇṇattā gotamatitthaṃ🔽nāma nāhosi. Pūrāti puṇṇā. Samatittikāti tīrasamaṃ udakassa tittā bharitā. Kākapeyyāti
analyzed: nikkhami tam gotamadvāram nāma ahosi gaṅgāya pana uttaraṇa attham gotamatittham  nāma nā ahosi pūrā ati puṇṇā samatittikā ati tīra samam udakassa tittā bharitā kākapeyyā iti
translated: was called the Gotama Gate. But because he did not cross the Ganges, the ford was not called the Gotama Ford.🔽Full: filled. Even with the banks: the water was even with the banks, filled up to the banks. Drinkable by crows: the water was such that crows could drink it by dipping the tip of their wings in it. By all three phrases

original: tīre ṭhitakākehi pātuṃ sakkuṇeyyaudakā. Tīhipi padehi ubhatokūlasamaṃ paripuṇṇabhāvameva
analyzed: tīre ṭhita kākehi pātum padehi ubhatas kūla samam paripuṇṇa bhāvam eva
translated: he shows that it was filled up to the banks on both sides.

original: vadati. Uḷumpanti pāragamanatthāya lahuke dārudaṇḍe gahetvā kavāṭaphalake viya aññamaññasambandhe🔽kātuṃ āṇiyo koṭṭetvā nāvāsaṅkhepena kataṃ. Kullanti veḷunaḷādike saṅgharitvā valliādīhi
analyzed: vadati uḷumpanti pāra gamana atthāya lahuke dāru daṇḍe gahetvā kavāṭa phalake viya aññamañña sambandhe  koṭṭetvā nāvā saṅkhepena katam veḷu naḷa ādike saṅgharitvā valli ādīhi
translated: He says: A raft is a raft made by putting together light pieces of wood for the purpose of crossing over, and then lashing them together with thongs.

original: kalāpavasena bandhitvā kataṃ.
analyzed: kalāpa vasena
translated: A log is a log made by collecting together bamboo, reeds, etc., and binding them together in bundles with creepers, etc.

original: Etamatthaṃ viditvāti etaṃ mahājanassa gaṅgudakamattassapi kevalaṃ tarituṃ asamatthataṃ,
analyzed: etam attham viditvā iti etam mahā janassa gaṅgā udaka mattassa api kevalam taritum
translated: Having known the meaning of this: having known in all ways the fact that the great multitude is incapable of crossing over even the mere stream of the Gaṅgā,

original: attano pana bhikkhusaṅghassa ca atigambhīravitthataṃ saṃsāramahaṇṇavaṃ taritvā ṭhitabhāvañca🔽sabbākārato viditvā tadatthaparidīpanaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi. Udānagāthāya attho pana🔽aṭṭhakathāyaṃ dassitoyeva. Tattha udakaṭṭhānassetaṃ adhivacananti yathāvuttassa yassa
analyzed: attanaḥ pana bhikkhu saṅghassa ca ati gambhīra vitthatam saṃsāra mahaṇṇavam taritvā ṭhita bhāvañca  sabba ākārataḥ viditvā tad attha paridīpanam imam udānam udānesi udāna gāthāya atthaḥ pana  aṭṭhakathā ayam tattha udakaṭṭhānassa etam adhivacanan ti yathā vuttassa yassa
translated: and the fact that he himself and the community of bhikkhus have crossed over and gone beyond the great ocean of the round of rebirths, which is very deep and wide,

original: kassaci udakaṭṭhānassa etaṃ aṇṇavanti adhivacanaṃ, na samuddassevāti adhippāyo. Saranti
analyzed: kassaci udakaṭṭhānassa etam adhivacanam na samuddassa iva ati adhippāyaḥ saranti
translated: he uttered this exalted utterance expressing that meaning. But the meaning of the stanza is shown in the commentary. Herein, this is a designation for a place of water: this is a designation for any place of water mentioned above, not only for the ocean, is the intention. They go🔽.

original: idha nadī adhippetā sarati sandatīti katvā. Gambhīraṃ vitthatanti agādhaṭṭhena gambhīraṃ,
analyzed: idha nadī adhippetā sarati sandati iti katvā gambhīram vitthatanti agādha ṭṭhena gambhīram
translated: It is deep and wide in the sense of unfathomable,🔽and it is wide in the sense of pervading the whole triple world.

original: sakalalokattayabyāpitāya vitthataṃ. Visajjāti anāsajja appatvā eva pallalāni tesaṃ
analyzed: sakala loka ttaya byāpitāya vitthatam visajjāti an āsajja a patvā eva pallalāni
translated: It is unfordable because it cannot be crossed without a raft.🔽For people make an effort to bind a raft,

original: ataraṇato. Kullañhi jano bandhatīti kullaṃ bandhituṃ āyāsaṃ āpajjati. Vinā eva kullenāti🔽īdisaṃ udakaṃ kullena īdisena vinā eva. Tiṇṇā medhāvino janāti ariyamaggañāṇasaṅkhātāya
analyzed: a taraṇataḥ kullam hi janaḥ bandhati iti kullam bandhitum āyāsam āpajjati vinā eva kullena ati  īdisam udakam kullena īdisena vinā eva tiṇṇā medhāvinaḥ janāti ariya magga ñāṇa saṅkhātāya
translated: and they make an effort to cross the water by means of a raft.🔽The wise who have crossed over by the raft

original: medhāya samannāgatattā medhāvino buddhā ca buddhasāvakā ca tiṇṇā paratīre patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: medhāya samannāgata ttāḥ medhāvinaḥ buddhā ca buddha sāvakā ca tiṇṇā para tīre patiṭṭhitā
translated: The wise are the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples. They have crossed over to the further shore and are established there because they possess the wisdom called the noble path.

original: Sunidhavassakāravatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sunidha vassakāra vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The story of Sunīdha and Vassakāra is finished.

original: Koṭigāme saccakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: koṭigāme sacca kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the story of the truth

original: 287. Koṭigāmoti mahāpanādassa rañño pāsādakoṭiyaṃ katagāmo, patitassa pāsādassa thupikāya
analyzed: koṭigāmo ti mahāpanādassa rañño pāsāda koṭiyam kata gāmo patitassa pāsādassa thupikāya
translated: Koṭigāma is a village built on the tip of a palace belonging to King Mahāpanāda. The meaning is that it is a village built on the site where the palace fell down.

original: patiṭṭhitaṭṭhāne niviṭṭhagāmoti attho. Ariyasaccānanti ye paṭivijjhanti, tesaṃ ariyabhāvakarānaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhita ṭṭhāne niviṭṭha gāmaḥ ti attho ariya saccānam ti ye paṭivijjhanti tesam ariya bhāva karānam
translated: The noble truths are the truths that cause the noble ones.

original: saccānaṃ. Ananubodhāti abujjhanena ajānanena. Appaṭivedhāti appaṭivijjhanena. Anubodho🔽cettha pubbabhāgiyañāṇaṃ, paṭivedho maggañāṇena abhisamayo. Tattha yasmā anubodhapubbako🔽paṭivedho anubodhena vinā na hoti, anubodhopi ekacco paṭivedhasambandho tadubhayābhāvahetukañca
analyzed: saccānam an anubodhā ati a bujjhanena a jānanena appaṭivedhā ati a paṭivijjhanena anubodhaḥ  ca ittha pubbabhāgiya ñāṇam paṭivedhaḥ magga ñāṇena abhisamayaḥ tattha yasmai anubodha pubbako  paṭivedhaḥ anubodhena vinā na hoti anubodhaḥ api ekaccaḥ paṭivedha sambandho tad ubhaya abhāva hetukañca
translated: ‘Non-penetration’ is non-penetration by non-awakening, by non-knowing. ‘Penetration’ is penetration by the knowledge of the path. Herein, the knowledge of the prior stage is ‘non-penetration’;🔽the penetration by the knowledge of the path is ‘penetration.’ Herein, since penetration is preceded by non-penetration, it is not without non-penetration; and since some non-penetration is associated with penetration, and some non-penetration is not,🔽

original: vaṭṭe saṃsaraṇaṃ, tasmā vuttaṃ “ananubodhā…pe… tumhākañcā”ti. Tattha sandhāvitanti🔽paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena bhavato bhavantarupagamanena sandhāvitaṃ. Saṃsaritanti aparāparaṃ🔽cavanupapajjanavasena saṃsaritaṃ. Mamañceva tumhākañcāti mayā ca tumhehi ca. Atha🔽vā sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritanti sandhāvanaṃ saṃsaraṇaṃ mamañceva tumhākañca ahosīti evamettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: vaṭṭe saṃsaraṇam tasmā vuttam tumhākam ca ati tattha sandhāvitam ti 🔽paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena bhavataḥ bhavantar upagamanena sandhāvitam apara aparam 🔽saṃsaritam maman ca iva tumhākam ca ati mayā ca tumhehi ca atha 🔽vā sandhāvitam saṃsaritanti sandhāvanam saṃsaraṇam mamañca iva tumhākam ca ahosi iti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: and of the Truths. Because of non-penetration: because of non-awakening, because of non-knowing. Because of non-comprehending: because of non-comprehending, because of non-penetrating. Herein, penetration is knowledge of the path. That is so because penetration is preceded by non-penetration, because there is no penetration without non-penetration, and because the round of rebirths is due to the absence of both. That is why it is said: “Because of non-penetration … and yours” . Herein, I have wandered: I have wandered on by way of rebirth-linking from existence to existence. I have gone round: I have gone round by way of dying here and being reborn there. Mine and yours: by me and by you. Or alternatively, I have wandered, I have gone round: the wandering, the going round, was by me and by you. This is how the meaning should be understood here.

original: Saṃsitanti saṃsaritaṃ. Bhavanetti samūhatāti dīgharajjuyā baddhasakuṇaṃ viya rajjuhattho
analyzed: saṃsitam ti saṃsaritam dīgha rajjuyā baddha sakuṇam viya rajju hatthaḥ
translated: “It is rolled up” means it is rolled up. “The guide to becoming is destroyed” means that like a bird tied with a long string, the string is pulled out from the bird’s beak.

original: puriso desantaraṃ, taṇhārajjuyā baddhasattasantānaṃ abhisaṅkhāro bhavantaraṃ neti🔽etāyāti bhavanetti, sā bhavato bhavaṃ nayanasamatthā taṇhārajju ariyamaggasatthena
analyzed: purisaḥ desantaram taṇhā rajjuyā baddha satta santānam abhisaṅkhāraḥ bhavantaram na iti  sā bhavataḥ bhavam nayana samatthā taṇhā rajju ariya magga satthena
translated: “The guide to becoming is destroyed” : just as a man with a rope in his hand leads a bird bound with a long rope from one place to another, so too, the guide to becoming leads the continuity of beings bound with the rope of craving from one becoming to another.

original: suṭṭhu hatā chinnā appavattikatāti bhavanetti samūhatā.
analyzed: suṭṭhu hatā chinnā appavattika tā ati samūha tā
translated: “The guide to becoming” is craving, which is capable of leading from becoming to becoming. That guide to becoming is “destroyed” by the noble path’s sword, cut down, made incapable of functioning.

original: Ambapālīvatthukathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The story of Ambapālī

original: 288. Yānassa bhūmīti yattha sakkā hoti yānaṃ āruyha yānena gantuṃ, ayaṃ yānassa bhūmi nāma. Yānā paccorohitvāti vihārassa bahidvārakoṭṭhake yānato orohitvā.
analyzed: yānassa bhūmi iti yattha sakkā hoti yānam āruyha yānena gantum ayam yānassa bhūmi nāma yānā paccorohitvā ati vihārassa bahi dvāra koṭṭhake yānataḥ orohitvā
translated: “Ground for a vehicle”: a place where it is possible to go by vehicle after mounting it. This is called “ground for a vehicle.” “Having alighted from the vehicle”: having descended from the vehicle at the outer door of the monastery.

original: Licchavīvatthukathāvaṇṇanā🔽289. Nīlāti idaṃ sabbasaṅgāhakavacanaṃ. Nīlavaṇṇātiādi tasseva vibhāgadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: licchavī vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā  nīlā ati idam sabba saṅgāhaka vacanam nīla vaṇṇa ati ādi tassa iva vibhāga dassana tham
translated: The story of the Licchavīs🔽“Blue”: this is a comprehensive statement. “Blue-dyed” and so on are given in order to show its analysis.

original: Tattha na tesaṃ pakativaṇṇo nīlo, nīlavilepanavilittattā panetaṃ vuttaṃ. Nīlavatthāti
analyzed: tattha na tesam pakati vaṇṇaḥ nīlaḥ nīla vilepana vilitta ttā pana itam vuttam nīla vatthā ati
translated: Herein, their natural color is not blue, but this is said because they are smeared with blue dye.

original: paṭadukūlakoseyyādīnipi nesaṃ nīlāneva honti. Nīlālaṅkārāti nīlamaṇialaṅkārehi nīlapupphehi
analyzed: paṭa dukūla koseyya ādīni pi honti nīla alaṅkārā ati nīla maṇi alaṅkārehi nīla pupphehi
translated: Their upper robes, lower robes, and so on, were blue only. They were adorned with blue ornaments, with blue gems and with blue flowers.

original: ca alaṅkatā. Te kira alaṅkārā suvaṇṇavicittāpi indanīlamaṇiobhāsehi ekanīlā viya
analyzed: ca alaṅkatā te kira alaṅkārā eka nīlā
translated: Their ornaments, though made of various kinds of gold, appeared as if they were all of sapphire,

original: khāyanti, rathāpi nesaṃ nīlamaṇikhacitā nīlavatthaparikkhittā nīladhajanīlavammikehi🔽nīlābharaṇehi nīlaassehi yuttā, patodayaṭṭhiyopi nīlāyevāti iminā nayena sabbapadesu
analyzed: khāyanti rathāḥ api nesam nīla maṇi khacitāḥ nīla vattha parikkhittāḥ nīla dhaja nīla vammikehi  nīla ābharaṇehi nīla assehi yuttā nīlāya iva ati iminā nayena sabba padesu
translated: and their chariots were covered with blue cloth and surrounded by blue railings, with blue flags and banners,

original: attho veditabbo. Paṭivaṭṭesīti pahari. Kissa je ambapālīti je-ti ālapanaṃ, bhoti
analyzed: atthaḥ veditabbaḥ paṭivaṭṭesi iti ambapālī iti jeti ālapanam bhoti
translated: and yoked to blue horses. Their whips and goads were blue only. The meaning should be understood in this way in all instances. He struck them back : he struck them. Why, Ambapali? : why, Ambapali?🔽The word je is a form of address. She said:

original: ambapāli kiṃkāraṇāti vuttaṃ hoti. Sāhāranti ettha āharanti imasmā rājapurisā balinti🔽āhāro, tabbhuttajanapado. Tena sahitaṃ sāhāraṃ, sajanapadanti attho. Aṅguliṃ phoṭesunti
analyzed: ambapāli kiṃkāraṇā iti vuttam hoti sa āhāram ettha āharanti imasmai rāja purisāḥ  āhāraḥ tad bhutta janapadaḥ tena sahitam sa āhāram sa janapadam ti atthaḥ aṅgulim phoṭesunti
translated: The king’s men are taking away the food and the people.🔽The word āhāra is derived from the root hr , to take away. It means the people who eat the food. The compound sāhāra is to be analysed as sahāraṃ, with the people.🔽They snapped their fingers : they moved their fingers.

original: aṅguliṃ cālesuṃ. Ambakāyāti mātugāmena. Upacāravacanañhetaṃ, itthīsu yadidaṃ ambakā
analyzed: aṅgulim ambakāyāti mātu gāmena itthīsu yat idam
translated: The word ambakā is a term of address for a woman.

original: mātugāmo jananikāti. Olokethāti passatha. Apalokethāti apavattitvā oloketha, punappunaṃ🔽passathāti attho. Upasaṃharathāti upanetha, imaṃ licchavīparisaṃ tumhākaṃ cittena
analyzed: mātugāmaḥ jananikā ati oloketha ati passatha apaloketha ati apavattitvā oloketha punappunaṃ  passatha ati atthaḥ upasaṃharatha ati upanetha imam licchavī parisam tumhākam cittena
translated: A woman is a woman. Look at her: see her. Look at her again and again:

original: tāvatiṃsasadisaṃ upasaṃharatha upanetha allīyāpetha. Yatheva tāvatiṃsā abhirūpā pāsādikā
analyzed: tāvatiṃsa sadisam upasaṃharatha upanetha yathā iva tāvatiṃsā abhirūpā pāsādikā
translated: look at her again and again, is the meaning. Bring her to mind: bring her to mind as being like the Thirty-Three Gods, bring her to mind as being like them, bring her to mind as being equal to them. Just as the Thirty-Three Gods are comely, graceful,

original: nīlādinānāvaṇṇā, evamime licchavīrājānopīti tāvatiṃsehi samake katvā passathāti attho.
analyzed: nīla ādi nānā vaṇṇāḥ evam ime licchavī rājānaḥ api iti tāvatiṃsehi samake katvā passatha ati attho
translated: blue-black-skinned, etc., so too are these Licchavi princes. Look at her as being equal to the Thirty-Three Gods, is the meaning.

original: Kasmā pana bhagavā anekasatehi suttehi cakkhādīnaṃ rūpādīsu nimittaggāhaṃ paṭisedhetvā
analyzed: kasmā pana bhagavā aneka satehi suttehi cakkha ādīnam rūpa ādīsu nimitta ggāham paṭisedhetvā
translated: But why does the Blessed One, after in many hundreds of suttas forbidding the taking of a sign in visible objects, etc.,

original: idha mahantena ussāhena nimittaggāhe niyojetīti? Hitakāmatāya tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ yathā
analyzed: idha mahantena ussāhena nimitta ggāhe niyojeti iti hita kāma tāya tesam bhikkhūnam yathā
translated: here urge them to take a sign with great insistence? Because of his desire for their welfare, since it was for the sake of their welfare

original: āyasmato nandassa hitakāmatāya saggasampattidassanatthaṃ. Tatra kira ekacce bhikkhū
analyzed: āyasmataḥ nandassa hita kāma tāya sagga sampatti dassana attham tatra kira ekacce bhikkhū
translated: that the venerable Nandaka showed the excellence of the Brahmā-world. For it seems that some bhikkhus there had slackened their energy,

original: osannavīriyā, te sampattiyā palobhento “appamādena samaṇadhammaṃ karontānaṃ evarūpā
analyzed: osanna vīriyā te sampattiyā palobhentaḥ appamādena samaṇa dhammam karontānam evarūpā
translated: and in order to stimulate them he said: “Those who do the recluse’s duty by diligence have such excellence as this.

original: issariyasampatti sulabhā”ti samaṇadhamme ussāhajananatthaṃ āha. Atha vā nayidaṃ nimittaggāhe
analyzed: issariya sampatti sulabhāti samaṇa dhamme ussāha janana attham āha atha vā nayidam nimitta ggāhe
translated: He said this in order to arouse zeal for the life of a recluse.

original: niyojanaṃ, kevalaṃ pana “dibbasampattisadisā etesaṃ rājūnaṃ issariyasampattī”ti anupubbikathāya
analyzed: niyojanam kevalam pana dibba sampatti sadisā etesam rājūnam issariya sampatti iti anupubbi kathāya
translated: Or else, this is not an injunction to grasp the sign; it is merely a statement of the succession of the kings’ prosperity, which is like the prosperity of the devas,🔽like the statement of the succession of the devas’ prosperity.

original: sampattikathanaṃ viya daṭṭhabbaṃ. Aniccalakkhaṇavibhāvanatthañcāpi evamāha. Na cirasseva
analyzed: sampatti kathanam viya daṭṭhabbam anicca lakkhaṇa vibhāvana attham ca api evam āha na cirassa eva
translated: He said this also in order to demonstrate the characteristic of impermanence,🔽for all these kings will soon come to destruction through Ajātasattu.

original: hi sabbepime ajātasattussa vasena vināsaṃ pāpuṇissanti, atha nesaṃ rajjasirisampattiṃ🔽disvā ṭhitabhikkhū “tathārūpāyapi nāma sirisampattiyā vināso paññāyissatī”ti aniccalakkhaṇaṃ🔽bhāvetvā saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattaṃ pāpuṇissantīti aniccalakkhaṇavibhāvanatthaṃ āha.
analyzed: hi sabbe pi me ajāta sattussa vasena vināsam pāpuṇissanti atha nesam rajja siri sampattim  disvā ṭhita bhikkhū nāma siri sampattiyā vināso paññāyissati iti anicca lakkhaṇam  bhāvetvā saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattam pāpuṇissanti iti anicca lakkhaṇa vibhāvana attham āha
translated: Then, seeing the prosperity and glory of their kingship,🔽the bhikkhus who are present will discern the characteristic of impermanence thus: “Even such prosperity and glory will come to destruction.”🔽And having discerned the characteristic of impermanence, they will attain arahantship together with the analytical knowledges.

original: Adhivāsetūti ambapāliyā nimantitabhāvaṃ ñatvāpi kasmā nimantentīti? Asaddahanatāya
analyzed: adhivāsetu uti ambapāliyāḥ nimantita bhāvam ñatvā api kasmai nimantenti iti asat dahana tāya
translated: “May the Blessed One consent”: although he already knew that Ambapali had invited him,

original: ca vattasīsena ca. Sā hi dhuttā itthī animantetvāpi “nimantesi”nti vadeyyāti tesaṃ
analyzed: ca vatta sīsena ca sā hi dhuttā itthī a nimantetvā api nimantesinti vadeyyāti tesam
translated: and by the custom of the country. For that woman was a prostitute, and she might say, “He invited me” even though he had not invited her.

original: ahosi. Dhammaṃ sutvā gamanakāle ca nimantetvā gamanaṃ nāma manussānaṃ vattameva.
analyzed: ahosi dhammam sutvā gamana kāle ca nimantetvā gamanam nāma manussānam vattam eva
translated: But it is the custom of the people of the country to invite her when they go after hearing the Dhamma.

original: Licchavīvatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: licchavī vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the story of the Licchavīs is finished.

original: Sīhasenāpativatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sīha senāpati vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the story of the general Sīhabāhu🔽is finished.

original: 290. Abhiññātāti ñātā paññātā pākaṭā. Santhāgāreti mahājanassa santhambhanāgāre vissamanatthāya
analyzed: abhiññātā ati ñātā paññātā pākaṭā santhāgāre iti mahājanassa santhambhana āgāre vissamana atthāya

analyzed: kate agāre sā kira santhā āgāra sālā nagara majjhe ahosi catūsu dvāresu ṭhitānam paññāyati
translated: built for the purpose. It seems that the assembly hall was in the middle of the city, and could be seen from the four gates.

analyzed: catūhi disāhi āgata manussā paṭhamam tattha vissamitvā pacchā attano attano phāsuka ṭṭhānam

original: gacchanti. Rājakulānaṃ rajjakiccasantharaṇatthaṃ kataṃ agārantipi vadantiyeva. Tattha
analyzed: gacchanti rāja kulānam rajja kicca santharaṇa attham katam

original: hi nisīditvā licchavīrājāno rajjakiccaṃ santharanti karonti vicārenti. Sannisinnāti
analyzed: hi nisīditvā licchavī rājānaḥ rajja kiccam santharanti karonti vicārenti
translated: For there the Licchavī kings sat down, discussed, decided, and deliberated on state affairs. Sitting

original: tesaṃ nisīdanatthaṃyeva paññattesu mahārahapaccattharaṇesu samussitasetacchattesu🔽āsanesu sannisinnā. Anekapariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantīti rājakulakiccañceva
analyzed: tesam nisīdana tthaṃyeva paññattesu mahā raha paccattharaṇesu samussita seta chattesu  āsanesu sannisinnāḥ aneka pariyāyena buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsanti iti rāja kula kiccam ca iva
translated: and they were seated on couches with white sunshades set over them, which had been prepared for them to sit on.🔽They were praising the Buddha in many ways.

original: lokatthakiriyañca vicāretvā anekehi kāraṇehi buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti. Paṇḍitā hi
analyzed: lokattha kiriyam ca vicāretvā anekehi kāraṇehi buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsanti paṇḍitāḥ hi
translated: They were discussing the duties of the royal household and the welfare of the world, and they were praising the Buddha in many ways.🔽For these kings were wise,

original: te rājāno saddhāsampannā sotāpannāpi sakadāgāminopi anāgāminopi ariyasāvakā, te sabbepi
analyzed: te rājāno saddhā sampannā sotāpannā api sakadāgāminaḥ pi anāgāminaḥ api ariyasāvakā te sabbe pi

original: lokiyajaṭaṃ bhinditvā buddhādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ ratanānaṃ vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.
analyzed: lokiya jaṭam bhinditvā buddha ādīnam tiṇṇam ratanānam vaṇṇam bhāsanti
translated: They had all broken the world’s bonds and were praising the three jewels, the Buddha and the rest.

original: Tattha tividho buddhavaṇṇo nāma cariyavaṇṇo sarīravaṇṇo guṇavaṇṇoti. Tatrime rājāno🔽cariyāya vaṇṇaṃ ārabhiṃsu – “dukkaraṃ vata kataṃ sammāsambuddhena kappasatasahassādhikāni
analyzed: tattha tividhaḥ buddha vaṇṇaḥ nāma cariya vaṇṇaḥ sarīra vaṇṇaḥ guṇa vaṇṇo ti tatrime rājānaḥ  cariyāya vaṇṇam ārabhiṃsu dukkaram vata katam sammāsambuddhena kappa sata sahassa adhikāni
translated: Herein, the praise of the Buddha is threefold, namely, praise of his conduct, praise of his body, and praise of his special qualities.

original: cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni dasa pāramiyo dasa upapāramiyo dasa paramatthapāramiyoti samatiṃsa
analyzed: cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni dasa pāramiyaḥ dasa upapāramiyaḥ dasa paramattha pāramiyaḥ ti samatiṃsa
translated: These kings began with praise of his conduct: “How difficult it was for the Perfect Buddha to achieve! For four incalculables and a hundred thousand great eons he fulfilled the ten perfections, the ten great perfections, and the ten ultimate perfections, making thirty perfections in all.

original: pāramiyo pūrentena ñātatthacariyaṃ lokatthacariyaṃ buddhatthacariyaṃ matthakaṃ pāpetvā
analyzed: pāramiyaḥ pūrentena ñāta ttha cariyam loka ttha cariyam buddha ttha cariyam matthakam pāpetvā
translated: and the practice of the knowledge of the perfections, the practice of the benefit of the world, and the practice of the benefit of the Buddha,

original: pañca mahāpariccāge pariccajantenā”ti aḍḍhacchakkehi jātakasatehi buddhavaṇṇaṃ kathentā
analyzed: pañca mahāpariccāge pariccajantena ati aḍḍhacchakkehi jātaka satehi buddha vaṇṇam kathentā

original: tusitabhavanaṃ pāpetvā ṭhapayiṃsu. Dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantā panete “bhagavatā dhammo
analyzed: tusitabhavanam pāpetvā ṭhapayiṃsu dhammassa vaṇṇam bhāsantā pana ite bhagavatā dhammo
translated: But when they were speaking about the Dhamma, they said: “The Dhamma was taught by the Blessed One,

original: desito, nikāyato pañca nikāyā honti, piṭakato tīṇi piṭakāni, aṅgato nava aṅgāni,
analyzed: desitaḥ nikāyataḥ pañca nikāyāḥ honti piṭakataḥ tīṇi piṭakāni aṅgataḥ nava aṅgāni
translated: and in terms of the collection there are five collections, in terms of the basket there are three baskets, in terms of the section there are nine sections,

original: khandhato caturāsītidhammakkhandhasahassānī”ti koṭṭhāsavasena dhammaguṇaṃ kathayiṃsu.
analyzed: khandhato caturāsīti dhammakkhandha sahassāni iti koṭṭhāsa vasena dhamma guṇam kathayiṃsu
translated: and in terms of the aggregate there are eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dhamma.”

original: Saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantā “satthu dhammadesanaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddhā kulaputtā
analyzed: saṅghassa vaṇṇam bhāsantā satthu dhamma desanam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhā kula puttā
translated: And when they were speaking about the Saṅgha, they said: “The sons of good family who, after hearing the Blessed One’s teaching of the Dhamma, gained faith,

analyzed: bhoga kkhandham ca iva ñāti parivaṭṭam ca pahāya seta chatta auparajja senāpati seṭṭhi bhaṇḍāgārika ṭṭhānantara ādīni
translated: and after abandoning the mass of wealth and the circle of relatives, left behind the white parasol, the position of deputy king, the position of general, the position of treasurer, the position of minister, and so on,

analyzed: a gaṇayitvā nikkhamma satthu vara sāsane pabbajanti seta chattam pahāya pabbajitānam
translated: and after going forth in the Blessed One’s supreme Dispensation, left behind the white parasol,

original: bhaddiyamahārājamahākappinapukkusātiādirājapabbajitānaṃyeva buddhakāle asīti sahassāni🔽ahesuṃ, anekakoṭidhanaṃ pahāya pabbajitānaṃ pana yasakulaputtasoṇaseṭṭhiputtaraṭṭhapālaputtādīnaṃ
analyzed: bhaddiya mahārāja mahākappina pukkusa ati ādi rāja pabbajitānam yeva buddha kāle asīti sahassāni  ahesum aneka koṭi dhanam pahāya pabbajitānam pana yasa kula putta soṇa seṭṭhi putta raṭṭha pāla putta ādīnam
translated: There were eighty thousand who went forth in the Dispensation of the Buddha, such as the Great King Bhaddiya, the Great Steward Kappa, and Pukkusāti.🔽There is no limit to the number of such sons of good family as Yasa, the son of a wealthy man, the son of the merchant leader Sonaka, and the son of the merchant leader Ratthapala, who went forth in the Dispensation of the Buddha, having abandoned wealth worth many millions.

original: paricchedo natthi, evarūpā ca evarūpā ca kulaputtā satthu sāsane pabbajantī”ti pabbajjāsaṅkhepavasena
analyzed: paricchedaḥ natthi evarūpā ca evarūpā ca kula puttā satthu sāsane pabbajanti iti pabbajjā saṅkhepa vasena
translated: Such and such sons of good family went forth in the Dispensation of the Buddha.”

original: saṅghaguṇaṃ kathayiṃsu.
analyzed: saṅgha guṇam kathayiṃsu
translated: Thus they spoke in praise of the Sangha in brief, by way of the going forth.🔽Sīha the general

original: Sīho senāpatīti evaṃnāmako senāya adhipati. Vesāliyañhi satta sahassāni satta satāni
analyzed: sīhaḥ senāpati iti evaṃnāmakaḥ senāya adhipati vesāliyam hi satta sahassāni satta satāni
translated: Sīha the general was the commander of the army. In Vesali there were seven thousand, seven hundred,

analyzed: satta ca rājāno te sabbe api sannipatitvā sabbesam manam gahetvā raṭṭham vicāretuṃ
translated: and seven kings. All of them assembled together and, after winning over the minds of all, they searched for a man who was able to investigate the country.

analyzed: samattham ekam vicinatha ati vicinantā sīha rāja kumāram disvā ayam sakkhissati iti
translated: They saw Prince Sīha and thought, “He will be able to do it.”

analyzed: sanniṭṭhānam katvā tassa ratta maṇi vaṇṇa kambala pariyonaddham senāpati chattam adaṃsu
translated: They came to a decision, and they gave him the general’s parasol, which was covered with a blanket the color of a precious gem.

original: Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “sīho senāpatī”ti. Nigaṇṭhasāvakoti nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa
analyzed: tam sandhāya vuttam sīhaḥ senāpati iti nigaṇṭha sāvako ti nigaṇṭhassa nāṭa puttassa

analyzed: upāli gahapati kapilapure vappaḥ sakkaḥ vesāliyam ayam sīhaḥ senāpati iti  nisinnaḥ hoti iti sesa rājūnam pi parisāya antare āsanāni paññāpayiṃsu sīhassa pana majjhe
translated: Upāli the householder at Nāḷandā, Vappa the Sakyan at Kapilavatthu, and Sīha the general here.🔽Was seated: they prepared seats for the other kings in the midst of the assembly, but for Sīha they prepared a seat in the middle,

original: ṭhāneti tasmiṃ paññatte mahārahe rājāsane nisinno hoti. Nissaṃsayanti nibbicikicchaṃ
analyzed: ṭhāne iti tasmim paññatte mahā rahe rāja āsane nisinnaḥ hoti nissaṃsayanti nibbicikiccham
translated: in the place of honour. Seated on that magnificent royal seat,🔽without doubt: without hesitation,

original: addhā ekaṃsena. Na hete yassa vā tassa vā appesakkhassa evaṃ anekasatehi kāraṇehi vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti.🔽Yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkamīti nigaṇṭho kira nāṭaputto “sacāyaṃ sīho kassacideva
analyzed: addhā ekaṃsena na ha ete yassa vā tassa vā appesakkhassa evam aneka satehi kāraṇehi vaṇṇam bhāsanti  yena nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto tena upasaṅkamīti nigaṇṭhaḥ kira nāṭa putto sacā ayam sīhaḥ kassacid eva
translated: certainly. For they do not praise in many hundreds of ways the virtues of just anyone.

original: samaṇassa gotamassa vaṇṇaṃ kathentassa sutvā samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati,
analyzed: samaṇassa gotamassa vaṇṇam kathentassa sutvā samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati
translated: Approached the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta: it seems that the Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta thought, “If Sīha hears someone praising the virtues of the recluse Gotama, he will go to see the recluse Gotama.

original: mayhaṃ parihāni bhavissatī”ti cintetvā paṭhamataraṃyeva sīhaṃ senāpatiṃ etadavoca
analyzed: mayham bhavissati iti cintetvā paṭhamataraṃya iva sīham senāpatim etat avoca
translated: “I shall be the loser.” And he spoke thus to the general Siha:

original: “senāpati imasmiṃ loke ‘ahaṃ buddho ahaṃ buddho’ti bahū vadanti, sace tvaṃ kañci
analyzed: senāpati imasmin loke aham buddhaḥ aham buddha iti bahū vadanti sace tvam kañcid
translated: “General, in this world many people say: ‘I am a Buddha, I am a Buddha.’ If you should wish to go and see anyone,

analyzed: dassanāya upasaṅkamitu kāmo ahosi mama puccheyyāsi aham te yutta ṭṭhānañca eva pesessāmi
translated: you should ask me. I shall send you to a suitable place,

analyzed: ayutta ṭṭhānataḥ nivāressāmi iti saḥ tam katham anussaritvā sace mama pesessati gamissāmi
translated: and I shall prevent you from going to an unsuitable place.” He thought: “If he sends me, I shall go.

original: No ce, na gamissāmī”ti cintetvā yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: no ce na gamissāmi iti cintetvā yena nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto tena upasaṅkami
translated: If he does not, I shall not go.” And he approached the Nigantha Nataputta.

original: Athassa vacanaṃ sutvā nigaṇṭho mahāpabbatena viya balavasokena otthaṭo “yattha dānissāhaṃ🔽gamanaṃ na icchāmi, tattheva gantukāmo jāto, hatohamasmī”ti anattamano hutvā “paṭibāhanupāyamassa
analyzed: athassa vacanam sutvā nigaṇṭhaḥ mahā pabbatena viya balava sokena otthaṭaḥ yattha dānissa aham  gamanam naḥ icchāmi tattha iva gantu kāmaḥ jātaḥ hataḥ ham asmi iti an atta manaḥ hutvā paṭibāhana upāyam assa
translated: Then the Nigantha, having heard his words, was as if struck by a mighty thunderbolt of grief. “Where I do not wish to go,🔽there I am obliged to go. I am lost.” And he became dispirited. Thinking: “I shall find a means of preventing him from going,” he spoke thus: “What is it to you?”

original: karissāmī”ti cintetvā “kiṃ pana tva”ntiādimāha. Evaṃ vadanto carantaṃ goṇaṃ tuṇḍe
analyzed: karissāmi iti cintetvā kim pana tu anti ādim āha evam vadantaḥ carantam goṇam tuṇḍe
translated: Speaking thus, he compared the Buddha to a bull that is wandering about with a goad in his mouth.

original: paharanto viya jalamānaṃ padīpaṃ nibbāpento viya bhattabharitaṃ pattaṃ nikujjanto
analyzed: paharantaḥ viya jalamānam padīpam nibbāpentaḥ viya bhatta bharitam pattam nikujjantaḥ
translated: as if he were extinguishing a flickering lamp, or as if he were turning over a bowl full of food,

analyzed: viya ca sīhassa uppannam pītim vināsesi gamika abhisaṅkhāraḥ ti hatthi yāna ādīnam yojāpana gandha mālā di gahaṇa vasena
translated: he destroyed the joy that had arisen in the lion. The preparations for the journey: the activity that occurred by way of the yoking of the elephant-chariot, etc., and the taking of perfumes, garlands, etc.

original: pavatto payogo. So paṭippassambhīti so vūpasanto.🔽Dutiyampi khoti dutiyavārampi. Imasmiñca vāre buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantā tusitabhavanato🔽paṭṭhāya yāva mahābodhipallaṅkā dasabalassa heṭṭhā pādatalehi upari kesaggehi paricchinditvā
analyzed: pavattaḥ payogaḥ saḥ paṭippassambhi iti saḥ vūpasantaḥ  dutiyam pi kho ti dutiya vāram pi imasmin ca vāre buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsantā tusita bhavanato  paṭṭhāya yāva mahā bodhipallaṅkā dasabalassa heṭṭhā pāda talehi upari kesaggehi paricchinditvā
translated: That was pacified: that was stilled.🔽For the second time: for the second occasion. And in this section, while praising the Buddha, they described the physical beauty of the Ten-Powered One, bounded below by the soles of his feet and above by the hair of his head, by way of the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, the eighty minor characteristics, and the bodily radiance,

original: dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇaasītianubyañjanabyāmappabhāvasena sarīravaṇṇaṃ kathayiṃsu.🔽Dhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantā “ekapadepi ekabyañjanepi avakkhalitaṃ nāma natthī”ti sukathitavaseneva
analyzed: sarīra vaṇṇam kathayiṃsu  dhammassa vaṇṇam bhāsantā eka pade pi eka byañjane pi avakkhalitam nāma natthi iti su kathita vasena iva
translated: beginning from the Tusita heaven and ending with the Great Bodhi seat.🔽While praising the Dhamma, they described the excellence of the Dhamma by way of its well-spokenness, saying: “There is nothing that has been wrongly stated, not even a single syllable.”

original: dhammaguṇaṃ kathayiṃsu. Saṅghassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantā “evarūpaṃ yasasirivibhavaṃ pahāya
analyzed: dhamma guṇam kathayiṃsu saṅghassa vaṇṇam bhāsantāḥ evarūpam yasa siri vibhavam pahāya
translated: While praising the Saṅgha, they described the excellence of the Saṅgha by way of the relinquishment of such glory, fame, and wealth,

original: satthu sāsane pabbajitā na kosajjapakatikā honti, terasasu pana dhutaguṇesu paripūrakārino
analyzed: satthu sāsane pabbajitāḥ na kosajja pakatikāḥ honti terasasu pana dhuta guṇesu paripūra kārinaḥ
translated: and that those who have gone forth in the Teacher’s Dispensation are not of lazy disposition, but that they are those who fulfill the thirteen ascetic practices.

original: hutvā sattasu anupassanāsu kammaṃ karonti, aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇavibhattiyo vaḷañjentī”ti
analyzed: hutvā sattasu anupassanāsu kammam karonti aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇa vibhattiyaḥ vaḷañjenti iti
translated: and that they are those who work in the seven contemplations and who develop the thirty-eight objects of mindfulness.”

original: paṭipadāvasena saṅghaguṇe kathayiṃsu.
analyzed: paṭipadā vasena saṅgha guṇe kathayiṃsu
translated: and they spoke in praise of the Community in terms of the practice.

original: Tatiyavāre pana buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsamānā “itipi so bhagavā”ti suttantapariyāyeneva
analyzed: tatiya vāre pana buddhassa vaṇṇam bhāsamānāḥ iti pi so bhagavā iti suttanta pariyāyena iva
translated: But in the third watch, while speaking in praise of the Buddha, they spoke in praise of the Buddha’s special qualities in the way of the sutta that begins thus: “Thus indeed, that Fortunate One is … ”

original: buddhaguṇe kathayiṃsu, “svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo”tiādinā suttantapariyāyeneva dhammaguṇe,
analyzed: buddha guṇe kathayiṃsu su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ ti ādinā suttanta pariyāyena iva dhamma guṇe
translated: and they spoke in praise of the Dhamma’s special qualities in the way of the sutta that begins thus: “The Dhamma is well-expounded by the Fortunate One … ”

original: “suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho”tiādinā suttantapariyāyeneva saṅghaguṇe ca kathayiṃsu.
analyzed: suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ ti ādinā suttanta pariyāyena iva saṅgha guṇe ca kathayiṃsu
translated: and they spoke in praise of the Community’s special qualities in the way of the sutta that begins thus: “The Fortunate One’s Community of disciples are good in their practice … ”

original: Tato sīho cintesi “imesaṃ licchavīrājakulānaṃ tatiyadivasato paṭṭhāya buddhadhammasaṅghaguṇe
analyzed: tatas sīhaḥ cintesi imesam licchavī rāja kulānam tatiya divasataḥ paṭṭhāya buddha dhamma saṅgha guṇe
translated: Then Sīha thought: ‘For three days now these Licchavīs, the royal clan, have been speaking in praise of the Buddha, the Dhamma and the Community,

original: kathentānaṃ mukhaṃ nappahoti, addhā anomaguṇasamannāgato so bhagavā, imaṃ dāni uppannaṃ
analyzed: kathentānam mukham nappahoti addhā anoma guṇa samannāgataḥ saḥ bhagavā imam dāni uppannam
translated: and their faces are not tired, surely that Fortunate One has special qualities, now this thought has arisen in me,

analyzed: pītim a vijahitvā ava aham ajja sammāsambuddham passissāmi iti athassa kim hi me karissanti

analyzed: nigaṇṭhā ati vitakkaḥ udapādi tattha kim hi me karissanti iti kim nāma mayham nigaṇṭhā  karissanti apalokitāḥ vā an apalokitāḥ vā ati āpucchitāḥ vā an āpucchitāḥ vā na hi me te
translated: What can they do?” means “What can the Niganthas do for me?”🔽“Whether I ask their permission or not” means “Whether I ask their permission or not,

analyzed: āpucchitāḥ yāna vāhana sampatti issariya yasa visesam dassanti na api an āpucchitāḥ māressanti
translated: they will not show me the excellence of their vehicles, their driving, their wealth, and their power if I ask their permission, nor will they kill me if I do not ask their permission.

original: aphalaṃ etesaṃ āpucchananti adhippāyo.
analyzed: aphalam etesam āpucchanan ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning is: “Asking their permission is fruitless.”

original: Divā divassāti divassa divā majjhanhike atikkantamatte. Vesāliyā niyyāsīti yathā
analyzed: divā divassa ati divassa divā majjhanhike atikkanta matte vesāliyā niyyāsi iti yathā
translated: “In the daytime” means at midday. “He set out from Vesali” means

analyzed: hi gimha kāle deve vuṭṭhe udakam sandamānam nadim otaritvā thokam eva gantvā tiṭṭhati

analyzed: na ppavattati evam sīhassa paṭhama divase dasabalam passissāmi iti uppannāya pītiyā
translated: so too, when the thought arose in the lion on the first day, “I shall see the One of Ten Powers,”

original: nigaṇṭhena paṭibāhitakālo, yathā dutiyadivase deve vuṭṭhe udakaṃ sandamānaṃ nadiṃ
analyzed: nigaṇṭhena paṭibāhita kālaḥ yathā dutiya divase deve vuṭṭhe udakam sandamānam nadim
translated: the time when the Nigaṇṭha had turned back, just as on the second day, when the rain had stopped, the water was flowing down the stream,

analyzed: dasabalam passissāmi iti uppannāya pītiyā nigaṇṭhena paṭibāhita kālaḥ yathā tatiya divase

original: deve vuṭṭhe udakaṃ sandamānaṃ nadiṃ otaritvā purāṇapaṇṇasukkhadaṇḍakanaḷakacavarādīni🔽parikaḍḍhantaṃ vālikāpuñjaṃ bhinditvā samuddaninnameva hoti, evaṃ sīho tatiyadivase🔽tiṇṇaṃ vatthūnaṃ guṇakathaṃ sutvā uppanne pītipāmojje “aphalā nigaṇṭhā, nipphalā
analyzed: deve vuṭṭhe udakam sandamānam nadim otaritvā purāṇa paṇṇa sukkhadaṇḍaka naḷaka cavara ādīni  parikaḍḍhantam vālikā puñjam bhinditvā samudda ninnam eva hoti evam sīho tatiya divase  tiṇṇam vatthūnam guṇa katham sutvā uppanne pīti pāmojje aphalā nigaṇṭhā nipphalā
translated: after the water, having entered the river, having gone a little way, having broken through the sand-bank with the old leaves, dry sticks, grass, etc.,
