analyzed: nigaṇṭhāḥ kim me ime karissanti gamissāmaham satthu santikam ti gamanam abhinīharitvā
translated: does not flow on, was like the time when, on the third day, after the Lion had heard the praise of the three objects, and the joy and gladness had arisen, (thinking): “The Nigantha’s are fruitless, the Nigantha’s are fruitless, what can they do for me, I will go to the Teacher”, and after he had set out,

original: vesāliyā niyyāsi. Niyyanto ca “cirassāhaṃ dasabalassa santikaṃ gantukāmo jāto, na
analyzed: vesāliyā niyyāsi niyyantaḥ ca cirassa aham dasabalassa santikam gantu kāmo jātaḥ na
translated: he left Vesālī. And after he had left, (thinking): “For a long time I have been wanting to go into the presence of the One of Ten Powers, now I will go to the Teacher”,

original: kho pana me yuttaṃ aññātakavesena gantu”nti “ye keci dasabalassa santikaṃ gantukāmo,
analyzed: kho pana me yuttam aññātaka vesena gantunti ye keci dasabalassa santikam gantu kāmo
translated: “It is not proper for me to go there in the guise of a stranger.” “Let all those who wish to go to the Buddha,

original: sabbe nikkhamantū”ti ghosanaṃ kāretvā pañca rathasatāni yojāpetvā uttamarathe ṭhito
analyzed: sabbe nikkhamantu uti ghosanam kāretvā pañca ratha satāni yojāpetvā uttama rathe ṭhitaḥ
translated: the One of Ten Powers, go out.” Having had this announcement made, he had five hundred chariots yoked, mounted the finest chariot,

original: tehi ceva pañcahi rathasatehi mahatiyā ca parisāya parivuto gandhapupphacuṇṇavāsādīni gāhāpetvā niyyāsi.🔽Yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamīti ārāmaṃ pavisanto dūratova asītianubyañjanabyāmappabhādvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni
analyzed: tehi ca iva pañcahi ratha satehi mahatiyā ca parisāya parivutaḥ gandha puppha cuṇṇa vāsa ādīni gāhāpetvā niyyāsi  yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamīti ārāmam pavisantaḥ dūratas vai asi iti anubyañjana byāma ppabhā advattiṃsa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni
translated: and, surrounded by a great retinue, taking perfumes, flowers, scented powder, and ointments, set out.🔽He approached the Blessed One. As he was entering the monastery, he saw from afar the thirty-two marks of a Great Man,

original: chabbaṇṇā ghanabuddharasmiyo disvā “evarūpaṃ nāma purisaṃ evaṃ āsanne vasantaṃ ettakaṃ
analyzed: chabbaṇṇāḥ ghana buddha rasmiyaḥ disvā evarūpam nāma purisam evam āsanne vasantam ettakam
translated: adorned with the eighty minor characteristics, shining with the radiance of a thousand suns, and thought: “I have not seen such a man, though he has been living so near me for so long.

original: kālaṃ nāddasaṃ, vañcito vatamhi, alābhā vata me”ti cintetvā mahānidhiṃ disvā daliddapuriso
analyzed: kālam na addasam vañcitaḥ alābhāḥ vata mā iti cintetvā mahā nidhim disvā dalidda purisaḥ
translated: I have been deceived, alas, it is a great loss to me!” Like a poor man who has found a great treasure,

original: viya sañjātapītipāmojjo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami. Dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākarontīti
analyzed: viya sañjāta pīti pāmojjaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami dhammassa ca anudhammam byākaronti iti
translated: he was filled with joy and happiness and approached the Blessed One. He expounded the Dhamma in conformity with the truth.

original: bhotā gotamena vuttakāraṇassa anukāraṇaṃ kathenti. Kāraṇavacano hettha dhamma-saddo
analyzed: bhotā gotamena vutta kāraṇassa anukāraṇam kathenti kāraṇa vacanaḥ ha ittha dhamma saddo
translated: They are called reasons because they are the reasons for what has been said by Master Gotama. The word “Dhamma” here is a word for a reason.

original: “hetumhi ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā”tiādīsu viya. Kāraṇanti cettha tathāpavattassa
analyzed: hetumhi ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā ti ādīsu viya kāraṇan ti ca ittha tathā pavattassa
translated: As in such passages as “Knowledge of the reason is the discrimination of Dhamma” .

original: saddassa attho adhippeto tassa pavattihetubhāvato. Atthappayutto hi saddappayogo.🔽Anukāraṇanti ca so evaṃ parehi tathā vuccamāno. Sahadhammiko vādānuvādoti parehi
analyzed: saddassa atthaḥ adhippetaḥ tassa pavatti hetu bhāvataḥ attha ppayuttaḥ hi sadda ppayogaḥ  anukāraṇam ti ca saḥ evam parehi tathā vuccamāno sahadhammikaḥ vādānuvādo ti parehi
translated: And here the meaning intended is the reason for the occurrence of the sound in that way, since that is the reason for its occurrence. For the use of a sound is determined by its meaning.🔽And the “counter-reason” is that same sound when spoken by others in that way. It is a counter-argument in accordance with the Dhamma, since it is a reason for the other’s speech.

original: vuttakāraṇena sakāraṇo hutvā tumhākaṃ vādo vā tato paraṃ tassa anuvādo vā koci appamattakopi🔽viññūhi garahitabbaṃ ṭhānaṃ kāraṇaṃ na āgacchati. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – kiṃ sabbākārenapi
analyzed: vutta kāraṇena sa kāraṇaḥ hutvā tumhākam vādaḥ vā tato param tassa anuvādaḥ vā koci appamattakaḥ api  viññūhi garahitabbam ṭhānam kāraṇam na āgacchati idam vuttam hoti kim sabba ākārena api
translated: Or it is a counter-reason, since it is a reason for your speech or for any subsequent speech of his.🔽No ground for censure can be found in you by wise men seeking the slightest occasion for it.🔽This is what is meant: “Is there no reason for censure in your speech at all?”

original: tava vāde gārayhakāraṇaṃ natthīti. Anabbhakkhātukāmāti na abhūtena vattukāmā.🔽291-292. Atthi sīha pariyāyotiādīnaṃ attho verañjakaṇḍe āgatanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: tava vāde gārayha kāraṇam natthi iti an abbhakkhātu kāmā ati na abhūtena vattu kāmā 🔽atthi sīha pariyāyo ti ādīnam atthaḥ verañja kaṇḍe āgata nayena iva veditabbo
translated: Not wishing to misrepresent him: not wishing to misrepresent him by speaking falsely.

original: Paramena assāsenāti catumaggacatuphalasaṅkhātena uttamaassāsena. Assāsāya dhammaṃ🔽desetīti assāsanatthāya santhambhanatthāya dhammaṃ deseti. Iti bhagavā aṭṭhahaṅgehi
analyzed: paramena assāsena ati catu magga catu phala saṅkhātena uttama assāsena assāsāya dhammaṃ  deseti iti assāsana tthāya santhambhana tthāya dhammam deseti iti bhagavā aṭṭhahaṅgehi
translated: With the highest consolation: with the supreme consolation consisting in the four paths and the four fruits. He teaches the Dhamma for the sake of consolation: he teaches the Dhamma for the sake of comforting, for the sake of steadying.

original: sīhasenāpatissa dhammaṃ deseti.
analyzed: sīha senāpatissa dhammam deseti
translated: With the highest consolation : with the supreme consolation consisting in the four paths and the four fruits. He teaches the Dhamma for the sake of consolation : he teaches the Dhamma for the sake of consolation, for the sake of support. Thus the Exalted One teaches the Dhamma to the lion-man Seniya by means of eight factors.

original: 293. Anuviccakāranti anuviditvā cintetvā tulayitvā kātabbaṃ karohīti vutta hoti.
analyzed: anuviccakāran ti anuviditvā cintetvā tulayitvā kātabbam karohi iti
translated: . Having considered : having considered, having reflected, having pondered, do what should be done is what is meant.

original: Sādhu hotīti sundaro hoti. Tumhādisasmiñhi maṃ disvā maṃ saraṇaṃ gacchante nigaṇṭhaṃ🔽disvā nigaṇṭhaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchante “kiṃ ayaṃ sīho diṭṭhadiṭṭhameva saraṇaṃ gacchatī”ti
analyzed: sādhu hoti iti sundaraḥ hoti tumhādisasmin hi mam disvā mam saraṇam gacchante nigaṇṭham  disvā nigaṇṭham saraṇam gacchante kim ayam sīhaḥ diṭṭha diṭṭham eva saraṇam gacchati iti
translated: It is good : it is beautiful. For when they see someone like you going for refuge to me, they say: “Why does he go for refuge to the lion? ”

original: garahā uppajjati, tasmā anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṃ sādhūti dasseti. Paṭākaṃ parihareyyunti🔽te kira evarūpaṃ sāvakaṃ labhitvā “asuko nāma rājā vā rājamahāmatto vā seṭṭhi vā
analyzed: garahā uppajjati tasmai anuviccakāro tumha ādisānam sādhu iti dasseti paṭākam parihareyyunti  te kira evarūpam sāvakam labhitvā asukaḥ nāma rājā vā rāja mahāmattaḥ vā seṭṭhi vā
translated: and when they see someone going for refuge to the Niganthas, they say: “Why does he go for refuge to the Niganthas? ” and thus criticism arises. Therefore the Exalted One shows that it is good to go for refuge after having considered.

original: amhākaṃ saraṇaṃ gato sāvako jāto”ti paṭākaṃ ukkhipitvā nagare ghosentā āhiṇḍanti.
analyzed: amhākam saraṇam gataḥ sāvakaḥ jātaḥ iti paṭākam ukkhipitvā nagare ghosentāḥ āhiṇḍanti
translated: He should remove the banner : it seems that when they obtain such a disciple, they raise a banner and go about the city proclaiming: “So-and-so, a king, a royal minister, or a merchant, has gone for refuge to us. He has become our disciple.”🔽.

original: Kasmā? “Evaṃ no mahantabhāvo āvi bhavissatī”ti ca, sace panassa “kimahaṃ ete saraṇaṃ
analyzed: kasmai evam naḥ mahanta bhāvaḥ āvi bhavissati iti ca sace panassa kim aham ete saraṇam
translated: Why? “So our greatness will be known.” But if he thinks, “What is the use of my going for refuge to them?

original: gato”ti vippaṭisāro uppajjeyya, tampi so “etesaṃ me saraṇagatabhāvaṃ bahū jānanti,
analyzed: gataḥ ti vippaṭisāraḥ uppajjeyya tam pi saḥ etesam me saraṇa gata bhāvam bahū jānanti
translated: Why? “So that our greatness may be known.” But if he should get remorse, thinking, “What have I gone for refuge to?” he would dispel it, thinking, “Many know that I have gone for refuge to them.

original: dukkaraṃ dāni paṭinivattitu”nti vinodetvā na paṭikkamissatīti ca. Tenāha “paṭākaṃ
analyzed: dukkaram dāni paṭinivattitum ti vinodetvā na paṭikkamissati iti ca tena āha paṭākam
translated: It is difficult now to turn back.” Therefore it is said, “He would remove the flag.”

original: parihareyyu”nti. Opānabhūtanti paṭiyattaudapāno viya ṭhitaṃ. Kulanti tava nivesanaṃ.🔽Dātabbaṃ maññeyyāsīti pubbepi dasapi vīsatipi saṭṭhipi jane āgate disvā natthīti
analyzed: parihareyyunti ṭhitam tava nivesanam  dātabbam maññeyyāsi iti pubbe pi dasapi vīsatipi saṭṭhipi jane āgate disvā na atthi iti
translated: “It would be as a ford”: it would be like a ford that is prepared. “To your family”: to your house.

original: avatvā desi, idāni maṃ saraṇaṃ gatakāraṇamatteneva mā imesaṃ deyyadhammaṃ upacchindittha,
analyzed: avatvā desi idāni mam saraṇam gata kāraṇa mattena iva mā imesam deyya dhammam upacchindittha
translated: “You would think it should be given”: before, when ten, twenty, or thirty people came, you did not say “There is none,” but gave to them. Now, do not stop giving to them just because they have gone for refuge to me.🔽For what should be given is to those who have come.

original: sampattānañhi dātabbamevāti ovadati. Sutaṃ me taṃ bhanteti kuto sutaṃ? Nigaṇṭhānaṃ
analyzed: sampattānam hi dātabbam eva ati ovadati sutam me tam bhante iti kutas sutam nigaṇṭhānam
translated: “I have heard this, venerable sir”: where did you hear this? From the Niganthas.

original: santikā. Te kira kulagharesu evaṃ pakāsenti “mayaṃ yassa kassaci sampattassa dātabbanti
analyzed: santikā te kira kula gharesu evam pakāsenti mayam yassa kassaci sampattassa dātabbanti
translated: They, it seems, proclaim in the families: “We are those to whom what has come should be given.”

original: vadāma, samaṇo pana gotamo ‘mayhameva dānaṃ dātabbaṃ…pe… na aññesaṃ sāvakānaṃ dinnaṃ
analyzed: vadāma samaṇaḥ pana gotamaḥ mayham eva dānam dātabbam pe na aññesam sāvakānam dinnam
translated: my disciples alone should be given, not the disciples of others.🔽What is given to me has great fruit, not what is given to my disciples.

original: mahapphala’nti evaṃ vadatī”ti. Taṃ sandhāya ayaṃ “sutaṃ me ta”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: evam vadati iti tam sandhāya ayam sutam me tanti ādim āha
translated: What is given to my disciples has great fruit, not what is given to the disciples of others.’“

original: 294. Pavattamaṃsanti pakatiyā pavattaṃ kappiyamaṃsaṃ, mūlaṃ gahetvā antarāpaṇe pariyesāhīti🔽adhippāyo. Sambahulā nigaṇṭhāti pañcasatamattā nigaṇṭhā. Thūlaṃ pasunti thūlaṃ mahāsarīraṃ
analyzed: pavatta maṃsanti pakatiyā pavattam kappiya maṃsam mūlam gahetvā antarāpaṇe pariyesāhi iti  adhippāyaḥ sambahulāḥ nigaṇṭhā ati pañca sata mattāḥ nigaṇṭhāḥ thūlam thūlam mahā sarīram
translated: “Ordinary meat” is meat that is allowable by nature. “Having taken the price” means having taken the money. “In the market” means in the place where it is sold.🔽The meaning is that he should search for it.🔽“Many naked ascetics” means about five hundred naked ascetics.🔽“A large animal” means an animal with a large body, such as a bull, an elephant, a buffalo, or a boar.

original: gokaṇṇamahiṃsasūkarasaṅkhātaṃ pasuṃ. Uddissakatanti attānaṃ uddisitvā kataṃ, māritanti🔽attho. Paṭiccakammanti ettha kamma-saddo kammasādhano atītakālikoti āha “attānaṃ
analyzed: gokaṇṇa mahiṃsa sūkara saṅkhātam pasum attānam uddisitvā katam māritam  atthaḥ paṭiccakammanti ettha kamma saddo kamma sādhanaḥ atīta kālikaḥ ti āha attānam
translated: “A dedicated animal” means an animal dedicated to a deity. “Slaughtered” means killed.🔽“A dedicated act” means an act dedicated to a deity.🔽“Having touched the dedicated act” means having touched the act dedicated to a deity.

original: paṭicca kata”nti. Nimittakammassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ “paṭicca kammaṃ phusatī”tiādīsu🔽viya. Nimittakammassāti nimittabhāvena laddhabbakammassa, na karaṇakārāpanavasena.
analyzed: paṭicca katam ti nimitta kammassa etam adhivacanam paṭicca kammam phusati itiādīsu 🔽viya nimitta kammassa ati nimitta bhāvena laddhabba kammassa na karaṇa kārāpana vasena
translated: “Having touched the dedicated act” means having touched the act that is to be dedicated.

original: Paṭiccakammaṃ ettha atthīti maṃsaṃ paṭiccakammaṃ yathā “buddhaṃ etassa atthīti buddho”ti.
analyzed: paṭiccakammam ettha atthi iti maṃsam paṭiccakammam yathā buddham etassa atthi iti buddhaḥ iti
translated: The flesh is the act of killing, since it is the cause of the act of killing, just as the Buddha is the Enlightened One since he is the cause of enlightenment.

original: Atha vā paṭicca kammaṃ phusatīti pāṭhaseso daṭṭhabbo, svāyaṃ etaṃ maṃsaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: atha vā paṭicca kammam phusati iti pāṭha sesaḥ daṭṭhabbo svāyam etam maṃsam paṭicca
translated: Or else, the reading may be taken as “paṭicca kammapho” . The meaning then is: “He touches the act of killing that is the cause of the flesh.”

original: taṃ pāṇavadhakakammaṃ phusatīti attho. Tañhi akusalaṃ upaḍḍhaṃ dāyakassa, upaḍḍhaṃ
analyzed: tam pāṇa vadhaka kammam phusati iti attho tat hi akusalam upaḍḍham dāyakassa upaḍḍham
translated: For that unwholesome kamma is shared by the giver and the receiver, according to their opinion.

original: paṭiggāhakassa hotīti nesaṃ laddhi. Upakaṇṇaketi kaṇṇamūle. Alanti paṭikkhepavacanaṃ,
analyzed: paṭiggāhakassa hoti iti na isam laddhi upakaṇṇake iti kaṇṇa mūle alam paṭikkhepa vacanam
translated: “In the ear-whispered” means in the ear. “Alā” is a word of refusal,

original: hotu kiṃ imināti attho. Na ca pana teti ete āyasmantā dīgharattaṃ avaṇṇakāmā hutvā🔽avaṇṇaṃ bhāsantāpi abbhācikkhantā na jiridanti, abbhakkhānassa antaṃ na gacchantīti
analyzed: hotu kim iminā ati atthaḥ na ca pana te ti ete āyasmantā dīgharattam a vaṇṇa kāmāḥ hutvā  avaṇṇam bhāsantā api abbhācikkhantā na jiridanti abbhakkhānassa antam na gacchanti iti
translated: meaning “Let it be, what is the use of this?”🔽“But they did not tire of speaking dispraise of the venerable ones” means that they did not tire of speaking dispraise of the venerable ones, having become dislikers of them for a long time.

original: attho. Atha vā lajjanatthe idaṃ jiridantīti padaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, na lajjantīti attho.🔽Sīhasenāpativatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: atthaḥ atha vā lajjana atthe idam jiridanti iti padam daṭṭhabbam na lajjanti iti atthaḥ  sīha senāpati vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The meaning is: they did not reach the end of their dispraise, did not tire of slandering them. Or else, the word “jiridanti” should be taken in the sense of “lajjanta,” meaning “they did not feel shame.”🔽The explanation of the story of the Lion General is finished.

original: Kappiyabhūmianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kappiya bhūmi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the allowance of the proper place.

original: 295. Abhilāpamattanti desanāmattaṃ. Āmisakhādanatthāyāti tattha tattha chaḍḍitassa🔽āmisassa khādanatthāya. Anuppageyevāti pātoyeva. Oravasaddanti mahāsaddaṃ. Taṃ pana🔽avatvāpīti andhakaṭṭhakathāyaṃvuttanayena avatvāpi. Pi-saddena tathā vacanampi anujānāti.🔽Aṭṭhakathāsu vuttanayenāti sesaaṭṭhakathāsu vuttanayena. “Kappiyakuṭiṃ karomā’ti🔽vā, ‘kappiyakuṭī’ti vā vutte sādhāraṇalakkhaṇa”nti sabbaaṭṭhakathāsu vuttaussāvanantikākuṭikaraṇalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: abhilāpa mattam ti desanā mattam āmisa khādana tthāya ati tattha tattha chaḍḍitassa  āmisassa khādana thāya orava saddam ti mahā saddam tam pana  a vatvā api iti andhaka aṭṭhakathā āyaṃvutta nayena a vatvā api pi saddena tathā vacanam pi anujānāti  aṭṭhakathāsu vutta nayena ati sesa aṭṭhakathāsu vutta nayena kappiya kuṭim karoma ati  vā kappiya kuṭī iti vā vutte sādhāraṇa lakkhaṇam ti sabba aṭṭhakathāsu
translated: “Mere expression” means mere teaching. “For the sake of eating food” means for the sake of eating the food that is discarded here and there. “At the very beginning” means in the morning. “Loudly” means loudly. “Without specifying it” means without specifying it in the way stated in the Andhaka-kathina. The word “also” allows that it may be done in that way.🔽“In the way stated in the commentaries” means in the way stated in the other commentaries. “If it is said ‘Let’s build a storehouse’ or ‘a storehouse’ it is a shared characteristic” is the announcement-and-then-the-building-of-the-storehouse-characteristic stated in all the commentaries.

original: Cayanti adhiṭṭhānaṃ. Yato paṭṭhāyāti yato iṭṭhakato silato mattikāpiṇḍato vā paṭṭhāya.🔽Paṭhamiṭṭhakādīnaṃ heṭṭhā na vaṭṭantīti bhittiyā paṭhamiṭṭhakādīnaṃ heṭṭhā bhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: cayanti adhiṭṭhānam yatas paṭṭhāya ati yatas iṭṭhakataḥ silataḥ mattikā piṇḍataḥ vā paṭṭhāya 🔽paṭhama iṭṭhaka ādīnam heṭṭhā na vaṭṭanti iti bhittiyā paṭhama iṭṭhaka ādīnam heṭṭhā bhūmiyam
translated: ‘Mere expression’: mere teaching. ‘For the sake of eating food’: for the sake of eating the food that is thrown here and there. ‘At the time of non-arrival’: in the morning. ‘Loud noise’: a great noise. ‘But without specifying it’: without specifying it in the way stated in the Andhaka Khandhaka. The word ‘but’ allows that it may be done in that way. ‘In the way stated in the commentaries’: in the way stated in the other commentaries. ‘We are making a storehouse’ or ‘a storehouse’ is the general characteristic. The characteristic of the making of a storehouse is stated in all the commentaries as the announcement. ‘To appropriate’: to determine. ‘From the time of’: from the time of the brick, the stone, the lump of clay. ‘The first layer of bricks, etc., below are not allowable’: the first layer of bricks, etc., on the ground below the wall

original: patiṭṭhāpiyamānā iṭṭhakādayo bhūmigatikattā “kappiyakuṭiṃ karomā”ti vatvā patiṭṭhāpetuṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpiyamānāḥ iṭṭhaka ādayaḥ bhūmi gati kattā kappiya kuṭim karoma iti vatvā patiṭṭhāpetum
translated: If bricks, etc., are being laid down, it is not allowable to say, “Let us make a hut,” and to have them laid down, because they are going to be on the ground.

original: na vaṭṭanti. Yadi evaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikhaṇitvā patiṭṭhāpiyamānā thambhā kasmā tathā vatvā🔽patiṭṭhāpetuṃ vaṭṭantīti āha “thambhā pana…pe… vaṭṭantī”ti. Saṅghasantakamevāti vāsatthāya🔽kataṃ saṅghikasenāsanaṃ sandhāya vadati. Bhikkhusantakanti vāsatthāya eva kataṃ bhikkhussa
analyzed: na vaṭṭanti yadi evam bhūmi iyam nikhaṇitvā patiṭṭhāpiyamānā thambhā kasmai tathā vatvā  patiṭṭhāpetum vaṭṭanti iti āha thambhāḥ panape vaṭṭanti iti saṅgha santakam eva ati vāsatthāya  katam saṅghika senāsanam sandhāya vadati bhikkhu santakam ti vā asatthāya eva katam bhikkhussa
translated: If that is so, why is it allowable to say, “Let us make a hut,” and to have posts set up if they are being set up after being dug into the ground?

original: puggalikasenāsanaṃ. Mukhasannidhīti iminā antovutthadukkaṭameva dīpitaṃ.
analyzed: puggalika senāsanam mukha sannidhi iti iminā antovuttha dukkaṭam eva dīpitam
translated: He says, “Posts, etc., are allowable,” and so on. “Belonging to the Community” is what is made for the purpose of living in belonging to the Community. “Belonging to an individual bhikkhu” is what is made for the purpose of living in belonging to a particular bhikkhu. “Within arm’s reach” shows that the offence is only for one who is within arm’s reach.

original: Kappiyabhūmianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kappiya bhūmi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Allowance for a Suitable Place is ended.

original: Keṇiyajaṭilavatthukathāvaṇṇanā🔽300. Yena āpaṇaṃ tadavasarītiādīsu āpaṇanti ekassa nigamassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tasmiṃ
analyzed: keṇiya jaṭila vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā  yena āpaṇam tadavasari iti ādīsu āpaṇanti ekassa nigamassa itam adhivacanam tasmin
translated: The explanation of the story of the matted-hair ascetic Keṇiya

original: kira nigame vīsati āpaṇamukhasahassāni vibhattāni ahesuṃ. Iti so āpaṇānaṃ ussannattā
analyzed: kira nigame vīsati āpaṇa mukha sahassāni vibhattāni ahesuṃ iti saḥ āpaṇānam ussanna ttā
translated: In the passage beginning, “He went to the market town” , the market town is the name of a certain village. In that village, it seems, there were twenty thousand market towns laid out. So it was called “Market Town” because of the abundance of markets.

original: “āpaṇa”ntveva saṅkhaṃ gato. Tassa pana nigamassa avidūre nadītīre ghanacchāyo ramaṇīyabhūmibhāgo
analyzed: saṅkham gataḥ tassa pana nigamassa avidūre nadī tīre ghana chāyaḥ ramaṇīya bhūmi bhāgaḥ
translated: “The market town” is the name of the town. Not far from the town, on the bank of a river, there was a dense forest with a delightful ground cover.

original: mahāvanasaṇḍo, tasmiṃ bhagavā viharati. Keṇiyoti tassa nāmaṃ. Jaṭiloti āharimajaṭādharo
analyzed: mahā vana saṇḍaḥ tasmin bhagavā viharati keṇiyaḥ ti tassa nāmam jaṭilaḥ ti āharima jaṭā dharo
translated: The Blessed One was staying there. Keṇiya was his name. He was a “matted-hair ascetic” , i.e., he wore his hair matted.

original: tāpaso. So kira brāhmaṇamahāsālo, dhanarakkhaṇatthāya pana tāpasapabbajjaṃ samādāya🔽rañño paṇṇākāraṃ datvā bhūmibhāgaṃ gahetvā tattha assamaṃ kāretvā pañcahi sakaṭasatehi
analyzed: tāpasaḥ saḥ kira brāhmaṇa mahā sālaḥ dhana rakkhaṇa atthāya pana tāpasa pabbajjam samādāya  rañño paṇṇākāram da tvā bhūmi bhāgam gahetvā tattha assamam kāretvā pañcahi sakaṭa satehi
translated: It is said that he was a great brahmin landowner. But he had taken up the life of an ascetic in order to protect his wealth.

original: vaṇijjaṃ payojetvā kulasahassassa nissayo hutvā vasati. Assamepi cassa eko tālarukkho
analyzed: vaṇijjam payojetvā kula sahassassa nissayaḥ hutvā vasati assame pi ca ssa ekaḥ tāla rukkho
translated: He had received a grant of land from the king. He had a hermitage built there, and he lived there, employing five hundred carts in his business and supporting a thousand families. It is said that in the hermitage there was a palm tree

original: divase divase ekaṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ phalaṃ muñcatīti vadanti. So divā kāsāvāni dhāreti,
analyzed: divase divase ekam sovaṇṇa mayam phalam muñcati iti vadanti saḥ divā kāsāvāni dhārā iti
translated: which produced a golden fruit every day. He wore yellow robes during the day,

original: jaṭā ca bandhati, rattiṃ kāmasampattiṃ anubhavati.
analyzed: jaṭā ca bandhati rattim kāma sampattim anubhavati
translated: and he wore his hair in braids. At night he enjoyed the pleasures of love.

original: Pavattāroti pavattayitāro, pāvacanavasena vattāroti attho. Yesanti yesaṃ santakaṃ.
analyzed: pavattāraḥ ti pavattayitāraḥ pāvacana vasena vattāraḥ ti atthaḥ yesanti yesam santakam
translated: “The promulgator” : the one who promulgated. The meaning is, the one who made it current by means of the recitation. “Of what belongs to them” : of those.

original: Mantapadanti mantasadde bahikatvā raho bhāsitabbaṭṭhena mantā eva taṃtaṃatthapaṭipattihetutāya
analyzed: manta padanti manta sadde bahi katvā rahaḥ bhāsitabba ṭṭhena mantāḥ eva taṃ taṃ attha paṭipatti hetutāya
translated: The words of the mantras: the mantras themselves are called “words” because they are uttered externally in the form of sounds and are to be spoken in private.

original: padanti mantapadaṃ, vedavacanaṃ. Gītanti aṭṭhakādīhi dasahi porāṇabrāhmaṇehi udāttānudāttādisarasampattivasena
analyzed: manta padam veda vacanam aṭṭhaka ādīhi dasahi porāṇa brāhmaṇehi udātta anudātta ādi sara sampatti vasena
translated: The mantras are the words of the Vedas. The chants: the ancient brahmins chanted the Vedas in ten recitations, etc., with the correct pronunciation of the vowels and consonants.

original: sajjhāyitaṃ. Pavuttanti pāvacanavasena aññesaṃ vuttaṃ, vācitanti attho. Samihitanti🔽samupabyūḷhaṃ rāsikataṃ, iruvedayajuvedasāmavedādivasena tatthāpi paccekaṃ mantabrāhmaṇādivasena
analyzed: sajjhāyitam pavuttam ti pā vacana vasena aññesam vuttam vācitam iti attho samihitam ti  samupabyūḷham rāsikatam iru veda yaju veda sāmaveda ādi vasena tattha api paccekam manta brāhmaṇa ādi vasena
translated: The recitations: what was recited by others in the form of recitations. The collections:

original: sajjhāyanavācakādivasena ca piṇḍaṃ katvā ṭhapitanti attho. Tadanugāyantīti etarahi
analyzed: sajjhāyana vācaka ādi vasena ca piṇḍam katvā tat anugāyanti iti etarahi
translated: they are called “collections” because they were compiled and placed in groups, each being compiled and placed in groups in the form of the Rg Veda, Yajur Veda, Sama Veda, etc., and in the form of the mantras, brahmins, etc., of each of these, and in the form of the reciters, etc.

original: brāhmaṇā taṃ tehi pubbe gītaṃ anugāyanti anusajjhāyanti. Tadanubhāsantīti taṃ anubhāsanti,
analyzed: brāhmaṇā tam tehi pubbe gītam anugāyanti anusajjhāyanti tat anubhāsanti iti tam anubhāsanti
translated: They chant after them: the brahmins of today chant after them, chant in imitation of them. They chant in imitation of them:

original: idaṃ purimasseva vevacanaṃ. Bhāsitamanubhāsantīti tehi bhāsitaṃ sajjhāyitaṃ anusajjhāyanti.
analyzed: idam purimassa iva vevacanam bhāsitam anubhāsanti iti tehi bhāsitam sajjhāyitam anusajjhāyanti
translated: this is a synonym for the preceding phrase. They chant in imitation of what was chanted by them: they chant in imitation of what was chanted and recited by them.

original: Vācitamanuvācentīti tehi aññesaṃ vācitaṃ anuvācenti. Seyyathidanti te katameti attho.
analyzed: vācitam anuvācenti iti tehi aññesam vācitam anuvācenti te katame iti attho
translated: They recited what was recited by them. The meaning is: what were they like?

original: Aṭṭhakotiādīni tesaṃ nāmāni. Te kira dibbacakkhuparibhaṇḍena yathākammūpagañāṇena
analyzed: aṭṭhaka uti ādīni tesam nāmāni te kira dibba cakkhu paribhaṇḍena yathā kammu upaga ñāṇena
translated: Aṭṭhaka, etc., are their names. They, it seems, having seen with the divine eye, which is a concomitant of knowledge of the passing away and arising of beings ,

original: sattānaṃ kammassakatādiṃ pubbenivāsañāṇena atītakappe brāhmaṇānaṃ mantajjhenavidhiñca🔽oloketvā parūpaghātaṃ akatvā kassapasammāsambuddhassa bhagavato vaṭṭasannissitena
analyzed: sattānam kammassaka tā ādim pubbenivāsa ñāṇena atīta kappe brāhmaṇānam mantajjhena vidhiñca  oloketvā para upaghātam a katvā kassapa sammāsambuddhassa bhagavataḥ vaṭṭa sannissitena
translated: the ownership of kamma by beings, and the rules of the brahmans in the past aeon by means of knowledge of past lives ,

original: vacanena saha saṃsanditvā mante ganthesuṃ. Aparāpare pana okkākarājakālādīsu uppannabrāhmaṇā
analyzed: vacanena saha saṃsanditvā mante ganthesum apara apare pana okkāka rājakāla ādīsu uppanna brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: and having combined their own verses with the Blessed One’s verses, which were dependent on the wheel-turning monarch, they composed the mantras. But others, brahmans who appeared in the time of King Okkāka, etc.,

original: pāṇātipātādīni pakkhipitvā tayo vede bhinditvā buddhavacanena saddhiṃ viruddhe akaṃsu.
analyzed: pāṇātipāta ādīni pakkhipitvā tayaḥ vede bhinditvā buddha vacanena saddhim viruddhe akaṃsu
translated: having inserted killing living beings, etc., divided the three Vedas and made them contradictory to the Buddha’s word.

original: Rattibhojanaṃ ratti, tato uparatāti rattūparatā. Atikkante majjhanhike yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā
analyzed: ratti bhojanam ratti tatas atikkante majjhanhike yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā
translated: Night food is night; from that cessation is night-cessation. Food eaten after midday, when the middle of the day has passed, until sunrise,

original: bhojanaṃ vikālabhojanaṃ nāma, tato viratattā viratā vikālabhojanā. Paṭiyādāpetvāti
analyzed: bhojanam vikāla bhojanam nāma tatas viratattā viratā vikāla bhojanā
translated: is called “food at the wrong time.” They are abstinent from that, thus they are abstinent from food at the wrong time. Having had food prepared:

original: sappimadhusakkarādīhi ceva maricehi ca susaṅkhataṃ pānaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā.🔽“Mahā kho keṇiya bhikkhusaṅgho”ti kasmā bhagavā punappunaṃ paṭikkhipi? Titthiyānaṃ
analyzed: sappi madhu sakkara ādīhi ca iva maricehi ca su saṅkhatam pānam paṭiyādāpetvā  mahā kho keṇiya bhikkhu saṅghaḥ iti kasmai bhagavā punappunam paṭikkhipi titthiyānam
translated: and had a drink prepared with ghee, honey, sugar, etc., and with ginger.

original: paṭikkhepapasannatāya. Titthiyā hi “aho vatāyaṃ appiccho, yo nimantiyamānopi na sādiyatī”ti
analyzed: paṭikkhepa pasanna tāya titthiyāḥ hi aho vata ayam appicchaḥ yaḥ nimantiyamānaḥ api na sādiyati iti
translated: Why did the Blessed One refuse again and again, saying, “The Sangha of bhikkhus is large, Keṇiya”? Because he knew that the sectarians would be pleased with his refusal. For the sectarians would think, “How little he wants! Though invited, he does not consent.”

original: upanimantiyamānassa paṭikkhepe pasīdantīti keci, akāraṇañcetaṃ. Natthi buddhānaṃ🔽paccayahetu evarūpaṃ kohaññaṃ, ayaṃ pana aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni disvā ettakānaṃyeva
analyzed: upanimantiyamānassa paṭikkhepe pasīdanti iti keci akāraṇam ca itam na atthi buddhānam  paccaya hetu evarūpam kohaññam ayam pana aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhu satāni disvā ettakānam yeva
translated: And they would be pleased with his refusal of their invitation. But this is not the reason, say some. For the Buddhas have no such stinginess.

original: bhikkhaṃ paṭiyādessati, sveva selo brāhmaṇo tīhi purisasatehi saddhiṃ pabbajissati,🔽ayuttaṃ kho pana navake aññato pesetvā imeheva saddhiṃ gantuṃ, ime vā aññato pesetvā
analyzed: bhikkham paṭiyādessati su eva selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tīhi purisa satehi saddhim pabbajissati  ayuttam kho pana navake aññatas pesetvā imehi iva saddhim gantum ime vā aññatas pesetvā
translated: But the Blessed One saw that there were more than three thousand bhikkhus and thought, “He will prepare alms only for this many. Tomorrow the brahmin Seṭṭha will go forth with three hundred men,

original: navakehi saddhiṃ gantuṃ. Athāpi sabbeva gahetvā gamissāmi, bhikkhāhāro nappahossati.
analyzed: navakehi saddhim gantum atha api sabbe iva gahetvā gamissāmi bhikkhāhāraḥ na ppahossati
translated: and it is not proper for the new bhikkhus to go with the others or for the others to go with the new bhikkhus. If I take them all, there will not be enough alms.”

original: Tato bhikkhūsu piṇḍāya carantesu manussā ujjhāyissanti “cirassampi keṇiyo samaṇaṃ
analyzed: tatas bhikkhūsu piṇḍāya carantesu manussāḥ ujjhāyissanti cirassam pi keṇiyaḥ samaṇam
translated: Then, when the monks are walking for alms, people will complain, ‘For a long time we have been giving to the naked ascetics,

original: gotamaṃ nimantetvā yāpanamattaṃ dātuṃ nāsakkhī”ti, sayañca vippaṭisārī bhavissati.
analyzed: gotamam nimantetvā yāpana mattam dātum na asakkhi iti sayam ca vippaṭisārī bhavissati
translated: Then, when the monks go for alms, people will complain, ‘For a long time Keṇiya has been inviting the ascetic Gotama to a meal, but he has not been able to give it.’ And he himself will be remorseful.

original: Paṭikkhepe pana kate “samaṇo gotamo punappunaṃ ‘tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno’ti
analyzed: paṭikkhepe pana kate samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ punappunam tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ ti
translated: But if you refuse, he will think, ‘The ascetic Gotama keeps on saying that I have confidence in brahmins.

original: brāhmaṇānaṃ nāmaṃ gaṇhātī”ti cintetvā brāhmaṇepi nimantetukāmo bhavissati, tato brāhmaṇe
analyzed: brāhmaṇānam nāmam gaṇhāti iti cintetvā brāhmaṇe api nimantetu kāmaḥ bhavissati tatas brāhmaṇe
translated: He must be thinking of inviting some brahmins.’ He will then invite some brahmins,

original: pāṭiyekkaṃ nimantessati, te tena nimantitā bhikkhū hutvā bhuñjissanti, evamassa saddhā🔽anurakkhitā bhavissatīti punappunaṃ paṭikkhipi. Kiñcāpi kho bho gotamāti iminā idaṃ
analyzed: pāṭiyekkam nimantessati te tena nimantitāḥ bhikkhū hutvā bhuñjissanti evam assa saddhā  anurakkhitā bhavissati iti punappunam paṭikkhipi kiñcā api kho bho gotama ati iminā idam
translated: and they will eat the meal as monks. In this way his faith will be protected.’ And he refused again and again.

original: dīpeti “bho gotama, kiṃ jātaṃ, yadi ahaṃ brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno, adhivāsetu bhavaṃ
analyzed: dīpa iti bho gotama kim jātam yadi aham brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ adhivāsetu bhavam
translated: ‘What is the matter, Master Gotama?’ Keṇiya meant, ‘What is the matter, Master Gotama, that I have confidence in brahmins? Please consent,

original: gotamo, ahaṃ brāhmaṇānampi dātuṃ sakkomi tumhākampī”ti. Ṭhapetvā dhaññaphalarasanti
analyzed: gotamaḥ aham brāhmaṇānam pi dātum sakkomi tumhākam pi iti ṭhapetvā dhañña phala rasanti
translated: Master Gotama, for I am able to give a meal to the brahmins as well as to you.’ ‘Except for the fruit of the fields and the juice of the sugarcane,

original: ettha taṇḍuladhovanodakampi dhaññarasoyevāti vadanti. Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ucchurasanti
analyzed: ettha taṇḍula dhovana udakam pi dhañña rasoyā iva ati vadanti anujānāmi bhikkhave ucchurasanti
translated: The water in which rice has been washed is also grain-juice, they say.

original: ettha nikkasaṭo ucchuraso sattāhakālikoti veditabbaṃ.🔽Imāhi gāthāhīti imāhi keṇiyassa cittānukūlāhi gāthāhi. Tattha aggiparicariyaṃ vinā🔽brāhmaṇānaṃ yaññābhāvato “aggihuttamukhā yaññā”ti vuttaṃ, aggihuttaseṭṭhā aggijuhanappadhānāti🔽attho. Brāhmaṇā hi “aggimukhā devā”ti aggijuhanapubbakaṃ yaññaṃ vidahanti. Vede sajjhāyantehi🔽paṭhamaṃ sajjhāyitabbato sāvittī “chandaso mukha”nti vuttā, sāvittī vedassa pubbaṅgamāti

Herein, because of the absence of sacrifice in the brahmans without the performance of fire worship, it is said: “Sacrifices with fire as their essence” . The meaning is: with fire worship as their chief thing. For brahmans, having made the gods “with fire as their essence” , perform a sacrifice that is preceded by fire worship. The Sāvitti is said to be “the mouth of the Vedas” because it is the first to be recited by those who are devoted to the recitation of the Vedas. And in the case of the twelvefold absence “on business” too,

original: 321-322. Yasmā disaṃgamikanavake “disaṃgamiko pakkamatī”ti vacaneneva “na paccessa”nti

analyzed: cīvara paṭivīsanti attanaḥ pattabba cīvara bhāgam apavilāyamānaḥ iti ākaṅkhamāno tassa

original: cīvaralābhe sati vassaṃvutthāvāse niṭṭhānasanniṭṭhānanāsanantikānaṃ vasena ekaṃ tikaṃ,

original: 324. Tato paraṃ niṭṭhānasanniṭṭhānanāsanantikasīmātikkantikasaubbhārānaṃ vasena phāsuvihārapañcakaṃ vuttaṃ. Sesamettha pāḷito aṭṭhakathāto ca suviññeyyameva.

original: Ādāyasattakādikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.

original: caturaṅgulapupphaṃ kojavaṃ.

original: 340. Upacāreti susānassa āsanne padese. Chaḍḍetvā gatāti kiñci avatvāyeva chaḍḍetvā gatā. So eva sāmīti akatāya katikāya yena gahitaṃ, sova sāmī.

translated: The Blessed One will declare: “That bhikkhu is a stream-enterer, a once-returner,” etc., and he will declare his way of knowledge,

translated: The intention is that it is allowable to store them only in a monastery with a door-bolt, even if one stores them for these four reasons.

translated: The explanation of the allowance for the Sangha to make a division of robe-cloth that has accrued

analyzed: pañca māsā iti ac c anta saṃyoge upayoga vacanam vaḍḍhim payojetvā ṭhapita upanikkhepato ti
translated: Five months: the expression “in use” is used for the actual joining. From what is deposited with interest:

analyzed: nāḷikera ārāma ādi tatruppādataḥ vassāvāsika lābha vasena vā mataka cīvara vasena vā tatruppāda vasena  vā aññena vā kenacid ākārena saṅgham uddissa uppanna cīvaram sabbam tassa iva atthatakathinassa
translated: from what is produced in a coconut estate, a monastery, etc. “Or from what is given for the rains, or from what is given for the dead, or from what is produced,🔽or from any other source, what is given to the Order is for the Order that has made kathina cloth, for five months;

analyzed: vuttha vassassa pañca māse pāpuṇāti tena iva paratas aṭṭhasu mātikāsu vassaṃvuttha saṅghassa  deti iti imassa mātikā padassa vinicchaye cīvara māsataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva hemantassa pacchimo
translated: That is why, in the eight sections of the table of contents that follow, the words “gives to the Sangha that has completed the rains”

original: divaso, tāva vassāvāsikaṃ demāti vutte kathinaṃ atthataṃ vā hotu anatthataṃ vā, atītavassaṃvutthānameva
analyzed: divaso tāva vassāvāsikam dema iti vutte kathinam atthatam vā hotu anatthatam vā atīta vassaṃvutthānam eva
translated: are commented on in the analysis as follows: “If it is said, ‘I give a gift for the rainy season from the robe-cloth month up to the last day of winter,’ then whether the robe-making ceremony has been performed or not, it is only for those who have completed the rains in the past.”

original: pāpuṇātī”ti vuttaṃ. Tato paranti pañcamāsato paraṃ, gimhānassa paṭhamadivasato paṭṭhāyāti attho.
analyzed: pāpuṇāti iti vuttam tatas param ti pañca māsataḥ param gimhānassa paṭhama divasato paṭṭhāya iti attho
translated: “After that” means after five months, from the first day of the hot season onwards.

original: “Kasmā? Piṭṭhisamaye uppannattā”ti idaṃ “udāhu anāgatavasse”ti imassānantaraṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Gimhānassa paṭhamadivasato paṭṭhāya uppannameva hi piṭṭhisamaye uppannattā “kiṃ atītavasse
analyzed: kasmā piṭṭhi samaye uppanna ttā ati idam udāhu anāgata vassā iti imassa anantaram daṭṭhabbaṃ  gimhānassa paṭhama divasataḥ paṭṭhāya uppannam eva hi piṭṭhi samaye uppanna ttā kim atīta vasse
translated: “Why? Because it arose in the period of the robe-making ceremony.” This should be read immediately after “Or in the future year?”

original: idaṃ vassāvāsika”ntiādinā pucchitabbaṃ, teneva paratopi vakkhati “gimhānaṃ paṭhamadivasato
analyzed: idam vassāvāsikam ti ādinā pucchitabbam tena iva paratas pi vakkhati gimhānam paṭhama divasataḥ
translated: For what arose from the first day of the hot season onwards is called “arisen in the period of the robe-making ceremony” because it arose in the period of the robe-making ceremony. Therefore it should be asked, “In what past year🔽was this robe-making ceremony?”

original: paṭṭhāya vutte pana mātikā āropetabbā ‘atītavassāvāsassa pañca māsā atikkantā, anāgato
analyzed: paṭṭhāya vutte pana mātikā āropetabbā atīta vassāvāsassa pañca māsāḥ atikkantāḥ anāgataḥ
translated: But if it is said, “From the first day of the hot season onwards,” then the schedule should be applied: “Five months of the past robe-making season have passed. In four months’ time the future

original: cātumāsaccayena bhavissati, kataravassāvāsassa desī’ti. Sace ‘atītavassaṃvutthānaṃ
analyzed: cātumāsaccayena bhavissati katara vassa āvāsassa desi iti sace
translated: one will come. In which robe-making season was it given?” If he says, “I give what was made in the past year,” then it reaches only what was made in the period of the robe-making ceremony in that year.

original: dammī’ti vadati, taṃantovassaṃvutthānameva pāpuṇātī”ti. Potthakesu pana “anatthatakathinassapi
analyzed: dammi iti vadati pāpuṇāti iti potthakesu pana
translated: But in the books it is said that “it reaches even what was made in the period of the robe-making ceremony in the year before last.”

original: pañca māse pāpuṇātī”ti imassānantaraṃ “kasmā? Piṭṭhisamaye uppannattā”ti idaṃ likhanti,🔽taṃ na yujjati. Na hi piṭṭhisamaye uppannaṃ sandhāya “anatthatakathinassapi pañca🔽māse pāpuṇātī”ti vuttaṃ, na ca piṭṭhisamaye uppannaṃ vutthavassasseva pāpuṇāti, sammukhībhūtānaṃ
analyzed: pañca māse pāpuṇāti iti imassa anantaram kasmā piṭṭhi samaye idam likhanti  tam na yujjati na hi piṭṭhi samaye uppannam sandhāya pañca  māse pāpuṇāti iti vuttam na ca piṭṭhi samaye uppannam vuttha vassassa iva pāpuṇāti sammukhībhūtānam
translated: “Why? Because it arose on the robe-making day.”

original: sabbesaṃ pāpuṇāti, teneva parato vakkhati “asukavihāre vassaṃvutthasaṅghassāti vadati,
analyzed: sabbesam pāpuṇāti tena iva paratas vakkhati asuka vihāre vassaṃvuttha saṅghassa ati vadati
translated: But that is not correct. For it is not said that “it falls to the one who has made kathina to be used for five months” with reference to what arose on the robe-making day. And what arose on the robe-making day does not fall to the one who has kept the rains only; it falls to all who are present. That is why it is said later on: “He says, ‘To the Sangha that has kept the rains in such-and-such a dwelling place.’

original: tatra vassaṃvutthānameva yāva kathinassubbhārā pāpuṇāti. Sace pana gimhānaṃ paṭhamadivasato
analyzed: tatra vassa utthānam eva yāva pāpuṇāti sace pana gimhānam paṭhama divasataḥ
translated: It falls to those who have kept the rains there until the end of the robe season. But if he says this from the first day of the hot season,

original: paṭṭhāya evaṃ vadati, tatra sammukhībhūtānaṃ sabbesaṃ pāpuṇāti. Kasmā? Piṭṭhisamaye uppannattā”ti.
analyzed: paṭṭhāya evam vadati tatra sammukhībhūtānam sabbesam pāpuṇāti kasmā piṭṭhi samaye uppanna ttā ati
translated: it falls to all who are present. Why? Because it arose on the robe-making day.”

original: Ṭhitikā pana na tiṭṭhatīti ettha aṭṭhitāya ṭhitikāya puna aññasmiṃ cīvare uppanne
analyzed: ṭhitikā pana na tiṭṭhati iti ettha aṭṭhitāya ṭhitikāya puna aññasmin cīvare uppanne
translated: “The extension does not apply”: when the extension has not been made, if another robe arises,

original: sace eko bhikkhu āgacchati, majjhe chinditvā dvīhipi gahetabbaṃ. Ṭhitāya pana ṭhitikāya
analyzed: sace ekaḥ bhikkhu āgacchati majjhe chinditvā gahetabbam ṭhitāya pana ṭhitikāya
translated: If one monk comes, it should be taken by both after cutting it in half.

original: puna aññasmiṃ cīvare uppanne sace navakataro āgacchati, ṭhitikā heṭṭhā gacchati.
analyzed: puna aññasmin cīvare uppanne sace navakataraḥ āgacchati ṭhitikā heṭṭhā gacchati
translated: But if a further robe-cloth comes, if the one that comes is newer, the previous one goes below.

original: Sace vuḍḍhataro āgacchati, ṭhitikā uddhamārohati. Atha añño natthi, puna attano pāpetvā
analyzed: sace vuḍḍhataraḥ āgacchati ṭhitikāḥ uddham ārohati atha aññaḥ natthi puna attanaḥ pāpetvā
translated: If the one that comes is older, it goes above. If there is no other, it should be taken after making it one’s own again.

original: gahetabbaṃ. Duggahitāni hontīti ettha saṅghikāneva hontīti adhippāyo. Gahitameva
analyzed: gahetabbam duggahitāni honti iti ettha saṅghikāna eva honti iti adhippāyaḥ gahitam eva
translated: They are not properly taken: the intention is that they are only for the Community.

original: nāmāti “imassa idaṃ patta”nti kiñcāpi na viditaṃ, te pana bhāgā atthato tesaṃ pattāyevāti
analyzed: nāma ati imassa idam pattanti kiñcā api na viditam te pana bhāgāḥ atthato tesam pattāya eva ati
translated: What is called “taken” : although it is not known, “This is his bowl,” the meaning is that those shares are just their bowls.

original: adhippāyo. Itovāti therānaṃ dātabbatoyeva.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ itas vā ati therānam
translated: From here: it should be given only to the senior monks.

original: Saṅghikacīvaruppādakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅghika cīvara uppāda kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the origin of robe-cloth for the Community is finished.

original: Upanandasakyaputtavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: upananda sakyaputta vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the account of the monk Upananda the Sakyan

original: 364. Sattāhavārena aruṇameva uṭṭhāpetīti etaṃ vacanamattameva ekasmiṃ vihāre sattāhakiccābhāvato.
analyzed: sattāha vārena aruṇam eva uṭṭhāpeti iti etam vacanam attam eva ekasmin vihāre sattāha kicca abhāvato
translated: The sun rises after seven days: this statement is just a way of saying that there is no business for seven days in one dwelling place.

original: Idanti ekādhippāyadānaṃ. Nānālābhehītiādīsu nānā visuṃ visuṃ lābho etesūti nānālābhā,🔽dve vihārā, tehi nānālābhehi. Nānā visuṃ visuṃ pākārādīhi paricchinno upacāro etesanti
analyzed: idam ti eka adhippāya dānam nānā lābhehi itiādīsu nānā visum visum lābhaḥ etesu iti nānā lābhā  dve vihārā tehi nānā lābhehi nānā visum visum pākāra ādīhi paricchinnaḥ upacāraḥ
translated: ‘This’: the giving of a single purpose. As regards the words ‘with different gains’ and so on, there are different gains for these, thus they are ‘with different gains’;🔽there are two dwellings, thus they are ‘with different dwellings’;🔽there are different enclosures, etc., for these, thus they are ‘with different enclosures’;

original: nānūpacārā, tehi nānūpacārehi. Ekasīmavihārehīti ekūpacārasīmāyaṃ dvīhi vihārehi.
analyzed: nānūpacārā tehi nānūpacārehi eka sīma vihārehi iti dvīhi vihārehi
translated: there are two dwellings with a single enclosure, thus they are ‘with a single enclosure’.

original: Gilānavatthukathāvaṇṇanā🔽365. Palipannoti nimuggo, makkhitoti attho. Uccāretvāti ukkhipitvā. Samānācariyakoti
analyzed: gilāna vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā  palipannaḥ ti nimuggaḥ makkhito ti attho uccāretvā āti ukkhipitvā samānācariyakaḥ ti
translated: The Discussion of the Case of the Sick Man

original: ettha sacepi ekassa ācariyassa eko antevāsiko hoti, eko saddhivihāriko, etepi aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: ettha sace pi ekassa ācariyassa ekaḥ antevāsikaḥ hoti ekaḥ saddhivihārikaḥ ete pi aññamaññam
translated: ‘Is submerged’: the meaning is, is immersed, is drenched. ‘Having carried out’: having lifted up. ‘With the same teacher’: here, even if there is one pupil and one novice of a single teacher, they are said to be

original: samānācariyakā evāti vadanti.🔽366. Bhesajjaṃ yojetuṃ asamattho hotīti vejjena “idañcidañca bhesajjaṃ gahetvā iminā
analyzed: eva ati vadanti  bhesajjam yojetum asamatthaḥ hoti iti vejjena idam ca idam ca bhesajjam gahetvā iminā
translated: ‘with the same teacher’

original: yojetvā dātabba”nti vutte tathā kātuṃ asamatthoti attho. Nīhātunti nīharituṃ, chaḍḍetunti attho.
analyzed: yojetvā dātabban ti vutte tathā kātum asamatthaḥ iti atthaḥ nīhātum ti nīharitum chaḍḍetum ti atthaḥ
translated: ‘Is unable to apply the medicine’: the meaning is, when the doctor says, ‘Having taken this and this medicine, apply it thus and give it,’ he is unable to do so. ‘To remove’: the meaning is, to take out, to throw away.

original: Matasantakakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Case of the Dead Man’s Requisites

original: 367-369. Bhikkhussa kālakateti ettha kālakata-saddo bhāvasādhanoti āha “kālakiriyāyā”ti. Tattha tattha saṅghassāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ vihāre saṅghassa.
analyzed: bhikkhussa kālakatā iti ettha kālakata saddaḥ bhāva sādhanaḥ ti āha kāla kiriyāya ati tattha tattha saṅghassa ati tasmin tasmin vihāre saṅghassa
translated: The Community’s: the Community’s in that dwelling place.

original: Saṅghe bhinne cīvaruppādakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅghe bhinne cīvara uppāda kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: When the Community is divided, the robe-material should be given to the faction that is present.🔽But in the country where the water runs to the right, the bhikkhus are owners of the gifts by merely taking up the water-offering.

original: 376. Yattha pana dakkhiṇodakaṃ pamāṇanti bhikkhū yasmiṃ raṭṭhe dakkhiṇodakapaaggahaṇamattenapi deyyadhammassa sāmino hontīti adhippāyo. Parasamuddeti jambudīpe.
analyzed: yattha pana dakkhiṇa udakam bhikkhū yasmin raṭṭhe deyya dhammassa sāminaḥ honti iti adhippāyaḥ para samudde ti jambudīpe
translated: The intention is this: in the country where the water runs to the right, the bhikkhus are owners of the gifts by merely taking up the water-offering.🔽From the ocean’s edge: from the Indian mainland.

original: 378. Matakacīvaraṃ adhiṭṭhātīti ettha maggaṃ gacchanto tassa kālakiriyaṃ sutvā avihāraṭṭhāne
analyzed: mataka cīvaram adhiṭṭhāti iti ettha maggam gacchantaḥ tassa kālakiriyam sutvā avihāra ṭṭhāne
translated: He determines the robe-material of the dead: one who is travelling along the road hears of his death in a place where there is no dwelling place for bhikkhus.

original: ce dvādasaratanabbhantare aññesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhāvaṃ ñatvā “idaṃ cīvaraṃ mayhaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti
analyzed: ce dvādasa ratana abbhantare aññesam bhikkhūnam abhāvam ñatvā idam cīvaram mayham pāpuṇāti iti
translated: If he knows that there are no other bhikkhus within twelve leagues, he determines thus: “This robe-material comes to me.”

original: adhiṭṭhāti, svādhiṭṭhitaṃ.🔽Aṭṭhacīvaramātikākathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāti svādhiṭṭhitam  aṭṭha cīvara mātikā kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: It is determined by himself.🔽The eight kinds of robe-material are determined by the method of determining by person.

original: 379. Puggalādhiṭṭhānanayena vuttanti “sīmāyadāna”ntiādinā vattabbe “sīmāya detī”tiādi
analyzed: puggala adhiṭṭhāna nayena vuttanti sīmāya dāna nti ādinā vattabbe sīmāya deti itiādi
translated: The method of determining by the place is stated thus: “He gives in the monastery” and so on.

original: puggalādhiṭṭhānanayena vuttaṃ. Parikkhepārahaṭṭhānena paricchinnāti iminā aparikkhittassa
analyzed: puggala adhiṭṭhāna nayena vuttam parikkhepa āraha ṭṭhānena paricchinnā ti iminā aparikkhittassa
translated: This is said by way of the method of the individual.

original: vihārassa dhuvasannipātaṭṭhānādito paṭhamaleḍḍupātassa anto upacārasīmāti dasseti.
analyzed: vihārassa dhuva sannipāta ṭṭhāna āditas paṭhama leḍḍupātassa antaḥ upacāra sīmā ati dasseti
translated: By “limited by a surrounding area that is suitable for the laying out of a boundary” it is shown that the zone of immediate vicinity is within the first wall-enclosure, etc., of a monastery that is not surrounded by a wall.

original: Idāni dutiyaleḍḍupātassa antopi upacārasīmāyevāti dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādi āraddhaṃ.🔽Dhuvasannipātaṭṭhānampi pariyantagatameva gahetabbaṃ. Bhikkhunīnaṃ ārāmappavesanasenāsanāpucchanādi🔽parivāsamānattārocanavassacchedanissayasenāsanaggāhādi vidhānanti idaṃ sabbaṃ imissāyeva
analyzed: idāni dutiya leḍḍupātassa antaḥ pi upacāra sīmāya iva ati dassetum api ca iti ādi āraddham  dhuva sannipāta ṭṭhānam pi pariyanta gatam eva gahetabbam bhikkhunīnam ārāma ppavesana senāsana āpucchana ādi  parivāsa mānatta ārocana vassa cheda nissaya senāsana ggāha ādi vidhānan ti idam sabbam imissāya eva
translated: Now, in order to show that the zone of immediate vicinity is also within the second wall-enclosure, etc., the words “Moreover, etc.,” are introduced.🔽The place of regular assembly should be taken as far as the boundary.🔽The following should all be understood as applying to this zone of immediate vicinity: the admission of nuns into the monastery, the asking for the dwelling place, the announcement of probation, the announcement of the ending of the probation, the announcement of the invitation, the cutting off of the rains, the taking of a lodging with formal support, and so on.

original: upacārasīmāya vasena veditabbaṃ. Lābhatthāya ṭhapitasīmā lābhasīmā. Samānasaṃvāsaavippavāsasīmāsu
analyzed: upacāra sīmāya vasena veditabbam lābha atthāya ṭhapita sīmā lābha sīmā samāna saṃvāsa a vippavāsa sīmāsu
translated: The boundary that is set out for the sake of gain is the boundary for gain.

original: dinnassa idaṃ nānattaṃ – “avippavāsasīmāya dammī”ti dinnaṃ gāmaṭṭhānaṃ na pāpuṇāti.
analyzed: dinnassa idam nānattam a vippavāsa sīmāya dammi iti dinnam gāmaṭṭhānam na pāpuṇāti
translated: The difference between the boundary for common affiliation and the boundary for not-separately-staying is this: a dwelling place given as “I give to the boundary for not-separately-staying” does not come under the village.

original: Kasmā? “Ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañcā”ti vuttattā. “Samānasaṃvāsakasīmāya dammī”ti
analyzed: kasmai ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacāram ca ati samāna saṃvāsaka sīmāya dammi iti
translated: But if it is given with the words, “I give to the Community of Bhikkhus who use the same resting place as I do,”

original: dinnaṃ pana gāme ṭhitānampi pāpuṇātīti.
analyzed: dinnam pana gāme ṭhitānam pi pāpuṇāti iti
translated: then it reaches those who are in the village.🔽“Sanctioned by the Enlightened One”: approved by the Blessed One.

original: Buddhādhivutthoti buddhena bhagavatā adhivuttho. Ekasminti ekasmiṃ vihāre. Pākavaṭṭanti🔽dānavaṭṭaṃ. Vattatīti pavattati. Paṃsukūlikānampi vaṭṭatīti “tuyhaṃ demā”ti avatvā
analyzed: buddha adhivutthaḥ iti buddhena bhagavatā adhivutthaḥ ekasmin ti ekasmin vihāre  dāna vaṭṭam vattati iti pavattati paṃsukūlikānam pi vaṭṭati iti tuyham dema iti a vatvā
translated: “In one place”: in one monastery. “A regular distribution”: a distribution by turns.🔽“It is distributed”: it is distributed. “It is distributed to the rag-robe wearers too”: it is distributed to the rag-robe wearers because it is said, “We give to the bhikkhus,” “We give to the elders.”

original: “bhikkhūnaṃ dema, therānaṃ demā”ti vuttattā paṃsukūlikānaṃ vaṭṭati. Vicāritamevāti
analyzed: bhikkhūnam dema therānam dema iti vutta ttā paṃsukūlikānam vaṭṭati vicāritam eva ati
translated: “It is already distributed”:

original: upāhanatthavikādīnamatthāya vicāritameva.🔽Upaḍḍhaṃ dātabbanti yaṃ ubhatosaṅghassa dinnaṃ, tato upaḍḍhaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, upaḍḍhaṃ🔽bhikkhunīnaṃ dātabbaṃ. Sacepi eko bhikkhu hoti ekā vā bhikkhunī, antamaso anupasampannassapi
analyzed: vicāritam eva  upaḍḍham dātabbanti yam ubhatosaṅghassa dinnam tatas upaḍḍham bhikkhūnam upaḍḍham  bhikkhunīnam dātabbam sace pi ekaḥ bhikkhu hoti ekā vā bhikkhunī antamasaḥ an upasampannassa api
translated: it is already distributed for the purpose of sandals, a carrying strap, and so on.🔽“Half should be given”: half of what is given to both Communities should be given to the bhikkhus, and half to the bhikkhunis. Even if there is only one bhikkhu or one bhikkhuni, half should be given even to one who is not fully admitted.

original: upaḍḍhameva dātabbaṃ. “Bhikkhusaṅghassa ca bhikkhunīnañca tuyhañcā”ti vutte pana
analyzed: upaḍḍham eva dātabbam bhikkhu saṅghassa ca bhikkhunīnam ca tuyham ca ati vutte pana
translated: But if it is said, “To the Community of Bhikkhus and to the bhikkhunis and to you,”

original: puggalo visuṃ na labhatīti idaṃ aṭṭhakathāpamāṇeneva gahetabbaṃ. Na hettha visesakāraṇaṃ
analyzed: puggalaḥ visum na labhati iti idam aṭṭhakathā pamāṇena iva gahetabbam na ha ittha visesa kāraṇam
translated: “One cannot be found apart from the other” should be understood by the evidence of the commentaries. There is no reason to distinguish between them here.

original: upalabbhati. Tathā hi “ubhatosaṅghassa ca tuyhañca dammī”ti vutte sāmaññavisesavacanehi🔽saṅgahitattā yathā puggalo visuṃ labhati, evamidhāpi “bhikkhusaṅghassa ca tuyhañcā”ti
analyzed: upalabbhati tathā hi ubhato saṅghassa ca dammi iti vutte sāmañña visesa vacanehi  saṅgahita ttā yathā puggalaḥ visum labhati evam idha api bhikkhu saṅghassa ca tuyham ca ati
translated: “One does not get a separate person” should be taken as the measure by the commentary. For no reason for distinction is found here. For when it is said, “I give to both Sanghas and to you,” the words “to both Sanghas” and “to you” are included in the words “to the Sangha” and “to you” respectively.

original: sāmaññavisesavacanasabbhāvato bhavitabbameva visuṃ puggalapaṭivīsenāti viññāyati,
analyzed: sāmañña visesa vacana sabbhāvataḥ bhavitabbam eva visum puggala paṭivīsena ati viññāyati
translated: And so, just as one gets a separate person, so too here, since the words “to the Sangha of bhikkhus” and “to you” are the same in form, it must be that one gets a separate person by the words “to you.”

original: tasmā aṭṭhakathāvacanamevettha pamāṇaṃ. Pāpuṇanaṭṭhānato ekameva labhatīti attano🔽vassaggena pattaṭṭhānato ekameva koṭṭhāsaṃ labhati. Tattha kāraṇamāha “kasmā? Bhikkhusaṅghaggahaṇena
analyzed: tasmai aṭṭhakathā vacanam eva ittha pamāṇam pāpuṇana ṭhānataḥ ekam eva labhati iti attano  vassaggena patta ṭṭhānato ekam eva koṭṭhāsam labhati tattha kāraṇam āha kasmā bhikkhu saṅgha ggahaṇena
translated: This is understood. Therefore the commentary is the measure here.

original: gahitattā”ti, bhikkhusaṅghaggahaṇeneva puggalassapi gahitattāti adhippāyo. Bhikkhusaṅghassa
analyzed: gahita ttā ti bhikkhu saṅgha ggahaṇena iva puggalassa pi gahita ttā ti adhippāyaḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: “He gets only one by the place of arrival” means that he gets only one share by the place of his own arrival. Here the reason is given: “Why? Because he is included by the words ‘to the Sangha of bhikkhus.’“ The intention is: because the person is included by the words “to the Sangha of bhikkhus” alone.

original: harāti vuttepi haritabbanti īdisaṃ gihiveyyāvaccaṃ na hotīti katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vutte pi haritabbam ti īdisam gihi veyyāvaccam na hoti iti katvā vuttam
translated: Even when it is said, “He takes away from the Sangha of bhikkhus,” it is not like this: “He should take away.”

original: Lakkhaṇaññū vadantīti idaṃ sanniṭṭhānavacanaṃ, aṭṭhakathāsu anāgatattā pana evaṃ🔽vuttaṃ. Bahiupacārasīmāyaṃ…pe… sabbesaṃ pāpuṇātīti yattha katthaci vutthavassānaṃ🔽sabbesaṃ pāpuṇātīti adhippāyo. Teneva mātikāṭṭhakathāyampi “sace pana bahiupacārasīmāyaṃ
analyzed: lakkhaṇaññū vadanti iti idam sanniṭṭhāna vacanam aṭṭhakathāsu anāgata ttā pana evam  vuttam sabbesam pāpuṇāti iti yattha katthaci vuttha vassānam  sabbesam pāpuṇāti iti adhippāyaḥ tena iva mātikā aṭṭhakathā ayam pi sace pana bahi upacāra sīmā ayam
translated: “He says, ‘I give to the Saṅgha that has kept the rains,’ ” is a statement of conclusion. But because it is not found in the commentaries, it is said

original: ṭhito ‘vassaṃvutthasaṅghassā’ti vadati, yattha katthaci vutthavassānaṃ sabbesaṃ sampattānaṃ🔽pāpuṇātī”ti vuttaṃ. Gaṇṭhipadesu pana “vassāvāsassa ananurūpe padese ṭhatvā vuttattā🔽vassaṃvutthānaṃ avutthānañca sabbesaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ. Na hi
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ vassaṃvuttha saṅghassa ati vadati yattha katthaci vuttha vassānam sabbesam sampattānam  pāpuṇāti iti vuttam gaṇṭhi padesu pana vassāvāsassa ananurūpe padese ṭhatvā vutta ttā  sabbesam pāpuṇāti iti vuttam tat na gahetabbam na hi
translated: thus. “In the vicinity of the monastery zone” … “to all” : the intention is that it goes to all who have kept the rains anywhere. That is why it is said in the commentary on the mātikā: “But if he says, ‘I give to the Saṅgha that has kept the rains,’ in the vicinity of the monastery zone, it goes to all who have kept the rains anywhere and have arrived there.”

original: “vassaṃvutthasaṅghassa dammī”ti vutte avutthavassānaṃ pāpuṇāti. Evaṃ vadatīti “vassaṃvutthasaṅghassa🔽dammī”ti vadati. Uddesaṃ gahetuṃ āgatoti tassa santike uddesaṃ agahitapubbassapi
analyzed: vassaṃvuttha saṅghassa dammi iti vutte avuttha vassānam pāpuṇāti evam vadati iti vassaṃvuttha saṅghassa 🔽dammi iti vadati uddesam gahetum āgataḥ ti tassa santike uddesam a gahita pubbassa api
translated: But in the Gaṇṭhi it is said: “Because he says it in a place that is not suitable for the residence of the rains, it goes to all who have kept the rains and to those who have not.” But that should not be accepted. For if he says, “I give to the Saṅgha that has kept the rains,” it does not go to those who have not kept the rains. “He says thus” means he says, “I give to the Saṅgha that has kept the rains.” “Has come to receive the recitation” means that even if he has not previously received the recitation in his presence,

original: uddesaṃ gaṇhissāmīti āgatakālato paṭṭhāya antevāsikabhāvūpagamanato vuttaṃ. Sesamettha suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: uddesam gaṇhissāmi iti āgata kālataḥ paṭṭhāya antevāsika bhāva upagamanataḥ vuttam sesam ettha su viññeyyam eva
translated: “I will learn the recitation” means from the time of coming to learn the recitation, from the time of accepting the position of pupil. The rest here is quite clear.

original: Aṭṭhacīvaramātikākathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭha cīvara mātikā kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the chapter on the eight kinds of robes is finished.

original: Cīvarakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: cīvara khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the chapter on robes is finished.

analyzed: ukkhitta anuvattake vadeyya  kammam kopeti iti nānā saṃvāsaka catutthaḥ ce bhikkhave kammam kareyya akammam

analyzed: tattha nisinnaḥ api tam kammam kopeti iti adhippāyaḥ upacāram muñcitvā iti ettha upacāraḥ
