analyzed: pārivāsika khandhake navakataram pārivāsikanti attanaḥ navakataram pārivāsikaṃ
translated: In the chapter on those on probation, one who is more junior: a probationer who is more junior than himself.

original: Pārivāsikassa hi attano navakataraṃ pārivāsikaṃ ṭhapetvā aññe mūlāyapaṭikassanārahamānattārahamānattacārikaabbhānārahāpi🔽pakatattaṭṭhāneyeva tiṭṭhanti. Tenāha “antamaso mūlāyapaakassanārahādīnampī”ti. Pāde🔽ghaṃsenti etenāti pādaghaṃsanaṃ, sakkharakathalādi. “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tisso
analyzed: pārivāsikassa hi attanaḥ navakataram pārivāsikam ṭhapetvā aññe  tiṭṭhanti tena āha antamasaḥ pāde  ghaṃsenti etena ati pāda ghaṃsanam sakkhara kathala ādi anujānāmi bhikkhave tissaḥ
translated: For one on probation, except for a probationer who is more junior than himself, others who deserve to be sent back to the beginning, who deserve the trial period, who are undertaking the trial period, and who deserve rehabilitation🔽all stand in the position of one who is senior to him. That is why he says “at least to those who deserve to be sent back to the beginning, etc.” He should rub their feet with his: the rubbing of the feet is with sand, potsherds, etc. “Monks, I allow three kinds of foot-rubbing: with sand, with potsherds, and with sea-foam.”

original: pādaghaṃsaniyo sakkharaṃ kathalaṃ samuddapheṇaka”nti hi vuttaṃ. Saddhivihārikādīnampi
analyzed: sakkharam kathalam samuddapheṇakan ti hi vuttam saddhivihārika ādīnam pi
translated: For his student, etc.,

original: sādiyantassāti saddhivihārikānampi abhivādanādiṃ sādiyantassa. “Mā maṃ gāmappavesanaṃ🔽āpucchathā”ti vutte anāpucchāpi gāmaṃ pavisituṃ vaṭṭati. Yo yo vuḍḍhoti pārivāsikesu
analyzed: sādiyantassa ati saddhivihārikānam pi abhivādana ādim sādiyantassa mā mama gāma pavesanam  āpucchatha iti vutte an āpucchā api gāmam pavisitum vaṭṭati yaḥ yaḥ vuḍḍho ti pārivāsikesu
translated: If he consents to the duties: if he consents to the duties of a pupil, such as paying respect to his co-resident. If he says, “Don’t ask permission to enter the village,” then he may enter the village without asking permission. To each senior monk:🔽

original: bhikkhūsu yo yo vuḍḍho. Navakatarassa sāditunti pārivāsikanavakatarassa abhivādanādiṃ sādituṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhūsu yaḥ yaḥ vuḍḍhaḥ navakatarassa sāditunti pārivāsika navakatarassa abhivādana ādim sāditum
translated: If he consents: if he consents to the duties of a pupil being done to him. If he says, “Don’t ask permission to enter the village,” then it’s allowable to enter the village without asking permission. To each senior: to each probationary monk. To consent to the duties: to consent to the duties of a pupil being done to a probationer who is junior to him.

original: Tatthevāti saṅghanavakaṭṭhāneyeva. Attano pāḷiyā pavāretabbanti attano vassaggena
analyzed: tattha iva ati saṅgha navaka ṭṭhāneya iva attanaḥ pāḷiyā pavāretabbanti attanaḥ vassaggena
translated: Right there: right there in the position of a junior monk. He should invite according to his own recitation: he should invite according to his own Rains retreat.

original: pattapāḷiyā pavāretabbaṃ, na pana sabbesu pavāritesūti attho. Yadi pana na gaṇhāti🔽na vissajjetīti yadi purimadivase attano na gaṇhāti gahetvā ca na vissajjeti. Catussālabhattanti
analyzed: patta pāḷiyā pavāretabbam na pana sabbesu pavāritesu iti atthaḥ yadi pana na gaṇhāti  na vissajjeti iti yadi purima divase attanaḥ na gaṇhāti gahetvā ca na vissajjeti catur sālabhattanti
translated: The meaning is that he should invite after all the others have invited. If he doesn’t take it

original: bhojanasālāyaṃ paṭipāṭiyā diyyamānabhattaṃ. Hatthapāse ṭhitenāti dāyakassa hatthapāse ṭhitena.
analyzed: bhojana sālāyam paṭipāṭiyā diyyamāna bhattam hattha pāse ṭhitena ati dāyakassa hattha pāse ṭhitena
translated: or give it: if he doesn’t take it on the previous day, and having taken it, he doesn’t give it. The meal in the four-section hall: the meal given in turn in the dining hall. Standing within arm’s reach: standing within arm’s reach of the donor.

original: 76. Añño sāmaṇero na gahetabboti upajjhāyena hutvā añño sāmaṇero na gahetabbo. Upajjhaṃ🔽datvā gahitasāmaṇerāpīti pakatattakāle upajjhaṃ datvā gahitasāmaṇerāpi. Laddhasammutikena🔽āṇattopi garudhammehi aññehi vā ovadituṃ labhatīti āha “paṭibalassa vā bhikkhussa🔽bhāro kātabbo”ti. Āgatā bhikkhuniyo vattabbāti sambandho. Savacanīyanti sadosaṃ.
analyzed: aññaḥ sāmaṇeraḥ na gahetabbo iti upajjhāyena hutvā aññaḥ sāmaṇeraḥ na gahetabbo upajjhaṃ  da tvā gahita sāmaṇerā api iti pakatatta kāle upajjham da tvā gahita sāmaṇerā api laddha sammutikena  āṇattaḥ api garu dhammehi aññehi vā ovaditum labhati iti āha paṭibalassa vā bhikkhussa  bhāraḥ kātabbaḥ ti āgatāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ vattabbā ati sambandhaḥ savacanīyanti sa dosam
translated: “Another novice should not be taken”: another novice should not be taken as a pupil. “Having given the status of preceptor”: having given the status of preceptor to one who has already taken a novice, “one who has received permission”: one who has received permission from the Sangha. “He may advise the other novices in the training rules”: he may advise the other novices in the training rules, or in other matters, if he is told to do so. “The duty of a pupil should be done to one who is qualified”: the duty of a pupil should be done to a monk who is qualified. “The nuns who have come should be told”: the construction is: “the nuns who have come should be told.” “With a rebuke”: with a criticism.

original: Jeṭṭhakaṭṭhānaṃ na kātabbanti padhānaṭṭhānaṃ na kātabbaṃ. Kiṃ tanti āha “pātimokkhuddesakena vā”tiādi.🔽Rajehi hatā upahatā bhūmi etissāti rajohatabhūmi, rajokiṇṇabhūmīti attho. Paccayanti🔽vassāvāsikalābhaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Ekapasse ṭhatvāti pāḷiṃ vihāya bhikkhūnaṃ pacchato
analyzed: jeṭṭhaka ṭṭhānam na kātabbanti padhāna ṭṭhānam na kātabbam kim tat ti āha pātimokkha uddesakena vā itiādi 🔽rajehi hatā upahatā bhūmi etissa ati rajaḥ hata bhūmi rajaḥ kiṇṇa bhūmi iti 🔽vassāvāsika lābham sandhāya vuttam eka passe ṭhatvā iti pāḷim vihāya bhikkhūnam pacchatas
translated: “Another novice should not be taken”: another novice should not be taken as a pupil. “Having given the status of a pupil”: having given the status of a pupil to one who was a novice. “One who has been told by one who has obtained permission”: one who has been told by another who has been told by one who has obtained permission. “One who is qualified”: one who is qualified to advise and instruct. “The burden should be taken up”: the burden of a pupil should be taken up. “The bhikkhunis who have come”: the bhikkhunis who have come should be told. “With a rebuke”: with a fault. “The position of the senior should not be taken up”: the position of the chief should not be taken up. “What is that?” “One who recites the Pāṭimokkha” and so on. “A place that is covered with dust”: a place that is covered with dust that has arisen from the earth. “Conditions”: this refers to the conditions for the rains residence. “Standing in one place”: having left the text, behind the bhikkhus.

original: ṭhatvā. Senāsanaṃ na labhatīti seyyāpariyantabhāgitāya vassaggena gaṇhituṃ na labhati.
analyzed: ṭhatvā senāsanam na labhati iti seyyā pariyanta bhāgitāya vassaggena gaṇhitum na labhati
translated: He does not get a dwelling: he does not get one by the method of taking a turn according to seniority, because he is not entitled to a choice place.

original: Assāti bhaveyya. “Āgantukena ārocetabbaṃ, āgantukassa ārocetabba”nti avisesena vuttattā
analyzed: assa ati bhaveyya āgantukena ārocetabbam āgantukassa ārocetabbam ti avisesena vuttattā
translated: He might: because of the words “He should announce himself to the incoming bhikkhu. The incoming bhikkhu should announce himself” without distinction,

original: sace dve pārivāsikā gataṭṭhāne aññamaññaṃ passanti, ubhohipi aññamaññassa ārocetabbaṃ.
analyzed: sace dve pārivāsikāḥ gata ṭṭhāne aññamaññam passanti ubhohi pi aññamaññassa ārocetabbam
translated: if two probationers meet in the place they are going to, they should announce themselves to each other.

original: Yathā bahi disvā ārocitassa bhikkhuno vihāraṃ āgate puna ārocanakiccaṃ natthi, evaṃ
analyzed: yathā bahi disvā ārocitassa bhikkhuno vihāram āgate puna ārocana kiccam na atthi evam
translated: Just as when a bhikkhu has announced himself outside and then enters the dwelling, there is no need for him to announce himself again,

analyzed: aññam vihāram gatena api tattha pubbe ārocitassa puna ārocana kiccam natthi iti vadanti
translated: so too, when one has announced himself in one dwelling, there is no need to announce himself again in another dwelling there.

original: 81. Avisesenāti pārivāsikassa ukkhittakassa ca avisesena. Obaddhanti palibuddhaṃ.
analyzed: avisesena ati pārivāsikassa ukkhittakassa ca avisesena obaddham ti palibuddham
translated: Without distinction: without making any distinction between a probationer and one who is subject to information. Obstructed: obstructed by.

original: 83. Sahavāsoti vuttappakāre channe pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ sayanameva adhippetaṃ, na sesairiyāpathakappanaṃ. Sesamettha suviññeyyameva.🔽Pārivāsikakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sahavāsaḥ ti vutta ppakāre channe pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhim sayanam eva adhippetam na sesa eriyāpatha kappanam sesam ettha su viññeyyam eva 🔽pārivāsika khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: Co-residence: only sleeping with a regular bhikkhu of the kind stated is intended, not the performance of the other postures. The rest is easily intelligible here.

original: 3. Samuccayakkhandhakaṃ🔽Sukkavissaṭṭhikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: 3. The chapter on the collective🔽The explanation of the sub-chapter on those on probation

analyzed: samuccaya khandhake vutta nayena vattam samādātabbanti pārivāsika khandhaka vaṇṇanāyam
translated: As in the chapter on the collective, the proper conduct should be undertaken. As in the explanation of the sub-chapter on those on probation,

analyzed: vutta nayena dvīhi padehi ekena vā samādātabbam vediyāmi iti cittena sampaṭicchitvā
translated: it should be undertaken with two or one statement.

original: sukhaṃ anubhavāmi, na tappaccayā ahaṃ dukkhitoti adhippāyo. Vuttanayeneva saṅghamajjhe🔽nikkhipitabbanti pārivāsikakkhandhake vuttanayena “mānattaṃ nikkhipāmi, vattaṃ nikkhipāmī”ti
analyzed: sukham anubhavāmi na tad paccayā aham dukkhitaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ vutta nayena iva saṅgha majjhe  nikkhipitabbanti pārivāsika khandhake vutta nayena mānattam nikkhipāmi vattam nikkhipāmi iti

As in the explanation of the sub-chapter on those on probation,🔽it should be relinquished with two or one statement: ‘I relinquish the trial period’, ‘I relinquish the proper conduct’.

analyzed: vatta bheda dukkaṭa parimocana attham vuttam dve leḍḍupāte atikkamitvā iti bhikkhūnam sajjhāyana sadda savana upacāra vijahana attham
translated: ‘After going beyond two throwing stones’: this is said for the purpose of avoiding the vicinity of the study hall of the monks.

analyzed: vuttam mahāmaggataḥ okkamma ati magga ppaṭipanna bhikkhūnam upacāra vijahana attham gumbena

analyzed: sabbesam pi ārocetabbattā ayam nikkhittavattassa parihāraḥ ti vuttam tattha nikkhittavattassa ati

analyzed: vattam nikkhipitvā parivasantassa ati atthaḥ ayam pana ittha therassa adhippāyaḥ vattam
translated: when one is living after announcing the offence. The Elder’s intention here is this:

analyzed: nikkhipitvā parivasantassa upacāra gatānam sabbesam ārocana kiccam natthi diṭṭha rūpānam

original: sutasaddānaṃ ārocetabbaṃ, adiṭṭhaasutānampi antodvādasahatthagatānaṃ ārocetabbaṃ.
analyzed: suta saddānam ārocetabbam a diṭṭha a sutānam pi antodvādasa hattha gatānam ārocetabbam
translated: It should be announced to those within twelve bow-lengths who have neither seen nor heard about it.

original: Idaṃ vattaṃ nikkhipitvā parivasantassa lakkhaṇanti.
analyzed: idam vattam nikkhipitvā parivasantassa lakkhaṇanti
translated: This is the characteristic of one who is living after announcing the offence.

original: Parivāsakathāvaṇṇanā🔽102. “Satiyeva antarāye antarāyikasaññī chādeti, acchannā hoti. Antarāyikassa pana
analyzed: parivāsa kathā vaṇṇanā  satiyā iva antarāye antarāyika saññī chādeti a channā hoti antarāyikassa pana

original: anantarāyikasaññāya chādayato acchannāvā”tipi pāṭho. Averīti hitakāmo. Uddhaste aruṇeti

translated: the act of emitting semen and so on.

analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhī iti vatthu ca iva gottam ca ati sukka vissaṭṭhī iti idam asuci mocana lakkhaṇassa  vītikkamassa pakāsanataḥ vatthu ca iva hoti sajātiya sādhāraṇa vijātiya vinivatta sabhāvāya
translated: The offense entailing suspension called “semen”: this is the action that is the basis for the offense,🔽because it is the act of emitting semen that is confessed. And it is the class of offenses,

analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhiyāḥ eva pakāsanataḥ gottam ca hoti iti atthaḥ gam tāyati iti hi gottam saṅgha ādisesaḥ ti  nāman ca iva āpatti ca ati saṅgha ādisesaḥ ti tena tena vītikkamena āpannassa āpatti nikāyassa

Because the name of the class of offenses committed by the one who confesses is confessed,

analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam
translated: “Venerable sirs, may the Sangha listen to me. This monk so-and-so has committed one offense entailing suspension.

original: sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ ekāhapaṭicchannaṃ, so saṅghaṃ ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā🔽ekāhapaṭicchannāya ekāhaparivāsaṃ yāci. Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno ekissā āpattiyā
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhim eka aha paṭicchannam saḥ saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā  eka aha paṭicchannāya eka aha parivāsam yāci saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno ekissā āpattiyā
translated: He’s asked the Sangha to give him probation for one day for that offense,

original: sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā ekāhapaṭicchannāya ekāhaparivāsaṃ adāsi. So parivutthaparivāso.
analyzed: sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyaḥ eka aha paṭicchannāya eka aha parivāsam adāsi saḥ parivuttha parivāsaḥ
translated: and the Sangha has given him that probation. He’s now completed that probation.

original: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajji sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ appaṭicchannaṃ,🔽so saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ āpattīnaṃ sañcetanikānaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhīnaṃ paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu ekam āpattim āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim appaṭicchannam  saḥ saṅgham tāsam āpattīnam sañcetanikānam sukka vissaṭṭhīnam paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya
translated: This monk has committed one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for one day.

original: ca chārattaṃ mānattaṃ yācati. Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno🔽dvinnaṃ āpattīnaṃ sañcetanikānaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhīnaṃ paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya
analyzed: ca chārattam mānattam yācati yadi saṅghassa patta kallam saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno  dvinnam āpattīnam sañcetanikānam sukka vissaṭṭhīnam paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya
translated: He’s asked the Sangha to give him the trial period of six days for those offenses,

original: ca chārattaṃ mānattaṃ dadeyya, esā ñatti.
analyzed: ca chārattam mānattam dadeyya esā ñatti
translated: and the Sangha has given him that trial period.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante…pe… so parivutthaparivāso. Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu ekaṃ āpattiṃ🔽āpajji sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ appaṭicchannaṃ, so saṅghaṃ tāsaṃ…pe… yācati.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante īpe saḥ parivuttha parivāsaḥ ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu ekam āpattim  āpajji sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim appaṭicchannam saḥ saṅgham yācati
translated: “Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me. … He has now completed the trial period and is asking for the trial period of six days to be given to him for two offenses. …

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnaṃ āpattīnaṃ sañcetanikānaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhīnaṃ🔽paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya ca chārattaṃ mānattaṃ deti. Yassāyasmato khamati
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnam āpattīnam sañcetanikānam sukka vissaṭṭhīnam  paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya ca chārattam mānattam deti yassa ayasmataḥ khamati
translated: The Sangha gives the monk so-and-so the trial period of six days for two offenses—one concealed and one unconcealed.

original: itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnaṃ āpattīnaṃ sañcetanikānaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhīnaṃ paṭicchannāya
analyzed: itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnam āpattīnam sañcetanikānam sukka vissaṭṭhīnam paṭicchannāya
translated: Any monk who approves of giving him the trial period of six days for two offenses—one concealed and one unconcealed—

original: ca appaṭicchannāya ca chārattaṃ mānattassa dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa. Yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: ca appaṭicchannāya ca chārattam mānattassa dānam so tuṇhassa yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: should remain silent. Any monk who does not approve should speak up.🔽For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṃ vadāmi…pe… tatiyampi etamatthaṃ vadāmi…pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: Dinnaṃ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnaṃ āpattīnaṃ sañcetanikānaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhīnaṃ
analyzed: dinnam saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dvinnam āpattīnam sañcetanikānam sukka vissaṭṭhīnam
translated: The Sangha has given the monk so-and-so the trial period of six days for two offenses—one concealed and one unconcealed.

original: paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya ca chārattaṃ mānattaṃ, khamati saṅghassa, tasmā
analyzed: paṭicchannāya ca appaṭicchannāya ca chārattam mānattam khamati saṅghassa tasmai
translated: and for six days on the concealed and unconcealed, the Sangha forgives him. Since there is silence,

original: tuṇhī. Evametaṃ dhārayāmīti –
analyzed: tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: I will regard it as follows.

original: Evaṃ kammavācaṃ katvā mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ. Ciṇṇamānattassa ca imināva nayena kammavācaṃ yojetvā abbhānaṃ kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: evam kamma vācam katvā mānattam dātabbam ciṇṇa mānattassa ca iminā ava nayena kamma vācam yojetvā abbhānam kātabbam
translated: After the announcement, the trial period should be given. And after the trial period has been completed, the announcement should be made in the same way as the announcement of the trial period.

original: Aññasminti suddhantaparivāsavasena āpattivuṭṭhānato aññasmiṃ. Dasasataṃ āpattiyo rattisataṃ chādayitvāti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: aññasmin ti suddhanta parivāsa vasena āpatti vuṭṭhānato aññasmin dasa satam āpattiyo ratti satam chādayitvā iti yojetabbam
translated: In another way: apart from the way of clearing offenses through the purification process. One hundred offenses and one hundred days: this is how it should be connected.

original: Parivāsakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Attano sīmaṃ sodhetvā vihārasīmāyāti vihāre baddhasīmameva sandhāya vuttaṃ. Vihārūpacāratopi🔽dve leḍḍupātā atikkamitabbāti bhikkhuvihāraṃ sandhāya vadati gāmūpacārātikkameneva
analyzed: parivāsa kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sīmam sodhetvā vihāra sīmāyā ati vihāre baddha sīmam eva sandhāya vuttam vihāra upacārataḥ pi  dve leḍḍupātā atikkamitabbā ati bhikkhuvihāram sandhāya vadati gāma upacāra atikkamena iva
translated: The explanation of the section on the purification process is finished.🔽Having purified his own monastery zone: this refers to the zone that is fixed for a monastery. The monastery zone:🔽he should go beyond two stone-throws. He is referring to the monks’ dwelling. Since the going beyond the monastery zone is the same as the going beyond the inhabited area,

original: bhikkhunīvihārūpacārātikkamassa siddhattā. Vihārassa cāti bhikkhuvihārassa. Gāmassāti
analyzed: bhikkhunī vihāra upacāra atikkamassa siddha ttā vihārassa ca ati bhikkhu vihārassa gāmassa ati
translated: the going beyond the nuns’ dwelling is included. The monastery:🔽the monks’ dwelling. The inhabited area:

original: na vuttanti gāmassa upacāraṃ muñcituṃ vaṭṭatīti na vuttaṃ, tasmā gāmūpacārepi vaṭṭatīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: na vuttam ti gāmassa upacāram muñcitum vaṭṭati iti na vuttam tasmā gāma upacāre pi vaṭṭati iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “Not stated” means that it is not stated that it is allowable to leave the vicinity of the village. Therefore the intention is that it is allowable also within the vicinity of the village.

original: Tattheva ṭhānaṃ paccāsīsantīti bhikkhūnaṃ ṭhānaṃ paccāsīsanti. Parivāsavattādīnanti
analyzed: tattha eva ṭhānam paccāsīsanti iti bhikkhūnam ṭhānam paccāsīsanti parivāsavatta ādīnam ti
translated: “If they should wish to spend the night there”: if they should wish to spend the night in the place of the bhikkhus. “The probation, etc.”:

original: parivāsanissayapaṭippassaddhiādīnaṃ. Yuttataraṃ dissatīti iminā anikkhittavattabhikkhunā
analyzed: parivāsa nissaya paṭippassaddhi ādīnam yuttataram dissati iti iminā anikkhittavattabhikkhunā
translated: the ending of the probation, the ending of the endurance of the penalty, and so on. “It is seen to be more fitting”: by this he shows that just as it is not allowable for a bhikkhu who has not yet done the proclamation to announce it to bhikkhunis, so too it is not allowable for a bhikkhuni who has not yet done the proclamation to announce it to bhikkhus.

original: viya bhikkhuniyāpi antoupacārasīmagatānaṃyeva ārocetabbaṃ, na gāme ṭhitānampi gantvā
analyzed: viya bhikkhuniyā api antar upacāra sīma gatānam yeva ārocetabbam na gāme ṭhitānam pi gantvā
translated: And he shows that it should be announced to those bhikkhus who are within the vicinity of the monastery or within the monastery zone, not to those who are in the village.

original: ārocetabbanti dīpeti. Tasmiṃ gāmeti yasmiṃ gāme bhikkhunupassayo hoti, tasmiṃ gāme.
analyzed: ārocetabbanti dīpeti tasmim gāme iti yasmin gāme bhikkhu upassayaḥ hoti tasmim gāme
translated: “In that village”: in the village where the bhikkhunis’ resting place is.

original: Bahi upacārasīmāya ṭhatvāti upacārasīmato bahi ṭhatvā. Sammannitvā dātabbāti ettha🔽sammannitvā dinnāya sahavāsepi ratticchedo na hoti.
analyzed: bahi upacāra sīmāya ṭhatvā ati upacāra sīmataḥ bahi ṭhatvā sammannitvā dātabbā ati ettha  sammannitvā dinnāya sahavāse pi ratti chedaḥ na hoti
translated: “Standing outside the vicinity of the monastery zone”: standing outside the monastery zone. “Having announced it and given it”:

original: Paṭicchannaparivāsakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭicchanna parivāsa kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: if it is given after announcing it, there is no break in the continuity of residence even if it is given together with the robe-cloth.

original: 108. Visuṃ mānattaṃ caritabbanti mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ akatvā visuṃ kammavācāya mānattaṃ gahetvā caritabbaṃ.
analyzed: visum mānattam caritabbanti mūlāya paṭikassanam a katvā visum kamma vācāya mānattam gahetvā caritabbam
translated: He should do the probation separately: he should do the probation by taking it with a separate announcement of the transaction without sending back to the beginning.

original: Sukkavissaṭṭhikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhi kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the case of emission of semen is finished.

original: Agghasamodhānaparivāsakathāvaṇṇanā🔽134. Ekāpattimūlakanti “ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā, ekā āpatti dvīhappaṭicchannā”tiādinā🔽vuttanayaṃ sandhāya vadati. Āpattivaḍḍhanakanti “ekā āpatti ekāhappaṭicchannā, dve
analyzed: aggha samodhāna parivāsa kathā vaṇṇanā  eka āpatti mūlakanti ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā ekā āpatti dvīha ppaṭicchannā ati ādinā  vutta nayam sandhāya vadati āpattivaḍḍhanakan ti ekā āpatti eka aha ppaṭicchannā dve
translated: The discussion of the simultaneous probationer🔽The method of one offence: he says this referring to the method stated thus, “One offence concealed for one day … One offence concealed for two days … ”

original: āpattiyo dvīhappaṭicchannā”tiādinā vuttaṃ āpattivaḍḍhanakanayaṃ sandhāya.
analyzed: āpattiyaḥ dvīha paṭicchannā iti ādinā vuttam āpattivaḍḍhanaka nayam sandhāya
translated: The method of increasing the offences: he says this referring to the method stated thus, “One offence concealed for one day … Two offences concealed for two days … ”

original: Dvebhikkhuvāraekādasakādikathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The discussion of the two-bhikkhu- transaction-eleven-offences, etc.

original: 181. Thullaccayādīhi missakanti ekavatthumhi pubbabhāge āpannathullaccayadukkaṭehi missakaṃ. Makkhadhammo nāma chādetukāmatā.
analyzed: thullaccaya ādīhi missakanti eka vatthumhi pubbabhāge āpanna thullaccaya dukkaṭehi missakam makkha dhammaḥ nāma chādetu kāma tā
translated: Mixed with a serious offence, etc.: mixed with a serious offence and a wrong-doing committed in the preliminary stage in one action.

original: 182. Sambahulā saṅghādisesā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇampītiādi jātivasenekavacanaṃ, bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso vā. Sesamettha pāḷito aṭṭhakathāto ca suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: sambahulā saṅgha ādi sesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati parimāṇam pi itiādi jāti vasena ekavacanam bhāva napuṃsaka niddesaḥ vā sesam ettha pāḷitaḥ aṭṭhakathāto ca su viññeyyam eva
translated: “He falls into several offenses entailing suspension, even if only a little” is a singular form in the feminine, or a description in the masculine. The rest is easy to understand in the text and the commentary.

original: Samuccayakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: samuccaya khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the chapter on the collection is finished.

original: 4. Samathakkhandhakaṃ
translated: The chapter on settling

original: Sammukhāvinayakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sammukha avinaya kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the legal procedure of resolution face-to-face

original: 187. Samathakkhandhake saññāpetīti ettha saṃ-saddūpapado ñā-saddo tosanavisiṭṭhe avabodhane vattatīti āha “paritosetvā jānāpetī”ti.
analyzed: samatha khandhake saññāpeti iti ettha saṃsadda upapadaḥ ñā saddaḥ tosana visiṭṭhe avabodhane vattati iti āha paritosetvā jānāpeti iti
translated: In the chapter on settling, “he should make them admit” is said. The word ñā, which has the prefix saṃ, is used for understanding that is distinguished by satisfaction. Therefore it is said, “after satisfying them, he should make them understand”.

original: Sativinayādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sati vinaya ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of resolution through recollection, etc.

original: 195-200. Desanāmattamevetanti “pañcimānī”ti etaṃ desanāmattaṃ. Sativepullappattassa
analyzed: desanā mattam eva etat ti pañcimāni iti etam desanā mattam sati vepulla ppattassa
translated: “It is just the teaching” means that “there are these five” is just the teaching. Resolution that is given to one who has attained fullness of mindfulness

original: khīṇāsavassa dātabbo vinayo sativinayo. Amūḷhassa dātabbo vinayo amūḷhavinayo. Paṭiññātena
analyzed: khīṇāsavassa dātabbaḥ vinayaḥ sati vinayaḥ amūḷhassa dātabbaḥ vinayaḥ amūḍha vinayo paṭiññātena
translated: and whose effluents are ended is resolution through recollection. Resolution that is given to one who is not confused is resolution because of past insanity.

original: karaṇaṃ paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: karaṇam paṭiññāta karaṇam
translated: A legal procedure consisting of getting consent is a procedure consisting of getting consent.

original: 212. Tiṇavatthārakasadisattāti taṃsadisatāya tabbohāroti dasseti yathā “esa brahmadatto”ti.
analyzed: tiṇavatthāraka sadisa ttā ati tad sadisa tāya tad bohāraḥ iti dasseti yathā esa brahmadatto ti
translated: “It is like the covering over as if with grass” shows that it is like that, that it is removed by that. As in the case of “This is Brahmadatta”.

original: Adhikaraṇakathāvaṇṇanā🔽216. Vivādādhikaraṇassa kiṃ mūlantiādīsu vivādamūlānīti vivādassa mūlāni. Kodhanoti🔽kujjhanalakkhaṇena kodhena samannāgato. Upanāhīti veraappaṭinissaggalakkhaṇena upanāhena🔽samannāgato. Agāravoti gāravavirahito. Appatissoti appatissayo anīcavutti. Ettha🔽pana yo bhikkhu satthari dharamāne tīsu kālesu upaṭṭhānaṃ na yāti, satthari anupāhane
analyzed: adhikaraṇa kathā vaṇṇanā  vivāda adhikaraṇassa kim mūlantiādīsu vivāda mūlāni iti vivādassa mūlāni  kujjhana lakkhaṇena kodhena samannāgataḥ upanāhi iti veraa paṭinissagga lakkhaṇena upanāhena  samannāgataḥ agāravo ti gārava virahitaḥ appatisso ti appatissayaḥ anīca vutti ettha  pana yaḥ bhikkhu satthari dharamāne tīsu kālesu upaṭṭhānam na yāti satthari an upāhane
translated: The explanation of the discussion

original: caṅkamante saupāhano caṅkamati, nīce caṅkame caṅkamante ucce caṅkamati, heṭṭhā vasante🔽upari vasati, satthu dassanaṭṭhāne ubho aṃse pārupati, chattaṃ dhāreti, upāhanaṃ🔽dhāreti, nahāyati, uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā karoti, parinibbute vā pana cetiyaṃ vandituṃ🔽na gacchati, cetiyassa paññāyanaṭṭhāne satthudassanaṭṭhāne vuttaṃ sabbaṃ karoti,
analyzed: caṅkamante saupāhano caṅkamati nīce caṅkame caṅkamante ucce caṅkamati heṭṭhā vasante 🔽upari vasati satthu dassanaṭṭhāne ubho aṃse pārupati chattam dhāreti upāhanam 🔽dhāreti nahāyati uccāram vā passāvam vā karoti parinibbute vā pana cetiyam vanditum 🔽na gacchati cetiyassa paññāyana ṭhāne satthu dassana ṭhāne vuttam sabbam karoti
translated: What are the roots of a legal issue arising from a dispute? The roots of a dispute. He is angry: he is endowed with anger, which has the characteristic of irritation. He is spiteful: he is endowed with spite, which has the characteristic of not letting go of enmity. He is disrespectful: he is without respect. He is undeferential: he is without deference, without dignity. Herein, a monk who does not attend upon the Teacher at the three times, who walks up and down with his sandals on when the Teacher is walking up and down without his sandals, who walks up and down on a high walk when the Teacher is walking up and down on a low walk, who lives above when the Teacher lives below, who covers both shoulders when it is the proper time for the Teacher to see him, who carries an umbrella, who carries sandals, who bathes, who voids urine or excrement, or who does not go to worship a shrine when the Teacher has attained final nibbana, who does all the things mentioned in the section on seeing the Teacher in the place for seeing the Teacher in the shrine terrace,

original: aññehi ca bhikkhūhi “kasmā evaṃ karosi, na idaṃ vaṭṭati, sammāsambuddhassa nāma lajjituṃ
analyzed: aññehi ca bhikkhūhi kasmai evam karosi na idam vaṭṭati sammāsambuddhassa nāma lajjitum
translated: and when other monks say, “Why do you act like this? It’s not allowable to be ashamed of the Buddha, the Perfected and Rightly Self-awakened One,”

original: vaṭṭatī”ti vutte “tuṇhī hohi, buddho buddhoti vadasi, kiṃ buddho nāmā”ti bhaṇati,
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti vutte tuṇhī hohi buddhaḥ buddho ti vadasi kim buddhaḥ nāma ati bhaṇati
translated: he says, “Be quiet. You say, ‘Buddha, Buddha.’ What’s a Buddha?”

original: ayaṃ satthari agāravo nāma.
analyzed: ayam satthari agāravaḥ nāma
translated: This is called lack of respect for the Teacher.

original: Yo pana dhammasavane saṅghuṭṭhe sakkaccaṃ na gacchati, sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ na suṇāti,
analyzed: yaḥ pana dhamma savane saṅghuṭṭhe sakkaccam na gacchati sakkaccam dhammam na suṇāti
translated: But when the recitation of the Teaching is about to begin, he doesn’t go with eagerness. He doesn’t listen to the Teaching with eagerness.

original: niddāyati vā sallapanto vā nisīdati, sakkaccaṃ na gaṇhāti na vāceti, “kiṃ dhamme
analyzed: niddāyati vā sallapantaḥ vā nisīdati sakkaccam na gaṇhāti na vācā iti kim dhamme
translated: He sits dozing or chatting. He doesn’t grasp the Teaching with eagerness. He doesn’t recite it.🔽When told, “Why do you show lack of respect for the Teaching?” he says,

original: agāravaṃ karosī”ti vutte “tuṇhī hohi, dhammo dhammoti vadasi, kiṃ dhammo nāmā”ti
analyzed: agāravam karosi iti vutte tuṇhī hohi dhammaḥ dhammo ti vadasi kim dhammo nāma ati
translated: “Be quiet. You say, ‘The Teaching, the Teaching.’ What’s the Teaching?”

original: vadati, ayaṃ dhamme agāravo nāma. Yo pana therena bhikkhunā anajjhiṭṭho dhammaṃ deseti
analyzed: vadati ayam dhamme agāravaḥ nāma yaḥ pana therena bhikkhunā anajjhiṭṭhaḥ dhammaṃ deseti
translated: This is called lack of respect for the Teaching. But when a senior monk hasn’t asked him, he teaches the Teaching,

original: uddisati pañhaṃ katheti, vuḍḍhe bhikkhū ghaṭṭento gacchati tiṭṭhati nisīdati, dussapallatthikaṃ
analyzed: uddisati pañham katheti vuḍḍhe bhikkhū ghaṭṭentaḥ gacchati tiṭṭhati nisīdati dussa pallatthikam
translated: recites it, answers questions, or instructs the monks. He goes, stands, sits, or lies down, pushing aside senior monks.

original: vā hatthapallatthikaṃ vā karoti, saṅghamajjhe ubho aṃse pārupati, chattupāhanaṃ dhāreti,
analyzed: vā hattha pallatthikam vā karoti saṅgha majjhe ubho aṃse pārupati chattu pāhanam dhāreti
translated: He wears his upper robe over both shoulders in the midst of the Community of monks, he carries an umbrella and sandals,

original: “bhikkhusaṅghassa lajjituṃ vaṭṭatī”ti vuttepi “tuṇhī hohi, saṅgho saṅghoti vadasi,
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghassa lajjitum vaṭṭati iti vutte pi tuṇhī hohi saṅgho saṅgho ti vadasi
translated: and when it is said, “It is proper to be ashamed before the Community of monks,” he says, “Be quiet, you say ‘Community,’

original: kiṃ saṅgho, migasaṅgho ajasaṅgho”tiādīni vadati, ayaṃ saṅghe agāravo nāma. Ekabhikkhusmimpi
analyzed: kim saṅghaḥ miga saṅghaḥ aja saṅghaḥ ti ādīni vadati ayam saṅghe agāravaḥ nāma eka bhikkhusmim pi
translated: what is the Community, a herd of deer, a herd of goats?” and so on. This is called lack of respect for the Community.

original: hi agārave kate saṅghe katoyeva hoti. Tisso sikkhā pana apūrayamāno sikkhāya na paripūrakārī nāma.
analyzed: hi agārave kate saṅghe katoyā iva hoti tissaḥ sikkhā pana a pūrayamāno sikkhāya na paripūrakārī nāma
translated: For when lack of respect is shown to even one monk, it is as if it were shown to the whole Community. But one who does not fulfill the three trainings is called “one who does not fulfill the training.”

original: Ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānanti ekasmiṃ vihāre dvinnaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ uppannavivādo
analyzed: ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussānaṃ ti ekasmin vihāre dvinnam bhikkhūnam uppanna vivādaḥ
translated: To the harm of gods and humans: when a dispute arises between two monks in a monastery,

original: kathaṃ devamanussānaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattati? Kosambakakkhandhake viya hi dvīsu🔽bhikkhūsu vivādaṃ āpannesu tasmiṃ vihāre tesaṃ antevāsikā vivadanti, tesaṃ ovādaṃ
analyzed: katham deva manussānam ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattati kosambaka kkhandhake viya hi dvīsu  bhikkhūsu vivādam āpannesu tasmin vihāre tesam antevāsikāḥ vivadanti tesam ovādam
translated: how does it lead to the harm and suffering of gods and humans? For when two monks🔽are disputing, their pupils dispute, and the Community of nuns disputes, taking the side of those who are giving them instruction.

original: gaṇhanto bhikkhunisaṅgho vivadati, tato tesaṃ upaṭṭhākā vivadanti, atha manussānaṃ
analyzed: gaṇhantaḥ bhikkhuni saṅghaḥ vivadati tatas tesam upaṭṭhākāḥ vivadanti atha manussānam
translated: Then their supporters dispute, and then people dispute,

original: ārakkhadevatā dve koṭṭhāsā honti. Tattha dhammavādīnaṃ ārakkhadevatā dhammavādiniyo
analyzed: ārakkha devatāḥ dve koṭṭhāsāḥ honti tattha dhamma vādīnam ārakkha devatāḥ dhamma vādiniyo
translated: The two sides are also divided as to their protective deities. Herein, the protective deities of those who speak in accordance with the Dhamma become those who speak in accordance with the Dhamma,

original: honti, adhammavādīnaṃ adhammavādiniyo. Tato ārakkhadevatānaṃ mittā bhummadevatā bhijjanti.
analyzed: honti adhamma vādīnam adhamma vādiniyaḥ tatas ārakkha devatānam mittāḥ bhumma devatāḥ bhijjanti
translated: and the protective deities of those who speak contrary to the Dhamma become those who speak contrary to the Dhamma. Then the earth deities who are friends of the protective deities split up.

original: Evaṃ paramparāya yāva brahmalokā ṭhapetvā ariyasāvake sabbe devamanussā dve koṭṭhāsā🔽honti. Dhammavādīhi pana adhammavādinova bahutarā honti. Tato “yaṃ bahukehi gahitaṃ,
analyzed: evam paramparāya yāva brahmalokāḥ ṭhapetvā ariyasāvake sabbe deva manussā dve koṭṭhāsā  honti dhamma vādīhi pana adhamma vādinaḥ uva bahutarāḥ honti tatas yam bahukehi gahitam
translated: In this way, by stages, all the gods and human beings, except for noble disciples, are divided into two sides as far as the world of High Divinity.🔽But those who speak in accordance with the Dhamma are more numerous than those who speak contrary to the Dhamma. Then, thinking “What is taken up by the majority

original: taṃ taccha”nti dhammaṃ vissajjetvā bahutarā adhammaṃ gaṇhanti. Te adhammaṃ purakkhatvā
analyzed: tam tacchanti dhammam vissajjetvā bahutarāḥ adhammam gaṇhanti te adhammam purakkhatvā
translated: is the truth,” they give the decision to those who speak contrary to the Dhamma, and the majority side with them. They live with that Dhamma contrary to the Dhamma

original: viharantā apāyesu nibbattanti. Evaṃ ekasmiṃ vihāre dvinnaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ uppanno vivādo
analyzed: viharantāḥ apāyesu nibbattanti evam ekasmin vihāre dvinnam bhikkhūnam uppannaḥ vivādaḥ
translated: as their chief. They are reborn in states of deprivation. Thus a dispute that arises between two bhikkhus in a single monastery

original: bahūnaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya hoti. Ajjhattaṃ vāti attani vā attano parisāya vā. Bahiddhā
analyzed: bahūnam ahitāya dukkhāya hoti ajjhattam vā ati attani vā attano parisāya vā bahiddhā
translated: leads to the harm and suffering of many people, both internally and externally.

original: vāti parasmiṃ vā parassa parisāya vā. Āyatiṃ anavassavāyāti āyatiṃ anuppādāya.
analyzed: vāti parasmin vā parassa parisāya vā āyatim an avassavāya ati āyatim an uppādāya
translated: Internally means in oneself or in one’s own following. Externally means in another or in another’s following. For the non-arising of in the future.

original: Makkhīti paresaṃ guṇamakkhanalakkhaṇena makkhena samannāgato. Paḷāsīti yugaggāhalakkhaṇena
analyzed: makkhī iti paresam guṇa makkhana lakkhaṇena makkhena samannāgataḥ paḷāsī iti yuga ggāha lakkhaṇena
translated: Malicious: endowed with malice, which is characterized by the disparaging of others. A slanderer: one who is characterized by the seizing of the weak points of others.

original: paḷāsena samannāgato. Issukīti parasakkārādīnaṃ issāyanalakkhaṇāya issāya samannāgato.
analyzed: paḷāsena samannāgataḥ issukī iti para sakkāra ādīnam issāyana lakkhaṇāya issāya samannāgataḥ
translated: Grudging: possessing the characteristic of begrudging, of being niggardly about the good qualities of others. Stingy: possessing the characteristic of grasping, of holding on tight. Jealous: possessing the characteristic of being envious of the gains and honours of others.

original: Maccharīti āvāsamacchariyādīhi samannāgato. Saṭhoti kerāṭiko. Māyāvīti katapāpapaṭicchādako.
analyzed: maccharī iti āvāsamacchariya ādīhi samannāgato saṭho ti kerāṭikaḥ māyāvī iti kata pāpa paṭicchādako
translated: Misers: possessing the characteristic of miserliness about dwelling places, etc. Sly: deceitful. Crafty: concealing the evil one has done.

original: Pāpicchoti asantasambhāvanicchako dussīlo. Micchādiṭṭhīti natthikavādī ahetukavādī
analyzed: pāpa iccho ti asanta sambhāvanā icchakaḥ dussīlaḥ micchādiṭṭhī iti natthika vādī ahetuka vādī
translated: Evil-minded: unvirtuous, wishing for what is not good. Wrongly enlightened: an annihilationist, a nihilist.

original: akiriyavādī. Sandiṭṭhiparāmāsīti sayaṃ diṭṭhameva parāmasati gaṇhāti. Ādhānaggāhīti🔽daḷhaggāhī. Duppaṭinissaggīti na sakkā hoti gahitaṃ nissajjāpetuṃ. Ettha ca kodhano
analyzed: akiriya vādī sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī iti sayam diṭṭham eva parāmasati gaṇhāti ādhāna ggāhī iti  daḷha ggāhī duppaṭinissaggī iti na sakkā hoti gahitam nissajjāpetum ettha ca kodhanaḥ
translated: Holding to a rules and observances: he holds to and grasps only what he himself has seen. Grasping:

original: hoti upanāhītiādinā puggalādhiṭṭhānanayena kodhūpanāhādayo akusaladhammā vivādamūlānīti
analyzed: upanāhi itiādinā puggala adhiṭṭhāna nayena kodha upanāha ādayaḥ akusala dhammāḥ vivāda mūlāni iti
translated: holding on tightly. Not easily abandoning: it is not possible to make him let go of what he has grasped. Herein, the unprofitable states beginning with anger and enmity are the roots of disputes by way of the method of determining persons thus: “He is angry, he is hostile … ” .

original: dassitāni, tathā duṭṭhacittā vivadantītiādinā lobhadosamohā. Aduṭṭhacittā vivadantītiādinā
analyzed: dassitāni tathā duṭṭha cittāḥ vivadanti itiādinā lobha dosa mohāḥ aduṭṭha cittāḥ vivadanti itiādinā
translated: and so too, when they dispute with a mind of hate, etc., greed, hate, and delusion are shown.🔽When they dispute with a mind of non-hate, etc.,

original: ca alobhādayo vivādamūlānīti dassitāni.
analyzed: ca alobha ādayaḥ vivāda mūlāni iti dassitāni
translated: non-greed, etc., are shown.

original: 217. Dubbaṇṇoti paṃsupisācako viya jhāmakhāṇuvaṇṇo. Duddassikoti vijātamātuyāpi amanāpadassano.
analyzed: dubbaṇṇaḥ ti paṃsu pisācakaḥ viya jhāma khāṇu vaṇṇaḥ duddassikaḥ ti vijāta mātuyā api amanāpa dassanaḥ
translated: “Ugly” : the colour of ashes like a dust-sprite. “Repulsive” : disagreeable to look at even to a mother who has just given birth.

original: Okoṭimakoti lakuṇḍako. Kāṇoti ekakkhikāṇo vā ubhayakkhikāṇo vā. Kuṇīti ekahatthakuṇī
analyzed: okoṭimako ti lakuṇḍako kāṇo ti ekakkhikāṇaḥ vā ubhayakkhikāṇaḥ vā kuṇī iti eka hattha kuṇī
translated: “Hunched over” : a hunchback. “Lame” : lame on one side or lame on both sides. “Crippled” : crippled in one hand or crippled in both hands. “Paralysed” :🔽paralysed in one foot or paralysed in both feet. “Deformed” :

original: vā ubhayahatthakuṇī vā. Khañjoti ekapādakhañjo vā ubhayapādakhañjo vā. Pakkhahatoti🔽hatapakkho pīṭhasappī.🔽220. Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kusalaṃ akusalaṃ abyākatanti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃ kusalaṃ akusalaṃ🔽udāhu abyākatanti pucchati. Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ siyā kusalantiādi vissajjanaṃ. Esa nayo
analyzed: vā ubhaya hattha kuṇī vā khañjo ti eka pāda khañjaḥ vā ubhaya pāda khañjaḥ vā pakkha hatoti  hata pakkhaḥ pīṭhasappī  vivāda adhikaraṇam kusalam akusalam vivāda adhikaraṇam kim kusalam akusalam  udāhu a byākata nti pucchati vivāda adhikaraṇam siyā vissajjanam esa nayo
translated: deformed in one side or deformed in both sides.🔽“A cause of dispute” : he asks, “Is a cause of dispute wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?” The answer is, “A cause of dispute may be wholesome, etc.” The same method applies to the rest.

original: sesesupi. Vivadanti etenāti vivādoti āha “yena vivadanti, so cittuppādo vivādo”ti.
analyzed: sesesu pi vivadanti etena ati vivādaḥ iti āha yena vivadanti so cittuppādaḥ vivādaḥ ti
translated: “They dispute by means of it” : thus it is a cause of dispute . He says: “The arising of consciousness by means of which they dispute is a cause of dispute.”

original: Kathaṃ pana so cittuppādo adhikaraṇaṃ nāmāti āha “samathehi ca adhikaraṇīyatāya adhikaraṇa”nti,🔽samathehi sametabbatāya adhikaraṇanti attho. Vivādahetubhūtassa hi cittuppādassa
analyzed: katham pana saḥ cittuppādaḥ adhikaraṇam nāma ati āha samathehi ca adhikaraṇīya tāya adhikaraṇam ti  samathehi sametabba tāya adhikaraṇanti atthaḥ vivāda hetu bhūtassa hi cittuppādassa
translated: How is it a legal question? “Because it is to be settled by means of the legal procedures” means that it is a legal question because it is to be settled by means of the legal procedures. For when the state of mind that is the cause of a dispute is settled,

original: vūpasamena tappabhavassa saddassapi vūpasamo hotīti cittuppādassa samathehi adhikaraṇīyatā🔽pariyāyo sambhavati.🔽222. Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ siyā akusalaṃ siyā abyākatanti ayaṃ vikappo paññattivajjaṃyeva🔽sandhāya vutto, na lokavajjanti dassetuṃ “sandhāyabhāsitavasenā”tiādimāha. Kasmā🔽panettha sandhāyabhāsitavasena attho veditabboti āha “yasmiṃ hī”tiādi. Pathavīkhaṇanādiketi
analyzed: vūpasamena tad pabhavassa saddassa api vūpasamaḥ hoti iti cittuppādassa samathehi adhikaraṇīya tā  sambhavati  āpatta adhikaraṇam siyā akusalam siyā abyākatam ti ayam vikappaḥ paññatti vajjam yeva  sandhāya vuttaḥ na dassetum sandhāya bhāsita vasena ati ādim āha kasmā  pana ittha sandhāya bhāsita vasena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ iti āha yasmin hi itiādi pathavī khaṇana ādikā iti
translated: the dispute that has arisen from it is also settled. Thus it is possible to say that the state of mind is a legal question because it is to be settled by means of the legal procedures.🔽“A legal question arising from an offense may be unwholesome or indeterminate” refers to the offense entailing expulsion for digging the earth, etc. This differentiation is stated with reference to the offense entailing expulsion for sexual intercourse, etc., which is a breach of the Monastic Law, not with reference to the offense entailing expulsion for sexual intercourse, etc., which is a breach of the law of nature. To show this, he said “because it is stated with a specific meaning.”

original: ettha ādi-saddena bhūtagāmapātabyatādipaññattivajjaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Yo vinaye
analyzed: ettha ādi saddena bhūta gāma pātabya tā ādi paññatti vajjam sikkhāpadam saṅgaṇhāti yaḥ vinaye
translated: Why is the meaning to be understood here as stated with a specific meaning? “Because, if the offense is not a breach of the Monastic Law, then the legal question is not settled by resolution face-to-face.”🔽“Digging the earth, etc.”: the word “etc.” includes the offense entailing expulsion for eating fresh or cooked food that has not been given, which is a breach of the Monastic Law.

original: apakataññutāya vattasīsena sammuñjaniādinā pathavīkhaṇanādīni karoti, tadā tassuppannacittaṃ
analyzed: apakataññutāya vatta sīsena sammuñjani ādinā pathavī khaṇana ādīni karoti tadā tassa uppanna cittam
translated: When he digs the earth, etc., with a spade, etc., through lack of gratitude, through being a wrong-doer, then the profitable consciousness that has arisen in him is called “the condition for the offence.”

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ “kusalacittaṃ aṅgaṃ hotī”ti. Aṅgaṃ hotīti ca vattasīsena karontassapi
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam kusala cittam aṅgam hoti iti aṅgam hoti iti ca vatta sīsena karontassa api
translated: And when it is said that “the profitable consciousness is a condition,” it is said with reference to the wrong-doer who does the act.

original: “imaṃ pathaviṃ khaṇāmī”tiādinā vītikkamajānanavasena pavattattā taṃ kusalacittaṃ🔽āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kusalacittaṃ āpattiyā kāraṇaṃ hotīti attho. Na hi vītikkamaṃ ajānantassa
analyzed: imam pathavim khaṇāmi iti ādinā vītikkama jānana vasena pavatta tā tam kusala cittam  āpatta adhikaraṇam kusala cittam āpattiyāḥ kāraṇam hoti iti atthaḥ na hi vītikkamam a jānantassa
translated: For that profitable consciousness occurs with the knowledge of the transgression in the form of the thought “I shall dig this earth,” etc.,🔽and so the profitable consciousness is the source of the legal question consisting of an offence, the meaning is that the profitable consciousness is the reason for the offence.🔽For there is no offence in digging the earth, etc., for one who does not know that it is a transgression.

original: pathavīkhaṇanādīsu āpatti sambhavati. Tasmiṃ satīti tasmiṃ kusalacitte āpattibhāvena🔽gahite satīti adhippāyo. Tasmāti yasmā kusalacitte āpattibhāvena gahite sati “natthi
analyzed: pathavī khaṇana ādīsu āpatti sambhavati tasmin sati iti tasmin kusala citte āpatti bhāvena  gahite sati iti adhippāyo tasmā ti yasmā kusala citte āpatti bhāvena gahite sati natthi
translated: The intention is this: “when that is apprehended as an offence.”🔽The meaning is: when that profitable consciousness is apprehended as an offence.🔽Because when that is apprehended as an offence it is not possible to say that “there is no legal question consisting of an offence that is profitable,” therefore.

original: āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kusala”nti na sakkā vattuṃ, tasmā. Nayidaṃ aṅgappahonakacittaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: āpatta adhikaraṇam kusalanti na sakkā vattum tasmai aṅga ppahonaka cittam sandhāya
translated: This is not said with reference to the consciousness that is a condition.

original: vuttanti “āpattādhikaraṇaṃ siyā akusalaṃ siyā abyākataṃ, natthi āpattādhikaraṇaṃ
analyzed: vuttanti āpatta adhikaraṇam siyā akusalam siyā abyākatam natthi āpatta adhikaraṇam
translated: The legal question consisting of an offence may be unprofitable or it may be indeterminate; there is no legal question consisting of an offence that is profitable.

original: kusala”nti idaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhāpakabhāvena aṅgappahonakaṃ āpattiyā kāraṇabhūtaṃ cittaṃ🔽sandhāya na vuttaṃ. Kiṃ pana sandhāya vuttanti āha “idaṃ panā”tiādi. Bhikkhumhi kammaṭṭhānagatacittena🔽nipanne niddāyante vā mātugāmo ce seyyaṃ kappeti, tasmiṃ khaṇe seyyākārena vattamānarūpameva
analyzed: kusalam ti idam āpatti samuṭṭhāpaka bhāvena aṅga pahonakam āpattiyā kāraṇa bhūtam cittam  sandhāya na vuttam kim pana sandhāya vuttan ti āha idam pana ati ādi bhikkhumhi kammaṭṭhāna gata cittena  nipanne niddāyante vā mātugāmaḥ ce seyyam kappeti tasmin khaṇe seyyākārena vattamāna rūpam eva
translated: “It is profitable” is said with reference to the consciousness that is the cause of the offence, which is the condition for the offence by being a factor in originating it.🔽But with reference to what is it said, “This is said with reference to the time when the woman lies down”? When a bhikkhu has entered upon a meditation subject in his mind and is lying down or has fallen asleep, if a woman lies down with him, at that moment the offence is the materiality occurring as the act of lying down.

original: āpatti, na kusalādivasappavattaṃ cittanti āha “asañcicca…pe… sahaseyyādivasena āpajjato
analyzed: āpatti na kusala ādi vasa ppavattam cittam ti āha sahaseyya ādi vasena āpajjataḥ
translated: It is not the consciousness occurring as profitable, etc., that is the offence. That is why it is said, “When one commits an offence through ignorance, etc., or through carelessness in the case of sleeping in the same sleeping place as a woman, it is indeterminate.”

original: abyākataṃ hotī”ti. Tasmiñhi khaṇe uṭṭhātabbe jāte anuṭṭhānato tadākārapavatto rūpakkhandhova āpatti.
analyzed: abyākatam hoti iti tasmin hi khaṇe uṭṭhātabbe jāte anuṭṭhānato tad ākāra pavattaḥ rūpa kkhandhaḥ uva āpatti
translated: For at that moment the offence is only the materiality occurring as that act, since the consciousness that should arise at the moment of rising up does not arise.

original: “Āpattiṃ āpajjanto kusalacitto vā āpajjati akusalābyākatacitto vā”ti vacanato kusalampi
analyzed: āpattim āpajjantaḥ kusala cittaḥ vā āpajjati akusala abyākata cittaḥ vā ati vacanataḥ kusalam pi
translated: “When one commits an offence, does one commit it with a profitable consciousness, or with a unprofitable or indeterminate consciousness?”🔽Since this is said, is it not that an offence is a source of legal questions that is profitable?

original: āpattādhikaraṇaṃ siyāti ce? Na. Yo hi āpattiṃ āpajjatīti vuccati, so tīsu cittesu
analyzed: āpatta adhikaraṇam siyā iti ce na yaḥ hi āpattim āpajjati iti vuccati so tīsu cittesu
translated: No. For the one who is said to “commit an offence” is one of the three kinds of consciousnesses.

original: aññataracittasamaṅgī hutvā āpajjati, na aññathāti dassanatthaṃ “kusalacitto vā”tiādi
analyzed: aññatara citta samaṅgī hutvā āpajjati na aññathā ti dassana ttham kusala cittaḥ vā ātiādi
translated: “With a profitable consciousness” and so on is said in order to show that one enters upon the course of action with a particular kind of consciousness and not otherwise.

original: vuttaṃ. Ayañhettha attho – pathavīkhaṇanādīsu kusalacittakkhaṇe vītikkamādivasena🔽pavattarūpasambhavato kusalacitto vā tathāpavattarūpasaṅkhātaṃ abyākatāpattiṃ āpajjati,🔽tathā abyākatacitto vā abyākatarūpasaṅkhātaṃ abyākatāpattiṃ āpajjati. Pāṇātipātādiṃ
analyzed: vuttam ayam ha ittha atthaḥ pathavī khaṇana ādīsu kusala citta kkhaṇe vītikkama ādi vasena  pavatta rūpa sambhavataḥ kusala cittaḥ vā tathā apavatta rūpa saṅkhātam abyākata āpattim āpajjati  tathā abyākata cittaḥ vā abyākata rūpa saṅkhātam abyākata āpattim āpajjati pāṇātipāta ādim
translated: Here is the meaning. When one is digging the earth, etc., and one’s consciousness is profitable at the moment of the transgression, etc., then one enters upon the course of action called “indeterminate” since the material action that occurs is indeterminate.🔽Or when one’s consciousness is indeterminate, then one enters upon the course of action called “indeterminate.”

original: akusalacitto vā akusalāpattiṃ āpajjati, rūpaṃ panettha abbohārikaṃ. Supinante ca
analyzed: akusala cittaḥ vā akusala āpattim āpajjati rūpam pana ittha abbohārikam ca
translated: When one is killing a living being, etc., and one’s consciousness is unprofitable, then one enters upon the course of action called “unprofitable.” But the material action here is indeterminate.

original: pāṇātipātādiṃ karonto sahaseyyādivasena āpajjitabbāpattiṃ āpajjanto akusalacitto
analyzed: pāṇātipāta ādim karontaḥ sahaseyya ādi vasena āpajjitabba āpattim āpajjantaḥ akusala cittaḥ
translated: And when one is dreaming that one is killing a living being, etc., and one enters upon the course of action that should be entered upon by lying down, etc., then one’s consciousness is indeterminate,

original: abyākatāpattiṃ āpajjatīti.
analyzed: abyākata āpattim āpajjati iti
translated: but the course of action is called “unprofitable.”

original: Kusalacittaṃ āpajjeyyāti eḷakalomaṃ gahetvā kammaṭṭhānamanasikārena tiyojanaṃ atikkamantassa
analyzed: kusala cittam āpajjeyya ati eḷaka lomam gahetvā kammaṭṭhāna manasikārena ti yojanam atikkamantassa
translated: “With a profitable consciousness” means that one who, having taken a piece of wool, goes beyond three hundred bow-lengths with attention given to a meditation subject,

original: paññattiṃ ajānitvā padaso dhammaṃ vācentassa ca āpajjitabbāpattiyā kusalacittaṃ āpajjeyya.
analyzed: paññattim a jānitvā padasaḥ dhammam vācentassa ca āpajjitabba āpattiyā kusala cittam āpajjeyya
translated: and when one who does not know the formulation but who recites the Dhamma by the text learns it, he would be guilty of a course of wrong-kncwledge.

original: Na ca tattha vijjamānampi kusalacittaṃ āpattiyā aṅganti tasmiṃ vijjamānampi kusalacittaṃ
analyzed: na ca tattha vijjamānam api kusala cittam āpattiyāḥ tasmin vijjamānam api kusala cittam
translated: But though a profitable consciousness is present there, it is not a factor of the course.

original: āpattiyā aṅgaṃ na hoti, sayaṃ āpatti na hotīti attho. Calitappavattānanti calitānaṃ
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ aṅgam na hoti sayam āpatti na hoti iti attho calita ppavattānam ti calitānam
translated: Though it is present there, it is not a factor of the course, is what is meant. The meaning is that it is not a course.🔽“In what is moving and in what is proceeding”: in what is moving, the body, and in what is proceeding, speech.

original: pavattānañca. Calito kāyo, pavattā vācā. Aññatarameva aṅganti kāyavācānaṃ aññatarameva
analyzed: pavattānam ca calitaḥ kāyo pavattā vācā aññataram eva aṅganti kāya vācānam aññataram eva
translated: “In one or the other”: in one or the other of the two, body and speech.🔽The meaning is that it is a course in one or the other.

original: āpattīti attho. Tañca rūpakkhandhapariyāpannattā abyākatanti iminā abyākatamāpattādhikaraṇaṃ, nāññanti dasseti.
analyzed: āpatti iti attho tat ca rūpa kkhandha pariyāpanna ttā abyākatanti iminā abyākatam āpatta adhikaraṇam dasseti
translated: And because it is included in the materiality aggregate it is indeterminate. This shows that the legal question is indeterminate when it is a course consisting in an offence.

original: Yadi evaṃ “sāpattikassa, bhikkhave, nirayaṃ vā vadāmi tiracchānayoniṃ vā”ti vacanato
analyzed: yadi evam sāpattikassa bhikkhave nirayam vā vadāmi tiracchānayonim vā ati vacanataḥ
translated: If that is so, then since it is said, “I declare that one who has committed an offence, bhikkhus, will go to hell or to the animal realm” ,🔽would not the ripening of an indeterminate course be implied?

original: abyākatassapi vipākadhammatā āpajjeyyāti? Nāpajjeyya. Asañcicca āpannā hi āpattiyo
analyzed: abyākatassa api vipāka dhamma tā āpajjeyya ati na āpajjeyya asañcicca āpannāḥ hi āpattiyaḥ
translated: It would not be, because the offence is one committed unintentionally.

original: yāva so na jānāti, tāva anantarāyakarā, jānitvā chādento pana chādanappaccayā aññaṃ🔽dukkaṭasaṅkhātaṃ akusalamāpattādhikaraṇamāpajjati, tañca akusalasabhāvattā saggamokkhānaṃ
analyzed: yāva so na jānāti tāva anantarāya karā jānitvā chādento pana chādana paccayā aññam  dukkaṭa saṅkhātam akusalam āpatta adhikaraṇam āpajjati tat ca akusala sabhāva ttā saggamokkhānam
translated: As long as he does not know, there is no offence. But if he conceals it after knowing, he commits an offence of wrong-doing, which is a legal question belonging to the class of offences of wrong-doing. And because of the nature of that wrong-doing, it is a legal question belonging to the class of offences.🔽

original: antarāyakaraṇanti sāpattikassa apāyagāmitā vuttā. Abyākataṃ pana āpattādhikaraṇaṃ🔽avipākadhammamevāti niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ. Teneva porāṇagaṇṭhipadesupi “puthujjano
analyzed: antarāya karaṇam ti sāpattikassa apāya gāmi tā vuttā abyākatam pana āpattādhikaraṇam  avipāka dhammam evā ti niṭṭham ettha gantabbam tena iva porāṇa gaṇṭhi padesu pi puthujjanaḥ
translated: As long as he does not know, there is no obstruction. But when he knows, he conceals it, and he commits an offence of wrong-doing, which is a form of unprofitable action. And because it is of an unprofitable nature, it is said that one who has committed an offence is bound for the states of loss, since it causes obstruction to heaven and deliverance. But an offence that is an actionable matter that is indeterminate🔽should be understood as having no result. Therefore, in the ancient guide- lines, after showing four kinds of persons—

original: kalyāṇaputhujjano sekkho arahāti cattāro puggale dassetvā tesu arahato āpattādhikaraṇaṃ🔽abyākatameva, tathā sekkhānaṃ, tathā kalyāṇaputhujjanassa asañcicca vītikkamakāle
analyzed: kalyāṇaputhujjanaḥ sekkhaḥ arahā ti cattāraḥ puggale dassetvā tesu arahataḥ āpatta adhikaraṇam  abyākatam eva tathā sekkhānam tathā kalyāṇa puthujjanassa asañcid ca vītikkama kāle
translated: an ordinary man, a good ordinary man, a disciple in higher training, and an Arahant—it is said with reference to the offence that is an actionable matter of an Arahant that it is indeterminate,

original: abyākatameva. Itarassa akusalampi hoti abyākatampi. Yasmā cassa sañcicca vītikkamakāle
analyzed: abyākatam eva itarassa akusalam pi hoti abyākatam pi yasmai ca ssa sañcid ca vītikkama kāle
translated: and with reference to that of a disciple in higher training and that of a good ordinary man when they have unintentionally transgressed that it is indeterminate. But that of an ordinary man is either unprofitable or indeterminate. And because when he has intentionally transgressed it is only unprofitable,

original: akusalameva hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ ‘natthi āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kusala’nti. Sabbattha evaṃ
analyzed: akusalam eva hoti tasmā vuttam na atthi āpatta adhikaraṇam kusalanti sabbattha evam
translated: it is said that there is no offence that is an actionable matter that is profitable. In all cases

original: abyākatanti vipākābhāvamattaṃ sandhāya vutta”nti likhitaṃ. Yañca āpattādhikaraṇaṃ
analyzed: abyākatam ti vipāka abhāva mattam sandhāya vuttam ti likhitam yat ca āpatta adhikaraṇam
translated: and “indeterminate” is said with reference to the mere absence of result.”🔽And a legal issue arising from an offense,🔽though unwholesome, is not an obstruction when confessed and settled.

original: akusalaṃ, tampi desitaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ vā anantarāyakaraṃ. Yathā hi ariyūpavādakammaṃ
analyzed: akusalam desitam vuṭṭhitam vā anantarāya karam yathā hi ariya upavāda kammaṃ
translated: For just as a legal procedure of condemnation,

original: akusalampi samānaṃ accayaṃ desetvā khamāpanena payogasampattipaṭibāhitattā avipākadhammataṃ🔽āpannaṃ ahosikammaṃ hoti, evamidampi desitaṃ vuṭṭhitaṃ vā payogasampattipaṭibāhitattā🔽avipākadhammatāya ahosikammabhāvena anantarāyakaraṃ jātaṃ. Teneva “sāpattikassa,
analyzed: akusalam pi samānam accayam desetvā khamāpanena payoga sampatti paṭibāhita ttā a vipāka dhamma taṃ  āpannam ahosikammam hoti evam idam pi desitam vuṭṭhitam vā payoga sampatti paṭibāhita ttā  a vipāka dhamma tāya ahosi kamma bhāvena anantarāya karam jātam tena iva sāpattikassa
translated: though unwholesome, becomes a non-offense when the offense is confessed and forgiveness is granted because the fault is counteracted by the excellence of the means,🔽so too this legal issue, when confessed and settled, becomes not an obstruction because the fault is counteracted by the excellence of the means and it becomes a non-offense.

original: bhikkhave, nirayaṃ vā vadāmi tiracchānayoniṃ vā”ti sāpattikasseva apāyagāmitā vuttā.
analyzed: bhikkhave nirayam vā vadāmi tiracchānayonim vā ati sa āpattikassa iva apāya gāmi tā vuttā
translated: That is why it is said that only one who has an offense goes to the nether world.

original: Adhikaraṇavūpasamanasamathakathāvaṇṇanā🔽228. Vivādasaṅkhāte atthe paccatthikā atthapaccatthikā.
analyzed: adhikaraṇa vūpasamana samatha kathā vaṇṇanā  vivāda saṅkhāte atthe paccatthikā attha paccatthikā
translated: The explanation of the section on the settlement of legal issues by resolution face-to-face🔽. In the case of a legal issue arising from a dispute, the opponents are the adversaries.

original: 229. Sammukhāvinayasminti sammukhāvinayabhāve.
analyzed: sammukha avinayasmin ti sammukha avinaya bhāve
translated: In the case of a legal issue arising from an accusation, the one who makes the accusation is the adversary.🔽In the case of a legal issue arising from an offense, the offense is the adversary.

original: 230. Antarenāti kāraṇena.
analyzed: antarena ati kāraṇena
translated: In the case of a legal issue arising from business, the other monks are the adversaries.🔽In the case of a legal issue arising from a dispute, the dispute is the adversary.🔽In the case of a legal issue arising from an accusation, the accusation is the adversary.🔽In the case of a legal issue arising from an offense, the offense is the adversary.🔽In the case of a legal issue arising from business, the business is the adversary.

original: 231. Ubbāhikāya khīyanake pācitti na vuttā tattha chandadānassa natthitāya.
analyzed: ubbāhikāya khīyanake pācitti na vuttā tattha chanda dānassa na atthitāya
translated: The offense entailing confession for sending away a sick nun is not mentioned here because there is no giving of consent there.

original: 236. Tassa kho tanti ettha kho tanti nipātamattaṃ.
analyzed: tassa kho tanti ettha kho tanti nipāta mattam
translated: . The word “there” is just a particle.

original: 238. “Kā ca tattha tassapāpiyasikāyā”ti potthakesu likhanti. “Kā ca tassapāpiyasikā”ti evaṃ panettha pāṭho veditabbo.🔽242. Kiccādhikaraṇaṃ ekena samathena sammatīti ettha “kiccameva kiccādhikaraṇa”nti🔽vacanato apalokanakammādīnametaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Taṃ vivādādhikaraṇādīni viya samathehi🔽sametabbaṃ na hoti, kintu sammukhāvinayena sampajjati, tasmā sammatīti ettha sampajjatīti
analyzed: kā ca tattha tassa pāpiyasikāya ati potthakesu likhanti kā ca tassa pāpiyasikā ati evam pana ittha pāṭhaḥ veditabbo  kicca adhikaraṇam ekena samathena ettha kiccam eva kicca adhikaraṇanti  vacanataḥ adhivacanam tam vivāda adhikaraṇa ādīni samathehi  sametabbam na hoti kintu sammukhā vinayena sampajjati tasmā sammatī iti ettha sampajjati iti
translated: . In the books it is written “What is the further penalty there?” But the reading here should be understood as “What is the further penalty?”

original: attho gahetabbo. Sesamettha suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: atthaḥ gahetabbo sesam ettha su viññeyyam eva
translated: . A legal issue arising from business is settled by one means of settling: since it is said, “Business is a legal issue arising from business,” this is a designation for the resolution by means of a resolution through recollection, etc. It is not to be settled by the means of settling legal issues, as is the case with legal issues arising from disputes, etc., but by resolution face-to-face. Therefore, the meaning of “is settled” in “is settled by” should be understood as “is accomplished by”. The rest is easy to understand.

original: Samathakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Khuddakavatthukkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: samatha khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the chapter on settling legal issues is finished.🔽The chapter on minor rules

original: Khuddakavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: khuddaka vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the chapter on minor rules

original: 243. Khuddakavatthukkhandhake aṭṭhapadākārenāti aṭṭhapadaphalakākārena, jūtaphalakasadisanti vuttaṃ hoti. Mallakamūlasaṇṭhānenāti kheḷamallakamūlasaṇṭhānena.
analyzed: khuddaka vatthu khandhake aṭṭhapada ākārena ati aṭṭhapada phalaka ākārena jūta phalaka sadisan ti vuttam hoti mallaka mūla saṇṭhānena ati kheḷa mallaka mūla saṇṭhānena
translated: In the Khandhaka on Minor Points, in the shape of an octagonal pillar: in the shape of an octagonal wooden pillar, is what is meant. In the shape of the root of a sugar-cane: in the shape of the root of a sugar-cane with its fibres.🔽With a fringe, etc.: the word “etc.” includes a tassel, and so on. A fringe is a hanging thread.🔽With a fringe like a bird’s wing: with a fringe like a bird’s wing.

original: 245. Muttolambakādīnanti ādi-saddena kuṇḍalādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Palambakasuttanti yaññopacitākārena olambakasuttaṃ.
analyzed: mutta ulambaka ādīnam ti ādi saddena kuṇḍala ādim saṅgaṇhāti palambaka suttam ti yañña upacita ākārena olambaka suttam
translated: With a fringe like a peacock’s tail: with a fringe like a peacock’s tail.

original: 246. Cikkalenāti silesena.🔽248. Sādhugītanti aniccatādipaṭisaṃyuttagītaṃ.🔽249. Caturassena vattenāti paripuṇṇena uccāraṇavattena. Taraṅgavattādīnaṃ uccāraṇavidhānāni
analyzed: cikkalena ati silesena  sādhu gītam ti anicca tā ādi paṭisaṃyutta gītam  catur assena vattena ati paripuṇṇena uccāraṇa vattena taraṅga vatta ādīnam uccāraṇa vidhānāni
translated: With a fringe like a shell: with a fringe like a shell.🔽With a fringe like a creeper: with a fringe like a creeper.🔽With a fringe like a staff: with a fringe like a staff.🔽With a fringe like a snake’s hood: with a fringe like a snake’s hood.🔽With a fringe like a garland: with a fringe like a garland.

original: naṭṭhappayogāni. Bāhiralominti bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso, yathā tassa uṇṇapāvārassa bahiddhā
analyzed: naṭṭha ppayogāni bāhira lomin ti bhāva napuṃsaka niddesaḥ yathā tassa uṇṇa pāvārassa bahiddhā
translated: With a fringe like a fish’s gills: with a fringe like a fish’s gills.🔽With a fringe like a cow’s ear: with a fringe like a cow’s ear.🔽With a fringe like a goat’s ear: with a fringe like a goat’s ear.🔽With a fringe like a sheep’s ear: with a fringe like a sheep’s ear.🔽With a fringe like a rabbit’s fur: with a fringe like a rabbit’s fur.🔽With a fringe like a lion’s mane: with a fringe like a lion’s mane.🔽With a fringe like a tiger’s fur: with a fringe like a tiger’s fur.🔽With a fringe like a leopard’s fur: with a fringe like a leopard’s fur.🔽With a fringe like a cat’s fur: with a fringe like a cat’s fur.🔽With a fringe like a monkey’s fur: with a fringe like a monkey’s fur.

original: lomāni dissanti, tathā dhārentassa dukkaṭanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: lomāni dissanti tathā dhārentassa dukkaṭan ti vuttam hoti
translated: With a fringe like a human hair: with a fringe like a human hair.🔽With a fringe like a bird’s feather: with a fringe like a bird’s feather.🔽With a fringe like a peacock’s tail: with a fringe like a peacock’s tail.🔽With a fringe like a snake’s hood: with a fringe like a snake’s hood.

original: 251. Imāni cattāri ahirājakulānīti idaṃ daṭṭhavise sandhāya vuttaṃ. Ye hi keci daṭṭhavisā,
analyzed: imāni cattāri ahi rāja kulāni iti idam daṭṭha vise sandhāya vuttam ye hi keci daṭṭha visā
translated: With a fringe like a garland: with a fringe like

analyzed: sabbe te imesam catunnam ahi rāja kulānam abbhantara gatā ava honti atta guttiyā ati attano
translated: All of them are included in these four royal families of snakes. For their own safety: for their own

original: guttatthāya. Attarakkhāyāti attano rakkhaṇatthāya. Attaparittaṃkātunti attano parittāṇatthāya
analyzed: gutta tthāya atta rakkhāya ati attanaḥ rakkhaṇa tthāya atta parittaṃkātum attanaḥ parittāṇa tthāya
translated: protection. For their own security: for their own safety. To make a protection for themselves: to make a protection for themselves.

original: attaparittaṃ nāma kātuṃ anujānāmīti attho.
analyzed: attaparittam nāma kātum anujānāmi iti
translated: The meaning is: I allow them to make a protection.

original: Idāni yathā taṃ parittaṃ kātabbaṃ, taṃ dassetuṃ “evañca pana bhikkhave”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni yathā tam parittam kātabbam tam dassetum evam ca pana bhikkhave iti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to show how that protection should be made, he said, “And thus, bhikkhus,” etc.

original: Tattha virūpakkhehīti virūpakkhanāgakulehi. Sesesupi eseva nayo. Sahayoge cetaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ,
analyzed: tattha virūpakkhehi iti virūpakkha nāga kulehi sesesu pi esa iva nayaḥ saha yoge ca itam karaṇavacanam
translated: Herein, with the Virūpakkhas: with the Virūpakkha snakes. The same explanation applies in each case. This is a gerundive expression.

original: etehi saha mayhaṃ mittabhāvoti vuttaṃ hoti apādakehīti apādakasattehi. Sesesupi eseva
analyzed: etehi saha mayham mitta bhāvaḥ ti vuttam hoti apādakehi iti apādaka sattehi sesesu pi esā iva
translated: The meaning is: “I have friendship with them.” With the legless: with the legless creatures. The same explanation applies in each case.

analyzed: nayo sabbe sattā ti itas pubbe ettakena ṭhānena odissaka mettam kathetvā idāni anodissaka mettam
translated: All beings: after previously stating loving-kindness with a specific object up to this point, he now began to state loving-kindness without a specific object.

original: kathetuṃ idamāraddhaṃ. Tattha sattā pāṇā bhūtāti sabbānetāni puggalavevacanāneva.
analyzed: kathetum idam āraddham tattha sattā pāṇāḥ bhūtā ati sabbān etāni puggala vevacanāni eva
translated: Herein, beings, creatures, and persons are all mere synonyms for a person.

original: Bhadrāni passantūti bhadrāni ārammaṇāni passantu. Mā kañci pāpamāgamāti kañci sattaṃ
analyzed: bhadrāni passantu uti bhadrāni ārammaṇāni passantu mā kañci pāpam āgamā ati kañci sattam
translated: May they see what is auspicious: may they see auspicious objects. Let no one come to any harm: let no being

original: pāpakaṃ lāmakaṃ mā āgacchatu.
analyzed: pāpakam lāmakam mā āgacchatu
translated: come to any harm, to misfortune.

original: Appamāṇo buddhoti ettha buddhoti buddhaguṇā veditabbā, te hi appamāṇā nāma. Sesadvayesupi
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ buddho ti ettha buddhaḥ ti buddha guṇā veditabbā te hi appamāṇāḥ nāma sesa dvayesu pi
translated: The Buddha is immeasurable: here the Buddha’s special qualities should be understood as “the Buddha,” for they are called “immeasurable.” The same method applies in the case of the other two.

original: eseva nayo, pamāṇavantānīti guṇappamāṇena yuttāni. Uṇṇanābhīti lomasanābhiko makkaṭako.🔽Sarabūti gharagoḷikā. Katā me rakkhā kataṃ me parittanti mayā ettakassa janassa rakkhā
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ pamāṇavantāni iti guṇa ppamāṇena yuttāni uṇṇanābhī iti lomasanābhikaḥ makkaṭako  ghara goḷikā katā me rakkhā katam me parittam ti mayā ettakassa janassa rakkhā
translated: They are “finite” when they are endowed with a measure in terms of special qualities. A monkey is a hairy, tailed animal.

original: ca parittāṇañca kataṃ. Paṭikkamantu bhūtānīti sabbepi me kataparittāṇā sattā apagacchantu,
analyzed: ca parittāṇam ca katam paṭikkamantu bhūtāni iti sabbe pi me kata parittāṇāḥ sattāḥ apagacchantu
translated: A pellet is a lump of clay. I have made protection, I have made a safeguard: I have made protection and a safeguard for this many people. Let the beings go away: let all beings for whom I have made a safeguard go away,

analyzed: mā mama viheṭhayiṃsu iti attho yassa mama etehi sabbehi pi mā ittam saḥ aham bhagavataḥ

analyzed: namaḥ karomi vipassī ādīnam ca sattannam sammāsambuddhānam namaḥ karomi iti sambandhaḥ
