original: bhūmiyaṃ pāteyyāthā”ti. So tattha gantvā seṭṭhiṃ āha “mahāseṭṭhi ayaṃ patto aññesaṃ
analyzed: bhūmiyam pāteyyātha ati so tattha gantvā seṭṭhim āha mahā seṭṭhi ayam patto aññesam
translated: When he got there, he said to the merchant, “Great merchant, this bowl is not fit for you.

original: nānucchaviko, mā te appamattakassa kāraṇā mama ākāse uppatanaṃ rucci, dehi me patta”nti.
analyzed: na ānucchavikaḥ mā te appamattakassa kāraṇā mama ākāse uppatanam rucci dehi me pattanti
translated: Do not allow me to fly up into the air for the sake of so little. Give me the bowl.”

original: Bhante, ākāsena uppatitvāva gaṇhathāti. Tato nāṭaputto “tena hi apetha apethā”ti
analyzed: bhante ākāsena uppatitvā ava gaṇhatha ati tatas nāṭa putto tena hi apetha apetha ati
translated: “Venerable sir, fly up into the air and take it.” Then the magician said, “Stand back, stand back!”

original: antevāsike apanetvā “ākāse uppatissāmī”ti ekaṃ hatthañca pādañca ukkhipi. Atha naṃ🔽antevāsikā “ācariya, kiṃ nāmetaṃ karotha, chavassa dārumayapattassa kāraṇā paṭicchannaguṇena
analyzed: antevāsike apanetvā ākāse uppatissāmi iti ekam hatthañca pādañca ukkhipi atha naṃ  antevāsikāḥ ācariya kim nāma etam karotha chavassa dāru maya pattassa kāraṇā paṭicchanna guṇena
translated: and he said to his pupils, “I will fly up into the air.” He raised one hand and one foot,

original: tumhehi mahājanassa dassitena ko attho”ti taṃ hatthapādesu gahetvā ākaḍḍhitvā bhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: tumhehi mahājanassa dassitena kaḥ atthaḥ ti tam hattha pādesu gahetvā ākaḍḍhitvā bhūmiyam
translated: but his pupils caught hold of him and said, “Master, what are you doing? For the sake of a piece of rotten wood, a mere bowl? What have you to do with showing your hidden virtue to the multitude?” So saying, they dragged him to the ground.

original: pātesuṃ. So seṭṭhiṃ āha “mahāseṭṭhi, ime me uppatituṃ na denti, dehi me patta”nti.
analyzed: pātesum saḥ seṭṭhim āha mahā seṭṭhi ime me uppatitum na denti dehi me pattanti
translated: He said to the treasurer, “Great treasurer, these men will not let me fly up into the air. Give me my bowl.”

original: Uppatitvāva gaṇhatha bhanteti. Evaṃ titthiyā cha divasāni vāyamitvāpi pattaṃ na labhiṃsuyeva.
analyzed: uppatitvā ava gaṇhatha bhante iti evam titthiyāḥ cha divasāni vā āyamitvā api pattam na
translated: “Fly up into the air and take it, Reverend Sir.” Thus for six days the heretic tried in vain to get his bowl.

original: Atha sattame divase āyasmato ca moggallānassa āyasmato ca piṇḍolabhāradvājassa “rājagahe
analyzed: atha sattame divase āyasmataḥ ca moggallānassa āyasmataḥ ca piṇḍolabhāradvājassa rājagahe
translated: On the seventh day the Venerable Moggallāna and the Venerable Piṇḍolabhāradvāja went to Rājagaha

original: piṇḍāya carissāmā”ti gantvā ekasmiṃ piṭṭhipāsāṇe ṭhatvā cīvaraṃ pārupanakāle dhuttakā
analyzed: piṇḍāya carissāma iti gantvā ekasmin piṭṭhi pāsāṇe ṭhatvā cīvaram pārupana kāle dhuttakā
translated: and sat down to put on their robes on a flat rock at the back of the house. At that moment the following discussion arose among the ascetics,

original: kathaṃ samuṭṭhāpesuṃ “hambho pubbe cha satthāro ‘mayaṃ arahantāmhā’ti vicariṃsu,
analyzed: katham samuṭṭhāpesuṃ hambho pubbe cha satthāraḥ mayam arahantāmha ati vicariṃsu
translated: “Friends, formerly the six teachers went about, saying, ‘We are Arahats.’

original: rājagahaseṭṭhino pana ajja sattamo divaso pattaṃ ussāpetvā ṭhapayato ‘sace arahā
analyzed: rājagaha seṭṭhinaḥ pana ajja sattamaḥ divasaḥ pattam ussāpetvā ṭhapayato sace arahā
translated: But today is the seventh day for the chief merchant of Rājagaha who has been holding up his bowl, saying: ‘If an Arahant🔽

original: atthi, ākāsenāgantvā gaṇhātū’ti vadantassa, ekopi ‘ahaṃ arahā’ti ākāse uppatanto
analyzed: atthi ākāsena āgantvā gaṇhātu uti vadantassa ekaḥ api aham arahā ati ākāse uppatanto
translated: But today is the seventh day since the treasurer of Rājagaha has been holding up his bowl, saying, ‘If there is an arahat, let him come through the air and take it.’ And not one of them has flown up into the air, saying, ‘I am an arahat.’

original: natthi, ajja no loke arahantānaṃ natthibhāvo ñāto”ti. Taṃ kathaṃ sutvā āyasmā mahāmoggallāno
analyzed: natthi ajja no loke arahantānam natthibhāvaḥ ñāto ti tam katham sutvā āyasmā mahāmoggallāno
translated: Today we have come to know that there are no arahats in the world.” When the venerable Mahā Moggallāna heard this conversation,

original: āyasmantaṃ piṇḍolabhāradvājaṃ āha “sutaṃ te, āvuso bhāradvāja, imesaṃ vacanaṃ, ime🔽buddhasāsanaṃ pariggaṇhantā viya vadanti, tvañca mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo, gacchetaṃ🔽pattaṃ ākāsena gantvā gaṇhāhī”ti. “Āvuso moggallāna, tvaṃ ‘iddhimantānaṃ aggo’ti
analyzed: āyasmantam piṇḍola bhāradvājam āha sutam te āvusaḥ bhāradvājaḥ ime ime  buddha sāsanam pariggaṇhantāḥ viya vadanti tvañca mahiddhikaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ gacchetam  pattam ākāsena gantvā gaṇhāhi iti āvuso moggallāna tvam iddhimantānam aggo ti
translated: he said to the venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja, “Friend Bhāradvāja, have you heard this conversation?🔽They are speaking as if they were the guardians of the Buddha’s Dispensation. And you are one of great might and power. Go and take the bowl through the air.”

original: pākaṭo, tvaṃ etaṃ gaṇha, tayi pana aggaṇhante ahaṃ gaṇhissāmī”ti āha. Atha āyasmā
analyzed: pākaṭaḥ tvam etam gaṇha tayi pana aggaṇhante aham gaṇhissāmi iti āha atha
translated: “Friend Moggallāna, you are well known as the foremost of those who have psychic power. Take it yourself. If you will not take it, I will.”🔽“Take it, friend,” said the venerable Mahā Moggallāna.

original: mahāmoggallāno “gaṇhāvuso”ti āha. Iti te lokassa arahantehi asuññabhāvadassanatthaṃ evamāhaṃsu.
analyzed: mahāmoggallānaḥ gaṇha avuso ti āha iti te lokassa arahantehi asuñña bhāva dassana tham evam āhaṃsu
translated: Thus they spoke in order to show that the world was not empty of arahats.

original: Tikkhattuṃ rājagahaṃ anupariyāyīti tikkhattuṃ rājagahaṃ anugantvā paribbhami. “Sattakkhattu”ntipi🔽vadanti. Thero kira abhiññāpādakaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjitvā uṭṭhāya tigāvutaṃ piṭṭhipāsāṇaṃ
analyzed: tikkhattum rājagaham anupariyāyi iti tikkhattum rājagaham anugantvā paribbhami sattakkhattum tipi  vadanti theraḥ kira abhiññā pādakam jhānam samāpajjitvā uṭṭhāya tigāvutam piṭṭhi pāsāṇam
translated: He went three times round Rājagaha. He went three times round Rājagaha, wandering about. They say that he went seven times round Rājagaha.

original: antantena paricchindanto tūlapicu viya ākāse uṭṭhāpetvā rājagahanagarassa upari sattakkhattuṃ
analyzed: antantena paricchindanto tūla picu viya ākāse uṭṭhāpetvā rājagaha nagarassa upari satta kkhattum
translated: The Elder, it seems, attained jhāna, which is a basis for direct-knowledge, and he emerged and lifted up the rock, which was three gavutes long, as if it were a tuft of cotton, and he went seven times round Rājagaha with it above the town.

original: anupariyāyi. So tigāvutappamāṇassa nagarassa apidhānaṃ viya paññāyi. Nagaravāsino
analyzed: anupariyāyi so tigāvuta ppamāṇassa nagarassa apidhānam viya paññāyi nagara vāsinaḥ
translated: It appeared as if the town had been covered with a roof three gavutes long. The people in the town

original: “pāsāṇo no avattharitvā gaṇhātī”ti bhītā suppādīni matthake katvā tattha tattha nilīyiṃsu.
analyzed: pāsāṇaḥ naḥ avattharitvā gaṇhāti iti bhītā suppādīni matthake katvā tattha tattha nilīyiṃsu
translated: were frightened, thinking “The rock is going to fall on us,” and they put pillows on their heads and lay down here and there.

original: Sattame vāre thero piṭṭhipāsāṇaṃ bhinditvā attānaṃ dasseti. Mahājano theraṃ disvā
analyzed: sattame vāre thero piṭṭhi pāsāṇam bhinditvā attānam dasseti mahā janaḥ theram disvā
translated: On the seventh time the Elder broke the rock and showed himself. The people

original: “bhante piṇḍolabhāradvāja, tava pāsāṇaṃ gāḷhaṃ katvā gaṇha, mā no sabbe nāsayī”ti
analyzed: bhante piṇḍolabhāradvāja tava pāsāṇam gāḷham katvā gaṇha mā no sabbe nāsayi iti
translated: saw the Elder and said, “Venerable Piṇḍolabhāradvāja, make your rock heavy and hold it down, lest you destroy us all.”

original: āha. Thero pāsāṇaṃ pādantena khipitvā vissajjesi. So gantvā yathāṭhāneyeva patiṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: āha theraḥ pāsāṇam pādantena khipitvā vissajjesi saḥ gantvā yathāṭhāneyā iva patiṭṭhāsi
translated: The Elder said, “Very well,” and with the tip of his foot he hurled the rock into the air and then let it fall. It went to the place where it had been before and remained there.

original: Thero seṭṭhissa gehamatthake aṭṭhāsi. Taṃ disvā seṭṭhi urena nipajjitvā “otara sāmī”ti
analyzed: thero seṭṭhissa geha matthake aṭṭhāsi tam disvā seṭṭhi urena nipajjitvā otara sāmi iti
translated: The Elder stood in the house of the treasurer. When the treasurer saw him, he fell on his breast and said, “Come down, Reverend Sir.”

original: vatvā ākāsato otiṇṇaṃ theraṃ nisīdāpetvā pattaṃ gahetvā catumadhurapuṇṇaṃ katvā therassa🔽adāsi. Thero pattaṃ gahetvā vihārābhimukho pāyāsi. Athassa ye araññagatā pāṭihāriyaṃ
analyzed: vatvā ākāsataḥ otiṇṇam theram nisīdāpetvā pattam gahetvā catu madhura puṇṇam katvā therassa  adāsi theraḥ pattam gahetvā vihāra abhimukhaḥ athassa ye arañña gatā pāṭihāriyam
translated: The Elder came down from the air and sat down. The treasurer took his bowl, filled it with the four sweet foods, and gave it to the Elder.

original: nāddasaṃsu, te sannipatitvā “bhante, amhākampi pāṭihāriyaṃ dassehī”ti theraṃ anubandhiṃsu.
analyzed: na addasaṃsu te sannipatitvā bhante amhākam pi pāṭihāriyam dassehi iti theram anubandhiṃsu
translated: The Elder took the bowl and started out for the monastery. Then those who had gone to the forest and had not seen the miracle assembled and said to the Elder, “Reverend Sir, show us a miracle.”

original: So tesaṃ tesaṃ pāṭihāriyaṃ dassento vihāraṃ agamāsi. Satthā taṃ anubandhitvā unnādentassa🔽mahājanassa saddaṃ sutvā “ānanda, kasseso saddo”ti pucchi. Tena vuttaṃ “assosi kho
analyzed: saḥ tesam tesam pāṭihāriyam dassentaḥ vihāram agamāsi satthā tam anubandhitvā unnādentassa  mahājanassa saddam sutvā ānanda kassa iso saddo ti pucchi tena vuttam assosi kho
translated: So the Elder showed them a miracle one after another, and then went to the monastery. The Teacher followed him, and when he heard the great crowd shouting,🔽asked Ānanda, “Ānanda, what is that shouting and great shouting?”

original: bhagavā…pe… kiṃ nu kho so, ānanda, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo”ti.
analyzed: kim nu kho saḥ ānandaḥ uccāsaddaḥ mahāsaddaḥ iti
translated: “So it is, Ānanda; so it is, Ānanda.”

original: Vikubbaniddhiyā pāṭihāriyaṃ paṭikkhittanti ettha vikubbaniddhi nāma “so pakativaṇṇaṃ🔽vijahitvā kumārakavaṇṇaṃ vā dasseti nāgavaṇṇaṃ vā, vividhampi senābyūhaṃ dassetī”ti
analyzed: vikubbaniddhiyā pāṭihāriyam paṭikkhittanti ettha nāma  vijahitvā kumāraka vaṇṇam vā dasseti nāga vaṇṇam vā vividham pi senā byūham dasseti iti
translated: The miracle of transformation is prohibited. Herein, the miracle of supernormal power is that described in the way beginning, “Having abandoned the normal appearance of oneself, showing the appearance of a boy, or showing the appearance of a nāga” ,

original: evamāgatā pakativaṇṇavijahanavikāravasena pavattā iddhi. Adhiṭṭhāniddhi pana “pakatiyā🔽eko bahukaṃ āvajjati sataṃ vā sahassaṃ vā satasahassaṃ vā, āvajjitvā ñāṇena adhiṭṭhāti
analyzed: evam āgatā pakati vaṇṇa vijahana vikāra vasena pavattā iddhi pana pakatiyā  ekaḥ bahukam āvajjati satam vā sahassam vā sata sahassam vā āvajjitvā ñāṇena adhiṭṭhāti
translated: and so on. The miracle of resolve is that described in the way beginning, “Having resolved on the normal appearance of oneself” ,

original: ‘bahuko homī”’ti evaṃ vibhajitvā dassitā adhiṭṭhānavasena nipphannā iddhi.
analyzed: bahukaḥ homi iti evam vibhajitvā dassitā adhiṭṭhāna vasena nipphannā
translated: and so on.

original: 253-254. Na acchupiyantīti na suphassitāni honti. Rūpakākiṇṇānīti itthirūpādīhi ākiṇṇāni.
analyzed: na acchupiyanti iti na su phassitāni honti rūpaka ākiṇṇāni iti itthi rūpa ādīhi ākiṇṇāni
translated: They do not touch each other: they do not touch each other closely. They are crowded with forms: they are crowded with the forms of women, and so on.

original: Bhūmiādhāraketi valayādhārake. Dāruādhārakadaṇḍādhārakesūti ekadārunā kataādhārake
analyzed: bhūmi ādhāraka iti valaya ādhārake eka dārunā eka dārunā
translated: On a support of earth: on a support of clay. On a support of wood, on a support of bamboo: the meaning is, on a support made of one piece of wood,

original: bahūhi daṇḍakehi kataādhārake vāti attho, tīhi daṇḍehi kato pana na vaṭṭati. Bhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: bahūhi daṇḍakehi kata ādhārake vā ati attho tīhi daṇḍehi kataḥ pana na vaṭṭati bhūmiyam
translated: on a support made of many bamboos. But one made of three bamboos is not allowed. On the ground,

original: pana nikkujjitvā ekameva ṭhapetabbanti ettha dve ṭhapentena upari ṭhapitapattaṃ ekena
analyzed: pana nikkujjitvā ekam eva ṭhapetabbanti ettha dve ṭhapentena upari ṭhapita pattam ekena
translated: But if it is turned over, it should be put down as one.🔽Two people putting it down are allowed to put it down so that the bowl is in contact with the ground on one side.

original: passena bhūmiyaṃ phusāpetvā ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭatīti vadanti. Ālindakamiḍḍhikādīnanti pamukhamiḍḍhikānaṃ.🔽Parivattitvā tattheva patiṭṭhātīti ettha “parivattitvā tatiyavāre tattheva miḍḍhiyā
analyzed: passena bhūmiyam ṭhapetum vaṭṭati iti vadanti pamukham iḍḍhikānam  parivattitvā tattha iva patiṭṭhāti iti ettha parivattitvā tatiya vāre tattha iva miḍḍhiyā
translated: The “edge of a bamboo, etc.” is the edge of a bamboo support.

original: patiṭṭhātī”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Paribhaṇḍaṃ nāma gehassa bahi kuṭṭapādassa thirabhāvatthaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhāti iti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam paribhaṇḍam nāma gehassa bahi kuṭṭa pādassa thira bhāva ttham
translated: It falls back on to the same place: in the passage “it falls back on to the same place in the third turn,” the words “in the third turn” are supplied from the commentary.🔽A “support” is a thin support made outside the house at the foot of the wall in order to make it firm.

original: katā tanukamiḍḍhikā vuccati. Tanukamiḍḍhikāyāti khuddakamiḍḍhikāya. Miḍḍhantepi ādhārake🔽ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭati. “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ādhāraka”nti hi vacanato miḍḍhādīsu yattha
analyzed: katā tanukam iḍḍhikā vuccati tanukam iḍḍhikāya ati khuddakam iḍḍhikāya ādhārake  ṭhapetum vaṭṭati anujānāmi bhikkhave ādhārakam ti hi vacanataḥ miḍḍha ādīsu yattha
translated: On a thin support: on a small support.🔽It is allowable to put it on a support even if it is not fixed.

original: katthaci ādhārakaṃ ṭhapetvā tattha pattaṃ ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭati ādhārake ṭhapanokāsassa
analyzed: katthaci ādhārakam ṭhapetvā tattha pattam ṭhapetum vaṭṭati ādhārake ṭhapana ukāsassa
translated: For it is said, “I allow you, monks, a support.” So it is allowable to put the bowl on a support after putting the support anywhere on the floor, on a rock, etc.

original: aniyamitattāti vadanti. “Pattamāḷo nāma vaṭṭetvā pattānaṃ agamanatthaṃ vaṭṭaṃ vā
analyzed: aniyamita ttā ti vadanti pattamāḷaḥ nāma vaṭṭetvā pattānam a gamana attham vaṭṭam vā
translated: they say. “A bowl-rack is a rack for hanging bowls in order to prevent their being damaged.

original: caturassaṃ vā iṭṭhakādīhi parikkhipitvā kato”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.🔽255. Ghaṭikanti upari yojitaṃ aggaḷaṃ. Tāvakālikaṃ paribhuñjituṃ vaṭṭatīti sakideva
analyzed: catur assam vā iṭṭhaka ādīhi parikkhipitvā kataḥ ti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam  ghaṭikam ti upari yojitam aggaḷam tāvakālikam paribhuñjitum vaṭṭati iti sakideva
translated: They say that it is not specified. “A bowl-rack is a rack for bowls made by surrounding them with a circle or a square of bricks, etc., for the purpose of preventing them from rolling off” is said in the Commentaries.

original: gahetvā tena āmisaṃ paribhuñjitvā chaḍḍetuṃ vaṭṭatīti adhippāyo. Ghaṭikaṭāheti bhājanakapāle.🔽Abhuṃ meti ettha bhavatīti bhū, vaḍḍhi. Na bhūti abhū, avaḍḍhi. Bhayavasena pana
analyzed: gahetvā tena āmisam paribhuñjitvā chaḍḍetum vaṭṭati iti adhippāyaḥ ghaṭi kaṭāha iti bhājana kapāle  abhum mā iti ettha bhavati iti bhū vaḍḍhi na bhaya vasena pana
translated: A bolt is a bar fixed above. The meaning is that it is allowable to use it for a short time. In the passage “a bowl-holder,” “holder” is a container.

original: sā itthī “abhu”nti āha, vināso mayhanti attho. Chavasīsassa pattanti chavasīsamayaṃ
analyzed: sā itthī āha chava sīsassa pattanti chava sīsa mayam
translated: “I was not” : “Bhū” is “vaḍḍhi” , increase. “Na bhū” is “avaḍḍhi” , non-increase. But the meaning of the passage is that the woman said “I was not” out of fear, that is, “I was not destroyed.” “A bowl for a dead person” is a bowl belonging to a dead person.

original: pattaṃ. Pakativikārasambandhe cetaṃ sāmivacanaṃ, abhedepi vā bhedūpacārenāyaṃ vohāro
analyzed: pattam pakati vikāra sambandhe sāmi vacanam abhede pi vā bhedu upacārena ayam vohāraḥ
translated: This is a possessive expression based on a relationship of transformation. Or this usage is based on the figure of speech called “non-difference between what is different”

original: “silāputtakassa sarīra”ntiādīsu viya.
analyzed: silāputtakassa sarīra nti ādīsu viya
translated: as in the passage “the body of the stone image.”

original: Cabbetvāti khāditvā. Ekaṃ udakagaṇḍusaṃ gahetvāti vāmahattheneva pattaṃ ukkhipitvā
analyzed: cabbetvā iti khāditvā ekam udaka gaṇḍusam gahetvā iti vāma hatthena iva pattam ukkhipitvā
translated: “Having eaten” : having chewed. “Having taken a mouthful of water” : having lifted up the bowl with the left hand.

original: mukhena gaṇḍusaṃ gahetvā. Ucchiṭṭhahatthenāti sāmisena hatthena. Ettāvatāti ekagaṇḍusagahaṇamattena.
analyzed: mukhena gaṇḍusam gahetvā ucchiṭṭha hatthena ati sa āmisena hatthena ettāvatā ati eka gaṇḍusa gahaṇa mattena
translated: Having taken hold of the boil with his mouth: having taken hold of the boil with his mouth. With a hand soiled with food: with a hand soiled with food. To this extent: just by taking hold of the boil.

original: Luñcitvāti tato maṃsaṃ uddharitvā. Etesu sabbesu paṇṇattiṃ jānātu vā mā vā, āpattiyeva.🔽256. Kiṇṇacuṇṇenāti surākiṇṇacuṇṇena. “Anuvātaṃ paribhaṇḍanti kilañjādīsu karontī”ti
analyzed: luñcitvā iti tatas maṃsam uddharitvā etesu sabbesu paṇṇattim jānātu vā mā vā āpattiyā iva  kiṇṇa cuṇṇena ati surā kiṇṇa cuṇṇena anuvātam paribhaṇḍanti kilañja ādīsu karonti iti
translated: Having cut: having removed the flesh from it. original: 280-282. Muṇḍavaṭṭīti mallakammakarādayo. Pamāṇaṅgulenāti vaḍḍhakīaṅgulaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Sesamettha pāḷito aṭṭhakathāto ca suviññeyyameva.🔽Khuddakavatthukkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.

translated: The section on the minor items is finished.

translated: and the wild beasts such as lions and tigers. For when one has entered a sheltered resting place and closed the door, these dangers do not arise. “Long-legged animals” are any animals that go on two legs. “Crocodiles” are mentioned only by way of illustration;🔽the inclusion of snakes, etc., should be understood in the same way. “Cold” is the cold touch arisen in the cold season, or for seven days in the winter,🔽or for a fortnight in the case of the “cold disease.” “Rain” is the rain that falls at that time.🔽“Wind and sun” are the wind and the sun that occur in a form that is harsh by reason of their causing the uprooting of trees, etc., and their being of a kind that is classified as “dusty” and so on.

original: vāto ceva gimhapariḷāhasamayesu uppattiyā ghoro sūriyātapo ca paṭihaññati paṭibāhīyati.

translated: and the wild beasts such as lions and tigers. For when he has entered a sheltered lodging and closed the door, these dangers do not exist for him. “Deep water” is any water that goes deep. “Crocodiles” is a term for large snakes. “Alligators” is a mere specification. “Fish” should be understood as including turtles, porpoises, etc., too. “Cold” is the cold touch arisen in the cold season or for seven days in the winter, etc. “Rain” is the rain that falls when the rains descend. “Wind and sun” is a strong wind and a strong sun that occur by blowing down trees, tearing up rocks, etc., and that are strong by arising in the hot season and the time of scarcity, respectively. “One should ward off” should be understood as “one should ward off by turning away from and by not giving attention to.”

original: Leṇatthanti nānārammaṇato cittaṃ nivattetvā paṭisallānārāmatthaṃ. Sukhatthanti vuttaparissayābhāvena

translated: ‘Dwelling’: a monastery. ‘Have built’: has built. ‘Pleasant’: delightful, comfortable. ‘Dwell’:

translated: Dwelling there, he should give them food and drink, clothing, and lodging, so that there may be no weariness in those learned men.

original: ratanattayaguṇānañca saddahanena vippasannena cetasā.

translated: He should give these requisites with a mind purified, with a mind of confidence, in those who are upright and endowed with faith in the fruits of action and the qualities of the Triple Gem.

translated: And when he goes out again, the bodily appearance fades in him through the sun’s heat and the wind and sun of the journey,

original: bahi vicarantassa ca pāde kaṇṭako vijjhati, khāṇu paharati, sarīsapādiparissayā ceva
analyzed: bahi vicarantassa ca pāde kaṇṭakaḥ vijjhati khāṇu paharati sarīsa pādi parissayā ca iva
translated: And when he goes out, thorns prick his feet, stumps hurt him, and there are dangers from snakes, etc.,

original: corabhayañca uppajjati, patissayaṃ pavisitvā dvāraṃ pidhāya nipannassa sabbe parissayā
analyzed: cora bhayam ca uppajjati patissayam pavisitvā dvāram pidhāya nipannassa sabbe parissayā
translated: and the fear of robbers arises. But when he has gone into the lodging and shut the door, all dangers cease.

original: na honti, sajjhāyantassa dhammapītisukhaṃ, kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasikarontassa upasamasukhañca
analyzed: na honti sajjhāyantassa dhamma pīti sukham kammaṭṭhānam manasikarontassa upasama sukham ca
translated: And when he recites the scriptures, he has the bliss of the happiness born of the Dhamma, and when he gives attention to a meditation subject, he has the bliss of tranquillity.

original: uppajjati bahiddhāvikkhepābhāvato, bahi vicarantassa ca sedā muccanti, akkhīni phandanti,
analyzed: uppajjati bahiddhā vikkhepa abhāvataḥ bahi vicarantassa ca sedāḥ muccanti akkhīni phandanti
translated: For there is no distraction outwards. And when he goes out, sweat pours from his armpits and his eyes water,

original: senāsanaṃ pavisanakkhaṇe mañcapīṭhāni na paññāyanti, muhuttaṃ nisinnassa pana akkhipasādo🔽āharitvā pakkhitto viya hoti, dvāravātapānamañcapīṭhādīni paññāyanti, etasmiñca āvāse🔽vasantaṃ disvā manussā catūhi paccayehi sakkaccaṃ upaṭṭhahanti. Tena vuttaṃ “so ca
analyzed: senāsanam pavisana khaṇe mañca pīṭhāni na paññāyanti muhuttam nisinnassa pana akkhipa sādaḥ  āharitvā pakkhittaḥ viya hoti dvāra vāta pāna mañca pīṭha ādīni paññāyanti etasmin ca āvāse  vasantam disvā manussā catūhi paccayehi sakkaccam upaṭṭhahanti tena vuttam saḥ ca
translated: and when he enters the lodging, the bed and chair are not visible because of the dust. But when he has sat down a while, the moisture of his eyes🔽cleanses his eyes as if he had applied collyrium to them, and the bed, chair, etc., become visible as if they had been washed. And people, seeing him living in this lodging,

original: sabbadado hoti, yo dadāti upassaya”nti.
analyzed: sabba dadaḥ hoti yaḥ dadāti upassayanti
translated: respectfully provide him with the four requisites. Hence it was said above: ‘He is a giver of all, he who gives a lodging.’

original: 296. Āviñchanacchiddanti yattha aṅguliṃ pavesetvā dvāraṃ ākaḍḍhantā dvārabāhaṃ phusāpenti,🔽tassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Āviñchanarajjunti kavāṭeyeva chiddaṃ katvā tattha pavesetvā
analyzed: aṅgulim pavesetvā dvāram ākaḍḍhantā dvāra bāham  tassa itam adhivacanam āviñchana rajjunti kavāṭeya iva chiddam katvā tattha pavesetvā
translated: The hole for the bolt is the place where they push the bolt in and pull the door to by pressing on the bolt.

original: yena rajjukena kaḍḍhantā dvāraṃ phusāpenti, taṃ āviñchanarajjukaṃ. Senāsanaparibhoge
analyzed: yena rajjukena kaḍḍhantāḥ dvāram tam āviñchana rajjukam senāsana paribhoge
translated: The rope for pulling the bolt is the rope for pulling the bolt by which they press on the door.🔽As to the use of a bed, there is no such thing as an unsuitable hide.

original: akappiyacammaṃ nāma natthīti dassanatthaṃ “sacepi dīpinaṅguṭṭhena katā hoti, vaṭṭatiyevā”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Cetiye vedikāsadisanti vātapānabāhāsu cetiye vedikāya viya paṭṭikādīhi dassetvā
analyzed: akappiya cammam nāma natthi iti dassana ttham sace pi dīpin aṅguṭṭhena katā hoti vaṭṭatiyā iva ati  vuttam cetiye vedikā sadisanti vāta pāna bāhāsu cetiye vedikāya viya paṭṭikā ādīhi dassetvā
translated: The words “If it is made of the skin of a rhinoceros” are said in order to show this.

original: kataṃ. Thambhakavātapānaṃ nāma tiriyaṃ dārūni adatvā ujukaṃ ṭhitehi eva veṇusalākādīhi kataṃ.
analyzed: katam thambhaka vātapānam nāma tiriyam dārūni a datvā ujukam ṭhitehi eva veṇu salākā ādīhi katam
translated: Like a railing on a shrine is a window-frame made by fixing strips of wood, etc., to the window- openings like a railing on a shrine.🔽A window-frame with posts is one made with bamboo poles, etc., fixed upright without cross-pieces.

original: Vihārānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Mañcapīṭhādianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vihāra anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  mañca pīṭha ādi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the allowance of a dwelling is finished.🔽The explanation of the discussion of the allowance of a bed, chair, etc.

original: 297. Poṭakitūlanti erakatiṇatūlaṃ. Poṭakigahaṇañcettha tiṇajātīnaṃ nidassanamattanti
analyzed: poṭaki tūlam ti eraka tiṇa tūlam poṭaki gahaṇam ca ittha tiṇa jātīnam
translated: Cotton wool from kapok pods: cotton wool from eraka pods. The mention of kapok here is merely by way of illustration.

original: āha “yesaṃ kesañci tiṇajātikāna”nti. Pañcavidhaṃ uṇṇāditūlampi vaṭṭatīti etthāpi🔽“bimbohane”ti ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. “Tūlapūritaṃ bhisiṃ apassayituṃ na vaṭṭatī”ti
analyzed: āha pañcavidham uṇṇa ādi tūlam pi vaṭṭati iti ettha api  bimbohane ti ānetvā sambandhitabbam tūla pūritam bhisim a passayitum na vaṭṭati iti
translated: “Of whatever kind they are, of grass, etc.”

original: keci vadanti, vaṭṭatīti apare. Upadahantīti ṭhapenti. Sīsappamāṇanti yattha galavāṭakato🔽paṭṭhāya sabbasīsaṃ upadahanti, taṃ sīsappamāṇaṃ. Tañca ukkaṭṭhaparicchedato tiriyaṃ
analyzed: keci vadanti vaṭṭati iti apare upadahanti iti ṭhapenti sīsa pamāṇanti galavāṭakato  paṭṭhāya sabba sīsam upadahanti tam sīsa ppamāṇam tam ca ukkaṭṭha paricchedato tiriyam
translated: Cotton-wool, etc., of five kinds are allowable. Here, too, the word “pillow” should be brought in. Some say that it is not allowable to use a pillow stuffed with cotton-wool; others say it is allowable. “They place” : they put. “The size of the head” : the size of the whole head, beginning from the neck.

original: muṭṭhiratanaṃ hotīti dassetuṃ “yassa vitthārato tīsu kaṇṇesū”tiādimāha. Majjhaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: muṭṭhi ratanam hoti iti dassetum yassa vitthārato tīsu kaṇṇesu utiādim āha majjha ṭṭhānam
translated: In order to show that this is the maximum size, he says, “Three inches across at the ears.”🔽The middle part

original: muṭṭhiratanaṃ hotīti bimbohanassa majjhaṭṭhānaṃ tiriyato muṭṭhiratanappamāṇaṃ hoti.🔽Masūraketi cammamayabhisiyaṃ. Phusitāni dātunti saññākaraṇatthaṃ bindūni dātuṃ.
analyzed: muṭṭhi ratanam hoti iti bimbohanassa majjha ṭṭhānam tiriyataḥ muṭṭhi ratana ppamāṇam hoti  masūraka iti camma maya bhisiyam phusitāni dātunti saññā karaṇa attham bindūni dātum
translated: is the size of a clenched fist. The middle part of the pillow is the size of a clenched fist across.🔽“A bag” : a pillow made of leather. “To mark” : to make marks.

original: 298. Na nibandhatīti anibandhanīyo, na allīyatīti attho. Paṭibāhetvāti maṭṭhaṃ katvā.
analyzed: na nibandhati iti a nibandhanīyaḥ na allīyati iti attho paṭibāhetvā ati maṭṭham katvā
translated: “It does not stick” : it is not sticky; it does not adhere, is the meaning. “After rubbing” : after making it smooth.

original: Iṭṭhakācayādianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: iṭṭhaka ācaya ādi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the allowance for a wall of bricks, etc.

original: 300. Rukkhaṃ vijjhitvāti rukkhadāruṃ vijjhitvā. Khāṇuke ākoṭetvāti dve dve khāṇuke
analyzed: rukkham vijjhitvā ati rukkha dārum vijjhitvā khāṇuke ākoṭetvā ati dve dve khāṇuke
translated: Having pierced a tree: having pierced a tree trunk. Having knocked together: having knocked two pieces together.

original: ākoṭetvā. Taṃ āharimaṃ bhittipādanti vuttanayena khāṇuke ākoṭetvā kataṃyeva sandhāya🔽vuttaṃ. Bhūmiyaṃ patiṭṭhāpetunti mūlena bhūmiyaṃ patiṭṭhāpetvā bhittipādassa upatthambhanavasena
analyzed: ākoṭetvā tam āharimam bhitti pādanti vutta nayena khāṇuke ākoṭetvā sandhāya  vuttam bhūmiyam patiṭṭhāpetunti mūlena bhūmiyam patiṭṭhāpetvā bhitti pādassa upatthambhana vasena
translated: The wall-foot that is brought: this is said referring to just what is made by knocking together pieces of wood in the way already described.

original: ussāpetvā khāṇukehi bhittipādaṃ ussāpetvā ṭhapetunti adhippāyo. Ubhato kuṭṭaṃ nīharitvā
analyzed: ussāpetvā khāṇukehi bhitti pādam ussāpetvā ṭhapetunti adhippāyaḥ ubhatas kuṭṭam nīharitvā
translated: Having set it up on the ground: having set it up with the root on the ground, the meaning is, having raised it by means of the wall-foot for the purpose of supporting it, having raised the wall-foot by means of the pieces of wood and having set it up.

original: katapadesassāti yathā antodvārasamīpe nisinnehi ujukaṃ bahi oloketuṃ na sakkā hoti,
analyzed: kata padesassa ati yathā antar dvāra samīpe nisinnehi ujukam bahi oloketum na sakkā hoti
translated: Having removed the wall on both sides: in such a way that those sitting near the inner door cannot look out straight in front of them,

original: evaṃ ubhohi passehi kuṭṭaṃ nīharitvā abhimukhe bhittiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā katapadesassa.🔽Samantā pariyāgāroti samantato āviddhapamukhaṃ. Ugghāṭanakiṭikanti daṇḍehi ukkhipitvā
analyzed: evam ubhohi passehi kuṭṭam nīharitvā abhimukhe bhittim upaṭṭhapetvā kata padesassa  samantā pariyāgāraḥ ti samantataḥ āviddha pamukham ugghāṭana kiṭikanti daṇḍehi ukkhipitvā
translated: having removed the wall on both sides and having set up the wall facing them, in the place that is made.

original: ṭhapanakapadarakiṭikaṃ.🔽Anāthapiṇḍikavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: ṭhapana kapadara kiṭikam 🔽anāthapiṇḍika vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: Having covered all round: having covered all round with a roof sloping inwards. The plastering-joint: the joint of the plastering-rod that is set up with sticks and

original: 304. Anāthapiṇḍikaseṭṭhivatthumhi kenacideva karaṇīyenāti vāṇijjakammaṃ adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: anāthapiṇḍika seṭṭhi vatthumhi kenacid eva karaṇīyena ati vāṇijja kammam adhippetam
translated: In the case of the story of Anathapindika the money-lender, “some business” is meant to be the business of trading.

original: Anāthapiṇḍiko kira rājagahaseṭṭhi ca aññamaññaṃ bhaginipatikā honti. Yadā rājagahe🔽uṭṭhānakabhaṇḍaṃ samagghaṃ hoti, tadā rājagahaseṭṭhi taṃ gahetvā sakaṭasatehi sāvatthiṃ🔽gantvā yojanamatte ṭhito attano āgatabhāvaṃ jānāpeti. Anāthapiṇḍiko paccuggantvā🔽tassa mahāsakkāraṃ katvā ekaṃ yānaṃ āropetvā sāvatthiṃ pavisati. So sace bhaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: kira rājagaha seṭṭhi ca aññamaññam bhagini patikāḥ honti yadā rājagahe  uṭṭhānaka bhaṇḍam samaggham hoti tadā rājagaha seṭṭhi tam gahetvā sakaṭa satehi sāvatthim  gantvā yojana matte ṭhitaḥ attanaḥ āgata bhāvam anāthapiṇḍiko paccuggantvā  tassa mahā sakkāram katvā ekam yānam āropetvā sāvatthim pavisati saḥ sace
translated: Anathapindika, it seems, was a money-lender of Rajagaha and a brother-in-law of the other. When the goods for sale in Rajagaha were all sold,🔽the Rajagaha money-lender took them in a hundred carts to Savatthi, and when he was a yojana from there he announced his arrival. Anathapindika went to meet him,

original: lahukaṃ vikkīyati, vikkiṇāti. No ce, bhaginighare ṭhapetvā pakkamati. Anāthapiṇḍikopi
analyzed: lahukam vikkīyati vikkiṇāti no ce bhagini ghare ṭhapetvā pakkamati anāthapiṇḍikaḥ api
translated: and after doing him great honour he took him up in a carriage and entered Savatthi with him. If the goods were saleable, he sold them. If not, he left them in his brother-in-law’s house and went away. Anathapindika did the same.

original: tatheva karoti. Svāyaṃ tadāpi teneva karaṇīyena agamāsi. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tathā iva karoti svāyam tadā api tena iva karaṇīyena agamāsi tam sandhāya itam vuttam
translated: So he went on this occasion for the same reason.

original: Taṃ divasaṃ pana rājagahaseṭṭhi yojanamatte ṭhitena anāthapiṇḍikena āgatabhāvajānanatthaṃ
analyzed: tam divasam pana rājagaha seṭṭhi yojana matte ṭhitena anāthapiṇḍikena āgata bhāva jānana attham
translated: But on that day, in order to let Anathapindika know that he had arrived, the Rajagaha money-lender stopped a yojana from Savatthi.

original: pesitaṃ paṇṇaṃ na suṇi, dhammassavanatthāya vihāraṃ agamāsi. So dhammakathaṃ sutvā
analyzed: pesitam paṇṇam na suṇi dhamma ssavana tthāya vihāram agamāsi saḥ dhamma katham sutvā
translated: He did not listen to the message and went to the monastery to hear the Dhamma.

original: svātanāya buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ nimantetvā attano ghare uddhanakhaṇāpanadāruphālanādīni
analyzed: svātanāya buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham nimantetvā attanaḥ ghare uddhana khaṇāpana dāru phālana ādīni
translated: After hearing the Dhamma talk, he invited the Community of monks headed by the Buddha for the next day’s meal and had the firewood chopped, the hearth built, the wood for the pestle and mortar split, and so on.

original: kāresi. Anāthapiṇḍikopi “idāni mayhaṃ paccuggamanaṃ karissati, idāni karissatī”ti
analyzed: kāresi anāthapiṇḍikaḥ api idāni mayham paccuggamanam karissati idāni karissati iti
translated: Anāthapiṇḍika thought, “Now he will come to meet me, now he will come,”

original: gharadvārepi paccuggamanaṃ alabhitvā antogharaṃ paviṭṭho paṭisanthārampi na bahuṃ
analyzed: ghara dvāre pi paccuggamanam a labhitvā antogharam paviṭṭhaḥ paṭisanthāram pi na bahum
translated: but he did not get a meeting at the door of the house. When he entered the house, he did not get much hospitality.

original: alattha. “Kiṃ mahāseṭṭhi kusalaṃ dārakarūpānaṃ, nasi magge kilanto”ti ettakova paṭisanthāro
analyzed: alattha kim mahāseṭṭhi kusalam dāraka rūpānam nasi magge kilanto ti ettakaḥ va paṭisanthāro
translated: “What is the matter, great treasurer? Are the children well? Are you tired on the road?” This was the only hospitality he got.

original: ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ “atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa etadahosī”tiādi.
analyzed: ahosi tena vuttam atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa etat ahosi itiādi
translated: Therefore it was said: “Then this occurred to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika” and so on.

original: Buddhoti tvaṃ gahapati vadesīti tassa kira mukhato buddhasaddaṃ sutvā anāthapiṇḍiko
analyzed: buddhaḥ iti tvam gahapati vadesi iti tassa kira mukhatas buddha saddam sutvā anāthapiṇḍiko
translated: You say “Buddha,” householder: it seems that after hearing the word “Buddha” from his mouth, Anāthapiṇḍika

original: pañcavaṇṇaṃ pītiṃ paṭilabhati, sā tassa sīse uṭṭhahitvā yāva pādapiṭṭhiyā, pādapiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: pañca vaṇṇam pītim paṭilabhati sā tassa sīse uṭṭhahitvā yāva pāda piṭṭhiyā pāda piṭṭhiyā
translated: obtained the fivefold rapture. It arose in his head and went as far as the soles of his feet, and from the soles of his feet

original: uṭṭhāya yāva sīsā gacchati, ubhato uṭṭhāya majjhe osarati, majjhe uṭṭhāya ubhato
analyzed: uṭṭhāya yāva sīsā gacchati ubhatas uṭṭhāya majjhe osarati majjhe uṭṭhāya ubhatas
translated: and it went up to his head, and it went up from both sides and down in the middle, and it went up in the middle and down from both sides.

original: gacchati. So pītiyā nirantaraṃ phuṭo “buddhoti tvaṃ gahapati vadesī”ti evaṃ tikkhattuṃ
analyzed: gacchati saḥ pītiyā nirantaram phuṭaḥ buddhaḥ ti tvam gahapati vadesi iti evam tikkhattum
translated: He was continuously suffused with rapture. “Householder, do you say ‘Buddha’? ” he asked three times.

original: pucchi. Akālo kho, gahapati, imaṃ kālaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamitunti🔽“buddhā nāma durāsadā āsīvisasadisā honti, satthā ca sivathikāya samīpe vasati, na
analyzed: pucchi akālaḥ kho gahapati imam kālam tam bhagavantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitun ti  buddhāḥ nāma durāsadāḥ āsīvisa sadisāḥ honti satthā ca sivathikāya samīpe vasati na
translated: “Householder, this is not the time to visit the Blessed One. ”

original: sakkā tattha imāya velāya iminā gantu”nti maññamāno evamāha. Buddhagatāya satiyā🔽nipajjīti aññaṃ kiñci acintetvā buddhagatāya eva satiyā nipajji. Taṃ divasaṃ kirassa
analyzed: sakkā tattha imāya velāya iminā gantun ti maññamānaḥ evam āha buddha gatāya satiyā  nipajji iti aññam kiñci a cintetvā buddha gatāya eva satiyā nipajji tam divasam kirassa
translated: “The Buddhas are hard to visit,” he thought. “They are like a poisonous snake. The Teacher is staying near a charnel ground. It is not possible to go there at this time.”🔽He lay down reflecting on the Buddha.

original: bhaṇḍasakaṭesu vā upaṭṭhākesu vā cittampi nuppajji, sāyamāsampi na akāsi. Sattabhūmikaṃ
analyzed: bhaṇḍa sakaṭesu vā upaṭṭhākesu vā cittam pi nuppajji sāyamāsam pi na akāsi satta bhūmikam
translated: He did not think of anything else. He lay down reflecting only on the Buddha. On that day, it seems, he had no thought of his merchandise or his attendants. He did not even have his evening meal.

original: pana pāsādaṃ āruyha supaññattālaṅkatavarasayane “buddho buddho”ti sajjhāyaṃ karontova
analyzed: pana pāsādam āruyha su paññatta alaṅkata vara sayane buddhaḥ buddha iti sajjhāyam karonto uva
translated: But he went up to the seven-storied palace and, sitting in the well-appointed, well-decorated bed-chamber, he recited the formula “Buddha, Buddha” over and over again.

original: nipajjitvā niddaṃ okkami. Tikkhattuṃ vuṭṭhāsi pabhātaṃ maññamānoti paṭhamayāme tāva
analyzed: nipajjitvā niddam okkami tikkhattum vuṭṭhāsi pabhātam maññamāno ti paṭhama yāme tāva
translated: When the first watch was over, he got up,

original: vītivatte uṭṭhāya buddhaṃ anussari, athassa balavappasādo udapādi, pītiāloko ahosi,
analyzed: vītivatte uṭṭhāya buddham anussari athassa balava pasādaḥ udapādi pīti ālokaḥ ahosi
translated: recollected the Buddha, and strong faith arose in him. There was a radiance of joy,

original: sabbatamaṃ vigacchi, dīpasahassujjalanaṃ viya canduṭṭhānasūriyuṭṭhānaṃ viya ca jātaṃ.
analyzed: sabbatamam vigacchi dīpa sahassa ujjalanam viya candu ṭṭhāna sūriyuṭṭhānam viya ca jātam
translated: and all darkness disappeared, as if a thousand lamps had been lit, or as if the moon had risen or the sun had come up.

original: So “pamādaṃ āpannomhi, vañcitomhi, sūriyo uggato”ti uṭṭhāya ākāsatale ṭhatvā candaṃ
analyzed: saḥ pamādam āpannomhi vañcitomhi sūriyaḥ uggataḥ ti uṭṭhāya ākāsa tale ṭhatvā candaṃ
translated: He thought, “I have been negligent, I have been deceived,” and he got up, stood in the air, and looked at the moon.

original: oloketvā “ekova yāmo gato, aññe dve atthī”ti puna pavisitvā nipajji, etenupāyena
analyzed: oloketvā ekaḥ iva yāmaḥ gataḥ aññe dve atthi iti puna pavisitvā nipajji etena upāyena
translated: He saw that one watch had passed and that two were left, so he went back to bed.

original: majjhimayāmāvasānepi pacchimayāmāvasānepi tikkhattuṃ uṭṭhāsi. Pacchimayāmāvasāne🔽pana balavapaccūseyeva uṭṭhāya ākāsatalaṃ āgantvā mahādvārābhimukho ahosi, sattabhūmikadvāraṃ
analyzed: majjhima yāma avasāne pi pacchima yāma avasāne pi tikkhattum uṭṭhāsi pacchima yāma avasāne  pana uṭṭhāya ākāsa talam āgantvā mahādvāra abhimukhaḥ ahosi satta bhūmika dvāram
translated: In the same way, he got up three times, at the end of the middle watch and at the end of the last watch.🔽But at the end of the last watch, he got up with the strong urge to urinate. He went to the top of the palace and stood facing the main gate.

original: sayameva vivaṭaṃ ahosi, pāsādā oruyha antaravīthiṃ paṭipajji.
analyzed: sayam eva vivaṭam ahosi pāsādāḥ oruyha antara vīthim paṭipajji
translated: The seven-terraced gate opened by itself, and he went down from the palace and set out on the main street.

original: 305. Amanussāti adhigatavisesā devatā. Tathā hi tā seṭṭhissa bhāvinisampattiṃ paccakkhato
analyzed: amanussā ti adhigata visesā devatā tathā hi tā seṭṭhissa bhāvi nisampattim paccakkhataḥ
translated: Amanussā: deities who had attained distinction. For they saw the future prosperity of the Great Treasurer with their own eyes.

original: sampassamānā “ayaṃ mahāseṭṭhi ‘buddhupaṭṭhānaṃ gamissāmī’ti nikkhanto paṭhamadassaneneva
analyzed: sampassamānā ayam mahā seṭṭhi buddha paṭṭhānam gamissāmi iti nikkhantaḥ paṭhama dassanena iva
translated: “This Great Treasurer has gone forth, thinking ‘I will go to the Buddha’s abode.’

original: sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhāya tiṇṇaṃ ratanānaṃ aggupaṭṭhāko hutvā asadisaṃ saṅghārāmaṃ
analyzed: sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhāya tiṇṇam rata nānam aggupaṭṭhākaḥ hutvā asadisam saṅgha ārāmaṃ
translated: By the first sight he has been established in the fruit of stream-entry. He will become the foremost supporter of the Three Gems. He will make the incomparable Saṅgha-ārāma

original: katvā cātuddisassa ariyasaṅghassa anāvaṭadvāro bhavissati, na yuttamassa dvāraṃ pidahitu”nti
analyzed: katvā cātuddisassa ariya saṅghassa an āvaṭa dvāraḥ bhavissati na yuttamassa dvāram pidahitunti
translated: and will be the one who keeps the door open to the noble Saṅgha of the four quarters. It is not proper for us to close the door to him.”

original: cintetvā dvāraṃ vivariṃsu. Antaradhāyīti rājagahaṃ kira ākiṇṇamanussaṃ, antonagare
analyzed: cintetvā dvāram vivariṃsu antaradhāyi iti rājagaham kira ākiṇṇa manussam antar nagare
translated: So they thought and opened the door. Antaradhāyī: it is said that Rājagaha was crowded with people.

original: nava koṭiyo bahinagare navāti taṃ upanissāya aṭṭhārasa manussakoṭiyo vasanti. Avelāya
analyzed: nava koṭiyaḥ bahi nagare tam upanissāya aṭṭhārasa manussa koṭiyaḥ vasanti avelāya
translated: In the inner city there were nine koṭis of people, and in the outer city there were nine koṭis. Thus, with the city as their support, eighteen koṭis of people lived there.🔽Unable to take out the dead bodies at the wrong time,

original: matamanusse bahi nīharituṃ asakkontā aṭṭālake ṭhatvā bahidvāre khipanti. Mahāseṭṭhi
analyzed: mata manusse bahi nīharitum a sakkontāḥ aṭṭālake ṭhatvā bahi dvāre khipanti mahā seṭṭhi
translated: they placed them on the city wall and threw them out of the city gate. The Great Treasurer

original: nagarato bahi nikkhantamattova allasarīraṃ pādena akkami, aparampi piṭṭhipādena pahari,
analyzed: nagarataḥ bahi nikkhanta mattaḥ iva alla sarīram pādena akkami aparam pi piṭṭhi pādena pahari
translated: as soon as he went out of the city, stepped on the dead body with his foot, and kicked another with his heel,

original: makkhikā uppatitvā pakiriṃsu, duggandho nāsāpuṭaṃ abhihani, buddhappasādo tanuttaṃ
analyzed: makkhikāḥ uppatitvā pakiriṃsu duggandhaḥ nāsāpuṭam abhihani buddha ppasādo tanuttam
translated: Flies rose up and swarmed about it, and a stench assailed his nostrils. His confidence in the Buddha became less intense,

original: gato. Tenassa āloko antaradhāyi andhakāro pāturahosi pītivegassa tanubhāve taṃsamuṭṭhitarūpānaṃ
analyzed: gataḥ tena assa ālokaḥ antaradhāyi andhakāro pāturahosi pītivegassa tanu bhāve
translated: and so the light disappeared and darkness appeared. This was because the form that arose from the force of his joy became weaker

original: paridubbalabhāvato. Saddamanussāvesīti “seṭṭhissa ussāhaṃ janessāmī”ti suvaṇṇakiṅkiṇikaṃ
analyzed: paridubbala bhāvataḥ saddam anussāvesi iti seṭṭhissa ussāham janessāmi iti suvaṇṇa kiṅkiṇikam
translated: because of the weakening of the force of joy. “He uttered a cry” means that he made a sound like the sound of a golden bell

original: ghaṭṭento viya madhurassarena saddaṃ anussāvesi.
analyzed: ghaṭṭentaḥ viya madhurassarena saddam anussāvesi
translated: in order to arouse the merchant’s energy.

original: Sataṃ kaññāsahassānīti purimapadānipi imināva sahassa-padena saddhiṃ sambandhitabbāni.
analyzed: satam kaññā sahassāni iti purima padāni pi iminā ava sahassa padena saddhim sambandhitabbāni
translated: “A hundred thousand maidens” : the preceding words should be construed with the word “thousand” here.

original: Yatheva hi sataṃ kaññāsahassāni, evaṃ sataṃ sahassāni hatthī, sataṃ sahassāni assā,
analyzed: yathā iva hi satam kaññā sahassāni evam satam sahassāni hatthī satam sahassāni assā
translated: For just as there were a hundred thousand maidens, so there were a hundred thousand elephants, a hundred thousand horses,

original: sataṃ sahassāni rathāti ayamettha attho, iti ekekaṃ satasahassaṃ dīpitaṃ hoti. Padavītihārassāti🔽padaṃ vītiharati etthāti padavītihāro. So dutavilambitaṃ akatvā samagamane dvinnaṃ
analyzed: satam sahassāni ati ayam ettha atthaḥ iti ekekam sata sahassam dīpitam hoti padavī tihārassa ati 🔽padam vītiharati ettha ati padavītihāraḥ saḥ a katvā sama gamane dvinnam
translated: and a hundred thousand chariots. This is the meaning here. Thus a hundred thousand each is indicated. “The pace of a chariot” :🔽a chariot is gone over here, thus it is the pace of a chariot. Without making it too slow, he went at an even pace.

original: padānaṃ antare muṭṭhiratanamattaṃ. Kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasinti taṃ ekaṃ padavītihāraṃ
analyzed: padānam antare muṭṭhi ratana mattam kalam tam ekam padavītihāram
translated: They are not worth a sixteenth part of it.

original: soḷasa bhāge katvā tato eko koṭṭhāso puna soḷasadhā, tato eko soḷasadhāti evaṃ soḷasa🔽vāre soḷasadhā bhinnassa eko koṭṭhāso soḷasī kalā nāma, taṃ soḷasiṃ kalaṃ etāni cattāri
analyzed: soḷasa bhāge katvā tatas ekaḥ koṭṭhāso puna soḷasadhā tatas ekaḥ soḷasadhā ati evam soḷasa  vāre soḷasadhā bhinnassa ekaḥ koṭṭhāso soḷasī kalā nāma tam soḷasim kalam etāni cattāri
translated: Having divided that one step into sixteen parts, one part of it again into sixteen, and again one part of that into sixteen, in this way🔽after sixteen repetitions, one part of it is called a sixteenth part.🔽Those four hundred thousand are not worth that sixteenth part. This is what is meant.

original: satasahassāni na agghanti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – sataṃ hatthisahassāni sataṃ assasahassāni
analyzed: sata sahassāni na agghanti idam vuttam hoti satam hatthi sahassāni satam assa sahassāni
translated: A hundred thousand elephants, a hundred thousand horses,

original: sataṃ rathasahassāni sataṃ kaññāsahassāni, tā ca kho āmukkamaṇikuṇḍalā sakalajambudīparājadhītarovāti
analyzed: satam ratha sahassāni satam kaññā sahassāni tā ca kho āmukka maṇi kuṇḍalā sakala jambudīpa rāja dhītarā uvāti
translated: a hundred thousand chariots, a hundred thousand maidens, and they are all adorned with pearl earrings and are the daughters of kings of all the kingdoms of India,

original: imasmā ettakā lābhā vihāraṃ gacchantassa tasmiṃ soḷasikalāsaṅkhāte padese laṅghanasādhanavasena
analyzed: imasmai ettakāḥ lābhāḥ vihāram gacchantassa tasmin soḷasi kalā saṅkhāte padese laṅghana sādhana vasena
translated: from all this gain, the thought that occurs to one who is going to the monastery, in the space called a sixteenth part, as a means of leaping over it,🔽is superior.

original: pavattacetanāva uttaritarāti. Padaṃ vā vītiharati etenāti padavītihāro, tathāpavattā
analyzed: pavatta cetanā vaḥ padam vā vītiharati etena ati tathā pavattā
translated: It is that by which one traverses a step, thus it is a step-traverse; it occurs in that way.

original: kusalacetanā, tassā phalaṃ soḷasadhā katvāti ca vadanti. Idaṃ pana vihāragamanaṃ
analyzed: kusala cetanā tassā phalam soḷasadhā katvā iti ca vadanti idam pana vihāra gamanam
translated: and the result of profitable kretā is sixteenfold.🔽But by whose reckoning is this going to the monastery stated?

original: kassa vasena gahitanti? Vihāraṃ gantvā anantarāyena sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhahantassa
analyzed: kassa vasena gahitanti vihāram gantvā anantarāyena sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhahantassa
translated: It is stated by the reckoning of one who, after going to the monastery, establishes himself in the fruit of stream-entry without delay.

original: vasena gahitaṃ. “Gandhamālādīhi pūjaṃ karissāmi, cetiyaṃ vandissāmi, dhammaṃ sossāmi,🔽dīpapūjaṃ karissāmi, saṅghaṃ nimantetvā dānaṃ dassāmi, sikkhāpadesu vā saraṇesu vā
analyzed: vasena gahitam gandha mālā ādīhi pūjam karissāmi cetiyam vandissāmi dhammam sossāmi  dīpa pūjam karissāmi saṅgham nimantetvā dānam dassāmi sikkhāpadesu vā saraṇesu vā
translated: It is also allowable by the reckoning of one who goes thinking “I shall make offerings of perfumes and garlands, I shall worship the shrine, I shall listen to the Dhamma,

original: patiṭṭhahissāmī”ti gacchatopi vasena vaṭṭatiyeva.🔽Andhakāro antaradhāyīti so kira cintesi “ahaṃ ekakoti saññaṃ karomi, amanussā ca
analyzed: patiṭṭhahissāmi iti gacchataḥ api vasena vaṭṭatiyā iva  andhakāraḥ antaradhāyi iti so kira cintesi aham ekako iti saññam karomi amanussā ca
translated: I shall make an offering of lights, I shall invite the Community and give a gift, I shall establish myself in the training precepts or in the Refuges.”

original: me anugāmino sahāyā atthi, kasmā bhāyāmī”ti sūro ahosi. Athassa balavā buddhappasādo
analyzed: me anugāminaḥ sahāyāḥ atthi kasmā bhāyāmi iti sūraḥ ahosi athassa balavā buddha ppasādo
translated: The darkness disappeared: it seems that he thought “I am not alone; there are non-human beings who are my companions and supporters. Why should I be afraid?” and he became bold. Then strong confidence in the Buddha arose in him,

original: udapādi, tasmā andhakāro antaradhāyi. Sesavāresupi eseva nayo. Āloko pāturahosīti
analyzed: udapādi tasmai andhakāraḥ antaradhāyi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: and so the darkness disappeared. The same method applies in the other cases. The light appeared:

original: purimabuddhesu cirakālaparicayasambhūtassa balavato pasādassa vasena uppannāya uḷārāya
analyzed: purima buddhesu cira kāla paricaya sambhūtassa balavataḥ pasādassa vasena uppannāya uḷārāya
translated: and by the power of the strong faith which he had acquired by long association with the Buddhas of the past, a great

original: buddhārammaṇāya pītiyā samuṭṭhāpito vipassanobhāsasadiso sātisayo cittapaccayautusamuṭṭhāno
analyzed: buddha ārammaṇāya pītiyā samuṭṭhāpitaḥ vipassanā bhāsa sadiso sa atisayaḥ citta paccaya otu samuṭṭhāno
translated: joy arose in his heart, having the Buddha for its object. This joy gave rise to a light, a light born of the elements of the body, a light which was the result of the power of the mind, a light which was like the radiance of insight.🔽Some say that the light was produced by the devas; but the former explanation is the correct one.

original: āloko pāturahosi. Devatāhi katotipi vadanti, purimoyevettha yuttataro. Ehi sudattāti
analyzed: vadanti ehi sudatta iti
translated: “Come, Sudatta!”

original: so kira seṭṭhi gacchamānova cintesi “imasmiṃ loke bahū pūraṇakassapādayo titthiyā
analyzed: so kira seṭṭhi gacchamānaḥ iva cintesi imasmin loke bahū pūraṇa kassapa ādayaḥ titthiyā
translated: As the treasurer was going along, he thought to himself, “In this world there are many sectarians, such as Pūraṇa Kassapa and others,

original: ‘mayaṃ buddhā, mayaṃ buddhā’ti vadanti, kathaṃ nu kho ahaṃ satthu buddhabhāvaṃ jāneyya”nti.🔽Athassa etadahosi “mayhaṃ guṇavasena uppannaṃ nāmaṃ mahājano jānāti, kuladattiyaṃ🔽pana me nāmaṃ aññatra mayā na koci jānāti, sace buddho bhavissati, kuladattikanāmena
analyzed: mayam buddhāḥ mayam buddha iti vadanti katham nu kho aham satthu buddha bhāvam jāneyyanti  athassa etat ahosi mayham guṇa vasena uppannam nāmam mahā janaḥ jānāti kuladattiyam  pana me nāmam aññatra mayā na koci jānāti sace buddhaḥ bhavissati kuladattika nāmena
translated: who say, ‘We are Buddhas, we are Buddhas.’ How shall I know whether the Teacher is a Buddha or not?”

original: maṃ ālapissatī”ti. Satthā tassa cittaṃ ñatvā evamāha.
analyzed: mam ālapissati iti satthā tassa cittam ñatvā evam āha
translated: And he thought to himself, “The name which I have received as the result of my own merits is known to all men, but the name which my parents gave me is known to no one except myself. If he is a Buddha, he will address me by the name which my parents gave me.” The Teacher, reading his thoughts, said to him, “Come, Sudatta!”

original: Parinibbutoti kilesaparinibbānena parinibbuto. Āsattiyoti rūpādīsu āsañjanaṭṭhena
analyzed: parinibbuto ti kilesa parinibbānena parinibbutaḥ āsattiyaḥ ti rūpa ādīsu āsañjana ṭṭhena
translated: ‘Extinguished’: extinguished by the extinction of defilements. ‘Attachment’: attachments to visible forms, etc.,

original: āsattiyo, taṇhāyo. Santinti kilesavūpasamaṃ. Pappuyyāti aggamaggena patvā. Sesamettha
analyzed: kilesa vūpasamam aggamaggena patvā sesam ettha
translated: are the craving for them. ‘Peace’: the stilling of defilements. ‘Having reached’: having reached by the path of the foremost way. The rest

original: pāḷianusāreneva veditabbaṃ. Yañcettha anuttānamatthaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttameva.
analyzed: pāḷi anusārena iva veditabbam yat ca ittha anuttānam attham tat aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam eva
translated: should be understood according to the text. What is not clear should be understood from the commentary.

original: 306. Vayameva veyyāyikanti āha “veyyāyikanti vayakaraṇaṃ vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: vayam eva veyyāyikanti āha veyyāyikanti vaya karaṇam vuccati iti
translated: ‘Work’: work is called what is to be done.

original: Anāthapiṇḍikavatthukathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anāthapiṇḍika vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the story of Anāthapiṇḍika is finished.

original: Aggāsanādianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: aggāsana ādi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the story of the permission to accept the chief seat, etc.

original: 310-311. Dakkhiṇodakanti aggato upanīyamānaṃ dakkhiṇodakaṃ. Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū
analyzed: dakkhiṇa udakam ti aggataḥ upanīyamānam dakkhiṇa udakam atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū
translated: ‘Water for the feet’: water for the feet brought forward. Then the Blessed One addressed the monks:

original: āmantesīti tehi bhikkhūhi attano attano rucivasena aggāsanādirahānaṃ kathitakāle
analyzed: āmantesi iti tehi bhikkhūhi attanaḥ attanaḥ ruci vasena aggāsana ādi rahānam kathita kāle
translated: ‘When those monks had told him of their refusal of the chief seat, etc., according to their own inclinations,

original: “na, bhikkhave, mayhaṃ sāsane aggāsanādīni patvā khattiyakulā pabbajito pamāṇaṃ,
analyzed: na bhikkhave mayham sāsane aggāsana ādīni patvā khattiya kulā pabbajitaḥ pamāṇam
translated: “In my Dispensation, monks, it is not the khattiya clan that is the criterion for accepting the chief seat, etc.,

original: na brāhmaṇakulā, na gahapatikulā pabbajito, na vinayadharo, na suttantiko, na ābhidhammiko,
analyzed: na brāhmaṇa kulā na gahapati kulā pabbajitaḥ na vinaya dharaḥ na suttantikaḥ na ābhidhammikaḥ
translated: not from a brahmin family, not from a merchant family, not an expert on the Monastic Law, not an expert on the discourses, not an expert on the analyses,

original: na paṭhamajjhānādilābhino, na sotāpannādayo pamāṇaṃ, atha kho, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ
analyzed: na paṭhama jhāna ādi lābhinaḥ na sotāpanna ādayaḥ pamāṇam atha kho bhikkhave imasmin
translated: not one who has attained the first absorption, not one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, but rather

original: sāsane yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ kattabbaṃ,
analyzed: sāsane yathāvuḍḍham abhivādanam paccuṭṭhānam añjali kammam sāmīci kammam kattabbaṃ
translated: in this Teaching, seniority is measured by how long one has gone forth.🔽The most senior monk should be offered the best seat, the best water, and the best almsfood.

original: aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍo laddhabbo, idamettha pamāṇaṃ, tasmā vuḍḍhataro bhikkhu
analyzed: agga āsanam agga udakam agga piṇḍaḥ laddhabbaḥ idam ettha pamāṇam tasmā vuḍḍhataraḥ bhikkhu
translated: This is the measure here. Therefore a more senior monk

original: etesaṃ anucchaviko. Idāni kho pana, bhikkhave, sāriputto mayhaṃ aggasāvako anudhammacakkappavattako
analyzed: etesam anucchavikaḥ idāni kho pana bhikkhave sāriputto mayham agga sāvakaḥ anudhamma cakka ppavattakaḥ
translated: is worthy of the best seat, the best water, and the best almsfood. Now, monks, Sāriputta is my chief disciple, the one who has developed disciples properly,

original: mamānantarasenāsanaṃ laddhuṃ arahati. So imaṃ rattiṃ senāsanaṃ alabhanto rukkhamūle🔽vītināmesi. Tumhe idāneva evaṃ agāravā appatissā, gacchante gacchante kāle kinti
analyzed: mama anantara senāsanam laddhum arahati saḥ imam rattim senāsanam a labhantaḥ rukkha mūle  tumhe idānā iva evam agāravāḥ appatissāḥ gacchante gacchante kāle kinti
translated: and he is worthy of the next best seat. But last night, not getting a dwelling, he spent the night at the foot of a tree.🔽But now you are so disrespectful and inconsiderate. As time goes by, what will you do?”

original: katvā viharissathā”ti vatvā atha nesaṃ ovādadānatthāya “pubbe, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatāpi
analyzed: katvā viharissatha ati vatvā atha nesam ovāda dāna tthāya pubbe bhikkhave tiracchāna gatā api
translated: Then, in order to instruct them, he told them this story about the past:

original: ‘na kho panetaṃ amhākaṃ patirūpaṃ, yaṃ mayaṃ aññamaññaṃ agāravā appatissā asabhāgavuttino
analyzed: na kho pana itam amhākam patirūpam yam mayam aññam aññam agāravāḥ appatissāḥ a sabhāga vuttino
translated: ‘It is not proper for us to live together without respect, without deference, without courtesy.

original: vihareyyāma, amhesu mahallakataraṃ jānitvā tassa abhivādanādīni karissāmā’ti sādhukaṃ🔽vīmaṃsitvā ‘ayaṃ mahallako’ti ñatvā tassa abhivādanādīni katvā devapathaṃ pūrayamānā
analyzed: vihareyyāma amhesu mahallakataram jānitvā tassa abhivādana ādīni karissāma ati sādhukam  vīmaṃsitvā ayam mahallakaḥ ti ñatvā tassa abhivādana ādīni katvā devapatham pūrayamānā
translated: Let us find out who is the more senior and then show him respect.’🔽After careful consideration they came to the conclusion that the elder was the more senior. They paid him respect, and then they went on their way, filling the whole path with their radiance.”

original: gatā”ti vatvā atītaṃ āharitvā dassetuṃ bhikkhū āmantesi.🔽Ye vuḍḍhamapacāyantīti jātivuḍḍho vayovuḍḍho guṇavuḍḍhoti tayo vuḍḍhā. Tesu jātisampanno
analyzed: gatā iti vatvā atītam āharitvā dassetum bhikkhū āmantesi  ye vuḍḍham apacāyanti iti jāti vuḍḍhaḥ vayaḥ vuḍḍhaḥ guṇa vuḍḍhaḥ iti tayaḥ vuḍḍhā tesu jāti sampannaḥ
translated: After telling this story, the Buddha spoke these stanzas to the monks:🔽“Those who respect the elder, who is skilled in the Dhamma,🔽who is virtuous, of good character, and has good friends,🔽will attain happiness in this very life.🔽Those who respect the elder, who is skilled in the Dhamma,🔽who is virtuous, of good character, and has good friends,🔽will attain happiness in this very life.”

original: jātivuḍḍho nāma, vaye ṭhito vayovuḍḍho nāma, guṇasampanno guṇavuḍḍho nāma. Tesu guṇasampanno🔽vayovuḍḍho imasmiṃ ṭhāne vuḍḍhoti adhippeto. Apacāyantīti jeṭṭhāpacāyikakammena pūjenti.
analyzed: jāti vuḍḍhaḥ nāma vaye ṭhitaḥ vayovuḍḍhaḥ nāma guṇa sampannaḥ guṇa vuḍḍhaḥ nāma tesu guṇa sampannaḥ  vayaḥ vuḍḍhaḥ imasmin ṭhāne vuḍḍhaḥ ti adhippeto apacāyanti iti jeṭṭhāpacāyika kammena pūjenti
translated: “Those who respect the elder”: there are three kinds of elders: elder by birth, elder by seniority, and elder by virtue. One who is endowed with birth is called “elder by birth.” One who has reached old age is called “elder by seniority.” One who is endowed with virtue is called “elder by virtue.” Of these, one who is endowed with virtue and who has reached old age is meant here by the word “elder.” “Respect”: they honor him by the duties of respect.

original: Dhammassa kovidāti jeṭṭhāpacāyanadhammassa kovidā kusalā. Diṭṭheva dhammeti imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: dhammassa kovidā ti jeṭṭha apacāyana dhammassa kovidā kusalā diṭṭhe iva dhamme ti imasmiṃ yeva
translated: “Skilled in the Dhamma”: skilled and adept in the Dhamma of respect for elders. “In this very life”: in this very existence.

original: attabhāve. Pāsaṃsāti pasaṃsārahā. Samparāye ca suggatīti samparetabbe imaṃ lokaṃ
analyzed: attabhāve pāsaṃsāti pasaṃsāra hā samparāye ca suggatī iti samparetabbe imam lokam
translated: in his own person. Praiseworthy: worthy of praise. And in the future a good destination:

original: hitvā gantabbe paralokepi tesaṃ sugatiyeva hotīti attho. Ayaṃ panettha piṇḍattho
analyzed: hitvā gantabbe para loke pi tesam su gatiyā iva hoti iti atthaḥ ayam pana ittha piṇḍa atthaḥ
translated: In this very life. Worthy of praise: deserving of praise. And in the future, a good destination: the meaning is that even in the next world, after they have left this world to go there, they have only a good destination. This is the overall meaning here.🔽The khattiyas, brahmins, vessas, suddas, householders, and those gone forth,

original: – bhikkhave, khattiyā vā hontu brāhmaṇā vā vessā vā suddā vā gahaṭṭhā vā pabbajitā
analyzed: bhikkhave khattiyāḥ vā hontu brāhmaṇāḥ vā vessāḥ vā suddāḥ vā gahaṭṭhāḥ vā pabbajitā
translated: and even the animals, who are skilled and adept in the practice of honouring the elder,

original: vā tiracchānagatā vā, ye keci sattā jeṭṭhāpacitikamme chekā kusalā guṇasampannānaṃ
analyzed: vā tiracchāna gatāḥ vā ye keci sattā jeṭṭhāpaciti kamme chekā kusalā guṇa sampannānam
translated: who pay respect to those who are endowed with good qualities and are advanced in years,

original: vayovuḍḍhānaṃ apacitiṃ karonti, te imasmiñca attabhāve jeṭṭhāpacitikārakāti pasaṃsaṃ
analyzed: vayaḥ vuḍḍhānam apacitim karonti te imasmin ca atta bhāve jeṭṭhāpaciti kārakā ati pasaṃsam
translated: in this very life they are praised, extolled, and lauded as ‘honourers of the elder,’

original: vaṇṇanaṃ thomanaṃ labhanti, kāyassa ca bhedā sagge nibbattantīti.🔽Aggāsanādianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vaṇṇanam thomanam labhanti kāyassa ca bhedā sagge nibbattanti iti  aggāsana ādi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: and with the breakup of the body, they are reborn in heaven.”🔽The explanation is finished of the section of text🔽in which the Buddha allows the use of the chief seat, etc.

original: Āsanappaṭibāhanādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: āsana paṭibāhana ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section of text🔽in which the Buddha allows the use of the chief seat, etc.

original: 313-4. Uddissakatanti gihīhi saṅghaṃ uddissa kataṃ. Gihivikatanti gihīhi kataṃ paññattaṃ, gihisantakanti vuttaṃ hoti. Atisamīpaṃ agantvāti bhikkhūnaṃ āsannataraṃ ṭhānaṃ agantvā.
analyzed: uddissakatanti gihīhi saṅgham uddissa katam gihivikatanti gihīhi katam paññattam gihisantakanti vuttam hoti atisamīpam a gantvā ati bhikkhūnam āsannataram ṭhānam a gantvā
translated: “Made for a specific person” means made for the Community by householders. “Made by householders” means made and prepared by householders, i.e., by the laity. “Without going too near” means without going to a place nearer to the bhikkhus.

original: Senāsanaggāhāpakasammutikathāvaṇṇanā🔽318. Paccayeneva hi taṃ paṭijagganaṃ labhissatīti tasmiṃ senāsane mahātherā tassa
analyzed: senāsana ggāhāpaka sammuti kathā vaṇṇanā  paccayena iva hi tam paṭijagganam labhissati iti tasmin senāsane mahā therā tassa
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the agreement to take charge of the resting places

original: paccayassa kāraṇā aññattha agantvā vasantāyeva naṃ paṭijaggissantīti attho. Ubbhaṇḍikā🔽bhavissantīti ukkhittabhaṇḍā bhavissanti, attano attano parikkhāre gahetvā tattha
analyzed: paccayassa kāraṇā aññattha a gantvā vasantāya iva nam paṭijaggissanti iti atthaḥ ubbhaṇḍikā  bhavissanti iti ukkhitta bhaṇḍāḥ bhavissanti attanaḥ attanaḥ parikkhāre gahetvā tattha
translated: The meaning is: because of the requisites, he will get the looking after of that resting place. The senior bhikkhus will not go elsewhere for the sake of those requisites but will live there and look after it themselves.🔽“They will be a burden” means they will be a burden to the bhikkhus. The meaning is: they will take their own requisites and wander about here and there.

original: tattha vicarissantīti attho. Dīghasālāti caṅkamanasālā. Maṇḍalamāḷo upaṭṭhānasālā.
analyzed: tattha vicarissanti iti attho dīghasālā ati caṅkamanasālā maṇḍalamāḷaḥ upaṭṭhāna sālā
translated: “Long hall” means a walking hall. “Pavilion” means a meeting hall.

original: Anudahatīti pīḷeti. Jambudīpe panāti ariyadese bhikkhū sandhāya vuttaṃ. Te kira tathā
analyzed: anudahati iti pīḷeti jambudīpe pana ati ariya dese bhikkhū sandhāya vuttam te kira tathā
translated: “Harasses” means torments. “In the Rose-Apple Island” is said with reference to the bhikkhus in the Noble One’s Dispensation.

original: paññāpenti. Na gocaragāmo ghaṭṭetabboti vuttamevatthaṃ vibhāveti “na tattha manussā🔽vattabbā”tiādinā. Vitakkaṃ chinditvāti “iminā nīhārena gacchantaṃ disvā nivāretvā
analyzed: paññāpenti na gocara gāmaḥ ghaṭṭetabbo ti vuttam eva attham vibhāveti na tattha manussā  vattabbā ati ādinā vitakkam chinditvā iti iminā nīhārena gacchantam disvā nivāretvā
translated: He explains the meaning of the words “The alms-resort village should not be disturbed” as follows: “People should not be spoken to there.”🔽Having cut off thoughts: without giving rise to thoughts such as “If they see me going on this errand, they will stop me and give me requisites.”

original: paccaye dassantī”ti evarūpaṃ vitakkaṃ anuppādetvā. Tesu ce ekoti tesu manussesu eko
analyzed: paccaye dassanti iti evarūpam vitakkam an uppādetvā tesu ce ekaḥ ti tesu manussesu ekaḥ
translated: If one of them: if one of those people is a wise man.🔽Goods for covering: goods for covering up, i.e. robes for covering the body.

original: paṇḍitapuriso. Bhaṇḍapaṭicchādananti paṭicchādanakabhaṇḍaṃ, sarīrapaṭicchādanaṃ cīvaranti attho.🔽Paṭijaggitabbānīti sammajjanādīhi paṭijaggitabbāni. Muṇḍavedikāyāti cetiyassa hammiyavedikāya.
analyzed: paṇḍita purisaḥ bhaṇḍa paṭicchādananti paṭicchādanaka bhaṇḍam sarīra paṭicchādanam cīvaranti attho  paṭijaggitabbāni iti sammajjana ādīhi paṭijaggitabbāni muṇḍa vedikāya ati cetiyassa hammiya vedikāya
translated: They should be looked after: they should be looked after by washing them, etc.🔽On the circular terrace: on the circular terrace of the shrine.

original: Hammiyavedikāti ca cetiyassa upari caturassavediyo vuccati. Paṭikkammāti vihārato🔽apasakkitvā. Upanikkhepanti khettaṃ vā nāḷikerādiārāmaṃ vā kahāpaṇādīni vā ārāmikādīnaṃ
analyzed: hammiya vedikā ati ca cetiyassa upari catur assa vediyaḥ vuccati paṭikkammā ati vihārato  apasakkitvā upanikkhepanti khettam vā nāḷikera ādi ārāmam vā kahāpaṇa ādīni vā ārāmika ādīnam
translated: And the circular terrace is called the “upper terrace” of the shrine.🔽Having gone out: having gone out from the monastery.

original: niyyātetvā “ito uppannā vaḍḍhi vassāvāsikatthāya hotū”ti dinnaṃ. Vattaṃ katvāti tasmiṃ
analyzed: itas uppannā vaḍḍhi vassāvāsika atthāya hotu uti dinnam vattam katvā iti tasmin
translated: Having handed over: having handed over the field or the pleasure garden with coconuts, etc., or the coins, etc., to the field-attendant or the garden-attendant, saying, “Let the profit from this be for the rains residence.”🔽Having done the duty: having done the duty

original: senāsane kattabbavattaṃ katvā.🔽Puggalavaseneva kātabbanti parato vakkhamānanayena “bhikkhū cīvarena kilamanti, ettakaṃ
analyzed: senāsane kattabbavattam katvā  puggala vasena iva kātabbanti paratas vakkhamāna nayena bhikkhū cīvarena kilamanti ettakam
translated: and he should do what is to be done in regard to the dwelling.

original: nāma taṇḍulabhāgaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvaraṃ kātuṃ ruccatī”tiādinā puggalaparāmāsavaseneva
analyzed: nāma taṇḍula bhāgam bhikkhūnam cīvaram kātum ruccati iti ādinā puggala parāmāsa vasena iva
translated: “It should be done by individuals”: it should be done by individuals, not by the Community, as will be explained later on. “The bhikkhus are tired of robes”: “It would be good if the Community were to give so much of this rice-gruel to the bhikkhus to make robes with.”

original: kātabbaṃ, “saṅgho cīvarena kilamatī”tiādinā pana saṅghaparāmāsavasena na kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: kātabbam saṅghaḥ cīvarena kilamati iti ādinā pana saṅgha parāmāsa vasena na kātabbam
translated: But it should not be done by the Community, as in “The Community is tired of robes.”

original: Cīvarapaccayanti cīvarasaṅkhātaṃ paccayaṃ. Vuttanti mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃvuttaṃ. Kasmā
analyzed: cīvara paccayanti cīvara saṅkhātam paccayam vuttanti mahā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam kasmā
translated: “The robe-material requisite”: the requisite consisting of robe-material. “Is stated”: is stated in the Mahā-Aṭṭhakathā.

original: evaṃ vuttanti āha “evañhi navako vuḍḍhatarassa, vuḍḍho ca navakassa gāhessatī”ti,🔽yasmā attanāva attano pāpetuṃ na sakkā, tasmā dvīsu sammatesu navako vuḍḍhatarassa,
analyzed: evam vuttanti āha evam hi navakaḥ vuḍḍhatarassa vuḍḍhaḥ ca navakassa gāhessati iti  yasmai attanā ava attano pāpetum na sakkā tasmai dvīsu sammatesu navakaḥ vuḍḍhatarassa
translated: Why is it stated thus? he says, “For in this way the junior can take from the senior and the senior from the junior.”

original: vuḍḍho ca navakassāti ubho aññamaññaṃ gāhessantīti adhippāyo. Sammatasenāsanaggāhāpakassa
analyzed: vuḍḍhaḥ ca navakassa ati ubho aññam aññam gāhessanti iti adhippāyaḥ sammata senāsana ggāhāpakassa
translated: Because it is not possible for one to take from oneself, therefore the meaning intended is this: “In the case of two who have been agreed upon, the junior can take from the senior and the senior from the junior, both can take from each other.”🔽As regards the taking of dwellings by one who has been agreed upon,

original: āṇattiyā aññena gāhitepi gāho ruhatiyevāti veditabbaṃ. Aṭṭhapi soḷasapi jane sammannituṃ
analyzed: āṇattiyā aññena gāhite pi gāhaḥ ruhatiyā iva ati veditabbam aṭṭha api soḷasa api jane sammannitum
translated: It is allowable to appoint eight or sixteen people.

original: vaṭṭatīti kiṃ visuṃ visuṃ sammannituṃ vaṭṭati, udāhu ekatoti? Ekatopi vaṭṭati. Niggahakammameva
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti kim visum visum sammannitum vaṭṭati udāhu ekatas iti ekatas pi vaṭṭati niggaha kammam eva
translated: But is it allowable to appoint them separately or together? It is allowable together.

original: hi saṅgho saṅghassa na karoti, sammutidānaṃ pana bahūnampi ekato kātuṃ vaṭṭati, teneva
analyzed: hi saṅghaḥ saṅghassa na karoti sammuti dānam pana bahūnam pi ekatas kātum vaṭṭati tena iva
translated: For the order does not do the act of censure towards the order. But the giving of the appointment is allowable to be done together for many. That is why,

original: sattasatikakkhandhake ubbāhikasammutiyaṃ aṭṭhapi janā ekato sammatāti.🔽Maggoti magge katadīghasālā. Pokkharaṇīti nahāyantānaṃ pokkharaṇiyaṃ katasālā. Rukkhamūlādayo🔽channā kavāṭabaddhāva senāsanaṃ. Vijaṭetvāti viyojetvā, visuṃ visuṃ katvāti attho.
analyzed: sattasatika khandhake ubbāhika sammutiyam aṭṭha api janāḥ ekatas sammatā ti  maggo ti magge kata dīgha sālā pokkharaṇī iti nahāyantānam pokkharaṇiyam kata sālāḥ rukkha mūla ādayaḥ  channā senāsanam senāsanam vijaṭetvā ati viyojetvā visum visum katvā ati
translated: in the case of the appointment of the eighty-four thousand bhikkhus in the Satta-satikakkhandhaka, eight people were appointed together.🔽“Road” is a long building on a road. “Pool” is a building on a pool for those who bathe. The roots of trees, etc.,🔽that are roofed and have doors are a dwelling. “Having untied” means having unfastened, having made separate, is the meaning.

original: Āvāsesūti senāsanesu. Pakkhipitvāti ettha pakkhipanaṃ nāma tesu vasantānaṃ ito uppannavassāvāsikadānaṃ.
analyzed: āvāsesu iti senāsanesu pakkhipitvā ti ettha pakkhipanam nāma tesu vasantānam itas uppanna vassāvāsika dānam
translated: “In the dwellings” means in the dwellings. “Having put in” : here “putting in” is giving to those who live there of the gifts of the rainy-season residence that have arisen there.

original: Pavisitabbanti aññehi bhikkhūhi tasmiṃ mahālābhe pariveṇe vasitvā cetiye vattaṃ katvāva
analyzed: pavisitabbanti aññehi bhikkhūhi tasmim mahā lābhe pariveṇe vasitvā cetiye vattam katvā ava
translated: “Should enter”: other bhikkhus should live in the surrounding area of the monastery where there is great gain, and after doing the duties to the shrine,

original: lābho gahetabboti adhippāyo.
analyzed: lābhaḥ gahetabbo ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: they should take the gain. This is the intention.

original: Paccayaṃ vissajjetīti cīvarapaccayaṃ nādhivāseti. Ayampīti tena vissaṭṭhapaccayopi.
analyzed: paccayam vissajjeti iti cīvara paccayam na adhivāseti ayam pi iti tena vissaṭṭha paccayaḥ api
translated: “Should give up the requisites”: he does not consent to the robe-requisite. “This one too”: the one who has given up the requisites.

original: Upanibandhitvā gāhetabbanti “imasmiṃ rukkhe vā maṇḍape vā vasitvā cetiye vattaṃ katvā
analyzed: upanibandhitvā gāhetabbanti imasmin rukkhe vā maṇḍape vā vasitvā cetiye vattam katvā
translated: “Should be taken by appointment”: “Live in this tree or in this pavilion, and after doing the duties to the shrine,

original: gaṇhathā”ti evaṃ upanibandhitvā gāhetabbaṃ. “Kattha nu kho vasissāmi, kattha vasantassa
analyzed: gaṇhatha ati evam upanibandhitvā gāhetabbam kattha nu kho vasissāmi kattha vasantassa
translated: take it.” “Where shall I live? Where, living,

original: phāsu bhavissati, kattha vā paccayo bhavissatī”ti evaṃ uppannena vitakkena caratīti🔽vitakkacāriko. Araññavihāresu parissayavijānanatthaṃ icchitabbattā “pañca pañca ukkā
analyzed: phāsu bhavissati kattha vā paccayaḥ bhavissati iti evam uppannena vitakkena carati iti  vitakka cārikaḥ arañña vihāresu parissaya vijānana attham icchitabba ttā pañca pañca ukkā
translated: shall I be comfortable? Where will there be requisites?”—he goes about thinking like this, thus he is a “thinker of thoughts” .

original: koṭṭetabbā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: koṭṭetabbā iti vuttam
translated: “Five torches should be set up” is said in order to know the dangers in the forest dwellings, because they are to be desired.

original: Vattanti katikavattaṃ. Tividhampīti pariyattipaṭipattipaṭivedhavasena tividhampi.
analyzed: vattanti katika vattam tividham pi iti pariyatti paṭipatti paṭivedha vasena tividham pi
translated: “Duties”: the duties of the Order. “All three”: the three kinds by way of learning, practice, and penetration.

original: Sodhetvā pabbājethāti bhabbe ācārakulaputte upaparikkhitvā pabbājetha. Dasavatthukakathā
analyzed: sodhetvā pabbājetha ati bhabbe ācāra kula putte upaparikkhitvā pabbājetha dasa vatthuka kathā
translated: “Having purified him, he should give him the Going-forth”: having tested him, he should give the Going-forth to one who is capable, who has good conduct and is a good family man.

original: nāma appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṃsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā
analyzed: nāma appiccha kathā santuṭṭhi kathā paviveka kathā asaṃsagga kathā vīriya ārambha kathā
translated: The talk on the ten grounds is the talk on fewness of wishes, talk on contentment, talk on solitude, talk on non-entanglement, talk on arousing energy,

original: sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā.
analyzed: sīla kathā samādhi kathā paññā kathā vimutti kathā vimutti ñāṇa dassana kathā
translated: talk on virtue, talk on concentration, talk on wisdom, talk on freedom, talk on the knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Viggahasaṃvattanikavacanaṃ viggāhikaṃ. Caturārakkhaṃ ahāpentāti buddhānussati mettā
analyzed: viggaha saṃvattanika vacanam viggāhikam catur ārakkham ahāpentā ati buddha anussati mettā
translated: “Causing schism in the Community” is divisive speech. “Not abandoning the four protections”: the protection of recollection of the Buddha, the protection of loving-kindness,

original: asubhaṃ maraṇassatīti imaṃ caturārakkhaṃ aparihāpentā. Dantakaṭṭhakhādanavattaṃ ācikkhitabbanti🔽ettha dantakaṭṭhakhādanavattaṃ yo devasikaṃ saṅghamajjhe osarati, tena sāmaṇerādīhi🔽āharitvā bhikkhūnaṃ yathāsukhaṃ paribhuñjanatthāya dantakaṭṭhamāḷake nikkhittesu
analyzed: asubham maraṇa sati iti imam catur ārakkham a parihāpentā danta kaṭṭha khādana vattam ācikkhitabbanti  ettha danta kaṭṭha khādana vattam yaḥ devasikam saṅgha majjhe osarati tena sāmaṇera ādīhi  āharitvā bhikkhūnam yathāsukham paribhuñjana atthāya danta kaṭṭha māḷake nikkhittesu
translated: the protection of the foulness meditation, and the protection of mindfulness of death. “The toothbrush-chewing procedure should be pointed out to him”:🔽herein, the toothbrush-chewing procedure is this. Whoever goes into the midst of the Community every day should bring a toothbrush and put it in the toothbrush-box

original: dantakaṭṭhesu divase divase ekameva dantakaṭṭhaṃ gahetabbaṃ. Yo pana devasikaṃ na
analyzed: dantakaṭṭhesu divase divase ekam eva dantakaṭṭham gahetabbam yaḥ pana devasikam na
translated: for the bhikkhus to use as they like. Only one toothbrush should be taken each day. But whoever does not go into the midst of the Community every day

original: osarati, padhānaghare vasitvā dhammassavane vā uposathagge vā dissati, tena pamāṇaṃ
analyzed: osarati padhāna ghare vasitvā dhammassavane vā uposathagge vā dissati tena pamāṇam
translated: If he sees that it is used up, or if he sees that it is used up after staying in the meditation yard and listening to the Dhamma or on the observance-day, then he should take a measure of it.

original: sallakkhetvā cattāri pañca dantakaṭṭhāni attano vasanaṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā khāditabbāni.
analyzed: sallakkhetvā cattāri pañca dantakaṭṭhāni attanaḥ vasanaṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā khāditabbāni
translated: He should put aside four or five tooth-sticks in his own dwelling place and use them.

original: Tesu khīṇesu sace punapi dantakaṭṭhamāḷake bahūni hontiyeva, punapi āharitvā khāditabbāni.🔽Yadi pana pamāṇaṃ asallakkhetvā āharati, tesu akhīṇesuyeva māḷake khīyati, tato keci
analyzed: tesu khīṇesu sace punapi dantakaṭṭhamāḷake bahūni punapi āharitvā khāditabbāni  yadi pana pamāṇam a saṃlakkhetvā āharati tesu a khīṇesu yā iva māḷake khīyati tatas keci
translated: If they are used up and there are still many tooth-sticks in the tooth-stick container, he should take more and use them.🔽But if he takes them without measuring them, and they are used up before those in the container, then some senior monks might say, “Those who took them should return them,”

original: therā “yehi gahitāni, te paṭiharantū”ti vadeyyuṃ, keci “khādantu, puna sāmaṇerā āharissantī”ti.
analyzed: therāḥ yehi gahitāni te paṭiharantu uti vadeyyum keci khādantu puna sāmaṇerāḥ āharissanti iti
translated: while others might say, “Let them use them. The novices will bring more.”

original: Tasmā vivādaparihāratthaṃ pamāṇaṃ sallakkhetabbaṃ. Gahaṇe pana doso natthi, maggaṃ
analyzed: tasmā vivāda parihāra attham pamāṇam sallakkhetabbam gahaṇe pana dosaḥ natthi maggam
translated: So in order to avoid a dispute, he should measure it. But there is no offense in taking it.🔽And if he is going on a journey, he may take one or two tooth-sticks in his bag.

original: gacchantenapi ekaṃ vā dve vā thavikāya pakkhipitvā gantabbanti. Bhikkhācāravattaṃ
