analyzed: gacchantena api ekam vā dve vā thavikāya pakkhipitvā gantabbanti bhikkhācāra vattam
translated: The proper conduct for going on alms round

original: vattakkhandhake piṇḍacārikavatte āvi bhavissati.
analyzed: vattakkhandhake piṇḍacārika vatte bhavissati
translated: will be given in the proper conduct for alms-food eaters in the chapter on proper conduct.

original: Pattaṭṭhāneti vassaggena āgantukabhikkhuno pattaṭṭhāne. Tesaṃ chinnavassattā “sādiyantāpi🔽hi te neva vassāvāsikassa sāmino”ti vuttaṃ, paṭhamaṃyeva katikāya katattā khīyantāpi
analyzed: patta ṭṭhāne ti vassaggena āgantuka bhikkhuno patta ṭṭhāne tesam chinna vassa ttā sādiyantā api  hi te na iva vassāvāsikassa sāminaḥ ti vuttam paṭhamaṃyeva katikāya kata ttā khīyantā api
translated: In the place of the bowl: in the place of the bowl of a newly arrived monk during the Rains. Because their Rains is cut, they are not owners of the benefits of the Rains.🔽Even though they consent, they are not owners of the benefits of the Rains. Because the agreement was made before the Rains, they are not owners of the benefits of the Rains. Even though they are exhausted,🔽the resident monks are not allowed to give it away.

original: ca āvāsikā neva adātuṃ labhantīti vuttaṃ. Bhatiniviṭṭhanti bhatiṃ katvā viya niviṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: ca āvāsikāḥ na iva a dātum labhanti iti vuttam bhati niviṭṭham ti bhatim katvā viya niviṭṭham
translated: The dwelling is fixed: it is fixed as if it were a gift.

original: pariyiṭṭhaṃ. Saṅghikaṃ pana apalokanakammaṃ katvā gāhitanti tatruppādaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: pariyiṭṭham saṅghikam pana apalokana kammam katvā gāhitan ti tatra uppādam sandhāya
translated: The Sangha has taken it by means of a resolution. This is said in reference to the origin of that dwelling.

original: vuttaṃ. Paccayavasena gāhitanti dāyakānaṃ vassāvāsikapaccayavasena gāhitaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: vuttam paccaya vasena gāhitanti dāyakānam vassāvāsika paccaya vasena gāhitam sandhāya
translated: The dwelling is taken by means of a condition: this is said in reference to the condition of the donors, who are giving the dwelling for the benefit of the Rains-residence.

original: vuttaṃ. “Idha, bhikkhave, vassaṃvuttho bhikkhu vibbhamati, saṅghasseveta”nti vacanato🔽“gataṭṭhāne…pe… saṅghikaṃ hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Manusseti dāyakamanusse. Varabhāgaṃ sāmaṇerassāti
analyzed: vuttam idha bhikkhave vassaṃvutthaḥ bhikkhu vibbhamati vacanataḥ  saṅghikam hoti iti vuttam manusse iti dāyaka manusse vara bhāgam sāmaṇerassa ati
translated: Because of the words, “Monks, a monk who has entered for the Rains should disrobe. It belongs to the Sangha,”🔽it is said, “In the place where he goes … it belongs to the Sangha.”

original: paṭhamabhāgassa gāhitattā vuttaṃ.🔽Senāsanaggāhāpakasammutikathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama bhāgassa gāhitattā vuttam 🔽senāsana ggāhāpaka sammuti kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The people: the donors. The best part for the novice: this is said because the first part was taken.

original: Upanandavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: upananda vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on Upananda.

original: 319. Yaṃ tayā tattha senāsanaṃ gahitaṃ…pe… idha muttaṃ hotīti yaṃ tayā tattha gāmakāvāse🔽pacchā senāsanaṃ gahitaṃ, taṃ te gaṇhanteneva idha sāvatthiyaṃ paṭhamagahitasenāsanaṃ🔽muttaṃ hoti. Idha dānāhaṃ …pe… tatrāpi muttanti “idānāhaṃ, āvuso, imasmiṃ gāmakāvāse
analyzed: yam tayā tattha senāsanam idha muttam hoti iti yam tayā tattha gāmaka āvāse  pacchā senāsanam gahitam tam te gaṇhantena iva idha sāvatthiyam paṭhama gahita senāsanam  muttam hoti idha dānāham pe tatra api muttanti idānāham āvuso imasmin gāmaka āvāse
translated: The dwelling place that you have taken there … is given up here: the dwelling place that you have taken in a village dwelling place🔽after taking the first dwelling place here in Sāvatthī, that is given up by you taking it. Here I give up … there too it is given up: saying, “I give up the dwelling place that I have taken in this village dwelling place,”

original: gahitasenāsanaṃ muñcāmī”ti vadantena tatrāpi gāmakāvāse gahitasenāsanaṃ muttaṃ.
analyzed: gahita senāsanam muñcāmi iti vadantena tatra api gāmaka āvāse gahita senāsanam muttam
translated: the dwelling place that you have taken in that village dwelling place is given up too.

original: 320. Dīghāsanaṃ nāma mañcapīṭhavinimuttaṃ yaṃ kiñci ekato sukhaṃ nisīdituṃ pahoti.
analyzed: dīghāsanam nāma mañca pīṭha vinimuttam yam kiñci ekatas sukham nisīditum
translated: A long seat: anything apart from a bed or a bench that is suitable for sitting on comfortably.

original: Hatthimhi nakho assāti hatthinakho. “Pāsādassa nakho nāma heṭṭhimaparicchedo, so🔽ca hatthikumbhe patiṭṭhito”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Gihivikatanīhārena labbhantīti
analyzed: hatthimhi nakhaḥ assa ati hatthinakho pāsādassa nakhaḥ nāma heṭṭhima paricchedaḥ so  ca hatthi kumbhe patiṭṭhito ti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam gihi vikata nīhārena labbhanti iti
translated: An elephant’s tusk: an elephant’s tusk. “The tusk of a stilt house is the lower part,

original: gihivikatanīhārena paribhuñjituṃ labbhanti, tehi attharitvā dinnāneva nisīdituṃ labbhanti,
analyzed: gihi vikata nīhārena paribhuñjitum labbhanti tehi attharitvā dinnāni eva nisīditum labbhanti
translated: and that is fixed in the elephant’s head,” it is said in the section on the knots. They are allowable by the method of householders’ use: they are allowable to use by the method of householders’ use. Only those that have been spread out by them are allowable to sit on if they have been given.

original: na sayaṃ atthatāni attharāpitāni vā.
analyzed: na sayam atthatāni attharāpitāni vā
translated: nor has he had them made.

original: Avissajjiyavatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: avissajjiya vatthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on “not to be given away” is finished.

original: 321. Arañjaroti bahuudakagaṇhanakā mahācāṭi. Jalaṃ gaṇhituṃ alanti arañjaro. “Vaṭṭacāṭi
analyzed: bahu udaka gaṇhanakāḥ mahā cāṭi jalam gaṇhitum alanti arañjaraḥ vaṭṭa cāṭi
translated: A large waterpot is a big waterpot that can hold a lot of water. It is called a “large waterpot” because it is difficult to fill with water.

original: viya hutvā thokaṃ dīghamukho majjhe paricchedaṃ dassetvā kato”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: viya hutvā thokam dīgha mukhaḥ majjhe paricchedam dassetvā kataḥ iti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: It is described in the Peṭakopadesa as being like a waterpot, but with a longish mouth and a division in the middle.

original: Pañcanimmalalocanoti maṃsadibbadhammabuddhasamantacakkhuvasena pañcalocano.
analyzed: pañca nimmala locanaḥ ti maṃsa dibba dhamma buddha samanta cakkhu vasena pañca locano
translated: He has five pure eyes: the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the eye of doctrine, and the eye of the Buddha.

original: Thāvarena ca thāvaraṃ garubhaṇḍena ca garubhaṇḍanti ettha pañcasu koṭṭhāsesu purimadvayaṃ🔽thāvaraṃ, pacchimattayaṃ garubhaṇḍanti veditabbaṃ. Jānāpetvāti bhikkhusaṅghaṃ jānāpetvā.
analyzed: thāvarena ca thāvaram garubhaṇḍena ca ettha pañcasu koṭṭhāsesu purima dvayam  thāvaram pacchimattayam garubhaṇḍanti veditabbam jānāpetvā ti bhikkhu saṅgham jānāpetvā
translated: The first two of the five items are “heavy” and the last three are “valuable.”🔽The monk should inform the Sangha and then accept the bed.🔽The bed is meant for the Sangha. If they say,

original: Kappiyamañcā sampaṭicchitabbāti “saṅghassa demā”ti dinnaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Sace pana🔽“vihārassa demā”ti vadanti, suvaṇṇarajatamayādiakappiyamañcepi sampaṭicchituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: kappiya mañcā sampaṭicchitabbā ti saṅghassa dema ati dinnam sandhāya vuttam sace pana 🔽vihārassa vadanti suvaṇṇa rajata maya ādi a kappiya mañce pi sampaṭicchitum vaṭṭati
translated: “We give it to the dwelling,” then it is allowable to accept even a bed made of gold, silver, etc.

original: Na kevalaṃ…pe… parivattetuṃ vaṭṭantīti iminā athāvarena thāvarampi athāvarampi parivattetuṃ
analyzed: na kevalam pe parivattetum vaṭṭanti iti iminā athāvarena thāvaram pi athāvaram pi parivattetum
translated: Not only … can be exchanged: by this he shows that it is allowable to exchange a permanent one for a permanent one and a non-permanent one for a non-permanent one.

original: vaṭṭatīti dasseti. Thāvarena athāvarameva hi parivattetuṃ na vaṭṭati. Akappiyaṃ vā
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti dasseti thāvarena athāvaram eva hi parivattetum na vaṭṭati akappiyam vā
translated: For it is not allowable to exchange a permanent one for a non-permanent one.

original: mahagghaṃ kappiyaṃ vāti ettha akappiyaṃ nāma suvaṇṇamayamañcādi akappiyabhisibimbohanāni
analyzed: mahaggham kappiyam vā ti ettha akappiyam nāma suvaṇṇa maya mañca ādi akappiya bhisi bimbohanāni
translated: What is not allowable is a golden bed, etc., and what is not allowable as a foot-stool, etc.;

original: ca. Mahagghaṃ kappiyaṃ nāma dantamayamañcādi pāvārādikappiyaattharaṇādīni ca.
analyzed: ca mahaggham kappiyam nāma danta maya mañca ādi pāvāra ādi kappiya attharaṇa ādīni ca
translated: what is allowable and valuable is an ivory bed, etc., and what is allowable as a sheet, etc., such as a sheet of silk.

original: Pārihāriyaṃ na vaṭṭatīti attano santakaṃ viya gahetvā pariharituṃ na vaṭṭati. “Gihivikatanīhāreneva
analyzed: pārihāriyam na vaṭṭati iti attanaḥ santakam viya gahetvā pariharitum na vaṭṭati gihi vikata nīhārena iva
translated: What is lent is not allowable: what is lent is not allowable to be used as though it were one’s own.

original: paribhuñjitabba”nti iminā sace ārāmikādayo paṭisāmetvā paṭidenti, paribhuñjituṃ vaṭṭatīti🔽dasseti. “Paṇṇasūci nāma lekhanī”ti mahāgaṇṭhipade vuttaṃ.
analyzed: paribhuñjitabbanti iminā sace ārāmika ādayo paṭisāmetvā paṭidenti paribhuñjitum vaṭṭati iti  dasseti paṇṇasūci nāma lekhanī iti mahāgaṇṭhipade vuttam
translated: By this he shows that if the monastery attendants, etc., hand it over and then give it back, it is allowable to use it.🔽A pen is a writing-pen.

original: “Aḍḍhabāhūti kapparato paṭṭhāya yāva aṃsakūṭa”nti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Aḍḍhabāhu
analyzed: aḍḍha bāhu iti kapparataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva aṃsakūṭam ti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam aḍḍha bāhu
translated: The upper arm is from the elbow to the shoulder-joint.

original: nāma vidatthicaturaṅgulantipi vadanti. Tatthajātakāti saṅghikabhūmiyaṃ jātā. Aṭṭhaṅgulasūcidaṇḍamattoti
analyzed: nāma vadanti vadanti saṅghika bhūmi iyam jātā aṭṭhaṅgula sūci daṇḍa mattā ti
translated: They also say that it is four fingerbreadths wide. “Grown on a monastery site” means grown on a site belonging to the Sangha. “Eight fingerbreadths long” means

original: dīghato aṭṭhaṅgulamatto pariṇāhato paṇṇasūcidaṇḍamatto. Muñjapabbajānaṃyeva pāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: dīghataḥ aṭṭhaṅgula matto pariṇāhataḥ paṇṇa sūci daṇḍa mattaḥ muñja pabbajānaṃ yeva pāḷiyam
translated: eight fingerbreadths long. “The size of a needle for sewing” means the size of a needle for sewing. “Reed and grass” are mentioned separately in the text,

original: visuṃ āgatattā “muñjaṃ pabbajañca ṭhapetvā”ti vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhaṅgulappamāṇoti dīghato
analyzed: visum āgata ttā muñjam pabbajam ca ṭhapetvā iti vuttam aṭṭha aṅgula ppamāṇaḥ ti dīghataḥ
translated: so “apart from reed and grass” is said. “Eight fingerbreadths long” means

original: aṭṭhaṅgulappamāṇo. Ghaṭṭanaphalakaṃ nāma yattha ṭhapetvā rajitacīvaraṃ hatthena ghaṭṭenti.
analyzed: aṭṭha aṅgula ppamāṇaḥ ghaṭṭanaphalakam nāma yattha ṭhapetvā rajita cīvaram hatthena ghaṭṭenti
translated: eight fingerbreadths long. “A board for smoothing” is where they place a dyed robe and smooth it with their hands.

original: Ghaṭṭanamuggaro nāma anuvātādighaṭṭanatthaṃ katoti vadanti. Ambaṇanti phalakehi pokkharaṇīsadisaṃ
analyzed: ghaṭṭanamuggaraḥ nāma anuvāta ādi ghaṭṭana attham kataḥ iti vadanti phalakehi pokkharaṇī sadisam
translated: “A smoothing hammer” is what they use for smoothing in the direction of the grain. “A water trough” is a water container made like a pond with plates.

original: katapānīyabhājanaṃ. Rajanadoṇīti yattha pakkarajanaṃ ākiritvā ṭhapenti. Bhūmattharaṇaṃ
analyzed: kata pānīya bhājanam rajana doṇī iti pakka rajanam ākiritvā ṭhapenti bhūmattharaṇam
translated: “A dye container” is where they collect the dye water and leave it. “A floor cover”🔽is said with reference to unsuitable leather. “A mat for sitting on” means that it is allowable to make a mat for sitting on. “A bed and a bench”

original: kātuṃ vaṭṭatīti akappiyacammaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Paccattharaṇagatikanti iminā mañcapīṭhepi
analyzed: kātum vaṭṭati iti akappiya cammam sandhāya vuttam paccattharaṇa gatikam ti iminā mañca pīṭhe pi
translated: means

original: attharituṃ vaṭṭatīti dīpeti. Pāvārādipaccattharaṇampi garubhaṇḍanti eke, noti apare,
analyzed: attharitum vaṭṭati iti dīpe ti pāvāra ādi paccattharaṇam pi eke no ti apare
translated: He shows that it is allowable to spread it. Some say that a sheet for the rainy season and so on is heavy goods; others say it is not.

original: vīmaṃsitvā gahetabbaṃ. Muṭṭhipaṇṇanti tālapaṇṇaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vīmaṃsitvā gahetabbam muṭṭhi paṇṇam ti tāla paṇṇam sandhāya vuttam
translated: It should be taken after examining it. The palm-leaf is said with reference to the tāla leaf.

original: Navakammadānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nava kamma dāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of giving building work.

original: 323. Kiñcideva samādapetvā kāressatīti sāmikoyeva kañci bhikkhuṃ samādapetvā kāressati.🔽Utukāle paṭibāhituṃ na labhatīti hemantagimhesu aññe sampattabhikkhū paṭibāhituṃ🔽na labhati. Tibhāganti tatiyabhāgaṃ. Sace saddhivihārikānaṃ dātukāmo hotīti sace
analyzed: kiñcid eva samādapetvā kāressati iti kañci bhikkhum samādapetvā kāressati  utu kāle paṭibāhitum na labhati iti hemanta gimhesu aññe sampatta bhikkhū paṭibāhitum  na labhati tatiya bhāgam sace saddhivihārikānam dātu kāmaḥ hoti iti sace
translated: After having encouraged someone a little: after having encouraged someone, the owner himself will do it.🔽He is not allowed to reserve it for the rainy season: in the cold weather and the summer he is not allowed to reserve it for other monks who have arrived.

original: so saṅghassa bhaṇḍakaṭhapanaṭṭhānaṃ vā navakānaṃ vā vasanaṭṭhānaṃ dātuṃ na icchati,
analyzed: so saṅghassa bhaṇḍa kaṭhapana ṭhānam vā navakānam vā vasana ṭhānam dātum na icchati
translated: The third part: the third portion. If he wants to give it to his students: if he does not want to give it to the Sangha as a storehouse or workshop, or as a dwelling for the new arrivals,

original: attano saddhivihārikānaññeva dātukāmo hotīti attho. Etañhi saddhivihārikānaṃ dātuṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ dātu kāmo hoti iti atthaḥ etat hi saddhivihārikānam dātum
translated: the meaning is that he wants to give it to his own students.

original: labhatīti etaṃ tatiyabhāgaṃ upaḍḍhabhāgaṃ vā dātuṃ labhati. Akataṭṭhāneti senāsanato
analyzed: labhati iti etam tatiya bhāgam upaḍḍha bhāgam vā dātum labhati a kata ṭṭhānā iti senāsanataḥ
translated: He is allowed to give it: he is allowed to give the third portion or half of it. Not yet used: not yet used for the dwelling.

original: bahi cayādīnaṃ akataṭṭhāne. Bahikuṭṭeti kuṭṭato bahi.
analyzed: bahi caya ādīnam a kata ṭṭhāne bahikuṭṭa iti kuṭṭataḥ bahi
translated: Outside the monastery means outside the place where the huts, etc., are built. Outside the wall means outside the wall.

original: Aññatraparibhogapaṭikkhepādikathāvaṇṇanā🔽324. Cakkalikanti kambalādīhi veṭhetvā cakkasaṇṭhānena pādapuñchanayoggaṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: aññatra paribhoga paṭikkhepa ādi kathā vaṇṇanā  kambala ādīhi veṭhetvā cakka saṇṭhānena pāda puñchana yoggam katam
translated: The explanation of the sub-chapter on forbidding the use of what belongs to the Sangha, etc.🔽A foot-wiping cloth is a cloth used for wiping the feet, made in the shape of a mat by sewing together strips of cloth, etc.

original: Paribhaṇḍakatā bhūmi nāma saṇhamattikāhi katā kāḷavaṇṇādibhūmi. Senāsanaṃ mañcapīṭhādi.
analyzed: paribhaṇḍaka tā bhūmi nāma katā kāḷavaṇṇa ādi bhūmi senāsanam mañca pīṭha ādi
translated: The ground that is made into a floor means a floor made of soft clay, colored black, etc. The furniture is the bed, chair, etc.

original: Tatheva vaḷañjetuṃ vaṭṭatīti aññehi āvāsikabhikkhūhi paribhuttanīhārena paribhuñjituṃ
analyzed: tathā iva vaḷañjetum vaṭṭati iti aññehi āvāsika bhikkhūhi paribhutta nīhārena paribhuñjitum
translated: It is allowable to use it in the same way means it is allowable to use it in the way it was used by the resident bhikkhus.

original: vaṭṭati. “Nevāsikā pakatiyā anatthatāya bhūmiyā ṭhapenti ce, tesampi anāpattiyevā”ti
analyzed: vaṭṭati nevāsikā pakatiyā anatthatāya bhūmiyā ṭhapenti ce tesam pi anāpattiyā eva ati
translated: If the resident bhikkhus do not store it on the ground because it is not suitable, there is no offense for them either.

original: gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Dvārampītiādinā vuttadvāravātapānādayo aparikammakatāpi na apassayitabbā.
analyzed: gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam dvāram pi iti ādinā vutta dvāra vāta pāna ādayaḥ aparikammaka tā api na apassayitabbā
translated: This is said in the summary section. The doors, windows, etc., mentioned in the words “doors and windows” are not to be used without being assigned.

original: Lomesūti lomesu phusantesu.🔽Saṅghabhattādianujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: lomesu iti lomesu phusantesu  saṅgha bhatta ādi anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: On the grass means on the grass that is being felt.🔽The explanation of the sub-chapter on the permission to eat Sangha food, etc.

original: 325. Uddesabhattaṃ nimantananti imaṃ vohāraṃ pattānīti ettha iti-saddo ādiattho,
analyzed: uddesa bhattam imam vohāram pattāni iti ettha iti saddaḥ ādi atthaḥ
translated: The words “the expression ‘invitation’ for a meal by nomination” are to be analyzed as follows:

original: “uddesabhattaṃ nimantana”ntiādivohāraṃ pattānīti ayamettha attho. Tampi anto katvāti
analyzed: uddesa bhattam pattāni iti ayam ettha atthaḥ tam pi antaḥ katvā iti
translated: Including that:

original: āyatiṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kukkuccavinodanatthāya tampi saṅghabhattaṃ anto katvā.
analyzed: āyatim bhikkhūnam kukkucca vinodana atthāya tam pi saṅgha bhattam antar katvā
translated: including that meal for the Order, in order to remove scruples in the bhikkhus in the future.

original: Uddesabhattakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: uddesa bhatta kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Meal by Invitation is ended

original: Attano vihāradvāreti vihārassa dvārakoṭṭhakasamīpaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Bhojanasālāyāti🔽bhattuddesaṭṭhānabhūtāya bhojanasālāya. “Dinnaṃ panā”ti vatvā yathā so dāyako deti,
analyzed: attanaḥ vihāra dvāre iti vihārassa dvāra koṭṭhaka samīpam sandhāya vuttam bhojana sālāya ati  bhattuddesa ṭṭhāna bhūtāya bhojana sālāya dinnam panāti vatvā yathā saḥ dāyakaḥ deti
translated: In the door-front of his own dwelling: this is said with reference to the door-front of the dwelling. In the refectory:🔽in the refectory that is the place for the meal-assignment. After saying “But when it is given” he says “To the Order, venerable sir” in order to show the method of giving as that giver gives. In a house:

original: taṃ vidhiṃ dassetuṃ “saṅghato bhante”tiādimāha. Antaraghareti antogehe. Antoupacāragatānanti🔽ettha gāmadvāravīthicatukkesu dvādasahatthabbhantaraṃ antoupacāro nāma. Antaragharassa
analyzed: tam vidhim dassetum saṅghataḥ bhante ti ādim āha antara ghara iti antar gehe  ettha gāma dvāra vīthi catukkesu dvādasa hattha abbhantaram antoupacāraḥ nāma antara gharassa
translated: in a house inside. To those who have gone inside the precincts:

original: upacāre pana labbhamānavisesaṃ dassetuṃ “gharūpacāro cetthā”tiādimāha. Ekavaḷañjanti
analyzed: upacāre pana labbhamāna visesam dassetum gharu upacāraḥ ca itthā ti ādim āha eka vaḷañjanti
translated: here the precincts are twelve handspans inside the village gate, the village street, and the village cross-roads. But in order to show the distinction obtainable in the precincts of a house he says “If the house is the precincts here” . Enclosed by a single fence:🔽it should be fenced in by a single gate. In the dwellings of different families:

original: ekena dvārena vaḷañjitabbaṃ. Nānānivesanesūti nānākulassa nivesanesu. Lajjī pesalo
analyzed: ekena dvārena vaḷañjitabbam nānā nivesanesu iti nānā kulassa nivesanesu lajjī pesalaḥ
translated: in the dwellings of different families. The modest, the competent,

original: agatigamanaṃ vajjetvā medhāvī ca upaparikkhitvā uddisissatīti āha “pesalo lajjī medhāvī
analyzed: agati gamanam vajjetvā medhāvī ca upaparikkhitvā uddisissati iti āha pesalaḥ lajjī medhāvī
translated: and he is clever and will examine the matter before he gives the invitation. “The clever one who is modest and wise,

original: icchitabbo”ti. Nisinnassapi niddāyantassapīti anādare sāmivacanaṃ. Ticīvaraparivāranti🔽ettha “udakapattalābhī viya aññopi uddesabhattaṃ alabhitvā vatthādimanekappakārakaṃ
analyzed: icchitabbaḥ uti nisinnassa api niddāyantassa api iti anādare sāmi vacanam ti cīvara parivāram ti  ettha udaka patta lābhī viya aññaḥ api uddesa bhattam a labhitvā vattha ādim aneka ppakārakam
translated: who is not overbearing, is the one to be invited.” “Sitting or lying down” is a term of disrespect. “The three robes and the requisites” :🔽Here it is said in the Thread of the Rule: “If one who has not received the invitation gets the three robes and other requisites of many kinds like one who has received the invitation, then they are his.”

original: labhati ce, tasseva ta”nti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Attano rucivasena yaṃ kiñci vatvā🔽āharituṃ vissajjitattā vissaṭṭhadūto nāma. Yaṃ icchatīti “uddesapattaṃ dethā”tiādīni
analyzed: labhati ce tassa iva tanti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam attanaḥ ruci vasena yam kiñci vatvā  āharitum vissajjita ttā vissaṭṭha dūtaḥ nāma yam icchati iti uddesa pattam detha ati ādīni
translated: Having said this or that according to his own inclination,

original: vadanto yaṃ icchati. Pucchāsabhāgenāti pucchāsadisena.
analyzed: vadantaḥ yam icchati pucchā sabhāgena ati pucchā sadisena
translated: he is called “one who has been dismissed by being given leave to take what he wants.” “What he wants” is what he wants by saying “Give me the invitation bowl” and so on. “As if it were a question” :🔽like a question.

original: “Ekā kūṭaṭṭhitikā nāma hotī”ti vatvā tameva ṭhitikaṃ vibhāvento “rañño vā hī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: ekā kūṭaṭṭhitikā nāma hoti iti vatvā tam eva ṭhitikam vibhāventaḥ raññaḥ vā hi iti ādim āha
translated: “There is one kind of standing-place called ‘one-day’ ” : having said this, he then analyses that standing-place, saying “Either of the king” and so on.

original: Aññehi uddesabhattehi amissetvā visuṃyeva ṭhitikāya gahetabbattā “ekacārikabhattānī”ti
analyzed: aññehi uddesabhattehi a missetvā visuṃ yeva ṭhitikāya gahetabba ttā ekacārikabhattāni iti
translated: “The one-day-meals” : because they are to be taken separately, without mixing them with other invitation meals, by one who is on a standing-place.

original: vuttaṃ. Theyyāya harantīti pattahārakā haranti. Gīvā hotīti āṇāpakassa gīvā hoti.
analyzed: vuttam theyyāya haranti iti patta hārakāḥ haranti gīvā hoti iti āṇāpakassa gīvā hoti
translated: He said this. They steal it: they take it away as though they were stealing it. He is responsible: he who orders is responsible.

original: “Manussānaṃ vacanaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti gacchantīti “manussānaṃ vacanaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti
analyzed: manussānam vacanam kātum vaṭṭati iti gacchanti iti manussānam vacanam kātum vaṭṭati iti
translated: “It is proper to do what people say”: they go because it is proper to do what people say.

original: tena bhikkhunā vuttā gacchanti. Akatabhāgo nāmāti āgantukabhāgo nāma. “Sabbo saṅgho
analyzed: tena bhikkhunā vuttāḥ gacchanti akata bhāgaḥ nāma ati āgantuka bhāgaḥ nāma sabbaḥ saṅghaḥ
translated: They are sent by that monk: they are sent by the monk who said, “It is proper to do what people say.”🔽The share that is not yet distributed: the share that has not yet been distributed.

original: paribhuñjatū”ti vutteti ettha “paṭhamameva ‘sabbaṃ saṅghikaṃ pattaṃ dethā’ti vatvā
analyzed: paribhuñjatu uti vuttā iti ettha paṭhamam eva sabbam saṅghikam pattam detha iti vatvā
translated: If he says, “Let the whole Sangha use it”: here it is said in the summaries, “First say, ‘Give me all the almsbowls belonging to the Sangha.’

original: pacchā ‘sabbo saṅgho paribhuñjatū’ti avuttepi bhājetvāva paribhuñjitabba”nti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pacchā sabbaḥ saṅghaḥ paribhuñjatu uti a vutte api bhājetvā ava paribhuñjitabbam ti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: Then, even if you don’t say, ‘Let the whole Sangha use it,’ you should distribute and use them.”

original: Nimantanabhattakathāvaṇṇanā🔽“Ettake bhikkhū saṅghato uddisitvā dethā”tiādīni avatvā “ettakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bhattaṃ
analyzed: nimantana bhatta kathā vaṇṇanā  ettake bhikkhū saṅghataḥ uddisitvā detha ati ādīni avatvā ettakānam bhikkhūnam bhattam
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the meal by invitation🔽Without saying, “Announce so-and-so many monks from the Sangha,” or “Give to so-and-so many monks from the Sangha,” if you say, “Take a meal for so-and-so many monks,”

original: gaṇhathā”ti vatvā dinnaṃ saṅghikaṃ nimantanaṃ nāma. Piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭatīti bhikkhāpariyāyena
analyzed: gaṇhatha ati vatvā dinnam saṅghikam nimantanam nāma piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati iti bhikkhā pariyāyena
translated: and it is given, this is called an invitation for the Sangha. It is also allowable for those who only eat almsfood.

original: vuttattā vaṭṭati. Paṭipāṭiyāti laddhapaṭipāṭiyā. Vicchinditvāti “bhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti
analyzed: vutta ttā vaṭṭati paṭipāṭiyā ati laddha paṭipāṭiyā vicchinditvā ati bhattam gaṇhatha ati
translated: It is allowable because it is stated. In turn: in turn as it falls to them. Without interruption: without saying, “Take the meal.”

original: padaṃ avatvā. Tenevāha “bhattanti avadantenā”ti. Ālopasaṅkhepenāti ekekapiṇḍavasena.🔽Ayañca nayo nimantaneyeva, na uddesabhatte. Tattha hi ekassa pahonakappamāṇaṃyeva🔽bhājetabbaṃ, tasmā uddesabhatte ālopaṭṭhitikā nāma natthi. Acchatīti tiṭṭhati. “Ekavāranti
analyzed: padam avatvā tena iva āha avadantena ati ālopa saṅkhepena ati ekeka piṇḍa vasena  ayaṃ ca nayaḥ nimantaneya iva na uddesa bhatte tattha hi ekassa pahona kappamāṇaṃya iva  bhājetabbam tasmai uddesa bhatte ālopaṭṭhitikā nāma natthi acchati iti tiṭṭhati eka vāram ti
translated: Hence it is said, “By one who does not say ‘Take the meal.’” By means of mouthfuls: by means of individual mouthfuls.

original: yāva tasmiṃ āvāse vasanti bhikkhū, sabbe labhantī”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Ayaṃ panettha🔽adhippāyo – ekavāranti na ekadivasaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, yattakā pana bhikkhū tasmiṃ🔽āvāse vasanti, te sabbe. Ekasmiṃ divase gahitabhikkhū aññadā aggahetvā yāva ekavāraṃ
analyzed: yāva tasmin āvāse vasanti bhikkhū sabbe labhanti iti gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam ayam pana ittha  adhippāyaḥ eka vāram ti na eka divasam sandhāya vuttam yattakā pana bhikkhū tasmin  āvāse vasanti te sabbe ekasmin divase gahita bhikkhū aññadā aggahetvā yāva eka vāram
translated: And this method applies only to invitations, not to meals by announcement. For in the latter case only as much as is sufficient for one person should be served. Therefore there is no such thing as a meal by announcement by means of mouthfuls. It lasts: it remains. “One-day means that as long as the bhikkhus stay in that residence, all of them get it” is said in the mnemonic verses. But the meaning intended here is this.

original: sabbe bhikkhū bhojitā honti, tāva ye jānanti, te gahetvā gantabbanti.
analyzed: sabbe bhikkhū bhojitāḥ honti tāva ye jānanti te gahetvā gantabbanti
translated: One-day means not that it is so for one day only, but that it is for as many bhikkhus as stay in that residence. Those bhikkhus who have taken it on one day should not take it on another day. They should take it as long as all the bhikkhus are fed by means of the one-day meal. Those who know about it should take it and go.

original: Salākabhattakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: salākabhatta kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of meals by portions.

original: Upanibandhitvāti likhitvā. Niggahena datvāti anicchantampi niggahena sampaṭicchāpetvā.
analyzed: upanibandhitvā ati likhitvā niggahena da tvā ati an icchantam pi niggahena sampaṭicchāpetvā
translated: Having written down: having made a written record. Having given by lot: having made them accept by lot even against their will.

original: Ekagehavasenāti ekāya gharapāḷiyā vasena. Uddisitvāti “tuyhañca tuyhañca pāpuṇātī”ti🔽vatvā. Dūrattā niggahetvāpi vārena gāhetabbagāmo vāragāmo. Vihāravāre niyuttā vihāravārikā,🔽vārena vihārarakkhaṇakā. Aññathattanti pasādaññathattaṃ. Phātikammameva bhavantīti
analyzed: eka geha vasena ati ekāya vasena uddisitvā ati tuyham ca tuyham ca pāpuṇāti iti  vatvā dūrattā niggahetvā api vārena gāhetabba gāmaḥ vāra gāmaḥ vihāra vāre niyuttā vihāravārikā  vārena vihāra rakkhaṇakāḥ aññathattanti pasāda aññathattam phāti kammam eva bhavanti iti
translated: By the area of a single house: by the area of a single house-site. Having assigned: having said, “It falls to you and to you.”🔽A village that has to be taken by turns, even though it is far away and has been accepted by lot, is a village by turns. Those who are appointed to the turn of the monastery are those who guard the monastery by turns.

original: vihārarakkhaṇatthāya saṅghena dātabbaatirekalābhā honti. Saṅghanavakena laddhakāleti🔽divase divase ekekassa pāpitāni dve tīṇi ekacārikabhattāni teneva niyāmena attano
analyzed: vihāra rakkhaṇa atthāya saṅghena dātabba atireka lābhāḥ honti saṅgha navakena laddha kālā iti  divase divase ekekassa pāpitāni dve tīṇi ekacārika bhattāni tena iva niyāmena attano
translated: Otherwise: otherwise than the faith. They become a service: they become extra gains to be given by the Sangha for the purpose of guarding the monastery.🔽When they are received by the Sangha by turns: when they are received by the Sangha by turns, one day for each, at the place where they fall to each one.

original: pāpuṇanaṭṭhāne saṅghanavakena laddhakāle. Yassa kassaci sammukhībhūtassa pāpetvāti
analyzed: pāpuṇana ṭṭhāne saṅgha navakena laddha kāle yassa kassaci sammukhībhūtassa pāpetvā ati
translated: Having served it to anyone who is present:

original: ettha “yebhuyyena ce bhikkhū bahisīmagatā honti, sammukhībhūtassa yassa kassaci pāpetabbaṃ
analyzed: ettha yebhuyyena ce bhikkhū bahi sīma gatāḥ honti sammukhībhūtassa yassa kassaci
translated: if the majority of the monks are outside the monastery zone, it should be served to anyone who is present.

original: sabhāgattā ekena laddhaṃ sabbesaṃ hoti, tasmimpi asati attano pāpetvā dātabba”nti
analyzed: sabhā gattā ekena laddham sabbesam hoti tasmim pi asati attanaḥ pāpetvā dātabbanti
translated: “Because of the similarity, what is obtained by one is for all. If there is none of that, then one should make it up from one’s own.”

original: gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Rasasalākanti ucchurasasalākaṃ.
analyzed: gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam rasa salākam ti ucchu rasa salākam
translated: This is said in the summary. “A stick for choosing curry” means a stick for choosing curry and rice.🔽“Even a non-staple food stick from the Sangha is allowable in the monastery for cooked food.”

original: “Saṅghato nirāmisasalākāpi vihāre pakkabhattampi vaṭṭatiyevā”ti sādhāraṇaṃ katvā
analyzed: saṅghataḥ nirāmisa salākā api vihāre pakka bhattam pi vaṭṭatiyā iva ati sādhāraṇam katvā
translated: Because this is said in the Path of Purification as a general statement,

original: visuddhimagge vuttattā “evaṃ gāhite sāditabbaṃ, evaṃ na sāditabba”nti visesetvā avuttattā
analyzed: visuddhi magge vutta ttā evam gāhite sāditabbam evam na sāditabbam ti visesetvā a vutta ttā
translated: and because it is not said in detail, “This is how it should be accepted, this is how it should not be accepted,”

original: ca bhesajjādisalākāyo cettha kiñcāpi piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭanti, salākavasena gāhitattā
analyzed: ca bhesajja ādi salākāyaḥ ca ittha kiñcā api vaṭṭanti salāka vasena
translated: it should be investigated here as to the intention in this: although sticks for medicine, etc., are allowable even for those who go for alms,🔽they should not be accepted because they are accepted by means of a ticket.

original: pana na sāditabbāti ettha adhippāyo vīmaṃsitabbo. Yadi hi bhesajjādisalākā salākavasena
analyzed: pana na sāditabbā ti ettha adhippāyaḥ vīmaṃsitabbaḥ yadi hi bhesajja ādi salākā salāka vasena
translated: For if it were not allowable to accept a stick for medicine, etc., because it is accepted by means of a ticket,

original: gāhitā na sāditabbā siyā, saṅghato nirāmisasalākā vaṭṭatiyevāti na vadeyya, “atirekalābho🔽saṅghabhattaṃ uddesabhatta”ntiādivacanato “atirekalābhaṃ paṭikkhipāmī”ti salākavasena
analyzed: gāhitā na sāditabbā siyā saṅghataḥ nirāmisa salākā vaṭṭatiyā iva ati na vadeyya atireka lābhaḥ 🔽saṅgha bhattam uddesa bhattam iti ādi vacanataḥ atireka lābham paṭikkhipāmi iti salāka vasena
translated: he would not say, “A non-staple food stick from the Sangha is allowable,” and he would not say, “I refuse extra gain,”🔽and “a meal given to the Order, a meal given to a named Order,” etc.,

original: gāhetabbaṃ bhattameva paṭikkhittaṃ, na bhesajjaṃ. Saṅghabhattādīni hi cuddasa bhattāniyeva
analyzed: gāhetabbam bhattam eva paṭikkhittam na bhesajjam saṅgha bhatta ādīni hi cuddasa bhattāniyā iva
translated: The alms food is to be accepted, not the medicine. For the fourteen kinds of alms food, beginning with the Sangha’s meal,

original: tena na sāditabbānīti vuttāni, khandhakabhāṇakānaṃ vā matena idha evaṃ vuttanti gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: tena na sāditabbāni iti vuttāni khandhaka bhāṇakānam vā matena idha evam vuttan ti gahetabbam
translated: are said to be not to be accepted. Or it can be understood that it is said thus according to the view of the reciters of the Khuddaka- pāṭha.

original: Aggato dātabbabhikkhā aggabhikkhā. Laddhā vā aladdhā vāti labhitvā vā alabhitvā vā.
analyzed: aggataḥ dātabba bhikkhā agga bhikkhā laddhā vā a laddhā vā ati labhitvā vā a labhitvā vā
translated: The alms food given to the head of the row is called “head alms food.” “Having received or not received” means having got or not getting.

original: Nibaddhāya aggabhikkhāya appamattikāya eva sambhavato labhitvāpi punadivase gaṇhituṃ
analyzed: nibaddhāya agga bhikkhāya appamattikāya eva sambhavataḥ labhitvā api puna divase gaṇhitum
translated: Because it is possible that the head alms food is small, it is said that it can be accepted on the following day even if it has been received.

original: vuttaṃ. Aggabhikkhāmattanti hi ettha matta-saddo bahubhāvaṃ nivatteti.
analyzed: vuttam agga bhikkhā mattanti hi ettha matta saddaḥ bahu bhāvam nivatteti
translated: For the word “only” in “head alms food only” excludes the possibility of more.

original: Salākabhattaṃ nāma vihāreyeva uddisīyati vihārameva sandhāya diyyamānattāti āha “vihāre🔽apāpitaṃ panā”tiādi. Tatra āsanasālāyāti tasmiṃ gāme āsanasālāya. Vihāraṃ ānetvā
analyzed: salākabhattam nāma vihāreya iva uddisīyati vihāram eva sandhāya āha vihāre  a pāpitam tatra āsana sālāya ati tasmin gāme āsana sālāya vihāram ānetvā
translated: The meal by tickets is announced in the monastery. It is given with reference to the monastery. Therefore it is said, “The meal by tickets is announced in the monastery.”🔽But if it is not announced in the monastery,🔽then it is said, “The meal by tickets is announced in the village.” There, in the sitting hall of that village. Having brought it to the monastery,

original: gāhetabbanti tathā vatvā tasmiṃ divase dinnabhattaṃ vihārameva ānetvā ṭhitikāya gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: gāhetabbanti tathā vatvā tasmin divase dinna bhattam vihāram eva ānetvā ṭhitikāya gāhetabbam
translated: it is to be accepted. Having said that, the meal given on that day is to be brought to the monastery and accepted by the method of “acceptance as stored.”

original: Tatthāti tasmiṃ disābhāge. Taṃ gahetvāti taṃ vāragāmasalākaṃ attanā gahetvā. Tenāti
analyzed: tattha ati tasmin disā bhāge tam gahetvā iti tam vāragāma salākam attanā gahetvā tena ati
translated: ‘There’: in that direction. ‘Having taken it’: having taken that voting ticket of the village of Vāra. ‘By him’:

original: yo attano pattaṃ vāragāmasalākaṃ disaṃgamikassa adāsi, tena. Anatikkanteyeva tasmiṃ
analyzed: yaḥ attano pattam vāragāma salākam disaṃgamikassa adāsi tena tasmin
translated: by the one who gave his own voting ticket to the one who was going away. ‘Before he has gone beyond’:

original: tassa salākā gāhetabbāti yasmā upacārasīmaṭṭhasseva salākā pāpuṇāti, tasmā tasmiṃ
analyzed: tassa salākā gāhetabbā ati yasmai upacāra sīmaṭṭhassa iva salākā pāpuṇāti tasmai tasmin
translated: because the ticket falls to the one who is within the zone of access, therefore

original: disaṃgamike upacārasīmaṃ anatikkanteyeva tassa disaṃgamikassa pattasalākā attano pāpetvā gahetabbā.
analyzed: disaṃgamike upacāra sīmam an atikkantā iya iva tassa disaṃgamikassa patta salākā attanaḥ pāpetvā gahetabbā
translated: before the one who is going away has gone beyond the zone of access, the voting ticket of the one who is going away should be brought to him and taken.

original: Anāgatadivaseti ettha kathaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āgatānāgatabhāvo viññāyatīti ce? Yasmā
analyzed: anāgata divasa iti ettha katham tesam bhikkhūnam āgata anāgata bhāvaḥ viññāyati iti ce yasmā
translated: ‘On the following day’: how is the coming and not coming of those monks known? Because

original: tato tato āgatā bhikkhū tasmiṃ gāme āsanasālāya sannipatanti, tasmā tesaṃ āgatānāgatabhāvo
analyzed: tatas tatas āgatāḥ bhikkhū tasmin gāme āsana sālāya sannipatanti tasmā tesam āgata anāgata bhāvo
translated: the monks who have come from here and there assemble in the sitting hall in that village, therefore their coming and not coming

original: sakkā viññātuṃ. Amhākaṃ gocaragāmeti salākabhattadāyakānaṃ gāme. Bhuñjituṃ āgacchantīti
analyzed: sakkā viññātum amhākam gocara gāmā iti salāka bhatta dāyakānam gāme bhuñjitum āgacchanti iti
translated: can be known. ‘To our alms resort village’: to the village where the donors of the ticket alms live. ‘Are coming to eat’:

original: “mahāthero ekakova vihāre ohīno avassaṃ sabbasalākā attano pāpetvā ṭhito”ti maññamānā āgacchanti.
analyzed: mahā theraḥ ekakaḥ iva vihāre ohīnaḥ a vassam sabba salākāḥ attanaḥ pāpetvā ṭhitaḥ iti maññamānāḥ āgacchanti
translated: “The senior elder has been left alone in the monastery. No doubt they have all taken their shares and gone.”

original: Pakkhikabhattādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pakkhika bhatta ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the story of the monthly allowance, etc.

original: Abhilakkhitesu catūsu pakkhadivasesu dātabbabhattaṃ pakkhikaṃ. Abhilakkhitesūti ettha
analyzed: abhilakkhitesu catūsu pakkha divasesu dātabba bhattam pakkhikam abhilakkhitesu iti ettha
translated: In the four fortnights that have been marked: the monthly allowance is to be given in the four fortnights that have been marked.🔽In the passage “in the four fortnights that have been marked,”

original: abhīti upasaggamattaṃ, lakkhaṇīyesu icceva attho, uposathasamādānadhammassavanapūjāsakkārādikaraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: abhi iti upasagga mattam lakkhaṇīyesu iti ca eva atthaḥ uposatha samādāna dhamma ssavana pūjā sakkāra ādi karaṇa ttham
translated: the prefix abhi is merely used for emphasis. The meaning is “in the fortnights that should be marked.” For the purpose of undertaking the observance-day ceremony, listening to the Dhamma, paying respect, making offerings,

original: lakkhitabbesu sallakkhetabbesu upalakkhetabbesūti vuttaṃ hoti. Sve pakkhoti “ajja
analyzed: lakkhitabbesu sallakkhetabbesu upalakkhetabbesu iti vuttam hoti sve pakkho ti ajja
translated: etc., the fortnights should be marked, should be considered, should be noted.

original: pakkhikaṃ na gāhetabba”nti pakkhikassa aniyamattā vuttaṃ. “Sve amhākaṃ ghare lūkhabhattaṃ
analyzed: pakkhikam na gāhetabbanti pakkhikassa aniyamattā vuttam sve amhākam ghare lūkha bhattam
translated: Tomorrow is the fortnight: “Tomorrow is the fortnight. Today the fortnight should not be taken.” This is said because the monthly allowance is not fixed.

original: bhavissatī”ti potthakesu likhanti, “pakkhabhattaṃ bhavissatī”ti pāṭhena bhavitabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhavissati iti potthakesu likhanti pakkhabhattam bhavissati iti pāṭhena bhavitabbam
translated: In the books it is written, “Tomorrow there will be coarse food in our house,” but the reading should be “There will be a monthly allowance.”🔽The allowance to be given on the observance day is the observance-day allowance.

original: Uposathe dātabbaṃ bhattaṃ uposathikaṃ. Nibandhāpitanti “asukavihārassā”ti niyamitaṃ.
analyzed: uposathe dātabbam bhattam uposathikam nibandhāpitanti asuka vihārassa ati niyamitam
translated: The allowance that has been set aside: the allowance that has been set aside for a particular monastery.

original: Gāhetvā bhuñjitabbanti tasmiṃ senāsane vasantehi ṭhitikāya gāhetvā bhuñjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: gāhetvā bhuñjitabbanti tasmim senāsane vasantehi ṭhitikāya gāhetvā bhuñjitabbam
translated: He should be fetched and eaten: he should be fetched by those who are staying in that dwelling and eaten for the purpose of keeping it.

original: Taṇḍulādīnipesenti…pe… vaṭṭatīti abhihaṭabhikkhattā vaṭṭati. Tathā paṭiggahitattāti
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti abhihaṭa bhikkha ttā vaṭṭati tathā paṭiggahita ttā ti
translated: They pour in rice, etc.: … it is allowable because it is almsfood that has been brought in. And because it has been received in that way:

original: bhikkhānāmena paṭiggahitattā. Pattaṃ pūretvā thaketvā dinnanti “guḷakabhattaṃ demā”ti
analyzed: bhikkhā nāmena paṭiggahita ttā pattam pūretvā thaketvā dinnanti guḷaka bhattam dema ati
translated: because it has been received with the alms-round formula. When it is given after filling the bowl and setting it aside: when it is given after saying, “We are giving a meal with sweet-ball curry.”

original: dinnaṃ. Guḷapiṇḍepi…pe… dātabboti ettha guḷapiṇḍaṃ tālapakkappamāṇanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: dinnam dātabbaḥ ti ettha guḷa piṇḍam tāla pakka ppamāṇam ti veditabbam
translated: In the case of a sweet-ball: … should be given: a sweet ball the size of a plum should be understood.

original: Sesamettha suviññeyyamevāti.
analyzed: sesam ettha su viññeyyam evā ti
translated: The rest is easily understandable.

original: Senāsanakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: senāsana khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of Dwelling Places is finished.

original: 7. Saṅghabhedakakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: saṅgha bhedaka khandhakam
translated: The Chapter on Schism in the Sangha

original: Chasakyapabbajjākathāvaṇṇanā🔽330. Saṅghabhedakakkhandhake anupiyāyantiādīsu “anupiyā nāmā”ti vattabbe ākārassa
analyzed: cha sakya pabbajjā kathā vaṇṇanā  saṅghabhedaka khandhake anupiyāyanti ādīsu anupiyā nāma ati vattabbe ākārassa
translated: The Discussion of the Going-forth of the Sakyans🔽In the case of the words Anupiya, etc., in the Chapter on Schism in the Sangha, it should be said “Anupiya” .🔽But the -n- in the middle of the word is lengthened and the nasalized -i- is added to make it “Anupiya.”

original: rassattaṃ anunāsikassa ca āgamaṃ katvā “anupiyaṃ nāmā”ti vuttaṃ. Mallānanti mallarājūnaṃ.
analyzed: rassa attam anunāsikassa ca āgamam katvā anupiyam nāma ati vuttam mallānam ti malla rājūnam
translated: The Mallans: the Mallan kings.

original: Na heṭṭhā pāsādā orohatīti uparipāsādato heṭṭhimatalaṃ na orohati, “heṭṭhāpāsāda”ntipi🔽paṭhanti. Anuruddho vā pabbājeyyāti yojetabbaṃ. Gharāvāsatthanti gharāvāsassa anucchavikaṃ🔽kammaṃ. Udakaṃ abhinetabbanti udakaṃ āharitabbaṃ. Ninnetabbanti ābhatamudakaṃ puna
analyzed: na heṭṭhā pāsādau orohati iti upari pāsādataḥ heṭṭhima talam na orohati  paṭhanti anuruddhaḥ vā pabbājeyya iti yojetabbam gharāvāsattham ti gharāvāsassa anucchavikam  kammam udakam abhinetabbanti udakam āharitabbam ninnetabbanti ābhatam udakam puna
translated: He does not descend from the upper terrace: he does not descend to the lower terrace. “Heṭṭhāpāsāda” is also read. Anuruddha should be supplied. “The duties of a householder”: the duties suitable for a householder. “Water should be fetched”: water should be brought. “Water should be poured out”: the water that has been brought should be poured out again.

original: nīharitabbaṃ. Niddhāpetabbanti antarantarā uṭṭhitatiṇāni uddharitvā apanetabbaṃ.🔽Lavāpetabbanti paripakkakāle lavāpetabbaṃ. Ubbāhāpetabbanti khalamaṇḍalaṃ harāpetabbaṃ.
analyzed: nīharitabbam niddhāpetabbam ti antarantarā uṭṭhita tiṇāni uddharitvā apanetabbam  lava apetabbanti paripakka kāle lava apetabbam ubbāha apetabbanti khala maṇḍalam hara āpetabbam
translated: He does not descend from the upper terrace: he does not descend to the lower terrace. “Lower terrace” is also read. He should be connected with “Anuruddha would send out.” Work suitable for a householder: work suitable for a householder. Water should be fetched: water should be brought. It should be poured: the water that has been brought should be poured again. It should be strained: the grass that has arisen in between should be removed and thrown away.🔽It should be boiled: it should be boiled when it is ripe. It should be taken down: the pot should be taken down.

original: Ujuṃ kārāpetabbanti puñjaṃ kārāpetabbaṃ. Palālāni uddharāpetabbānīti palālāni apanetabbāni.
analyzed: ujum kārāpetabbanti puñjam kārāpetabbam palālāni uddharāpetabbāni iti palālāni apanetabbāni
translated: It should be made even: the heap should be made even. The chaff should be removed: the chaff should be thrown away.

original: Bhusikā uddharāpetabbāti gunnaṃ khuraggehi sañchinnā bhusasaṅkhātā nāḷadaṇḍā apanetabbā.
analyzed: bhusikā uddharā apetabbā ati gunnam khura aggehi sañchinnā bhusa saṅkhātā nāḷa daṇḍā apanetabbā
translated: The husks should be removed: the stalks called husks, which are cut off at the tip of the corn, should be thrown away.

original: Opunāpetabbanti vātamukhe opunāpetvā palālaṃ apanetabbaṃ. Atiharāpetabbanti antokoṭṭhāgāraṃ
analyzed: opunāpetabbanti vāta mukhe opunāpetvā palālam apanetabbam atiharāpetabbanti antokoṭṭhāgāram
translated: Should be removed: the straw should be removed after it has been shaken out in the wind. Should be taken away: to the threshing floor inside the monastery.

original: upanetabbaṃ. Na kammāti na kammāni. Gharāvāsatthenāti upayogatthe karaṇavacanaṃ.🔽Upajānāhīti ca upasaggamatto upa-saddo. Tenāha “gharāvāsatthaṃ jānāhī”ti. Jānāhīti
analyzed: upanetabbam na kamma ati na kammāni ghara āvāsa atthena ati upayoga tthe karaṇa vacanam  upajānāhi iti ca upasagga mattaḥ upasaddaḥ tena āha ghara āvāsa ttham jānāhi iti jānāhi iti
translated: Should be removed: the straw should be removed after being taken out through the door. Should be taken away: it should be taken to the threshing-floor. Not work: not work-a-day duties. For the sake of living in a house: the accusative is used for the sake of.

original: cettha paṭipajjāti attho veditabbo. Akāmakāti anicchamānā.🔽331-332. Yaṃ na nivattoti yasmā na nivatto. Suññāgāragatoti “ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca🔽avasesaṃ arañña”nti (pārā.92) vuttaṃ araññaṃ rukkhamūlañca ṭhapetvā aññaṃ pabbatakandarādi
analyzed: ca ittha paṭipajjā ti atthaḥ veditabbo akāmakā ati an icchamānā  yam na nivatto ti yasmai na nivatto suññāgāra gato ti ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca  avasesam araññanti vuttam araññam rukkha mūlañca ṭhapetvā aññam pabbata kandara ādi
translated: Understand: the prefix upa is merely a particle. Hence he said: “Understand for the sake of living in a house.” The meaning of “understand” should be understood here as “practice.”🔽Not willing: unwilling.🔽Not returned: because he did not return. Gone to an empty place: the forest is said to be “anywhere except a village and the vicinity of a village” .

original: pabbajitasāruppaṃ nivāsaṭṭhānaṃ janasambādhābhāvato idha “suññāgāra”nti adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: pabbajita sāruppam nivāsa ṭṭhānam jana sambādha abhāvataḥ idha suññāgāram ti adhippetam
translated: Except for a tree-root and a place under a roof-eave, any other place suitable for a monk to live in, such as a mountain cave, etc., is called “an empty place” here because it is free from the congestion of people.

original: Atha vā jhānakaṇṭakānaṃ saddānaṃ abhāvato vivittaṃ yaṃ kiñci agārampi “suññāgāra”nti
analyzed: atha vā jhāna kaṇṭakānam saddānam abhāvataḥ vivittam yam kiñci agāram pi suññāgāram ti
translated: Or else, any house that is secluded because of the absence of the noise of the thorns of jhāna is called “an empty place.”

original: veditabbaṃ. Taṃ suññāgāraṃ upagato. Abhikkhaṇanti bahulaṃ. Udānaṃ udānesīti so hi
analyzed: veditabbam tam suññāgāram upagataḥ abhikkhaṇanti bahulam udānam udānesi iti so hi
translated: should be known. He has gone to that empty place. He has penetrated: he has penetrated it much. He has uttered an utterance: that venerable one,

original: āyasmā araññe divāvihāraṃ upagatopi rattivāsūpagatopi yebhuyyena phalasamāpattisukhena
analyzed: āyasmai araññe divāvihāram upagataḥ api ratti vāsū upagataḥ api yebhuyyena phala samāpatti sukhena
translated: having gone to the forest for his day-quarters and having gone to stay for the night,

original: nirodhasamāpattisukhena ca vītināmesi, tasmā taṃ sukhaṃ sandhāya pubbe attanā anubhūtaṃ
analyzed: nirodha samāpatti sukhena ca vītināmesi tasmā tam sukham sandhāya pubbe attanā anubhūtam
translated: spent the time mostly in the happiness of fruition attainment and in the happiness of attainment of cessation. Therefore, referring to that happiness,

original: sabhayaṃ sapariḷāhaṃ rajjasukhaṃ jigucchitvā “aho sukhaṃ aho sukha”nti somanassasahitañāṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: sa bhayam sa pariḷāham rajja sukham jigucchitvā aho sukham aho sukham ti somanassa sahita ñāṇa samuṭṭhānam
translated: having despised the happiness of sovereignty that he had formerly experienced himself, which was fearful and accompanied by fever, he uttered a cry of joy accompanied by happiness, which arose from the knowledge of the thought: “Oh, what happiness! Oh, what happiness!”

original: pītisamuggāraṃ samuggirati. Te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocunti te sambahulā bhikkhū
analyzed: pīti samuggāram samuggirati te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocun ti te sambahulāḥ bhikkhū
translated: Those monks said this to the Lord: those many monks,

original: ullumpanasabhāvasaṇṭhitā tassa anuggaṇhanādhippāyena bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ, na ujjhānavasena.
analyzed: ullumpana sabhāva saṇṭhitā tassa anuggaṇhana adhippāyena bhagavantam etat avocum na ujjhāna vasena
translated: having become established in the state of uplifting, said this to the Lord with the intention of supporting him, not with the intention of censuring him.

original: Nissaṃsayanti asandehena, ekantenāti attho. Te kira bhikkhū puthujjanā tassa āyasmato
analyzed: nissaṃsayanti asandehena ekantena ati attho te kira bhikkhū puthujjanā tassa āyasmataḥ
translated: Without doubt: without hesitation, the meaning is, with certainty. Those monks, it seems, were ordinary people, and that venerable one was an arahat.

original: vivekasukhaṃ sandhāya udānaṃ ajānantā evamāhaṃsu. Samanussarantoti ukkaṇṭhanavasena anussaranto.
analyzed: viveka sukham sandhāya udānam a jānantāḥ samanussarantaḥ ti ukkaṇṭhana vasena anussarantaḥ
translated: “Recollecting”: recollecting with the thought of discontent.🔽“A certain bhikkhu”: a bhikkhu who was not well known by name and race.

original: Aññataranti nāmagottena apākaṭaṃ ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ. Āmantesīti āṇāpesi te bhikkhū saññāpetukāmo.
analyzed: aññataram ti nāma gottena apākaṭam ekam bhikkhum āmantesi iti āṇāpesi te bhikkhū saññāpetu kāmo
translated: “He addressed”: he spoke to those bhikkhus, wishing to make them understand.🔽“So”: this is an expression of assent, meaning “Very well.”

original: Evanti vacanasampaṭiggahe, sādhūti attho. Evaṃ bhanteti ettha pana evaṃ-saddo paṭiññāyaṃ.
analyzed: evam ti vacana sampaṭiggahe sādhu iti atthaḥ evam bhante ti ettha pana evaṃsaddo
translated: “So, friend”: here the word “so” is an expression of assent.🔽“He uttered this utterance: ‘Oh, the bliss! Oh, the bliss of solitude!’”

original: “Abhikkhaṇaṃ ‘aho sukhaṃ aho sukha’nti imaṃ udānaṃ udānesī”ti yathā te bhikkhū vadanti,
analyzed: abhikkhaṇam aho sukham aho sukhanti imam udānam udānesi iti yathā te bhikkhū vadanti
translated: He assents to the statement of those bhikkhus by saying, “So it is, friend.”

original: taṃ evaṃ tathevāti attano udānaṃ paṭijānāti. “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ bhaddiyā”ti kasmā bhagavā
analyzed: tam evam tathā iva ati udānam paṭijānāti kim pana tvam bhaddiya ati kasmai bhagavā
translated: “But, Bhaddiya, why do you say that?” Why does the Exalted One ask this?

original: pucchati, kiṃ tassa cittaṃ na jānātīti? No na jānāti, teneva pana tamatthaṃ vadāpetvā
analyzed: pucchati kim tassa cittam na jānāti iti no na jānāti tena iva pana tam attham vadāpetvā
translated: Does he not know the state of his mind? He does know it, but he asks in order to make those bhikkhus understand by having him state the reason.🔽For it is said: “The Tathāgatas ask knowing, and they ask not knowing;

original: te bhikkhū saññāpetuṃ pucchati. Vuttañhetaṃ “jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchanti, jānantāpi
analyzed: te bhikkhū saññāpetum pucchati vuttam ha etam jānantā api tathāgatā pucchanti jānantā api
translated: they ask knowing and not knowing, and they ask neither knowing nor not knowing” .

original: na pucchantī”tiādi. Atthavasanti kāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: na pucchanti itiādi kāraṇam
translated: “The reason”: the cause.

original: Antopi antepureti itthāgārassa sañcaraṇaṭṭhānabhūte rājagehassa abbhantare, yattha🔽rājā nahānabhojanasayanādiṃ kappeti. Rakkhā susaṃvihitāti ārakkhādikatapurisehi gutti🔽suṭṭhu samantato vihitā. Bahipi antepureti aṭṭakaraṇaṭṭhānādike antepurato bahibhūte🔽rājagehe. Evaṃ rakkhito gopito santoti evaṃ rājageharājadhānīrajjadesesu anto bahi
analyzed: antopi antepurā iti itthā āgārassa sañcaraṇa ṭṭhāna bhūte rāja gehassa abbhantare yattha  rājā na hāna bhojana sayana ādim kappeti rakkhā su saṃvihitā ati ārakkha ādi kata purisehi gutti  suṭṭhu samantataḥ vihitā antepurā iti aṭṭa karaṇa ṭṭhāna ādike antepurataḥ bahi bhūte  rāja gehe evam rakkhitaḥ gopitaḥ santo ti evam rājageha rājadhānī rajja desesu antar bahi
translated: In the inner palace: in the royal palace, which is the place where the women go about.🔽There the king bathes, eats, lies down, etc. Protection is well-provided: the protection, etc., is well-provided all around by guards.🔽Outside the inner palace: in the royal palace outside the inner palace, in the place for the proclamation of the king’s orders, etc.🔽Thus guarded, thus protected: thus guarded and protected in the royal palace, the capital, the kingdom, inside and outside,

original: ca anekesu ṭhānesu anekasatehi susaṃvihitarakkhāvaraṇaguttiyā mameva nibbhayatthaṃ🔽phāsuvihāratthaṃ rakkhito gopito samāno. Bhītotiādīni padāni aññamaññavevacanāni.🔽Atha vā bhītoti pararājūhi bhāyamāno. Ubbiggoti sakarajjepi pakatikkhobhato uppajjanakabhayubbegena
analyzed: ca anekesu ṭhānesu aneka satehi su saṃvihita rakkhā āvaraṇa guttiyā mama eva nibbhaya ttham  phāsu vihāra attham rakkhitaḥ gopitaḥ samānaḥ bhītaḥ iti ādīni padāni aññamañña vevacanāni  atha vā bhītaḥ iti para rājūhi bhāyamānaḥ ubbiggaḥ iti saka rajje pi pakati khobhataḥ uppajjanaka bhaya ubbegena
translated: Antopi antepure means inside the royal palace, which is the place where the women of the harem move about, where the king takes his bath, eats, sleeps, etc. Rakkhā susaṃvihitā means the protection is well arranged all around by the men who are appointed as guards. Bahipi antepure means outside the royal palace, in the royal palace which is outside the harem, in the place where the king’s orders are issued, etc. Evaṃ rakkhito gopito santo means being thus protected and guarded in the royal palace, the capital, the kingdom, etc., inside and outside, in many places, by many hundreds of well-arranged guards, protection, and watchmen, for my own fearlessness, for my own comfort. Bhīto, etc., are synonyms.

original: ubbiggo calito. Ussaṅkīti “raññā nāma sabbakālaṃ avissatthena bhavitabba”nti vacanato
analyzed: ubbiggaḥ calitaḥ ussaṅkī iti raññā nāma sabbakālam a vissatthena bhavitabban ti vacanato
translated: Or else, bhīto means frightened by other kings. Ubbiggo means agitated, shaken by the fear and anxiety that arise from the natural disturbances even in one’s own kingdom. Ussaṅkī means suspicious because of the statement: “A king must always be distrustful.”

original: sabbattha avissāsanavasena tesaṃ tesaṃ kiccakaraṇīyānaṃ accayato uppajjanakaparisaṅkāya
analyzed: sabbattha a vissāsana vasena tesam tesam kicca karaṇīyānam accayataḥ uppajjanaka parisaṅkāya
translated: Because of the absence of confidence in all things, and because of the arising of doubt as to the performance of duties,

original: ca uddhamuddhaṃ saṅkamāno. Utrāsīti “santikāvacarehipi ajānantasseva me kadāci anattho
analyzed: ca uddham uddham a saṅkamānaḥ a si iti a jānantassa iva me kadāci anatthaḥ
translated: he is afraid, thinking: “If I do not know what is near, I may sometimes come to harm.”

original: bhaveyyā”ti uppannena sarīrakampampi uppādanasamatthena tāsena utrāsi. “Utrasto”tipi
analyzed: bhaveyyāti uppannena uppādana samatthena tāsena utrāsi
translated: He is afraid with the fear that is able to cause trembling of the body.

original: paṭhanti. Viharāmīti evaṃbhūto hutvā viharāmi.
analyzed: paṭhanti viharāmi iti evaṃbhūtaḥ hutvā viharāmi
translated: He dwells, he lives, in this way.

original: Etarahīti idāni pabbajitakālato paṭṭhāya. Ekoti asahāyo. Tena vivekaṭṭhakāyataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: etarahi iti idāni pabbajita kālato paṭṭhāya ekaḥ iti asahāyo tena viveka ṭṭhakāya tam dasseti
translated: From now on, from the time of his going forth, he is alone, without a companion. He shows that his body is in solitude.

original: Abhītotiādīnaṃ padānaṃ vuttavipariyāyena attho veditabbo. Bhayādinimittassa pariggahassa
analyzed: abhītaḥ ti ādīnam padānam vutta vipariyāyena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ bhaya ādi nimittassa pariggahassa
translated: The meaning of the words fearless, etc., should be understood in the opposite sense to the meaning of the words fearful, etc.

original: taṃnimittassa ca kilesagahanassa abhāvenevassa abhītāditāti etena cittavivekaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: tad nimittassa ca kilesa gahanassa abhāvena iva ssa etena citta vivekam dasseti
translated: He is fearless, etc., because of the absence of the condition for fear, etc., and because of the absence of the thicket of defilements that have that as their object. By this he shows the solitude of mind.

original: Appossukkoti sarīraguttiyaṃ nirussukko. Pannalomoti lomahaṃsuppādakassa chambhitattassa
analyzed: appa ussukkaḥ ti sarīra guttiyam nirussukkaḥ panna lomaḥ ti loma haṃsa uppādakassa chambhi tattassa
translated: He is secluded, he is not occupied with the care of the body. He is dust-free, he is free from the trembling that causes the hairs of the body to stand erect.

original: abhāvena anuggatalomo. Padadvayenapi serivihāraṃ dasseti. Paradattavuttoti parehi🔽dinnena cīvarādinā vattamāno. Etena sabbaso saṅgābhāvadīpanamukhena anavasesabhayahetuvirahaṃ🔽dasseti. Migabhūtena cetasāti vissatthavihāritāya migassa viya jātena cittena. Migo🔽hi amanussapathe araññe vasamāno vissattho tiṭṭhati nisīdati nipajjati yenakāmañca
analyzed: abhāvena anuggatalomaḥ pada dvayena pi seri vihāram dasseti para datta vutto ti parehi  dinnena cīvara ādinā vattamānaḥ etena sabbaso saṅga abhāva dīpana mukhena anavasesa bhaya hetu viraham  dasseti miga bhūtena cetasā ati vissattha vihāritāya migassa viya jātena cittena migaḥ  hi amanussa pathe araññe vasamānaḥ vissatthaḥ tiṭṭhati nisīdati nipajjati yenakāmañca
translated: and by the two words ‘without’ he shows the dwelling in the absence of fear. ‘Living on what is given by others’: living on robes, etc., given by others. By this he shows the absence of any cause for fear without exception, by the method of showing the absence of all conflict. ‘With a mind like a deer’s’: with a mind that has become like a deer’s through dwelling in confidence. For a deer, living in the forest on a road frequented by men, stands confidently, sits confidently, and lies down confidently wherever it wishes.

original: pakkamati appaṭihatacāro, evaṃ ahampi viharāmīti dasseti. Vuttañhetaṃ paccekasambuddhena –🔽“Migo araññamhi yathā abaddho;🔽Yenicchakaṃ gacchati gocarāya;🔽Viññū naro serita pekkhamāno;🔽Eko care khaggavisāṇakappo”ti. ;🔽Imaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, atthavasanti bhagavā yadidaṃ mama etarahi paramaṃ vivekasukhaṃ
analyzed: pakkamati appaṭihata cāraḥ evam aham pi viharāmi iti dasseti vuttam ha etam paccekasambuddhena 🔽migaḥ araññamhi yathā a baddhaḥ 🔽yenicchakam gacchati gocarāya 🔽viññū naraḥ sā īrita pekkhamānaḥ 🔽ekaḥ care khagga visāṇa kappo ti 🔽imam kho aham bhante bhagavā yat idam mama etarahi paramam viveka sukham
