original: phalasamāpattisukhaṃ, idameva kāraṇaṃ sampassamāno “aho sukhaṃ, aho sukha”nti udānemi.🔽Etamatthanti etaṃ bhaddiyattherassa puthujjanavisayātītaṃ vivekasukhasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ
analyzed: phala samāpatti sukham idam eva kāraṇam sampassamānaḥ aho sukham aho sukham ti udānemi  etam attham ti etam bhaddiya therassa puthujjana visaya atītam viveka sukha saṅkhātam attham
translated: The reason I uttered the inspired utterance was that I saw the bliss of the attainment of fruition.🔽Having known the meaning: having known the meaning, which is the bliss of seclusion that transcends the domain of ordinary people,

original: sabbākārato viditvā. Imaṃ udānanti imaṃ sahetukabhayasokavigamānubhāvadīpakaṃ udānaṃ udānesi.
analyzed: sabba ākārataḥ viditvā imam udānan ti imam sa hetuka bhaya soka vigama anubhāva dīpakam udānam udānesi
translated: I uttered the inspired utterance: I uttered this inspired utterance, which reveals the power of being free from fear and sorrow together with its cause.

original: Yassantarato na santi kopāti yassa ariyapuggalassa antarato abbhantare attano citte
analyzed: yassa antarataḥ na santi yassa ariya puggalassa antarataḥ abbhantare attano citte
translated: He in whom there is no anger: in the heart, in the mind of the noble person,

original: cittakālussiyakaraṇato cittappakopā rāgādayo āghātavatthuādikāraṇabhedato anekabhedā
analyzed: citta kālussiya karaṇataḥ citta ppakopāḥ rāga ādayaḥ āghāta vatthu ādi kāraṇa bhedataḥ aneka bhedā
translated: there is no anger, no irritation of the mind, which is due to lust, etc., and which has many varieties according to the different kinds of objects such as the grounds for irritation, etc.

original: dosakopā eva vā na santi, maggena pahīnattā na vijjanti. Ayañhi antara-saddo kiñcāpi
analyzed: dosa kopāḥ eva vā na santi maggena pahīna ttā na vijjanti ayan hi antara saddaḥ kiñca api
translated: Or else, there is no anger, no hatred, which is of many kinds according to the different kinds of objects such as the grounds for irritation, etc.🔽This word antara is seen in the sense of reason in such passages as “mañca tvañca kimantara” ,

original: “mañca tvañca kimantara”ntiādīsu kāraṇe dissati, “antaraṭṭhake himapātasamaye”tiādīsu
analyzed: mañca tvañca kim antar antiādīsu kāraṇe dissati antaraṭṭhake himapāta samaya iti ādīsu
translated: in the sense of middle in such passages as “antaraṭṭhake himapātasamaye” ,

original: vemajjhe, “antarā ca jetavanaṃ antarā ca sāvatthi”ntiādīsu vivare, “bhayamantarato
analyzed: vemajjhe antarā ca jetavanam antarā ca vivare bhayam antarataḥ
translated: in the sense of interval in such passages as “antarā ca jetavanaṃ antarā ca sāvatthi” ,🔽and in the sense of fear in such passages as “bhayamantarato ca bāhirato ca” .

original: jāta”ntiādīsu citte, idhāpi citte eva daṭṭhabbo. Tenevāha “yassa citte kopā na santī”ti.
analyzed: jāta nti ādīsu citte idha api citte eva daṭṭhabbo tena iva āha yassa citte kopāḥ na santi iti
translated: In such passages as “The mind is born” , it should be understood here too in the same way as in the last passage. Hence he says: “In whom there is no anger of mind.”

original: Abhava-saddassa vibhava-saddena atthuddhāre kāraṇamāha “vibhavoti ca abhavoti ca
analyzed: abhava saddassa vibhava saddena attha uddhāre kāraṇam āha vibhavaḥ ti ca abhavaḥ ti ca
translated: He explains the reason for the interchange of meaning between the words vibhava and abhava thus: “Vibhava and abhava are synonymous.”

original: atthato eka”nti. Iti-saddo pakāravacanoti āha “iti anekappakārā bhavābhavatā”ti.
analyzed: atthataḥ ekam ti iti saddo pakāra vacano ti āha iti aneka ppakārā bhava abhava tā ti
translated: The word iti is a demonstrative pronoun; hence he says: “Thus there are many kinds of becoming and non-becoming.”

original: Vītivattoti atikkanto. Ettha ca “yassā”ti idaṃ yo vītivattoti vibhattivipariṇāmavasena🔽yojetabbaṃ. Taṃ vigatabhayanti taṃ evarūpaṃ yathāvuttaguṇasamannāgataṃ khīṇāsavaṃ
analyzed: vītivatto ti atikkantaḥ ettha ca yassa ati idam yaḥ vibhatti vipariṇāma vasena  yojetabbam tam tam evarūpam yathāvutta guṇa samannāgatam khīṇa āsavam
translated: Vītivatta means “gone beyond.” And here the word yassa should be construed with vītivatta by way of ellipsis of the words “the defilements” .

original: cittakopābhāvato itibhavābhavasamatikkamanato ca bhayahetuvigamena vigatabhayaṃ.🔽Vivekasukhena aggaphalasukhena ca sukhiṃ, vigatabhayattā eva asokaṃ. Devā nānubhavanti
analyzed: citta kopa abhāvataḥ iti bhava abhava samatikkamanataḥ ca bhaya hetu vigamena vigata bhayam  viveka sukhena agga phala sukhena ca sukhim vigata bhayattāḥ eva asokam devāḥ na anubhavanti
translated: Taṃ vigatabhayaṃ means “that which is free from fear.” The one who has destroyed the taints, who possesses the aforementioned qualities, is free from fear because he is devoid of anger of mind and because he has gone beyond becoming and non-becoming, i.e., because he is free from the causes of fear.🔽Sukhiṃ means “happy,” happy with the happiness of seclusion and the happiness of the foremost fruit . Asoganti asokaṃ , i.e., free from sorrow, because he is free from fear.

original: dassanāyāti adhigatamagge ṭhapetvā sabbepi upapattidevā vāyamantāpi cittacāradassanavasena
analyzed: dassanāya ati adhigata magge ṭhapetvā sabbe pi upapatti devāḥ vā āyamantā api citta cāra dassana vasena
translated: Devā nānubhavanti means “the gods do not experience.” All the gods who have been reborn in the heavens, even though they strive, do not experience the Tathāgata’s path, which has been attained, by way of seeing his mental activity.

original: dassanāya daṭṭhuṃ nānubhavanti na abhisambhuṇanti na sakkonti, pageva manussā. Sekkhāpi
analyzed: dassanāya daṭṭhum na anubhavanti na abhisambhuṇanti na sakkonti pageva manussā sekkhā api
translated: They do not experience, do not succeed in seeing, do not succeed in knowing, the arising and passing away of the mind of an arahat, much less ordinary people.

original: hi puthujjanā viya arahato cittappavattiṃ na jānanti. Tassa dassanaṃ devānampi dullabhanti
analyzed: hi puthujjanāḥ viya arahataḥ citta ppavattim na jānanti tassa dassanam devānam pi dullabhanti
translated: For even the trainees do not know the mental process of an arahat, as do ordinary people.

original: etthāpi cittacāradassanavasena tassa dassanaṃ devānampi dullabhaṃ alabbhanīyaṃ, devehipi🔽taṃ dassanaṃ na sakkā pāpuṇitunti evamattho gahetabbo. Abhāvattho hettha du-saddo
analyzed: ettha api citta cāra dassana vasena tassa dassanam devānam pi dullabham a labbhanīyam devehi pi  tam dassanam na sakkā pāpuṇitun ti evam atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ abhāva atthaḥ ha ittha dusaddaḥ
translated: The meaning should be understood thus: “The seeing of him is difficult to obtain even for the gods.”🔽The meaning of the word du in the compound dukkara is the meaning of non-existence,

original: “duppañño”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: duppaññaḥ ti ādīsu viya
translated: as in the case of the words duppañña, etc.

original: 333. Bhattābhihāroti abhiharitabbabhattaṃ. Tassa pana pamāṇaṃ dassetuṃ “pañca ca
analyzed: bhattābhihāro ti abhiharitabba bhattam tassa pana pamāṇam dassetum pañca ca
translated: “Food that is to be brought” : food that is to be brought to him. In order to show the measure of that food, it is said: “and five hundred hot meals.”

original: thālipākasatānī”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha eko thālipāko dasannaṃ purisānaṃ bhattaṃ gaṇhāti.
analyzed: thālipāka satāni iti vuttam tattha ekaḥ thālipākaḥ dasannam purisānam bhattam gaṇhāti
translated: Here, one hot meal is sufficient for ten men.

original: Lābhasakkārasilokenāti ettha lābho nāma catupaccayalābho. Sakkāroti tesaṃyeva sukatānaṃ
analyzed: lābha sakkāra silokena ati ettha lābhaḥ nāma catu paccaya lābho sakkāro ti tesam yeva su katānam
translated: “Gain, honor, and fame” : here, gain is the gain of the four requisites. Honor is the good opinion of others.

original: susaṅkhatānaṃ lābho. Silokoti vaṇṇaghoso. Manomayaṃ kāyanti jhānamanena nibbattaṃ
analyzed: su saṅkhatānam lābho siloko ti vaṇṇa ghoso manaḥ mayam jhānam anena nibbattam
translated: and his gain is well-ordered. The world of the gods is the report of his beauty. The mind-made body is the body produced by his jhāna.

original: brahmakāyaṃ. Upapannoti upagato. Attabhāvappaṭilābhoti sarīrapaṭilābho. Dve vā tīṇi🔽vā māgadhakāni gāmakhettānīti ettha māgadhakaṃ gāmakhettaṃ atthi khuddakaṃ, atthi
analyzed: brahmakāyam upapanno ti upagataḥ sarīra paṭilābhaḥ dve vā tīṇi  vā māgadhakāni gāma khettāni iti ettha māgadhakam gāma khettam atthi khuddakam atthi
translated: He has appeared: he has come. The acquisition of a selfhood is the acquisition of a body. Two or three🔽Magadhan village-fields: here a Magadhan village-field is small,

original: majjhimaṃ, atthi mahantaṃ. Khuddakaṃ gāmakhettaṃ ito cattālīsa usabhāni, etto cattālīsa🔽usabhānīti gāvutaṃ hoti. Majjhimaṃ ito gāvutaṃ, etto gāvutanti aḍḍhayojanaṃ hoti.🔽Mahantaṃ ito diyaḍḍhagāvutaṃ, etto diyaḍḍhagāvutanti tigāvutaṃ hoti. Tesu khuddakena
analyzed: majjhimam atthi mahantam khuddakam gāmakhettam itas cattālīsa usabhāni ettas cattālīsa  usabhāni iti gāvutam hoti majjhimam itas gāvutam ettas gāvutanti aḍḍha yojanam hoti  mahantam itas diyaḍḍhaga āvutam ettas diyaḍḍhaga āvutam ti tiga āvutam hoti tesu khuddakena
translated: medium, or large. A small village-field is a league from here and a league from there and is a league in🔽circumference. A medium one is two leagues from here and two leagues from there and is three leagues in🔽circumference. A large one is two and a half leagues from here and two and a half leagues from there and is three and a half leagues in circumference. Among them, his selfhood is three small

original: gāmakhettena tīṇi, khuddakena ca majjhimena ca dve gāmakhettāni tassa attabhāvo.
analyzed: gāma khettena tīṇi khuddakena ca majjhimena ca dve gāma khettāni tassa atta bhāvaḥ
translated: ones, and two small ones and a medium one.

original: Tigāvutañhissa sarīraṃ. Pariharissāmīti paṭijaggissāmi gopayissāmi. Rakkhassetanti rakkhassu etaṃ.
analyzed: tigāvutam hissa sarīram pariharissāmi iti paṭijaggissāmi gopayissāmi rakkhassa itanti rakkhassu etam
translated: His body is three and a half leagues. I will tend: I will look after, I will guard. Protect it: guard it.

original: Pañcasatthukathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañca satthu kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the verse of five hundred.

original: 334. Satthāroti gaṇasatthāro. Nāssassāti na etassa bhaveyya. Tanti taṃ satthāraṃ.
analyzed: satthāraḥ ti gaṇa satthāraḥ nāssassa ati na etassa bhaveyya tanti tam satthāram
translated: “Satthāro” means teachers of a group. “Nāssassu” means it would not be for him. “Taṃ” means that teacher.

original: Tenāti amanāpena. Samudācareyyāmāti katheyyāma. Sammannatīti amhākaṃ sammānaṃ karoti.
analyzed: tena ati amanāpena samudācareyyāma ati katheyyāma sammannati iti amhākam sammānam karoti
translated: “Tenā” means with that displeasure. “Samudācareyyāma” means we would speak. “Sammannati” means he does honor to us.

original: Tenāha “sammānetī”ti, sammannatīti vā parehi sammānīyatīti attho.
analyzed: tena āha sammāneti iti sammannati iti vā parehi sammānīyati iti atthaḥ
translated: Therefore it is said “sammāneti,” or the meaning is that he is honored by others.

original: 335. Nāsāya pittaṃ bhindeyyunti acchapittaṃ vā macchapittaṃ vā nāsāpuṭe pakkhipeyyuṃ.
analyzed: nāsāya pittam bhindeyyunti accha pittam vā maccha pittam vā nāsāpuṭe pakkhipeyyuṃ
translated: “Would pierce his nose with a hot skewer” means he would put clear bile or fish bile into his nostrils.

original: Parābhavāyāti avaḍḍhiyā vināsāya. Assatarīti vaḷavāya kucchismiṃ gadrabhassajātā,
analyzed: parābhavāya ati avaḍḍhiyā vināsāya assatarīti vaḷavāya kucchismim gadrabhassajātā
translated: “For his destruction” means for his non-prosperity, for his ruin. “Assatarī” means a mule born in a mare’s womb,

original: taṃ assena saddhiṃ sampayojenti, sā gabbhaṃ gaṇhitvā kāle sampatte vijāyituṃ na sakkoti,
analyzed: tam assena saddhim sampayojenti sā gabbham gaṇhitvā kāle sampatte vijāyitum na sakkoti
translated: which they yoke with a horse. She conceives, and when the time comes she cannot give birth.

original: pādehi bhūmiṃ paharantī tiṭṭhati, athassā cattāro pāde catūsu khāṇukesu bandhitvā
analyzed: pādehi bhūmim paharantī tiṭṭhati athassā cattāraḥ pāde catūsu khāṇukesu bandhitvā
translated: She stands kicking the ground with her feet. Then they bind her four feet to four posts

original: kucchiṃ phāletvā potakaṃ nīharanti, sā tattheva marati. Tena vuttaṃ “attavadhāya gabbhaṃ gaṇhātī”ti.
analyzed: kucchim phāletvā potakam nīharanti sā tattha eva marati tena vuttam atta vadhāya gabbham gaṇhāti iti
translated: and open her belly and take out the foal. She dies right there. Therefore it is said “she conceives for her own destruction.”

original: 339. Potthanikanti churikaṃ, yaṃ kharantipi vuccati.
analyzed: potthanikam ti churikam yam vuccati
translated: Potthana means a knife, also called a khara.

original: Nāḷāgiripesanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nāḷāgiri pesana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the elephant Nāḷāgiri

original: 342. Mā kuñjara nāgamāsadoti bho, kuñjara, buddhanāgaṃ vadhakacittena mā upagaccha.
analyzed: mā kuñjara nāgam āsadaḥ uti bho kuñjara buddha nāgam vadhaka cittena mā upagaccha
translated: Do not attack the elephant, Nāga, means, elephant, do not approach the Buddha-elephant with a mind to kill.

original: Dukkhanti dukkhakāraṇattā dukkhaṃ. Kathaṃ taṃ dukkhanti āha “na hi nāgahatassā”tiādi.
analyzed: dukkham ti dukkha kāraṇattā dukkham katham tat dukkham ti āha na hi nāga hatassa atiādi
translated: Painful: painful because it is a cause of pain. How is it painful? He said, “For the one who strikes the elephant,” etc.

original: Nāgahatassa sugatipaṭikkhepena buddhanāgassa ghāto duggatidukkhakāraṇanti dasseti.
analyzed: nāga hatassa sugati paṭikkhepena buddha nāgassa ghātaḥ duggati dukkha kāraṇanti dasseti
translated: He shows that the killing of the Buddha-elephant is a cause of the pain of the unhappy destination by the prohibition of a happy destination for the one who strikes the elephant.

original: Itoti ito jātito. Yatoti yasmā. Ito paraṃ yatoti ito paraṃ gacchantassāti vā attho.
analyzed: itas iti itas jātitaḥ yatas uti yasmai itas param yatas iti itas param gacchantassa ati vā attho
translated: From here: from this birth. From here on: from here on, going.

original: Madoti mānamado. Pamādoti pamattabhāvo. Paṭikuṭitoti saṅkuṭito. Alakkhikoti ahiriko.
analyzed: mado ti māna mado pamādo ti pamatta bhāvo paṭikuṭito ti saṅkuṭitaḥ alakkhiko ti ahiriko
translated: Conceit: pride-conceit. Carelessness: the state of being heedless. Shameless: without shame.

original: Yatra hi nāmāti yo nāma.
analyzed: yatra hi nāma ati yaḥ nāma
translated: Where, indeed: who, indeed.

original: Pañcavatthuyācanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañca vatthu yācana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the request for the five things

original: 343. Tikabhojananti tīhi bhuñjitabbabhojanaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ ekato paṭiggahetvā bhuñjituṃ
analyzed: tika bhojanam ti tīhi bhuñjitabba bhojanam tiṇṇam ekatas paṭiggahetvā bhuñjitum
translated: Three-part meal: a meal that is to be eaten in three parts, having accepted from three .

original: paññapessāmīti attho. Kokālikotiādīni catunnaṃ devadattapakkhiyānaṃ gaṇapāmokkhānaṃ
analyzed: paññapessāmi iti attho kokālikā iti ādīni catunnam devadatta pakkhiyānam gaṇa pāmokkhānam
translated: The meaning is: I will proclaim. Kokālika, etc., are the names of the four chief disciples of Devadatta.

original: nāmāni. Āyukappanti ekaṃ mahākappaṃ asītibhāgaṃ katvā tato ekabhāgamattaṃ kālaṃ antarakappasaññitaṃ kālaṃ.
analyzed: nāmāni ekam mahākappam asīti bhāgam katvā tatas eka bhāga mattam kālam antara kappa saññitam kālam
translated: The life-span: having made a great aeon into eighty parts, the period called an intermediate aeon is one part of it.

original: Āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavocāti devadatto sabbaṃ saṅghabhedassa pubbabhāgaṃ nipphādetvā
analyzed: āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca ati devadattaḥ sabbam saṅghabhedassa pubbabhāgam nipphādetvā
translated: He said this to the venerable Ānanda: Devadatta, having completed all the preliminary work for the schism in the Sangha,

original: “ekaṃseneva ajja āveṇikaṃ uposathaṃ saṅghakammañca karissāmī”ti cintetvā etaṃ “ajjatagge”tiādivacanaṃ
analyzed: ekaṃsena iva ajja āveṇikam uposatham saṅgha kammañca karissāmi iti cintetvā etam ajjatagga iti ādi vacanam
translated: thought: “Today, without delay, I will perform the Uposatha and the Sangha duties.” He spoke these words beginning with “From today onward.”

original: avoca. Tattha aññatreva bhagavatāti vinā eva bhagavantaṃ, taṃ satthāraṃ akatvāti🔽attho. Aññatra bhikkhusaṅghā uposathaṃ karissāmi saṅghakammāni cāti bhagavato ovādakārakaṃ
analyzed: avoca tattha aññatra iva bhagavatā ati vinā eva bhagavantam tam satthāram a katvā iti  atthaḥ aññatra bhikkhu saṅghāḥ uposatham karissāmi saṅgha kammāni ca ati bhagavataḥ ovāda kārakam
translated: Herein, apart from the Blessed One: without the Blessed One, not taking him as the Teacher—this is the meaning.🔽Apart from the Sangha of bhikkhus, I will perform the Uposatha and the Sangha duties: without the Sangha of bhikkhus, which is the doer of advice for the Blessed One,

original: bhikkhusaṅghaṃ vinā maṃ anuvattantehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ āveṇikaṃ uposathaṃ saṅghakammāni
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgham vinā mam anuvattantehi bhikkhūhi saddhim āveṇikam uposatham saṅgha kammāni
translated: together with bhikkhus who follow me, I will perform the Uposatha without delay and the Sangha duties.

original: ca karissāmi. Ajjatagge, bhante, devadatto saṅghaṃ bhindissatīti bhedakārakānaṃ sabbesaṃ
analyzed: ca karissāmi ajjatagge bhante devadatto saṅgham bhindissati iti bheda kārakānam sabbesam
translated: I will do so. Today, venerable sir, Devadatta will split the Order. ’

original: devadattena sajjitattā “ekaṃseneva devadatto ajja saṅghaṃ bhindissatī”ti maññamāno
analyzed: devadattena ekaṃsena iva devadattaḥ ajja saṅgham bhindissati iti maññamānaḥ
translated: Because Devadatta had been devoted to him, he thought ‘ Devadatta will certainly split the Order today ’ and so he said this.

original: evamāha. Bhindissatīti dvidhā karissati.🔽Etamatthaṃ viditvāti etaṃ avīcimahānirayuppattisaṃvattaniyaṃ kappaṭṭhiyaṃ atekicchaṃ
analyzed: evam āha bhindissati iti dvidhā karissati  etam attham viditvā iti etam avīci mahāniraya uppatti saṃvattaniyam kappaṭṭhiyam atekiccham
translated: ‘ Will split ’ : will make it two.

original: devadattena nibbattiyamānaṃ saṅghabhedakammaṃ sabbākārato viditvā. Imaṃ udānanti🔽kusalākusalesu yathākkamaṃ sappurisāsappurisānaṃ sukarā paṭipatti, na pana nesaṃ
analyzed: devadattena nibbattiyamānam saṅgha bheda kammam sabba ākārataḥ viditvā imam udānanti  kusala akusalesu yathākkamam sappurisa asappurisānam sukarā paṭipatti na pana nesam
translated: Having understood the meaning : having understood in all aspects the act of splitting the Order that Devadatta was bringing into existence, which would result in his reappearance in the Avici Great Hell and last an aeon and be incurable.

original: akusalakusalesūti idamatthavibhāvanaṃ udānaṃ udānesi.
analyzed: akusala kusalesu iti idam attha vibhāvanam udānam udānesi
translated: This utterance : this utterance of the meaning of the distinction that the right and the wrong courses are respectively easy and difficult for the good and the bad, not that they are respectively difficult and easy for the bad and the good.

original: Tattha sukaraṃ sādhunā sādhūti attano paresañca hitaṃ sādhetīti sādhu, sammāpaṭipanno.
analyzed: tattha sukaram sādhunā sādhu iti attano paresam ca hitam sādhu iti iti sādhu sammāpaṭipanno
translated: Herein, it is easy for the good to be good : the good is he who is rightly gone , who brings about his own welfare and that of others.

original: Tena sādhunā sāriputtādinā sāvakena paccekasambuddhena sammāsambuddhena aññena vā
analyzed: tena sādhunā sāriputta ādinā sāvakena paccekasambuddhena sammāsambuddhena aññena vā
translated: By that good man, by that good disciple such as Sariputta, by that Paccekabuddha, by that Fully Enlightened One, or by anyone else,

original: lokiyasādhunā sādhu sundaraṃ bhaddakaṃ attano paresañca hitasukhāvahaṃ sukaraṃ sukhena🔽kātuṃ sakkā. Sādhu pāpena dukkaranti tadeva pana vuttalakkhaṇaṃ sādhu pāpena devadattādinā
analyzed: lokiya sādhunā sādhu sundaram bhaddakam paresam ca hita sukha āvaham sukaram sukhena  kātum sakkā sādhu pāpena tat eva pana vutta lakkhaṇam sādhu pāpena devadatta ādinā
translated: It is easy to do good by good means, etc. : It is easy to do good, which is good, beautiful, excellent, productive of one’s own and others’ welfare and happiness, and which can be done with ease.

original: pāpapuggalena dukkaraṃ kātuṃ na sakkā, na so taṃ kātuṃ sakkotīti attho. Pāpaṃ pāpena🔽sukaranti pāpaṃ asundaraṃ attano paresañca anatthāvahaṃ pāpena yathāvuttapāpapuggalena🔽sukaraṃ sukhena kātuṃ sakkuṇeyyaṃ. Pāpamariyehi dukkaranti ariyehi pana buddhādīhi
analyzed: pāpa puggalena dukkaram kātum na sakkā na saḥ tam kātum sakkoti iti attho pāpam pāpena  pāpam asundaram attano paresam ca anattha āvaham pāpena yathā vutta pāpa puggalena  sukaram sukhena kātum ariyehi pana buddha ādīhi
translated: It is difficult to do evil by evil means: It is difficult to do that same good, which has the characteristics already stated, by evil means, by a bad person such as Devadatta. The meaning is that he is not able to do it.🔽It is easy to do evil by evil means: Evil, which is bad, ugly, and productive of harm to oneself and others, is easy to do, can be done with ease, by evil means, by a bad person of the kind already stated.

original: taṃ pāpaṃ dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ. Setughātoyeva hi tesaṃ tatthāti dīpeti.
analyzed: tam pāpam dukkaram durabhisambhavam setu ghātoya iva hi tesam tattha ati dīpeti
translated: It is difficult to do evil by means of the noble ones: But that evil is difficult to do, hard to accomplish, by means of the noble ones, the Buddhas, etc. For them it is as impossible as it would be for a stone to float in water.

original: Saṅghabhedakathāvaṇṇanā🔽345. Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto ādesanāpāṭihāriyānusāsaniyātiādīsu parassa cittaṃ
analyzed: saṅgha bheda kathā vaṇṇanā  atha kho āyasmā sāriputto ādesanā pāṭihāriya anusāsaniya ati ādīsu parassa cittam
translated: The Commentary on the Discourse on the Schism in the Sangha

original: ñatvā kathanaṃ ādesanāpāṭihāriyaṃ, sāvakānañca buddhānañca satataṃ dhammadesanaṃ
analyzed: ñatvā kathanam ādesanā pāṭihāriyam sāvakānam ca buddhānam ca satatam dhamma desanam
translated: Now, when it is said above that the venerable Sariputta “knew the minds of others and spoke thus in order to give a teaching by a working of mind over mind” , the “working of mind over mind” is the teaching by knowing another’s mind. And the “constant teaching of the Dhamma” is the teaching by the working of mind over matter.

original: anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ, iddhividhaṃ iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ. Tattha iddhipāṭihāriyena saddhiṃ
analyzed: anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam iddhi vidham iddhi pāṭihāriyam tattha iddhi pāṭihāriyena saddhiṃ
translated: the miracle of instruction, and the miracle of psychic power. Herein, the miracle of psychic power is

original: anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ mahāmoggallānattherassa āciṇṇaṃ, ādesanāpāṭihāriyena saddhiṃ🔽anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṃ dhammasenāpatissa. Tena vuttaṃ “āyasmā sāriputto ādesanāpāṭihāriyānusāsaniyā
analyzed: anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam mahāmoggallāna ttherassa āciṇṇam ādesanā pāṭihāriyena saddhiṃ  anusāsanī pāṭihāriyam dhammasenāpatissa tena vuttam āyasmā sāriputto ādesanā pāṭihāriya anusāsaniyā
translated: The miracle of instruction is the miracle of teaching. The miracle of psychic potency is the miracle of psychic power. Herein, the miracle of instruction together with the miracle of psychic potency was performed by the Elder Mahā Moggallāna,🔽and the miracle of instruction together with the miracle of reading the minds of others was performed by the General of the Dhamma. That is why it is said: “The venerable Sāriputta advised and instructed the bhikkhus with talk on the True Idea” , and so on.

original: bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadī”tiādi. Tadā hi dvīsu aggasāvakesu dhammasenāpati tesaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya ovadi itiādi tadā hi dvīsu aggasāvakesu dhammasenāpati tesaṃ
translated: For on that occasion the General of the Dhamma, having known the course of thought of those bhikkhus,

original: bhikkhūnaṃ cittacāraṃ ñatvā dhammaṃ desesi, mahāmoggallānatthero vikubbanaṃ dassetvā🔽dhammaṃ desesi, pāḷiyañcettha dvinnampi therānaṃ desanāya dhammacakkhupaṭilābhova
analyzed: bhikkhūnam citta cāram ñatvā dhammaṃ desesi mahāmoggallāna theraḥ vikubbanam dassetvā  dhammam desesi pāḷiyam ca ittha dvinnam pi therānam desanāya dhamma cakkhu paṭilābhaḥ uva
translated: taught them the True Idea, and the Elder Mahā Moggallāna, having shown a miracle of psychic potency,🔽taught them the True Idea. And in the text only the Elder’s teaching of the True Idea is shown as resulting in the bhikkhus’ obtaining of the vision of the True Idea.

original: dassito. Dīghabhāṇakā pana evaṃ vadanti “bhagavatā pesitesu dvīsu aggasāvakesu dhammasenāpati
analyzed: dassitaḥ dīghabhāṇakā pana evam vadanti bhagavatā pesitesu dvīsu aggasāvakesu dhammasenāpati
translated: But the Long-Discourse Deliverers say that when the two chief disciples had been sent by the Blessed One, the General of the Dhamma,

original: tesaṃ cittacāraṃ ñatvā dhammaṃ desesi, therassa dhammadesanaṃ sutvā pañcasatāpi bhikkhū
analyzed: tesam citta cāram ñatvā dhammaṃ desesi therassa dhamma desanam sutvā pañca satā api bhikkhū
translated: having known the course of thought of those bhikkhus, taught them the True Idea, and that when the bhikkhus heard the Elder’s teaching of the True Idea,

original: sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhahiṃsu. Atha nesaṃ mahāmoggallānatthero vikubbanaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhahiṃsu atha nesam mahāmoggallāna theraḥ vikubbanam dassetvā
translated: and they were established in the fruit of Stream-Entry. Then the Elder Mahā Moggallāna, after showing them a miracle,

original: dhammaṃ desesi, taṃ sutvā sabbe arahattaphale patiṭṭhahiṃsū”ti. Devadattaṃ uṭṭhāpesīti
analyzed: dhammam desesi tam sutvā sabbe arahatta phale patiṭṭhahiṃsu iti devadattam uṭṭhāpesi iti
translated: and they all were established in the fruit of Liberation.” Devadatta raised him up

original: jaṇṇukena hadayamajjhe paharitvā uṭṭhāpesi.
analyzed: jaṇṇukena hadaya majjhe paharitvā uṭṭhāpesi
translated: he raised him up by striking him in the middle of the chest with his knee.

original: 346. Sarasīti saro. Suvikkhālitanti suṭṭhu vikkhālitaṃ, suvisodhitaṃ katvāti attho.
analyzed: sarasi iti saraḥ su vikkhālitanti suṭṭhu vikkhālitam su visodhitam katvā iti attho
translated: A lake: a lake. Well-washed: well-washed, well-purified, is the meaning.

original: Saṃkhāditvāti suṭṭhu khāditvā. Mahiṃ vikubbatoti mahiṃ dantehi vilikhantassa. Nadīsu
analyzed: saṃkhāditvā iti suṭṭhu khāditvā mahim vikubbataḥ ti mahim dantehi vilikhantassa nadīsu
translated: Having chewed: having well-chewed. While scratching the earth: while scratching the earth with his tusks. In the rivers

original: bhisaṃ ghasānassāti yojetabbaṃ. Nadīti cettha mahāsaro adhippeto. Jaggatoti hatthiyūthaṃ
analyzed: bhisam ghasānassa ati yojetabbam nadī iti ca ittha mahā saraḥ adhippetaḥ jaggataḥ ti hatthi yūtham
translated: should be connected. Herein, a lake is what is intended. A herd: a herd of elephants.

original: pālentassa. Bhiṅkovāti hatthipotako viya. Mamānukubbanti maṃ anukaronto.
analyzed: pālentassa hatthi potakaḥ viya mama anukubbanti mam anukarontaḥ
translated: A leader: a leader of a herd of elephants. Like a calf: like a young elephant. Following me: following after me.

original: 347. Dūteyyanti dūtakammaṃ. Gantumarahatīti dūteyyasaṅkhātaṃ sāsanaṃ harituṃ dhāretvā
analyzed: dūteyyanti dūta kammam gantum arahati iti dūteyya saṅkhātam sāsanam haritum dhāretvā
translated: A message: a message. Is fit to go: is fit to carry a message, to carry a message called a message,

original: harituṃ arahati. Sotāti yaṃ assa sāsanaṃ denti, tassa sotā. Sāvetāti taṃ uggaṇhitvā🔽“idaṃ nāma tumhehi vutta”nti paṭisāvetā. Uggahetāti suuggahitaṃ katvā uggahetā. Dhāretāti🔽sudhāritaṃ katvā dhāretā. Viññātāti attanā tassa atthaṃ jānitā. Viññāpetāti paraṃ
analyzed: haritum arahati sotā ati yam assa sāsanam denti tassa sotā sāvetā ati tam uggaṇhitvā  idam nāma tumhehi vuttanti paṭisāvetā uggahetā ati su uggahitam katvā uggahetā dhāretā ati  su dhāritam katvā dhāretā viññātā ati attanā tassa attham jānitā viññāpetā ati param
translated: He should listen to it: he should listen to whatever instruction they give him. He should repeat it: he should repeat it, saying, “This is what you said.” He should learn it: he should learn it well. He should remember it: he should remember it well. He should understand it: he should understand its meaning. He should ask about it:

original: vijānāpetā. Sahitāsahitassāti “idaṃ sahitaṃ, idaṃ asahita”nti evaṃ sahitāsahitassa
analyzed: vijānāpetā sahita asahitassa ati idam sahitam idam asahitam ti evam sahita asahitassa
translated: He should be able to remember it. “He should be able to hear it”: he should be able to hear whatever instruction they give him. “He should be able to repeat it”: having learned it, he should be able to repeat it back to them, saying, “This is what you said.” “He should be able to learn it”: he should learn it well. “He should be able to remember it”: he should remember it well. “He should be able to understand it”: he should understand its meaning himself. “He should be able to make others understand it”: he should make others understand it. “He should be skilled in what is and what is not decisive”: he is skilled in what is and what is not decisive in this way: “This is decisive; this is not decisive.”

original: kusalo upagatānupagatesu cheko sāsanaṃ ārocento sahitāsahitaṃ sallakkhetvā āroceti.
analyzed: kusalaḥ upagata an upagatesu cheko sāsanam ārocento sahita asahitam sallakkhetvā āroceti
translated: When he is able to determine what is and what is not decisive, he is able to report the instruction well.

original: Na byathatīti na vedhati na chambhati. Uggavādininti pharusavacanena samannāgataṃ.
analyzed: na byathati iti na vedhati na chambhati pharusa vacanena samannāgatam
translated: “He should not be overbearing”: he should not be overbearing or nervous. “He should be a good speaker”: he should not be offensive in his speech.

original: Pucchitoti paṭiññatthāya pucchito.🔽348. Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehītiādīsu asaddhammehīti asataṃ dhammehi, asantehi
analyzed: pucchito ti paṭiñña tthāya pucchitaḥ 🔽aṭṭhahi bhikkhave asat dhammehi itiādīsu asat dhammehi iti asatam dhammehi asantehi
translated: “He should be questioned”: he should be questioned for the purpose of a confession.

original: vā asobhanehi vā dhammehi. Abhibhūtoti ajjhotthaṭo. Pariyādinnacittoti khepitacitto
analyzed: vā asobhanehi vā dhammehi abhibhūto ti ajjhotthaṭaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ iti khepita cittaḥ
translated: or with unattractive things. Overcome: overwhelmed. His mind is destroyed: his mind is ruined.

original: lābhādihetukena icchācārena mānamadādinā ca khayaṃ pāpitakusalacitto. Atha vā pariyādinnacittoti🔽parito ādinnacitto, vuttappakārena akusalakoṭṭhāsena yathā kusalacittassa uppattivāro
analyzed: lābha ādi hetukena icchā ācārena māna mada ādinā ca khayam atha vā  paritas ādinna cittaḥ vutta ppakārena akusala koṭṭhāsena yathā kusala cittassa uppatti vāro
translated: Because of gain, etc., by the practice of will for sensual pleasure, and by pride, conceit, etc., his wholesome mind is destroyed. Or alternatively, his mind is destroyed

original: na hoti, evaṃ samantato gahitacittasantānoti attho. Apāye nibbattanārahatāya āpāyiko.🔽Tatthapi avīcisaṅkhāte mahāniraye uppajjatīti nerayiko. Ekaṃ antarakappaṃ paripuṇṇameva
analyzed: na hoti evam samantataḥ gahita citta santānaḥ ti attho apāye nibbattana araha tāya āpāyikaḥ  tattha api avīci saṅkhāte mahāniraye uppajjati iti nerayikaḥ ekam antara kappam paripuṇṇam eva
translated: because it is seized all round, in the sense that the occurrence of a wholesome mind is prevented, as it is seized all round by the unwholesome class of states already mentioned. The meaning is that the continuity of his mind is seized all round. He is doomed to hell because he is destined for rebirth in hell.

original: katvā tattha tiṭṭhatīti kappaṭṭho. Atekicchoti buddhehipi anivattanīyattā avīcinibbattiyā
analyzed: katvā tattha tiṭṭhati iti kappaṭṭhaḥ atekiccho ti buddhehi pi a nivattanīya ttā avīci nibbattiyā
translated: He is a hell being because he is reborn in the Great Hell called Avīci. He is one who will remain there for an eon because he will remain there for an entire eon. He is incurable because he cannot be turned away from rebirth in Avīci even by Buddhas.

original: tikicchābhāvato atekiccho, atikicchanīyoti attho. Lābhenāti lābhena hetubhūtena.
analyzed: tikicchā bhāvataḥ a tekicchaḥ a tikicchanīyaḥ ti atthaḥ lābhena ati lābhena hetu bhūtena
translated: The meaning is that he is incurable, beyond cure. Because of gain: because of gain that has become the cause.

original: Atha vā lābhahetukena mānādinā. Lābhañhi nissāya idhekacce puggalā pāpicchā icchāpakatā
analyzed: atha vā lābha hetukena māna ādinā lābham hi nissāya idha ekacce puggalā pāpa icchāḥ icchā pakatā
translated: Or alternatively, because of pride, etc., that have gain as their cause. For some people here, because of gain, have evil desires and are dominated by will for sensual pleasure.

original: icchācāre ṭhatvā “lābhaṃ nibbattessāmā”ti anekavihitaṃ anesanaṃ appatirūpaṃ āpajjitvā
analyzed: icchācāre ṭhatvā lābham nibbattessāma ati aneka vihitam an esanam appatirūpam āpajjitvā
translated: Having fallen into the practice of desire and greed, he engages in various kinds of improper search for gain.

original: ito cutā apāyesu nibbattanti. Apare yathālābhaṃ labhitvā taṃnimittaṃ mānātimānamadamacchariyādivasena🔽pamādaṃ āpajjitvā ito cutā apāyesu nibbattanti, ayañca tādiso. Tena vuttaṃ “lābhena,
analyzed: itas cutāḥ apāyesu nibbattanti apare yathālābham labhitvā tad nimittam māna atimāna mada macchariya ādi vasena  pamādam āpajjitvā itas cutāḥ apāyesu nibbattanti ayam ca tādisaḥ tena vuttam lābhena
translated: After death he is reborn in the states of deprivation. Others, having obtained gain according to their deserts, fall into negligence through pride, conceit, vanity, and envy, etc., based on that gain.

original: bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko”tiādi. Asakkārenāti hīḷetvā
analyzed: bhikkhave abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ devadattaḥ āpāyikaḥ iti ādi asakkārena ati
translated: After death they are reborn in the states of deprivation. This person is such. Therefore it is said: “Devadatta, bhikkhus, was overcome and his mind was controlled by gain. He has appeared in a bad destination, in the Avici Hell” .

original: paribhavitvā parehi attani pavattitena asakkārena, asakkārahetukena vā mānādinā.
analyzed: paribhavitvā parehi attani asakkārena asakkāra hetukena vā māna ādinā
translated: By disesteem: by disesteem that has arisen in others and is directed towards oneself. Or else, by the pride, etc., that are the causes for disesteem.

original: Asantaguṇasambhāvanādhippāyena pavattā pāpā icchā etassāti pāpiccho, tassa bhāvo
analyzed: asanta guṇa sambhāvanā adhippāyena pavattā pāpā icchā etassa ati pāpicchaḥ tassa bhāvo
translated: He who has the evil desire called “covetousness” is an evil-wisher. The state of that is evil-wishfulness.

original: pāpicchatā, tāya. “Ahaṃ buddho bhavissāmi, bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pariharissāmī”ti hi tassa
analyzed: pāpa iccha tā tāya aham buddhaḥ bhavissāmi bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi iti hi tassa

original: icchā uppannā. Kokālikādayo pāpā lāmakā mittā etassāti pāpamitto, tassa bhāvo pāpamittatā, tāya.

analyzed: anujānāpentaḥ bhedassa anurūpam vā bodhentaḥ yathā bhedaḥ hoti evam bhinditabbe bhikkhū

original: 352. Aṭṭhārasabhedakaravatthumhi dasa akusalakammapathā saṃkiliṭṭhadhammatāya vodānadhammapaapakkhattā
analyzed: aṭṭhārasa bheda kara vatthumhi dasa akusala kamma pathā saṃkiliṭṭha dhamma tāya

analyzed: adhammaḥ ti dassitā tathā upādāna ādayaḥ bodhi pakkhiya dhammānam ekanta anavajja bhāvato

original: akathananti katvā adhammabhāvoti dassento āha “tayo satipaṭṭhānā”tiādi. Niyyānikanti🔽sapāṭihīraṃ appaṭihataṃ hutvā pavattatīti attho. Tathevāti iminā “evaṃ amhāka”ntiādinā🔽vuttamatthaṃ ākaḍḍhati. Kātabbaṃ kammaṃ dhammo nāmāti yathādhammaṃ karaṇato dhammo
analyzed: a kathananti katvā adhamma bhāvaḥ ti dassentaḥ āha tayo sati paṭṭhāna atiādi niyyānikanti  sa pāṭihīram appaṭihatam hutvā pavattati iti attho tathā iva ati iminā evam amhākam ti ādinā  vutta mattham ākaḍḍhati kātabbam kammam dhammaḥ nāma ati yathādhammam karaṇataḥ dhammaḥ

original: Rāgavinayo…pe… ayaṃ vinayo nāmāti rāgādīnaṃ vinayanato saṃvaraṇato pajahanato paṭisaṅkhānato🔽ca vinayo nāma, vuttavipariyāyena itaro avinayo. Vatthusampattiādivasena sabbesaṃ
analyzed: ayam vinayaḥ nāma ati vinayanataḥ saṃvaraṇataḥ pajahanataḥ paṭisaṅkhānataḥ  ca vinayaḥ nāma vutta vipariyāyena itaraḥ avinayaḥ vatthu sampatti ādi vasena sabbesam
translated: The destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion is called “discipline” because it disciplines, restrains, abandons, and eliminates lust, etc. The opposite of that is called “non-discipline.”

original: vinayakammānaṃ akuppatāti āha “vatthusampatti…pe… ayaṃ vinayo nāmā”ti. Tappaṭipakkhato
analyzed: vinaya kammānam akuppa tā ti āha vatthu sampatti pe ayam vinayaḥ nāma ati tad paṭipakkhato

analyzed: adhamme bheda kara vatthumhi saṅgha bheda saṅkhāte eva ca adhamme ṭhito ti adhammaṭṭho  yogakkhemā padhaṃsati iti hitataḥ parihāyati catūhi pi yogehi an upadduta tā yogakkhemam

analyzed: nāma arahattam nibbānam ca tatas panassa dhaṃsane vattabbam eva na atthi diṭṭhi sīla sāmaññato  saṅgha taṭṭhena saṅgham tatas eva eka kamma ādi vidhāna yogena samaggam sahitam bhinditvā
translated: “He breaks up the refuge” : he falls away from what is beneficial. The refuge is the state of arahantship and Nibbāna, which are free from the four bonds. analyzed: pubbe vutta lakkhaṇena saṅgha bhedena bhinditvā kappanti antara kappa saṅkhātam āyu kappam

analyzed: buddhānam uppādaḥ ati samaggānam ca nuggahaḥ ati samaggānam sāmaggi anumodanena anuggaṇhanam

analyzed: samaggam katvā na ati bhinnam saṅgham saṅgha rāji ppattam vā samaggam sahitam katvā  kappanti āyu kappam eva saggamhi modati iti kāmāvacara deva loke aññe deve dasahi ṭhānehi

translated: “In heaven he delights” means that he delights, rejoices, amuses, and enjoys himself in the sense-desire-world divine world, surpassing other gods in ten respects,

analyzed: manussānam parivisana ṭṭhānan ti yattha manussāḥ sa putta dārāḥ āvasitvā denti hattha dhovana odakam  sandhāya iti bhutta avissa bhojana avasāne hattha dhovana odakam sandhāya tena iva āha antarā  pipāsitena pana pe hatthāḥ na dhovitabbā ati potthakesu pana pānīyam pivitvā hatthāḥ

analyzed: na dhovitabbā ati likhanti hatthāḥ dhovitabbā ati pāṭhena bhavitabbanti amhākam khanti  aññathā na tāva udakanti idam hattha dhovana odakam sandhāya vuttan ti vatvā antarā
translated: With reference to the water for washing the hands means with reference to the water for washing the hands after the meal. analyzed: pipāsitena pana ati ādinā vutta visesaḥ na upalabbhati atha matam na tāva therena udakam

original: paṭiggahetabbanti idaṃ kiṃ pānīyapaṭiggahaṇaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, udāhu hatthadhovanaudakaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: paṭiggahetabbanti idam kim pānīya paṭiggahaṇam sandhāya vuttam udāhu hattha dhovana odaka ggahaṇam

analyzed: sandhāya iti āsaṅkā nivattana attham idam hattha dhovana odakam sandhāya vutta nti ādi kathitanti  tat ca na tattha āsaṅkāya eva asambhavataḥ na hi bhagavā yāva aññe na bhuttāvino
translated: In order to remove doubt, it is said: ‘This was said with reference to the water for washing the hands.’

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ, “na tāva therena udakaṃ paṭiggahetabba”nti udakasaddappayogo ca
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam na tāva therena udakam paṭiggahetabban ti udaka sadda ppayogaḥ ca

analyzed: na kattabbaḥ siyā aṭṭhakathāyam ca idam hattha dhovana odakam sandhāya vuttan ti vatvā
translated: should not have been made. And in the commentary, after saying: ‘This was said with reference to the water for washing the hands,’

analyzed: tena nivattitabbam attham dassentena antarā pipāsitena pana gale vilagga amisena vā

analyzed: pānīyam pivitabbanti ettakam eva vattabbam pānīyam pivitvā hatthāḥ na dhovitabbā ati

translated: The Discussion of the Rules for Almsfood Wanderers

original: Senāsanavattakathāvaṇṇanā🔽369-370. Aṅgaṇeti abbhokāse. Na vuḍḍhaṃ anāpucchāti ettha tassa ovarake tadupacāre
analyzed: senāsanavatta kathā vaṇṇanā  aṅgaṇā iti abbhokāse na ettha tassa ovarake tad upacāre

original: uddisituṃ upāsikāya ratanapāsāde nisinno hoti. Nisajja pana bhikkhūnaṃ cittāni olokento🔽ekaṃ dussīlapuggalaṃ disvā “sacāhaṃ imasmiṃ puggale idha nisinneyeva pātimokkhaṃ

translated: Out of compassion for him, he remained silent.🔽Gone beyond: passed beyond, exhausted.🔽When the dawn has risen: when the head of the dawn has risen.

translated: But why did the Blessed One spend those three watches of the night in that way? He did so in order to make the incident clear.

original: anuddisitukāmo tassa vatthuṃ pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ.

translated: He saw: how did he see? By means of his knowledge of penetration of minds he knew the minds of the bhikkhus in the assembly.

analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ nāma hoti tasmai addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ tam puggalam dussīlanti  vuttam yathā iva hi anāgate sattasu divasesu pavattam paresam cittam cetaḥ pariya ñāṇa lābhī

translated: means that even if countless great eons were to pass without the arising of Buddhas, not a single being would attain Nibbāna,🔽and still one could not say that the element of Nibbāna is diminished. But even during the time of the Buddhas, when countless beings attain the deathless Nibbāna in each assembly,

original: samāgame asaṅkhyeyyāpi sattā amataṃ ārādhenti, tadāpi na sakkā vattuṃ “pūrā nibbānadhātū”ti.🔽Vimuttirasoti kilesehi vimuccanaraso. Sabbā hi sāsanasampatti yāvadeva anupādāya
analyzed: samāgame asaṅkhyeyyā api sattāḥ amatam ārādhenti tadā api na sakkā vattum pūrāḥ nibbāna dhātū ti  vimutti rasaḥ ti kilesehi vimuccana rasaḥ sabbā hi sāsana sampatti yāvat eva an upādāya
translated: one cannot say that the element of Nibbāna is increased.

original: āsavehi cittassa vimuttīti attho.
analyzed: āsavehi cittassa vimutti iti attho
translated: “The taste of liberation”: the taste of liberation from the defilements. For the entire excellence of the dispensation is nothing but the liberation of the mind from the cankers through non-clinging.🔽This is the meaning.

original: Ratanānīti ratijananaṭṭhena ratanāni. Satipaṭṭhānādayo hi bhāviyamānā pubbabhāgepi anekavidhaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ nibbattenti, pageva aparabhāge. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: ratanāni iti rati janana ṭṭhena ratanāni sati paṭṭhāna ādayaḥ hi bhāviyamānā pubbabhāge pi anekavidham pīti pāmojjam nibbattenti pagā iva aparabhāge vuttam ha etam
translated: Jewels : they are jewels in the sense of delight-generating . For when the foundations of mindfulness, etc., are being developed, they generate a diversity of happiness and gladness even in the earlier stage, to say nothing of the later stage. For this is said:

original: “Yato yato sammasati, khandhānaṃ udayabbayaṃ;
analyzed: yatas yatas sammasati khandhānam udaya bbayam
translated: “From whatever point one comprehends the rise and fall of the aggregates,

original: Labhatī pītipāmojjaṃ, amataṃ taṃ vijānata”nti. ;
analyzed: labhatī pīti pāmojjam amatam tam
translated: One gains happiness and gladness; that is the deathless state, I say” .

original: Lokiyaratananimittaṃ pana pītipāmojjaṃ na tassa kalabhāgampi agghati. Apica –
analyzed: lokiya ratana nimittam pana pīti pāmojjam na tassa kala bhāgam pi agghati apica
translated: But the happiness and gladness that have the world’s destruction for their object are not worth a fraction of that. Moreover:

original: Cittīkataṃ mahagghañca, atulaṃ dullabhadassanaṃ;
analyzed: cittīkatam mahaggham ca atulam dullabha dassanam
translated: It is esteemed, of great worth, incomparable, hard to see,

original: Anomasattaparibhogaṃ, ratananti pavuccati. ;
analyzed: anoma satta paribhogam ratananti pavuccati
translated: And used by the peerless man: that is called a jewel.

original: Yadi ca cittīkatādibhāvena ratanaṃ nāma hoti, satipaṭṭhānādīnaññeva bhūto ratanabhāvo.
analyzed: yadi ca cittīkata ādi bhāvena ratanam nāma hoti bhūtaḥ ratana bhāvaḥ
translated: And if something is a jewel in the sense of being esteemed, etc., then the foundations of mindfulness, etc., are the only things that are real jewels.

original: Bodhipakkhiyadhammānañhi so ānubhāvo, yaṃ sāvakā sāvakapāramīñāṇaṃ, paccekasambuddhā
analyzed: bodhi pakkhiya dhammānam hi saḥ ānubhāvaḥ yam sāvakā sāvaka pāramī ñāṇam paccekasambuddhā
translated: For that is the power of the enlightenment factors, by which the disciples attain the knowledge of the disciple’s perfection,🔽the paccekabuddhas the knowledge of the paccekabuddha enlightenment,

original: paccekabodhiñāṇaṃ, sammāsambuddhā sammāsambodhiṃ adhigacchanti āsannakāraṇattā. Paramparakāraṇañhi
analyzed: pacceka bodhi ñāṇam sammāsambuddhā sammāsambodhim adhigacchanti āsanna kāraṇa ttā parampara kāraṇam hi
translated: and the fully enlightened Buddhas the enlightenment of the supreme perfect Buddha. It is a proximate cause.

original: dānādiupanissayoti evaṃ ratijananaṭṭhena cittīkatādiatthena ca ratanabhāvo bodhipakkhiyadhammānaṃ
analyzed: dāna ādi upanissayaḥ ti evam rati janana ṭṭhena cittīkata ādi atthena ca ratana bhāvaḥ bodhi pakkhiya dhammānam
translated: The jewels are the enlightenment factors, which are so called because they are the cause of the arising of joy, and because they are the cause of the state of being a jewel.

original: sātisayo. Tena vuttaṃ “tatrimāni ratanāni, seyyathidaṃ – cattāro satipaṭṭhānā”tiādi.
analyzed: sa atisayaḥ tena vuttam tatra imāni ratanāni seyyathā idam cattāro sati paṭṭhāna ati ādi
translated: The jewel-nature of the enlightenment factors is very great in this way. Hence it was said above: “Herein, these are the jewels: that is to say, the four foundations of mindfulness” , and so on.

original: Ārammaṇe okkanditvā upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena paṭṭhānaṃ, satiyeva paṭṭhānaṃ satipaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: ārammaṇe okkanditvā upaṭṭhāna aṭṭhena paṭṭhānam satiyā iva paṭṭhānam sati paṭṭhānam
translated: The establishment of mindfulness is the establishment of the object by leaping over it, or it is the establishment of mindfulness itself.

original: Ārammaṇassa pana kāyādivasena catubbidhattā vuttaṃ “cattāro satipaṭṭhānā”ti. Tathā🔽hi kāyavedanācittadhammesu subhasukhaniccaattasaññānaṃ pahānato asubhadukkhāniccānattabhāvaggahaṇato
analyzed: ārammaṇassa pana kāya ādi vasena catubbidha ttā vuttam cattāro sati paṭṭhānā ti tathā  hi kāya vedanā citta dhammesu subha sukha nicca atta saññānam pahānataḥ asubha dukkha anicca anatta bhāva ggahaṇato
translated: But because the object is of four kinds as the body, etc., it is said: “There are four foundations of mindfulness” .

original: ca nesaṃ kāyānupassanādibhāvo vibhatto.🔽Sammā padahanti etena, sayaṃ vā sammā padahati, pasatthaṃ sundaraṃ vā padahananti
analyzed: ca nesam kāya anupassanā ādi bhāvaḥ vibhattaḥ  sammā padahanti etena sayam vā sammā padahati pasattham sundaram vā padahananti
translated: For the contemplation of the body, etc., is distinguished in this way because the perception of beauty, pleasure, permanence, and self in the body, feelings, mind, and mental qualities is abandoned, and because the apprehension of the body, etc., as ugly, painful, impermanent, and not self is effected.🔽It is right endeavour because it is the means of right endeavour, or because it is the means of one’s own right endeavour, or because it is the means of the endeavour of the one who is praiseworthy and good.

original: sammappadhānaṃ, puggalassa vā sammadeva padhānabhāvakaraṇato sammappadhānaṃ, vīriyassetaṃ
analyzed: sammappadhānam puggalassa vā sammat eva padhāna bhāva karaṇataḥ sammappadhānam vīriyassa etam
translated: It is right endeavour because it is the means of making a person’s endeavour right.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Tampi anuppannuppannānaṃ akusalānaṃ anuppādanapahānavasena anuppannuppannānaṃ
analyzed: adhivacanam tam pi anuppannuppannānam akusalānam an uppādana pahāna vasena anuppannuppannānam
translated: and verbal expression. And that is said to be “four right endeavours” because it accomplishes the fourfold task by abandoning unwholesome states that have arisen and by preventing unarisen unwholesome states from arising,

original: kusalānaṃ uppādanaṭhāpanavasena ca catukiccasādhakattā vuttaṃ “cattāro sammappadhānā”ti.
analyzed: kusalānam uppādana ṭhāpana vasena ca catu kicca sādhaka ttā vuttam cattāro sammappadhānā ti
translated: and by arousing wholesome states that have not arisen and by increasing wholesome states that have arisen.

original: Ijjhatīti iddhi, samijjhati nipphajjatīti attho. Ijjhanti tāya vā sattā iddhā vuddhā🔽ukkaṃsagatā hontīti iddhi. Paṭhamena atthena iddhi eva pādo iddhipādo, iddhikoṭṭhāsoti
analyzed: ijjhati iti iddhi samijjhati nipphajjati iti attho ijjhanti tāya vā sattāḥ iddhāḥ vuddhā  ukkaṃsa gatāḥ honti iti iddhi paṭhamena atthena iddhi eva pādaḥ iddhi pādaḥ iddhi koṭṭhāso ti
translated: “Success” is “iddhi” . The meaning is, it succeeds, it comes about. Or alternatively, beings succeed, they are successful, they are elevated,

original: attho. Dutiyena atthena iddhiyā pādo patiṭṭhā adhigamupāyoti iddhipādo. Tena hi uparūparivisesasaṅkhātaṃ🔽iddhiṃ pajjanti pāpuṇanti. Svāyaṃ iddhipādo yasmā chandādike cattāro adhipatidhamme
analyzed: atthaḥ dutiyena atthena iddhiyā pādo patiṭṭhā adhigama upāyo ti iddhipādo tena hi upari upari visesa saṅkhātam  iddhim pajjanti pāpuṇanti svāyam iddhipādaḥ yasmā chanda ādike cattāro adhipati dhamme
translated: they are exalted, by means of it, thus it is success . In the first case success is a foot, thus it is a “basis for success” , in the second case it is a footing, a support, a means of attaining, thus it is a basis for success.🔽For by means of it beings reach, attain, the success called the higher and higher kinds.

original: dhure jeṭṭhake katvā nibbattīyati, tasmā vuttaṃ “cattāro iddhipādo”ti.
analyzed: dhure jeṭṭhake katvā nibbattīyati tasmā vuttam cattāro iddhipādāḥ ti
translated: And this basis for success is produced by making the four things beginning with zeal the chief condition, thus it is said to be “four bases for success.”

original: Pañcindriyānīti saddhādīni pañca indriyāni. Tattha assaddhiyaṃ abhibhavitvā adhimokkhalakkhaṇe
analyzed: pañcindriyāni iti saddhā ādīni pañca indriyāni tattha assaddhiyam abhibhavitvā adhimokkha lakkhaṇe
translated: The five faculties are the five beginning with faith. Herein, it makes the unfaithful subject their characteristic of resolution,

original: indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti saddhā indriyaṃ. Kosajjaṃ abhibhavitvā paggahalakkhaṇe, pamādaṃ
analyzed: indaṭṭham kāreti iti saddhā indriyam kosajjam abhibhavitvā paggaha lakkhaṇe pamādam
translated: and so it makes faith a faculty. It makes the idle subject their characteristic of exertion,🔽it makes the heedless subject their characteristic of steadiness,

original: abhibhavitvā upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇe, vikkhepaṃ abhibhavitvā avikkhepalakkhaṇe, aññāṇaṃ
analyzed: abhibhavitvā upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇe vikkhepam abhibhavitvā avikkhepa lakkhaṇe aññāṇam
translated: it makes the confused subject their characteristic of non-confusion,

original: abhibhavitvā dassanalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti paññā indriyaṃ.
analyzed: abhibhavitvā dassana lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti paññā indriyam
translated: and it makes the ignorant subject their characteristic of seeing, and so it makes understanding a faculty.

original: Tāniyeva assaddhiyādīhi anabhibhavanīyato akampiyaṭṭhena sampayuttadhammesu thirabhāvena ca balāni veditabbāni.
analyzed: tāni yeva assaddhi ādīhi anabhibhavanīyataḥ akampiya ṭṭhena sampayutta dhammesu thira bhāvena ca balāni veditabbāni
translated: They should be understood as powers since they overpower the unfaithful, etc., and since they are unshakable and firm in the things associated with them.

original: Satta bojjhaṅgāti bodhiyā, bodhissa vā aṅgāti bojjhaṅgā. Yā hi esā dhammasāmaggī,
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅgā ati bodhiyā bodhissa vā aṅgā ati bojjhaṅgā yā hi esā dhamma sāmaggī
translated: The seven enlightenment factors are enlightenment’s , or are factors of enlightenment . For this is the path of enlightenment,

original: yāya lokuttaramaggakkhaṇe uppajjamānāya līnuddhaccapatiṭṭhānāyūhanakāmasukhattakilamathānuyogaucchedasassatābhinivesādīnaṃ
analyzed: yāya lokuttara magga kkhaṇe uppajjamānāya
translated: since it arises at the moment of the supramundane path, and it is the abandoning of the misinterpretations of depression and agitation, of the pursuit of gratification, of the pursuit of self-mortification, of the doctrine of perishing, and of the doctrine of the permanence, etc., of the world.

original: anekesaṃ upaddavānaṃ paṭipakkhabhūtāya satidhammavicayavīriyapītipassaddhisamādhiupekkhāsaṅkhātāya
analyzed: anekesam upaddavānam paṭipakkha bhūtāya sati dhamma vicaya vīriya pīti passaddhi samādhi upekkhā saṅkhātāya
translated: and which is a condition for the arising of the noble path,

original: dhammasāmaggiyā ariyasāvako bujjhati kilesaniddāya uṭṭhahati, cattāri vā ariyasaccāni🔽paṭivijjhati, nibbānameva vā sacchikarotīti “bodhī”ti vuccati, tassā dhammasāmaggisaṅkhātāya
analyzed: dhamma sāmaggiyā ariya sāvako bujjhati kilesa niddāya uṭṭhahati cattāri vā ariya saccāni  paṭivijjhati nibbānam eva vā sacchikaroti iti bodhī iti vuccati tassāḥ dhamma sāmaggi saṅkhātāya
translated: the noble disciple awakens to the four noble truths, or he realizes Nibbāna.

original: bodhiyā aṅgāti bojjhaṅgā jhānaṅgamaggaṅgādayo viya. Yopesa vuttappakārāya dhammasāmaggiyā🔽bujjhatīti katvā ariyasāvako “bodhī”ti vuccati, tassa bodhissa vā aṅgātipi bojjhaṅgā
analyzed: bodhiyā aṅgā ati bojjhaṅgāḥ jhānaṅga maggaṅga ādayaḥ viya vutta ppakārāya dhamma sāmaggiyā  bujjhati iti katvā ariya sāvakaḥ bodhī iti vuccati tassa bodhissa vā aṅgā atipi bojjhaṅgā
translated: The factors of this awakening are called enlightenment factors because they are factors of that awakening, like the factors of concentration and the factors of the path.🔽The noble disciple is called “one who has awakened” because he awakens to the four noble truths by means of the concordance of states of the kind already described.🔽The enlightenment factors are also called enlightenment factors because they are factors of that awakening.

original: senaṅgarathaṅgādayo viya. Tenāhu porāṇā “bujjhanakassa puggalassa aṅgāti bojjhaṅgā”ti,
analyzed: senaṅga rathaṅga ādayaḥ viya tena āhu porāṇāḥ bujjhanakassa puggalassa aṅgā ati bojjhaṅgā ati
translated: The ancient teachers said: “The enlightenment factors are factors of the person who is awakening.”

original: “bodhāya saṃvattantīti bojjhaṅgā”tiādinā nayenapi bojjhaṅgaṭṭho veditabbo.
analyzed: bodhāya saṃvattanti iti bojjhaṅga ati ādinā nayena api bojjhaṅga ṭṭhaḥ veditabbo
translated: The meaning of enlightenment factor should also be understood in the way beginning: “They lead to enlightenment, thus they are enlightenment factors.”

original: Ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggoti taṃtaṃmaggavajjhehi kilesehi ārakattā ariyabhāvakarattā
analyzed: ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo ti taṃ taṃ magga vajjhehi kilesehi ārakattā ariya bhāva karattā
translated: The noble eightfold path is called noble because it is far from defilements by being the opposite of the defilements, and because it causes the attainment of the noble fruit.

original: ariyaphalapaṭilābhakarattā ca ariyo. Sammādiṭṭhiādīni aṭṭhaṅgāni assa atthi, aṭṭhaṅgāniyeva🔽vā aṭṭhaṅgiko. Mārento kilese gacchati, nibbānatthikehi vā maggīyati, sayaṃ vā nibbānaṃ
analyzed: ariya phala paṭilābha karattā ca ariyaḥ sammādiṭṭhi ādīni aṭṭhaṅgāni assa atthi aṭṭhaṅgāniyeva  vā aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ mārentaḥ kilese gacchati nibbāna atthikehi vā maggīyati sayam vā nibbānaṃ
translated: And it is noble because it causes the attainment of the noble fruit. It has the eight factors of right view, and so on, or it is the eight factors,

original: maggatīti maggoti evametesaṃ satipaṭṭhānādīnaṃ atthavibhāgo veditabbo.🔽Sotāpannoti maggasaṅkhātaṃ sotaṃ āpajjitvā pāpuṇitvā ṭhito, sotāpattiphalaṭṭhoti🔽attho. Sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannoti sotāpattiphalassa attapaccakkhakaraṇatthāya
analyzed: maggati iti maggaḥ iti evam etesam sati paṭṭhāna ādīnam attha vibhāgaḥ veditabbo  sotāpannaḥ ti magga saṅkhātam sotam āpajjitvā pāpuṇitvā ṭhitaḥ sotāpatti phala ṭṭho ti  atthaḥ sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ ti sotāpatti phalassa atta paccakkha karaṇa tthāya
translated: or it goes to the defilements as a killer, or it is gone by those who seek Nibbāna, or it has gone to Nibbāna by itself, thus it is a path . This is how the exposition should be known here as to meaning.🔽One who has reached the stream, who has attained the path called the stream, is a “stream-enterer” . The meaning is that he is one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: paṭipajjamāno paṭhamamaggaṭṭho, yo aṭṭhamakotipi vuccati. Sakadāgāmīti sakideva imaṃ
analyzed: paṭipajjamānaḥ paṭhama magga ṭṭho yaḥ aṭṭhamakaḥ tipi vuccati sakadāgāmī iti sakidevaḥ imam
translated: One who is practising the way to realize the fruit of stream-entry is a “candidate for the fruit of stream-entry” . The meaning is that he is practising the way to make the fruit of stream-entry his own by realizing it for himself. He is one who is on the first path and is also called an “eighth-pre-deliverance” .

original: lokaṃ paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena āgamanasīlo dutiyaphalaṭṭho. Anāgāmīti paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena
analyzed: lokam paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena āgamana sīlaḥ dutiya phala ṭṭhaḥ anāgāmī iti paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena
translated: A “once-returner” is one whose nature is that of the second fruit. He is liable to come once again to this world in order to make an end, and he is called a “once-returner” because of that.🔽An “non-returner” is one whose nature is that of the third fruit. He is liable to come back no more to this world in order to be reborn here, and he is called a “non-returner” because of that.

original: kāmalokaṃ anāgamanasīlo tatiyaphalaṭṭho. Yo pana saddhānusārī dhammānusārī ekabījīti
analyzed: kāma lokam an āgamana sīlo tatiya phalaṭṭho yaḥ pana saddhā anusārī dhamma anusārī eka bījī iti
translated: One who is a follower by way of faith, one who is a follower by way of the Dhamma, and one who is a single- thing-obtainer are called “candidates for the fruit of non-return.”

original: evamādiko ariyapuggalavibhāgo, so tesaṃyeva bhedoti. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.🔽Etamatthaṃ viditvāti etaṃ attano dhammavinaye matakuṇapasadisena dussīlapuggalena🔽saddhiṃ saṃvāsābhāvasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ viditvā. Imaṃ udānanti imaṃ asaṃvāsārahasaṃvāsārahabhāvānaṃ
analyzed: evamādikaḥ ariya puggala vibhāgo so tesam yeva bhedaḥ ti sesam vutta nayam eva  etam attham viditvā iti etam attanaḥ dhamma vinaye mata kuṇapa sadisena dussīla puggalena  saddhim saṃvāsa abhāva saṅkhātam attham viditvā imam udānanti imam a saṃvāsa araha saṃvāsa araha bhāvānam
translated: This is the kind of classification of noble persons. It is their difference. The rest is as already stated.🔽Having understood the meaning: having understood the meaning consisting in the fact that he does not live with a person who is unvirtuous and who is like a corpse in his Dhamma and Discipline.

original: kāraṇaparidīpanaṃ udānaṃ udānesi.🔽Tattha channamativassatīti āpattiṃ āpajjitvā paṭicchādento aññaṃ navaṃ āpattiṃ
analyzed: kāraṇa paridīpanam udānam udānesi  tattha channam ativassati iti āpattim āpajjitvā paṭicchādentaḥ aññam navam āpattim
translated: This utterance: this utterance that he uttered in order to show the reason for the unsuitability of living with and the suitability of living separately from the unvirtuous.🔽Therein, what is covered by the rain: having fallen into an offense, he conceals it.🔽He falls into another new offense: he falls into another new offense.

original: Āpajjati, tato aparanti evaṃ āpattivassaṃ kilesavassaṃ ativiya vassati. Vivaṭaṃ nātivassatīti🔽āpattiṃ āpanno taṃ appaṭicchādetvā vivaranto sabrahmacārīnaṃ pakāsento yathādhammaṃ
analyzed: āpajjati tatas aparanti evam āpatti vassam kilesa vassam ativiya vassati vivaṭam na ativassati iti  āpattim āpanno tam a paṭicchādetvā vivarantaḥ sabrahmacārīnam pakāsentaḥ yathādhammam
translated: Then, after that: in this way, the rain of offenses and the rain of defilements rain down excessively.🔽What is open is not covered by the rain: having fallen into an offense, he does not conceal it.

original: yathāvinayaṃ paṭikaronto desento vuṭṭhahanto aññaṃ navaṃ āpattiṃ nāpajjati, tenassa
analyzed: yathāvinayam paṭikarontaḥ desentaḥ vuṭṭhahantaḥ aññam navam āpattim na āpajjati tenassa
translated: He reveals it to his companions in the spiritual life, makes amends for it according to the Dhamma and the Discipline, confesses it, and emerges from it. He does not fall into another new offense. Therefore

original: taṃ vivaṭaṃ puna āpattivassaṃ kilesavassaṃ na vassati. Yasmā ca etadeva, tasmā channaṃ🔽chāditaṃ āpattiṃ vivaretha. Evaṃ taṃ nātivassatīti evaṃ sante taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjanapuggalānaṃ
analyzed: tam vivaṭam punar āpatti vassam kilesa vassam na vassati yasmai ca etat eva tasmai channam  chāditam āpattim vivaretha evam tam na ativassati iti evam sante tam āpattim āpajjana puggalānam
translated: And since this is so, therefore:🔽“Let him open up the covered offence.”🔽If he does so, then:🔽“It will not rain upon him again.”🔽If he does so, then that offence will not rain upon the person who has fallen into it, will not rain upon his person, with the rain of defilement, will not torment him.

original: attabhāvaṃ ativijjhitvā kilesavassanena na vassati na temeti, evaṃ so kilesehi anavassuto

analyzed: pātimokkha savana āraha kathā vaṇṇanā  atha bhagavā cintesi idāni bhikkhu saṅghe abbudaḥ jātaḥ aparisuddhā puggalā uposathaṃ

analyzed: na idāni aham uposatham na karissāmi pātimokkham na uddisissāmi iti paccekam nakārena  sambandhaḥ duvidham pātimokkham āṇāpātimokkham ovāda pātimokkha nti tesu suṇātu me

original: vassasatesu saddhammaṭṭhitiyā kāraṇanidassanaṃ. Paṭisambhidāpabhedappattakhīṇāsavavaseneva

translated: Herein, as to “the going forth of women”: this is not a reason for the duration of the True Dhamma for five hundred years only, leaving out a century. But it is a reason for the True Dhamma’s duration for five hundred years from the time when the going forth of women took place. For the Blessed One would not have allowed the going forth of women if the True Dhamma would have lasted only four hundred years. And the Elder Mahā Kassapa would not have asked for it if it were to disappear in a century’s time. So it should be understood that this is a reason for the duration of the True Dhamma for five hundred years from the time when the going forth of women took place.🔽As to “the Arahants who have attained the discriminations”: this is a reason for the duration of the True Dhamma for five hundred years only. For the True Dhamma would not have disappeared if it had lasted longer than that even with the Arahants who have attained the discriminations.
