analyzed: paṭisambhidā pattehi vassa sahassam aṭṭhāsi chaḷabhiññehi vassa sahassam tevijjehi vassa sahassam sukkha vipassakehi vassa sahassam pātimokkhena vassa sahassam aṭṭhāsi iti
translated: ‘The Dispensation lasted a thousand years with those who had attained the discriminations, a thousand years with those possessed of the six kinds of direct knowledge, a thousand years with those possessed of the three kinds of true knowledge, a thousand years with the bare-insight workers, and a thousand years with the mere Patimokkha-rule reciters.’

original: Aṅguttaranikāyaṭṭhakathāyampi –
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam pi
translated: And in the Commentary to the Anguttara Nikāya it is said:

original: “Buddhānañhi parinibbānato vassasahassameva paṭisambhidā nibbattetuṃ sakkonti, tato
analyzed: buddhānam hi parinibbānataḥ vassa sahassam eva paṭisambhidāḥ nibbattetum sakkonti tatas
translated: ‘For a thousand years after the Enlightened One’s final attainment, the discriminations were produced;

original: paraṃ cha abhiññā, tato tāpi nibbattetuṃ asakkontā tisso vijjā nibbattenti, gacchante
analyzed: param cha abhiññā tatas tā api nibbattetum a sakkontā tissaḥ vijjāḥ nibbattenti gacchante
translated: after that, the six kinds of direct knowledge; after that, the three kinds of true knowledge; after that, the bare-insight workers; after that, the mere Patimokkha-rule reciters.

original: gacchante kāle tāpi nibbattetuṃ asakkontā sukkhavipassakā honti. Eteneva upāyena
analyzed: gacchante kāle tā api nibbattetum a sakkontā sukkha vipassakā honti etena iva upāyena
translated: As time went on, they were unable to produce the fruit of stream-entry and became dry-insight workers. In the same way

original: anāgāmino sakadāgāmino sotāpannā”ti –
analyzed: anāgāmino sakadāgāmino sā utāpannā ati
translated: they were unable to produce the fruits of once-returner, of non-returner, and of Arahantship. ”

original: Vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam
translated: This is said.

original: Saṃyuttanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana –🔽“Paṭhamabodhiyañhi bhikkhū paṭisambhidāpattā ahesuṃ. Atha kāle gacchante paṭisambhidā🔽pāpuṇituṃ na sakkhiṃsu, chaḷabhiññā ahesuṃ, tato cha abhiññā pattuṃ asakkontā tisso🔽vijjā pāpuṇiṃsu. Idāni kāle gacchante tisso vijjā pāpuṇituṃ asakkontā āsavakkhayamattaṃ🔽pāpuṇissanti, tampi asakkontā anāgāmiphalaṃ, tampi asakkontā sakadāgāmiphalaṃ, tampi
analyzed: saṃyutta nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam pana  paṭhama bodhiyam hi bhikkhū paṭisambhidā pattāḥ ahesuṃ atha kāle gacchante paṭisambhidā  pāpuṇitum na sakkhiṃsu chaḍ abhiññāḥ ahesum tatas cha abhiññāḥ pattum a sakkontā tisso  vijjā pāpuṇiṃsu idāni kāle gacchante tissaḥ vijjā pāpuṇitum a sakkontāḥ āsava khaya mattam  pāpuṇissanti tam pi a sakkontā anāgāmi phalam tam pi a sakkontā sakadāgāmi phalam tam pi
translated: But in the Commentary to the Saṃyutta Nikāya it is said:

original: asakkontā sotāpattiphalaṃ, gacchante kāle sotāpattiphalampi pattuṃ na sakkhissantī”ti –
analyzed: a sakkontā sotāpatti phalam gacchante kāle sotāpatti phalam pi pattum na sakkhissanti iti
translated: “At the time of the first enlightenment the bhikkhus attained the discriminations. Then as time went on they were unable to attain the discriminations, they became possessed of the six kinds of direct knowledge. Then as time went on they were unable to attain the six kinds of direct knowledge, they became possessed of the three true knowledges. Now as time went on they were unable to attain the three true knowledges, they will attain only the destruction of the taints. Those unable to do that will attain the fruit of non-return. Those unable to do that will attain the fruit of once-return. Those unable to do that will attain the fruit of stream-entry. As time goes on they will be unable to attain even the fruit of stream-entry. ”

original: Vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam
translated: This is said.

original: Yasmā cetaṃ sabbaṃ aññamaññapaṭiviruddhaṃ, tasmā tesaṃ tesaṃ bhāṇakānaṃ matameva
analyzed: yasmā ca itam sabbam aññamañña paṭiviruddham tasmā tesam tesam bhāṇakānam matam eva
translated: But since all this is mutually contradictory, it is the opinion of

original: ācariyena tattha tattha dassitanti gahetabbaṃ. Aññathā hi ācariyasseva pubbāparavirodhappasaṅgo siyāti.
analyzed: ācariyena tattha tattha dassitanti gahetabbam aññathā hi ācariyassa iva pubba apara virodha ppasaṅgo siyāti
translated: It should be taken as shown by the teacher here and there. For otherwise there would be the fault of contradiction between the earlier and later statements of the teacher himself.

original: Tāniyevāti tāniyeva pañca vassasahassāni. Pariyattimūlakaṃ sāsananti āha “na hi pariyattiyā
analyzed: tāniyā iva ati tāniyā iva pañca vassa sahassāni pariyatti mūlakam sāsananti āha na hi pariyattiyā
translated: “Those very same”: those very five thousand years. The Dispensation has the scriptures as its basis: hence he said, “For there is no penetration without the scriptures.”

original: asati paṭivedho atthī”tiādi. Pariyattiyā hi antarahitāya paṭipatti antaradhāyati,
analyzed: asati paṭivedhaḥ atthi itiādi pariyattiyā hi antarahitāya paṭipatti antaradhāyati
translated: For when the scriptures have disappeared, the practice of the path disappears;

original: paṭipattiyā antarahitāya adhigamo antaradhāyati. Kiṃkāraṇā? Ayañhi pariyatti paṭipattiyā
analyzed: paṭipattiyā antarahitāya adhigamaḥ antaradhāyati kiṃkāraṇā ayan hi pariyatti paṭipattiyā
translated: and when the practice of the path has disappeared, the realization of the fruition disappears. And why? Because this scripture is a condition for the practice of the path,

original: paccayo hoti, paṭipatti adhigamassa, iti paṭipattitopi pariyattiyeva pamāṇaṃ. Tattha🔽paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hotipi na hotipi. Ekasmiñhi kāle paṭivedhakarā bhikkhū
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti paṭipatti adhigamassa iti paṭipattitaḥ pi pariyattiyā iva pamāṇam tattha  paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hoti pi na hoti pi ekasmin hi kāle paṭivedha karāḥ bhikkhū
translated: and the practice of the path is a condition for the realization of the fruition. So the practice of the path too has the scriptures as its measure.🔽Herein, penetration and the practice of the path occur and do not occur. For at one time there are many bhikkhus who are engaged in penetration,

original: bahū honti, “esa bhikkhu puthujjano”ti aṅguliṃ pasāretvā dassetabbo hoti, imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: bahū honti esa bhikkhu puthujjanaḥ ti aṅgulim pasāretvā dassetabbo hoti imasmin yeva
translated: and it is possible to point out one saying, “This bhikkhu is an ordinary man,” and another saying, “This bhikkhu is an initiate.”

original: dīpe ekavāraṃ puthujjanabhikkhu nāma nāhosi. Paṭipattipūrakāpi kadāci bahū honti,
analyzed: dīpe eka vāram puthujjana bhikkhu nāma na ahosi paṭipatti pūrakā api kadāci bahū honti
translated: and there was never a time when there was no ordinary man bhikkhu in the island. And sometimes there are many who fulfil the practice,

original: kadāci appā, iti paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hotipi na hotipi. Sāsanaṭṭhitiyā pana
analyzed: kadāci iti paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hoti pi na hoti pi sāsana ṭṭhitiyā pana
translated: sometimes few. So penetration and practice are sometimes and are not always. But as regards the duration of the Dispensation,

original: pariyattiyeva pamāṇaṃ. Paṇḍito hi tepiṭakaṃ sutvā dvepi pūreti. Yathā amhākaṃ bodhisatto
analyzed: pariyattiyā iva pamāṇam paṇḍitaḥ hi tepiṭakam sutvā dve api pūreti yathā amhākam bodhisatto
translated: it is the learning that is the criterion. For the wise man, having learned the three Piṭakas, fulfils both. As our Bodhisatta,

original: āḷārassa santike pañcābhiññā satta ca samāpattiyo nibbattetvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā🔽parikammaṃ pucchi, so “na jānāmī”ti āha, tato udakassa santikaṃ gantvā adhigatavisesaṃ
analyzed: āḷārassa santike pañca abhiññā satta ca samāpattiyaḥ nibbattetvā nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana samāpattiyā  parikammam pucchi saḥ na jānāmi iti āha tatas udakassa santikam gantvā adhigata visesam
translated: after producing the five kinds of supernormal knowledge and the seven kinds of concentration in the presence of Āḷāra, asked about the preliminary work for the attainment of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception,🔽and when Āḷāra said, “I do not know,” he went to Uddaka and,

original: saṃsanditvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammaṃ pucchi, so ācikkhi, tassa vacanasamanantarameva
analyzed: saṃsanditvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammam pucchi so ācikkhi tassa vacana samanantaram eva
translated: after telling him of the distinction he had himself attained, asked about the preliminary work for the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception. Uddaka explained it to him, and as soon as he heard it,

original: mahāsatto taṃ sampādesi, evameva paññavā bhikkhu pariyattiṃ sutvā dvepi pūreti, tasmā
analyzed: mahāsatto tam sampādesi evam eva paññavā bhikkhu pariyattim sutvā dve api pūreti tasmā
translated: the Great Man accomplished it. So too, a wise bhikkhu, having heard the learning, fulfils both. Therefore

original: pariyattiyā ṭhitāya sāsanaṃ ṭhitaṃ hoti. Yathāpi mahato taḷākassa pāḷiyā thirāya
analyzed: pariyattiyā ṭhitāya sāsanam ṭhitam hoti yathā api mahataḥ taḷākassa pāḷiyā thirāya
translated: the Dispensation is established as long as the learning is established. Just as when the embankment of a great reservoir is intact,

original: udakaṃ na ṭhassatīti na vattabbaṃ, udake sati padumādīni pupphāni na pupphissantīti🔽na vattabbaṃ, evameva mahātaḷākassa thirapāḷisadise tepiṭake buddhavacane sati mahātaḷāke🔽udakasadisā paṭipattipūrakā kulaputtā natthīti na vattabbaṃ, tesu sati mahātaḷāke
analyzed: udakam na ṭhassati iti na vattabbam udake sati paduma ādīni pupphāni na pupphissanti iti  na vattabbam evam eva mahā taḷākassa thira pāḷi sadise tepiṭake buddha vacane sati mahā taḷāke  udaka sadisā paṭipatti pūrakā kula puttā natthi iti na vattabbam tesu sati mahā taḷāke
translated: and when there is water, it cannot be said that “the lotuses and so on will not flower.”🔽So too, when the Tipiṭaka, the Buddha’s word, is intact like the firm banks of the great lake, it cannot be said that “there are no clansmen fulfilling the practice” in the great lake,

original: padumādīni pupphāni viya sotāpannādayo ariyapuggalā natthīti na vattabbaṃ. Evaṃ ekantato
analyzed: paduma ādīni pupphāni viya sotāpanna ādayaḥ ariya puggalāḥ natthi iti na vattabbam evam ekantato
translated: and when they are there, it cannot be said that “there are no noble persons such as stream-enterers” like the lotuses and so on in the great lake. Thus,

original: pariyattiyeva pamāṇaṃ.🔽Pariyattiyā antarahitāyāti ettha pariyattīti tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ sāṭṭhakathā
analyzed: pariyattiyā iva pamāṇam  pariyattiyā antarahitāya ati ettha pariyattī iti tepiṭakam buddha vacanam sā aṭṭhakathā
translated: the mere texts are the sole criterion.🔽When the texts have disappeared: here the texts are the Buddha’s word in the three Piṭakas with the seven paracanonical works, the Pāli with the commentaries.

original: pāḷi. Yāva sā tiṭṭhati, tāva pariyatti paripuṇṇā nāma hoti. Gacchante gacchante kāle
analyzed: yāva sā tiṭṭhati tāva pariyatti paripuṇṇā nāma hoti gacchante gacchante kāle
translated: As long as they last, the texts are complete. As time goes on,

original: kaliyugarājāno adhammikā honti, tesu adhammikesu tesampi amaccādayo adhammikā honti,
analyzed: kali yuga rājānaḥ adhammikāḥ honti tesu adhammikesu tesam pi amacca ādayaḥ adhammikāḥ honti
translated: the kings of the Kali age become unrighteous, and when they are unrighteous, their ministers and so on become unrighteous too,

original: tato raṭṭhajanapadavāsinoti tesaṃ adhammikatāya na devo sammā vassati, tato sassāni🔽na sampajjanti, tesu asampajjantesu paccayadāyakā bhikkhusaṅghassa paccaye dātuṃ
analyzed: tatas raṭṭha janapada vāsino ti tesam adhammika tāya na devaḥ sammā vassati tatas sassāni  na sampajjanti tesu a sampajjantesu paccaya dāyakāḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa paccaye dātuṃ
translated: Then the people of the country and the provinces, because of their unrighteousness, do not get rain from the right source, and then the crops

original: na sakkonti, bhikkhū paccayehi kilamantā antevāsike saṅgahetuṃ na sakkonti. Gacchante🔽gacchante kāle pariyatti parihāyati, atthavasena dhāretuṃ na sakkonti, pāḷivaseneva
analyzed: na sakkonti bhikkhū paccayehi kilamantāḥ antevāsike saṅgahetum na sakkonti gacchante  gacchante kāle attha vasena dhāretum na sakkonti pāḷi vasena iva
translated: do not succeed. When these do not succeed, the givers of requisites are unable to give requisites to the Community of Bhikkhus, and the bhikkhus, being short of requisites, are unable to look after their pupils. As time goes on

original: dhārenti. Tato kāle gacchante pāḷimpi sakalaṃ dhāretuṃ na sakkonti, paṭhamaṃ abhidhammapiṭakaṃ
analyzed: dhārenti tatas kāle gacchante pāḷimpi sakalam dhāretum na sakkonti paṭhamam abhidhamma piṭakam
translated: the texts are lost, and they are unable to remember them by their meaning, they remember them only by the letter. Then as time goes on they are unable to remember the texts in their entirety, and first the Abhidhamma Piṭaka is lost. For it is lost from the top downwards.

original: parihāyati, parihāyamānaṃ matthakato paṭṭhāya parihāyati. Paṭhamameva hi mahāpakaraṇaṃ
analyzed: parihāyati parihāyamānam matthakato paṭṭhāya parihāyati paṭhamam eva hi mahā apakaraṇam
translated: For the first of the great works,

original: parihāyati, tasmiṃ parihīne yamakaṃ, kathāvatthu, puggalapaññatti, dhātukathā, vibhaṅgo, dhammasaṅgahoti.
analyzed: parihāyati tasmin parihīne yamakam kathā vatthu puggala paññatti dhātu kathā vibhaṅgaḥ dhamma saṅgahaḥ ti
translated: the Dhammasangani, is lost, and when that is lost the Yamaka, the Kathāvatthu, the Puggalapaññatti, the Dhātukathā, the Vibhaṅga, and the Dhamma Saṅgaṇi are lost.

original: Evaṃ abhidhammapiṭake parihīne matthakato paṭṭhāya suttantapiṭakaṃ parihāyati. Paṭhamañhi
analyzed: evam abhidhamma piṭake parihīne matthakataḥ paṭṭhāya suttanta piṭakam parihāyati paṭhamam hi
translated: When the Abhidhamma Piṭaka has thus disappeared, the Sutta Piṭaka begins to disappear, starting from the end. For the first

original: aṅguttaranikāyo parihāyati, tasmimpi paṭhamaṃ ekādasakanipāto…pe… tato ekakanipātoti.
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāyo tasmin pi paṭhamam tatas
translated: to disappear is the Numerical Division. In it the first to disappear is the Elevens Section, … the Ones Section.

original: Evaṃ aṅguttaranikāye parihīne matthakato paṭṭhāya saṃyuttanikāyo parihāyati. Paṭhamañhi
analyzed: evam aṅguttara nikāye parihīne matthakato paṭṭhāya saṃyutta nikāyo parihāyati paṭhamam hi
translated: When the Numerical Division has thus disappeared, the Connected Division begins to disappear, starting from the end. For the first

original: mahāvaggo parihāyati, tato saḷāyatanavaggo, khandhakavaggo, nidānavaggo, sagāthāvaggoti.
analyzed: mahā vaggo parihāyati tatas saḷāyatana vaggo khandhaka vaggo nidāna vaggo sagāthā vaggo ti
translated: to disappear is the Great Chapter, then the Six Sense-Bases Chapter, the Aggregates Chapter, the Source Chapter, the Verses Chapter.

original: Evaṃ saṃyuttanikāye parihīne matthakato paṭṭhāya majjhimanikāyo parihāyati. Paṭhamañhi
analyzed: evam saṃyutta nikāye parihīne matthakataḥ paṭṭhāya majjhima nikāyaḥ parihāyati paṭhamam hi
translated: When the Connected Division has thus disappeared, the Middle Division begins to disappear, starting from the end. For the first

original: uparipaṇṇāsako parihāyati, tato majjhimapaṇṇāsako, tato mūlapaṇṇāsakoti. Evaṃ majjhimanikāye
analyzed: upari paṇṇāsako parihāyati tatas majjhima paṇṇāsako tatas mūla paṇṇāsako ti evam majjhima nikāye
translated: to disappear is the Fifty, then the Middle Fifty, then the Beginning Fifty. When the Middle Division has thus disappeared,🔽the Long Division begins to disappear, starting from the end. For the first

original: parihīne matthakato paṭṭhāya dīghanikāyo parihāyati. Paṭhamañhi pāthikavaggo parihāyati,
analyzed: parihīne matthakataḥ paṭṭhāya dīgha nikāyo parihāyati paṭhamam hi pāthika vaggo parihāyati
translated: to disappear is the Pāṭika Vagga,

original: tato mahāvaggo, tato sīlakkhandhavaggoti. Evaṃ dīghanikāye parihīne suttantapiṭakaṃ
analyzed: tatas mahā vaggo tatas sīlakkhandha vaggo ti evam dīgha nikāye parihīne suttanta piṭakam
translated: Thus when the Long Division is lost, the Collection of Discourses is lost.

original: parihīnaṃ nāma hoti. Vinayapiṭakena saddhiṃ jātakameva dhārenti. Vinayapiṭakañhi🔽lajjino dhārenti, lābhakāmā pana “suttante kathitepi sallakkhentā natthī”ti jātakameva
analyzed: parihīnam nāma hoti vinaya piṭakena saddhim jātakam eva dhārenti vinaya piṭakam hi  lajjinaḥ dhārenti lābha kāmā pana suttante kathite pi sallakkhentā natthi iti jātakam eva
translated: They preserve only the Jātaka together with the Vinaya Piṭaka.🔽For the modest preserve the Vinaya Piṭaka, but those who are greedy for gain preserve the Jātaka, saying, “There is nothing to be seen in the discourses when they are recited.”

original: dhārenti. Gacchante kāle jātakampi dhāretuṃ na sakkonti. Atha nesaṃ paṭhamaṃ vessantarajātakaṃ
analyzed: dhārenti gacchante kāle jātakam pi dhāretum na sakkonti atha nesam paṭhamam vessantara jātakam
translated: As time goes on, they are unable to preserve the Jātaka. Then the Vessantara Jātaka

original: parihāyati, tato paṭilomakkamena puṇṇakajātakaṃ, mahānāradajātakanti pariyosāne apaṇṇakajātakaṃ
analyzed: parihāyati tatas paṭiloma kkamena puṇṇaka jātakam mahānārada jātakanti pariyosāne apaṇṇaka jātakam
translated: is lost first, then the Puṇṇaka Jātaka, the Mahānārada Jātaka, and finally the Apaṇṇaka Jātaka.

original: parihāyati, vinayapiṭakameva dhārenti.
analyzed: vinaya piṭakam eva
translated: They preserve only the Vinaya Piṭaka.

original: Gacchante kāle tampi matthakato paṭṭhāya parihāyati. Paṭhamañhi parivāro parihāyati,
analyzed: gacchante kāle matthakato paṭṭhāya parihāyati paṭhamañhi parivāro parihāyati
translated: As time goes on, that too is lost beginning from the end. For the First Section is lost first,

original: tato khandhako, bhikkhunīvibhaṅgo, mahāvibhaṅgoti anukkamena uposathakkhandhakamattameva
analyzed: tatas khandhakaḥ bhikkhunī vibhaṅgaḥ mahā vibhaṅgaḥ ti anukkamena uposatha khandhaka mattam eva
translated: then the Khandhaka, the Bhikkhunī Vibhaṅga, the Mahā Vibhaṅga—in due order—and finally only the Uposatha Khandhaka remains.

original: dhārenti. Tadāpi pariyatti anantarahitāva hoti. Yāva pana manussesu catuppadikagāthāpi🔽pavattati, tāva pariyatti anantarahitāva hoti. Yadā saddho pasanno rājā hatthikkhandhe🔽suvaṇṇacaṅkoṭakamhi sahassatthavikaṃ ṭhapāpetvā “buddhehi kathitaṃ catuppadikaṃ gāthaṃ
analyzed: dhārenti tadā api pariyatti anantarahitā ava hoti yāva pana manussesu catuppadika gāthā api  pavattati tāva hoti yadā saddhaḥ pasannaḥ rājā hatthikkhandhe  suvaṇṇacaṅkoṭakamhi sahassa tthavikam ṭhapāpetvā buddhehi kathitam catuppadikam gātham
translated: But as long as even a four-line verse of the tradition is current among human beings, the tradition is not interrupted.

original: jānanto imaṃ sahassaṃ gaṇhatū”ti nagare bheriṃ carāpetvā gaṇhanakaṃ alabhitvā “ekavāraṃ
analyzed: jānantaḥ imam sahassam gaṇhatu iti nagare bherim carāpetvā gaṇhanakam a labhitvā eka vāram
translated: But when a faithful, confident king has a thousand coins placed in a golden casket on the back of an elephant and has a proclamation made in the town with the beating of drums, “Whoever knows a four-line verse spoken by the Enlightened One may take this thousand,” and when no one claims it,

original: carāpite nāmaṃ suṇantāpi honti asuṇantāpī”ti yāvatatiyaṃ carāpetvā gaṇhanakaṃ alabhitvā
analyzed: cara apite nāmam suṇantā api honti a suṇantā api iti yāvatatiyam gaṇhanakam a labhitvā
translated: and he has it proclaimed a second and a third time, and still no one claims it,

original: rājapurisā sahassatthavikaṃ puna rājakulaṃ pavesenti, tadā pariyatti antarahitā nāma hoti.
analyzed: rāja purisā sahassatthavikam punar rājakulam pavesenti tadā pariyatti antarahitā nāma hoti
translated: and the king’s men take the thousand coins back to the royal compound, then the tradition is said to be interrupted.

original: Ciraṃ pavattissatīti pariyattiyā antarahitāyapi liṅgamattaṃ addhānaṃ pavattissati.
analyzed: ciram pavattissati iti pariyattiyā antarahitāya api liṅga mattam addhānam pavattissati
translated: It will last long: even though the tradition is interrupted, the mere sign will last for a long time.

original: Kathaṃ? Gacchante gacchante hi kāle cīvaraggahaṇaṃ pattaggahaṇaṃ samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ
analyzed: katham gacchante gacchante hi kāle cīvara ggahaṇam patta ggahaṇam samiñjana pasāraṇam
translated: How? As time goes on, the wearing of robes, the carrying of bowls, the flexing and extending of limbs,

original: ālokitavilokitaṃ na pāsādikaṃ hoti, nigaṇṭhasamaṇā viya alābupattaṃ bhikkhū pattaṃ
analyzed: ālokita vilokitam na pāsādikam hoti nigaṇṭha samaṇāḥ viya alābu pattam bhikkhū pattam
translated: The monks’ bowls are not beautiful to look at when they are being carried, like the bowls of the Niganthas, like gourds.

original: aggabāhāya parikkhipitvā ādāya vicaranti, ettāvatāpi liṅgaṃ anantarahitameva hoti.
analyzed: agga bāhāya parikkhipitvā ādāya vicaranti ettāvatā api liṅgam anantara hitam eva hoti
translated: The monks carry them, having put the straps over the upper arms. The sign is not yet lost.

original: Gacchante pana kāle aggabāhato otāretvā hatthena vā sikkāya vā olambetvā vicaranti,🔽cīvarampi rajanasāruppaṃ akatvā oṭṭhaṭṭhivaṇṇaṃ katvā rajanti. Gacchante kāle rajanampi🔽na hoti, dasacchindanaṃ ovaṭṭikāvijjhanaṃ kappamattañca katvā vaḷañjanti, puna ovaṭṭikaṃ
analyzed: gacchante pana kāle agga bāhato otāretvā hatthena vā sikkāya vā olambetvā vicaranti  cīvaram pi rajana sāruppam a katvā oṭṭhaṭṭhivaṇṇam katvā rajanti gacchante kāle rajanam pi  na hoti dasa chindanam ovaṭṭikā vijjhanam kappa mattam ca katvā vaḷañjanti punar ovaṭṭikam
translated: But later on they take them down from their upper arms and carry them, hanging them from their hands or from their shoulders.🔽And the robes are not dyed in the right way. They are dyed the colour of a ripe palmyra fruit. Later on🔽there is no dye at all. They cut the cloth into strips, they cut the strips crosswise, they make a patchwork of the pieces, and they sew them together.

original: vijjhitvā kappaṃ na karonti. Tato ubhayampi akatvā dasā chetvā paribbājakā viya caranti.
analyzed: vijjhitvā kappam na karonti tatas ubhayam pi a katvā dasā chetvā paribbājakāḥ viya caranti
translated: Then they do not cut the strips crosswise. Then they do not make a patchwork. They cut the cloth into strips and carry it about like the wanderers of other sects.

original: Gacchante kāle “ko iminā amhākaṃ attho”ti khuddakaṃ kāsāvakhaṇḍaṃ hatthe vā gīvāyaṃ
analyzed: gacchante kāle kaḥ iminā amhākam atthaḥ ti khuddakam kāsāva khaṇḍam hatthe vā
translated: Later on they think, “What is the point of this to us?” They tie a small piece of yellow cloth to their hands or their necks

original: vā bandhanti, kesesu vā allīyāpenti, dārabharaṇaṃ karontā kasitvā vapitvā jīvikaṃ
analyzed: vā bandhanti kesesu vā dāra bharaṇam karontā kasitvā vapitvā jīvikam
translated: or they stick it in their hair. They make a show of being ascetics, and they live by ploughing and sowing.

original: kappetvā vicaranti, tadā dakkhiṇaṃ dento jano saṅghaṃ uddissa etesampi deti. Idaṃ🔽sandhāya bhagavatā vuttaṃ “bhavissanti kho panānanda, anāgatamaddhānaṃ gotrabhuno🔽kāsāvakaṇṭhā dussīlā pāpadhammā, tesu dussīlesu saṅghaṃ uddissa dānaṃ dassanti, tadāpāhaṃ,
analyzed: kappetvā vicaranti tadā dakkhiṇam dentaḥ janaḥ saṅgham uddissa etesam pi deti idam  sandhāya bhagavatā vuttam bhavissanti kho pana ānanda anāgatam addhānam gotrabhunaḥ  kāsā avakaṇṭhā dussīlā pāpa dhammā tesu dussīlesu saṅgham uddissa dānam dassanti tadāpāham
translated: and they went about in the guise of monks. Then people giving gifts dedicated them to the Community.

original: ānanda, saṅghagataṃ dakkhiṇaṃ asaṅkhyeyyaṃ appameyyaṃ vadāmī”ti. Tato gacchante kāle🔽nānāvidhāni kammāni karontā “papañco esa, kiṃ iminā amhāka”nti kāsāvakhaṇḍaṃ chinditvā🔽araññe khipanti, tasmiṃ kāle liṅgaṃ antarahitaṃ nāma hoti. Kassapadasabalassa kira
analyzed: ānanda saṅgha gatam dakkhiṇam asaṅkhyeyyam appameyyam vadāmi iti tatas gacchante kāle  nānāvidhāni kammāni karontā kim iminā amhākam chinditvā  araññe khipanti tasmin kāle liṅgam antarahitam nāma hoti kassapadasabalassa kira
translated: With reference to this the Blessed One said: “There will be, Ānanda, in the future, clansmen who are degenerate, unvirtuous, of evil character. They will give gifts dedicated to the Community of monks. Then, Ānanda, I declare that the gift dedicated to the Community of monks is incalculable, immeasurable” .🔽Then, as time went on, they did various kinds of work, saying, “This is a nuisance. What is the use of this to us?” They cut off the pieces of the yellow cloth and threw them away in the forest. At that time the sign was called “disappeared.”

original: kālato paṭṭhāya yonakānaṃ setavatthāni pārupitvā caraṇacārittaṃ jātaṃ. Evaṃ pariyattiyā
analyzed: kālatas paṭṭhāya yonakānam setavatthāni pārupitvā caraṇa cārittam jātam evam pariyattiyā
translated: From the time of Kassapa, the Leader of the world, it seems, the yakkhas have worn white garments and have gone about doing the duties of monks.

original: antarahitāyapi liṅgamattaṃ ciraṃ pavattissatīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: liṅgam attam ciram pavattissati iti veditabbam
translated: So it should be understood that even when the scriptures have disappeared the mere sign will continue for a long time.

original: Aṭṭhagarudhammakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭha garu dhamma kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Eight Great Standards is ended.

original: Bhikkhunīupasampannānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhikkhunī upasampanna anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on the nuns’ full admission.🔽On the very day: on the very day on which he did so.🔽On that very day: on that very day.

original: 404-405. Yadaggenāti yaṃ divasaṃ ādiṃ katvā. Tadevāti tasmiññeva divase. Anuññattiyāti
analyzed: yat aggena ati yam divasam ādim katvā tat eva ati tasmin ñeva divase anuññattiyā ati
translated: With the permission: with the permission.

original: anuññāya. Ekāhaṃ, bhante ānanda, bhagavantaṃ varaṃ yācāmīti “evameva kho ahaṃ, bhante
analyzed: anuññāya ekāham bhante ānanda bhagavantam varam yācāmi iti evam eva kho aham bhante
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, I ask the Blessed One for a favor: that I be allowed to observe the eight important rules for life.”

original: ānanda, ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇhāmi yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīye”ti paṭijānitvā🔽idāni kasmā varaṃ yācatīti ce? Parūpavādavivajjanatthaṃ. Evañhi keci vadeyyuṃ “mahāpajāpatiyā
analyzed: ānanda ime aṭṭha garu dhamme paṭiggaṇhāmi yāvajīvam an atikkamanīyā iti paṭijānitvā  idāni kasmai varam yācati iti ce evam hi keci vadeyyum mahāpajāpatiyā
translated: “So be it, venerable Ānanda, I accept these eight important rules for life, not to be transgressed as long as I live.”🔽If it be asked: why does she ask for a favor?

original: paṭhamaṃ sampaṭicchitattā bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīnañca yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ nāhosi,
analyzed: paṭhamam sampaṭicchita ttā bhikkhūnam bhikkhunīnam ca yathāvuḍḍham abhivādanam na ahosi
translated: In order to avoid the imputation of favoritism. For some might say: “Since Mahāpajāpatī was the first to accept the eight important rules for life, the nuns and monks did not salute her according to seniority.

original: sā ce varaṃ yāceyya, bhagavā anujāneyyā”ti.
analyzed: sā ced varam yāceyya bhagavān anujāneyya ati
translated: If she had asked for a favor, the Blessed One would have allowed it.”🔽With passion: for the sake of passion, for the sake of the increase of passion for sensual desires and passion for becoming.

original: 406. Sarāgāyāti sarāgabhāvāya kāmarāgabhavarāgaparibrūhanāya. Saññogāyāti vaṭṭe saṃyojanatthāya.
analyzed: sa rāgāya ati sa rāga bhāvāya kāma rāga bhava rāga paribrūhanāya saññogāya ati vaṭṭe saṃyojana tthāya
translated: With attachment: for the sake of bondage in the round of rebirths.

original: Ācayāyāti vaṭṭassa vaḍḍhanatthāya. Mahicchatāyāti mahicchabhāvāya. Asantuṭṭhiyāti
analyzed: ācayāya ati vaṭṭassa vaḍḍhana atthāya mahiccha tāya ati mahiccha bhāvāya a santuṭṭhiya ati
translated: With hoarding: for the sake of the increase of the round of rebirths. With great desires: for the sake of great desires. With discontent: for the sake of discontent.

original: asantuṭṭhibhāvāya. Saṅgaṇikāyāti kilesasaṅgaṇagaṇasaṅgaṇavihārāya. Kosajjāyāti kusītabhāvāya.
analyzed: asantuṭṭhi bhāvāya saṅgaṇikāya ati kilesa saṅgaṇa gaṇa saṅgaṇa vihārāya kosajjāya ati kusīta bhāvāya
translated: for the state of discontent. For the sake of society: for the sake of living in society with defilements and with society of people. For the sake of laziness: for the sake of the state of laziness.

original: Dubbharatāyāti dupposatāya. Virāgāyāti sakalavaṭṭato virajjanatthāya. Visaññogāyāti
analyzed: dubbhara tāya ati dupposa tāya virāgāya ati sakala vaṭṭataḥ virajjana tthāya visaññogāya ati
translated: For the sake of difficulty in keeping: for the sake of difficulty in nourishing. For the sake of fading away: for the sake of fading away from the whole round of suffering. For the sake of dispassion:

original: kāmarāgādīhi visaṃyujjanatthāya. Apacayāyāti sabbassapi vaṭṭassa apacayatthāya, nibbānāyāti🔽attho. Appicchatāyāti paccayappicchatādivasena sabbaso icchāpagamāya. Santuṭṭhiyāti
analyzed: kāma rāga ādīhi visaṃyujjana tthāya apacayāya ati sabbassa api vaṭṭassa apacaya tthāya nibbānāya ati  atthaḥ appiccha tāya āti paccaya ppiccha tā ādi vasena sabbaso icchā apagamāya santuṭṭhiya iti
translated: for the sake of dispassion from sensual desire, etc. For the sake of giving up: for the sake of giving up the whole round of suffering. For the sake of extinction:🔽this is the meaning. For the sake of fewness of wishes: for the sake of the complete absence of wishes in the form of fewness of wishes for requisites, etc. For the sake of contentment:

original: dvādasavidhasantuṭṭhibhāvāya. Pavivekāyāti pavivittabhāvāya kāyavivekāditadaṅgavivekādivivekasiddhiyā.
analyzed: dvādasavidha santuṭṭhi bhāvāya pa vivekāya ati pa vivitta bhāvāya kāya viveka ādi tad aṅga viveka ādi viveka siddhiyā
translated: for the state of the twelvefold contentment. For the sake of seclusion: for the sake of the state of seclusion, for the sake of the success of the seclusion consisting in bodily seclusion, etc., and of the seclusion consisting in the abandoning of defilements, etc.

original: Vīriyārambhāyāti kāyikassa ceva cetasikassa ca vīriyassa paggaṇhanatthāya. Subharatāyāti
analyzed: vīriya ārambhāya ati kāyikassa ca iva cetasikassa ca vīriyassa paggaṇhana atthāya subhara tāya ati
translated: For the sake of the arousing of energy: for the sake of the exertion of bodily and mental energy. For the sake of easy maintenance:

original: sukhaposanatthāya. Evaṃ yo pariyattidhammo uggahaṇadhāraṇaparipucchāmanasikāravasena
analyzed: sukha posana tthāya evam yaḥ pariyatti dhammo uggahaṇa dhāraṇa paripucchā manasikāra vasena
translated: for the sake of easy support. So the text is stated in this way for the sake of the profitable states consisting in learning, remembering, questioning, and attention,

original: yoniso paṭipajjantassa sarāgādibhāvaparivajjanassa kāraṇaṃ hutvā virāgādibhāvāya
analyzed: yonisaḥ paṭipajjantassa sa rāga ādi bhāva parivajjanassa kāraṇam hutvā virāga ādi bhāvāya
translated: It is the cause for one who practices wisely of avoiding the state of being with lust, etc., and it leads to the state of being without lust, etc.

original: saṃvattati, ekaṃsato eso dhammo, eso vinayo sammadeva apāyādīsu apatanavasena dhāraṇato
analyzed: saṃvattati ekaṃsataḥ esaḥ dhammaḥ esaḥ vinayo sammat eva apāya ādīsu apatana vasena dhāraṇato
translated: This is the one-sidedness of this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: kilesānaṃ vinayanato, satthu sammāsambuddhassa ovādānusiṭṭhibhāvato etaṃ satthusāsananti
analyzed: kilesānam vinayanataḥ satthu sammāsambuddhassa ovāda anusiṭṭhi bhāvataḥ etam satthu sāsanam ti
translated: This is the Teacher’s Dispensation in the sense of bearing in mind, in the sense of subduing defilements, and in the sense of being the Teacher’s advice as a Fully Enlightened One.🔽You should bear it in mind, you should know it, you should understand it—this is the meaning.

original: dhāreyyāsi jāneyyāsi, avabujjheyyāsīti attho. Imasmiṃ sutte paṭhamavārena vaṭṭaṃ,
analyzed: dhāreyyāsi jāneyyāsi avabujjheyyāsi iti attho imasmin sutte paṭhama vārena vaṭṭam
translated: In this sutta the first section deals with the round,

original: dutiyavārena vivaṭṭaṃ kathitaṃ.
analyzed: dutiya vārena vivaṭṭam kathitam
translated: and the second with the cessation of the round.

original: 409-410. Vimānetvāti aparajjhitvā. Kammappattāyopīti kammārahāpi. Āpattigāminiyopīti
analyzed: vimānetvā ati aparajjhitvā kamma ppattāya api iti kamma ārahā api āpatti gāminiyaḥ api iti
translated: Having disregarded: having rejected. Even though they are fit for the action: even though they are worthy of the action. Even though they are liable to offence:

original: āpattiāpannāyopi. Vuttanayeneva kāretabbataṃ āpajjantīti tathākaraṇassa paṭikkhittattā
analyzed: āpatti āpannāya api vutta nayena iva kāretabba tam āpajjanti iti tathā karaṇassa paṭikkhitta ttā
translated: even though they have committed an offence. They come to be dealt with in the way stated: because the carrying out of that is prohibited,

original: dukkaṭena kāretabbataṃ āpajjanti.
analyzed: dukkaṭena kāretabbatam āpajjanti
translated: they come to be dealt with by a wrong-doing offence.

original: 413-5. Dve tisso bhikkhuniyoti dvīhi tīhi bhikkhunīhi. Na ārocentīti pātimokkhuddesakassa na ārocenti. Na paccāharantīti bhikkhunīnaṃ na paccāharanti. Visesakanti vattabhaṅgaṃ.
analyzed: dve tissaḥ bhikkhuniyo ti dvīhi tīhi bhikkhunīhi na ārocenti iti pātimokkhuddesakassa na ārocenti na paccāharanti iti bhikkhunīnam na paccāharanti visesakam ti vattabhaṅgam
translated: Two or three nuns: two or three nuns. They do not inform: they do not inform the reciter of the Monastic Code. They do not announce: they do not announce to the nuns. The one who is in charge: the one who has the authority.

original: 420. Tena ca bhikkhu nimantetabboti sāmīcidassanametaṃ, na pana animantiyā āpatti.
analyzed: tena ca bhikkhu nimantetabbaḥ ti sāmīci dassanam etam na pana a nimantiyāḥ āpatti
translated: And the monk should be invited: this is a rule for the purpose of seeing, but there is no offense if he is not invited.

original: 425. Tayo nissayeti senāsananissayaṃ apanetvā apare tayo nissaye. Rukkhamūlasenāsanañhi sā na labhati.
analyzed: tayaḥ nissayā iti senāsana nissayam apanetvā apare tayaḥ nissaye rukkha mūla senāsanam hi sā na labhati
translated: The three kinds of formal supports: except for the formal support of a dwelling, the other three kinds of formal support. For she is not allowed to use a dwelling at the foot of a tree.

original: 428. Anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapentīti issariyaṃ pavattenti.
analyzed: anuvādam paṭṭhapenti iti issariyam pavattenti
translated: They make a complaint: they exercise authority.

original: 430. Bhikkhudūtena upasampādentīti bhikkhuyeva dūto bhikkhudūto, tena bhikkhudūtena, bhikkhudūtaṃ katvā upasampādentīti attho.
analyzed: bhikkhu dūtena upasampādenti iti bhikkhuyā iva dūtaḥ bhikkhu dūto tena bhikkhu dūtena bhikkhu dūtam katvā upasampādenti iti attho
translated: They give the full admission by means of a monk messenger: a monk is a messenger, thus a monk messenger. The meaning is: they give the full admission by means of a monk messenger.

original: 431. Na sammatīti nappahoti. Navakammanti navakammaṃ katvā “ettakāni vassāni vasatū”ti apaloketvā saṅghikabhūmidānaṃ.
analyzed: na na na pahoti nava kammanti nava kammam katvā ettakāni vassāni vasatu iti apaloketvā saṅghika bhūmi dānam
translated: She is not capable: she is not able. Building work: after building work has been done, they give a gift of a dwelling place belonging to the Sangha, after getting permission, saying, “Live here for so many years.”

original: 432. Sannisinnagabbhāti patiṭṭhitagabbhā.
analyzed: sannisinna gabbhā ati patiṭṭhita gabbhā
translated: Pregnant: she has a fetus.

original: 434. Pabbajjampi na labhatīti titthāyatanasaṅkantāya abhabbabhāvūpagamanato na labhati.
analyzed: pabbajjam pi na labhati iti tittha āyatana saṅkantāya abhabba bhāva upagamanataḥ na labhati
translated: He does not get the going forth: he does not get it because he has gone over to the sectarians and so is incapable.

original: Idaṃ odissa anuññātaṃ vaṭṭatīti ekato vā ubhato vā avassave satipi odissa anuññātattā
analyzed: idam odissa anuññātam vaṭṭati iti ekatas vā ubhatas vā avassave sati pi odissa anuññāta ttā
translated: It is allowable if it is allowed for a specific purpose: if there is a breach on one or both sides, it is allowable because it is allowed for a specific purpose.

original: vaṭṭati. Sesamettha pāḷito aṭṭhakathāto ca suviññeyyamevāti.
analyzed: vaṭṭati sesam ettha pāḷitaḥ aṭṭhakathātaḥ ca su viññeyyam evā ti
translated: The rest here can be understood from the texts and the commentary.

original: Bhikkhunīupasampannānujānanakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhikkhunī upasampanna anujānana kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the discussion of the allowance of full ordination for nuns is finished.

original: Bhikkhunikkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhikkhunikkhandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the chapter on nuns is finished.

original: 11. Pañcasatikakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: pañcasatika khandhakam
translated: The chapter on five hundred nuns

original: Saṅgītinidānakathāvaṇṇanā🔽437. Pañcasatikakkhandhake pāvāya kusināranti pāvānagare piṇḍāya caritvā kusināraṃ
analyzed: saṅgīti nidāna kathā vaṇṇanā  pañca satika khandhake pāvāya kusināranti pāvā nagare piṇḍāya caritvā kusināram
translated: The explanation of the introduction to the chapter on the recital🔽In the chapter on five hundred nuns, “At Pāvā, at Kusināra” means that after walking for alms in the town of Pāvā, he was on the main road going to Kusināra, thinking, “I will go to Kusināra.”

original: gamissāmīti addhānamaggappaṭipanno. Mandāravapupphaṃ gahetvāti mahācāṭippamāṇaṃ pupphaṃ
analyzed: gamissāmi iti addhāna magga ppaṭipannaḥ mandārava puppham gahetvā iti mahā cāṭippamāṇam puppham
translated: “Taking a coral-tree flower” means that he took a flower the size of a large fan

original: āgantukadaṇḍake ṭhapetvā chattaṃ viya gahetvā. Addasaṃ khoti āgacchantaṃ dūratova
analyzed: āgantuka daṇḍake ṭhapetvā chattam viya gahetvā addasam kho ti āgacchantam dūratas va
translated: and held it like an umbrella, placing it on the end of his walking stick. “I saw” means that he saw him coming from far away.

original: addasaṃ. Disvā ca pana “pucchissāmi naṃ bhagavato pavatti”nti cittaṃ uppādetvā “sace
analyzed: addasam disvā ca pana pucchissāmi nam bhagavato pavattin ti cittam uppādetvā sace
translated: I saw him. Having seen him, I thought: “I will ask him about the Lord’s affairs.”

original: kho pana nisinnakova pucchissāmi, satthari agāravo kato bhavissatī”ti uṭṭhahitvā🔽ṭhitaṭṭhānato apakkamma chaddanto nāgarājā maṇicammaṃ viya dasabaladattiyaṃ meghavaṇṇapaṃsukūlacīvaraṃ
analyzed: kho pana nisinnakaḥ uva pucchissāmi satthari agāravaḥ kataḥ bhavissati iti uṭṭhahitvā  ṭhita ṭṭhānataḥ a pakkamma chaddantaḥ nāga rājā maṇi cammam viya dasa baladattiyam megha vaṇṇa paṃsukūla cīvaram
translated: But if I were to ask him while sitting down, I would be showing disrespect to the Teacher.” So he got up🔽and, stepping back from the place where he was standing, Chaddanta the king of elephants, like a maṇi gem, put on the ten powers’ robe, which was the color of a rain cloud,

original: pārupitvā dasanakhasamodhānasamujjalaṃ añjaliṃ sirasmiṃ patiṭṭhāpetvā satthari katena

translated: If they are unable, they will say, “You get a contractor and we will provide the materials.”

original: Evaṃ vutte kāretvā tesaṃ ācikkhitabbaṃ, manussā vaḍḍhakīnaṃ dātabbaṃ dassanti. Sace🔽āvāsasāmikā natthi, aññesampi bhikkhācāravattena ārocetvā kāretuṃ vaṭṭati. Imaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: evam vutte kāretvā tesam ācikkhitabbam manussāḥ vaḍḍhakīnam dātabbam dassanti sace  āvāsa sāmikā natthi aññesam pi bhikkhā cāra vattena ārocetvā kāretum vaṭṭati imam sandhāya
translated: When this has been said, they should be told to have it done and to give it to the builders. If🔽there are no owners of the dwelling, it is allowable to have it done after informing others who go on alms round. This is what is meant by🔽

original: “pariyesitabba”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Dārūti senāsane gopānasiādīsu palujjamānesu tadatthāya dāru pariyesitabbaṃ. Sakaṭanti
analyzed: pariyesitabban ti vuttam  dāru iti senāsane gopānasi ādīsu palujjamānesu tad atthāya dāru pariyesitabbam sakaṭam ti
translated: When this has been said, they should be told to get them made and to give them to the builders. If there are no owners of the dwelling, it is allowable to get them made after informing others who go on alms round. It was with reference to this that it was said: “Should be sought for.”

original: gihivikaṭaṃ vā tāvakālikaṃ vā katvā sakaṭaṃ pariyesitabbaṃ. Na kevalañca sakaṭameva,🔽aññampi vāsipharasukudālādiupakaraṇaṃ evaṃ pariyesituṃ vaṭṭati. Purisoti hatthakammavasena🔽puriso pariyesitabbo. Yaṃ kañci hi purisaṃ “hatthakammaṃ āvuso dassasī”ti vatvā “dassāmi
analyzed: gihi vikaṭam vā tāvakālikam vā katvā sakaṭam pariyesitabbam na kevalam ca sakaṭam eva  aññam pi vā asi phara su kudāla ādi upakaraṇam evam pariyesitum vaṭṭati puriso ti hattha kamma vasena  purisaḥ pariyesitabbaḥ yam kañci hi purisam hattha kammam āvuso dassasi iti vatvā dassāmi
translated: Wood: if the dwelling is collapsing, wood should be sought for the purpose of propping it up. Cart: a cart should be sought, either one belonging to a layman or one that is temporary. And not only a cart,

original: bhante”ti vutte “imasmiṃ idañcidañca karohī”ti yaṃ icchati, taṃ kāretuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: bhante iti vutte imasmin idam ca idam ca karohi iti yam icchati tam kāretum vaṭṭati
translated: but also any implement such as a spade, basket, and so on, is allowable to seek in this way. Man: a man should be sought for the purpose of manual labour. For it is allowable to get any man to do whatever one wants done, after saying, “I will give you a wage,” and he has agreed, saying, “I will do it, venerable sir.”

original: Na tvevāhaṃ gāmaṇi kenaci pariyāyenāti jātarūparajataṃ panāhaṃ kenacipi kāraṇena
analyzed: na tu eva aham jātarūpa rajatam kāraṇena
translated: “But, headman, in no circumstances🔽can I allow gold and silver.”

original: pariyesitabbanti na vadāmi.
analyzed: pariyesitabbanti na vadāmi
translated: “But, headman, I do not say that gold and silver should be sought for by any means.”

original: 449. Pāpakaṃ katanti asundaraṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: pāpakam asundaram
translated: “Evil is done” means: ugly is done.

original: 450. Ahogaṅgoti tassa pabbatassa nāmaṃ.
analyzed: ahogaṅgā iti tassa pabbatassa nāmam
translated: “Ahoganga” is the name of a mountain.

original: 451. Paṭikacceva gaccheyyanti yattha taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ bhikkhū sannipatanti, tattha paṭhamameva gaccheyyaṃ. Sambhāvesunti pāpuṇiṃsu.
analyzed: paṭikaccā iva gaccheyyanti yattha tam adhikaraṇam vūpasametum bhikkhū sannipatanti tattha paṭhamam eva gaccheyyam sambhāvesunti pāpuṇiṃsu
translated: “I would go back” means: I would go first to the place where the bhikkhus have assembled to settle the legal question. “They honoured” means: they reached.

original: 452. Aloṇakaṃ bhavissatīti aloṇakaṃ bhattaṃ vā byañjanaṃ vā bhavissati. Āsutāti sabbasambhārasajjitā. “Asuttā”ti vā pāṭho.
analyzed: a loṇakam bhavissati iti a loṇakam bhattam vā byañjanam vā bhavissati āsutā ati sabba sambhāra sajjitā asuttā ati vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: “It will be without salt” means: the rice or the curry will be without salt. “Ready” means: all the requisites are prepared. “Ready” is also a reading.

original: 453. Ujjaviṃsūti nāvaṃ āruyha paṭisotena gacchiṃsu. Pācīnakāti pācīnadesavāsino.🔽454. Nanu tvaṃ āvuso vuḍḍho vīsativassosīti nanu tvaṃ āvuso vīsativasso, na nissayapaṭibaddho,
analyzed: ujjaviṃsu iti nāvam āruyha paṭisotena gacchiṃsu pācīnakāḥ ati pācīna desa vāsinaḥ  nanu tvam āvuso vuḍḍhaḥ vīsati vasso asi iti nanu tvam āvuso vīsati vassaḥ na nissaya paṭibaddhaḥ
translated: “They went upstream” means: they went upstream in a boat. “The easterners” means: the residents of the eastern country.

original: kasmā taṃ thero paṇāmetīti dīpenti. Garunissayaṃ gaṇhāmāti kiñcāpi mayaṃ mahallakā,
analyzed: kasmā tam thero paṇāmeti iti dīpenti garu nissayam gaṇhāma ati kiñcā api mayam mahallakā
translated: “But, friend, you are old, sixty or seventy years old. Why does the elder send you away?” They explain: “We will take a junior as our attendant.” Although we are old,

original: etaṃ pana theraṃ garuṃ katvā vasissāmāti adhippāyo.🔽455. Mettāya rūpāvacarasamādhimattabhāvato “kullakavihārenā”ti vuttaṃ, khuddakena
analyzed: etam pana theram garum katvā vasissāma ati adhippāyaḥ  mettāya rūpāvacara samādhi matta bhāvataḥ kullaka vihārena ati vuttam khuddakena
translated: The meaning is that they will live there out of respect for the elder.🔽Because of the limited extent of his concentration of the fine-material sphere, which is only the absorption of the first jhāna, it is said that he “lived in a small dwelling.”

original: vihārenāti attho, khuddakatā cassa agambhīrabhāvatoti āha “uttānavihārenā”ti. Suññatāvihārenāti
analyzed: vihārena ati attho khuddaka tā ca ssa agambhīra bhāvato ti āha uttāna vihārena ati suñña tā vihārena ati
translated: The meaning is that it was a small dwelling because it was not deep. He said “in a shallow dwelling” because it was shallow.

original: suññatāmukhena adhigataphalasamāpattiṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: suñña tā mukhena adhigata phala samāpattim sandhāya vuttam
translated: He said “in an empty dwelling” with reference to the attainment of fruition reached by means of the emptiness attainment.🔽The “Suttavibhaṅga” is the Padabhājaniya.

original: 457. Suttavibhaṅgeti padabhājanīye. Tena saddhinti purepaṭiggahitaloṇena saddhiṃ.🔽Na hi ettha yāvajīvikaṃ tadahupaṭiggahitanti “kappati siṅgiloṇakappo”ti ettha vuttasiṅgiloṇaṃ
analyzed: sutta vibhaṅge iti pada bhājanīye tena saddhim ti pure paṭiggahita loṇena saddhim  na hi ettha yāvajīvikam tad ahu paṭiggahitanti kappati siṅgiloṇa kappo ti ettha vutta siṅgiloṇam
translated: “Together with it”: together with the salt that had been received earlier.🔽For the salt mentioned in the passage “the use of salt in a horn is allowable” is not what is meant here by “received for life.”

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tañhi pure paṭiggahetvā siṅgena parihaṭaṃ na tadahupaṭiggahitaṃ.🔽Yāvakālikameva tadahupaṭiggahitanti siṅgiloṇena missetvā bhuñjitabbaṃ aloṇāmisaṃ

translated: For that salt is not received on that day, though it may have been received earlier and is kept in a horn.🔽The salt received for a limited period should be mixed with the salt received on that day and eaten. The food that is not salty

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Uposathasaṃyutteti uposathapaṭisaṃyutte, uposathakkhandhaketi vuttaṃ🔽hoti. Atisaraṇaṃ atisāro, atikkamo. Vinayassa atisāro vinayātisāro. Taṃ pamāṇaṃ karontassāti
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam uposatha saṃyutte iti uposatha paṭisaṃyutte uposatha khandhake iti vuttam  hoti atisaraṇam atisāraḥ atikkamaḥ vinayassa atisāraḥ vinaya atisāraḥ tam pamāṇam karontassa ati
translated: “In the context of the observance-day ceremony” means in the context of the observance-day procedure. “The observance-day section” is what is meant.

original: dasāya saddhiṃ nisīdane yaṃ pamāṇaṃ vuttaṃ, dasāya vinā taṃ pamāṇaṃ karontassa. Sesamettha suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: dasāya saddhim nisīdane yam pamāṇam vuttam dasāya vinā tam pamāṇam karontassa sesam ettha su viññeyyam eva
translated: “Transgression” is overstepping, overrunning. “Transgression of the Monastic Law” is a transgression of the Monastic Law. “If he makes that the standard”: if he makes the standard that is stated for sitting together with ten the standard for sitting together with less than ten. The rest is easy to understand.

original: Sattasatikakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Dvivaggasaṅgahāti cūḷavaggamahāvaggasaṅkhātehi dvīhi vaggehi saṅgahitā. Dvāvīsatipabhedanāti
analyzed: sattasatika khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  dvi vagga saṅgahā ati cūḷa vagga mahāvagga saṅkhātehi dvīhi vaggehi saṅgahitā dvāvīsati pabhedanā ati

original: mahāvagge dasa, cūḷavagge dvādasāti evaṃ dvāvīsatippabhedā. Sāsaneti satthusāsane.

original: Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ

original: 1. Pakatatthapaṭiniddeso ta-saddoti tassa “bhagavatā”tiādīhi padehi samānādhikaraṇabhāvena

analyzed: sāmañca buddha ttā sammāsambuddhena atha vā antarāyika dhamme jānatā niyyānika dhamme
