translated: The sections on offenses and the observance days, etc., are called “the analysis” because they are analyzed in the way beginning, “An offense entailing expulsion and an offense entailing suspension.”

original: vuttāni. Tevīsati saṅghādisesāti bhikkhunīnaṃ āgatāni dasa, bhikkhūnaṃ terasāti tevīsati.
analyzed: vuttāni tevīsati saṅgha ādisesā ati bhikkhunīnam āgatāni dasa bhikkhūnam terasā ati tevīsati
translated: “Twenty-three kinds of suspension” means the ten that apply to nuns and the thirteen that apply to monks.

original: Dvecattālīsa nissaggiyātiādīsupi eseva nayo. Dvīhi…pe… kiccaṃ ekena sammatīti dvīhi
analyzed: dvecattālīsa nissaggiya ati ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ dvīhipe kiccam ekena dvīhi
translated: The same method applies in the case of “forty-two kinds of relinquishment”, and so on. “Two, etc., are settled by one” means:

original: vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, catūhi anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, tīhi āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, ekena kiccādhikaraṇaṃ sammatīti attho.
analyzed: vivāda adhikaraṇam catūhi anuvāda adhikaraṇam tīhi āpatta adhikaraṇam ekena kicca adhikaraṇam sammatī iti
translated: two by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement; four by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements; three by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement; and one by a majority decision.

original: 339. Niraṅkatoti saṅghamhā apasārito.
analyzed: saṅghamhā apasāritaḥ
translated: “Expelled” means sent away from the Sangha.

original: Adhikaraṇabhedavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the analysis of legal issues

original: 340. Yasmā adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭento samathappattameva ukkoṭeti, tasmā “vivādādhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭento kati samathe ukkoṭetī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yasmai adhikaraṇam ukkoṭento samatha ppattam eva ukkoṭeti tasmai vivāda adhikaraṇam ukkoṭento kati samathe ukkoṭeti itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: Since one who reopens a legal issue reopens only one that has reached a settlement, it is said: “When one who reopens a legal issue reopens a legal issue, how many kinds of legal issues does he reopen? How many kinds of settlements does he reopen?”

original: 341. Pāḷimuttakavinicchayenevāti vinayalakkhaṇaṃ vinā kevalaṃ dhammadesanāmattavasenevāti
analyzed: pāḷimuttaka vinicchayena iva ati vinaya lakkhaṇam vinā kevalam dhamma desanā matta vasena iva ati
translated: “By means of a decision based on what is commonly recognized”: by means of a mere teaching of the Dhamma without the characteristics of the Monastic Law.

original: attho. Yenāpi vinicchayenāti pāḷimuttakavinicchayameva sandhāya vuttaṃ. Khandhakato
analyzed: atthaḥ yena api vinicchayena āti pāḷimuttaka vinicchayam eva sandhāya vuttam khandhakato
translated: “By means of a legal issue”: this refers to the same kind of decision based on what is commonly recognized.🔽“From the collection and the recitation”: from the discourses that have been brought together in the collection and the recitation.

original: ca parivārato ca suttenāti khandhakaparivārato ānītasuttena. Nijjhāpentīti paññāpenti.
analyzed: ca parivārataḥ ca suttena ati khandhaka parivārataḥ ānīta suttena nijjhāpenti iti paññāpenti
translated: “They would be laying down”: they would be laying down a rule.🔽“In regard to the legal issues that arise because of the legal issues”: in regard to the legal issues that arise because of the legal issues that were previously reopened.

original: 342. Kiccaṃ nissāya uppajjanakakiccānanti pubbe kataukkhepanīyādikiccaṃ nissāya uppajjanakakiccānaṃ. Kīdisānaṃ? Yāvatatiyasamanubhāsanādīnaṃ.
analyzed: kiccam nissāya uppajjanaka kiccānam ti pubbe kata okkhepanīya ādi kiccam nissāya uppajjanaka kiccānam kīdisānam yāvatatiya samanubhāsana ādīnam
translated: “What kind of legal issues?”

original: 343. Taṃ hīti taṃ vivādādhikaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: tam hi iti tam vivāda adhikaraṇam
translated: “Up to the third announcement”: up to the third announcement of a legal issue.🔽“That legal issue”: that legal issue that is a legal issue arising from a legal issue.

original: 344. Adhikaraṇesu yena adhikaraṇena sammanti, taṃ dassetuṃ vuttanti yadā adhikaraṇehi
analyzed: adhikaraṇesu yena adhikaraṇena sammanti tam dassetum vuttam ti yadā adhikaraṇehi
translated: “In order to show by which legal issues they are settled”:

original: sammanti, tadā kiccādhikaraṇeneva sammanti, na aññehi adhikaraṇehīti dassanatthaṃ vuttanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: tadā kicca adhikaraṇena iva na aññehi adhikaraṇehi iti dassana ttham vuttanti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that this is said in order to show that when they are settled, they are settled by the legal issue of business only, not by the other legal issues.

original: 353. “Sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katame chattiṃsa samuṭṭhānā”ti pucchitvāpi “kammassa kiriyā
analyzed: sattannam samathānam katame chattiṃsa samuṭṭhānā ti pucchitvā api kammassa kiriyā
translated: “Of the seven principles for settling legal issues, how many origins are there?”

original: karaṇa”ntiādinā sammukhāvinayassa samuṭṭhānāni avibhajitvāva sativinayādīnaṃ channaññeva
analyzed: karaṇa nti ādinā sammukhāvinayassa samuṭṭhānāni a vibhajitvā āva sati vinaya ādīnam
translated: Although this is asked, the origins of face-to-face-settlement are not analyzed by “action, performance, doing,🔽and accomplishing” and so on, but the origins of the other six, namely, by “recollection,” etc.,

original: cha samuṭṭhānāni vibhattāni, taṃ kasmāti āha “kiñcāpi sattannaṃ samathāna”ntiādi.
analyzed: cha samuṭṭhānāni vibhattāni tam kasmā iti āha kiñca api
translated: are analyzed. Why is this? He says, “Although there are seven principles for settling legal issues,” and so on.

original: Sativinayādīnaṃ viya saṅghasammukhatādīnaṃ kiccayatā nāma natthīti āha “kammasaṅgahābhāvenā”ti.
analyzed: sati vinaya ādīnam viya saṅgha sammukha tā ādīnam kiccaya tā nāma natthi iti āha kamma saṅgaha abhāvena ati
translated: There is no such thing as the act-qua-doing of “face-to-face-settlement,” etc., as there is of “recollection,” etc. He says, “because they are not included among the legal procedures.”

original: Dutiyagāthāsaṅgaṇikavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya gāthā saṅgaṇika vaṇṇanā
translated: The second collection of verses

original: 359. Mantaggahaṇanti aññamaññaṃ saṃsandanaṃ. Anu anu sandhānaṃ anusandhitanti bhāvasādhano anusandhitasaddoti āha “anusandhitanti kathānusandhī”ti.
analyzed: manta ggahaṇam ti aññamaññam saṃsandanam anu anu sandhānam anusandhitanti bhāva sādhanaḥ anusandhita saddo ti āha anusandhitanti kathā anusandhi iti
translated: “Memorizing the texts” means the mutual connection. The word “connected” is a word formed by adding the suffix -ita to the verbal root sandh, to connect. Therefore he says, “connected” means “connected by the discussion.”

original: Saṅgāmadvayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgāma dvaya vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the two kinds of battles

original: 365. Ṭhānanisajjavattādinissitāti “evaṃ ṭhātabbaṃ, evaṃ nisīditabba”nti evamādikā.
analyzed: ṭhāna nisajja vatta ādi nissitā ati evam ṭhātabbam evam nisīditabbam ti evam ādikā
translated: ‘The duties of sitting and lying down, etc.’: ‘You should sit like this, you should lie down like this,’ and so on.

original: Saññājananatthanti cuditakacodakānaṃ saññuppādanatthaṃ. Anuyogavattaṃ kathāpetvāti
analyzed: saññā janana ttham ti cuditaka codakānam saññā uppādana ttham anuyoga vattam kathāpetvā iti
translated: ‘To arouse a perception’: to arouse a perception in the accused and the accuser. ‘After having had the duties of cross-questioning recited’:

original: “kiṃ anuyogavattaṃ jānāsī”ti pucchitvā teneva kathāpetvā.
analyzed: kim anuyogavattam jānāsi iti pucchitvā tena iva kathāpetvā
translated: after having had the duties of cross-questioning recited by the accused when asked, ‘Do you know the duties of cross-questioning?’

original: 375. Nīlādivaṇṇāvaṇṇavasenāti nīlādivaṇṇavasena ārogyatthādiavaṇṇavasena ca.
analyzed: nīla ādi vaṇṇa avaṇṇa vasena ati nīla ādi vaṇṇa vasena ārogyattha ādi avaṇṇa vasena ca
translated: ‘By the colour of the sky, etc., and by the colour of health, etc.’: by the colour of the sky, etc., and by the colour of health, etc.

original: Kathinabhedavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the classification of the robe-making ceremony

original: 404. Purejātapaccaye panesa uddiṭṭhadhammesu ekadhammampi na labhatīti esa udakāharaṇādipayogo🔽attano purejātapaccayabhāve pubbakaraṇavasena uddiṭṭhesu dhovanādidhammesu ekadhammampi
analyzed: purejāta paccaye pana esa uddiṭṭha dhammesu eka dhammam pi na labhati iti esaḥ udaka āharaṇa ādi payogo  attanaḥ purejāta paccaya bhāve pubba karaṇa vasena uddiṭṭhesu dhovana ādi dhammesu eka dhammam pi
translated: ‘He does not get even one of the things mentioned as a condition for what is prior to that’: this means the carrying of water, etc.

original: na labhati attano purejātassa pubbakaraṇasaṅgahitassa dhammassa natthitāya.
analyzed: na labhati attanaḥ purejātassa pubba karaṇa saṅgahitassa dhammassa na atthitāya
translated: ‘He does not get even one of the things mentioned as a condition for what is prior to that’: he does not get even one of the things mentioned as a condition for what is prior to that, for washing, etc., in the sense of prior action, because there is no thing that is prior to that and included in prior action on his part.

original: 412. Rūpādīsu dhammesūti vaṇṇagandhādīsu suddhaṭṭhakadhammesu.
analyzed: rūpa ādīsu dhammesu iti vaṇṇa gandha ādīsu suddhaṭṭhaka dhammesu
translated: ‘In the case of things such as visible forms’: in the case of pure material things such as colour, odour, etc.

original: 416. Purimā dveti imasmiṃ adhikāre paṭhamaṃ vuttā antarubbhārasahubbhārā, na pakkamanantikādayo dve uddhārā.
analyzed: purimāḥ dve iti imasmin adhikāre paṭhamam vuttāḥ antar ubbhāra sahubbhārāḥ na pakkamanantika ādayaḥ dve uddhārā
translated: The first two: in this legal issue, the first two are the resolution face-to-face and the resolution by recollection, not the resolution because of past insanity, etc.

original: Upālipañcakavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the group of five on Upāli

original: 420-421. Omaddakārakoti omadditvā abhibhavitvā kārako. Upatthambho na dātabboti sāmaggivināsāya
analyzed: omadda kārako ti omadditvā abhibhavitvā kārako upatthambhaḥ na dātabbo ti sāmaggi vināsāya
translated: One who causes a schism: one who causes a schism by overpowering. Support should not be given: support should not be given for the purpose of destroying unity.

original: anubalaṃ na dātabbaṃ. Diṭṭhāvikammampi katvāti “na metaṃ khamatī”ti diṭṭhiṃ āvi katvāpi.
analyzed: anubalam na dātabbam diṭṭha avikammam api katvā ati na mā etam khamati iti diṭṭhim āvi katvā api
translated: Even after doing a procedure of acknowledgment: even after making a declaration of what is contrary to the Teaching, saying, “I don’t accept this.”

original: Vohāravaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vohāra vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the group of legal procedures that are a basis for accusation

original: 424. Kāyappayogena āpajjitabbā kāyappayogā. Vacīpayogena āpajjitabbā vacīpayogā.
analyzed: kāya ppayogena āpajjitabbā kāya ppayogā vacī payogena āpajjitabbā vacī payogā
translated: Those that are committed by bodily action are the legal procedures that are a basis for accusation that are committed by bodily action. Those that are committed by verbal action are the legal procedures that are a basis for accusation that are committed by verbal action.

original: Navasu ṭhānesūti osāraṇādīsu navasu ṭhānesu. Dvīsu ṭhānesūti ñattidutiyañatticatutthakammesu.🔽Tasmāti yasmā mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttanayena ubhatovibhaṅgā asaṅgahitā, tasmā. Yaṃ🔽kurundiyaṃ vuttaṃ, taṃ gahetabbanti sambandho.🔽Diṭṭhāvikammavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: navasu ṭhānesu iti osāraṇa ādīsu navasu ṭhānesu dvīsu ṭhānesu iti ñatti dutiya ñatti catuttha kammesu 🔽tasmā iti yasmā mahā aṭṭhakathā ayam vutta nayena ubhatas vibhaṅgā asaṅgahitā tasmā yam 🔽kurundiyam vuttam tat gahetabban ti sambandho 🔽diṭṭhā vikamma vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: In nine grounds: in the nine grounds, such as the rehabilitation. In two grounds: in the two grounds, such as the first, second, and third legal procedures.

original: 425. “Catūhi pañcahī”ti vacanato dvīhi vā tīhi vā ekato desetuṃ vaṭṭati, tato paraṃ na vaṭṭati. Māḷakasīmāyāti khaṇḍasīmāya. Avippavāsasīmāyāti mahāsīmāya.
analyzed: catūhi pañcahi iti vacanataḥ dvīhi vā tīhi vā ekatas desetum vaṭṭati tato param na vaṭṭati māḷaka sīmāya ati khaṇḍa sīmāya avippavāsa sīmāya ati mahā sīmāya
translated: “With four or five” means that it is allowable to teach with two or three on one side, but not with more than that. In a sector sīmā: in a sector sīmā consisting of a line. In a non-co-resident sīmā: in a major sīmā.

original: Musāvādavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: musāvāda vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The sub-commentary on the chapter on false speech

original: 444. Pariyāyena jānantassa vuttamusāvādoti yassa kassaci jānantassa pariyāyena vuttamusāvādoti attho.
analyzed: pariyāyena jānantassa vutta musāvādo ti yassa kassaci jānantassa pariyāyena vutta musāvādo ti attho
translated: The meaning of “lying speech spoken by one who knows” is the lying speech spoken by anyone who knows.

original: 446. Anuyogo na dātabboti tena vuttaṃ anādiyitvā tuṇhī bhavitabbanti attho.
analyzed: anuyogaḥ na dātabbaḥ ti tena vuttam an ādiyitvā tuṇhī bhavitabbanti attho
translated: “He should not be given leave” means that he should be ignored and not spoken to.

original: Bhikkhunovādavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhikkhunovāda vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The sub-commentary on the chapter on instructing bhikkhunīs

original: 454. Ekūnavīsatibhedāyāti maggapaccavekkhaṇādivasena ekūnavīsatibhedāya.
analyzed: ekūnavīsati bhedāya ati magga paccavekkhaṇa ādi vasena ekūnavīsati bhedāya
translated: “In nineteen ways”: in nineteen ways, such as the reviewing of the path, etc.

original: Adhikaraṇavūpasamavaggavaṇṇanā🔽458. Pañcahi kāraṇehīti idaṃ atthanipphādanakāni tesaṃ pubbabhāgāni ca kāraṇabhāvasāmaññena
analyzed: adhikaraṇa vūpasama vagga vaṇṇanā  pañcahi kāraṇehi iti idam attha nipphādanakāni tesam pubbabhāgāni ca kāraṇa bhāva sāmaññena
translated: The sub-commentary on the chapter on the settling of legal issues

original: ekajjhaṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ, na pana sabbesaṃ pañcannaṃ samānayogakkhemattā. Anussāvanenāti
analyzed: ekajjham gahetvā vuttam na pana sabbesam pañcannam samāna yogakkhema ttā anussāvanena ati
translated: “For five reasons”: this is said by taking the preceding and the subsequent as reasons because they are similar in being reasons for the production of the meaning, but not because all five are in agreement.

original: bhedassa anurūpasāvanena. Yathā bhedo hoti, evaṃ bhinditabbānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ attano
analyzed: bhedassa anurūpa sāvanena yathā bhedaḥ hoti evam bhinditabbānam bhikkhūnam attanaḥ
translated: by a proclamation in conformity with the schism. As the schism is, so the monks who are to be split should be split.

original: vacanassa sāvanena viññāpanenāti attho. Tenāha “nanu tumhe”tiādi. Kaṇṇamūle vacībhedaṃ
analyzed: vacanassa sāvanena viññāpanena ati attho tena āha nanu tumhā itiādi kaṇṇamūle vacī bhedam
translated: By the proclamation of the schism’s suitability. In such a way that the schism will take place, by proclaiming, by making known, his own words to the monks who are to be split. This is the meaning. Hence he said, “Have you not?” etc.

original: katvāti etena pākaṭaṃ katvā bhedakaravatthudīpanaṃ voharaṇaṃ. Tattha attanā vinicchitamattaṃ🔽rahassavasena viññāpanaṃ anussāvananti dasseti. Kammameva uddeso vā pamāṇanti tehi
analyzed: katvā iti etena pākaṭam katvā bheda kara vatthu dīpanam voharaṇam tattha attanā vinicchitam attam  rahassa vasena viññāpanam anussāvananti dasseti kammam eva uddesaḥ vā pamāṇam ti tehi
translated: By making a schismatic proclamation in the ear: by making it clear, by making a statement that reveals the subject of the schism. Herein, he shows that the proclamation is the private communication of what he himself has decided.

original: saṅghabhedasiddhito pamāṇaṃ, itare pana tesaṃ sambhārabhūtā. Tenāha “vohārā”tiādi. Tatthāti voharaṇe.
analyzed: saṅgha bheda siddhitaḥ itare pana tesam sambhāra bhūtā tena āha vohāra atiādi tattha ati voharaṇe
translated: The act itself is the proclamation, or the measure. Since the schism of the Order is established by these, they are the measure. But the others are the requisites for them. Hence he said, “The proclamation,” etc. Herein, in the proclamation.

original: Kathinatthāravaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kathinatthāra vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Kathina section

original: 467. Antarā vuttakāraṇenāti “tañhi vandantassa mañcapādādīsupi nalāṭaṃ paṭihaññeyyā”tiādinā vuttakāraṇena.
analyzed: antarā vutta kāraṇena ati tat hi vandantassa mañca pāda ādīsu pi nalāṭam vutta kāraṇena
translated: . By the reason stated in the interval: by the reason stated thus, “For if he were to pay homage, his forehead would touch the foot of the bed, etc.”

original: Samuṭṭhānavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samuṭṭhāna vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the origin.

original: 470. Pubbe vuttamevāti sahaseyyādipaṇṇattivajjaṃ. Itaranti sacittakaṃ. Bhiṃsāpanādīni katvāti bhiṃsāpanādinā āpattiṃ āpajjitvāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: pubbe vuttam eva āti sahaseyya ādi paṇṇatti vajjam itaran ti sacittakam bhiṃsāpana ādīni katvā iti bhiṃsāpana ādinā āpattim āpajjitvā ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: “As stated previously” means the offense of wrong conduct in the rule prohibiting sleeping in the same sleeping place as a person who has been suspended for not recognizing an offense. “The other” means with cognizance. “After frightening, etc.,” etc.: the intention is that after having fallen into an offense by frightening, etc.,

original: Aparadutiyagāthāsaṅgaṇikaṃ
analyzed: apara dutiya gāthā saṅgaṇikam
translated: The second chapter on the collection of two-liners is finished.

original: Kāyikādiāpattivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the offenses of body, etc.

original: 474. Vinaye garukā vinayagarukā. Kiñcāpi idaṃ dvīsu gāthāsu āgataṃ, aññehi pana missetvā vuttabhāvato nānākaraṇaṃ paccetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vinaye garukā vinaya garukā kiñcā api idam dvīsu gāthāsu āgatam aññehi pana missetvā vutta bhāvataḥ nānākaraṇam paccetabbam
translated: “Serious in the Monastic Law” means serious in the Monastic Law. Although this is found in two verses, it should be understood as being different because it is given mixed in with other things.

original: Desanāgāminiyādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of what should be confessed, etc.

original: 475. Dve saṃvāsakabhūmiyoti ettha bhūmīti avatthā. Aṅgahīnatā kāraṇavekallavasenapi🔽veditabbāti āha “apicetthā”tiādi. Esa nayoti “apicetthā”tiādinā vuttanayo. Vanappatiṃ
analyzed: dve ettha bhūmi iti avatthā aṅga hīna tā kāraṇa vekalla vasena api  veditabbā iti āha apica itthā atiādi esa nayo ti apica itthā iti ādinā vutta nayaḥ vanappatim
translated: “The two grounds for being in communion”: here “ground” means state. The deficiency in a factor should be understood as being due to a deficiency in the reason.🔽“Besides, here”: the method is that stated in the passage beginning, “Besides, here”.

original: chindantassa pārājikanti adinnādāne vanappatikathāya āgataṃ parasantakaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: chindantassa pārājikam ti adinna ādāne vanappati kathāya āgatam para santakam sandhāya
translated: “If he cuts down a tree belonging to a forest-dwelling spirit, there is an offense entailing expulsion”: this is said with reference to the owner of a tree belonging to a forest-dwelling spirit, which is found in the explanation of stealing.

original: vuttaṃ. Vissaṭṭhichaḍḍaneti sukkavissaṭṭhiyā mocane. Dukkaṭā katāti dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam vissaṭṭhi chaḍḍane ti sukka vissaṭṭhiyā mocane dukkaṭā katā ati dukkaṭam vuttam
translated: “In the case of emission by rubbing”: in the case of emission through rubbing. “It is said to be wrong conduct”: it is said to be wrong conduct.

original: Paṭhamasikkhāpadamhiyevāti bhikkhunovādakavaggassa paṭhamasikkhāpadeyeva. Āmakadhaññaṃ
analyzed: paṭhama sikkhāpadamhi yeva ati bhikkhunovādaka vaggassa paṭhama sikkhāpadeyeva āmakadhaññam
translated: In the first training rule: in the first training rule of the chapter on instructing. Raw grain:

original: viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā pubbapayoge dukkaṭaṃ, ajjhohāre pācittiyaṃ.
analyzed: viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā pubba payoge dukkaṭam ajjhohāre pācittiyam
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for every effort in asking for raw grain to be eaten; for eating it, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: Pācittiyavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pācittiya vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the offense entailing confession.

original: 476. Abbhuṇhasīloti abhinavasīlo.

original: Kammavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kamma vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kammakkhandhaka is finished.

original: Apaññatte paññattavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: a paññatte paññatta vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Paññattinti-vagga of the Apaññatta-kkhandhaka

original: 500. Satta āpattikkhandhā paññattaṃ nāmāti sambandho. Kakusandhakoṇāgamanakassapā
analyzed: satta āpatti kkhandhā paññattam nāma ati sambandhaḥ kakusandha koṇāgamana kassapā
translated: The connection is this. The seven classes of offences are called “laid down”. Kakusandha, Konāgamana, and Kassapa

original: eva satta āpattikkhandhe paññapesuṃ, vipassīādayo pana ovādapātimokkhaṃ uddisiṃsu,
analyzed: eva satta āpatti kkhandhe paññapesum vipassī ādayo pana ovāda pātimokkham uddisiṃsu
translated: laid down the seven classes of offences. Vipassī and the rest recited the Ovada-Pāṭimokkha,

original: na sikkhāpadaṃ paññapesunti āha “kakusandhañca…pe… antarā kenaci apaññatte sikkhāpade”ti.
analyzed: na sikkhāpadam paññapesunti āha kakusandhañcape antarā kenaci a paññatte sikkhāpade iti
translated: but they did not lay down training precepts. That is why it is said, “Kakusandha and the rest, and in between, in the absence of any training precepts laid down” .

original: Sesamettha suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: sesam ettha su viññeyyam eva
translated: The rest of this is quite clear.

original: Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ
analyzed: iti samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: Thus in the Commentary called “The Expositor”,

original: Parivāraṭṭhakathāvaṇṇanā samattā.
analyzed: parivāra ṭṭhakathā vaṇṇanā samattā
translated: the commentary on the Parivāra is finished.

original: Nigamanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nigamana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nigamana

original: Avasānagāthāsu pana ayamattho. Vibhattadesananti ubhatovibhaṅgakhandhakaparivārehi vibhattadesanaṃ vinayapiṭakanti yojetabbaṃ. Tassāti tassa vinayassa.
analyzed: avasāna gāthāsu pana ayam atthaḥ vibhatta desananti ubhatas vibhaṅga khandhaka parivārehi vibhatta desanam vinaya piṭakanti yojetabbam tassa ti tassa vinayassa
translated: In the verses of conclusion, however, the meaning is this. The words “The teaching of the analysis” should be construed as “The analysis-teaching of the Vinaya Piṭaka” by means of the two Vibhaṅgas, the Khandhakas, and the Parivāra. “That” : of that Vinaya.

original: Tatridantiādi paṭhamapārājikavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: tatridanti ādi paṭhama pārājika vaṇṇanāyam vutta nayam eva
translated: “Therein” , etc., is in the same way as stated in the commentary on the first Pārājika.

original: Satthumahābodhivibhūsitoti satthunā paribhuttamahābodhivibhūsito maṇḍito, tassa mahāvihārassa
analyzed: satthu mahā bodhi vibhūsitoti satthunā paribhutta mahā bodhi vibhūsitaḥ maṇḍito tassa mahā vihārassa
translated: “Adorned with the Great Bodhi frequented by the Master” : adorned, embellished, with the Great Bodhi frequented by the Master.

original: dakkhiṇabhāge uttamaṃ yaṃ padhānagharanti sambandho. Tattha padhānagharanti taṃnāmakaṃ
analyzed: dakkhiṇa bhāge uttamam yam padhāna gharanti sambandho tattha padhāna gharanti taṃnāmakam
translated: “To the south of the Great Monastery, the best of the meditation houses” is the connection. Herein, “meditation house” is a park by that name.

original: pariveṇaṃ. Sucicārittasīlena, bhikkhusaṅghena sevitanti idampi padhānagharavisesanaṃ.
analyzed: pariveṇam su cicāritta sīlena bhikkhu saṅghena sevitanti idam pi padhāna ghara visesanam
translated: “Frequented by the Community of Bhikkhus, by those whose virtue is pure and whose conduct is good” is also a description of the meditation house.

original: Tatthāti tasmiṃ padhānaghare. Cārupākārasañcitanti manāpena pākārena parikkhittaṃ.
analyzed: tattha ati tasmin padhāna ghare cāru pākāra sañcitanti manāpena pākārena parikkhittam
translated: “Therein” : in that meditation house. “Surrounded by a beautiful rampart” : enclosed by a delightful rampart.

original: Sītacchāyatarūpetanti ghananicitapattasañchannasākhāpasākhatāya sītacchāyehi rukkhehi
analyzed: ghana nicita patta sañchanna sākhā apasākhatāya sīta chāyehi rukkhehi
translated: “With trees that have cool shade” : with trees that have cool shade by reason of their thick foliage and branches.

original: upetaṃ. Vikasitakamalakuvalayapuṇḍarīkasogandhikādipupphasañchannamadhurasītaludakapuṇṇatāya
analyzed: upetam vikasita kamala kuvalaya puṇḍarīka sogandhika ādi puppha sañchanna madhura sītala udaka puṇṇa tāya
translated: and so it is “well-endowed.” “With a lake of good water” : with a lake filled with water that is good in five ways, being clear, cool, sweet, light, and not harmful to the throat or stomach.

original: sampannā salilāsayā assāti sampannasalilāsayo. Uddisitvāti buddhasiriṃ nāma theraṃ
analyzed: sampannā salila āsayā assa ati sampanna salila āsayaḥ uddisitvā iti buddhasirim nāma theram
translated: “Having dedicated” : having dedicated to the Elder Buddhasiri,

original: nissāya, tassa ajjhesanaṃ nissāyāti vuttaṃ hoti. Iddhāti atthavinicchayādīhi iddhā phītā paripuṇṇā.
analyzed: nissāya tassa ajjhesanam nissāya ati vuttam hoti iddhā ati attha vinicchaya ādīhi iddhā phītā paripuṇṇā
translated: having relied on his request, is what is meant. “Flourishing” : flourishing, prosperous, and complete, with the flourishing of the meaning, etc.

original: Sirinivāsassāti siriyā nivāsaṭṭhānabhūtassa. Jayasaṃvacchareti jayappattasaṃvacchare.
analyzed: siri nivāsassa ati siriyāḥ nivāsa ṭṭhāna bhūtassa jaya saṃvacchare iti jayappatta saṃvacchare
translated: “Dwelling of glory” : the dwelling of glory. “In the year of victory” : in the year of the attainment of victory.

original: Ayanti theraṃ buddhasiriṃ uddissa yā vinayavaṇṇanā āraddhā, ayaṃ. Dhammūpasaṃhitāti
analyzed: theram buddha sirim uddissa yā vinaya vaṇṇanā āraddhā ayam dhamma upasaṃhitā ti
translated: “This” : this commentary on the Vinaya that was begun in dedication to the Elder Buddhasiri. “In conformity with the Dhamma” :

original: kusalasannissitā. Idāni sadevakassa lokassa accantasukhādhigamāya attano puññaṃ pariṇāmento
analyzed: kusala sannissitā idāni sa devakassa lokassa accanta sukha adhigamāya attano puññam pariṇāmento
translated: based on the wholesome. Now, dedicating his merit to the attainment of the highest happiness by the world with its gods,

original: “ciraṭṭhitattha dhammassā”tiādimāha. Tattha samācitanti upacitaṃ. Sabbassa ānubhāvenāti
analyzed: dhammassa atiādim āha tattha samācitam ti upacitam sabbassa ānubhāvena ati
translated: he says, “For the long-enduring of the Dhamma.” Herein, “accumulated” means “stored up.” “By the power of all” :

original: sabbassa tassa puññassa tejena. Sabbepi pāṇinoti kāmāvacarādibhedā sabbe sattā. Saddhammarasasevinoti
analyzed: sabbassa tassa puññassa tejena sabbe api pāṇinaḥ ti kāmāvacara ādi bhedā sabbe sattā saddhamma rasa sevinaḥ ti
translated: By the power of all that merit,🔽May all beings, all creatures,🔽May all beings, all creatures, of the kinds classed as sense-sphere, fine-material, immaterial, etc.,

original: yathārahaṃ bodhittayādhigamavasena saddhammarasasevino bhavantu. Sesamettha suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: yathāraham bodhi ttayā adhigama vasena saddhamma rasa sevinaḥ bhavantu sesam ettha su viññeyyam eva
translated: May they be devoted to the true Dhamma,🔽The rest here is quite clear.

original: Nigamanakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nigamana kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section of the verses of the monks is ended.

original: Nigamanakathā
analyzed: nigamana kathā
translated: The section of the verses of the monks

original: Ettāvatā ca –🔽Vinaye pāṭavatthāya, sāsanassa ca vuḍḍhiyā;
analyzed: ettāvatā ca  vinaye pāṭava atthāya sāsanassa ca vuḍḍhiyā
translated: And so,🔽In the Vinaya, for the sake of the text,🔽And for the sake of the growth of the Dispensation,🔽The commentary that was begun,

original: Vaṇṇanā yā samāraddhā, vinayaṭṭhakathāya sā.
analyzed: vaṇṇanā yā samāraddhā vinaya aṭṭhakathāya sā
translated: On the Vinaya commentary,

original: Sāratthadīpanī nāma, sabbaso pariniṭṭhitā;
analyzed: sāratthadīpanī nāma sabbaso pariniṭṭhitā
translated: Called The Expositor, is finished,

original: Tiṃsasahassamattehi, ganthehi parimāṇato.
analyzed: tiṃsa sahassa mattehi ganthehi parimāṇato
translated: In its entirety, in thirty thousand lines.🔽I, who was urged by the king,

original: Ajjhesito narindena, sohaṃ parakkamabāhunā;
analyzed: ajjhesitaḥ narindena saḥ aham parakkama bāhunā
translated: By Parakkamabāhu,🔽Who desired the establishment of the true Dhamma,

original: Saddhammaṭṭhitikāmena, sāsanujjotakārinā.
analyzed: saddhamma ṭṭhiti kāmena sāsanujjota kārinā
translated: And the illumination of the Dispensation,🔽In this Jetavana, which he had built,

original: Teneva kārite ramme, pāsādasatamaṇḍite;
analyzed: tena iva kārite ramme pāsāda sata maṇḍite
translated: Delightful, adorned with a hundred palaces,🔽Filled with many kinds of birds,

original: Nānādumagaṇākiṇṇe, bhāvanābhiratālaye.
analyzed: nānā duma gaṇa ākiṇṇe bhāvanā abhirata ālaye
translated: A dwelling-place for those devoted to meditation,🔽And provided with cool water,

original: Sītalūdakasampanne, vasaṃ jetavane imaṃ;
analyzed: sītalūdaka sampanne vasam jetavane imam
translated: I have made this good commentary,

original: Atthabyañjanasampannaṃ, akāsiṃ suvinicchayaṃ.
analyzed: attha byañjana sampannam su vinicchayam
translated: Rich in meaning and in words.

original: Yaṃ siddhaṃ iminā puññaṃ, yaṃ caññaṃ pasutaṃ mayā;
analyzed: yam siddham iminā puññam yam caññam pasutam mayā
translated: Whatever merit has been accomplished by this, and whatever else has been recited by me,

original: Etena puññakammena, dutiye attasambhave.
analyzed: etena puñña kammena dutiye atta sambhave
translated: By this meritorious deed, in the second existence,

original: Tāvatiṃse pamodento, sīlācāraguṇe rato;
analyzed: sīla ācāra guṇe rataḥ
translated: Rejoicing in the Tāvatimsa heaven, delighting in the virtues of morality and conduct;

original: Alaggo pañcakāmesu, patvāna paṭhamaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: alaggo pañca kāmesu patvāna paṭhamam phalam
translated: Free from blemish in the five sense pleasures, having attained the first fruit,

original: Antime attabhāvamhi, metteyyaṃ munipuṅgavaṃ;
analyzed: antime atta bhāvamhi metteyyam muni puṅgavam
translated: In the final existence, having seen the sage Metteyya, the chief of the sages,

original: Lokaggapuggalaṃ nāthaṃ, sabbasattahite rataṃ.
translated: The foremost person in the world, the protector, delighting in the welfare of all beings,

original: Disvāna tassa dhīrassa, sutvā saddhammadesanaṃ;
analyzed: disvāna tassa dhīrassa sutvā saddhamma desanam
translated: And having heard the teaching of the true Dhamma of that wise one,

original: Adhigantvā phalaṃ aggaṃ, sobheyyaṃ jinasāsanaṃ.
analyzed: adhigantvā phalam aggam sobheyyam jina sāsanam
translated: Having attained the supreme fruit, I would adorn the Jina's Dispensation.

original: Sadā rakkhantu rājāno, dhammeneva imaṃ pajaṃ;
analyzed: sadā rakkhantu rājānaḥ dhammena iva imam pajam
translated: May the kings always protect this people righteously;

original: Niratā puññakammesu, jotentu jinasāsanaṃ.
analyzed: niratā puñña kammesu jotentu jina sāsanam
translated: Free from fear, engaged in meritorious deeds, may they illuminate the Jina's Dispensation.

original: Ime ca pāṇino sabbe, sabbadā nirupaddavā;
analyzed: ime ca pāṇinaḥ sabbe sabbadā nirupaddavā
translated: May all these beings always be free from harm;

original: Niccaṃ kalyāṇasaṅkappā, pappontu amataṃ padanti.
analyzed: niccam kalyāṇa saṅkappā pappontu amatam padanti
translated: Constantly having wholesome thoughts, may they attain the deathless state.

original: Sāratthadīpanī nāma vinayaṭīkā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sāratthadīpanī nāma vinaya ṭīkā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary named The Illuminator of the Meaning is finished.
